Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mishywishy1967
Reviews.Content: I and various others have joined me at staying at this W location. You can tell that you have entered a special hotel from the moment you enter. It is very hip and minimalistic without being unwelcoming. It's rooms are especially small (even by my New York standards). The club downstairs Whiskey Blue is very 'in' but for the VERY young during after hours. Otherwise, it's a nice place to have an expensive cocktail (although I prefer to go across the street to the Bull and Bear at the Waldorf Astoria for that drink). It's service can be so-so. I once had a disagreement about a room that was handicap accessible (that I did not request) and the bathroom kept flooding. I asked to be moved ("no") and upon departure asked for some sort of compensation for a miserable stay from the manager and he said No but would offer me some extra Starpoint Reward points. I was late for a flight so I dropped (but clearly have not forgotten) the incident. I would still recommend the hotel for it's quality and great location (almost across from Grand Central Station).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Ann K
Reviews.Content: This is the second time to stay at this hotel. The service and staff are wonderful! Best bed, large closets and bathrooms. Breakfast was expensive, but yummy. You can walk to a near by subway station. Bloomingdale's is a 7 block walk. And the walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue are short.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, it is really central, so of course our first stop was Tiffany on 5th Ave a 10 min walk away, and then a stroll around Central Park, just across the road from Tiffany. There is also a subway station about 2 min walk from the hotel. Of course with the hotel being so central it is busy and there always seemed to a queue for check in, but the staff were very helpful and provided drinks while we waited. The hotel reception is bright and modern. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The only reason I am not giving this hotel 5 stars is because the AC/heating system in the room is very noisy. Within the hotel is a bar called Blue Whiskey with a good atmosphere for a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssrapp
Reviews.Content: First of all I have stayed at many different hotels all over NYC. The rooms are the typical size of many - small. But a difference here is the bathrooms are not tiny, but good size. And this hotel had the MOST comfortable bed I have ever slept in. All the staff was VERY welcoming (free glass of champagne while checking in) and attentive. Everyone we had contact with was very friendly and professional. The Bliss products, iPod charger, wireless and noon checkout were great little touches. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good vibe”
Reviews.Author: YYZtotheworld
Reviews.Content: As others have pointed out, the rooms are on the small side. I intentionally booked the "spectacular" class of room hoping for a slightly bigger room, but still quite small (have stayed in at least 10 different hotels in New York - yes rooms are generally small but would say this hotel's rooms are smaller than average). Common areas and hallways are very chic and feel luxurious. Bathroom was small and tub didn't drain very fast. Not sure why housekeeping wouldn't have caught this from the previous guests and arranged for a fix. DJ in the lobby after hours nice touch and added to the cool vibe. Location excellent on Lexington.. close to everything. I expect the hotel is constrained a bit given the age of the building. Service was very good.. Overall experience in the room not up to usual W standards though. I wouldn't stop anyone from booking a room here.. Just be aware it's in an older (but completely renovated) building so has some quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy but misses the basics”
Reviews.Author: txtrekr
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on business. Got in very late. No one to greeted me. At 1am the staff seemed too busy to be bothered. Only one person at the front desk for checking in and got caught behind 3 people who were making some complicated transaction. Didn't have the king bed I had reserved and left me with two twins. They comped a banana and yogurt for breakfast for my troubles. ....nice. I had a "Wonderful" room. It was a room. Wonderful? Not so much. Small. Clock didn't work. iPod charger didn't work. Breakfast made me sick. For $300 a night honestly not even close to par. Had better service at Courtyards.

Reviews.Title: “First-timer and impressed”
Reviews.Author: Maldivesfan2010
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a lovely 4 days in New York and my stay at the W accounts for a good part of that. Even though 'you're only sleeping in the room, so why bother with anything fancy' has a point, I do still want to have that haven you can go to after a day of busy, hot (yes, in March!), fast-paced action around the city. The W did just that for me. I had booked a Cozy room, and was fully prepared for the broom closet I was going to get, when Tim at reception told me I had been upgraded a room size (a Superior if I remember correctly?) as I a was staying for more than 3 days. I was travelling by myself, but even for 2 people, there would have been plenty of space to move around in. Amazing bed (very soft, but I like em that way). The bathroom was spotless - and remained spotless for all 4 days of my stay - and as I didn't face Lexington, no noise issues for me. The AC was rather noisy though, luckily I always pack a pair of earplugs, and if you're a light sleeper, I suggest you do the same, cause otherwise it will keep you awake. It can be turned off though, as opposed to what I read in earlier reviews. The lobby, as has been mentioned before, is a nice place to have a cocktail at the start or end of the evening and the free Wifi a bonus. Free apples and cucumber water are available for all. The concierge service is excellent: they helped me find a movie theater close by as well as checked me in for the flight home when my phone died on me. To the Twinkie-man working on Monday evening: still no luck, but thanks so much for your efforts anyways :) All in all, a great stay and definitely to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Carmen Hui's Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I have been working in New York from Texas Sunday through Friday for 4 months. It has been difficult, it has been cold and truly my only solace has been knowing that I'll be in a great room and receive excellent service whenever I get a few moments off from Work. Carmen Hui at the W New York (Lexington) has been a beacon of awesomeness every day. While others provide good service in their own right. I select the W New York as my choice of hotels because I know there's a little bit of Texan hospitality at the front desk when I get off. My only complaint is that she doesn't work 7 days a week!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: tonyandreg
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the W for St. Patrick's Day weekend. Staff was the most courteous and helpful I've interacted with in quite a while and I travel a lot for work. We were there to celebrate my sister's birthday, and the check-in staff upgraded us to a larger room. Yes, the rooms are small, but most are in NY. They were spotless(which is more important to me) and the bed was very comfortable and floor was quiet. It is a modern hotel, bar/lounge area got pretty crowded and was a nice mix of people Would def stay again. Although the I had no problems at all, it was obvious the staff takes customer service seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, small rooms, typical trendy W”
Reviews.Author: c p
Reviews.Content: I travel to Midtown NYC often for work, and stay here every week. Carmen at the front desk is awesome - very sweet, remembered my name after staying there just two weeks. She goes out of her way to make my experience wonderful. Dereon the valet is also fantastic, he's got a great attitude and so pleasant to talk to! Customer service is key!!! The lobby is very typical of the W brand, very trendy, ladies and gents dressed to impress. The rooms are on average small, though I've stayed at W hotels in other cities (Chicago, Atlanta) and they are comparable in size. The beds are fairly comfortable though, and I like the Bliss products in the bathroom. Location is good for my purposes on business, and there are several good bars/restaurants nearby. I'd recommend 2nd Ave for casual bars, and there are tons of sushi and Italian places to choose from nearby. Friendliness of the staff and proximity to my work keep me coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: LAFRMIL
Reviews.Content: While the location is very good and the place tried to be 'hip', the rooms are really below what one would expect for a W hotel. The room is very small, the bed is small, the shower is below average, the elevator got stuck and the acoustics are poor. The hotel staff attempt to make it up by offering Champagne upon check in but I would rather they spend the time upgrading the hotel. Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice, but not too central.”
Reviews.Author: BackpackNorway
Reviews.Content: We arrived with maybe a bit of skepticism due to the mixed reviews, but it was an overall nice experience. Got the room on Priceline for 160$ + tax in the begining of March, so I guess that's a good price for NY The room: Of course on the small side (had a standard â€œcozy queenâ€�) but we were well aware of that due to the reviews, andâ€¦. Itâ€™s New York. No room for a suitcase to stay out, but there were a couple of drawers and a closet, so when we unpacked and put the suitcases away, it was fine. Have read some complaints about the lighting in the room, but this was no problem. Maybe they put in more lamps, because this was really no issue at all. Nice and modern room and bathroom. Cleanness: OK, but not the best Iâ€™ve seen. There was a lot of minibar stuff on the bedside, and all of this seemed a bit dusty. Bathroom was clean and fresh. In the hallway there was always room service stuff or other things standing around. Understand that there isnâ€™t cleaning staff on every floor all the time, but for a 4* I would expect them to check it a bit more often. Service: Friendly staff. They were happy to keep our luggage the day we left, since we had a late flight out. They also have a car that you can book to take you to any Manhattan destination for free. We didnâ€™t demand much more, so we were happy ï�Š Location: Well, I read a lot of positive comments on the location, but from my point of view it was a bit far outâ€¦ Itâ€™s right there in midtown east next to the Waldorf, Marriot, Hilton and other high end hotels, and if you are a business traveler it might be just the area. Close to Rockefeller Center and subway station. As tourists, we spent most of the time in the Times Square / Empire State area, and it was quite a walk from the hotel to get there. Next time I would try to get something a bit more central. The hotel: It is called a luxury hotel, but in my opinion it is too average to be called that. But itâ€™s really a nice modern hotel, and deserves its 4*. It feels like a really hip business hotel (if that can be combinedâ€¦). Worth it if you get a good price and want to stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PSLDad
Reviews.Content: Trendy place, real quick check in, excellent location. Right in the heart of mid town, Waldorf is across the street, walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Central Park and of Course the MAC store. Wife can shop or sight see while you work. The hotel itself is nice, I found the water to have a real strong smell of chlorine, small room didn't help,

Reviews.Title: “Wife's Birthday Week-end”
Reviews.Author: rojl76
Reviews.Content: I booked a quick getaway for my wife's birthday this past week-end. We always worry about picking the right hotel and spend way too much time reading reviews. You get excited about good reviews but start worrying about the bad ones. We bit the bullet and booked the W hotel and were pleasantly surprised. Yes the room and bathroom are small but who cares? We were there to roam the city and not spend our time cooped up in the room. The studio was just right for us. The hotek is very trendy and lively (loby & lounge) but when you get upstairs you can't hear a thing its as if you stepped into another world. Everything was so cleand and tidy and the staff was attentice and helpful. Three people nust be commended, Jessie on the 16th floor was extremely nice and friendly. She was pleasant as was David the guest coordinator(?) stationed right by the elevators. There was also the concierge (a pretty blonde) that was right on the money with all restaurant recommendations. In my booking notes I had indicated that it was my wife's birthday and wanted to do something special for her. I even discussed it with the clerk when I was checking in. Something was lost in translation because nothing special was done. For that David and Jessie were both very apologetic and that ws appreciated. The Hotel was central to all of the places that we wanted to visit and we will not hesitate to book them again. Management must commend their workers for a job well done!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, walking distance to everything, rooms a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: Rjb1215
Reviews.Content: I had a work meeting at our NYC office and the W Hotel was conveniently located to Park Avenue. The hotel itself is very nice, lively lobby bar, lots of loud music as you enter into the lobby to check in. Its a very trendy, hip place to meet up with friends before heading out to a show or dinner. I found the rooms to be very small and nothing very special. The gym is good for a NYC hotel. I have stayed at this hotel many times before and had fun and felt like the staff was genuinely happy to see me again. One of the doorman made my stay very comfortable with his recommendations and assistance. I even used the Acura car service to take me to a restaurant location in the meat packing district. The driver was extremely helpful and as a result ended up buying a new Acura! I look forward to my next stay at the W on Lexington Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service, Incredible Penthouse Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin B
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a W Hotel. We were looking forward to the hip atmosphere, which catered perfectly to our age group. Our Studio Suite room on the 7th floor was occupied, but quickly was upgraded to the Extreme Wow Suite. This room was SPECTACULAR, especially the wrap-around terrace. Even better than the penthouse suite was the staff, I have never experienced such remarkable customer service in any situation. Every single staff member we encountered was kind, cheerful, friendly and conversational. Some notable staff members include Marcus - Bellman, Jessie Sidnez - Housekeeping (Can't wait to see her again when we return, she was so sweet!), Roni - Room Service, Marbi - Valet, Germain - Bellman. We made the most of our stay at the W New York, including hanging out at Whiskey Blue. We loved the Munchie Bar, the amazing bed, the television IN the bathroom mirror, and especially the Bliss products. We loved them so much we went downstairs and bought the full-sized versions!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and gorgeous lobby”
Reviews.Author: acswift
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the W on Lex was a good one. I had tweeted that I would be arriving shortly and they asked me to DM them my information so they could insure the room was ready. I did in fact DM them, and reiterated that I had called a week prior to request a hypoallergenic room due to a feather allergy. Upon my arrival at 5PM on a Friday, I was told at check in that this request had not been specified in the computer. They comped us two drinks at the bar and enrolled my husband in the SPG program as they stated it would make it easier to track my allergy in the computer. We were told to enjoy our drinks at the bar and the room on the 16th floor (which I believe are larger "Wonderful" rooms) would be prepared without down bedding and they would deliver our keys to us at the bar. When 45 minutes passed, I returned to the check in desk to see if there had been any progress with our room as we had dinner reservations and I wanted to have a shower and get dressed before then. The helpful gentleman who originally helped us was with another customer so we were assisted by a very rude man who kept cutting me off when I was trying to explain what I needed. When I started to say "I wanted to check the status of the availability of my room" he cut me off and said "YOU ARE ALREADY CHECKED IN" as if I didn't know. He then told me that we were going to be in room 923, on the 9th floor. Due to the discrepancy I reconfirmed that this was the down-free room, not the one we were originally assigned. I'm not going to allow the actions of this one gentleman to taint my view of the whole establishment as everyone else was super friendly and very helpful. I've noticed that a lot of people who have stayed at the W on Lex in the past have complained of small rooms, but in honesty I have stayed in about 10 other NYC hotels and they are mostly comparable. Our view was of the top of a parking garage, but at least it was quiet.... except when a car alarm started going off at 4AM. The bathroom had an acceptably sized shower with good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The toilet had a good solid flush. The mirror was very well lighted. We were supplied with Bliss Spa bath products which were amazing. You can buy full size varieties at the shop downstairs. The frosted glass door, however, did not have a latch and the door had a tendency to open whenever it felt like it. Though I love my husband very much, there are certain things I don't want to see. And vice versa, I'm sure. When we first checked in, the room was quite hot and stuffy. I couldn't quite figure out how to get the A/C to the right temp, it seemed to always be running. I managed to get it to turn off then just opened the window a crack and everything was fine. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, but there wasn't much on the bed in the way of blankets. Luckily the room was always a little too warm anyhow. On the last night of the stay, we arrived back to our room to a cheese and berry plate and a split of Coppola's Merlot. A very nice little treat. All in all, I wasn't completely impressed with the room itself but I really appreciate all the staff did to make up for not having the room ready to specifications.

Reviews.Title: “I loved NYC”
Reviews.Author: I S
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit NYC for the first time this year. I chose my 40th birthday for the occasion. I must say it was one of the best visits I've ever had anywhere. All of the negative things I've heard about NYC over the years regarding how rude and unfriendly people were the subways being dangerous and the traffic being unbearable was totally wrong. My experience was the exact opposite. The locals were great and very hospitable. I felt like I was back home in the south and the staff at the W treated us like royalty. I can't remember the last time i had such fun and felt like the staff was genuinely happy to see us. One of the door ambassadors in general (Derron) made our stay very memorable. He made us feel at home from the minute we stepped out of the cab arriving from the airport and he made sure we were taken care of throughout our stay. I can't wait to go back to for another visit and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else but the W on Lexington Ave and a big reason is because of Derron's hospitality. The rooms were a little small but we expected that. It was just my wife and I so really no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss stays here”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one. I have stayed here four times and three of the four have been great. The location is great and very easy to catch the subway on 53rd street. The lobby bar is good and gets very busy with a DJ that plays in the evenings. There is also another bar located at the hotel that is also fun and worth a try. Can't say much of the restaurant because I haven't tried it. Rooms are good, comfortable and reasonably priced. So why the average rating? Well on my last stay, we were getting ready for bed after a night out, and to our surprise we found a cockroach...What a disappointment. I did complain and the manager did move us to a suite, but regardless it is very hard to look past this type of incident. I like this place but they need to be proactive and avoid these types of incidents at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not ready and staff not dealing with noise issues at 1AM”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC 10 nights per year and will not stay at the W New York ever again. The room was not ready at check in (3PM) which I get for a Hampton in but not W. I had to wait for a call (that never came) so just stood in the lobby. The other, bigger issue was a significant party in the room next door that went on until 1AM. The noise was so loud through the adjoined door and walls that we had to call down 3 times starting at 12. Each time, it appeared that nothing happened. At 1 am management finally cleared the room out. Not sure why they did not deal with it to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want tourist NYC with a local option”
Reviews.Author: dsj247
Reviews.Content: Had a great long weekend at the W on Lexington. Hotel is centrally located so great to do all the obvious tourist experiences in mid-town but it also offers the advantage of heading east a couple of blocks and you get into the residential areas, with more local-feel restaurants and atmosphere. We had a deluxe room which gave us decent space for a New York hotel room as well as great products from the Bliss Spa that is part of the hotel. Bar in the lobby is bustling with a live DJ at the weekends but not too busy to put you off a drink either pre or post an evening out. The concierge team also deserve a special mention, they were great with recommendations for a local diner for breakfast and a couple of restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “A poor excuse for a supposedly hip, high-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: teekhe
Reviews.Content: My company has a deal with this hotel and so I stayed here for ~6 weeks, typically 3 nights a week in late 2011 and early 2012. I would not recommend this hotel for the price, even in NYC. At a summary level the problems with this hotel are poor maintenance and poor management. On the positive side the location is very good for business in mid-town and convenient to the subway on the East side. After week 2, I decided to write to the manager, Edward Maynard(that was always leaving me automated voicemails welcoming me). I kept track of problems and issues to help him improve the hotel. Here's the highlights: Week 1 - AC/Heat didn't work. Froze my bottom off trying to sleep. Week 2 - Drain is clogged. Staff turned off heat and I returned to freezing room. Week 3 - Sliding bathroom door in suite doesn't work so you have no privacy if you are sharing the room. $200 in random mini-bar charges in one day (that were quickly reversed when I pointed them out) Week 4 - Dirty bathroom - Urine on toilet seat when I first entered the room. Only one wash cloth and no drinking water (supposed to be free from me as a Platinum Starwood member) At least it's not risky staying at this hoel. Risk would mean uncertainty in whether or not your stay will be good. There is no risk - you will have to call downstairs because of something that didnt' get taken care of by the maid or someone else that should done it. Something will be broken. If you like that type of certainty, the W is your place! On a very different note, when did W begin to stand for "Wines of Walmart"? I swear they have the most over-priced and least interesting wine list in the history of NYC hotels. If I recall they sell wines by the glass for $12 to $15 where the bottle retail is about $ 10. If they are going to charge 5x retail, they should at least have the courtesy to serve wines that are not quite as widely available as Columbia Crest, Jacob's Creek and Mondavi Central Coast. I'd like to at least be able to fool myself that I'm not being totally ripped off by drinking a mystery brand. Oh I sent Ed Maynard (manager) two notes on the above problems. No response. As I mentioned I am a Starwood Platinum customer and even so, I can't get service at this hotel. Perhaps you'll have better luck, but if you're not willing to bet your on luck at a $300+/night hotel I suggest you look elsewhere in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “So-So experience”
Reviews.Author: NonieLove
Reviews.Content: Decided to treat myself and my boyfriend to a 5 star holiday in New York from Ireland. Our agent advised that the W was a young hotel suited to our age and lifestyle and booked straight away. We were in New York for 5 nights, however due to crazy weather we were snowed into the hotel for a couple of days, and I got the flu for the first two, but we still managed to have a brilliant time. The first morning we decided to have breakfast in the hotel, which was not included in the price. We ordered scrambled eggs and they were absolutely disgusting, water floating around the plate and obviously cooked in a microwave as it was still in one large lump, the eggs were full of bizarre herbs and some veg and we just left, I'm embarrassed to say we instead found an Irish pub that served yummy rashers and sausages and ate there instead, something I never do when I leave Ireland as I like to try more native places but without decent food in our bells we would have been useless. The hotel was very very quiet, the girl at the bar hit on my boyfriend, though he was delighted and I found this hilarious but it wasn't dry professional. The room for the 5 nights was about â‚¬800 approx â‚¬1000 USD, and it seemed overpriced. I found the boxes of grass growing for decor around the hotel particularly hilarious. The cleaning staff were absolutely amazing, so friendly, and when I was I'll the first few days they kept checking I was okay and left me extra robes and towels just in case despite not asking for these. I was excited to visit this hotel to make use of the Bliss Spa, however this was closed while I was there, not sure why. The shop downstairs although tiny, I managed to dent a hole in my wallet buying myself shoes and jewellery when the weather was too bad to leave. The room bill at the end was enough to induce heart failure, almost â‚¬1000, we got a film, and had some stuff from the minibar but was unprepared for that, the water I was drinking when I was sick turned out to be over $10, which is daylight robbery but I was grateful for it at the time. The location is quite good, nothing too exciting in the immediate vicinity but you never had to walk far to experience New York at its finest. All in all despite everything this is still my favourite holiday, However for my next trip I think I'll stay somewhere less 'chic' and somewhere with a bit of an atmosphere as aside from sleeping (in the tiny even for New York rooms) there wasn't much else going on worth staying in for. Just to mention consierage were fantastic, anything we needed we got before we finished asking for anything. We had some bizarre requests all met with professionalism. We mentioned we were visiting music shops to buy an instrument and before we left consierage had printed us addresses, numbers, maps and details of all music shops in the city. We couldn't have gotten better off them

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall”
Reviews.Author: jazzy81
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are tiny, but worst of all nowhere to put your bags etc.. as the only bit of space is taken up by minibar stuff that you can't move or you get charged. Besides that, when you're in NYC, who cares about the size of the room, as long as it's in a good location, clean and safe. Our biggest gripe was the 'free wifi' which didn't work half the time and you had to sit on the chair right next to the door to get a signal!! We made the most of the Azure car, which took us around a few times - for free! And it's not a bad car at all. We stayed here in the period between Christmas and NYE and we didn't find the hotel too noisy. The hotel is close to Rockefeller centre and 5th avenue shopping and around the corner from the metro. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Edna at the Front Desk was great!”
Reviews.Author: trixie25
Reviews.Content: We took our kids to NYC for the first time in Dec 2011. (we are veteran NY travellers!) We wanted to stay in a a boutique hotel to give them a bit more of a "New Yorky" feel. The first person we met was Edna at the front desk, who was so lovely and bright and instantly picked up on the kids' excitement at being at such a "grown up" hotel. Checked us in promptly and gave us good info about the hotel and gave us a great room. We had a room with 2 double beds - experienced none of the noise issues that we had read in other reviews. The room was spacious enough, not enormous, but comfortable and the beds were great. We love the aesthetic, the bathrooms etc. The view was nothing special, but that wasn't a deal breaker. The halls in the hotel are dark and have a weird layout, which we got used to. Like everyone else on TA we hate paying for WiFi, so counterintuitive for a hotel. We will stay again at the W Lex for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Derron is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Cjohnson1040
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The W New York - Lexington on several occasions for business. The customer service that Derron gives to the guests is absolutely superb! He always greets us as we come and go and remembers us each time we return. He is a sure friendly face when we come and go. He always has a cab waiting when he sees us coming. I wish his level of service was the standard in the hotel industry. He certainly sets the bar high for others! Thanks Derron - we appreciate you!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Caroline S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in the W on Lexington. The hotel lobby is nice and welcoming. The check-in could be much faster, queued for 30mins to check in. We stayed in a Cosy Room - which to be honest is too small, there wasnt anywhere for us to put our clothes. There seem to be no surfaces to put anything on, the snack bar and mini fridge take up the only storage in the room and you cant move the items, as they are all plugged in and auto billed to your account. The AC vents take up the whole window cil so you cant put anything here either. Our first night was terrible, the bed had a duck down topper and this poked in your body and was uncomfortable. The guests at the hotel are there to party and we had a couple next door drinking, laughing and talking very loudly til gone 4am! Also the air-conditioning is a nightmare. One minute its cold and ten minutes later its blasting out hot, you feel like you are under a hair dryer. We woke up sweating in the night. So in the end, forced the window open. You cant turn the ac off, and it has a mind of its own, also very loud. We both bought ear-plugs for the second night! We isnt really acceptable in a hotel. We then moved rooms to a standard room and there was more space here! We could put clothes down in piles, which was an improvement. However, the hotel staff offered to move our bags - only to lose them for about 4 hours. So we came home after a night out with no bags, nothing to change into and no bathroom products. They apologised but it wasnt acceptable, we had been out for 4 hours, plenty of time to move 2 suitcases. The bar area of the hotel is way too small for the amount of guests, you never get a chance to sit and have a drink. In the evenings a DJ plays loud music which is okay., but gets tiresome. I think this is the ideal hotel for local americans who might come to NY for one night or two nights to party with friends, but not really for tourists who have travelled a long way and are looking for a decent night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chiquito04
Reviews.Content: the rooms are sound proof and your r right in the spot!!! very trendy.... i loved it

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent, Room Size fell short”
Reviews.Author: Desiree G
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was out of this world. The staff/David went out of their way to make our experience something to remember for a life time. The room was just oh-ok and this is why I only gave the hotel a 4 out of 5. The room's heater made a loud noise, which made it diff. to sleep. The room was spacious, but the bathroom was way to small. Overall, I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jewelianna
Reviews.Content: Not my first stay here, and probably not my last. The modern hotel is a comfortable spot not far from Grand Central or Rockefeller Center. Beds are comfortable, but I'm not a huge fan of the down pillowtop on the mattress. Plenty of pillows are given, but sheets aren't tucked in so you have to almost remake the bed before you sleep. Bathrooms are sleek and modern, very clean, with fantastic rain shower heads. Rooms have a desk that cleverly swivels to increase work surface and wall mounted TVs. Amenities are extensive but most have additional feels. The hotel does not have free wifi, which is a huge downfall in a place like NYC where you are constantly looking showtimes, making reservations, or searching for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay at the W on lexington”
Reviews.Author: atraveler2_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and it was great. We were close enough to walk to times square and a subway station right around the corner. Many great local restaurants within walking distance. Everyone at hotel was super nice and a fun atmosphere in the lobby. No complaints! Room was pretty small but for 2 people in New York it was great! When we first arrived the check in line was super long but they were working fast so it didn't take forever. We had a really late departing flight so they held our bags for us after we had to check out. Great stay, definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: takeahikeBoulder_CO
Reviews.Content: The W on Lexington is a great hotel in a great location. This was not my first stay here and it won't be my last. I love this hotel. We were greeted at check in with a glass of sparkling and it only got better. We were kindly given an upgraded room and the Bliss products in the room are wonderful. They think of everything, even foaming face wash! We were celebrating our 15th anniversary and when we returned from dinner Friday night, we found a bottle of sparkling chillling in our room - very kind of the W staff! The lobby is very hip and fun, Whiskey Blue is fab. The housekeeping staff is amazing, so friendly - literally every person I encountered in the hallways said hello, talked about the day, asked if we were having fun...The concierge, a gal who I believe was called Lauren, was so helpful and so friendly. Staying at the W on Lex is like being in a dream world where everyone is nice - everyone! Oh, and I almost forgot about the bed - wow - super comfortable...when we got home we looked up the W bed online b/c we want to buy one! Thanks W for a great stay. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service and service”
Reviews.Author: ecav
Reviews.Content: The W is a nice hotel with a great location. The staff is warm and friendly. Although the rooms are small they are definitely upscale.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay in Midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: aruba67416
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in a Fantastic Suite at the W New York. You will be just a short walk from Central Park, and 5th Ave, Theater District, and will truly enjoy the classy hotel location on "Lex". The hotel's Oasis Bar is a great place to unwind after sightseeing all day. To our surprise, a DJ was playing to 40 music on Saturday night which brought the atmosphere to a whole new level. It doesn't get much better than staying at W New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jase2482
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, we did have a minor issue with our first room but we were upgraded straight away. Staff were great and never expected a tip. Ronny on the door was great and made sure we were looked after with taxis. Would recommend a stay, well done W

Reviews.Title: “Great experience although too hip for this 50 year old”
Reviews.Author: billiejoe
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights over Presidents Day weekend in this very urban, very hip hotel. The location is fabulous....can walk to just about anywhere...Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Broadway etc. Service was outstanding. They have a Whatever/Whenever button on the phone in your room that tries to make anything you want happen. The queen sized room is not large but has everything you need except a coffee maker....that is a big no/no to me. I want my coffee when I wake up and don't want to pay $10 for room service or get dressed and go out. By the elevators on the lobby floor they have an urn with either cocoa or hot apple cider. That was a really nice treat after coming in from the cold and it was complimentary. The lobby or as they call it the living room turns into a happening nightclub in the evening. The young crowd seemed to really enjoy it. I personally would have liked a place to have a nice cup of tea before retiring for the evening but that is more my problem than theirs. My twenty something daughter loved this hotel. I really enjoyed it even though I am probably out of their demographics. It's lively, well maintained, great location and offered excellent service. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing night at W”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: I had written the GM in advance that I was coming for my 5th anniversary. From the check in it was all easy, fast and extremely forthcoming. I was already upgraded in the computer and asked if I wanted a late checkout. I can only recommend the W!

Reviews.Title: “Salima D”
Reviews.Author: Salima S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location several times, the W is my favorite place to stay. Mainly because the staff make the stay memorable, they could not have been more attentive. Derron the doorman went above and beyond during my last stay in December. My family that joined me during the trip could not of been more impressed with the service. The moment we arrived Derron welcomed all of us and made us feel special and this continued during our entire stay. Great location - would definitely book again as always.... great service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh yeah, you should definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Selbee
Reviews.Content: This place is simply over the top for customer service and outstanding staff. From the moment you walk in everyone who works there makes you feel like your the only one that matters. The rooms are top notch and I have never slept better (I have got to get me a W bed!) They have a great bar with a DJ at night if you are not venturing out and if you are this is a great location to get to everything. This hotel is a vacation itself! I can't say enough about the people who work here all the way from the management to the housekeeping staff. They truly care about you and taking care of anything you might need. This will be my only place to stay when I visit NYC. Rooms are very clean and have everything you need, the products from bliss are much better than you get at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Derron is an awesome doorman at the W at 50th and Lexington”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: Derron has an excellent attitude and is helpful and always shares a smile plus helps with luggage and taxi's. The W on 50th and Lexington is a great experience! ask for Derron!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great value...”
Reviews.Author: toni s
Reviews.Content: Our stay involved 2 rooms, extended family and a 9 month old and quite a bit if gear. The rooms are small, even by New York standards, but very clean and the beds are quite comfy. The restaurant serves a great breakfast and the staff is very friendly. I would recommend the W if you want to be near Grsnd Central.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ari A
Reviews.Content: We just had a great experience at this hotel for our honeymoon. The service was great, the rooms were the typical W style and the location was perfect for us. The staff went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and everything we needed. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AngelaWashDC
Reviews.Content: When i visit NYC, the W is my favorite place to stay. Partly because of the fabulous Bliss products, but also for the attentive service they provide their guests. It is clear that the management of this hotel has set a high bar for excellence. From the moment I arrive and am welcomed by the doormen, I feel like a special guest in their 'home'. The staff throughout the hotel, from the check-in counter to the bar are friendly and have a genuine spirit of helpfulness. The rooms and bathrooms are small (cozy), but very clean and very comfortable. They offer free wi-fi in the lobby, and great food in the restaurant or the lounge. Hint: If youre in a rush for breakfast, grab coffee and the yogurt parfait at the bar-It is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel on Lexington”
Reviews.Author: Charlene W
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been more attentive. Derron the doorman went above and beyond. Great location - would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE This hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LisainLondonUK
Reviews.Content: I ADORE this hotel. I stayed there for almost a week and was delighted with everything. The room was small, but exceptionally comfortable. The staff were professional, friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was hip and friendly and everything was spotlessly clean. I also loved that Bliss Spa is located here...it made my stay all the more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in New York City - W New York”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lot of fun and the room was very comfortable. Most of the staff was attentive and they offered a lot of amenities for no charge. The common areas were very noisy for an older couple, but would appeal to younger travelers. When we walking into the lobby there was a DJ in the "living room" with music pumping and lots of people mingling and having a great time. The hotel elevator had tech music blaring and the bar also had a lot of music. The decor was beautiful, the bed very comfortable and the exercise room was adequate. They named everything different "cute" names, so I didn't always know what to call things. Definitely a hotel for the under 40 set. Only problem was the closet door which locked shut the first morning. My husband was able to put together a decent look with clothes outside the closet for his meeting, but I had to wait 2 hours for maintenance to open the door so I could dress for the day. They didn't fix it before we checked out at 3PM. Seemed to be more a problem with the front desk than maintenance. Finally, my husband thought he was saving money by parking about a 1/2 block away at a garage not affiliated with the hotel. The posted in large print was for guests of another hotel. I would recommend that you use the hotel's parking.

Reviews.Title: “bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey L
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 12 nights over new year. we also got married in ny. the location was great. room small but adequate. the heating system was very noisey and we couldnt turn it off! we got an upgrade to a bigger room after 4 days. my husband left some items in the 1st room and they were never seen again! not valuble but sentimental. we were told several times to contact lost property but they were never found. we were particularly upset when we returned to the hotel after our wedding. we were congratulated by a member of staff and told he would have a complimentery gift sent up to the room. it never arrived! i found some of the staff quite rude and ignorant! they also tried to charge us for things from the goody bar which we had not had! we would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “W hotel New York excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: rosana n
Reviews.Content: excellent experience location is ideal, walking distance from 5th Ave , subway station, etc. loved the cleanliness, gym equipment fairly new. Enjoyed the Bliss spa as well and loved the green apples in the lobby at all times! Staff very helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly run, needs major renovation.”
Reviews.Author: msviv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply too dated to be up to W standards. There is no reason to stay here instead of any of the other Ws in NYC unless you absolutely need to be in this location. On top of that the service is quite poor. In two days we had four incidents of indifferent, lazy staff doing the bare minimum and making it clear that they were doing their jobs against their wishes. There is a "That's not my responsibility" culture with the staff that makes stays very unpelasant. Simply put, this is a very poorly run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Least impressive W I've been to”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a Lot of W hotels around the world, given i'm an spg member and they are generally young and vibrant, but this was certainly the least impressive. Hotel is dated now, rooms nothing special and the maseuse I got was at least 90 years old, but too late to say anything so I cringed it out for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “It is the W!”
Reviews.Author: MooOun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Union Sq. for 2 nights. This hotel is one of the very first W hotels, and it lived up to our expectation! A really nice and safe location on Lexington near Park Ave. East side, a lot better area than to stay in Times Square area where it is just too crowded, full of tourists. Staffs are helpful if we asked questions/help,, but not attentive. Room very nice but pretty small as expected in most NYC hotels. We had a nice time at the Nikki Beach club, a good wine tasting at the Delicatessen in Soho, an excellent brunch at the Japanese teppan style restaurant around the corner of the Hotel(don't remember the name but their sunday brunch offers Kobe beef to grill for only $50).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: KinkyNoodle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for our 10 year anniversary. Had complementary champagne and chocolates, which was a fantastic touch (easily bought !). Room was very plush as was the reception. Bathroom was amazing. The best thing though was the location which put us right in the middle of the action. Cannot recommend highly enough. In fact, we are coming back for New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Too "Hip" for their own good.”
Reviews.Author: tbikerman
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The first time was fine, though the room was small, we understand it's NYC and that's often what you get. This time was different though. First it started with the half-hour lines to check-in. I arrived early - 1pm, so I wasn't surprised when they said a room wasn't available. When my friends arrived about 2:45pm and were told that there still weren't any rooms available, it became annoying. We didn't actually get into our rooms until after 5pm. This is unacceptable - especially since we had dinner and theater plans for that evening. The service at the hotel was terrible. One of the bellmen actually tried to pick a fight with my friend. It was noisy in the lobby (as always) when the bellman asked my friend if he needed help. My friend replied "what?" and then then bellman proceeded to ridicule him and then got into his face. This was amazing. My friend is a marathoner and in great shape, but really? This is SERVICE? We ended up just walking away. Getting a luggage cart brought to the room took about 25 minutes. No reason given, just typical lousy service that one gets here. The walls of the rooms are paper-thin. I could hear everything from the rooms and the hall around our room. I am not a particularly light sleeper, yet was awoken 2 nights in a row by a couple fighting in their room down the hall. I finally called security after 2 hours of them screaming and it being 4am. The hotel security did a good job in getting up there quickly and taking care of the situation. Of course, the maids start chatting in the halls at 7am, so that doesn't allow for a whole lot of sleeping time. (Not that it is the W's fault for the bad behavior of their guests.) Then there is the half-hour wait for check-out as well. Anything that required service always required at least a 20-minute wait - getting luggage out of the storage area, even getting a drink of water at the bar. The hotel is conveniently located, but that is really all the good I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a New York Weekend.”
Reviews.Author: vogpr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my birthday stay the weekend of 1/12/12. Ill make it short. Amazing staff and service. Great drinks at the lobby bar. A great night at the Whiskey Bar. A beautiful room which was upgraded at checkin by the awesome and friendly checkin staff. A very relaxing massage the last day at Bliss Spa. Complimentary Acura service for short trips. Subway almost next door. If available, I will make the W New York my home for my future NY trips, which hopefully are very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a W”
Reviews.Author: Blondie2846
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I expected more from this hotel. Service was beyond average, which in my opinion can make or break a hotel. Rooms are just large enough to fit a bed & desk - yes, definitely expected in NY though. It is an excellent location. Bed was super comfy. Room was very dark, but I didn't mind. The bathroom had adequate lighting (important for makeup!). The issues were 1) the Shower didn't drain at all. In fact, it overflowed onto the bathroom floor. That was quite disgusting showering with your feet wading in a puddle of dirty water. 2) I tried asking for a second set of bath products (one of the main reasons I stay at W hotels). The first time I called, it rang for 5 minutes. Tried 15 minutes later, same thing. So i tried the next morning before we left (and before I had to shower again). I actually reached someone - and they said they would bring it right up. An hour later, I had to shower and we had to leave. So out of spite (obviously no need for it at that point), I asked them to bring it as I waited after checkout. Wow, Kimpton hotels wouldn't do this to me. So average hotel. There are so many in New York, I wouldn't stay here unless on points or if I got an amazing deal.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: maxjos
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in W Hotel - Lexington in April 2011. It's a great hotel, nice design, friendly people. although it's not cheap, I can recommend this place. In the hotel, you'll find a beauty center from Bliss, which are great products. Breakfast is very nice and healthy, with everything you can expect from this category of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Xalec
Reviews.Content: I love the W Hotel chain as you can always be certain of the "stay experience" you're going get wherever you are in the US. There's the contemporary decor, lively bar & vibrant atmosphere and the W NY didn't disappoint. However, what I didn't count on was an exceptionally small room, air con with only one temperature setting "very hot" and a room that was tidy but didn't feel clean to the corners. I've stayed at a few W's in NYC and know that this is not usually the way so was surprised by this experience especially given the room rate. Would I stay here again? Probably. It's a good hotel but just not as good as all the other W hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: Anuraag G
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay @W New York and everytime have stayed for more than 2 weeks. I must say- Excellent location, neat and clean rooms, pulsating bar and iconic lounge. It is surrounded by some great eating joints and shopping areas. ...but I must make a special mention about "Derron"- he was simply AWESOME! He always went above and beyond regarding a last minute request I had. A great example of superb customer service and centricity. Derron: thanks for all the help ...you have made my stay far more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “"W" is for "Wholly Wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: EllenRN
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel as part of a celebration of a special family birthday. The "spa suite" on the 17th floor we booked was a fantastic space, with a huge wrap-around terrace that had stunning city views, plenty of chaises, and even a pool table! Too bad it was too cold to spend lots of time out there, but we did get great photos. The management bent over backwards to accommodate us. The beds were super comfortable with nary a bedbug in sight (and we checked, as one member of our party was scared by some reports on this and other websites). The bathroom had a tub with jacuzzi and a walk-in shower with waterfall head, plus it was supplied with toiletries from the Bliss spa, AND cozy bathrobes. I can't say enough good things about the hotel, its location, the attentiveness of its staff, its cleanliness, its security, and its overall vibe. There are a few little things that kept me from giving it an "excellent" review. One is the continental breakfast. The choices are lovely but there is really no place to eat. I hate trying to eat at something other than a proper table, and while the lobby area is lovely and the chairs and sofas are comfy, where do you put your cereal? We did have a proper Sunday brunch in the hotel's restaurant and it was just lovely. Also, the electronics in the room were impressive but there weren't any instructions. I know the "W" line prides itself on appealing to the hip and wired crowd but some of us still need guidance. Plus the lighting in the rooms was wholly inadequate. There were no hooks on any of the doors, and with three women in the suite, the one little closet filled up fast. And, of all things--not a single full-length mirror! (Unless you count the one situated, disconcertingly, next to the toilet.......really not a good spot.) A few little tweaks could make this already very good hotel really great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good staff, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: jamescunners
Reviews.Content: Me and my other half stayed in the W on Lexington from the 13th - 17th January. As soon as we arrived we were greeted with Champagne upon arrival, and an immediate free room upgrade without even asking for one, the lovely lady on reception also provided us free wifi in the room for the stay which was very handy. We got in the room and it was very nice, modern & clean. We left the hotel and went for an explore and to see some sights. We were right in the middle of everything, all sights and shops are a mere short walk away. Unfortunatley when it come to sleeping the air conditioning made an awful racket which woke me up once or twice, but it wasnt so bad that I would complain. There is a great trendy bar next door called Whiskey Blue, which is very lively, full of New Yorkers, great fun Also on the weekend in the Lounge bar they have a DJ which was also very fun. Considering the price I paid for this hotel. I was very very pleased. Compared to alot of the other hotels in NY was a reasonable price for such a hip trendy clean hotel. Would definatley go again, and would definatley try another W hotel Good stuff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sptopper
Reviews.Content: Location: great. Drinks / cocktail lounge: great but could get quite crowded. excellent vibe. Rooms: typical NYC size but very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona-Dreamin
Reviews.Content: The W Hotels are hip, lively and always an enjoyable stay. The W New York located in Midtown is no exception. From the moment you walk into the lobby the energy surrounds you. If your agenda is a weekend getaway to the city for food, fun and nightlife, then this is the place for you. If you need to go uptown or downtown, you're in the perfect location. The late night bar is also a great place to have a nightcap, not too big not too small. The only issue we had was with the room, as it was a bit small for a couple. But...it's New York City, so this came as no surprise to us. That said...you are in the greatest city in the world...why are you hanging out in your room?????

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, service and rooms good, but not upto previous W experiences.”
Reviews.Author: LGF90
Reviews.Content: The Location of the W New York is fantastic. As a first rime tourist to New York this hotel was close enough to times square and rockerfellar centre and central park that you could walk to each, but also far enough away that it wasn't overbearing. The hotel is conveniently placed between two subway stations - each on different lines- so getting to downtown, meatpacking district, soho was fairly simple. One of the stations is also on the Jamaica line which connects with the airport train so we didn't have to change train lines to get to/from JFK. When we arrived at about 8pm (December 18) there was a large line at reception and only two staff working on the desk. When we were assigned our room, we took our suit cases upstairs ourselves (I was surprised there was no luggage assistance- at both other W hotels our bags were taken to our room for us as soon as we arrived). Once upstairs, the key to our room didn't work. My partner waited upstairs while I went downstairs and had to join the 15 minute long line at reception again. She sent me back up with new keys, but again they didn't work. I went down to reception again (this time skipping the line, thank god!) and she sent us to a new room on a different level. This time the key worked, but someone's things were already set up in this room!! She gave us access to a room already in use and if I wasn't a decent human being I could have easily gone through their things. So I went to the desk a third time, and after an hour of going up and down the elevator we finally had our room. (all we got to compensate for the hassle was 4 drink cards for the bar). The main part of the 'Wonderful' room was good- nice soft bed, good tv with lots of sports channels which my partner enjoyed. The bathroom was aged and worn- ugly shower curtain and pretty small, but knowing the building wasn't new andin new York everything is tiny, we had expected this. Don't go expecting a 5 star marble bathroom (as per my experience at the W hong Kong and Koh Samui, thailand). The first concierge (male, 30s, dark hair) was rude and when I asked when the Boom Boom Room at the standard hotel was open he said, without looking up from his computer, "Tonight is gay night, you probably won't get in if you're not on a guest list, you'll have to line up for about 2 hours, and you'll have to dress nicely"- as though I wasn't going to dress nicely? Turns out getting into that bar was easy anyway and nothing like he explained! The concierge Lauren, however, was FANTASTIC- booked us a great restaurant - Illili - on Christmas eve and was happy to help with all my questions. The free Acura car service was wonderful and we used it a few times- including to get to maddison square garden on Christmas day which was a huge help and money saver for cabs, just make sure you book a fee days in advance. Didnt try room service but the bagels and pastries and juices downstairs were really good because we could get them in a take away bag and eat as we were exploring. About $6 for a yummy juice and a bagel or croissant. Slept really well, rooms nice and dark, cleaning service staff were very polite- even gave me some extra bliss products when I asked! Love that the bar downstairs was always busy at night, always people around which I enjoyed but might not be to your taste. All in all, the W New York was about what we expected, just don't go expecting a 5 star bathroom or 5 star service. I'd say it's more of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: bbaut
Reviews.Content: I've locked in on the W on Lex almost all my NYC travel. I stay there for business; I spent a mother-daughter weekend there; my husband and I selected the W when we had an event to spend in the city. The location is great. The rooms are nice and clean. The atmosphere in the lobby can be fun, but the rooms are QUIET - you don't even get much street noise. And for NYC, the price is right. It's my go-to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rachel_joanthan
Reviews.Content: The W Lexington is in a prime location for walking to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Time Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park. The few places we didn't walk to, Battery Park and Greenwich Village, the complimentary Acura car experience drove us to. The Acura Experience was awesome. We just scheduled when and where we wanted to go (within Manhattan) and they took us there. Then we'd hop on the subway to come back in the evenings. We were able to check in early and even received an upgrade for being an SPG member. The room was small, but cozy. The Bliss products were great - loved having the anti-static shampoo and hand cream, a must for every girl in the winter time. We stayed on the 11th floor, which I'm thankful for, because the bar in the lobby gets very busy and very loud. We did have another guest who had a little too much to drink bang on our door in the middle of the night, but security was quick to take care of the situation. The bed was comfortable and the linens were nice. We will stay at this hotel again and again, because of the staff. The concierge made our trip. Every recommendation was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, trendy vibe, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: wonderfelle
Reviews.Content: The W Lexington is conveniently located - near shopping, restaurants and many things to do. Service was not exactly Wherever/Whenever but it was better than average and staff were generally helpful. The rooms are pretty small even for NYC standards - upgrade or spend as much as you can to avoid the standard room. Ventilation (or lack of) in the bathroom was also an issue. I like the modern, trendy vibe of the lounge area downstairs and there's also a Bliss spa which is nice. Overall I'd recommend the hotel if you can get a good rate, otherwise there are better options for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel best fit for NY soul”
Reviews.Author: Nursah
Reviews.Content: NY is the most stylish city I have ever been. There, I feel I am in the center of the world. W Hotel (we have stayed in December 2011 during Christmas) was the best hotel I have stayed in NY. In my opinion and experience it reflects the soul of the city- always crowded; stylish; lives 24 hours; unique; qualified; creative...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK for a W”
Reviews.Author: CrunchyJiff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights and on points. As SPG members we received an upgrade to a "larger" room, keeping in mind this is New York and we weren't planning to spend much time in the room anyway. The room was clean though showing its age; amenities were fine (Bliss bath products, robes, iPod dock, in-room safe), though I suggest you hit up the Duane Reade for your H2O and other snacks, as $7 for a medium-sized Fiji is just plain ridiculous. I wasn't crazy about the half door on the shower, so splishy-splashy latherers take heed. We took advantage of the concierge for our first night's dinner and last morning's brunch. Both suggestions were great and delivered with efficiency and professionalism. Check-in/-out staff were pleasant, though upon check-out my husband discovered a mystery $100 charge on our final bill. It was quickly removed, but it was kind of a rub to be handed an enveloped bill with the assumption all charges are correct. Many other hotels we've visited offer a bill review before sign-off, which is appreciated. Overall, the location is good (close to Rock Center, 5th Ave., transit), common areas are trendy and staff are friendly, but what you pay for in terms of the room falls a little below the caliber of our other W experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrazyRocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (Jan 2012). The hotel staff was awesome. When we got there to check in we were upgrade to a larger room, which was really nice. The room was awesome, with amazing views of the city. The location is great. It close to Rockefeller Center and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip-W national management should be concerned about this location.”
Reviews.Author: Kingofsyl
Reviews.Content: Love W Hotels but this is the least impressive W location I've experienced in my travels. I know most rooms in NYC hotels are small, but you expect them to be clean. I had a balcony and the door wouldn't open correctly and the lock was broken. The balcony was litered with cigarret butts. Service staff didn't seem concerns about fixing the door either. Room seemed worn and dirty. Restaurant in lobby was closed and very small lobby. Staying in NYC a lot over the next few months and hoping the other NYC W locations will be better. I would not reccomend this location for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “My Worst Starwood Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ajit G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of Starwood properties. I'm a SPG Gold member and have enjoyed trying their different brands. But for the first time ever, I was sorely disappointed with a Starwood property. The place is definitely showing signs of aging. It isn't too bad, but it lacks luster and polish, something you'd expect from a W. The staff were polite, but only passingly so--just the basics. It felt routine and uninspired. I stayed in a Wonderful room which was...very basic. Small, even by NYC standards (at least for a hotel of this caliber and cost). And the Wonderful rooms aren't the smallest rooms at the W. The shower was tiny and designed poorly--just too cramped and ugly. But what really bugged me was the lack of any acknowledgement of my Gold membership or any sort of upgrade or complementary service/extras. Why bother being a Gold member if you aren't going to do anything special for us? Also, I stayed on Cash and Points and got hit with an extra $16 worth of taxes and fees, including a ridiculous fee relating to...the Jarvis Center, which I never stepped foot in. Really W? How cheap. It's the first time I've been hit with such ridiculous extra fees on a Cash and Points stay and I can promise you, it is the last time--since I won't stay here again. Sure. They nickle and dimed me for a few extra bucks in the short run, but in the long run, they lost my business permanently.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, hotel is lacking!”
Reviews.Author: Leighlittleton
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel on Lexington is in a very central location of New York City. The staff is friendly, attentive and helpful. The hotel has some major flaws, especially in relation to the price tag. The first thing you cannot help but notice is the constant loud lobby techno music. It makes it difficult to carry on a conversation. Very annoying. The Dj at night plays the same techno music at almost the same volume level. We could not catch a break. The rooms are small with small closets and drawer space. The bathroom has a serious mildew issue and never seemed sparkly clean. The carpet was torn and old and the room furnace was very dusty and pretty inefficient. The sheets are even scratchy.They work very hard at the small details (robes in the room, spa soaps) but forget to look at the big picture. The restaurant food and coffee is mediocre and pretty expensive. I would recommend this hotel for the location and awesome staff but if you are looking for cleanliness, views, great food, relaxing atmosphere this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “A big joke”
Reviews.Author: ramos123
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, so small, with no view. Room service : 1st day, 1 hour and 20 minutes to get a coffee. 2nd day, 35 minutes to get a cold expresso at ... $18.40. There are so many options in NYC, including other W hotels, stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, big beds, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: fuzz021
Reviews.Content: We booked into a cosy room and it was just that. The room had a large bed but the room itself was small. The noise from outside was minimal and the bathroom was clean with nice products. The hotel provides easy access to Time Square and so is a good choice for sight seeing. We were not wowed by the hotel but is did provide a decent bed and a location.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: austin_res
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas, Dec 24-27. We got a cozy room on the 5th floor, which is very small - not unusual for New York. No coffee maker in the room. View is of the furnace and another building. Bed is very comfortable. Room is clean and modern. They gave us free internet. Nice lobby and lounge. Expect to pay for coffee and hot water. Location is good - near a subway station and walking distance to 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, etc. After checking out I used their Acura service to get to Penn Station - nice service but I recommend reserving the day before as it fills up quickly. All in all, the hotel was good enough for the price paid but I wouldn't pay full price for that room.

Reviews.Title: “This is luxury? Whatever/Whenever WHAT-A-JOKE”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: I've waited a while to write this review, as this hotel was such a bad experience, I was simply trying to block it out. I've stayed at more than thirty of the four stars in Manhattan by now, and I generally don't care for most of them - New York is a city where you seem to have to pay the dollars to stay at a five star or a boutique hotel to get an exceptional service and comfort experience, and if you are hardly in the room, it doesn't seem worth it. Still, there are plenty that give you a clean, functional room that allows a comfortable stay. I needed one extra night when I extended my stay for the US Open and the Marriott I was staying at the second week was booked, so I used priceline and was quite surprised when I was given this hotel which I mistakenly imagined was higher than the priceline four star bid level (based on W hotels in other cities). Well, from the moment i checked into the rude, horrifying desk, I was treated according to my priceline-station-in-life. The woman could not muster a smile or a welcome as she pushed the room key toward me. The room I was given was simply a disaster. First of all, there isn't anything special about these rooms. Cheap "trendy" furniture, and what is supposed to pass for a modern look, which is actually dated compared to the equivalent hotels elsewhere in the world. I wasn't concerned with the decor, however. My first and foremost concern is that many parts of this particular room had not been vacuumed in what must have been years. I'd lay in bed and look down below the side table, and never mind the whole candy wrapper, the nail clippings, and other filth, the thick layer of grey fuzz dust was astonishing. The edges of the desk, the shelves, but most appallingly, any area of the carpet that was not easily accessible to the vacuum was totally filthy. One large oily stain on the mattress sheet. Stains on the pillow cases. I have not experienced this in a four star, what is more a W. The bahtroom tiles cracked in more places than I could count. A big black dent in the tub. The toilet didn't flush, and I called downstairs. They fixed that. The toiletries were nice, and thats the only good thing I can recall. The lighting which is the mood lighting that perhaps appeals to a certain younger clientele (god knows why) was depressing, nonfunctional, and simply a joke. I've stayed at art-tech hotels around the world and maybe this place is trying to emulate those. They should not try. Get a lighting expert in, and fix the placement of the bulbs to garner the same effect, but in a functional way. I was too tired from the US Open to care to make a big fuss, but the next day upon checkout I asked for a receipt. I was refused a receipt showing a zero balance, because I had used priceline. Three rude women, one a manager, kept telling me I could not get a receipt. I've used the same service for maybe a hundred hotel stays and have always been able to get a printed hotel record of my stay. But no, these ladies could not be bothered. I got so tired of being ignored as they went about their business behind the desk, I even left for a few hours and asked that they figure it out upon my return to retrieve my bags The checkout was so horrifyingly inefficient, with one individual ATTEMPTING to handle all the bags people wanted to store for the day, and not managing at all - and piles of tourists standing around in the lobby cursing or complaining about the bad service. It took 35 minutes to hand a tiny bag to this man, who seemed angry the whole time he tried to take bags to storage. It took almost as long to retrieve it upon my return. The idiot desk-folk had still not figured out how to print a hotel receipt documenting my stay upon my return. This was the final straw and I asked to speak to a manager. I listed the problems in my room, and the state of filth in the room, as well as the checkout fiasco and all i got was "I assure you, we vacuum the rooms" with a blank stare. And this was the manager. Had I not been so tired from that weekend, and wiped out by moves between hotels and Flushing Meadows, I would have insisted on a room inspection. But every request at this hotel took so long, I would have missed my flight. The place was a zoo, and a poorly run zoo. Chaotic, noisy, unfriendly. Finally, and most irritatingly - a pet peeve of mine is when hotel staff treat guests differently, based clearly on what the assume their station in life is, all in the span of minutes. This is an idiotic asinine habit that you usually find in slightly higher end hotels (but not in the very best hotels), among poorly trained staff. You can find them lavishing one hotel guest with attention,respect, welcoming smiles....while not spending a second in attending to another moments later. I observe this from afar, and in this particular case, near - and find it appalling. These surface judgements of merit and worth have no place in the service industry, and any place that doesn't value all their customers equivalently deserves a zero rating. You can't judge a book by its cover. A person's clothing, luggage, sunglasses or nail manicure are not the basis for your hospitality. Learn what it means to provide service. This hotel was certainly one such place, all pretense and with no substance. I've never been treated so poorly, in visiting NYC six or more times annually. Train your staff. Clean your rooms. Meanwhile, I shall keep away and warn everyone I know not to stay at this particular W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, good, clean hotel, nice lobby and bar, would recommend for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Year's 2011!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolina D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay for young people, the rooms are very small, and for that they gave us free internet access. The bed and sheets are very comfortable and the bathroom has the perfect size. Really like the â€œBlissâ€� products, especially the Facial Foam. The service is A++ for the rooms, our floor in-charge personnel Flor from the Dominican Republic, made us feel right at home with her amiable welcome and attendance. The dry clean service was well done, but it was delivered 2 days after. The TV has a great size for those who enjoy a movie before sleeping. The paperview movies are extremely expensive, not worth purchasing. The price was relatively ok if you compare them to others, but it is not cheap. I would stay in this hotel again for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth returning”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: In early December we were given the amazing gift of a weekend in NYC at this hotel. Actually surprised to begin writing this and see negative reviews. We were there at the peak of the holiday season and had a very positive experience. Lobby is definitely the happening place for beautiful people, with deafening music. Yet, we were quickly able to get our room with no trouble. We had the junior suite and it did not disappoint. Very ultra modern, quite large sized by NYC hotel standards. The 'living area' had an avante garde style couch, chair, large screen TV and music. Bedroom very comfy bed and amply sized bathroom. Very clean. Can't say the view was great but we were hardly in the room long enough to care. We remarked that all the staff were exceptionally friendly, a shock to us given this is NYC. The only disappointment was being misled into the amount of time needed to get a taxi, even from the hotel. Grabbing a taxi was like winning the lottery. All in all, location was really great- we could easily walk to everywhere- and had to! Friendly staff, a small coffee place downstairs and plenty of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more - don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: jmtobias
Reviews.Content: What can you say about an uber expensive hotel, in an uber expensive city with rooms smaller than my closet and yet they cannot be bothered to dust? Well, gross is one word that comes to mind. Gross and dirty. Take your money somewhere else because if you dare say anything negative about the "whatever, whenever" experience, they will question if you really stayed there. And don't bother trying to clean up for them because they will actually charge you for touching the mini-bar (when all you were trying to do was get the 1/2 inch thick dust sheet off the area). And do not bother to ask for assistance - ever, because they do not give it. They do not have enough staff to assist at the front desk. The lines were insane (and they do not have the standard SPG preferred guest line). The concierge virtually ignored people waiting for assistance... what hotel in NYC does not have the appropriate number of staff during the holidays. Don't think that you will get the adequate number of towels (even if you ask). Don't think that your keys will work. Don't try to link reservations with points and cash (that just confuses everything). I have stayed in several "W's" and I have stayed in other NYC hotels... this is not acceptable. Heck, I have stayed in better Best Westerns in the middle of nowhere that could show this place a thing or two. This hotel is horrible. Small dirty rooms. Rude staff. Horrible service.
