I will not be going back again, location be damned. You are better off in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly bad”
Reviews.Author: alwaystravelling69
Reviews.Content: Normally W are great. This was average: room was small even when paying for a *larger* room. Room safe broken; food order messed up; lots of noise from the neighbouring room; breakfast much more expensive that other W hotels. Still trendy and good service, but a long way from the amazing experience normal at W.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: M30001
Reviews.Content: The good: Hotel is in a great location, close to a lot of good NY spots The bad: Basic rooms are miniscule (imagine jumping across the bed to get to the other side of the room), A/C units are very loud, lighting in rooms is not great, very expensive relative to other places you could be staying

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ.......W stands for Woeful not Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W Hotel on Lexington Ave was terrible. Waited over 25 mins to check-in. On my first night l had a shower. Had to cut my shower short as it flooded and the water almost made it to the carpet. Spent 20 mins mopping up. Went to have a sleep but couldn't as the air-con was so loud. Tried to turn it off but there is no on/off switch. The next morning l raised the matters at the front desk. No apology was offered. They said they would get it fixed. Later that day when l returned, the air-con was still rumbling, sounding much like the Space Shuttle taking off. I went back down to the front desk and raised the matter with them. Once again no apology was offered. They did move me to another room. No offer was given to assist moving my luggage. My new room was located right outside the lifts/elevators (note: Don't stay anywhere near the elevators as it is very noisy with people coming and going all night). At approximately 1:30AM when l got into bed the sheets didn't feel crisp and fresh like they should have. I pulled back the sheets and found several PUBIC HAIRS and what appeared like FECAL MARKS on the bottom sheet - SERIOUSLY. I was almost sick at the sight and thought of what l had been in contact with. I went down to the front desk and told them that the sheets had not been changed (i didn't didnt tell them what l found on the sheets as l was too embarassed and sick at the thought). Once again no apology was offered. They said they would send someone up to change my sheets. On 2 occasions my room was not serviced. When it was serviced they missed placing new face washers and enough towels. On the topic of towels, some looked off white. If you drink at trhe bar make sure you pay cash. I originally started a tab but then decided to pay cash. A few days later l looked at my account on the tv and found that l had been charged for the drinks. I am not accusing anyone of anything, however it makes you wonder what happened to the cash. If you do pay cash for anything at the W Hotel, ask for a receipt. My opinion is that the W Hotel is catering for the younger crowds. They have a nice bar and reception area however that's were NICE STOPS at the W Hotel. If you do drink at the bar and need to visit the restroom you need to go to the 2nd floor. How inconvenient and stupid is that???????? When staying in New York City, think twice about staying at the W on Lexington. There are so many other nice hotels that compliment such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “W NEW YORK, Lexington/49th Street”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: For many years - I have used this hotel for booking my boss' travel needs and also it is the ONLY hotel she will stay at when in NYC. Over the years she and I both have continued to receive the same first class customer service all the time. Accomodations and arrangements have always been perfect and we never have to worry that my boss, Ms. Alvarez, will have the most enjoyable experience during her stays at this hotel. It is always a wonderful crew to deal with but particularly the one who shines brightest is Ms. Edna Barkley. Edna has not only been the consummate professional but a breath of fresh air and just the most pleasant person - and this is all the time, 24/7 - even when she is on holiday she is happy to assist! If everyone could be like Edna, this world would such a different and more enjoyable place! Kudos to Edna for being a superstar and special recognition to the team she is a part of, led by Ed - the General Mgr.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and with W comfy super comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: chrisinbogota
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location - except for going down to SoHo, we walked everywhere as this hotel is so well located for museums, upper 5th Av shopping, Bloomies, and Central Park. If you do need a subway, there is one just a couple of blocks uptown from the hotel. As we were there before Christmas, we walked the short distance to Rockerfeller Centre at night to soak up the festive atmosphere by watching ice skaters and the Saks laser show. The standard rooms are very small - we were dancing around each other, and the bed, but luckily we were upgraded. The front desk and concierge service was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Small dark rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: bonniep71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your typical W. Rooms are soooo small, couldn't even fit family of 5 in 2 rooms! Lobby is hip and has a great vibe/music. Hallways are so dark, lighting in rooms is practically non-existent. Mirror in bathroom starts above my head! Beds/linens are comfortable and tv is large! Staff was average, left something in room, called before taxi arrived at airport and never received a return call. They did find the item but when I called back 8 hours later it was as though they were never going to follow up. Affinia hotels are much better for families but this was a last minute stay and we had to go so I booked this through Priceline for $175.00/nt per room, not bad for NYC standards but I think the rooms across the street at the Waldorf would have been a better bet. Complimentary transportation in Acurais a nice touch, just make sure to book asap after check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelingcowgirl_rmb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the W Union Square and numerous W's when we travel, we like their consistent service motto and they generally have a great vibe. We upgraded to a two room suite which was fantastic-- large private patio, two bathrooms and a large amount of space for NYC. We thought the service at this W was outstanding, led by Darron who was an outgoing and wonderful greeter. Our only negative was the Whiskey Blue lounge which is not managed by Starwood, the staff in there needs to get an attitude adjustment and hire servers instead of strippers. The W lounge on the other hand was fantastic, outstanding cocktails. The gym here was first class as well.

Reviews.Title: “Spent Christmas week at W on Lexington!”
Reviews.Author: D G
Reviews.Content: I took my family to NYC for Christmas and we stayed at the W Lexington for 4 nights. We combined our SPG points to cover 2 rooms and the process took several reservations as we added points toward our stay; we had approximately 7 confirmation numbers to cover 8 nights total. Our initial contact with the front desk staff was with Ysaira. She was a very beautiful and pleasant young lady and she quickly sorted through our confirmations (spread out over three names) to simplify our rooms. She also upgraded our daughters' room to give them a room next to ours. We dealt with Ysaira anytime we needed assistance, and each time, she was very pleasant and quick to help! Another very good impression was made by Claudio, one of the doormen. He promptly helped us with our luggage upon our arrival and was very gracious and understanding when I informed him I had yet to acquire cash for tips and such. We checked into our room (an hour early thanks to Ysaira) and set out to see the city. Claudio gave us directions to Times Square, Lincoln Center and a few other destinations we wanted to see that evening. I assured Claudio that I would look for him as soon as we returned but he told me not to worry about the tip, that his shift was ending soon - he then gave us breakfast tickets for the next morning and 2 beverage tickets for the bar. I returned the next morning and reminded Claudio that I had not overlooked his tips and tipped him at that time. He graciously stated that he understood and asked if we needed any assistance. He never once acted as if he deserved it, nor did "linger," as some doormen do, anytime he assisted us. We took the opportunity to ask him for help with the subway system and he promptly directed us to the nearest station that would get us to our intended destination. Our room a bit small, but we knew this going in, and was very clean when we arrived and each afternoon when we returned. The housekeeping staff honored our door-hanger and waited until I removed it to address the room. Every staff member we encountered during our stay was friendly, courteous and accommodating during our entire stay. This location was perfect for our itinerary! We were close enough walk to most attractions and several subway stations within located a block or two. I will definitely stay here again - especially if the W keeps people like Ysaira and Claudio on their staff! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for touring the big apple”
Reviews.Author: Chazyd17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2011. Booked a double room and it has to be one of the smallest rooms i have ever stayed in. The bed and wadrobe took up most of the room, the view was non-existant, a brick wall, but we didnt spend any time in our room anyway. The hotel is spotless and staff are very friendly. The bathroom was amazing - a great shower and all of the tolieteries provided. Make sure you use the Acura experience - you get a free ride in their car and can go anywhere for free! The hotel is ideally located - you can see grand central and the chrysler building from the front of the hotel and it is directly opposite the Waldorf=Astoria, which is well worth a look! dont be scared of the subway - it runs 24 hrs a day and can get you from A to B in the quickest time. Take comfortable shoes - you will be on your feet a lot!! Make sure you go on the statten island ferry - its free and has the best views of the statue of liberty! Views from Top of the Rock are amazing - try the rooftop bar at 350 on 5th avenue - its free to get in and has even better views of the Empire state for free!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Rondawh
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with others, the rooms are VERY SMALL, but our stay was still wonderful! The check-in staff was helpful and tried to accomodate our needs. The lobby was very nice and inviting. We had the oppurtunity to meet a security officer working the front lobbyof the hotel, "Albert", last name I tink, Lozada. He was very helpful and went out of his way to make sure all of our questions were answered. If there is an employee of the month for this location I vote ALBERT, employee of the month. Because of this gentleman's professionalism and helpfulness, I would definately return to this hotel. Please thank and commend Albert on my behalf! Thank You, Rhonda O

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: marturey
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The location is great and close to the subway and walking distance to Grand Central. Check-in was efficient and the staff was professional without being snobbish. While the room wasn't big, after having read so many comments mentioning the room size I was expecting something tiny which our room wasn't. A second chair besides the one at the desk would have been nice. I hated the bathroom though. It needs a more sturdy door separating the bathroom for the room itself. The bed was heavenly. One of the best rests I've had in a while. The lobby is a great place to people watch and surf the web (many people go down there because the internet is complementary in the lobby). The gym is really comprehensive. More than just cardio which was nice. The hotel charges a lot for everything though - room service was really expensive and so is internet usage in the room and local calls- but hey, it's NYC. I liked that a hotel key card was necessary for access to the elevator and there was a security guard in the lobby at night when we returned to the hotel. For some reason if you have special status with SPG and get a late check-out, they still deactivate your card at 12pm and you have to go down to the lobby to get back into your room. This was really inconvenient since we were in a rush and the lobby was packed with people. This is a great hotel in Midtown. We wanted to extend our stay but the hotel was sold out. It bustles with NYC energy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, again!”
Reviews.Author: Kelton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2006 and have been at many different hotels in NYC. Our favotites are now any Affinia (best for small groups or families as the space is LARGE) and W New York as a COUPLE! Again, this lobby and hotel were very hip, "Sex in the City" youngish, professional 25-50 crowd. Room was EXCELLENT, right down to special features like nice robes and FREE luxury bath products from the BLISS spa (on site). If you plan to visit the spa, plan ahead and make reservations NOW as they were very busy, as BLISS is one of the best spas in town, known to NYC locals as well. The small room is more than made up for - by the EXCELLENMT AMENITIES: Plasma TV, bath prodcuts, CLEANILNESS, and service! Nice desk with internet, CD player, DVD, TV, etc. The bed, is in fact, HEAVENLY, as the advertising suggests. Nice mood, throughout the hotel. Excellent, large work-out facility, with personal training available, as well as a BLISS spa on-site (no pool). Free access to steam room and gym, even without SPA service. Drinks and small meals and apps are available in the lobby bar, as well as desserts. They were were very good at $12-15 per cocktail, but well worth it for the atmosphere and people watching and the fireplace. If your are a SCOTCH specialiast, the WHISKEY BLUE bar is on site with many speciatlity and single malt Scotch offerings. ($12+). GREAT location, on Lexington at 49th. Five minute walk to Grand Central. 10 minutes to Rockefeller Center, 20 minites the theatre district. Very active lobby with free Granny Smith apples and champagne (at specific times)! Helpful and cheerful front desk and concierge desk. Enjoy your stay at this EXCELLENT hotel! We will return, again! In fact, this has become our destination of choice for NYC, most due to the attention to detail provided by Ed, SAMI, and JASON - W SuperSTARS!. THANK YOU! Our HIGHEST recommendation, ever. A+++++++++.

Reviews.Title: “An uncharacteristic disappointment for us with this fine brand”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a few days before Christmas. The HVAC in our room was very loud and made noise even when it was off, keeping us up most of the first night. We left the room at 9 the next morning and mentioned the problem to the front desk. When we returned at 4 PM it had not been tended to - and neither had the room been made up. When I called down, they said that they don't make up rooms unless you specifically ask them to. The engineer who showed up shortly thereafter to fix the HVAC told us that this was nonsense, which we understood it had to be, and when the cleaning lady later showed up (at around 5) she was defensive and a bit aggressive about having been tattled on. The HVAC was not fixed, though it was somewhat less noisy. Also, the scent that permeated the room, meant to be reminiscent of a spa or something, reacted badly with my wife's allergies.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLouie
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many W hotels-usually very happy with them. This cannot be a four star hotel! No way!!!! The room was so small that you bumped into furniture. Awful.Reminded me of a college dorm room. My husband speculated that a prison cell must be comparable! The heating system clicked on and off loudly all night! On the positive side, the staff is super friendly and it is in a great area-walking distance to Rock Center and St. Pats but I would never stay here again!!! The bathroom was also tiny. Better off at Doubletree or Eastside Marriott in my opinion. Couldn't wait to get out of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: ruzy2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on 22nd Dec and checked out on xmas day. From check in to check out it a was a great experience. The lady at the Welcome Desk, Nadia, made sure that we had a great stay! We arrived at 2pm-ish and was upgraded to a room on the 16th floor. The room was not ready yet but Nadia put a rush on it and assured us that it's worth the wait. She gave us some water (we don't drink alcohol so we declined the offer of free drinks at the bar) and breakfast coupons. It wasn't a long wait - 15mins later we were in the room :) The first thing that hit me once the elevator doors opened was the sweet scent. It could be lavendar or jasmine but it was such a nice smell. The smell was in our room too and our clothes smelled lightly the same way. It was very refreshing. We went out for dinner and when we got back, there was a plate of cut fruit and a bottle of Perrier in our room with a nice note from Nadia :) She made us feel so welcome! The decor in the room is minimilast and stylish (umbra dustbin in the toilet!). The toilet is admittedly small, but hey, no one's gonna sleep in the toilet eh? The bliss spa amenities were great and the housekeeping always kept it well stocked. The housekeepers were always very nice, saying hello/how are u whenever we pass in the corridors. The bed was comfortable with plush pillows. The location of the W at Lexington is fabulous! It's located a mere 5 minutes walk to either Grand Central Station (turn left from the lobby) or the E,M & 6 subway (turn right from the lobby). It's located on a quieter part of mid-town but still a close 10mins walk away from 5th Ave. I went for a facial at Bliss spa - loved it! And you could charge to the room too which was a convenience. Overall - i'll be back for sure! Loved the ambiance, the staff and the location. Plus we spent about USD150 per night as we took the stay 3 nights save 30% off package offered on the Starwood website. And ask for Nadia at the front desk - she's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: kaj2600
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on Lexington a couple of years ago and enjoy the hotel, the location and the service -- so we booked it again for our Christmas trip. While we were upgraded -- the room was tiny, poorly lit, and frayed -- the the point where the wall paper was torn in the bathroom and the tile was grungy. Aside from the location I would rate the maid service as VERY GOOD, they were lovely and very helpful with additional Bliss products, since we blew through our first round in record time.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good experience”
Reviews.Author: justpeachy81
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11pm on a Friday night, the lobby was very busy (DJ playing and some older ladies dancing!) however there was no queue to check in so process was very quick. No doorman to help with bags, which was fine. Room wasreasonably spacious for NYC (we had a spectacular room), not tons of floor space but fine for 2 people. Decor is nice, basic, but could have done with more storage for cothes and toiletries. View was terrible (vents and roof of another building) and i thought we would get a decent one, as we were on 15th floor and paid exta for a better room. As other people have mentioned the bathrooms are tiny - again, fine for 2 people however it's awkward to move around in there! No bath which wasnt ideal, shower wasnt the most powerful but fine for a afew days stay. Room was very clean, housekeeping come everyday. Free Bliss toiletries are nice, and overall we had a good stay. We didnt use any of the amenities of the hotel, only thing which I would complain about it that internet is $16.95 per day (and should be free!). Beds are super comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific service....much better last night at the Holiday Inn Houston Intercontinental .....AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: Pondsat302
Reviews.Content: IsOur group should have anticipated a disaster upon arrival when mobs of customers were lined up at 3:30 with complaints of rooms not ready....we overheard one couple state this was their 5th visit to the desk only to be given keys to a VERY occupied room. No bellman was even available to assist in the pouring rain....for 10 women!!! The desk clerk was very nice and upon request offered 6 vouchers for drinks for a party of 10...I requested to speak to the manager and explain that when rooms are supposed to be ready at 3 ....new arrivals really do not care to hear explanations such as we allow our "platinum and gold" members to check out late....thereby inconveniencing minions such as our obviously unimportant party. I might have felt I was being overly critical had there not been a long line waiting to speak with management. To compound matters....after one full hour at the desk and the absolute refusal of the "welcome desk talent coach" Scott -- to at least provide a measly cocktail for our entire party....some of our keys failed to work resulting in a subsequent return and wait at the dreaded desk. Mr -- is a poor representative of what is usually a wonderfully branded hotel. Choose well and differently....our previous stays at The Mela, Grand Hyatt, Marriott Marquis, Renaissance Times Square and even the Holiday Inn Empire State have exceeded my first abysmal 3 hours at this horrible place. The room...coined a cozy queen is without doubt the smallest room in existence.

Reviews.Title: “Mario as always A+”
Reviews.Author: Vuelosporvida
Reviews.Content: A quick Pre-christmas trip with the family made better by Mario! Even before our arrival Mario had taken steps to ensure our check in was seamless and everything was in place. We didn't get to see him until following day-but when he did, he had his trademark warm personality and wanted to make sure our stay was going well. We even enjoyed a glass of champagne! As SPG preferred guests we have many options of hotels but the wonderful service we receive still makes ithe W on Lex our number one choice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Carlo S
Reviews.Content: Good location and reasonable price accounted for the 3 stars. Service was horrible. The door men did not help with luggage nor hail taxis. The bell boys wanted a tip up front to store your luggage. The front desk was overwhelmed with the check in and check out process. We had a suite with a good sized ante room but with a miniscule bathroom. We had the bad luck of being placed in the 4th floor where the spa and the gym were located. Too many people walking around the floor did not make for a restful night or morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in the City”
Reviews.Author: Greenjeans10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the perfect location at Christmas with dining, shopping so near. Highlight was the staff, particularly Derron who greeted us with such a welcoming smile. So knowledgeable and helpful, which is rare and delightful in this bustling city!

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: travels120000
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay. I don't expect special service but when you advertise perks for your SPG preferred guests, it should be followed up on. Even though we were are platinum elite on starwoods we were given the smallest room I think they have on the fifth floor with a view of pipes and a roof, outside our window were a bunch of cigarette buds. No SPG line on entrance waited 20 minutes to check in, no breakfast etc. There was only enough room to walk around the king bed, I hit my leg on the bed getting up and then almost walked into the wall. The worst was the bathroom. Despite living in NYC for years in the past and knowing everything in NY is small, one can't sit on the toilet without lifting up an arm because the sink protrudes onto the toilet. (Body size doesn't matter only a child would be able to be comfortable using the facilities) We booked with miles. I'm so glad I didn't pay for this room. After being given that room, standing in line, no breakfast etc., they did give a vouchers for drinks in the Whiskey Bar. SO that was appreciated. Hotel was clean and great location. That lounge has always been fun, I'd say just visit the lounge just find somewhere else to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: JCNYtraveler
Reviews.Content: Had my anniversary stay at the W Lex although I live in... NYC! They were able to accomodate all our wishes, which made for a wonderful stay and a great spa experience. Management staff is attentive and caring. Would recommend to any couple or business traveler in the City. Great location also, a litle away from touristy midtown, yet close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “One Star Hotel, Four Star Rates”
Reviews.Author: james h
Reviews.Content: This grossly mismanaged property gives new meaning to Bette Davis' old line"What a dump", and a dump with precious little service at that. Two days before our arrival, I called the hotel to check on the details of our reservations (party of 4/2rooms) and was told I needed to speak to the House Manager. He/she were "too busy" to speak with me, so when I had not recieved a call back after 24 hours, I called again. This time the call was returned, and was given a laundry list of excuses for not returning my call, however we were "upgraded" to rooms with TWIN beds. This an upgrade?? Upon our arrival at 2:00 PM on a Saturday, there was no doorman/bellman in sight, so we scheped our bags into the hotel ourselves. I complained to the House Manager about the lack of staff at the front door, only to be told that at the W they believed in "casual dress" for the staff. How nice for them. It's impossible for the poor guest to who differniated between staff and anyone who might have wandered in from the street. How charming. My zero balance credit card was denied at check-in by the front desk. A call to my credit card company informed me that the hotel had not presented my card for approval, confirming the problem was at the hotel's end. The rooms are tiny and the bathroom slightly bigger than a postage stamp. Absolutely wretched. In one room the shower was broken and not repaired for 48 hours, in the other room the TV was fuzzy and needed attention. Both bathrooms were dirty and poorly stocked with worn and dingy towels, the phone system impossible, the room doors lack dead bolts, the elevator situtation cumbersome, the halls dark, dreary and littered with dirty dishes, the lobby furniture stained, ripped, and horrid (they must have used Ethel Mertz's interior designer in this joint) not to mentioned the loud music and drunkness in the lobby late at night.The printer in the business center was out of paper, and it took 30 minutes to get some one there to refill it. They did comp breakfast for us because of our problems. Big deal. They should have comped our stay. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -- excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Richard L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for a special birthday evening in NYC -- during the holiday season. It was an excellent overall experience. The room was amazing as was the location. Most notably, the service was fantastic. The Front Desk professional -- Cindy Cabrera -- was incredibly helpful and went out of her way to ensure the stay, room and experience was perfect. I would highly recommend the hotel and if possible ask for Cindy when you check in!

Reviews.Title: “Great door staff!”
Reviews.Author: mark d
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Hotel Lexington & 49th many times and love the hotel, but I want to say something about there door staff and valet service. Derron, Nam and Claudio are so courteous and helpful and it is clear they are not doing it for tips. They go above and beyond each time I arrive and make the hotel experience that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to New York I Pricelined a hotel for the weekend of December 16 and got The W on Lexington Avenue for $150 per night. A great price for late December and only 2 -3 blocks from Rockefeller Center and the shopping on 5th Avenue. The hotel was much more trendy than I prefer, but the room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel was full for the weekend, but the staff was friendly and appeared to handle the crowd very well. At night there was disco-style music in the lobby, but my room on the 9th floor was very quiet. I was very pleased with the hotel and the staff and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms. Great location. Good hotel. Not super-luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The check in lobby--as in almost all W hotels--is like a night club: loud, difficult to hear, and full of "wannabe" cool people. The check in is always good, but the attitude of the front desk sometimes absorbs the attitude of the bar (sometimes, they just think they're too cool because they work in the W). The rooms themselves are small, as New York hotels almost all are. But the rooms are not super-luxurious. The bathroom is nice, but nothing great. The walls are paper-thin, and you can hear your neighbors very easily. Overall, it's a very good hotel in an excellent location. You cannot beat the location, that's for sure. It's not super-luxurious, but it's overall a good hotel in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: Angela Y
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently on business and leisure and frequently stay at W Hotels. The W at 541 Lexington Ave is especially appealing if for no other reason then checking in at the front desk with Mario. He always has a smile on his face and sets the tone for my whole stay. Great location and great staff make for an enjoyable stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “PARTY MOM!”
Reviews.Author: BruinGirl21478
Reviews.Content: Most of the W hotels that I've stayed at have been because the price is right for the location and I'm a Starwood member. Overall, they tend to be trying too hard to be hip and clever. This location is a little bit more low key than most of them but the lounge was filled with party moms...45ish ladies just let out of the PTA meeting and ready for some action. The rooms are extremely small and dark and really too small for the furniture. If you're looking for something that actually is comfortable and hip, Le Parker Meredien is great.

Reviews.Title: “W is for Weird”
Reviews.Author: jrsaustx
Reviews.Content: Not your father's business hotel, and maybe not yours either. The lobby becomes a disco with a DJ at night. Coming home late from a show, expect to wander through crowds of drunk people gyrating to loud music. Say hello to the big bouncer stationed by the elevators to keep these people confined to the lobby. Welcome to your room. Strangely shaped, you say? Yes, why *didn't* they take another 15 sq ft or so off the ample bedroom to make a bathroom that isn't so small you can't open the door all the way without it banging into the sink? How do you like the decor? What shall we call it? Hmmm, maybe 1980's Playboy Magazine Chic? The broken lampshade and the towel rack that falls off the wall whenever touched do spoil the mood a little. But don't worry: I'm sure the maid is used to mopping up the water that is just naturally going to wind up on the bathroom floor from the shower stall that has neither a door or a curtain. That being said, the location of the hotel is excellent. When you're feeling down about your room, you can walk across the street in one direction to the Marriott to see what an affordable hotel looks like or across Lexington to the Waldorf Astoria to see what a really nice hotel looks like. With any luck, you won't have to wait until 6:30 pm to get into a room because the Starwood Preferred Guest in your room is exercising his privilege of "late check out". Thanks, guys, for the compensatory free bar vouchers; I don't drink. I was in a two-day meeting in the hotel, and I will say that the meeting rooms are superb. I've probably never been in a nicer hotel meeting space, and the catering for the meeting was also excellent. Everyone I dealt with at the hotel was professional, cordial and eager to serve.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced over styled would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: DeanMadge
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via hotels.com and paid Â£1200.00 for five nights. I had written to the hotel before as I was concerned about the reviews and I requested a room on a high floor. On arrival we were happy to get a room on the 14th floor. The room was very small and tired the bathroom was cramped and need a good make over. The next morning we awoke to a smell of water and noticed the that one side of the floor was totally soaked from the air con on the floor. We called down and later someone called us back to say we would be removed. Rooms moves take place between 3 and 6pm. We arrived back to the hotel and the move had not been done. Called down to be ask what is your wish ? Explaining the situation we were told someone would call us back. 25 minutes later still no call we called down to be asked what is your wish explained the situation and was then transferred to a voice mail called back again to be ask what is your wish to then be cut off ! We finally got to speak to someone who told us you should never feel you need to chase us! We then left and the room on the promise that the room move would be done. Arrived back in the evening and we had been moved but to a small room - not happy. To date no one has actually apologised about this. Each morning we were woke up by housekeeping as there office is outside the bedroom door. The rooms are tired air con was hard to get right and the rooms are very cluttered. If the hotel spent more time training it's team on customer service and less on quirky things for the rooms they might get it right. Minibar was not stocked. Throughout the stay. Staff generally were not interested and really for this chain and price it should be a whole lot better. We made the mistake if getting to coffees in the bar - coffee small, not hot enough and served with what I felt was the usual dis interest from the staff in the hotel. On e last day we called down and asked for bags to be stored and told they would be collected at no time were we asked to wait in the room, came back later bags still in the room made to feel it was our fault. Really disappointed with this hotel and I would recommend people not to stay here if you want something nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if You Can Get it On the Cheap”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPWorldwide
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and bagged it less than 200 bucks which at Christmas in NYC, is a good deal. That being said, itâ€™s just an â€œokay hotelâ€� and many of the comments on here are pretty accurate. The rooms are very small but well thought out so for a few days, itâ€™s fine. The shower door arrangement is quite odd but as long as you arenâ€™t doing gymnastics under the showerhead, you wonâ€™t flood. The biggest issue is the â€œhot roomsâ€�---this property has issues with climate control. I was there on a relatively cold day and even with the AC on high, the room was an oven. Sliding open the window a few inches cooled things down a bit but the tradeoff was listening to midtown Manhattan traffic and honking all night. I also viewed comments on long check-in lines. I got lucky but over a period of two days, I noticed that the check-in line was always pretty long and with some less than happy looking people. Other than that, the hotel is fine. W did their research and is clearly aiming at a target clientele of the young and hip. Techno beat music in the lobby and elevators, good looking 20-something people at the bar and cute signs in the rooms telling you to â€œconnectâ€�, â€œindulgeâ€� , etc. I am probably a bit past this in hotels but no harm at all. If you can get this hotel at a good price, its location and other attributes make it worthwhile. If they charge to zap you for full rate, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for worst”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a recent 3 night stay. Had to wait on a line for 20 minutes to check in. The woman at the front desk assured me she would look up my Starwood preferred guest # and add it to my stay-she never did. The room was tiny, which I accept in NYC: it still had potential. I called the concierge to help with a dinner reservation and got voicemail-left a message and never heard back. Upon departure, I tried to call to have my car brought around by the valet-again no answer. I ultimately went downstairs to find 3 front desk personnel with one customer-not exactly swamped, yet I still had to wait as they pecked away at their computers. We then went out to pick up our car and 2 doormen basically ignored us-we loade our luggage ourselves. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC and this was by far the worst service I have seen. I believe there is a culture of poor service here. The final kicker-I called the manager 3 days ago to express my concern and still have not heard from them. Maybe I know where the culture begins.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a Pig”
Reviews.Author: JoeFood
Reviews.Content: The lobby was loud and crowded and there were line-ups to check-in. The room was decorated nicely but extremely small with antiquated heating and a/c. We spent the night freezing as shutting off the a/c resulted in the room turning into an oven. We stayed here as our company Christmas party was being held in the hotel. Next year we will stay somewhere else, anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: none n
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the W New York for the last 8 yrs or so and have had universally wonderful service. Specifically, Derron is a doorman who takes care of me every time I'm in town. Seems like an easy thing to remember returning guests, but experience suggests otherwise. Derron makes the effort every time. I've found this to be representative of the staff in general.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for the W Brand”
Reviews.Author: Leilani D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels throughout NYC and tend to always end up near Times Square, especially with most SPG brands, which I am not a fan of dealing with, especially during this time of the year. This W is a prime location in Midtown, convenient to everything but off the main drag to not always be insane to deal with. I have stayed at this W a couple times now and have always encountered friendly and helpful staff. It was an extremely busy and cold Saturday night and Fermin Archer, the nightshift Welcome Ambassador went above and beyond to secure me a cab after and make sure I knew where I was going. I will be honest the rooms are not large, but it definitely worked for my needs. They have acknowledged the issues of how small some of their rooms are and have comped internet, which is worth it to me because very few hotels do. Overall great experience, it's my go to hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Lost it's Edge -- the Zeitgeist has moved and been replaced by New Jersey”
Reviews.Author: urbansprawl
Reviews.Content: Always stayed here when in NY without kids, just soaking up the lobby atmosphere always put that NYC vibe in the pulse, people watching excellent. Sad to say, lobby worn, furniture could be from a yard sale with ripping upholstery, no real design effort made here. Floor lamps look cheesy with white-hot low-energy bulbs. Just not nearly as exquisite as Gramercy Park, Gansevvort, Kimpton Hotels, where every detail is attended to. Rooms still tiny, used to be forgiven for the luscious details elsewhere in facility. Plus, even though I'm nearly 50 I don't want to look at a bunch middle aged bridge and tunnelers, I'm heading elsewhere next time. W on Lex and 49th needs to close ship and completey renovate.

Reviews.Title: “W New York - Midtown East - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jport7
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room, one of the best prices we could find during the December holiday season, though still not cheap. Of course the rooms are small, it is NYC. We had the Spectacular room. The only thing not spectacular was the lack of exhaust fans in the bathroom. After taking a shower, everything in the bathroom was wet from condensation. You can walk to Times Square, Rockefeller, 5th Ave. Also, the 51st St 6 Train will take you directly down to the Brooklyn Bridge/City Hall exit which has great access to ground zero and the 9/11 Memorial.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jenniebeth
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was excellent, but I felt my trip was downhill from there. When I walked into my room, a housekeeper who was getting off work was changing in my room and using my bathroom to do so. She said this was "normal" that they washed up in the last room. Really? But, she had to go grab some more toiletries, towels and laundry bags which she had used to replace in my room. This meant she was in another 10 minutes before I could settle in. Then, things were just inconsistent. Some days I had a bath rug, some days not. Some days I had lotion, some days not. I got a wake up call each day: the first day it was 35 minutes early and no second one (requested) received, the next day it was fine, the last day it was 10 minutes late. Meaning, I couldn't rely on the wake up call. I know this seem like little things, but when paying $400 a night you expect much better (and I have had better in many other hotels in this area). The room is terribly small - even for NYC - but I'm okay with that. It's also severely out of date (but, again, not a big deal). The service issues just really irritated me. Not impressed, I will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than before -- customer service abounds”
Reviews.Author: goldbeadz
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the W several years ago on several business trips and never liked it. While I expected the rooms to be small, the staff really made you feel that they were doing you the favor in allowing you to stay in the hotel. NOT THIS TIME! Customer service was certainly high on their list. I was delighted to find that I could request a coffee maker. They brought it up with many coffee & tea K-cups. I then got a call to make sure I had gotten the unit. I had but explained that I could not figure out how to use it. No problem - they came back and showed me what I doing wrong! My daughter and I had a drink in the bar and she wanted a hot toddy. The bartender found out how to make it and brought it over, checking with us to make sure it was ok. All in all, a totally different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Uncomfortable Hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: Many rooms in NYC are small but these are the smallest we have stayed in. The AC was terrible - they did replace the Compressor for the AC but that did not seem to help. We could not wait to leave. Breakfast service was also very slow. We waited about 45 min to 1 hr to be served. We have stayed at all of the other W hotels in the city and have had pleasant experiences. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Room was OK, Staff and location were excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dakota20
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in the hotel and overall my experience was very good. The bad, I'm not sure I would have rated this a 4 * hotel because when I check into my room there was no bathtub, just a shower. When traveling to Europe I've learned to check on this but was surprised to discover it at a 4* American Hotel. The room was very small but had nice toiletries, great television, was clean and a small safe. The good - I called and inquired about the room with no tub, they said I needed to request it, I did and they accommodated me with no questions asked. They moved our suitcases the next day and our next room was slightly larger with a combo shower and tub.We were there 5 days and invited to a managers reception with complimentary drinks and appetizers although our schedule didn't allow us to attend. What was really great about this hotel was the location, easy walking distance to midtown shopping (Sakes, Bloomingdale's, Tiffany's etc.). The subway was a short block away and made transportation to China Town and the rest of the city easy. There was a 24 hour drug store within 2 blocks as well as a number of inexpensive place to eat immediate adjacent to the hotel as well as an excellent Chinese restaurant "Mr. K's). Internet was extra and expensive. Bottom line staff was excellent, location superb, and room ok. I booked through a discounts site and got a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Heatbeat resturant”
Reviews.Content: Every time I go in, Tereza Santos, the hostess is always there to greet me personally. She is quick to seat our party, and has a smile on her face. I travel to NYC a lot, and I very rarely eat breakfast anywhere else because of her. The food is good, actually very good. But she is the real deal

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE FUN PLACE TO HANG”
Reviews.Author: belladoli
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times. The first time was with my adult daughter for a week over New Years. Since, a few more times with friends who come to the area and I want to impress them. The W never fails to impress. I've stayed everywhere from the Waldorf to the Ritz and absolutely love the W. Ask for an 08 room if you want to see a phenomenal street view! Unfortunately you'll never see towards the ball side of Time's Square, only towards the back end (against traffic) but it's still amazing! Fantastic for people watching. The other rooms have little peeks of the Hudson, and buildings, etc. The doormen are warm and welcoming, as are all the staff. The relaxing living room is separated enough for privacy for each 'party', yet open enough to feel spacious. The decorations are amazing and the water walls and ceilings really set these hotels apart from most in the area/on the East coast. The bar/living room area is very comfy with plentiful yet warm lighting. There is at least one street cam which can be watched on a decent sized flat screen near the bar. Blue Fin is a great restaurant located on the bottom floor of the hotel and we had dinner there one night, it was very good so you don't have to go far! Bliss toiletries await you in the glass enclosed bathroom as do other items which are available for sale, including bottled oxygen, t-shirts, snacks wine and shot bottles of liquor. The concierge also oftentimes has promo vehicle use, just ask if you don't get a coupon upon arrival. I really enjoy the W. It is a little costlier than your average hotel, but this IS NYC, and it IS worth it. The time we stayed for New Years, we were given several free drinks, additional free Bliss products, exceptional service, baggage hold, etc. We were also happy to find out that the police had a sub-station located at the entrance and so the main part was blocked off and only hotel guests could stay in the roped off area (hence it was quite empty) which was THE BEST for New Years and beating the crowd! We ran down, watched the ball drop, sang a bit and were back in the room having a drink at 12:18. I love the hustle and bustle of Times Square and have not stayed anywhere else in NYC since discovering the W and cannot wait to go again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for easy access into the city”
Reviews.Author: justabbi76
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here, stayed in a "wonderful" room, small, compact but everything you need from a hotel room in New York, great cosmetics from Bliss spa to use in the bathroom, but ladies if you have long hair, take your own hairdryer as the travel one provided is likely to blow if not!! Attentive staff, very helpful, you can store luggage free of charge if you have a late flight on day of checkout (very helpful). Great location, just off 5th ave and Madison, we couldn't have asked for much more :) There are other more luxury W's in NY but this one serves it's purpose, because really, you're in New York, who wants to stay in their room!.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad !”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: There are nicer W hotels in New York but nonetheless this is an ok one. Its starwood category is lower than the other Ws in New York, so if you book with points, it does require fewer points. Rooms are generally small but clean and modern. I'll stay here again if I get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you enjoy the buzz and don't mind room size.”
Reviews.Author: proukakis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice modern room with superb bed and toiletries, but very small, poor view and noise from air condition when on, and some noise (presumably air-con systems) from outside. The lounge is excellent, has good music and fantastic cocktails. Wifi didn't work in our room which was very annoying, I didn't bother to ask for change.

Reviews.Title: “Learn to Communicate - Three Strikes...You're Out!”
Reviews.Author: American_Expat999
Reviews.Content: OK, first the full disclosure, this stay was part of a Friends and Family arrangement thru a relative who works for Starwood. Let me sum it up this way, with friends like this, who needs enemies. We were given the "cozy room." That means it is tiny with a queen bed. When I made the reservation I said I needed a rollaway for a child. When we arrive, they said the room was TOO SMALL to accommodate the bed. We had to go to Bed, Bath and Beyond to buy an inflatable mattress for $99 plus tax. Strike One...I had called reservations, that could look up my room on their system when they reserved the roll-away for me that the front desk subsequently said was too big for the room. Their solution, extra sheets so the child could sleep on the floor. Wife and child complained about headaches while in the room and finally realized they were allergic to the down comforter. We went to the concierge to ask for a hypoallergenic replacement who called housekeeping. The latter reported that the hotel was booked and they didn't have any. A hotel without a single extra blanket. Amazing. Strike Two. Housekeeping did come up by the way, and sure enough, they had a new, in the package, synthetic comforter. Strike Three for communication again. Why two stars? Failure to communicate, frayed scratchy towels, and a room size appropriate for a turn of the century Lower East Side tenement. So much for the W experience they seem to have spent so much marketing money on, perhaps they should divert some of it from foo-foo soap and shampoo to training staff on listening skills. Will I stay at a W again? No. Starwood property, yes (great rewards program). I heart New York, but I don't heart this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: majmaj4
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Lobby Area Comfortable Beds Good Climate controls for the room Nice clean modern rooms (although small) Free Internet Good service - I was looking for the ice machine, and one of the floor workers went out of their way to lead me to the right place and fill up my bucket. Easy walking distance Broadway Only a block from a metro stop THe only downside was the small rooms. As a tip: when staying there you can arrange a free ride in the city with Acura. I almost didn't notice the little insert. It was a great way to get to Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Bean06
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great bar and generally a beautiful Hotel.Great 1st room, bigger than expected, great decor and fabulous view but we had an issue with our ceiling leaking for 2 days and the bathroom shower not draining. We were moved to another room but the room was a bit smaller, on a lower level floor and not a Lexington Avenue view. Our only compensation was one free breakfast. Service at breakfast was very slow to start and had to ask for water more than 2 times, server was not attentive or friendly but was sure quick to bring the tab as soon as the food was delivered. Additionally, we tried to use the whatever/whenever service and it was either never available when we needed it or didn't go to the locations we were interested in. Really expected better service overall for a W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “emanuel de olveira”
Reviews.Author: emanuel d
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. bed very nice. stay at w lexington ave make it easy to any place in the city by subway it's close by. the people at the desk very great expecial Mr. Mario made the check in very fast nice person Likes to talk and share ideas that's wath i like more the "calida bien venida". My best time in New York 4 days expetacular Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: ronilight
Reviews.Content: I usually find the rooms here are tiny. But this time I went with a friend, and we got twin beds. We got a room that was quite large and in a corner. So much better than the post stamp rooms I normally get here. I may just always ask for two beds from now on for the extra space. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was nice, and I love the bliss products. The only funky thing was that when we walked into the room it smelled like nasty cleaning products. Since we were in a corner room, we just opened the windows and got a cross breeze to get rid of the smell. As always, the halls are on the dark side and kind of a pain. I usually love the lobby and hanging there in the morning over coffee. But, this time the music was like breaking glass. It seemed designed to drive people out of the lobby--mission accomplished. Not my favorite hotel, but a good stand by in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Tripwell
Reviews.Content: Amazing comfort, fun bar in the hotel also a Bliss spa -though this is cosmetic and pricey. Room was on the small side, but this is NYC. Love the W hotels and the ambience they have. Cool comfort. Convenient location for Manhahattan.

Reviews.Title: “great time @ W New York”
Reviews.Author: Yudelka N
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in NY, everything worked great from meetings to the weather. The stay at W in Lexington Ave was the cherry on top!!! The room was sexy, the lobby rocks and the staff does great. We spent a week and found everyone very helpful, we had Rufina doing our room, and concierge Patrick and Evelyn offered good recommendations and did our reservations. The hotel has a great location, we wil definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and lots of amenities!”
Reviews.Author: kharm
Reviews.Content: Loved the W NY. The location just cant be beat. We were walking distance to Rockefeller, Subways, 5th Ave, and Central Park. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was always friendly and willing to help. The doormen were also very helpful. Amazing how a little tip to them goes a long way. We booked the cozy room which even though it is tiny it truly was cozy for just us 2 and we didnt spend much time in there anyways except to sleep and shower. All NY rooms are small from experience but dont knock it. They had fresh green apples in the lobby daily for snacking and complimentary orange and mint infused water. The lobby turns into party central on Fri and Sat nights it seems with a DJ in the lobby area and the Whiskey Blue bar but we didnt have any problems getting to our room or with noise. Bed was very comfy, clean, and perfect sized! I would definitely consider staying at the W next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful little rooms”
Reviews.Author: crookieScotland
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting hotel.The check in was quick and efficient.My initial reaction when we entered the room was one of disappointment as it was so small.However, my initial reaction turned to one of pleasure when we looked around the room.It was spotlessly clean,the complimentary toiletries were from Bliss.The bed was one of the most comfortable that I have ever slept in.I felt that our room had a lovely peaceful aura.We did not use the bar but it was always busy and the people in it looked like the were having fun.I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay there, just spent a fantastic evening in the bar there!”
Reviews.Author: bchrist1
Reviews.Content: We heard the bar was good there, and it was excellent! The staff quickly honed in on that we were a couple boys from Western Canada as opposed to more prevalent Eastern Canadian tourists, so they socialized with us a fair bit and made us feel like we had been going there our whole lives! Met alot of great New Yorkers that frequent this club and like most New Yorkers they wasted no time in welcoming us into their group and were very social! Not too loud so it's easy to enjoy music and still be able to talk. Look forward to hitting that spot again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy = small, but they do cozy very well.”
Reviews.Author: jayn71
Reviews.Content: Super small rooms, but they are clean and super cozy. The beds are comfy - which is the main thing, right? Who stays in their rooms in NYC but to sleep? Friendly, efficient staff. Great bar in the lobby. I think it might be my favorite W in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “They try hard to please”
Reviews.Author: gjspring
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary hotel - if you like "old world" luxury, try the Waldorf Astoria across the street. The good: Very comfy bed, clean rooms, pleasant staff, good shower with hot water, good soundproofing, great location. The bad: Rooms too small for comfort. Even in an upgraded room ("spectacular size"), my elbow kept hitting the sink while sitting on the commode. The room has a balcony door, but unfortunately it is locked with a sign that says it won't open for safety reasons. The staff try very hard to please, although I'd rather things were done right to begin with. For example, they say you can request a coffee machine for you room - I did so BEFORE we arrived - it wasn't there. Then they called me three times to ask if I'd received it (I hadn't). Finally it arrived, but the maid didn't replenish the stock the next day (even when asked with a note). This is an okay hotel, but I don't think I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Prototype W Hotel - not up to current chain standards.”
Reviews.Author: knightline
Reviews.Content: This was the prototype hotel for W Hotels. They updated the rooms well, but it was built in the 30s or 40s (when it was the Belmont Manor - where Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis were staying when they met in the mid-40s). As an old hotel, it has VERY small rooms. That is why this hotel is cheaper than the other Ws in NYC. Service is excellent and lives up to the other Ws - it's just the tiny rooms that bother me. Couples might do well to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience from an experienced New York visitor!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBarbie658
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out it was awesome! We stayed in a cozy room and it was great! For 2 girls with ALOT of clothes it was more than big enough. The bathroom was huge with the best shower Ive ever had, always hot and fantastic flow! Rooms were made up daily and we particularly liked the free Bliss Spa products we received in our bathroom each day (they charge $25 for the same set down in the spa so hang on to them each day!) The bed was really comfy, plenty of floor space for all the shopping bags and our cases. The staff are so attentitive, every time we called down requesting something (i.e more towels, ice bucket, bath robes etc) we always received it moments after calling down. THEN 5 minutes later we were always called to see if we received whatever we had requested. They are just so nice! We also requested a dvd (they are free to hire) one evening but later realised that our room type didnt have a DVD player. So, because they are so wonderful, for the 'inconvenience' (gotta love the yanks!) we were given a free movie from the box office which was taken off our bill at the end of our stay! If thats not good customer service then I dont know what is. The location is perfect, around 5 blocks from Broadway which I think is a great location to be in. I dont mind walking a little bit to get to places so suited us fine. The door men always hailed cabs right away and even on an incredibly wet evening when there was an hour and a half wait for cabs (and we had tickets for a show starting in 15 minutes!) the door men managed to get us a taxi and sent us off to the show with smiles on our faces! The Living Room bar downstairs is great (the 1 hour free wifi was also useful) and the Whiskey Blue bar was great fun too, drinks are strong though so if you dont want a fuzzy head in the morning then take it easy ;) The Bliss Spa is well worth a visit, its not cheap but you pay for the experience, they definatley know what they are doing in there and as I mentioned before the products are A-MAZ-ING! Definatley stay here, do not take any notice of the bad reviews because some people are just pathetic and they nit pick at silly little things that wouldnt bother a normal person!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, solid place.”
Reviews.Author: ilovereb
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on hotels.com. Good location, not great. We had a long wait to check in and they had waters and champagne available. Room was small but nice. Pet friendly. They had a dj in the lobby after 9 pm. Not the quietest, but you are in NYC. I was awakened at 130 am by a vocal young lady that let's just say wasn't sleeping,

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep I've ever gotten in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie D
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I were exploring the Big Apple for a week by ourselves and found the W Hotel to be the best way to experience it! The beds were SO comfortable and the Bliss Products made it feel like I was at a spa for a week. One night we got in pretty late and called the 'Whenever, Wherever' line to ask what places delivered pizza this late (or early - it was 5 am!). Shon Wimbush was SOOO much help! He called all over and although there were no places that delivered that late, he got our order, called it in for us, and then picked it up and delivered it to our room! Needless to say, we were pleasantly surprised at the great, friendly attitude he had and the willingness to go out in the cold and get us pizza! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing experience in the bustling city!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not GREAT”
Reviews.Author: mtlfamily4
Reviews.Content: Big W fan here but this hotel could use some help...rooms are the smallest I have ever seen, smaller than rooms in europe! Clean YES but what a price for such a tiny space!

Reviews.Title: “Great time for thanksgiving in nyc”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children (4yr old and 20 mo old) spent thanksgiving in nyc at the W. We had a great experience. The room we had was very spacious and clean. Jessie was very helpful and treated us like family. We have stayed at all the W's in NYC and this is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, nice stay on a Busy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bzygo
Reviews.Content: Went to New York City for a long weekend in early November and stayed at The W because it was one of the better values I found. I arrived before the stated check-in time, wasn't a problem, they got me a room right away and even set up a late check-out time for me on Sunday. The room was small, but nice and comfortable. While the lobby/bar area has the feel of a night club, the noise was limited to that space and could not be heard in my room. The doormen were very helpful in getting guests cabs, even during the cab rush hour. My friends were staying in SoHo, and though that wasn't exactly close, it was easy to get to via cab, subway, or even walking if you were up for it. I'd stay there again. I made a mistake and first posted this review for The W - Union Square, my mistake, I stayed at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary!!”
Reviews.Author: Fernando T
Reviews.Content: It was amazing, great service, great attention and we had a few excellent anniversary surprises, our experience was WOW!! My wife loved it and we enjoyed every second staying there. Nicole Fondry was amazing and made our trip extraordinary, we will definitely visit again. Unforgettable experience at the W New York!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever...”
Reviews.Author: retired080
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here if you have children. Do NOT stay here if you are over 30. Our room was miniscule even by NYC standards. We had twin beds! I haven't slept in a twin bed since I was a child. The room was so small we had to crawl over the beds to get around from one side to another. The mattress toppers kept slipping off the twin bed so you felt as if you were going to fall off the bed onto the floor. The pillows were hard and the sheets had holes in them on more than one occasion. One of the robes also had a hole in the sleeve. A giant cobweb hung from the ceiling the entire week we stayed there. There was a hair in the tub when we checked in....yuck. Our room looked out on the garbage pickup area of another hotel. They picked up garbage starting about midnight and continuing through the night, the noise was horrendous. The lovely lobby they call the "living room" is not ever solely for the use of the guests. They have loud, booming music playing 24/7, during the day it is filled with people who are attending business meetings in the hotel conference rooms. They fill almost every seat and attempt to talk to each other and into their phones by screaming over the music. Starting on Friday night the "living room" is turned into a club. Loud and obnoxious music and a loud, drinking crowd. We checked in on a Sat. night and had to literally scream over the music for the desk clerk to hear us. My daughter had an important conference call across town, they messed up our reservation and she had to straighten it out before she could leave for her meeting. The shorter, older male desk clerk with the glasses started screaming at her that she should respect him and no one is allowed to get upset and not respect him.......I am not kidding. The manager witnessed the end of this and promised to speak to him and gave my daughter 500 points, seriously???? The desk clerk should have been pulled off the desk immediately. Trying to check out our suitcases were already in the taxi and the desk clerk was making a personal phone call and refused to acknowledge our existence. Finally my daughter left the key on the counter and we left. The only positive things I can say about this hotel is that it is in a good location, but so are other hotels and you would have to be treated better than you will be at this hotel. The maintenance staff is wonderful, we did not have ANY hot water for the first 2 days and they worked until it was fixed. The food is also very good but ridiculously high priced. Between the garbage trucks, the thumping music of the club that we could hear in our room and the beds being twin with slipping pads we never got a decent night's sleep. Also the room was boiling hot and we could not get the air conditioning to cool it down. To top off the entire experience I could not get on the internet the last night we stayed there. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service by Welcome Ambassador, L. Germain”
Reviews.Author: sonalim
Reviews.Content: It was the Welcome Ambassador, Mr. L. Germain who made my visit there memorable. Not only was her super-helpful, but he made sure that me and my guests were looked after. Especially since my guests arrived from the UK and their flight was 7 hours delayed, the hospitality by L. Germain made a huge difference on our impression of W New York. Hope all staff members learn from this wonderful gesture!!!! Will definitely return as me and my guests were hugely impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent deal.”
Reviews.Author: johnny16
Reviews.Content: This came up as a 4-star hotel on Hotwire. The room I had couldn't be called that. It was cramped. Still, for, I think 188 a night (tax included) it was a pretty good deal. Centrally located with the 6 Subway right there. The staff was nice, although we didn't ask for much except a cab and for them to get the heater to stop baking us, which they did quickly. My daughter enjoyed the $8 tic-tacs from the mini-bar before I yelled at her to stop touching stuff as I evened the score with an $11 Heineken.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, big price, indifferent front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: FondofTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the W Hotel on Lexington. It's centrally located with a happening lobby. We waited 15 minutes to check in, were given a "spectacular" king room for nearly $600. It was tiny, with the smallest bathroom I've seen in a hotel. The bathroom door and closet door hit each other if you need to open both of them at the same time. The lighting was poor. We were really unimpressed. Given the price, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kay J
Reviews.Content: Recently I was at the W- New York. Edna and Gloria went above and beyond to ensure my New York was Amazing. Everyone should experience the lobby, spa and the entire W. Upon check Miram was the holding the late shift and even at the late hours - her service was outstanding. Bravo Bravo

Reviews.Title: “"A very modern hotel"”
Reviews.Author: MManuVR
Reviews.Content: I loved the W, itÂ´s in Lexington street!. ItÂ´s perfect, the design of the hole hotel itÂ´s one of the best in the world!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W New York for 5 nights. It was special week because we were getting married. The service level was off the charts! The staff took such great care of us, along with several of our guests that also stayed at the hotel. We called down for service several times, and our orders were fulfilled extremely quickly. We met the hotel manager, who sent a bottle of champagne to our room as congratulations, and she greeted us almost every time we walked through the lobby. It was quite a special week, and thanks to W New York for making it even more outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A very cool place!”
Reviews.Author: Ronit H
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple who came for our honeymoon. After hearing that most rooms are pretty small, we asked to upgrade our room and got the "superb room", which was excellent, although the bed was only a quin size, without anymore charge. The room is very cool and well designed, the stuff is very nice and there is a party in the lobby every weekend (but in the room it's quite). We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W New York was an amazing experience. The staff was exceptional and the hotel was meticulous from the lobby to the room and everything in between. Our experience was memorable and the ambiance at the Oasis Lounge was exceptional. The staff and food was great and they were more than happy to assist with any of our needs. From when we got out of the car to the front desk to the lounge the experience was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for the room”
Reviews.Author: jnaviation
Reviews.Content: Extremely tiny rooms charged at a 5 stars rate. The hotel is not more than a four points sheraton. Completely overrated, I can find better deals in NY for 250 bucks per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Makes it Best”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC often, and I try to get a room at the W New York on Lex whenever I can. I've had several great experiences staying at the hotel, and they always go back to specific employees who go out of their way to make my stay more enjoyable. Most recently, I stayed for an entire week for business. I always call ahead and speak to the concierge (Evelyn now). Evelyn verified my reservation was in order, and I arrived Sunday night. It was a rough day of delayed planes, gates at the airport without marshals to bring in the plane, luggage took forever, I missed my train into the city, etc. To my surprise, when checking in at the W, I found that Evelyn had pointed out I had hit a milestone of stays with W Hotel. I walked into my room to see a gift from the staff, and two handwritten notes from W Insiders letting me know they were a phone call away. The night security team, the breakfast staff, the desk, the bartenders, everyone tries to remember your name, and ask if my stay is enjoyable. Tip of the hat to Evelyn and everyone at the W New York. I'm coming back. Mark C.

Reviews.Title: “Not the "W" to stay in”
Reviews.Author: LisaAnne_quilts
Reviews.Content: I decided to stray from my usual W (Union Square) on my last trip to NYC in order to experience a new neighborhood. The designer thought more of 'modern' than efficient, pleasant, or accessible. You need to get to the fifth floor in order to get to check-in. After check-in, you need to go through the bar area to get to your room. The first room I had smelled bad - another, lesser room was provided and was ok. The hotel car was 'booked' when I called to request an appt - but my daughter was able to walk up and ask the driver and suddenly there was an opening. Take my advice. If you have the $$ (or SPG points) to stay at the W in NY, pick the one in Union Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: I would normally not stay at a W hotel because of their price, however I found a great deal for this particular W Hotel! Included in our price was breakfast, hotel, and of course this hotel offers bliss products in the bathroom. My friend and I arrived prior to normal check-in time, and not only was a room available but they also upgraded our room complimentary! The staff was very hepful, and when we requested shower caps they can quicker than expected. The elevators and overall building smelled very pleasant as well. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York!

Reviews.Title: “W hotel, NYC, Midtown”
Reviews.Author: 543Alexthewriter
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with the most comfortable bed I've ever found anywhere. That alone rates five star reviews. Excellent staff, very good business center, all amenities. Kind of Japanese modern for decor in the room we had. A bit small, but not a problem. It's convenient to everything. I would stay thedre again.

Reviews.Title: “Room hot, hotel run down”
Reviews.Author: BrentHouston
Reviews.Content: Very hot room with no air. The hotel is rather run down. Not what I expected for a W hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good italian taste”
Reviews.Author: Roland B
Reviews.Content: I would like to write a special remark for Isabel and Benito at the W Cafe. Their warmth and kindness make me feel home everytime I enjoy the hospitality of this friendly hotel. Benito and Isabel also achieved great results in making a really special espresso coffee, really close to my hometown taste. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveloverer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally in midtown...easy access to all NY has to offer. We lucked out and got a corner room with a balcony (no access however), but the extra light coming into the room was great. Also, since it was a corner room, it was pretty spacious. The bathroom was small, but adequate. Overall the room was clean and well maintained and no beg bugs! I know these bugs have been an issue for NY hotels. We didn't try the restaurant on site, but we did go to the lobby lounge which served up great small bites in the evening and had a DJ on Fri and Sat night. The atmosphere is very inviting...pretty hip and fun. Whiskey Blue is another alternative for a bar, but you'll find the lobby bar area much more exciting. The service is excellent...they are a stickler for "whatever whenever" you wish for. Staff was even willing to run to the store for me for an emergencey purchase. We tried to book the Acura car but timing didn't work - apparently the car service is a separate concierge from the hotel concierge. It was a great weekend at the W. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: breebro
Reviews.Content: The W is a very nice, chic hotel. I enjoyed my three night stay there very much. I was there with three girlfriends in their cozy room (squeezing four people into this room is not recommended...three should be fine). The room was really nicely decorated and comfortable. Got the room for a steal on Priceline ($109/night plus taxes and fees). Having gone to NYC three times this year, this hotel was the best by far (other two times we stayed at the Radisson and the Pod). The doormen were always helpful in hailing cabs and overall it's a gorgeous, modern hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-town location @ 49th & Lexington.”
Reviews.Author: 3fortheride
Reviews.Content: The location is very convienient to all of mid-town. The W scene can be very loud so do not expect a quite environment as you enter the lobby in the evening hours. The bar, Whisky Blue, is small but comfortable with great service. The rooms are generally quite, are very comfortable but are very small. In fact, their upgrade, spectacular room, is smaller than most hotel rooms. Their "cozy" room is smaller than the walk-in closet in my house. That said, most people are not in NYC to be in their room so the great location out weighs the noise and tight quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but come on, you are in NYC! Unless you want to pay half your mortgage in one night, a smaller but fairly priced room is just fine. Plus you should be out in the city playing! You do great free wifi and bonus Starwood points when you stay here. That's a nice bonus! The lobby does turn into a club atmosphere on Fri and Sat nights. That didn't bother us, but we also weren't expecting it. The location was stellar because it was so close to the 6 subway which can easily take you to great parts of town like Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service from Sara in Accounting Department”
Reviews.Author: Deborah W
Reviews.Content: Sara was extremely helpful in assisting me with a billing question- fast and accurate. Provided me with everything I requested within 20 minutes of my phone call to her. She went above and beyond my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Leah T
Reviews.Content: Pros: the hotel is walking distance from 5th avenue and very accessible to the nearest train station on 51 st street. The door man are really attentive and very helpful always assisting in helping us get cabs. I really appreciate the fact that one of the bell man did not accept a tip from me saying that my co traveler staying at the hotel gave him a tip already. I felt it was very ethical. Cons: the bath map was torn which was not acceptable when I was paying about 350 dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in almost all aspects”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_In_Taipei
