Reviews.Content: I stayed only in 2 W in the world so far: W Taipei and W NY on Lexington. Having been very pleased with the one in Taipei (see my review for W Taipei), my expectation for NY was high. Unfortunately, it was very disappointing ! The only 2 positive aspects of W Lexington is the good response we get from Whatever/Whenever (usually fast and efficient CS response) and the Concierge and the location. Negative are: - the Spectacular room we got has nothing spectacular => very tiny room (only 1m large around the bed), no particular atmosphere, used carpet, tiny tiny tiny old bathroom (max 2.5m2 - you cannot be 2 persons in the bathroom at the same time - there is simply not enough space) - the noise at the Reception area is always TOO loud => are we in a disco or is it STILL a hotel? - the heating system is somewhat antic => impossible to customized the temperature of the room. - cleanliness of the room can be improved, especially in the bathroom - impossible to sleep without earplugs. The windows are antic so no isolation from street noise. All in all, this is really the last time we are going to this W.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: empresz
Reviews.Content: We were in town for yet another wedding a few weeks ago. I booked the W based on reviews, location and cost. My husband and I flew the red eye to NY, arrived at the hotel by 9:30AM. I know most hotels have a strict check-in policy of 3PM. We decided to ask anyway to see if it was possible to get our room any earlier since we were incredibly tired. The lovely girl at the front desk found us a room that was just emptied and clean. I was already in love w/ the W based on that alone. When we arrived to our room, I wasn't prepared for how tiny it was. It was VERY small. In fact, a little note said something like "we know it's a small room, but we hope the extras make up for the lack of space." The extras were free WiFi and 500 starwood points. I mean, it wasn't horrible, but I'm the type of person who likes to spend time in a hotel room to unwind and relax. I felt a bit claustrophobic in there. The view was also not great. I swear I don't consider myself a picky person, but the view was really atrocious. It was of the dirty parking structure and we can clearly see into the other rooms. I'll post photos as soon as possible. But other than that, I liked the W. Staff was friendly and helpful. The bar was a nice scene. I love the Bliss products, and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the W New York”
Reviews.Author: broffel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W New York and we had a great time. Our cozy room was small, but we knew that when we booked. Everything was very well laid out and it was fine seeing that you don't spend much time in the room. It was spotless and the bath products were fantastic. This hotel is in a very good location. We were about a 10 minute walk to Times Square and we were just up the street from Bloomingdale's. There is plenty of shoppin on Lexington and lots of great places to eat Nearby. The only negative would be that the music in the lounge was quite loud in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Jack V
Reviews.Content: As an extremely frequent global traveler, I feel well qualified to comment on the best and worst hotels in the world. The W in midtown is by far my favourite hotel in the world. From the moment you are greeted until you check out, the staff does an admirable job of making you feel welcome. Sometimes it is as simple as a, "Hello" in the hallway. Other times it is the doorman asking if you have remembered your phone and wallet and laptop as he puts you in a taxi to the airport. The lobby is alwaqys teeming with interesting and beautiful people. There is a buzz there that is all New York. In the end, though, it is the staff that makes a difference. And here they do!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the classics”
Reviews.Author: Liorfi
Reviews.Content: So i had a week in NYC and i was looking for a place to stay and pay less than 200$ a day. This hotel is located right in the middle of everything, it is near the subway, it offers free transportation in the city, and most of all, it has a great bar and lobby. The room was a bit small but it was clean and tidied everyday, the bath was amazing with Gliss products

Reviews.Title: “Heavy on attitude, light on CS”
Reviews.Author: telegirl68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about attitude. Obnoxious disco music is pumped into the all public areas of the hotel at all times. Botched check-in (my associate checked me in, supposedly I had only to "pick up my key"but when I arrived, with an hour to spare before engagement, my room "wasn't ready"). Then they gave me key to an occupied room, so I schlepped up there with all my stuff and---eeek! So I had to schlepp back down and wait in line to talk to another snotty clerk. All in all---40 minutes of dicking around. Supposed apology bottle of wine never materialized). When I finally got the room, it was comfy and quiet, with a big flat screen. Also, a big wet spot in carpet and wet-dog smell in room---eeew. Wonder what was on the rug? Black hair in bathtub which I left to test them was still there two days later (I'm blonde). Internet is $15 a day (hello, Mr. Shrager, buy a vowel--even the Days Inn has free internet). A 7 oz. bottle of water or M&M's in mini-bar was $8. Luckily, there's a liquor store up the street! Bar full of bridge-and-tunnel wannabe hipsters yelling at each other. To be fair, on the upside, they offer yummy bed and bedding, great products, cafe food excellent and well-served. But for me, there will be no next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great night, amazing room, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ev4
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I'm very picky about hotels. I do not sleep well when I am away from my own bed and the conditions need to be "just so" in order for me to have a good experience at a hotel. The W definitely surpassed my expectations and I had a wonderful night. My boyfriend and I spent the night here as part of his father's birthday celebration. Form the outside, you can barely tell that the place is a hotel because it is so anassuming except for the large front doors and the W Hotel flag in front. Immediately upon walking in, you forget you are in a busy city because it is so serene. The lobby is spacious and interestingly decorated with grass by the check-in desk. There was a fresh pitcher of iced tea at the desk, which I thought was a nice touch. The staff are accomodating and efficient, making check-in a breeze. The elevators are a bit scary since it is an old building, but it adds to the experience. Overall the room was awesome. It was spacious and very clean. It was so quiet, we did not hear any street noise at all. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the TV was large and modern. In fact everything about the decor was very modern and pretty. A housekeeper came and asked us if we wanted her to turn down the bed. She was so sweet and said she would come back later. (She did, and she left us little chocolates on the pillows!) There is an attention to detail in the hotel. There are small writing pads and pens all over, as well as plenty of towels and toiletries. When we called the front desk for something, they knew who we were and greeted us by saying "Hello Mr. __, How may I assist you?"--very professional! I was impressed. After we put our stuff in the room we went down to the bar to have cocktails before we got ready to go out. The bar was nice, and it was crowded by the time we got there. We were able to get seats on the main floor of the bar. The servers were attentive and efficient. The next morning we met up for brunch. The food was great, but the service was quite slow. I guess it depends on the time of day. Before we went out we walked around the area a bit and went to the farmer's market in Union Square. There is always so much going on in this area and the hotel is in a great location. You can walk from the hotel right into the heart of Union Square and find a ton of things to do anytime of the day or night. Overall I had a great experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay/Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: canada2011ns
Reviews.Content: I rely on Trip advisor for reviews when planning my travel and not often do I give 5 stars to hotels. Normally something is missing. Not at the W New York. At first glance when booking our weekend in New York I looked at other hotels including the Waldorf (which is accross the street). However the W hotel is part of a conglomerate of hotels that we often frequent for business meetings. After reading the review, I booked it and we were very happy we did. From the booking stage, when I had to add my husband's name on the room as we were arriving from two separate countries, to the check-in/check out were were pleased with the service. The room was well appointed. The Bliss bath products " blissful" and the staff warm and accomodating. We will stay here again, the area was great and the lounge was energizing. Don't hesitate and book the W New York

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: nix_05
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about the inconvenient location, small rooms and potentially rude staff, I was very pleased to find that, in my case, they were all wrong! We arrived in NY on a red eye from LAX, got to the hotel at 7AM to find, unsurprisingly, that our room was not ready. No problem, the lovely Gloria said we'd have one by 11. Got back to the hotel around 10 and within 30 minutes we were told we had been upgraded to a King room and it was ready right away. The room was a good size, plenty of room for 2 adults, luggage, and lots of shopping. The bathroom was a little snug, but workable. Our room had a huge TV, very comfy bed and 2 large windows overlooking 49th Street & Lex. The hotel itself is very cool, hip and calm. The Lounge Room is a brilliant area and the staff were always very friendly and helpful, no matter what time of day/night. As for location, its walking distance to 5th Avenue and the 51st Street subway, a hop on/off tour bus stops across the street, but cabs are so cheap in NYC, there's no reason to walk or get the subway unless you really want to! I'd definitely stay here again, if I had a King or larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay w/ GREAT Service”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W NY many times and continue going back. However, this most recent staay was one of our best and most enjoyable and it was all thanks to Cyndi at the front desk. Cyndi truly went above and beyond to help us out and we had a GREAT visit especially thanks to her!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jaimecml
Reviews.Content: We had such a great experience at this hotel. The staff were friendly, the location was convenient and the car service was great! We spent 11 nights at this hotel, and enjoyed it immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Very friendly and warm staff”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this W several times now over the past few years and I have to tell you that this by far was the best stay (not that the other stays were bad). The one thing that stood out the most is the friendliness and warmth of your employees. They are hands down the friendliest people that I have encountered at any hotel during my travels over the years. Everybody from the bellman to the housekeepers in the hallway, they really made you feel welcomed and took time to offer their assistance even if it was not needed. I donâ€™t know what your secret is but you certainly have to be proud of them. And it has to make your job that much easier. Kindness and friendliness goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, upscale and very well located. Small rooms and pricey but a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mcallongbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for two nights in Oct. Overall it was a great stay. Service was awesome with champagne at check in and a very attentive staff. It's a small room but its clean and comfortable. The location on Lexington is great. I got the room on Priceline and overall very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME GIRLS' TRIP”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to have ourselves a little girls' vacation to NYC. We arrived around 1PM and our rooms were not ready....we weren't expecting it to since check in is scheduled at 4PM. We decided to wait at the bar and had a great bartender, Peter. We received a call around 3:30PM to let us know our rooms were ready and we would be being upgraded! The upgrade was extremely nice and gave 4 girls a much needed second bathroom. The last day of our trip, we made a reservation for brunch through the concierge, Patrick. He is GREAT!! When we got to the restaurant they seated us immediately and at the end of the meal, they brought over a dessert tray...compliments of the concierge desk at the W hotel! HOW SWEET...literally and figuratively!! Overall, the staff at the W Hotel Lex Ave are WONDERFUL! Our trip made us realize; we need an annual girls' trip and ONLY stay at the W. Next trip, South Beach!! HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: marcodelbarco
Reviews.Content: The W New York has received its mixed reviews, but from my perspective, it was just right! Starting with the courteous service and genuine warmth (NOT some smarmy, patronizing service), the relatively central location in Manhattan, the cool spaces, I was completely satisfied. The rooms are small, but cozy, comfortable, and completely adequate. I didn't come to NYC to hang out in my room anyway (does anyone?!) The added bonus of the Acura driver service was an unexpected surprise. And finally, the express check out was a breeze, and a welcome end to my visit. If you're coming to NYC alone, or on business, or for just a fun, romantic weekend getaway, this hotel does the trick!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for grandma too!”
Reviews.Author: swimfishswim
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel!!! If you are traveling with someone that is had to satisfy, The W New York on Lexington Ave is for you. The staff was friendly and ready to help with any questions you may have or just getting you a cab. The corner jr suite is a good size. The beds are so comfortable. I also found this location to be convenient to shopping and restaurants. We are already planning our trip back to this hotel. Great job guys!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great three day trip”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto S
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three day trip to NYC. I flew in on the red eye Thursday. I arrived early Friday morning extremely fatigued. Mario at the front desk was very accomodating. He made several calls to housekeeping to have my room ready asap. I was able to take a nap in the second floor lounge area while my room was prepared. Mario followed up with me periodically to reassure I was comfortable. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aaiselly
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff is great - friendly, helpful, courteous. The beds could not be more comfortable. The location is terrific. I was worried after reading some of the negative reviews but there was no need to be. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisBob
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a business trip, and the highlight was getting a chance to stay at the W New York on Lexington Ave. I have stayed at other W hotels, but never in New York and this was a treat! Check-in was prompt and cheerful. I received a room on the 16th floor that overlooked the Waldorf Astoria. The room in was bright and recently renovated. The bathroom was cool - pocket door, nice walk-in stand-up shower with adjustable rainhead shower, big sink and terrific shelf space. I love the Bliss toiletries that they stock at W hotels. The bed was a queen, but so comfortable, with plenty of pillows. Heating and cooling was quiet and efficient. Great radio with ipod dock. I slept like a bear and woke up to a fantastic breakfast in the restaurant - try the fresh yogurt or a Manhattan Bagel - while a bit pricey (but this is New York) the food is great, service prompt, and staff attentive. I was very happy with the hotel and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “a total joke”
Reviews.Author: jmt12london
Reviews.Content: so...3 nights for $2000 in total, for a tiny room, view over a car park, air conditioning that makes more noise than a formula grand prix and just very basic basic service. ok, the location is pretty central but this is a total rip off. even the shampoo smells very cheap. their motto of whatever whenever is a total joke. they should start with basic amenities. marc

Reviews.Title: “Not a review of the hotel but of the concierege desk”
Reviews.Author: Simply_Rob
Reviews.Content: Many have already written plenty about the W New York on Lexington. This is a succinct reference to Laurent and Evelyn, who have been real gems throughout my stay, always being bright as sunshine and having more than one answer to my endless questions about "where do I..." or "what is the best..." or "when should I...". Both Laurent and Evelyn deserve special mention and praise. I truly hope that the management of the hotel (greetings, Mr Maynard) will take good note of these two lovely individiduals from a SPG-P guest who has spent three months at the W NY over the past 18 months.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but SUPERB location”
Reviews.Author: bladerunner168
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in October 2011, paid $280 per night for a Spectacular room, direct booking from hotel website. The location of the hotel was perfect, Midtown East, perfect for exploring NYC and shopping. The room is small but this is NYC so I guess not much people will be spending much time in there anyway apart from sleeping. Whilst on the subject of sleeping, the bed is one of the best I've slept on, truly amazing. The rain shower was good but I would have preferred an adjustable option too. Also, the shower curtain was poor, there were minor floods every time I took a shower. Room service was prompt, food was fairly decent but there is just too many options in this city to be eating in the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful, no complaints here. Internet access is slow and expensive, avoid if you can (I couldn't). I can confirm there were no bedbugs in my room. I didn't go to the bar, it was always packed, plus, there are much better options in Soho, West Side and Willamsburg in Brooklyn. If I had to pay full rate, I would not stay here again as the hotel looks a bit tired, but for me, the price I paid and the location made this stay in NYC very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: p f
Reviews.Content: Stayed this summer. Check in by Mario was a delight, warm and personable. The room is smaller, but the housekeeping staff did a great job, I did not find other people's hair in my towels, or bathroom floor, that is a huge plus for me. The Bliss products are wonderful, and the beds comfy. When I was leaving, Mario remembered me, and bid me a warm goodbye, great personal touch. Coming from Hawaii, I was impressed by the warm aloha I received.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - i'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ctaylor0159
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small (but all of NYC's rooms are) & they are very modernly decorated which i liked. service was accomodating even during the month of december! i arrived before check-in & they were happy to give me a room early. hotel was very crowded & may have been sold out since it was december. the bar area in the lobby is hopping. friday and saturday night when i was there it was packed & very fun. not a big lobby & limited seating but it was fun. conseirge was less than helpful but she seemed swamped. again, it was december in NYC. wonderful location in midtown manhattan & tons of great places are in walking distance. highly recommend the hotel even though it can be pricey during peak times like the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay thanks to wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: parleek
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the W on Lexington in late September after booking via Hotwire. We anticipated getting one of the small rooms (Cozy Rooms in W parlance) because of our discount booking and having read other reviews here thought we were prepared for the room size, but seriously it was the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. The room is cleverly designed to fit in everything a hotel room should have and was very clean but honestly seemed designed for one (small) person not two. If we had ended up staying in that room for our 2 nights we would have probably just put up with it but I canâ€™t see it would have left us with a glowing impression of the place. However, just after we arrived, staff from building engineering knocked on the door to replace the light in the room (which as other reviews have noted, was blue and made it extremely difficult to see in the room). We weren't unpacked yet, we told them just to come in and go ahead. We chatted a bit about the room while they worked, and they offered to find us a larger room due to the problems with the first. The second room we were given was very large and comfortable, with a great view over Lexington. The bed was very comfortable, the room quiet and the curtains seemed to be made of something magic that kept any light from getting into the room. We slept extremely well both nights we were there. We didnâ€™t make much use of the public areas of the hotel. The lobby is big and open, there is a nice lounge area with a bar and comfortable couches. It is quite clubby at night and this isnâ€™t really our scene, but we were impressed that despite the loud and bustling lobby, the halls and rooms were quiet. All of our interactions with staff were positive: everyone was very friendly and helpful. Our flight to NYC arrived in the morning and we were allowed to check in very early (before noon). In particular Kenny from engineering was great: super friendly, funny and helpful (he even carried my bag from the old room to the new one.) Oh, and he mentioned that the aforementioned blue lights are being replaced throughout the hotel. The location is very convenient: there are two subway lines very close at hand. The W is usually a little outside my budget, and it was definitely a step up in terms of design and quality of furnishings etc than the hotels I normally stay in. Will definitely look at this property for a future NYC stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great vibe, you only get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Katejp99
Reviews.Content: Overall the perfect choice if you want a great location, funky rooms and a great vibe. Everyone is very cool and the bar in the lobby pumps every night. They also have a nice free limo transfer service - but book early as it fills up quickly. On the downside rooms are NY small, so don't buy the lead in price. The beds are also doubles, so whilst very comfortable are small. Probably the biggest downside is that you need to be prepared to pay considerably for anything extra - wi fi, business centre etc. Look for a room rate with as much included as possible. Concierge was also very helpful - I emailed them in advance and they organized a heap of restaurant reservations for me. Overall, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Columbus Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: LaptopLift
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the city over a glorious weekend of blue skies and sunshine for 5days - our stay at the W Hotel on Lexington was complemented by the wonderful welcome service we received from the beginning - right to our good byes ... Mario made the W Hotel a welcomed delight with a lasting impression that would make us look no further for a place to stay. Thank you, Trish&Kenny

Reviews.Title: “The rooms might be small, but...”
Reviews.Author: CarolCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We were very glad we opted to reserve a suite. We had a nice sitting area with fully equipped computer desk, chaise lounge, large ottoman, dressing table, TV, and even access to an outside balcony. This was the roomiest part of our suite. The bedroom was nicely appointed but small. The bathroom was tiny--only one person could be in there at a time. From the printed layout of the hotel, we could see that the tight bedrooms and the tiny baths were the norm for the standard rooms. The service we received at the W was excellent, however. The food in their restaurant was innovative and tasty, room service was prompt, and the concierge provided us with excellent recommendations and service. The overall vibe of the hotel was young, upbeat and "happening." I would definitely recommend this hotel for the level of their services, excellent location on Lexington Avenue, and the atmosphere of the place. Just be sure to reserve a suite, or don't spend a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business & Romance”
Reviews.Author: zgabster
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the W & Loved every moment. From the moment you walk in you enjoy the music played by a DJ at the lobby lounge & was met with a glass of champagne to enjoy while waiting in line to check in. Excellent start. Then as I was checking in, the manager offered me a preferred rate for an upgrade to a suite, when he learned that my wife will join later that week to enjoy the weekend. I stayed from Saturday to Thursday in a Mega room (for business) & upgraded to a Marvelous Suite with terrace & sun beds overlooking Manhattan. Spectacular views!! I added pictures of the Terrace & its views. For room, go to hotel website to see Marvelous Suite details. I enjoyed drinks for a couple of nights with clients at the Whisky Blue Bar (very happening bar with lots of eye candy). Even though the automated curtains did not work, the Hotel maintenance staff tried their best to fix it & we enjoyed asking for 10 pillows to cover the whole window & ordered excellent room service meals & enjoyed an amazing sleep on the luxuriously comfortable bed (-: Friday morning we spent 1.5 hours of massage at the BlissÂ®49 Spa & then attacked the city for a weekend of restaurant & shopping. The staff, service & location offer you an oasis of relaxation in a city that doesn't sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Really Small”
Reviews.Author: W_Alva_3
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews that said that the rooms were small, but I was travelling by myself and got a really good rate in this good location. However, the room was even smaller than I expected and reminded me of a cruise ship cabin. I actually felt a little claustrophobic. Free internet was a bonus I wasn't expecting and the staff was friendly, but I don't want to stay in a room that small again.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a makeover”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoBubbie
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this property since it first opened a decade ago. The first W to open in the city and it was a great place to stay. I expect properties to slowly start to become run down but then I expect the hotel to reinvest in their property and make sure the guest doesn't notice the aging of everything. This last trip, I could not wait to leave. The bedding has become so tattered that the sheets would no longer stay in tact on the mattress. I woke up every morning to find myself sleeping on a very dingy old mattress pad, the mattress as well was greying and had bad stains on it. The walls in the bathroom had collected years of debris from toothpaste to makeup to small bits of toilet paper. The air conditioning units leaked onto the carpeting. The carpets are worn. The TV is massive in the tiny rooms (I'm Platinum and they told me 200 SF was an upgrade) so you are constantly dodging the TV to go to the bathroom. They need to forget about 42" plasma TV's and make things more size appropriate for the space. The staff was great however. Breakfast was good every morning in the Heartbeat restaurant. The powers that be that decide when its time to spend money on updating - listen up, ITS TIME!

Reviews.Title: “Great Nouveau Riche Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anntd
Reviews.Content: The W New York met my expectations and more. It's lobby hums with rhythmic music that would appeal to the younger set (I'm 50+) but we liked the vibe. Many comfortable couches and seats are located strategically around the upper and lower lounge area and accommodate small groups of 2 to 6. Drinks ranged from $8 to $15. I loved our room! My husband wasn't as wild about the minimalist look, but I think it blended well with the overall atmosphere of the W Hotel. Ammenities in the bathroom included shampoo, conditioner, body wash, moisturizer and face wash.The closet was the largest hotel closet I've seen, providing plenty of space to store luggage, etc.and equipped with bathrobes. The room was ample with a comfortable queen bed, desk and flatscreen TV. My only complaint was the partial glass shower door. If you didn't keep the water flow on low (it was adjustable), the bathroom floor got easily wet. We were on the 15th floor and looked across at the Waldorf Astoria. The location included other upscale hotels and plenty of restaurants, from nice sit-down to delis where you could quickly grab a meal I felt like we were on the Monopoly board with the W on Lexington and Park Place a block away, so shopping in the area speaks for itself. The subway was only a block and a half away. This would not be the #1 choice if you wanted to be close to Times Square, but we've been there, done that and wanted to explore another area of Manhattan. Well worth the decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite stay with times square view”
Reviews.Author: Tapnmel23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a great suite at the W Times Square. It was spacious and was fabulous for three guests because there was a divider that separated the living room from the bedroom so there was privacy between the two rooms. There were also large flat screen TVs in both rooms which was great. The room was dim and had little light but that didn't bother us. However, one tv was fuzzy and a bathroom light was burned out and it took three phone calls to the front desk on three different occasions over 2 days to get them to actually show up and fix them. That being said, we really enjoyed our stay and the fabulous W bed!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Joe V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very trendy, younger more hip crowd. The lobby had a great atmosphere at night and the DJ played good music each night. Also, the staff was one of the best of the W brand hotels. They were very kind, courteous, and accommodating. We used the complimentary car shuttle service several times and the driver was very knowledgeable! Also front desk employee Yesliana was very helpful when we requested a larger room. I had redeem 16000 starpoints for the stay and when I got to the originally assigned room it was very small. She immediately took care of the situation and offered us a larger room. Overall the experience was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “An Odd Balancing Act”
Reviews.Author: relaxandread
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to review this place because there is so much right with it - and so much that (depending on your room) can make things quite unpleasant. The positives definitely include the location, the cleanliness, quality bed and pillows, a good restaurant for breakfast (with healthy choices), and at least one concierge who is wonderful (as in great last minute tickets to a hot Broadway show). As for the negatives, I would agree with other reviewers that the rooms can be extremely small. If you book the cheapest room (which is not cheap), be prepared for Tokyo-sized surroundings, tiny bed, and a small wardrobe where you can hang about 4 things. This may work if you are a single traveler - for two it is very tight. (On the visit last week, I experienced two different rooms - I had a second booking for the weekend. The second room was bigger and much more tolerable.) There are also times when the W aesthetic gets in the way of the practical. The sliding glass doors for the bathroom means that if someone uses it in the middle of the night, the whole room lights up. When you need signage on a lamp to tell you how to turn it on, perhaps you need to rethink what design really means. Two final complaints: (1) the air system in the hotel seems crazy - if you are on the lower floors, you may have a loud white noise from the vents that can't be turned off (it gets better on the higher floors, but the temperatures are erratic); (2) because the hotel brand is geared toward attracting a younger, "hipper" demographic, be prepared for those guests who are oblivious to the basics of "Miss Manners." On our last night, we returned to our room around midnight and heard a couple hours of loud music and talking from a group in the next-door suite (and I mean just about every word that they said) until at least 3am (OK - they appeared to take at least an hour break to go clubbing). The hotel apologized and gave us extra points, but it hardly seems worth it. In short, when I want to stay in this location next time, I'm going to work hard to find an alternative. This hotel has a Marriott and The Benjamin on either side, plus the Waldorf Astoria across the street. The price ranges overlap for all of these, and they are worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the experience...A very memorable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MBH610
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent her birthday and Thanksgiving weekend in New York city and had a wonderful experience at this hotel. This hotel is conveniently located and close to everything which made getting around so easy to go sightseeing and shopping. The hotel staff were really pleasant and we loved the ambience and overall feel of this hotel. The W Insider (Kate) was so warm and hospitable and extremely helpful. She truly made us feel so welcome. She was awesome! Beckim (one of the ambassadors) was also really helpful and always went out of his way to whatever he could to make our stay more enjoyable. The hotel overall was really trendy and cool. The entire staff from the front desk to the maintenance staff were always willing to go above and beyond to make us feel so welcome. No complaints at all - we would return in a heartbeat. The staff was awesome!! Overall an amazing weekend in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: wise_lily
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Stylish design for trendy people. Small rooms and small beds.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, friendly, convenient”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W several times now as it is so convenient to many Midtown locations. I love the cool feel it has about it, especially in the lounge / lobby area - doesnt make you feel like you are a business traveler. Rooms can be VERY small - I will admit that - but then who spends a lot of time in their room when they are in NYC! This time I was lucky and got an upgrade to a slightly more spacious room. It has all that you need. Biggest drawbacks are what most NYC hotels suffer from - quite a lot of noise (I never travel without earplugs) and expensive extras (from internet access to minibar and room service - luckily there are lots of cafes and restaurants nearby).

Reviews.Title: “All fur coat...”
Reviews.Author: bermondsey_traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad but certainly not what I expected of Starwood's W brand. On the whole, it's a standard place that has had a few accoutrements such as witty signs and doormats. Here's some information on the facilities: Service: pleasant welcome and farewell voicemails left. Concierge desk staff pleasant but too busy. Reception desk busy or understaffed at all times. Value: Don't pay over the odds by comparing this to a traditional W or boutique hotel since it's akin to a standard midtown place Sleep quality: fine where I was on the eighth floor. Noisy bar and restaurant on ground floor so stay away from there Cleanliness: fine - no problem Location - great. Close enough to Broadway and 42nd, the park, Bloomingdale's. Away from the hustle of Times Square Rooms - fine for a couple of days. Small for one.

Reviews.Title: “It's "okay" so long as you don't spend a lot of time in your (tiny) room”
Reviews.Author: rossvesq
Reviews.Content: Wife and I went to NYC for 4 days of shopping, eating, etc. W was the only "4 star" in the 300-400 range. Would have been very unhappy if I spent more. I read the reviews before arriving and was expecting a small room. But this was ridiculous - and we were "upgraded" from the "cozy" room (which I assume means the former broom closet), otherwise I don't think our bags would have fit. Staff was incredibly polite (a misguided effort to make up for the tiny rooms?), lobby is nice in that chic modernistic W Hotel way, but overall the place is really just a 3 star hotel that is coated with a thin veneer of hipness. Too big flat panel TV for the room, an incredibly noisy AC system that could not make up its mind, and an electronic minibar that kept charging us if we even just bumped the items on the shelf added up to a no return experience. I'm usually pretty easy going on hotels, but I seriously cannot recommend the W New York. Sorry, but it's not worth the coin, even at half the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel trying to pose as 4 star (and charge accordingly) but barely 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: yopi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, with very attractive modern "minimalist" facilities. But going beyond the superficial, the rooms are completely impractical. One needs a new dictionary to understand the hotel's descriptions: cozy means tiny; double bed means full bed (where no two adults can sleep comfortably); an "eggplant canopy", means ceiling on top of the bed is painted purple; "whatever/whenever service", means youÂ´re in luck if anyone answers the phone when you need something... The room has tons of useless cutsey gadgets all over the place (little kaleidoscope, plastic thingy that says "relax", weird lamps, throw pillows, etc.), which make the room even more impractical, as you barely have room to put the things you do need. Oh, no coffee pot: little sign says you can â€œfindâ€� coffee downstairs (when open, at fancy hotel price), or ask for a coffee pot (which will never come). The staff is very friendly and smiles all the time, and knows how to oh and ah and make you feel better when you ask for something... But there is nothing else they can do to help. It is one of the few hotels that still includes a full minibar that will automatically charge your account for anything you touch; it also has, in lieu of a bedstand, lots of "goodies" that also will be charged to your account if you touch them or if you try to find a place to put your glasses, phone or watch for the night. Be sure to double check your bill when leaving, because there will surely be minibar charges.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Naim00
Reviews.Content: Decent staff @ welcome. The lobby is very nice and elegant and the bar is trendy as expected from a W. The rooms however are really tiny, maybe not at small as the rooms @ The Hudson but still small. There is a HUGE LCD TV in the room, really too big for this size. The room i got on the 3rd floor did not have any view.. it actually looked over a small roof with an AC unit and 2 other Bldgs, so no view @ all. Bathroom is nice and the soap/shampoo provided are of good but not excellent quality. Of course there is the mini-bar that charges you if you touch or move whatever is on it, which is ridiculous! The valet charges an outrageous 75$/night! a parking on 48th street, a block away charges 35$/night (until 10am)... like everything else in NYC a rip-off! Location is good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: sfederico22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, extremely clean and located right near Grand Central. The staff at the W are very accommodating. Rianna at the front desk helped us with upgrading our room, and Renee and Katherine (W insiders) made our stay extra special. We look forward to coming back again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MLSWorldwide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for Fashion Week and the following week in Sept - our original booking at another hotel had be cancelled in error and we had to book another hotel at the last minute - with this in mind we ended up booking the W only because it was the lowest price we could find and at over $400 for the basic room - it was not very low. Overall we found the hotel to be good, but nothing special - the breakfast was average and it always surprises me that such a large hotel group cant hire a decent barrister to make coffee for guests - i mean they dont cost much and the happiness of guests would be so much higher if you could get a decent coffee in the morning. The rooms are not sound proof and all night we were woken up by sirens - from the UN conference. The hotel was clean, staff were nice, room service food was pretty good (only had it the night we checked in) - Lucky NYC is so fabulous - makes it fine to stay in clean simple hotel - think overall they should not charge (even at last minute) such high rates for what is in essence a 4 star hotel. Note for travelers - Don't stay over the road from the Waldof Astoria when the UN conference is in town.

Reviews.Title: “NO COMPLAINTS!”
Reviews.Author: cnic1980
Reviews.Content: I Always stay with W Brand Hotels when traveling so when I read the reviews I was a little worried about this particular hotel. These people must not travel often because the size of the room is up to NYC standards . There is plenty of space for your luggage, a great area for putting on makeup/hair, and a super comfy bed. If you want more space go to Seattle, this is NYC! In addition this hotel is trendy, sexy and chic! The lobby has a lot going on. The upstairs downstairs lounge area has great couches and people watching. The complimentary champagne is a nice touch. The staff is by far the most helpful and friendly. One in particular: Darron, Darron, Darron. He was always smiling and happy. Very helpful and easy on the eyes! Their "Whenever Wherever" policy is great! I called at 1am for some Tums and they brought it to my room within minutes. I will be back at this W!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great people!!”
Reviews.Author: milljol
Reviews.Content: We came to NY for a quick girls weekend. We booked the W online about 2 months ago as it was the only 4 star hotel in the area that had reasonable rates and was close to Rockefeller Center. We checked in, the front desk staff was AMAZING! We got a free room upgrade (it was my birthday), free breakfast coupons, free drink coupons too for later that night too! Our flight got in about 9am, and our room was ready by 10:30 - they even called my cell phone! The room was typical New York, a little on the small side, but comfortable to move around in (there were 2 of us). THE BED WAS AMAZING!!! I'd stay here just for the bed - NO JOKE. Bathroom was clean, rain shower head, the soaps and stuff were this lemony smelling stuff from their spa. Bathrobes hanging in the closet too, nice touch. Our view was great! You need to be mindful to shut your curtains though, there are people all around! We were close to the subway station, lots of little deli's and shops, 5th avenue, park avenue, central park. It really was the best location for what we needed to do. They had 2 guys working the outside of the hotel the entire time we were there. They were the "CAB WRANGLERS", and they were hopping at all times. We never worried about our bags, a cab, nothing. Everyone was so helpful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Vibe and Comfy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: This property manages to catch that hip NYC vibe without trying too hard. Unlike other hotels I have stayed at in NYC where style rules out over substance, the W is also quite practical. A couple of things that always bug me are long check in lines, and long elevator waits. The front desk was well staffed when I arrived at 6:00 pm, and the entire check in process took less than one minute. There were ample elevators, so I never waited more than a minute to get on one. Very efficient hotel! They do have rooms the size of broom closets, so I recommend that you ask for one that is of a humane size. I find that the rooms close to the elevators are good ( try 1501) and they are more than sufficient size for 2 adults. The beds are absolutely the most comfortable in town! Also great is FREE high speed internet, both wired and wireless. I come to NYC at least once a month on business, and this is truly one of the better properties I have stayed out. I am honestly surprised it doesn't rank higher on Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmityL
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern. Swanky feel. 2 good bars. Love the fireplace. Have used the lobby for business since and it's perfect. No one bothers you and there is Internet service. Highly recommend it for that. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A happening place!”
Reviews.Author: BenDere
Reviews.Content: This is one hip hotel! It's so much fun to walk into the lobby. And the location is fantastic - close to the fun of 5th Avenue and subway stations. A lot of reviews bemoan the small rooms, but we had a nicely sized room with a "view" down to Lexington and the Waldorf=Astoria across the street. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, but some shortcomings. Loud”
Reviews.Author: MDP03
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thanks to an online negotiating site, and got an excellent price. The hotel is in a fantastic location, walking distance from all the midtown attractions, and just a few steps from the Subway if you need to get further away. When we arrived on Friday evening there was a DJ in the lobby playing very loud music. OK if you want to party, not so much if you're looking for some quiet (but maybe you never look for that in NYC!). The room was OK, not particularly large, but nice and comfortable. The big minus in our trip: when we checked out, we left our luggage in the storage room. When we came to pick it up, they could not find it anymore. It turns out they had given it out by mistake to another customer, on his/her way to Philadelphia. Even though the staff was very friendly and helpful after the incident, and they even reimbursed us in full for buying a new train ticket having missed our originally scheduled one, it would have been better if the incident had not happened in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: keithki
Reviews.Content: Returned to the W New York last week and my stay was great as usual. They upgraded my room based on my spg platinum status. Returning again in a few weeks. Great hotel and awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Overall - Can't Beat Price”
Reviews.Author: HCanter169Weston
Reviews.Content: There are a zillion hotels in New York City. Ok, maybe not that many, but there are a lot. And, if you have caviar tastes on a Raman Noodle budget, your options become extremely limited. Therefore, I have to credit the online price negotiating tool we used to get our room at the W on Lexington. Why? Because at $250 a night, the W was fantastic. At $550 a night, the W would be less than spectacular. Yes, the rooms are small, but not claustrophobic. The beds are fantastic and the pillows are plentiful...you'll never have problems finding a cool side! We stayed on the 10th floor with a view of the Waldorf across the street. Not sure if the view from higher up would be better. The hotel bar is small, but adjacent to the Whiskey Bar. Both were hopping on a Friday night. Dessert at the W was delicious - warm brownie with peanut butter and Hagen Daz ice cream. All in all, an excellent place to stay for the price. However, if I had paid the prices posted on the W website, I would have been disappointed since I've stayed at equally impressive hotels for less.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wow Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Msdacko
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a Wow Suite. Only at Ws have a stayed in a bi-level room and it was quite amazing. Wooden floors and floor to ceiling windows made me think, "Man, I wish I had this as an apartment." I stayed here in preparation for Hurricane, I mean, Tropical Storm Irene. The hotel management even handed out flashlights and glowsticks in case the power went out during the storm. It never went out because the storm barely hit Manhattan at all.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Infested”
Reviews.Author: LoveTheUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: The headline says it all. Roaches in the rooms! NEVER will I stay here again and I didn't even get my room credited. That's poor customer service. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, trendy”
Reviews.Author: traveller90909
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice and clean rooms and a contemporary layout. The lounge on the 5th floor is pretty inviting too.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W Hotel for the brand”
Reviews.Author: PA_Bank
Reviews.Content: The location is great but that's it. The rooms are filthy and very noisy . The food quality is poor. The staff is very rude and unprofessional. W hotels are usually good value and quality but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjcSING
Reviews.Content: I was hesitate when booking this hotel for a short weekend stay in the city. A lot of the negative comments tend to focus on the size of the rooms. Having statyed in New York before, I knew what to expect and was pleasantly surprised by the decor, personal touches, and, yes, the spaciousness of the room. The W is a great New York hotel. The service was excellent. The in-room dining superb. And the bed comfortable and made for a great night's sleep. I'll definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not on par with other W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mlbdenver
Reviews.Content: I am currently saying at the W on Lexington. I have stayed here before, so I was prepared for the small rooms, which is not atypical for Manhattan. However, I will say that this property has slipped somewhat. My room has an odor like mildew (or heaven forbid urine?), specifically in the bathroom. The shower head is pretty flimsy and the water pressure is low. It seems the hotel goes out of it's way to be W cool, but things like the radio with iPod dock don't work all that well and just end up taking up space. also, the window AC is super loud and it woke me up several times overnight. The place just feels tired. I really want to like this hotel due to it's location and due to being an SPG member, but I may decide to choose a different property next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sissypo
Reviews.Content: Got a very good price on "name your own price" from priceline.Was actually surprised this was the hotel i got.Rooms were a little small but N.Y.C small.It was very modern.Bathroom and toiletries i loved,more than the usual stuff.Beds comfy,big flat screens.Robes,fridge and nice mini bar (expensive though).Decent view.I liked that they had a computer,fax room and was allowed to use computer to print boarding pass free.Hotel had a couple nice bars the one in lobby was relaxing ,it was weekend so alot of younger men in suits etc The other i saw alot of dancing ,however was too busy to check any out.Unfortunately I didn't get to check out the restaurant's,spa etc.They were very nice and helpful at check-in.Close to alot of popular landmarks.We walked to Grand Central for dinner .Overall I really liked the hotel one of my favs in N.Y.C now.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar, great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: B-YVR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice area and walking distance from subway stations and most major shopping. It's got a great hotel bar and the Whiskey bar below which is bumping at night. It lives up in terms of quality to a W but the rooms are just so small. I know NYC hotels are normally quite small and I've stayed in enough to know what the standard is. However, these were exceptionally small (felt like a cabin on a cruise ship). The hotel clearly knows it because there is a sign saying they give us extra Starwood points due to the small room size. Nice gesture but still ...

Reviews.Title: “The location is very good the service not so much.”
Reviews.Author: Burkett14527
Reviews.Content: The mega room is the way to go here as it is the size of an average room you would get outside of the city. The staff are nice enough and well meaning but there is no attention to detail so if you are looking for a room close to Time Square and don't need anything from the staff this would be fine. If you are the type of person that likes room service, concierge services or pretty much anything else that the staff would provide this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was awesome, I'll be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: fresh4yphe
Reviews.Content: Customer service was great overall, everyone was nice and very helpful. Check in was quick and my room was sooooooo nice and the bed was so comfortable and there's this amazing smell in the hallways and rooms. .... So nice, KUDOS to The W and to Kevin @ the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Service was over the top!”
Reviews.Author: GregSnLA
Reviews.Content: As always, I had a wonderful stay at your hotel last week. It seems that each time I am there I get to meet someone on the staff that goes out of their way to say that extra hello, give a warm smile or genuinely care about the guests comfort. Last week I had the pleasure of meeting Edna at the front desk. I think that the front desk team are so important to the business and there are some true professionals that look out for you. Mario, Albert and Edna have all left a wonderful impression with me. I look forward to my return visit to the W New York- Lexington in October.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyBei
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, clean, and had exceptional service. I found out the "W" stands for wish. You have a red button in your room and anything you need or wish for can be attained by pushing the red button. The beds were comfortable, the room had a great view, and was very quiet at night. The location is perfect. It is in walking distance from Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, St. patrick's cathedral, and central park, just to name a few "must sees". There is also a subway stop 1/2 a block out the front door that will take you everywhere in manhatten that you want to go. I would definately reccomend this hotel, and it will be my first choice when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: bt8755
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the W. The room was clean and efficient, the staff was very friendly and helpful (especially Lauren and other concierge) and the location was great. There was easy access to cabs and the subway station was about a block away. We would book again. Brian

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAFF EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick G
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I spend a week at the W (room 1805 on the top floor) and I know I will come back next year. the main reason is the staff working there : everybody is so friendly, helpful, available, smiling I want to thank especially JESSY, LAMINE, MIRIAM, MARITZA, ANNA and Mickey (from housekeeping, whatever whenever etc): they ve all been AMAZING, so nice, they are smiling and friendly and make you feel at home of course the hotel, the rooms, the situation are great, but what makes it the best hotel in the area are the people working there and especially the ones listed above. thank you again for your welcome and see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid S
Reviews.Content: I was there for 1 night only. This is my first time to stay at W, and I found out later that this W is actually the 1st W in the US. At first I was assigned a corner room at 5th floor. I could see huge aircon pipe right outside of my window, so I called front desk to request to change to another room. I was assigned a room at 10th floor facing Lexington Ave. I'm satisfied with the view. This room is also a bit more spacious than the original corner room. The maintenance of the room is ok. Bed and pillows are very comfy. I would love to go back if I can get such good deal again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was VIP”
Reviews.Author: Sofia R
Reviews.Content: Since 2008, I have traveled to NYC twice a year for pleasure. I traditionally utilize Priceline for my hotels in NYC. I have been extremely successful at securing a four star hotel for less than 50 percent off the regular room rates. On this trip, the W Hotel took my bid. This was one of the BEST experiences from any of the hotels I have stayed in throughout Manhattan. The staff is seriously dedicated to the W theme which is whatever, whenever. When we arrived and the room was better suited for a married couple than a couple of friends, they immediately worked to get us a larger room with a roll away bed. Since it would take them a bit of time to get the room ready, they let us use the smaller room to freshen up and provided a few free coupons for cocktails. The new room was large by NYC standards, had the rollaway for no extra charge and was very quiet. I didn't hear a peep from the other rooms. This particular weekend they were offering a car from Lexus. You could book the car for free to take you where ever you needed! We utilized it for a trip to lower Manhattan for shopping. While in the car, the driver mentioned that there was another W just blocks from the store where we went shopping and that we could book a car through that hotel to take us back to our W on Lex. How amazing is that? If you book your hotel through the W, ask about this opportunity and book well in advance for trips throughout the city which will save you time and money. The bellmen were extremely sweet. When there was a shortage of cabs running they hailed a private car for us. More drink tickets came because we had to take the car instead of the cab. We had cocktails multiple times in the lounge which had a live DJ. Very fun, young atmosphere and couches made you feel like you were hanging at home with friends. The food in the lounge was excellent and served promptly with a smile. The bartenders were extremely friendly and fun to chat with the couple of times we sat at the actual bar. My only personal negative is the location of this hotel. For me personally, I prefer staying on the west side of Manhattan, but it didnâ€™t make for a bad stay, just a side note as you are planning what your activities are and where they are in the city. I have to tell you that I am a platinum rewards member with another group of hotels. I had stayed two nights on points at one of their properties on this same trip and had a negative experience. I moved to the W for the remainder of my NYC stay and I have to admit that my experience at the W made me become a rewards member with Starwood. I signed up before I left the hotel. I will search for Wâ€™s now whenever I travel. I travel 7-9 weeks out of the year throughout the country and the Wâ€™s are on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for total claustrophobia”
Reviews.Author: JRR055
Reviews.Content: I expected far more from a Starwood property. This hotel is absolutely mediocre. The rooms are unspeakably tiny, the bathroom doesn't even have turnaround space, and the water pressure in the shower was horrible. The only good thing I can say about it is that the location is fantastic, and the hotel is surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. But there are a lot of other choices on the East side. Stay at the Fitzpatrick, for example, which has suites.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: terere2
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit biased because I received an upgrade. Keep in mind that these are infrequent and, besides, the staff here is top notch. Every request was taken care of, I loved the location and gym, and the friendly people made up for the dreary weather. I've stayed at numerous Starwood properties in NYC and here they made a real effort as opposed to intimating that I should feel lucky to stay at their property. Use the Acura car service and soak up the lobby vibe. The next time I am in the city without family I will be back. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Planning by Kevin W.”
Reviews.Author: BisonBaby
Reviews.Content: Happily, this is my second time posting about the exceptional customer service experienced at W NY! I've been visiting from DC for both business and weekend getaways for 4 years now. Without fail, Liz P. has always been one of the most gracious and personable agents I have ever encountered in travel. Without exaggeration when planning a trip to this W it feels as if I'm visiting a close friend. This past weekend, with Hurricane Irene fast approaching, I was assisted by Kevin W. He was definitely courteous and professional. But his extraordinary service in patiently taking the time to help me plan my options for weathering this storm drove me to write this review. He was the best! See you all in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Back again - Love the W Lexington”
Reviews.Author: DonJean911
Reviews.Content: Always liked this place. Staff is extremely dedicated and nice which makes a big difference in an hotel. I always had bigger rooms than the standard so I can't compare to some comments I read on tripsadvisor. My room was superbe and it's unfortunate that I couldn't spend more time in it... because it's NYC! My girlfriend loves the bath products and don't hesitate to stop by the downstair store. Tips for NYC, I finally found where you can go out for a good time. You need to go downtown, try bleekers street. One night, we went to a club called CafÃ© Wha? and what a good time we had. Also many restaurants in that area. I will be back next August unless I can afford another trip to NYC before then:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, trendy, clean... BUT TINY!”
Reviews.Author: 2YoungFoodies
Reviews.Content: In typical W style... the place is hop'n and has a great vibe. But the standard rooms are ridiculously small... esp given the price. I know, I know.. it's NYC... but around the corner at Hotel Intercontinental... the standards rooms are SOOOO much bigger, and KING is standard. Oh and a view of a parking garage isn't so desirable. They even have lil notes hanging on the mirrors and such saying, "Does size really matter... we know the room is small, but the perks are BIG!" (They do offer free wi-fi.. so if that's worth staying in a shoe box...) We scored it for one night on priceline.com for $155/night.. which is a great deal for a W hotel in NYC. But... overall, I think I'd rather spend closer to $200 for a bigger room around the corner. We were constantly bumping into each other, and tripping over shoes, luggage, etc.... You have to DUCK under the TV to walk around the 6 inches left on the other side of the bed by the window! BUT... the rooms are VERY clean and nicely done. There is no chipped paint, missing grout, or distasteful brass fixtures anywhere. So if trendy, queen size beds and SMALL is your thing... then you'll enjoy your stay! So for $155, it's a great deal for NYC... but it's not worth the rack rate for sure due to it's size. It's updated decor, trendiness, cleanliness makes it a nice place to stay.. but only if you're paying less than $175/night

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tamsin8782
Reviews.Content: I arrived about 11.30am and although check in was not till 3pm they found me a room straight away. It is called a cozy room and it is but perfectly comfortable with everything you might need. I used the spa and they were great at finding a convenient time for me and the massage i had was fantastic (thanks vivian). The bar was also nice with friendly staff and a good atmosphere. I had a very nice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Always a friendly face -Mario Quijano”
Reviews.Author: Vuelosporvida
Reviews.Content: One of the many perks of visits to NYC is a great hotel. There a many choices but the W New York is our top choice. Every visit Mario has been friendly, helpful, professional and always ready to go the extra mile. He is a representation of true customer service. As I checked in today for a "little girl weekend" with my daughter - there was Mario with his usual smile- remembering us and taking extra steps to ensure we have a great visit. It is always a pleasure to see Mario, he is A+!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star, tiny room, loud toilet, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ginoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, no staff to greet and help with bag, asked for quiet room, gave me low level room with traffic noise and flag that knocked on the window, loudest toilet I ever encountered. I stayed at other w hotels which was great but this is the worst w hotel, more like upgraded motel.... Find other true 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location. Every detail is taken into account.”
Reviews.Author: FDRKP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, the decor is really modern and the location is perfect. It is near to the metro station in Lexington and 53th. The Central Park is just some blocks away. Regarding the hotel, the lobby is beautiful and sometimes dj's play during the afternoon. Rooms are very comfy but maybe not as spacious as they should be. A really useful advice, don't touch things at the minibar if you are not planning to consume them. Turns out that as soon as you grab the bottle of wine or the soda from the refrigertator this will be automatically billed to your account. Of course there is a sign warning this but who reads everything you see. I was staying at the 15th floor so there wasn't noise from the street, and the sommier was awesome so the sleep quality was excellent. Also the gym is very modern with hi-tech machines. Wi-fi is free at the lobby but very expensive in the room. Anyway, it was a great stay at W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown location, but small rooms and not the best hotel for business travelers.”
Reviews.Author: ereynihc
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. The bar is a hot spot for drinks. The lobby is very contemporary and full of life. And excitement. For these reasons, I would not consider this hotel again when on business travel. It is noisy with music and too many patrons crowding the lobby and walkway to the elevators. The rooms are very small as well. Although, that is common in the city I think they are smaller here that in many other area hotels. I've stayed across the street at the Waldorf many times and rooms are much bigger (although the hotel class is different). You can get an averaged size room at the W New York, but you will pay a lot more (almost double for us). I would come back to this hotel if I was on a leisure visit but not for business. Too much noise, distractions, and small rooms are convenient for working.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jabacchus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend this past weekend for 3 nights just for a weekend getaway to New York. After reading reviews for this hotel I was not expecting the best of the best but I was expecting more from the W chain. I expected the rooms to be small as stated in other reviews but I did not expect the musty smell. Every time we walked into the room it smelled musty and old. The pillows also smelled musty and sort of like urine. The room itself was clean and nicely decorated which was nice but I would not classify this hotel as a 4 star. More like a 3 star or 3 and a half which would be pushing it. The hotel claims to have free WiFi but when you try to log in it tells you about payment information. The location of the hotel is ideal because you can hop on the subway just two blocks away and it is easy to travel in any direction you please. It was a humid weekend in New York and we had the air conditioning on it the room but when we went to sleep and woke up we felt cold and sweaty. Not a good combination. Overall, I would not stay at this hotel again, as I do not think it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better every time”
Reviews.Author: farfelu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W New York three times a year on business and each visit seems better than the last. I have gotten to know some of the staff and they always make me feel welcome amd special. They go out of their way to accomodate my every need, in a pleasant and friendly manner. Mario and Gloria at Reception are terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Southbeachstyle79
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute in this place... didnt want to leave :) Perfect hotel for a true NYC experience !!! Close to everthing that matters in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Robert62Florida
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Not just the location, or Acura car service, or the complimentary breakfast, or the re done rooms; but the fact that the staff knew it was two couples celebrating our 40th anniversary. From champagne in our rooms to a complimentary full breakfast in the restaurant, with extra fruit platter and special pancakes, the staff went overboard to make our special weekend extra special. The W on Lexington Ave in our new favorite hotel when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, loud lobby”
Reviews.Author: BearTavern
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the W hotel on Lexington Ave in July. I booked on Priceline.com. We were three and needed two beds, When I called the W they said the Priceline rooms were single bed rooms. They agreed to give us a room with two beds but there was an extra charge. When we arrived the front desk told us there would be no extra charge for the room. The room was not ready, and we were given vouchers for the bar to wait while they prepared the room. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, helpful and polite. The average rating is because of the lobby. There wasn't any place to sit, relax and talk. In the evening there was a DJ who cranked up the music to hurtful levels. In the morning there was music piped in that, at least, in my opinion was unnecessary. Along with the usually background noise of people checking in and out it was unfortunately not a place you could sit down after a busy day of sightseeing. The W is a good place to stay only on block from the subway and on the Lex Ave bus line. In an already noisy city it would have been nice to walk into a lobby that offered a toned down atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The housekeeping was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Mallory0
Reviews.Content: My experience at the W was greatly enhanced by Joy Runy. She was the housekeeper on my floor (12) for the last two weeks. She greeted me in the hall everyday with a smile. One morning, I was running late for work and left my door open by mistake. She closed it for me as well as let me know what had happened so that I could check my belongings for everything. She took the time to talk to me durning my stay and truly cared about my New York and W experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small, awkward room - not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: riccume
Reviews.Content: I was booked in a "Wonderful" room and I ended up in a small and weirdly shaped room overlooking a multi-storey car-park - which meant that every time a car went in or out the headlights would light up my room. My colleague in another room was so unhappy with the mattress that he ended up sleeping on the floor. On the positive side location is very good, bar downstairs is OK, gym and service are good - but given the above I certainly won't be back, plenty of better options at this price (and I got a special rate).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous... Funky... Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Meleliz1321
Reviews.Content: This isn't the first time I've stayed at this location but I feel as though I have to write a review because I stayed here twice in one month and each time it has been fabulous! The welcome staff is great, Teddy, to mention my favorite! He is always upbeat, happy to help, and fun to talk to. The music, drinks upon arriving, and the eagerness to please sends this staff to the top, in my book. The rooms are tight but they have used the space to their advantage. Never overlooking a chance to throw in their sheek style. I stayed in the spectacular room and it was spectacular! The area is perfect if you want to walk to central park or times square... Either way, you'll never have a problem finding your way around when you have such helpful staff! Thank you W for another great stay! We will be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a competitive price!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ViajeNut
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W new york in July for a getaway weekend with my wife for an anniversary. Its one of the W's oldest properties in NYC, but it is very well maintained. The lobby itself is modern and all the staff as you enter are fantastic. The basic room is extremely small, yet well-appointed. Do your homework on the size of the room. If size is important, upgrade quickly to avoid disappointment. Loved the lobby bar on Friday nite. Cozy yet very chic. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth paying W Hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: sokokyu
Reviews.Content: We got this W through betting on Priceline for a 4 star hotel. The rooms are very small to the point that our bathroom had to have a sliding door (that pinched my finger by the way). No bathtub, only a shower with an awkward strip of glass pretending to be a door. The lobby and lounge is nice and enjoyable. Ask a staff member for free cocktail coupons (up to $20 value) and ask if they'll waive your wifi fees if you become an SPG member. The two elevators on the left are faster than the ones on the right. Provided hotel toiletries are from their bliss spa and seemed to be very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: BlueIslander
Reviews.Content: OK, so this in a pretty handy position for mid town and there is a very trendy bar and Cowshed products in the rooms, but that's about it. They've even got rid of the overpriced retro bar - Whiskey Blue (note: it is still there and overpriced, just now looking a bit more like the interior of Abercrombie and Fitch). The cheaper rooms are tiny - we really struggled to store our luggage. The noise from the bar (which is in the lobby) goes on 'till late, with loud music and despite asking several times, I never managed to get the "free" internet access that should have been included in my rate removed from my bill. Other little things grate, like how slow the lifts are. There are plenty of nearby hotels in and around the price range - pick one of them (for my money, the Marriott)

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Content: 1. when we got to our room it was clearly a single room, couldn't get round to the other side of the bed as the end of the bed was up to the wall and there was a huge tv in the corner hanging over the bed (tip to the designer - when it's such a small room don't emphasize the fact by putting such a big tv in it) when laying in bed the tv was 2 feet away so the picture was awful. i went back downstairs to ask about a double room and was told that we had a double room, they don't do single rooms (rubbish - that was not a room for 2) bathroom was tiny also and again not helped by the huge sink in it. 2. sticker on the window confirming that they know it's a small room however to compensate for that they offer free wifi - not true, you have to pay. 3. they charge $8.73 for a bottle of water!!. 4. cleaner removed the soap and didn't replace it. 5. when we checked out the person on the desk asked if we had enjoyed our stay i said new york was great but we weren't impressed with the hotel. she shrugged and said "oh well". 6. we wanted to leave our bag at the hotel for the day as our flight wasn't until the evening, we were stood waiting for 5 minutes, 3 members of staff on the check in desk had walked past and ignored us - a simple "someone will be right with you" to acknowledge that they had seen us would have been nice, but no - i eventually got one of the check in girls attention to asked if someone could help us, as she turned to us she gave us the dirtiest look as if to say "how dare you ask me a question" i asked if she could let someone know that there were people waiting, she huffed and very slowly picked up the phone, but didn't know who to call. i have never been treated so badly in a hotel, and i have travelled a lot, staying in many different kinds of hotels from 2* - 4* i wouldn't even rate this hotel as a 2*.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but with everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis1000
Reviews.Content: We met some friends for a weekend in New York and stayed at the W on Lexington Ave. The room was small, but we knew they would be so through internet reviews. The room was small, but it had everything we needed. The room was very well planned, we a large closet with sliding doors with enough space for our suitcase and to hang plenty of clothes, although in the room our friend's stayed in (same size as ours) the closet was smaller than ours. Bathroom was very well supplied and toiletries were just wonderful, there even was a face wash, which is not very common at hotels. There was no coffee maker in the room, but you can ask for one, although we didn't. We all had rooms on the 8th floor; our friends stayed at a room facing Lexington Ave. and they complained of noise coming from the street, we had a back room, so that was not a problem, but we did hear a baby crying next door one morning. This was the first time we stayed at a W and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Reception Desk Makes a Difference”
Reviews.Author: AWYu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property a number of times. When I returned this time, Mario at the front desk greeted me with a warm smile when he saw me and shook my hand to welcome me back. This made a such a difference for a traveler who just got into New York through a red-eye flight from the West Coast. Now I look forward to returning to the W due, in large part, to that personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: bsannich
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel exceeds expectations. Service is excellent, the rooms are always clean, gym is functional and clean, location can't be beat (assuming you want to be in Midtown). I had a reservation for a Wonderful room, but got a free upgrade to a Spectacular room. It was a larger than what I was used to, which was nice. Yes, the rooms at this hotel are pretty small - but functional and perfectly clean every time.

Reviews.Title: “Personable, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: davidinathens
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, as expected. But the great staff was the best part--Mario at check-in, Graciela at the phones and Patrick at the concierge desk were all exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “excellent mid-town location/rooms clean, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: artsofdarkness
