Reviews.Content: stayed for four nights in August, room was small but fine for two people in NYC, queen bed was comfortable and there was a new flatscreen tv, 14th floor window view was back alley but good background of gothic building across alley, room was quiet and cleaned properly, staff in lobby were very helpful and polite, dj's spun relaxed beats in the lounge on some nights and bar was quite popular, very centrally located for walking city and very close to 6th line subway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Maveryx
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via Hotwire and got a great deal for 3 nights this past weekend. The hotel was beautiful inside. The concierge and staff were very friendly and you had the genuine feel that they were looking out for you. The rooms were very tiny as every has said below, but you can't really expect something gigantic for a NYC hotel. We were basically there to sleep at night, so it served us well. The rooms were clean and very posh in design. There was also free wifi, which was a great bonus. The location is in midtown at 50th and Lexington, just steps from Grand central and most of the great spots to see. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: missdanag
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these reviews just before we left for our trip we were a little worried about staying here. Thankfully, we could not have enjoyed it more. We found the staff outstanding, the hotel very inviting and chic and we loved our room! Sure it was small, but not unbearable at all. It was clean, stylish, and very comfortable. I found the spa staff could have been a bit friendlier, but overall, we loved this place and the location and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mudandlumber
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery of staying here for a family long weekend in NYC. Concerned our midwestern nonhipster selves would be out of place and unwelcomed. Couldn't have been more wrong. What a beautiful hotel with great people. From Freddie's greeting and assistance at arrival and departure to the friendly front desk and housekeeping staff, we felt like visiting royalty. Great location didn't hurt. Walked to Central Park, 30 Rock and Times Square. Lots of great restaurants nearby. Hope to return again soon. Loved the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Miniscule rooms - even by NY City Standards; wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1199
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in March - and especially given the extended stay I would have expected a much better room. My room was truly miniscule with barely enough room to walk around the bed and a bathroom that was ridiculously cramped (with the sink and toilet bowl effectively on top of each other). The view was also of a roof top with vents and the room was very dark with limited lighting. There was a sign in the room that offered extra Starwood points because the room was so small. I asked for a different room but was offered one of the same size with a bathroom that was maybe 6-12 inches larger and the only benefit being that it had a better view (of the street). The location is good for meetings in midtown, but I would try somewhere else the next time I'm in town. On the positive side, the bed was quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HSGKKG
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a W hotel and I was very, very impressed. They've really thought about everything and anything that you could possibly need to make your stay comfortable. Service was great and the rooms and hotel were extremely clean. I loved the Bliss products and would definitely go back! Location was great and close to a lot of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Convenient Location, and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Agent1126
Reviews.Content: First let me say I stayed at the property twice so far in the month of July. I booked it using Pricelines bid system first time 140 + tax, second was 150 + tax. The check-in process both times was rather slow but I got room upgrades both times. The first time it was a suite the second time to a spectacular room. So I did not mind the wait. The rooms are nicely renovated. Flat screens, comfy bed, comfortable shower and most importantly very clean. When I ordered more towels and wash cloths in the morning the service was very prompt. The rooms are small but if you upgrade to a suite the room is about 430 sq ft which is very spacious. Overall I think it is a solid hotel if you use Priceline to get the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD!!”
Reviews.Author: sylvars
Reviews.Content: They didnt have the right room that i had booked, claimed they weret familiar with the 3rd party i billed thru (cheap o air) then tried to re-charge me for the rooms i had already paid for. they said it was cleared up and took my cc for "incidentals" and to this day 2 mos. later are still attempting to charge my card for the 2 rooms. its a long time consuming process im working on to get the charges deleted!! rooms were dirty robes old dingy and not soft at all!! no more W hotels for this girl!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend to anyone staying in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ghughes75
Reviews.Content: The W on Lexington Ave is a great location no matter what you are looking to do in NYC. Service is great and it is very clean. The rooms were great and the beds were extremely comfortable. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but small room!”
Reviews.Author: PandaZoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here with my wife on business. The only great thing is the location but otherswise the room was rather small and I'd say rather expensive and I would not stay here if I was paying myself. In general the service was good and the room was clean. There was a radio with an ipod dock and you can play your own ipod music easily. Some little special things like the memo paper was good quality with a "W' punched through it. I took several pieces of the paper as a souveneir!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and teeny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: brainmind
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to get over itself. Got great rate through priceline name your own price for $140. I was there for 6 nights and needed to add a seventh and they told me it would be $400 for the seventh. The room is so tiny that you need to walk under the TV screen to get to the other side of the bed. On the plus side, great location, nice staff and nice toiletries from the Bliss Spa on location.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we were hoping for”
Reviews.Author: dazza02129
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying in a "two twins" room, which actually ended up being two singles and one of the smallest hotel rooms i've stayed in, in the US. Overall the hotel was fairly nice, though I honestly didn't spend much time in it. The car service only ran from 10am until 9 or so, which was a problem as we wanted to leave at 9:30 but there were plenty of taxis in the vicinity. It's quite a few blocks to Times square so if that's where you are planning on hanging out then you might want to go somewhere a bit closer to the action. Oh, one point to note is that there were security guards between the nightclub and the hotel at night to ensure only guests got to the elevators. Not sure why, but I guess it may have been a problem at some point, but it wasn't much of a hassle to show up key cards to get past. Another thing that slightly bothered me is that we had maid service knocking on our door at 8:30 am on the Sunday asking if we were ready to have the room cleaned. Seemed a bit ridiculous as a) we were checking out that day and b) it was 8:30 on a Sunday morning! Luckily we were up and about but it struck me as a bit odd. I guess we could have put the DND sign up, but you'd think they'd coordinate things a bit better than that. I guess I just never really got over the size of the room or the beds, even the hotel knew it was too small as they offered free internet and 500 SPG points for staying in that room - they even had a sign in the room telling you that fact.

Reviews.Title: “Lisa at the Concerige went well beyond any ever!”
Reviews.Author: Debra1818
Reviews.Content: This is the type of service that sets hotel apart. Lisa went way beyond the call of duty of any Concerige I have know in my 30 years of travelling to help my daughter and I find a real estate agent on a Sunday afternoon at 2 pm willing to meet us to help us out of our bind. It's the care and ingenuity of what Lisa accomplished on Sunday and Monday that we were able to leave the hotel, well rested with fabulous comforts, great amenities, friendly front staff and an exceptional concerige, and an apartment leased for the coming year! Kudos to caring and resourcefullness!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: psteiner2323
Reviews.Content: This a hotel you must stay ... well located and the attention beyond any expectatives... I had an excellent atteion in the front desk with Mrs Gloria and Miss Evelyn, as well as Mrs Millie (Milagros) in the "Whenever-Whatever" department. Also Mr David as the Concierge. The gym and spa is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Room Help”
Reviews.Author: BrownBear_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on Lexington for three nights from 7/21-7/24; notice an odor in the room after the 1st night. Yesheara at the front desk upgraded me on the spot and changed rooms. Excellent and quick service. She and the hotel took great care of me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience and the staff! I tell everyone about it!”
Reviews.Author: erafi5
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience at this hotel and have stayed there a couple of times! The staff is outstanding and the manager, Scott, was a dream to work with- excellent attitude, friendly, and extremely helpful! Perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “loved the marvelous suite!”
Reviews.Author: deborahpan
Reviews.Content: i was booked with points for a studio suite for a one night stay and upon check in, they upgraded me automatically to a 700+sq ft marvelous suite on the top floor with a rooftop deck that could seat and entertain 6 people! it was unbelievable. skyline views, living room, awesome bedroom and fantastic jacuzzi tub with separate shower. i was stunned at the customer service. convenient location within walking distance of grand central and across the street from my meeting venue. loved, loved, loved it! and great bliss bath products to boot. i love the starwood company and they definitely honored my gold status and upgraded me without even asking. bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/ Great Service”
Reviews.Author: WTH_11
Reviews.Content: I had an outstanding experience while recently staying at the W Hotel on Lexington Ave in NYC. The hotel as great atmosphere and the staff is very helpful. I'd like to commend Cindy Cabrera (front desk) for her courtesy and general helpfulness during my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Properties never disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: ELN66
Reviews.Content: I also first check to see if any Starwood property is available no matter where I am traveling especially NYC. The St-Regis, Westin or W properties also have impeccable service, clean rooms and great beds! The W New York also provides free Acura car service as long as you make arrangements in advance.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my room and the hotel as well.”
Reviews.Author: sacagewaya
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at the W hotel. I liked it very much. I wish to come back again. The service was excellent. My room was a bit small but I like it any way, best amenities,good room service. What I like the best is when I was just about to check out, the stylist at the door, EVETTE, was very nice and asked me some questions, then wished me good luck. While i was waiting for the elevator, the kind young lady ran up to me and handed my cell phone that i forgot in the room. She is very trust worthy and i thank the W hotel for having such great service. Thank you once again.

Reviews.Title: “Was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: I had only checked in for one night before a flight to Iceland from JFK, so I wanted to stay somewhere that was fun to kick off the start of a good trip. Arriving at the hotel, the porter was immediately available to help with the luggage. Check-in was smooth and I had asked for an upgrade and was surprised to get that they were able to upgrade me to a Wow Suite. The room was pretty large for New York standards, with a separate living room, bedroom and plenty of closet space. The bathroom was nice and the bed was extremely comfortable. The room was a corner suite so I was able to get in plenty of light. All of the staff were very friendly. I discovered one of the best assets of this hotel was their gym. It is situated near their Bliss spa, and guest have access to the spa lounges which had snacks and beverages throughout the day. The gym also had plenty of equipment and was open 24 hours. When I go back to Ny I will try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MooreJD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location for getting around the City. The rooms are good but the service is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, whenever! love!!!”
Reviews.Author: bOnita19_11
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to stay in New York! Beautiful area, beautiful hotel and beautiful people! W live up to their promise! Whatever, Whenever! My sister in law and I enjoyed our birthdays at W. Would commend the manger, Mr. Maynard for sending champagne in our room which was a big surprise to us, and yes, we truly loved it, and also Ms. Pantaleon for being so nice and accomodating. She is truly an asset of W. Next time we're back in NY, we will surely stay with you again...and hopefully it won't take a year long for our next birthdays to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing if you're expecting the typical W experience. I would NOT come back”
Reviews.Author: StarPeopleDreams
Reviews.Content: A strong brand and parentage of the Starwood group drew me to the W. Add the fact that its a business hotel! You would think you can't go wrong with that but think again. The rooms are tiny. I was upgraded and still the room was so small I couldn't walk without bumping in to something. The lighting is very poor. Being in Lex, the hotel is surrounded by taller buildings, hence, natural light is obviously low. However, the in-room lighting is so low it only adds to the dingyness The staff was surprisingly unprofessional. I was in my room changing when they barged in for room cleaning, without knocking. Apart from that though, the staff was just fine. The location- 49thy on Lex- is pretty depressing given it sees no sunshine even in the middle of July. Overall, I wouldn't recommend it. I love the W and stay frequently at the W in Boston, New Orleans, Hong Kong, but nay, for New York. For a price of $250 per night, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Mother Daughter Getaway at the W”
Reviews.Author: karrie3399
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I are doing a girls getaway at the W. She is 25 and picked the hotel, probably because it is so trendy. I had read so many reviews about the hotel, and now that I am here, I realize that people will complain about anything, just to hear themselves complain This is such a terrific hotel, right in the heart of mid town, with such awesome staff, that anyone would be crazy not to want to stay here. The lobby is very trending with a conceirge desk that is so fabulous and helpful and always smiling. There is never a stupid question and they always make you feel like they are glad to help....with whatever, whenever... The check in was a breeze, with a young lady that was sweet, cheerful and so pleasantt and welcoming. I cannot imagine how all of the employees at this hotel stay so happy and so nice and so positive all the time. One is nicer than the next, and I wonder if there is some sort of NICE competition going on. Our room is overlooking Lexington Avenue. I absolutely love this view, I like to know what's going on outside, I don't find it noisy at night, being up on the 14th floor keeps up far enough away from the street. Perhaps if you were a light sleeper, than a different view would be better for you, but for me this is so perfect. The air conditioning in the room works really good, and some people complained about the noise, and i have to ask them, WHAT ARE YOU KIDDING ME? Have you never heard an air conditioner before. It is NOT particularly noisy. Some people will complain about anything. Our room is lovely with a writing desk and the most comfortable chair I have ever sat in. The rooms are dimly lit with very trendy, modern lighting. My daughter and I had no problems applying makeup or getting ready to go out. It is summer, so it is light out late. Oh and the beds and the pillows are the most comfortable EVER. The hallways are also dimly lit, and if I was here with my hubby, I would imagine that it could be very romantic. The are dimly lit, for atmosphere, but not dark. We feel perfectly safe in the hallways and in the elvators. Matter of fact, there is security at night that checks your room key, to make sure you are a guest here, before you enter the elevator. Then in the elevator, you cannot get to any floors without inserting your room key. I think this is so great. I was actually a bit worried, two women in NY together, but not here. I feel completely at home and completely safe, and completely satisfied that we made a great decision by picking the W, and will come back again and stay right here!

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Broom closet of a room, ran out of water and treated lile dirt.”
Reviews.Author: travellady059
Reviews.Content: I booked this W hotel on Lexington through a web service and paid $190 per night. When my daughter and I checked in in the morning, we were treated like second class citizens and the key was practically thrown at us while the full paying guests right next to us were treated like royalty. Our room was about half the size of a college dorm room and little more than a broom closet. We had to climb over the bed to get to the other side. You couldn't sit down on the toilet without hitting the overlapping vanity. We dreaded going back to our room every night. On the second night we had been out on the water all day and had booked a lovely dinner reservation. We went to get ready and my daughter started her shower with a trickle of water that stopped after 2 min. Absolutely no water. I called and they said they would send an engineer straight up. 50 min later still no one. I washed with several bottles of water!!!. When I complained I was told oh sorry, the hotel is old, and we did get it fixed after about 4 hours. I asked for compensation on my room rate and they said they could not do anything as the room was prepaid. They were going to comp us a free breakfast!! When I said we would be leaving too early for breakfast they offered to credit a star awards account a few points. I never use a star awards account!! The manager's were extremely unhelpful and made it very clear that they cared very little about us as we were obviously not full-paying guests-- all for the priviledge of paying $190 a night for the room!!! This was the most degrading insulting hotel experience I have ever had. I will never go to another W again. Not to be treated like this. This was clearly a room they would never ever give to a full paying guest and really made our whole two days in New York a miserable experience from the standpoint of comfort. When I book a 4-star hotel room and pay for it it is the least I expect. Not a one-star room for a 4-star price

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: littledz8417
Reviews.Content: this place sucks we had to wait over 3 hours to get into the lounge upstairs and when we were there they had some gay dude with a g string DJing super loud music. horrible atmosphere they had alot of workers but yet we found ourselves waiting around 20 minutes a time when we needed our server who then over charged us and we didnt find out until the next day. this place blows they try to hard to be a "cool" place to be. overrated and a waste of a good friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor cleaning and concierge service”
Reviews.Author: Danzifra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W twice last month (June 2011) because my company has preferential rates and the location is convenient, but I was really disappointed with the overall service. The first time I had such a small room that it should have never be given for that price! In addition, they never picked up my calls when I needed, they are always busy at the welcome desk, nobody picking up the phone. The second time the room was better as I had complained but the service was even worst: the bathroom was not cleaned for 2 days in a raw! They only replenished amenities and towels. The hotel is always full because is very central and clubby, but I would never recommend anybody to stay there, at that price then!

Reviews.Title: “It was an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorresFam6
Reviews.Content: I was able to book this hotel at a very low nightly rate through a close friend that works at the W. The standard room is extremely small, narrow, and dark, but it has what you need to sleep. Luckily we were in a room far from the elevators and not on the busy street side. It was clean, bed was comfortable, not too keen on the sheets and pillow, toiletries were restocked daily, and the 27" tv on the wall was nice. We barely spent time in the room as we were there to sight see, so it was just a small room to come back to and go to sleep. We hung out at the lobby lounge Friday night, but that was too crowded and noisy, and the drinks are ridiculously priced and not made well. We ate at the Heart restaurant for breakfast and it was a decent meal. The subway is right around the corner and it is very easy to catch a taxi in front of the hotel. This made commuting in the city very convenient. Walking near the area in either direction made for great sightseeing before we would head back to the hotel. Plenty of restaurants, stores, fruit and hotdog stands, and DuaneReed's close by. If I had to pay the full nightly rate, I would only complain about the quality of the hotel. I've stayed at others that provide top-notch quality service, hallways are better lit, rooms are better decorated and designed to make your stay more comfortable, that you forget it's the size of a walk-in closet. If staying here meant saving money to enjoy more of New York, I would stay again, otherwise, there are others in the same area that you should consider first.

Reviews.Title: “Like a hot fudge sundae w cherry on top !”
Reviews.Author: Beryl1950
Reviews.Content: Our stay was our BEST EVER! The staff was so great. When we were early for our room I was given champagne and our suite was upgraded! The lobby was lovely as well the Acura car was at our disposal many times and one person stood out to make this all happen. PAUL WORGAFTIK !!! He made sure we were happy every step of the way. I can't wait to go back in august and see him and my old friend Theresa from Whatever Whenever. And they mean it. They really dot their i's and cross their t's when it comes to amenities in the room. I had a microwave,a fridge, a great, make up, mirror, coffee make, and of course great BLISS products! Can't wait to go back. Beryl Block, chgo

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Awesome Locale..only a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: RN2babes
Reviews.Content: Great hotel awesome location couldn't believe we were down the street from Rockefeller Center and across from the Waldorf. Check in was smooth, they convinced me to joined the Starwoods program which was great because they comped the internet, which would have cost approx $15/day. Ridiculous! Rooms were clean and neat one for kids one for adults (smartest idea ever). However the lighting was very dim. I know they are trying to create atmosphere but I flat out couldn't see. I don't have the best vision so mood lighting doesn't always work for me. Lol! Service was okay, unfortunately when housekeeping came to clean the rooms there were no clean washcloths provided for either rooms (and yes I did leave a tip! Lol). Also did not replinish the facial wash. Loved the free apples and flavored water in the lobby, and the complimentary umbrellas as it was raining. The lounge and nightspot looked great and both were busy, but alas I had my younger nieces wth me so I passed on that. Will definitley come back and check it out again. Great place to stay with the BF, GF, or BFF!! Oh and the bellmen were fabulous not to mention cute Special thanks to Duraun who hailed us a cab in the pouring rain :)

Reviews.Title: “Favorite W hotel in the city, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: spgfan17
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this particular hotel and each time I find more to love about this W - and being a new yorker, I have some high expectations. I was able to take advantage of Bliss spa and had a relaxing massage with Mcguire. We had great drinks at the bar, breakfast was delicious in the restaurant, our room was upgraded and the view was incredible... and it's nice that this W isn't right in the most touristy part of the city, but still down the road from all that great shopping on 5th. A huge, huge thank you to David Almada who was such a great conceirge and really went out of his way to make sure that this trip so nice, much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoy W Hotels... I was disappointed with the service”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler40
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this W hotel in the past, but was disappointed with the service I received during this stay. It is a "buzzing" hotel, often very crowded. I was originally put in a VERY small room --- a sticker on the window said that it was small -- but that I would get free wireless service, and 500 points at check-out. GOOD IDEA --- but I would have hoped to have been informed about the size of the room BEFORE I got to it. Be prepared for high NYC prices. I chose to get dinner delivered from one of my favorite sushi places in the area, and was surprised that I did not receive a call before the delivery person came to my door. I am a STARWOODS Preferred member, and did not feel like there was any acknowledgment of this ---- EXCEPT after I filled out a survey... I received a VERY nice letter from their customer service department. I was impressed with the responsiveness and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MichAsco
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of midtown, this location is ideal to any visitor to NY, but also to anyone who lives here. The bar is loaded with people after business hours and quite a fun scene to grab a drink after work. The food in restaurants is also great quality should you need to grab a bite quickly. The rooms are comfortable and certainly above NYC standards when it comes to size. The property is well maintained and kept clean at all times of the day. The gym is the best I have seen in most of the W properties. Overall, the size of this hotel is much more spacious than other W's in NY. The most important thing I can comment on is the service and quality of staff members at this hotel. Every need of mine was addressed immediately if not sooner, and the staff was very attentaive to everything. I think service is most important when it comes to staying at a hotel, and this particular property exceeded my expectations and will return because of that (in addition to the excellent hotel itself). A special shout out goes to Valerie Solodukho for her above and beyond service in both setting up reservations and making sure the stay itself was enjoyable. Her work was extremely efficient and made my stay carefree. I look forward to returning to this property again soon.

Reviews.Title: “singin' in the rain”
Reviews.Author: lugan11
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the W New York for the Fourth of July weekend. The W's style, apparent from the lobby, is chic and modern. As a result it appears to appeal to a young (40's or less) set. Reading the reviews I expected a small room when I checked in. When I asked the clerk about an upgrade, however, she without hesitation upgraded me to a "Spectacular" room. And provided free wi-fi to boot! While not exceptionally spacious, the Spectacular room was more than enough size, and plenty for two people. The view faced 51st Street to the Benjamin hotel, and was very quiet on the 9th floor. And I could not hear neighbors, so the walls were well insulated. While the basics of the hotel and the room were more than enough to make my stay a pleasant one, it was the little touches the hotel provided that really enhanced my impression of the W. From a cooler with cold water and fresh citrus fruit for guests in the elevator lobby, to the free NY Times or WSJ (including Sunday edition), to the car service provided by Acura. But I really appreciated what the W staff did on the morning a thundershower broke out when we were walking out for the day. They provided free umbrellas for whomever wanted one as they went out the door! It made me relax that the W "had my back" as we went to spend our day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “the most comfortable bed & pillows I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: mainasb
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend. The lobby was quite busy and noisy all the time, so don't expect to spend a quiet and relaxing stay if you go there; but if you like a kind of funky place, it's perfect. I paid a ridiculously low price for a 1 queen bed room on the 3rd floor, by booking through a web page that doesn't tell you the name of the hotel until you fully book and pay for your stay. Room was small and for that reason we got free wifi internet in the room during our stay. In addition to the restaurant where breakfast is served, there is a bar to have coffee in the morning and drinks in the night. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable ever. LCD 32" in the room, minibar, DVD player. The hotel was fully booked but I still didn't hear my room neighbours, which is good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and service, if you bypass the public spaces”
Reviews.Author: deekaye
Reviews.Content: For those of us old enough to remember when W's were new, enjoying a stay there now requires maximizing the still-considerable room comforts and service while avoiding their public spaces. My recent stay at this mid-stream W was marked by a very comfortable room and very good service. Though checking in late on a holiday week, as a Starwood member I was upgraded without asking from a tiny ("cozy") room to one quite spacious enough for a single person (though it would have been cramped for two). The mid-floor room -- which faced a deep courtyard set back from Lexington Ave but had a partial sky view -- was quiet and clean, with a good bed and amenities such as robe, radio, toiletries and TV with basic-cable channels. Coffee arrived promptly when ordered and was nicely served. My checkout and bag storage was smooth. Desk staff seemed quite professional, which is not always the case in New York. That said, the public spaces can be horrifying to anyone who is no longer very young. Throbbing loud music everywhere, which attracts tee-shirted partyers on weekend eves. The W persists in its once-fresh but now-stale habits of piping the loud music into the elevators, giving cutesy but mystifying names to standard items, and stocking M 'n' Ms in the minibars. It's time to upgrade the music, nomenclature, and chocolate, folks! (If the W wants to keep up-to-date, it's also time to switch to organic toiletries, put recycling bins in, and offer towel drying racks.) I didn't use the spa in this W, so cannot comment on it. The lack of free wifi or computer access is also unacceptable. Not only does there appear ti be none in the lobby, but there isn't any in the business center -- all is for-pay. All you can do for free is print out your boarding pass, hardly a state-of-the-art situation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great night"”
Reviews.Author: RacheleWarren_NJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on Lexington on July 4 as we had business in NYC on July 5. Enjoyed delicious cocktails in the lounge and then went up to our cool and very comfortable room. Breakfast the next morning was wonderful and they gladly held our bags for a few hours. A lovely night!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: CocoCParis
Reviews.Content: Concierge and bellmen were wonderful but that's where my positive experience with this hotel ended. Check-in was painfully slow and treatment I received was very poor. Expressed concern about personal safety when I was put in a room at the end of a dark hallway, near the electrical closet and ice machine, with no other nearby rooms, and received standard language about "safest hotel in NYC", etc. Felt like I was listening to a recording. As a single woman traveling alone, I expect my concerns to be taken seriously, but they did were not at this hotel. I don't understand the appeal of W - dark, oppressive hallways, poor lighting in room, expensive internet access. I do like their Bliss toiletries but that's about the only aspect I enjoy at W hotels. Also, hotel was very loud, making sleep difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception assistance!”
Reviews.Author: mbt3
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, Janaina, the front desk clerk, was so warm, friendly and helpful. It is so wonderful to be greeted and checked in by someone who was great at their job. Janiana had us in a "wonderful" room facing Lexington Avenue. We had a great view of the city out of our large hotel window and the room size was fine for two people. I really enjoyed the little "perks" that W Hotels has placed about the room. I definately will be back and the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Liz Pantaleon was amazing at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: zed3030
Reviews.Content: lovely room, large an airy for new York. we felt really welcomed and at home by the warm reception at the front desk,especially Liz. would def recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and clean”
Reviews.Author: jstar28
Reviews.Content: The best part about the W Hotel on Lexington is the location. No need for cabs to Broadway, Times Square, 5th Avenue, or Central Park. It's all within walking distance. The hotel is classic W: very clean rooms, quality bath products, iPod docks, signature scent in the low-lighted hallways, and attentive staff. Where this W differs from others is the size of the rooms. The W price is the same but rooms are significantly smaller. There is a shower only (no bath) and the bed reaches almost from one wall to the other -- just enough room to walk around the foot of the bed. The hotel acknowledges this, however, and provides free WiFi as compensation. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a nice getaway or business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would come back if there was a deal”
Reviews.Author: travelingwhilbury
Reviews.Content: The W Lexington was a great spot to stay at for our weekend NYC getaway. I knew going in that the rooms were going to be small (and they were) but this didn't bother us too much because we spent the majority of our time outside. The beds and pillows were extremely comfy and the airconditioning was welcomed after a NYC summer day. There little snack bar was motion sensor monitored to we were afraid to go anywhere near it just in case. Although we thought adding lube and condoms on the snack bar a nice touch for those emergency situations. The shower had great water pressure valve which you could change to be as hard or as soft as you wanted. The bathrooms, like the bedroom, are very tiny. If you don't like cramped spaces (or if cramped spaces don't like you) I would probably try and stay somewhere else. Great help was given at the Whatever/ Whenever desk. They made wonderful recommendations of where to eat no matter what part of NYC I was asking about. When it's raining, they offer complimentary umbrellas you can take for the day to stay dry during your walks. All in all I wasn't disappointed with my stay at W. Although, I would only return if it was a part of another travel deal. I would try another hotel instead if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card statement (part 2), or better still check into a different hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Ill advised decision, further to my earlier experiences (see post May 2010) stayed at the hotel for a recent overnight business trip. A week after checking out noticed an additional charge for $ 65. Further enquiry clarified it as parking charge. Given that I flew in from Toronto this must have been my share of the cost of parking the Air Canada plane at the gate in LaGuardia or perhaps the 1 min at the curb that it took a taxi to drop me off at the front door of the hotel... Extremely loud air conditioning unit which couldn't even be turned off.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: 1nternationa1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W New York Hotel in late July for a few nights and was sorely disappointed. The bottom line is that the star rating for the hotel is not four stars and is three! The level of service received was erratic. There appears to be ill-thought into when the front desk requires support i.e. during peak check-in and check-out times as often only one or two members of staff were present. At other 'quieter' times, there were at least three or four members of staff enjoying a conversation together. When queues built-up, staff were reluctant to re-act given it would interrupt their conversations. Now, I did encounter some lovely and pleasant staff at the front desk, who genuinely offered help to make my stay an enjoyable experience but equally, I agree with another reviewers comments on the 'ice-cold' reception received by some staff at times. The hotel prides itself on the Whatever, Whenever culture; although, my experience of this service was poor. Many features were offered but not managed in its entirety, for example, the complementary water near the elevators was a nice touch but always empty... In addition, when points were raised regarding the room's fixtures to reception to be resolved, I was still awaiting a fix by the time I checked-out of the room. No sense of urgency or communication with the guest on potential steps to resolution. The room was a 'Cosy Queen Non-Smoking', which was adequate for my needs and as a base to see the sights of New York. The phrase 'shabby-chic' comes to mind given the fixtures were worn and missing parts. You are engulfed in the room by the TV but the real issue was the air conditioning unit. It is the equivalent of sleeping next to a major flight path! Loud, useless, and dirty: do I need to say any more? The bathroom was small but more concerning was the cleanliness: have the white tiles seen a deep clean since the renovations? The TV had a very grainy picture and kept reseting itself to the hotels promotional clip on in-house entertainment. Given the size of the room, a pink sticker is attached to the window and mirror which states that they understand it is a small room; therefore, would like to offer 500 Starwood points and free Wifi. So, if you are not a member of the loyalty scheme and have no need for the Wifi: the gesture has no real benefit. As an alternative, why doesn't the hotel offer complementary service at the bar or breakfast in the restaurant? In short, the hotel is in a great location for the Manhattan must-see attractions; however, I fundamentally believe that the management need to review the services offered from a back-to-basics approach. I left believing the hotel had 'all style and no substance' to their claims. A disappointment given it could be a great hotel. Back to the competition on my next stay in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Loud and Loud. Unfortunately, great style does not cover noise”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Krabs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very classy and chic. No doubt, but unfortunately, when you pay so much for a room, you expect it to be perfect. We were supposed to stay for 2 nights only. The first night was terrible. We were in a room with an incredibly loud fan. Even with my ear plugs I could hear it. My husband who can sleep in almost any condition and who had who was completely jetlagged could not fall asleep. This is absolutely unacceptable. Also, the line at the reception was so long. At any time we went to the reception, we had to wait for 15minutes. The previous occupant obvisouly helped himself in the minibar. The pack of Vitamin C was left on the minibar as untouched, but it was empty. I had to ask not be charged for this. The room was very styled and clean. Yet, the bathroom was not optimal. Very poor light, making it impossible to put make up on. The shower has no door, so that the floor is completely wet. We asked to be changed room for the second night to avoid the loud fan. They did it. That's cool, thx!. Hoping to get some sleep, there was still a fan on this side of the hotel, but less loud. I could get some sleep. Overall, I would not recommand this hotel if you are looking for some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff; early check-in”
Reviews.Author: tjphantom
Reviews.Content: I flew in on a red-eye from SF last week. I had a client meeting at 10am and wanted to check in early to freshen up. They had a lot of similar requests to accommodate but were able to get me in my room in 40 minutes, by 8am. The woman who helped me at reception was very nice and clearly made a difference to make sure I could get a room. It was awesome and I was very grateful.

Reviews.Title: “DJ was the best”
Reviews.Author: SolarSoar
Reviews.Content: Like many NY hotels, the rooms were small. But there were some nice amenities like an iPod speaker and robes in the closet. The highlight of the hotel for me was the DJ Friday night. The music she spun was really fun. The bar in the main lobby has some really nice cocktails. I enjoyed the martini with lychees.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lca2316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in countless hotels and I must say that this is one of our favoites of all. The service, hospitality and genuine concern of the staff is incredible. In addition to the beautiful accomodations and location makes this by far one of the best in the city that never sleeps. C & L

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New York !”
Reviews.Content: This is the Best Place to stay in New York! Special thanks to Nils Bergmann who really took Care of us! Best recommondations ever!!!! Restaurant, Bars, Shopping. We had a very charming and Quite Room to the Patio. The bar in the hotel in One of the Best Bars in manhattan...my Wide Envoyed the cocos Apples daiquiry Every day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: glilyb
Reviews.Content: I came here after my Business trip for a few days with a friend. What a great hotel. Everyone was extremely friendly offering restaurant reservations, things to do, tickets to shows and anything else I could think off. It was an amazing experience that is truly different from the West Coast. The city really knows how to do Christmas, I only wish I could have got tickets to SNL! I will come back againl but I think I would come back during warmer weather. I really appreciated the car provided, to take us around town. the lounge was great and always full of people. The Bliss products in the room are great. The front desk was kind enough to give me an extra lotion to take home. Everytime we stepped out of the hotel there was a taxi with in a few minutes which was great because it was extremely cold. Rooms where a little small, but it had everything we needed. I will be coming back to New York for sure and hopefully there will be a room waiting for me at the W New York!

Reviews.Title: “A great Gem!”
Reviews.Author: QueenV71
Reviews.Content: My recent stay absolutely wonderful. As soon as I exited the taxi, my daughter and I were greeted by your doorman, Deron (not sure of the spelling). He was charming and helpful. We arrived in the morning, expecting to have to store our luggage and were pleasantly surprised that we were able to check in very early. Suggestions for dining, and lounging were spot on from your concierge. The bar was great for drinks before the theater. On our last day, I called down for a late check-in and was surprised that it was extended until 3pm. That gave us time to enjoy lunch, last minute shopping, and a place to freshen up before leaving for the airport. Your staff was very accommodating. I will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Late Checkout Scam”
Reviews.Author: SturmDrang
Reviews.Content: Arrived NYC Midtown Manhattan with reservations for SPA level suite. Posted check-in time was 3pm, but room wasn't available because of late checkout 3pm offered to last client. Almost 4pm and still waiting. Front desk offered to downgrade me. Downgrade, not Upgrade! The last thing someone who has shelled out $$$ for a suite at a supposedly nice hotel in Midtown Manhattan is the word DOWNGRADE. Get a clue. Any other hotel I have ever stayed in has offered a free UPGRADE if my room is not ready. Will not stay here again. They are much nicer across the street at the Waldorf. Did NOT offer an

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the door and to the room!”
Reviews.Author: DMRoundtree
Reviews.Content: Great service all the time here. I have stayed a number of times and it is my favorite property in NYC. I have stayed at several hotels in the Manhattan and a few other W Hotels there. W New York give a great experience in lounge and Whiskey Blue bar. The Front Desk is always smiling and greets you by name if you are returning to the hotel. Deron is one of the doorman who always has a smile and pleasant conversation. He knows what is hopping in the city nightlife and happy to help out with tips in the city. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three star masquerading as a five-star”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: Good: snappy elevator service. No bedbugs. Clean. Great location. Intermediate: Exercise room. Service. Room quiet but air conditioner very noisy. Bad: Very small rooms, badly lit. Very slow (free) internet. Lousy TV quality. High prices. Defective message service. Details. Bedbugs have been a concern at this hotel. None visible in room after inspection. Some machine and some TV's broken in exercise room. Exercise room itself somewhat shabby. Hotel room so small that one cannot get around bed without squeezing by TV. Poor lighting makes it hard to see bag. Bed light worked intermittently, and only illuminated one side of room. Paid movies and hotel ads in high quality digital on TV. All other cable and broadcast stations in low-quality analog TV distorted to fit screen. Internet so slow that only good for reading email and light surfing. Message light blinked frequently reporting on hotel ads left as messages, but the message button didn't work. Checkin OK, but had to wait while clerk got off phone on checkout and then clerk refused to print out receipt because room pre-paid.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W Hotel I've stayed at... and I still stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Luu
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveller that spends over 200 nights in hotels a year so I've seen it all. Keep that in mind when reading my reviews. THE GOOD Location. This is the closest Starwood property to my clients / office. So convenience factor plus Starwood points really plays into why I stay here. THE BAD Ironically this was the first W property I ever stayed in, back in 2002. Since then I've stayed at W properties all over the world. This one is by far at the lower end of all the W's, but I still come back because of the reasons I gave above. Smallest rooms for a W in New York. Terribly inconsistent service... front desk is especially bad - sometimes they greet you warmly, other times it's cold as ice. Also if there is a line upfront they won't even acknowledge that you've been waiting for a More often than not I've always found something wrong with my room - Dirty towels, brown water from the faucet, dirty sheets. Plus I have to call multiple times to get these things fixed. Not at all what you would expect or pay for in a W. THE UGLY Did I also mention that the rooms were SMALL?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful people -- efficient and greatly located. Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: QueenoftheSlipstream
Reviews.Content: Just what you'd expect from a W - modern sleek rooms (not huge though). Very hip lobby bar (and super expensive, but who cares when in NY?) It's worth it just to watch the cool people lounging. Great location, can get to everything NY has to offer. Concierge staff the best! Great diner around the corner (exit hotel, go right, to corner, go right 1/2 block) for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “"Shabby Chic" or just plain shabby.”
Reviews.Author: Patroclas
Reviews.Content: 6 hours in a bus from the Cape and we were ready for to relax. PS I would recommend a Peter Pan bus from Hyannis to New York much better than flying and a magnificent view as you approach the city. Great welcome at the W Lexington Ave really friendly face with a great attitude. I think his name was Tim. Lobby and reception were what we were expecting and the sofas and chairs looked inviting in the bar area and we mentally promised ourselves a drink before dinner. From the lift to the room I knew the room would be small looking at the spacing in between the doors but small rooms donâ€™t bother me as we have stayed in some really tiny ones in Paris but nothing prepared me for the shoe box we would be staying in for four days. You couldnâ€™t open the curtains to let the light in due to the multi storey car park view. It was like staying in a cell. Monks would love it!! I had trouble getting around the bed avoiding the large television on a pole in one corner. We have shoe boxes that are bigger. No way could we u pack the bags as one door of the 4 contained the safe and another the mini bar. The closet was even smaller we hung up about 6 things and it was full. The carpet and tiles in the bathroom were dirty and the walls in the bathroom had heavy textured wall paper which hung on to all the splashes from the basin. I couldnâ€™t dry myself in the bathroom just too small. We were kept awake all teh 1st night as the window would not close and teh noise from teh air conditioning was horrendous. Two call the next day did get it repaired but it was a rear facing room and the noise was only marginally better. It was what I can only describe as the Emperorâ€™s new clothes. Every one afraid of being uncool if they critique something that is labelled hip/ trendy. Nice design fittings do not make up for cramming people in to an unsafe space. Truly awful!. To make matters worse you try getting a seat in the bar when it is full of non-resident office types who hang about there after work taking up space from people staying. We gave up in the end and went to a local bar. Breakfast was no better in a dull really dull breakfast room with no natural light and just plain depressing we took to eating a diner down the avenue. Next trip to New York we will look elsewhere. Best things were the welcome and the consierge who helped us get tickets to non broadway theatre it was down hill from there.

Reviews.Title: “I am in love with your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roxanadalila
Reviews.Content: To be honest I had never heard of the W, and a friend invited me to stay for 6 days. The experience was unbelievable from the moment I arrived to the moment I ran out of the hotel to catch my train at Penn Station, I felt like royalty. Everyone there was willing to help with anything at any time. I will definately visit this hotel again, and now I tell everyone about it!! The concierge always recomended memorable spots with great food, and helped me with everything. The only downfall was your beds are so comfortable, I hate sleeping in my bed now!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: charlessouthey
Reviews.Content: The W should stand for Why? why are you mopping tread mills at 6:45 AM and not drying them? Why Invite the guest to coffee and then charge for it? Why is the hotel so unhip? 80's are over, get back to serving your business cliental.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good choice if you don't need much room.”
Reviews.Author: Familytravel1113
Reviews.Content: Moved here after a weekend with the family at the Marriott. Checked in early in the morning and asked to store my bags, but was able to get a room, which was great. Front desk person was the same as last year when I stayed here; she was very courteous, as she was last year when I had a billing issue. Elevator requires you enter your room key, which is a nice feature. Last year, there were staff people before the elevators who asked to see your key, but they were not present this year. Rooms are small and this time I had the smallest of small. They actually put a sign in the room advising they know it's small and they will be giving you extra points to make up for it . Very, very clean. Bilss products for which I was thankful as I ran out of my airline-size shampoo. View was of a wall. Overall quiet (12th floor), but ac unit was on the noisy side. I have stayed here several times and find it very reliable.

Reviews.Title: “W must stand for the WORST HOTEL ever”
Reviews.Author: ruinedourtrip
Reviews.Content: After day 2 we tried to move to a different hotel but could not find one--the W is horrible.Confirmed reservation for double--given a single and told they'd work on correcting it--we contacted manager and after about an hour did get moved to a double--then late that night a man tried to get into our room--they'd given him keys and booked him in same room. Room supposed to have coffee maker--finally got one after asking for it for 2 days -- but no coffee--it is an extra $11 a pot. Also got charged and extra $5 to get a coffee cup. We had drinking glasses for 2 days and then we got charged $5 on a day when the maid did not leave galsses and we had to call down and ask for more. We started washing and hiding glasses and coffee cups because they wanted to charge $5 extra to use one each day !! We also had to ask for extra clothes hangars-- the room comes with only 2. One day our room keys did not work--front desk said cell phones erased the magnetic strip. Room had bedside lamp and then on day 3 it was removed with no explanation and never replaced. On day 5 I found out the sheets were not being changed--small spill on a sheet and it was still there after the maid had been in. I asked and found out they don't change sheets until the guest leaves--we we're booked for 8 days. (we'd been tipping the maid every day--after that we left much smaller tips). Internet connection was $20 a day in a city where all other places have free internet. The room was very small and very noisy--crying child next door was horrible and there was a lot of noise in the hall at all hours. The W also extends it's mini-bar to covering a dresser top with snacks and a notice that says the snacks are on a pressure pad and we'd be charged if we moved any of the junk off the dresser top--no flat surfaces in the room to put anything on. The place tried to sound British calling the elevator a lift and bathrooms waterclosets but front desk clerks pretend to not understand English whenever we asked a question. We reserved the room for $289 a night for 8 nights but when we settled the bill we found a charge of $599 for one night with no explanation-- desk clerk actually walked away and turned her back on us when we asked her to explain the charge !!! We're still trying to get that corrected. We're in NY twice a year for confrences-- we've stayed in many NY hotels---this one was the worst ever. We booked a room here because we were in the city for longer than usual and wanted a really nice place-- never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Medici58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was a pleasant experience. Front desk was very helpful, location was great and though the room was a bit small, it had everything we needed. We went to the bar downstairs twice and the people there were so nice! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJP208
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about the location since on my previous trips to NYC I had always stayed closer to Times Square or to Rockefeller Center. I was pleasantly surprised, however, that this hotel is in close proximity to everything and is a relatively short walk or cab ride to many places. The hotel is actually quite nice--although the rooms are very small (they call them "cozy" for a reason). The lounge and bar areas in the lobby are very comfy but a bit pricey even for New York City. The Bliss products in the rooms are a plus. Overall, we enjoyed our stay for our Girls' Weekend--and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nothing to dream of, but functional”
Reviews.Author: fritzrudolf
Reviews.Content: had to ask for another room since the one I got first had no daylight at all (lower floor with window facing a wall), the second one wasnt too much better but a lot smaller... another difficulty was the noisy air conditioning otherwise ok, and the location in walking distance to the UN and many other places is certainly good, the breakfast to go in the entrance hall was useful and good quality

Reviews.Title: “Location, Helpful Staff, Lounge,”
Reviews.Author: cecemac_302
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business. Good location. Great lobby and lounge. Ordinary sized room, small as all in the city. Room service was wonderful. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, central to most anything”
Reviews.Author: JimEveryCountry
Reviews.Content: I like this W (I've stayed at most of the others in NYC). It is a couple of blocks from the subways (the "E" line goes to/from JFK, so you can skip the LIRR/Penn Station connection). Hotel was good. Room quiet and decent. The bar scene is interesting ~ generally lively and with a good crowd. The front desk staff is fun (in a Virgin sort of way)... I left my keys in the room 3 times and they were great about making duplicates.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, Clean & Super Friendly”
Reviews.Author: HeyJohnnyK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend and was impressed at how attentive the staff were. From the front desk, the security guys to the housekeepers. I spoke with the night manager Michael, a couple nights before my arrival and he was nice too. I liked the daily calls to check on my stay. The room (#746) was very nice and very clean, not used up at all. Posh one bedroom with a small but very nice new (carrera marble) bathroom. I never did figure out how to use the television to play music or the CD I found next to it. I stayed at this hotel about 4 years ago and found the staff considerably more attentive this time around. I come to NY about once a year and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CyberJava
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the courteous and professional services we received at this hotel. Had a mechanic problem with the car upon arrival. The valet notified us of the problem timely through the phone. Ashley, Director of Welcome Office, helped us contact the insurance company and the towing company. She also offered us the late check-out for accommodation. Fortunately, the car was fixed in time. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and pleasant. It is a true statement of the whatever&whenever services.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: baddawgbob
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern but small. We had a great view with a very comfortable King bed. We had to wait an hour and a half past check in to get into our room however the check in girls were very accomodating. The card keys were a pain in the, you know what, and didn't work half the time. The "bell boys" were unfriendly and pretty much unhelpful as well. They were more like door men for a night club then a Hotel! If you are paying for the location then you got your money's worth, anything else is average or less!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL & STAFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: vickyness
Reviews.Content: We redeyed out to NYC on a Friday night and made our way to the hotel at 9am. It is conveniently located to the E & 6th subway lines and a few blocks away from Grand Central Terminal. I had the pleasure of being helped by Carlene who was bubbly and was THE BEST front desk staff I've ever encountered. She was energetic and worked to get us a room even though check in time is 3PM. The hotel was super clean, no bed bugs! They use Bliss Spa products which are awesome! Loved the awesome car service they provide and the super helpful concierge service. Beds are super comfortable and the sheets/duvet were clean. Standard room sizes are very small for California standards but are typical of NY. The corner king bedrooms are larger and more spacious. Soundproofing is done well here since we couldn't hear the honking from the street. I absolutely loved the W Hotel concept! No swimming pool here but there is a sauna in their spa for visitors to use. Definitely a fabulous hotel and it made our first NY trip all the more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: emster_26
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the W, we were expecting a much smaller room in New York, but the room was good, with modern decor. When we arrived it was about 12:00 pm and were slightly concerned with the loud music in the bar, but by the time we found our room we couldn't hear anything. The room had a ipod docking station, TV, minibar (which was only for those with a large wallet), the bathroom was small but done well, walk in shower and lovely toiletries. We found the hotel to be in a good location and were able to walk everywhere - until our feet began to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Nice mid-town option”
Reviews.Author: SLS51
Reviews.Content: Great location and fun trendy hotel. The rooms are small, even by NYC standards, but they always seem to contain everything we need. This trip we were lucky enough to stay in a "Fantastic Suite" which was a very bright corner room. I appreciate the security of this hotel -- no access to room floors without a key. When I lost my key, the front desk would not give me an additional key without confirming ID.

Reviews.Title: “W its fun, moder and great service”
Reviews.Author: Panchex
Reviews.Content: I stayed for memorial weekend, great location and great amenities. I stayed in a suite and it was outstanding! Renee at the front desk is great she would make everything posible! I would recomend to stay hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: passiontravel9 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the heart of New York city, easily accessible to all you can do and think of doing in this vibrant city.This hotel has some really good bars and the food is good too.Very nice Spa but mind you try and book treatments in advance as they are really busy. The rooms are very comfortable and have every convenience built in. The subway station is right there ans so is the bus stop so extremely convenient.Great restaurants all round the hotel as this is really a restaurant city with some great food.. The managers at this hotel are really nice and i had to extend my stay due to an emergency but was immediately assisted by Mr Tim Mcdonnell and everything was taken care of inspite of the fact that the hotel was really busy. The concierge service was excellent unlike many similar hotels in the area. Will definately like to go back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Room was a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: Honeybee2121
Reviews.Content: I had to stay one night in midtown on business, and I got a great rate on one of the cozy rooms here. It was very small, but it was clean and it had everything I needed. The staff was friendly and helpful. I wouldn't recommend the cozy room with a traveling mate, unless you are really, really close. My room was very quiet, but I stayed on a Friday night and the bar was loud and hopping with a very bridge-and-tunnel crowd. Nothing wrong with that, but it was not somewhere you'd stop for a quiet drink if that's what you like in your hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Face, Empty Soul, Plastic Clientele”
Reviews.Author: travelmiracle
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three days at the W on Lexington in Midtown after having won the 4 Star on Priceline. I was upgraded from the hole-in-the-wall Cozy rooms where you literally look out the window to a brick wall to a Wonderful Room, where you get to look at the gorgeous Marriott next door. This was a very nice thing for the Reservation Desk person to do and I do appreciate that very much, so for $150 I was overall pleased with the stay. I also found the staff who was what I would call a Welcome Staff to be very fun and convivial. And the best part of my stay? The delightful Haitian Room Service person who was the best part of the hotel. I did find the concierge telling me I couldn't just buy bus tours off the street vendors but had to use the W voucher to be dishonest and tacky, so much so I went back to her after talking to the street vendor and got my $11 back out of principle alone. Tacky, tacky. However, I would not stay there again for a few reasons. It was such a plastic 'scene' that it bordered on ridiculous. The uber trendy euro design was so over the top that it was not a place of comfort, despite their furry pillows and low lighting. The Living Room was a great concept, but the over design of it left it cold and unwelcoming. I also had to chuckle at the posing pretty people who were so concerned with who was looking at them the entire time that it just became a bizarre experience all together. The energy in the hotel among the guests was so insecure and strange it made me SO happy to be 40 and over that era. If you're in your 20s, if you want to see and be seen then this IS the place for you. If you appreciate modern design that is executed well, if you want to be able to see in proper lighting, if you want a warm home in NYC and if you hate pretension, then this is NOT the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: rafkam
Reviews.Content: Checked in super late (midnight) on a Friday night after a long flight to find a very long line at reception. The music in the living room bar was so loud I could barely hear the girl at reception. Perhaps the loud music would explain the surly behaviour. Since I couldnâ€™t hear anything, to this day Iâ€™m not sure whether or not my SPG Platinum status was acknowledged and whether we actually received an upgrade. If we did, these were the smallest rooms Iâ€™ve ever seen! Very cramped rooms, and directly facing more rooms, despite being a corner room. I hear the standard rooms are like prison cells, so Iâ€™m guessing mine must have been a suite. Despite the size, room was comfortable, if a little dark. We ordered room service on arrival, but desk space is so cramped there wasnâ€™t enough room for the tray, or for another person to sit down, so I had to sit on the chair and my wife on the bed while we ateâ€¦ Location is spot on, for business or shopping, although we later checked into the W Union Square and found this to be much better for cool bars and restaurants. Acura service is great and we were able to book a couple of rides on short notice. Very courteous driver and a great service altogether! Concierge was quite unreliable, sending us to lame tourist traps like Sara Bethâ€™s, when we asked about a nice place for brunch. Breakfast at the hotel is good and reasonably good value, and the living room bar is actually nice, despite the fact that after 10pm they crank up the music way too loud. Whisky Blue (or is it Whisky Mist) is definitely a has been. I would stay here again whilst on business based on the fact that itâ€™s a fairly good value (for NY!) Starwood affiliated option, but Iâ€™m sure there are other places with nice - and bigger - rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NoraNJtoLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from NY and NJ but now live elsewhere. We typically stay at the Palace when we come into town but decided to try the W to collect some more starpoints. What a waste! The lobby of the hotel is fine- open and spacious. But that is where the good points end. The people at the front desk go between incompetent and rude, and I'm not really sure which I find to be annoying. I had asked for an itemized bill to be ready for my husband to pick up in the afternoon; it was nowhere to be found when he was there. He had checked his bags after checking out, and it took 20 minutes for people to find his bags. The line for the front desk is out of control it is so long (it reminded me of queueing for a Las Vegas hotel). There was no SPG line and absolutely no accommodation made for SPG gold members that we could tell (and no upgrade even though the hotel was not even near full capacity). The rooms were teeny tiny, and in true W fashion, had so little light that I needed to extend the little light on my Kindle in order to read comfortably. The only positive I experienced in my week here was when I ran into random staff members. From housekeeping to other W employees traveling between floors, everyone was upbeat and polite. Too bad their positive attitudes didn't wash off on the people at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to w standards”
Reviews.Author: Scootg
Reviews.Content: W prices but poor service,smallest rooms even with an upgrade as a platinum member. Location good but many other hotels in the area are a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but very nice overall.”
Reviews.Author: flaura
Reviews.Content: As a picky traveler, I would have otherwise been very irritated by the tiny room I stayed in for 3 nights in mid May. But the room was exactly what I needed. A clean, modern, hip place to stay in NYC. It is also in a great location. The staff is great. They even loaned me an umbrella. And gave me their car to use when the one I booked was 30 min. late.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel - would definitely return soon!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlottes-Travels
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing weeks stay in this beautiful buzzing hotel in New York. it was bright, clean, airy, lots happneing around, a nice hustle bustle in the busy reception with guests and people at the bar, able to enjoy the buzz in NY but then returning to a very relaxing bedroom upstairs!! I stayed on the bliss spa level in a beautiful Spa Studio suite, I would highly recommend this, walking distance to the Spa and the gym, great for relaxation and working out. the room was spacious, clean and very nice, lots of hotels in NY have small boxy rooms but this was airy and great, had a great view onto the Waldolf Hotel. It is perfect for business, young couples or anyone who likes a modern funky hotel. Perfect location too, walking distance either way to both parts of Manhattan, whether you want to visit Central park, greenwich Village or Downtown. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, the concierge were great when looking for theatre tickets and baseball tickets for games whilst we were the there, and recption were service with a smile too. Will definitely be returning - Top hotel in New York - if you want a quiet chilled out hotel this is not for you however - great for New york as its busy, moving and got a great feel!

Reviews.Title: “The "W"”
Reviews.Author: E8N14
Reviews.Content: The W"s are always a good bet. I had not been home in a year and this trip was perfect ! My room at the W Lex was perfect, spotless, cozy and comfortable and CLEAN. Minimal in design like my home and extremely courteous staff. This also includes my very, very nice and beautiful house keeper. This is a prime location. Right in the middle of the city. Convenient Pizza around the corner for the times you just want a good slice. Grand Central Sta a few blocks away. "Needed to attend a party in White Plains and hit City Island" Metro North to the rescue, via the Oyster Bar. For this to be the original W, one would never know by apearance. I highly recommend this hotel with enthusiasm. Good bar scene and attractive people to meet. Yes, I had some fun... Look forward to staying there during the U.S. Open in Sept. Enjoy G. D.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed, not as swank as the brand would suggest”
Reviews.Author: roamingmatt
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations, since I have heard a lot about the W hotels, and how cool and stylish they are. But the W New York was overall a disappointment. This contemporary hotel is in an old building. The lobby and restaurant areas were as cool and stylish as one could imagine. But the room was quite small and dark (since it was painted in a stylish dark gray). There was little space to store luggage and clothes, and the bathroom was small. All pretty cool looking but not exactly brand new. The W service motto is "Whatever, whenever" and I did find staff very helpful but that doesn't help when there are only 2 people in reception for checkout and the queue is long. Room service food was very good, as one would expect. But the Wi-Fi didn't work so well, the connection was a bit weak in my room. I didn't try the gym. Overall the hotel was of course pretty nice but for the price and the high profile brand I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Wedding Weekend at the W”
Reviews.Author: tzanchan81
Reviews.Content: Group of us stayed at the W for a family wedding in NJ. Greatest location for all the city sights, shopping and restaurants, even theater. The hotel room was very comfortable and staff accomodating... but excelled in the arrangements made by the concierge (David) for our super plush limo shuttle to take all 10 of us to New Jersey to the wedding (and back) on Sunday. Other wedding guests were so jealous! We all had an amazing time and would definitely stay at the W again!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room outside of Japan coffin rooms”
Reviews.Author: PhilSommelier
Reviews.Content: I have travelled the world, have stayed in many NYC hotels also, and I have never stayed in a room this small. It is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay here”
Reviews.Author: lovesylvie
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. A subway stop right around the corner. Room was cozy, but I was alone- so it was not a problem. I love the Bliss spa products!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AjayJM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located conveniently close to the mid-town offices. The check-in was fast and efficient. The room was reasonably sized (compared to my expectation that it would be small). The bathroom was reasonably sized as well - though had some drainage problem. The bed was super (extra feather mattress pad was great for the sleep quality). On the minus side, no freebees in terms of internet or wifi (charge of $14 for 24 hours). Also, I was incorrectly billed for mini- bar usage however the staff were courteous enough to reverse it. Overall, very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of our Worst Stays.”
Reviews.Author: Morgan021
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many W Hotels before and they were great but because of our room and service... made for the worst stay. Born a New Yorker myself I know New York has smalls spaces but the room was so small and it was across from the cleaning staff who were so loud starting at 6am. Sounded like they were banging pots outside are door to wake us up. The front desk was not at all friendly or accommodating. The Concierge desk was not help ful in the least. This hotel gives NY a bad taste for the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room Ive Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: reesmarie
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice lobby and lounge area and good conference facilities. However, the bathroom was so small and the room so small, it made for a lousy stay. This isnt the place you should stay unless you want to splash out for a suite or some such thing because the standard rooms are miniscule. That said, great selection of snacks, etc in the room, good room service and high quality finishings (nice tv, bed, etc). Ive traveled all over the world including a lot of time in NYC and I think this is the smallest room Ive ever experienced and its (for sure) the smallest bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “a very private and secluded experience.”
Reviews.Author: malibu420
Reviews.Content: vincent jephanion always made my w experience smooth and private , i will definitely return to this property. thank you

Reviews.Title: “More bark than bite”
Reviews.Author: rhartogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 324 with a spectacular view of the inside of a parking garage. The sign on the window apologized for being a small room, but did give free wifi. The connection was a little slow. The bed was nice. Bathroom decent. Weak shower head and the separation between shower and bathroom is half open...may look stylish, but not functional. Employees were nice there and treated me with respect. The bar was bustling and loud; I would advise people with children to stay elsewhere. Services are way too expensive at this hotel, even for New York. One egg cooked anyway you want it is $8! The courtesy Acura shuttle that they tout is hard to get.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our trip wonderful”
Reviews.Author: R70_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on Lexington for a quick romantic getaway. Due to the efforts of the staff, we were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in we experienced the hospitality and friendliness of the staff. It was their efforts that made this a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you may expect if your looking for luxury and star watching”
Reviews.Author: RobS3
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel on Lexington Avenue is the newest W Hotel in New York and was suggested over other W hotels in New York. The service was immediate and welcoming, the lobby and lounge looked as though they were made for the set of a television show or movie. At that point the glamour ends. We requested a room with two queen size beds, as we were traveling with our daughter. The hotel had very few of these rooms and it took some time to get the room ready. The room itself was the size of my kitchen with two large beds squeezed in the middle. For all the cache that W hotels have, this was not what I imagined. The bathroom and one closet was small, so the room remained cluttered with our baggage when most rooms provide ample space. The service was attentive and the location was ideal for our where we wanted to be. I know New York hotel rooms have very little space due to the number of hotels and rooms, but this was the smallest hotel room I've stayed in the city. I would recommend the hotel, but just for two people, maybe on a childless vacation to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Moved twice, inconsistent, poor service, broken fixtures. Avoid if you can.”
Reviews.Author: pixelix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in April 2011. The W on Lexington appears to be a hastily updated and spruced up hotel, where the existing small rooms have been 'pimped' with a lick of paint and new wallpaper, and a queen size (or larger) bed, a 37" TV and a fancy expanding desk.
