As as result, the rooms feel very small indeed - the TV, for example, has to be mounted on a pole rather than be placed on a unit or mounted to the wall. Check-in was fine and I was assigned a room on the 3rd floor. A shame not to be on a higher floor with the chance of a city view, I thought - but I considered that I'd bought my stay here on Priceline, at a small discount from the W's own publicised prices, so it'd probably be fine. How wrong I was! I was given room 326, which is directly opposite the elevators. Strike one. It features a view of a multi-story car-park and the rear yard of a Chinese restaurant, complete with dumpsters of festering food. Strike two. I noticed the window sticker others have commented on - saying, basically, "Hey, we know this room is crappy, but, here, have free wifi!". Big deal. It's also a fairly shallow gesture as the wireless didn't work at all reliably - certainly not well enough to load webpages. Still - I figured, I'm paying bottom dollar, what can I expect? So I stuck it out and stayed the first night. I pulled a bottled beer ($9 - same price as the lobby bar) from the mini-bar... no bottle opener. Rang the front desk, who firstly treated me as if I was some kind of simpleton that couldn't work out how to open a bottle, and eventually said they would send someone up with a replacement opener. 45 minutes later it still hadn't arrived, and I had places to be, so I left it. Next morning, the handle came off the cold tap in the bathroom sink. No biggie - rang the front desk again, who once again seemed to think I was making this up ("What do you mean 'the handle has come off of the faucet', sir?") and eventually said they'd send someone up. I went out, enjoyed New York and returned 10 hours later. Tap still not fixed. Hell, bottle opener still not present - enough! Marched down to the front desk to complain and was moved, and was comped 'breakfast' for my remaining days, as some kind of apology for the inconvenience. I was moved to the 14th floor, room 1430. This room had its own set of problems (including the missing bottle opener!) - specifically a heating and cooling problem. The room has a boxed-in cavity running down one side of the room, next to the bed - I suspect this contains several hot water pipes, as it radiated heat like a furnace. As a consequence, the air-conditioning in this room is set to compensate - which means, the very, very noisy air-conditioning is running, full pelt, all the damn time. If you turn it off, the room quickly becomes a sauna. Great for cohesive sleep. Not. Tried to cash in those free 'breakfasts' given by the desk staff, looking forward to some nice eggs, bacon and pancakes - only to be told that my account was only allowed to have a cup of tea or coffee, a single pot of yoghurt and/or a piece of fruit... So, in short, I'd definitely not stay here again. The professionalism of some of the staff is questionable at best, and incompetent at worst.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, understaffed, shoe box rooms”
Reviews.Author: Youro-Star
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at many Westins, I decided to check out the hype of the "W" properties. While it certainly looked "cool" and the room had some cool amenities like an iPod dock, there was really nothing else to distinguish it from a run of the mill 2-3 star place. Certainly not worth the 4 star price. What particularly annoyed me was that I needed to wait for long periods every time I went to the front desk. There were never enough people working there, even at predictably busy times (like check-out). It's close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Fine except for the smoking!”
Reviews.Author: chikletqt
Reviews.Content: Our non-smoking room seemed to fill up with smoke every morning. I don't know if someone was smoking outside, in their room, or on another floor. We were told they could bring up an air cleaning system- but right when we were getting ready? It never smelled any other time but in the morning. They said they did allow smoking on certain floors- but not the floor we were on. The room was fine for NY standards, the bath was nice and modern/clean, the bedding was very nice- comfortable bed. No view, I believe we were on the 8th floor. Really did not like the bartender- she was totally rude. I did fill out a survey from starwood with the same comments and someone actually did contact me apologizing, but that was all. The location is so-so. I think next time I'll stay in a different part of NY.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: gerdest
Reviews.Content: I chose this property for a surprise engagement vacation and came away with a smile from ear to ear! In addition to booking a suite, I also purchased the "Tru Wuv" package. Included is a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and rose petals throughout the room. The team at the W were in constant communication with me (via text/email) so when I returned from proposing, the room would be ready and was it ever! Rose petals with the word "Congrats" had been laid out on the living room floor, a path from the entrance of the room to the bed was also laid out, a huge heart of rose petals was on our bed and another near the strawberries and champagne (which was on ice of course). In addition, the view was awesome and the hotel has a very welcoming vibe after being out in the city all day. I definitely recommend staying at this property whether it be for business or leisure. Special thanks to Renee for making it all happen!

Reviews.Title: “2 Year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Musikk
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel and Iâ€™m so glad that we were able to spend our 2nd year anniversary her at the W. From the moment we entered the hotel Yasmere at the front desk greeted us with a smile and made us feel more than welcome, she was wonderful. Our check-in process was smooth and quick. The lobby and rooms are really well presented, so there is a nice feeling of comfort from when you first arrive. The concierge was most helpful with must sees & helped us with reservations for shows, dinner and great shopping options. Lisa and Marco were very friendly and answered all our questions with enthusiasm. Their service is more than amazing: courteous, respectful, helpful and always there when we needed them. They are the BEST! Sharonette in housekeeping is a great person with a beautiful smile that makes you want to smile back at her. I first met her on Saturday morning because it was raining and we hung out in our room for most of the day. She asked us how we were doing and if we were pleased with the services we had been receiving. From that day on I looked forward to seeing her every morning just to see her smile and say good morning. It's not often that the housekeeping staff is friendly with the guest and inquire if they are enjoying their stay. Iâ€™m sorry to say the one service I was unable to take advantage of was the Bliss Spa. I visited your spa to schedule a massage but the 2 young ladies were rude from the moment I entered the spa. I had to practically pry every answer out of them regarding the services that they offered. Marco, Lisa, Yasmere and Sharonette did a great job of making our 2 year anniversary memorable- from the moment we arrived through check-in and all the way to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: msjnl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the W for a girls weekend in the city to celebrate my birthday. Overall, the W is in a great location and is a beautiful hotel. The Whiskey Blue bar is a fun night spot. I saw some reviews where people complained about how expensive the drinks are, but I think one needs to realize that this is NYC not the midwest. We had a Wonderful Room with twin beds, which was kind of small, but again, it's NYC. It was quiet though and you could barely hear the traffic. (We were on the 10th floor) My friend and I also went to the Bliss Spa, which is in the hotel. All I can say is "AMAZING!" The front door staff are very helpful and nice about getting cabs....even if it means standing in the pouring rain. One thing I was a little annoyed about was the wait time it took for our room to be ready. I had called ahead requesting an early check in and was told it would be noted in the system. The woman I spoke to said it would not be guaranteed. I was ok with that but hopeful we could be accomodated....especially since the hotel markets themselves as a place where they will bend over backwards to accomodate their guests. We arrived around 11AM and was told the room was not ready. The front desk did offer us a room with a queen size bed, but since there were two of us, we elected to keep our Wonderful room with twin beds. I was told they would call me when the room was ready. Again, no big deal because we had a day at the spa planned anyway and they stored our bags for us. We came back to the front desk around 2PM and was advised again how the room was not ready. Again....understandable considering the early check in wasn't guaranteed and and check in time was 3PM. I returned to the desk again at 3:15P and was told my room was ready. This time I was annoyed. I am a seasoned traveler and have never been told my room is not ready after the designated check in time. I advised the front desk person about how it was my third time asking and we need to room to change because we had plans. She called up to housekeeping, but did not seem all that concerned that 1) we had a deadline and 2) the guest was unhappy. She also expected me to wait in line again, which by the this time was out the door. I advised the girl that she had half an hour to get the room ready and also I was not standing in line. She did allow me to bypass the line to give me my keys when the room was finally ready.....after 4PM. Once we were in the room, we were getting settled and changed.....only to have the housekeeping supervisor barge in on us while yelling "Are you finished with this room? Are you in here?!" The woman was apologetic, but it was a little unnerving to suddenly have your room door fly open. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would probably stay again. I do hope they work on getting the rooms ready in a more timely manner or perhaps change the check in time for later.

Reviews.Title: “Getting on a bit”
Reviews.Author: tanseaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Hotel recently. Have to say that this hotel has really seen better days. It seems to be getting on a bit. Check-in was an absolute nightmare. A half-hour wait in a queue - apparently the new check-in system is very slow. Utterly ridiculous. Half those guests are never coming back. Service is pretty good and quite efficient. Staff are responsive and get the job done with a minimum of fuss. Free wifi in the lobby is a nice bonus. The rooms are clean, with a modern look, if a bit cramped - but that's NYC for you I suppose. Beds are very comfy. The location is top notch - right in the middle of Midtown and just a block from the nearest subway station. Most of the usual tourist shopping stops are within a 15 minute walk. This hotel was packed with guests when I was there - save time and use express checkout when you leave. You will appreciate it, and so will they. PS. The bar downstairs is pretty happening at night - not dead like most hotel bars. On the flip side, it's hard to get a table!

Reviews.Title: “W New York Hotel Clean, Convenient, and Great Location April 2011.”
Reviews.Author: azdesert2009
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the W New York on Lexington Ave. We stayed on the 12th floor. There was NO bed bug problem there, something I had been worried about. The room was small but comfortable as is typical of every stay I have had in New York. We had a queen size bed with down comforter, very comfortable, 37" flat screen TV, nice. Very modern, clean updated. Nice bathroom with a rain shower head. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I booked the room on Priceline, so I paid $150 per night. It is usually more expensive. My complaints about the hotel were the expensive room service, expensive restaurant, $17 for internet per day, parking almost $100 per day, and the bathroom door is a little weird. The door is made of thin white glass that slides but doesn't latch. Anything you are doing in the bathroom is known to anyone else in the room. All said though, it wasn't that bad. As far as my other complaints, I didn't bring my car. I went to the Starbucks around the corner for free internet. I went down the street to the drug store and bought some snacks and dry cereal really cheap and just paid them for coffee and yogurt at the breakfast bar of the hotel. Put the yogurt on the Cheerios and tada...breakfast. The excellent location makes up for the little problems, and there's always a way to deal with those things. I would stay there again. It is right behind the Waldorf Astoria on Lexington Ave. and down the street from the Chrysler Building. it's also only a few blocks to Rockefellar Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral and several subway lines. Down the street was a cafe called Raffles. It was very good food and not as pricey as many of the other restaurants in the area. Oh yeah, there is no refrigerator or coffee maker in the room. Don't dare touch the mini bar. If you even move something, they know it. It had sensors of some sort. Good Air Conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! The W was a great base to explore NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Jacmor63
Reviews.Content: Good sized room for NYC compared to our last year's one! What lovely interior design this hotel has - the lobby is lovely with some unique looking features (look up at the little bird mobile) with light projecting onto areas and fabulous little green touches - a staff member/gardener was tending branches of blossom tree which were displayed in vases on the windowsills of the louge/bar. The cocktail bar doubles as a breakfast bar in the morning where you can collect some items to eat there or take away. Incidentally don't worry about taking toiletries - the Bliss products are so lovely I was searching for where to buy the facewash when I got home! Hairdryer, iron, lovely big telly with lots of stations if you want to chill late evening or early morning! Go along the road and you will reach Grand Central Station (look at the glass and chandeliers and the marble - it's a lovely space); plenty of delis in the area to eat, a small McDs along the road, several small Starbucks in the area. Not too far to walk to find all the shops of 5th Avenue, the Rock, Chrysller Building, etc. If you turn right out the front door keep along Lexington and you will find yourself walking up the side of Central Park/Upper East side - look out for the posh little doggies going out for a walk with their little coats on! New York brings something new to discover every time you visit. If its your first time - probably all the tourist sites, tours, movie sites etc. Second time round we ventured on the subway (easy! and cheap!) and went to Chinatown, Chelsea, West Village, Seaport as well as all the Midtown sites and Central Park, the Times Warner centre (the basement deli is a must - collect and weigh your food then find a seat in the cafe and enjoy!). Oh, can't wait to go back and although we may try another area to stay in the next time (we stayed Midtown the first time and then the W this time), I'd have no hesitation in recommending the W. Staff worked very hard in the background to keep the place spotless and when we had occasion to ask for something (our wine glasses which were dirty had been removed but not replaced), there was a knock at the door in under 10 minutes with a selection of glasses. We bought our own wine and used the wine bucket and ice (available along the corridor) to enjoy a chilled glass after walking about all day! Enjoyed our break at the W. Well worth the price we paid. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pmac125
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of April. We asked for an upgrade as it was my 30th and although they were completely full that night, they upgraded us the following day to a slightly bigger room with views over Lexington. Lots of people bang on about the rooms being too small but we had no problems with the standard room on the 1st night...you only sleep there so whats the problem? Staff super helpful, my girlfriend loved the toiletries, we got some free cocktails and its great location for tourists. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Clanging pipes / Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: RWPD
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9pm. Went to my room to find it was tiny (I know, it is New York, but I expected more from the W). I opened the shades to find a sticker on the window with one of those pithy W hotel slogans, it said "Size isn't everything and to make up for the small size of the room, you get free Wi-Fi". Great, that's just what I wanted (not). After resigning myself to the small room on the 3rd floor, I ordered room service. It came quickly and the food was good. As I was eating, I heard what sounded like someone taking a hammer and hitting the water pipes (about 6 times). The noise went away and then returned 20 minutes later. I called the front desk and an engineer came promptly. It appears as if he was familiar with this problem and said he could fix it by running water through the main. This is annoying as it means the hotel knows this room sucks and would be impossible to sleep in. Anyhow, at 12:15 in the morning, the clanging returned and woke me from sleeping. I called the front desk again and they again offered to send the engineer. I demanded a different room and they moved me at 12:45. Needless to say, I wasn't bright eyed and bushy tailed for the next day's meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Top 5 hotels in NY”
Reviews.Author: cj234
Reviews.Content: I cant ask for anything more, i was upgraded and everyone in this hotel is nice to you. i think its a requirement that you have to be a great person to work at this hotel. people dont take advantage of the free hotel car and the other services that this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “I will always make this my first choice.”
Reviews.Author: migstown
Reviews.Content: The staff is great. Lounge very nice. Had alot of fun. Food was great. Bar was great. Excellent . Comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overbilled, Under serviced”
Reviews.Author: chrissa21
Reviews.Content: I've traveled extensively to NYC for several years- always staying at a Starwoods property. My client insisted on staying at this W. What a mess-- we were both highly disappointed, disgusted in the lack of service in the lobby and bar area, and they charges were embarssingly expensive. Two months later I am still getting miscellaneous charges-- now from the shipping department even though I brought my own label and tipped generously. Never will I stay at a W again. W = WORTHLESS

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Wexford_PA
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast, friendly and early. Room was comfy and clean. Folks in the front were very helpful. Cool water and apples in lobby were delightful. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury above the snowy streets”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in early February while in NYC on business. We lucked out because the corp travel agent tried to put us up at another hotel, but once I discovered that hotel was listed in the "NY Bed Bug Registry," we were able to convince the Finance Director to allow us at the W, instead. It was pricey, booking that late, and were it my own money, I'm not sure I could have afforded 2 nights there. I think we paid around $350/nt. I know, however, you can get better deals by booking in advance. At the time of booking, the hotel was very full (I think we were only booking about 5 - 6 days ahead) and the only rooms left were higher-priced. My confirmation said I had been booked into a "Queen Suite," but when I arrived in my room, it was really just a large room (there was no sofa or additional room). I am a Starwood Preferred Guest, however, so I was given a room on the 17th floor -- far above the crazy streets. The room was lush and modern and our my massive picture window, I actually had a view of the balcony of some glorious 2-story suite. As it was very snowy during my visit, no one was ever out on that balcony, however. The bathroom was large and perfectly outfitted with fluffy towels and bath mats, robe and Bliss products. My one complaint about the bathroom was the shower. The shower head was very nice and the quality of the actual water pressure and temp were wonderful, but due to the design of the shower stall, water goes EVERYWHERE all over the bathroom. I actually had to use both bathmats + an extra hand-towel along the edge of the shower in order to make sure pools of water didn't end up all over the bathroom floor (i.e. in front of the sink/vanity). This is a design flaw and should probably be figured out, since wet tile can be very slippery. The bed is out of this world. I have not had a night of sleep like that in years! The mattress itself is incredibly comfy and it's topped with a featherbed. The pillows are fluffy and squishy in the best possible way and you literally feel like you are sleeping in a cloud. I never wanted to leave that heavenly womb. The room was very quiet, despite being located near the elevator (which, honestly, I had specifically asked to be away from). I didn't partake of the bar or restaurant, so can't really comment on them (other than the massive amount of trendiness each one oozed). I was in NYC...why the heck would I stay IN the hotel for my drinking/eating pleasures? NYC has some of the best restaurants and bars in the world. You can literally walk, subway or cab to ANY of them within about 10 - 15 minutes. I would never "knock down" a hotel because of their bar or restaurant when in a city that offers the best-of-the-best, anyway. That's just silly. As an aside, someone mentioned this hotel being "downtown." It isn't. It's at 49th/Lex, which is midtown. "Downtown" is traditionally anything below 14th Street (or, maybe, you can stretch it to 23rd). Midtown is a lot more corporate office buildings and culture, so the amount of "hip" places to go are limited. That said, as mentioned previously, you are close to the subway and can usually get a cab just about anywhere. It's a quick trip downtown, if that's where you want to be. If you have the coin and need to stay in midtown, I cannot think of a better place than the W. Our flight was originally canceled out of NY due to a snowstorm, I was half-hoping we couldn't get on another one, so that I could stay one more night in my glorious room. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I'm too sexy for this hotel . . . .”
Reviews.Author: kajones_2000
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the lobby of the W, the first thing I thought of was that 90s song by Right Said Fred. This place was all about being trendy. You could barely hear the hotel staff over the pulsating sound of techno music coming from the lounge . . . similar music greeted you in the elevator . . . and your room. This hotel is much more about being a social spot than being an actual place of rest. When I wanted help with my luggage, a bellhop was nowhere to be found. The room service was terrible. Oh and the staff knocked on my door early the day of my exit to make sure I was leaving. Nice. The rooms were supersmall - reminded me of a rich kid's dorm room. But given that it's downtown NYC, that's to be expected. Overall it was comfortable enough. I was only there for a weekend, so I didn't mind, but definitely don't think it would've sufficed for a longer stay. Overall it was adequate, but not to place to go if you want a relaxing weekend. If you want to party? Definitely. Oh, I did enjoy the free Bliss products. So that was good. Despite my somewhat negative review, I would recommend this hotel. It is good for the money. You just have to no what you're getting yourself into.

Reviews.Title: “W was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: After my 3 night stay at the W New York, I have shared my wonderful experience with colleagues, friends and family members. The customer service was outstanding...from the reservationists to the housekeeping staff, everyone was a delight. Experience Manager, Nicole, went above and beyond meeting my needs and my favorite bellhop, Nam, was extremely helpful in directing me and assisting me whenever needed. The Acura Experience was also a great service. The hotel lives up to its reputation! Location offers easy access to Museumâ€™s, shopping and restaurants without being in the hustle and bustle of Time Square. I will make the W my first choice in all my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Staff = Snobby as hell”
Reviews.Author: Jane155033
Reviews.Content: Some of the staff were super sweet but the people at the check in desk were rude, lame and low energy. The bar was really cool- not for everyone though- seems to target the younger crowd. Wayy pverpriced. The room was so so tiny, and the view not all that great (the suite is a better option). One good thing about the W rooms= soundproof! And yes be careful with the mini-bar=they'll charge you! if you move anything. Location=excellent. but bring your own shampoo and conditonner + body cream cause their stuff smells like Mr. Clean (it;s lemon scented and smells ultra cheap).

Reviews.Title: “too noisy, too small”
Reviews.Author: NJ008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend. Rooms are tiny and bath rooms are so so. Dinner through room service was always too expensive and was not what I ordered. " whatever & whenever" service was wonderful. My room was on 14th floor but noise from the hallway and from out side the hotel woke me up several times during night and early in the morning. Next night I had to ask for ear plugs which helped.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Maxing-n-Relaxing
Reviews.Content: This hotel has high rates but it seems that what you are paying for is the privilege of being in a 'trendy' hotel. The first surprise was that there were no doormen present on arrival and so nobody to hold the door while bringing luggage in. Once inside, service was nothing special and not of the standard I would expect from a hotel of this price. I'm not sure if this is intentional and designed to be in keeping with being a 'cool' hotel and thus staff aiming to take a more relaxed and informal approach. The hotel was refurbished a couple of years ago so the furnishings are modern and the hotel is in good condition. However, the room was tiny and simply too small in my opinion (especially at the prices charged). There was barely room to walk around to the other side of the bed as the wall was so close. The wardrobe hardly had space for any clothes and the bathroom was also cramped. The lobby bar and 'Whiskey Blue' were quite busy and if being in a trendy location is of primary importance, this may hold some appeal (but in NYC there are many bars and clubs available rather than needing them in your own hotel). The final irritation was finding additional charges on my credit card after having checked out and settled my bill. On phoning the hotel they said they were charges for the minibar (which I hadn't used at all). As there was a sign next to the minibar cautioning that even a slight movement of items would be detected and automatically billed, I found it odd that this wouldn't have appeared on my bill at checkout if the items had supposedly been used prior to me leaving the room. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst AirCon System ever!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoGoGo123
Reviews.Content: We had a W suite which was much much bigger than we were expecting having read other reviews. Very pleased with the room however the bathroom was tiny. It was also so hot it was like being in a sauna. The air con system was so noisy and had steam coming out of it. We had to call an engineer to the room to sort it. He came very quickly and because of the noise we asked him to leave it turned off. The next day when we returned to the room it was back on. Again that night we needed another engineer to sort it out. It was louded than ever. With it off the room became very hot and stuffy hence my score for sleep quality. Great bar in the hotel. fab atmosphere and service. Hotel location perfect for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: AffairsinMiami
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the W for a work related event. The staff was great and friendly. I tested the Whatever you want whenever and they prooved to me it works. I asked for a phone charger, menus, extra towels... you name it (all within reason of course) and they delivered as promised. My room had a view to the city and the layout was very spacious. I was on the top floor and had a great view tot he Waldorf Astoria and far glimpses of central park! They got me reservations at a very popular restaurant (LAVO) and arranged the transportation I needed in a timely manner. On my last day of my trip it rained adn I asked to borrow an umbrella. Upon my return from a day out in the city, I asked if i could purchase the umbrella and was told I could keep it (thank goodness because i used it the rest of the day). The location is great and the service was ok. I am a bit spoiled and thought I would receive a bit more of a VIP treatment but overall i was happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fab Location, Funky Lobby Bar”
Reviews.Author: StonABen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 'W' for 4 nights in December for some pre Christmas shopping. The hotel is in a fantastic location, the breakfast was great, the lobby bar was brilliant, the rooms were nice! The only faults I could pick (if I needed to) were: * The lobby bar was quite busy with non-residents meaning 7-8pm when you had come back to the hotel and wanted a sit-down, you struggled to get a couch. * The bathrooms were a little small - as are a lot of New York Hotels. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NYC at its best”
Reviews.Author: NYCdudeInVa
Reviews.Content: Great staff, small room, high prices, BUT this is NYC and this IS a "boutique hotel." for what it is, it's great. If you can afford it, it's in line to what you are accustomed to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: luvlacandi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 5th anniversary. I couldn't have asked for more luxury! The hotel offers the whatever/whenever service and I highly recommend it!! You will not be disappointed. This was an excellent location and had many dining options. Also loved the bliss bath products. I can't say enough positive things about this hotel. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: clocky
Reviews.Content: It is close to everything. Easy access for walking just about anywhere. Very close to Central Park and just down from 5th Avenue. Room was very small considering what we paid. Not a cheap place to stay..... The restaurant was not worth it at all. Go out and eat, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service = an awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: juddlaw1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2/17/11. My wife was scheduled for delivery of of our baby the next day. Cindy at the front desk asked about our special day and put us in the most incredible room with a free standing tub inside the room/suite. Shortly after we checked in, we received a delivery of cupcakes and a cool book about pregnancy - talk about service! Cindy went byond and when we settled into our room after walking to dinner, we had a great night. My son entered the world in style the next day. Thanks W... Really nice time before our big day.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay86
Reviews.Content: After spending one night at another hotel (a block away) where we didn't have such a great experience, my daughter and I were both very much looking forward to our stay at the W Hotel. Upon check-in, although they were pretty busy processing check-outs (11 am), the front desk clerk was very friendly and upgraded our room to a 'Spectacular' room and allowed us to check in early (which the other hotel wanted to charge us $100 to do). I knew at that moment that our stay would be great at this hotel. We both loved the room and all it's little swanky features. Although I had read that the rooms were small, we were very happy to find that our room was a good size. The location is great, the staff was incredibly helpful and definitely went out of their way to make our stay nice. Our TV had 'no signal' (probably due to the rain) and I called down to report it and they had someone at our door within a few minutes. By that time, the TV had corrected itself but the maintenance person handed me some dollars that were crumpled up and said he found it outside my front door. WOW!! (It ended up being only $2 but still!). The one thing I would like others to know is that you need to be careful about touching anything in the mini-bar area..it's all on sensors and there were a few guests before me that had the charges put automatically on their bill. The front desk clerk was great about reversing the charges though for those customers. We will definitely be back to this and other W hotels. Thanks again for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, from the service to the food to the location”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here in February as a part of a group who was in town for a meeting. I had personally negotiated the rooms and while NYC is expensive and the W is no exception, this hotel has a great location in respect to our office and we didn't want to risk being farther away in winter. I didn't get to the hotel until past 3am due to delayed flight, but there was still someone to bring in my bag, check me in, etc, immediately. They didn't mention they had upgraded me to a mega room, but it was a pleasant surprise. There was also a message from the GM on the phone welcoming me, as well as a few amenities and a note. Very nice touches. The room was larger than I expected, thanks to the upgrade and was a solid size for the city. I'm never a huge fan of the W bathrooms as there's never much room to put your stuff, but this one was slightly better than normal. The soap tray in the shower never held anything though, anything i put there would immediately fall off. The shower was a bit awkward with just half of a door, but it worked out okay. The bed was very comfortable and the TV has a guide on it which I love compared to just having to scroll through. There are plenty of plugs near the bed which is always a plus and all the normal amenities like a safe, etc were there. They seem to always be doing road work in NYC at night, so bring your ear plugs no matter how high up you think you'll be staying. The heater in my room sounded like it was taking off when it started, but it seemed like just the first time was bad and then it wasn't so loud. The food from room service is always great at Ws and this was no exception. In fact, besides the room service I had once at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay, this is the best I've ever had for dinner. Miso Halibut with a side salad and a glass of wine, plus they give you bread and a chocolate. Don't get me wrong, $65 for this meal is beyond ridiculous and is it really necessary to have a delivery fee, processing fee, tax and 20%+ gratuity? There's no way I would have done it if I wasn't exhausted and at least had a per diem from my work. The next night I went to the bar with some colleagues and the drinks were good, but expensive, and the bar was definitely a happening spot. What I appreciate most about this stay is that everything was done exactly as quoted -- there were some rooms on our group that were supposed to be charged directly to the guest, internet was included, etc and everything came out exactly as it was agreed to (this seems simple but trust me, I've had horrible experiences elsewhere). As long as I get a deal, I'll stay at this hotel again because of it's proximity to my office.

Reviews.Title: “W= WONDERFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tsellinger
Reviews.Content: Delicious experience! This hotel offers an amazing location, fabulous service, hip rooms, BLISS products (yum), a rockin' bar, BLISS spa...wow, can I PLEASE live here???? We checked in and, without even asking, were upgraded to a gorgeous corner suite. A knock on our door announced the arrival of a complimentary fruit plate. We met a client in the lobby bar, and the experience of just hanging out there and chatting resulted in a much longer meeting than anticipated and an additional sale! Late night, we stopped into the Whiskey Bar and met an intelligent, charming group of people with whom we've already been in touch with regarding meeting up again. Honestly, I've never had such an uplifting experience at a hotel. W, I'm in love.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jesau123
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about the staff and facilities at The W. My husband and I stayed here, as did our 20's something daughter and we were joined by friends..destination was evening wedding in NY/NY. Prior to our visit the staff was amazingly helpful w/our planning. They pre arranged the free Acura car service that brought us all to Tribeca for the wedding.. in Style for sure. The February storms did not dampen the spirits of the door ambassadors, who helped us w/ luggage and our car despite the snow and slush. The cozy room was just perfect. OK , it's cozy for sure but hey it's NY and real estate is at a premium. The robes were scrumptious, the bliss products blissful. We especially appreciated the security within the hotel. Our daughter was out late with friends and we felt confident in the location and the safety in the lobby. The staff was gracious, helpful but observant in a safe way. Great breakfast. The lobby is aptly named, "The Living Room".. lounging with the Times in the AM with the fire crackling made it hard to leave. I would highly recommend this hotel to any size group, including families..

Reviews.Title: “Easy for business”
Reviews.Author: JDofWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there several times for business when coming to New York. Super mid-town location. Genuine and relaxed welcome with easy check in. Upgraded my room without asking and.is very much appreciated. Rooms are simple and easy and clean...perfect for in and out trips and the bed was super. Look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: So for $300 a night I'm staying in a tiny room with a view of the air conditioning unit? Please. My room was 45 degrees and it took an act of God to get the room in some kind of habitable condition. I'm not one of these touchy hotel guests, but this went beyone the pale. Sorry guys, next time I'm staying at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect is an understatement...”
Reviews.Author: metsguy
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that I have had some incredible travel experiences (as well as some awful experiences) in the past, and this is the first time I have been compelled to write a review... I wanted to throw my wife a surprise party for her 30th bday with a few of her closest friends that would be unforgettable... I am a pretty loyal SPG member so I was only looking at starwood properties in the city. After having a disastrous experiences with two other properties leading to canceled reservations 4 days before the party, I called the W on lexington. I had explained my frustration to the receptionist in regards to what had happened, and she put me in touch with Tim, who is in charge of rooms control. I explained to him what my situation was and that I wanted to book a suite on points with a possible upgrade which I was willing to pay for. Within 10 minutes, Tim had arranged for my suite with an upgrade that was perfect for an acceptable cost. The day before the party, Tim put me in contact with Renee, a W insider who was to help me coordinate my deliveries of flowers, food, etc... On the day of check in, I was in constant contact with Renee to ensure that everything went smoothly. There was a slight delay in check in time, and Renee graciously upgraded my upgrade to one of the most incredible rooms one could imagine... Additionally, she made sure that my stay was perfect, and made sure that my guests and I felt as if we were the most important people at the hotel. To top it off, she left an extremely nice gift for my wife on the day of our checkout. I cannot comment on the regular rooms, but the suite we had (the Wow suite) was absolutely incredible, the service was impeccable, and the guest relations were exactly what you would expect from this type of property. I cannot thank Tim and Renee for their help in making my wife's birthday a night to remember forever.

Reviews.Title: “No peril too small at W New York: provided you let them know!”
Reviews.Author: olindacat
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed in the W NY for a good year before last week. I arrived with my wife in our 'mainland' car as we own a home out in W. NJ. My back has been in disrepair as we had been doing some crazy chores at the house and I had tweaked it, not to mention recent surgery. As we drove up to the door, I got out an asked the bellman (aka 'ambassador') if he'd give me a hand with our baggage. He just stood there looking at me with his hands in his pockets, rocking on his feet! I was obviously feeling the pressure to move quickly, due to the midtown traffic, and as I strode toward the trunk to grab the bags myself I mumbled audibly 'I guess I'm on my own here....' Still no response! Another 'ambassador' was struggling with other bags but he came to help me after I hauled my bags to the revolving front door. When I checked in, I informed the manager on duty (aka 'coach') of the snub, and then we went to our room. It was 90 degrees in there and my wife couldn't for the life of us both get the thermostat to work. The phone rang but when we tried to answer it the handset wasn't working. I used the speakerphone to listed to the VM, which was the young 'coach' telling me the snub was because the ambassadors rotate customers to equitably balance out their tip money. Not what I wanted to hear. Engineering came to fix the phone first. The first 'engineer' couldn't get it to work and aid he needed to replace all the room' base units. Okay, I thought. Before he came back another engineer came to look at the units again. He did something and they started to work. The previous engineer solved the heat issue by opening our bedroom window, fully. I think good help is ust hard to find :-) The second one couldn't fix it either. I sent an email to yet another 'coach' expressing my feelings about the ambassador situation. I called again to express my feelings about the thermostat/window situation not being a good long-term fix. Now, I jockey between several hotel loyalty programs. I think Starwood's Platinum membership is one of the best. I almost always get an upgrade to a suite. So, inasmuch as I sound like I'm down on this property, I'm not! Before we went to the lobby for a drink, the Whatever/Whenever person I was talking with had sent us a bottle of wine and cheese as an amenity. How wonderful! Then, when we decided the room too hot, we headed down to the lobby where we were intercepted by the second 'coach' who game me a luxurious soaking bath product from the Bliss spa for my back! To boot, the manager moved us out of our already upgraded suit and into an 'Extreme Wow Suite'! He must've noticed I had a next-day reservation for W Union Sq. (I was headed to CT and unsure I'd be able to get back to city so planed to check out-in and wanted to see the Union Sq. Hotel while i was here anyway.) But it was such a big upgrade and he offered to let us continue on in that lovely room for two more days, so we agreed! I looked up the rate for that room and it is $3400 a night with taxes! We were paying about $220! Now that's what I call a to-notched crisis management solution if I ever saw one! Many hotels will just put some dummy on the phone with a scripted response to virtually anything. Not W NY. This property, and I'd have to say almost all Ws in general, are continuously on top of the changing winds of hospitality. They didn't have to what they did, but they went ahead and threw the kitchen sink at our problems and for that gesture, they deserve kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing location, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: dce19
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the W during our recent trip to New York city. All of the staff - from the concierge, to the front desk, to the housekeeping staff - were so friendly and accommodating. The lounge was great and the hotel itself was spotlessly clean. The location of the W was perfect, only two short blocks from the subway. After staying at the W myself, I can't believe some of the negative comments posted on this site. Yes the rooms are small, but it's New York city! I have been to NYC many times and have yet to find a room one might consider "large". We also had free wifi in our room and in the lobby. One note - don't touch anything on the mini-bar counter area - it's motion activated, so you will get charged. Overall, I totally recommend the W at Lexington and 49th. Great showers with a really nice spa-line of body products too. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Well Designed Room”
Reviews.Author: Fafolguy
Reviews.Content: First of all I feel that I should mention that I got this place for $80 a night on Priceline. That said, I thought the W was AWESOME. I was in a "Cozy" room which is small, yes, but I have stayed in smaller and paid much more for the experience. From the moment I approached the front desk the hotel staff were all very pleasant and went out of their way to make me feel welcomed. Maintenance crews in the hallways called elevators and let me take the ones they had been waiting for. Every person I encountered seemed really happy to do whatever they could to make my stay enjoyable. The location was great as well. Midtown east, with a nice walk down to Grand Central, or a short block up to the closer station if the wind was blowing too hard! Always plenty of cabs available on Lexington and waiting at the hotel. Getting around was never a problem at all. So yeah the room is kind of small, but it has enough room for 2 people and a large suitcase. I enjoy the Bliss bathroom products, and being in the cozy room got me free internet access for doing research for my trip as well as extra starwood points. When I travel to NYC, I am not there for what's inside the hotel...it's NYC for crying out loud! The design of the room felt cool and chic. Friends have all been extremely jealous when I show them the pictures. In short, I loved this place and felt like a rock star when staying here, and I will deifinately be looking into staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a W...”
Reviews.Author: Yainey
Reviews.Content: Ok, the good news: no bed bugs, no signs of bed bugs- yes I checked. Clean enough. To the comment that the rooms are small, that is fair, but its NY. I was so excited to finally stay at a W as I've wanted to for some time, but I have to say the details simply didn't live up to expecations. My biggest complaint was the bathroom- it was just kind of grungy, not neccessarily unsanitary- but for example, there were smudges of something on the wall, the door didn't close exactly right. There was not one place in the entire bathroom/ hotel room that I could plug a hair dryer and straightening iron in in front of a mirror. I guess it's the little things- and the W is the kind of place I expect to get this right. The lighting was HORRENDOUS...there was no "practical" option anywhere in that room. The TV wasf finicky. The front desk staff were ok, but not great. The valets were amazing. In summary, of all my stays in NY, I had the highest hopes for this hotel, but it was easily the biggest dissapointment. I'd take the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central any day over this, if you are looking for a sort of fun, modern and convenient midtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LowaChap
Reviews.Content: We really liked our room. Great size for New York. Had the Mega Suite. Location was great close to Time Square, 5th Avenue and subway. The stay was so nice and great during our big snow storm. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lgelkins
Reviews.Content: The basic king room at this hotel is mini. Probably the smallest I've seen in NYC. However, my friends and I were moved to a double room with two beds, which was considerably larger, although not huge. Beds: very comfortable and plenty of pillows. Bathroom: small with basic fixtures; loved the Bliss toiletries. The sliding opaque glass door was annoying because it never quite shut all the way and was a bit noisy. Hotel: stylishly modern decor, with a fun lobby/bar area. The whole decor is very dark, including the hallways. Staff very attentive, although the night concierge woman was barely helpful when trying to find out how to get a DVD for the in-room DVD player. We did not eat here and would have loved to use the adjoining Bliss spa, but didn't have time. The location is great, but I probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: KELMUR
Reviews.Content: I typically do not write reviews but I do read them prior to booking any trip. I like to know what to expect. As I read the reviews I didn't think it would be any different than any of the other hotels we have stayed at in NYC. Well just to let everyone one prior to booking the "COZY" room, you walk in theres a small bathroom to the side as you enter and then a bed that takes up the rest of the room. My husband and I were on a one night getaway and we were bumping into each other immediately after walking in the door. Reading the reviews on how small it is does not even give you the visual of what it really is. The service was great! Immediately we called the front desk and were immediately upgraded to the "Spectacular" room. It was much better than the first room, but still quite small in comparison to normal rooms. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful for our short stay. It was conforting to know that there was security there when we arrived at 1 am and we had to show our room key to even get to the elevators. Once there we needed the key to get to our floor in the elevator. Another main thing to keep in mind is the $65 parking fee, but I guess thats to be expected in NYC for an overnight stay. I would definitely

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but no 4 star”
Reviews.Author: TheMomCrowd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the W Hotel for our babymoon in NYC.Â This place is adequate if you just want a place to crash in midtown. I would NOT expect a 4 star experience.Â  We booked this hotel through Priceline for $100 a night. They offered us a queen room upon arrival. Being 8 months pregnant I wanted more space and a King was an extra $45 a night, so we took it. The front desk man even mentioned that the room was a bigger than the queen room. We went up to the room with high hopes, but even after an upgrade the room was still tiny! I can't imagine how super tiny a queen room would have been.Â  We left the next day at 10:00 a.m. and by 6:00 p.m. our room was NEVER cleaned. We asked the front desk for it to be cleaned when we left at 7:30 pm. We came back around 1:00 a.m. and it still wasn't cleaned. Thankfully we had hung up our towels so we could reuse them. We had already started 1 towel down, because when we arrived one towel had lipstick all over it.Â  We asked for a late check out at 2:00 pm. We got back to our room at 1:50 to get our one carry-on out of the room. Our keys didn't work and we had to go back down to the front desk to activate our card. When we got back our room was finally clean - 10 minutes before we were leaving. Thanks for nothing.Â  Pro:Â  Close location to #6 metro lineÂ  Provided Bliss soaps are nice Large flat screen TV The valet guy flagging down taxis for you is helpful Cons: Front desk does not follow through with your requests An almost non-existent maid service Expensive Wi-Fi at $17 a day Tiny rooms Bad lighting Bed was too fluffy for our taste iPod speakers did not work The water carafe in lobby is never refilledÂ  This hotel lacks an attention to detail and serviceÂ

Reviews.Title: “This is like my second home”
Reviews.Author: Vivaladiva1
Reviews.Content: Most times I travel to NYC (which is weekly) I usually try to stay here. They staff is so nice to me. Always greeting me, handing me free fiji water from the conceriege desk when they see me stumbling in drunk, and I almost ALWAYS get a suite upgrade. This particular stay I had a great suite with a balcony. The lobby is always jumping with people and a dj. But when I go to my room, it silent. Now I'm a city girl, so the lexington street noise I natural tune out. Its a great location, not far from trains, the acura car service comes in handy, and the best part of staying here is that if i party the night before or work really late, no one comes knocking on my door 15 times, to see if checked out yet! They ALWAYS respect my 4pm checkout. When I come to check in they always remember me and what I wore the last time. Its nice and I feel like I'm at home. I even wrote an email to the manager (which I NEVER do). If you are a regular traveler to NYC and hate times squares bright lights and tourist, this is your hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing less than perfect”
Reviews.Author: Carmencita410
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W multiple times both in the New York area as well as in other locations. My stay at this W property was one of my best experiences ever. The check-in staff was so gracious. The living room area was beautifully decorated, and if you have the chance to relax there, I highly recommend sampling the bar's Sexy Fries. As for the rooms, my friends and I stayed in two suites. Both were gorgeously appointed. When we needed extra linens and towels, they were brought to us within 30 minutes. I could go on and on, but suffice it to say that if you do not enjoy a stay at this property, you are really missing out!

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill bad...”
Reviews.Author: CPAMonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be so nice! Wow, this was a bad experience. I booked a room at the W on Valentine's Day. First, I was supposed to have a large room with a queen size bed - instead I have a tiny, dark room facing the wall of another building. There is a sticker on the wall saying "Is the room too small? Call this number for 500 starwood points." I didn't want starwood points, I wanted a large room! Anyway - next problem - the bathroom was FILTHY. The floor tiles were brown with dirt and the grout was moldy. The shower didn't drain properly, and as a result, there was a puddle of dirty water remaining from the previous guest on the shower floor. And, the glasses were dirty and looked like they had not been washed properly. GROSS!! Well, finally, after all that I decided to go downstairs for breakfast. What a disaster - the hostess was confused, not a single table was clean and ready for customers, and the food took almost an hour to arrive. In the meantime, nobody came to apologize or explain where our food was. It was just dropped in front of us like a sack of potatos.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined New York for me”
Reviews.Author: lovecities89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2010, was really looking forward to my stay as id heard alot and read alot about this hotel!.....Firstly our flight landed at 6.30am...so when we booked this hotel in May we requested an early check in..we were told it was not gaurenteed...fair enough...so when we arrived at the hotel at 7.20 we were told our room wouldnt be ready untill 11.00 and told there was no other rooms available...so we waited(very very tired) in the hotel lobby ....11.10 we asked if it was ready we were told no, 11.45 asked again and the lady at the desk said "oh its been ready for hours"....i was soooo tired i just took the key and went up to my room no complaining....they gave us a room with the freezing air con on full blast and it would turn off...after 4 calls to front desk for help they finally sent a man up to try and fix it...which he didnt...after another 2 calls to the desk they gave us another room "no problem we can get you another room we are very quiet at the moment"the lady at the desk said...yet they kept us waiting in the lobby for nearly 5 hours....Anyway with that over the location was very good...the few more encounters we had with the staff were terrible, they are very stuck up unhelpfull and i felt because of my age (im 21) they just couldnt be bothered me..huffing when ever i asked for travelers cheques to be changed up......on our last night about 12.10am a very large group of teenagers checked in on our floor excitedly running and shouting between rooms we rang front desk and they said they would ask them to quiet down....they didnt....Alll in all was a horrific hotel too worried about looking "hip" and "cool" than looking after their guests...before we arrived in New York we had stayed at Vegas The Bellagio and LA The Beverly Hilton which were a total differnt class to this dump

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Scot1082
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the W in June for holiday with friends, stayed in a Mega room and was fantastic, the hotel was lovely and clean and experienced some great staff. The Whisky Blu is a great end to the night, one night we watched a single bar tender serving a full bar with no problems. The room was great, lovely and spacious with an excellent seating area to relax, the bathroom was huge. Had a lovely welcome gift from the GM, Mr Maynard wich was also lovely. Location is great, 10 mins from Times Square and a nice walk down 5th Ave to Central Park, I am returning again to celebrate New Years Eve and can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kennethsoh
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite midtown hotel. Great location. Hip vibe. Super service

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was only $90/night on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: mekmkf
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing, if i had been one of these other people that paid like $240 a night for the W experience, I would be pissed. However, I am priceline fanatic and after 4 days of trying got this weekend experience for 90/night plus tax. Woohoo. Pros: Near the 6 train (easy block away). Comfy beds, good shower head, functional staff, nice tv in the room & dvd player Cons: Really small rooms - think europe tiny, bathroom could have been cleaner AND bigger, sink didnt drain well, walls were a little thin. Have you ever been to IKEA and seen those "life in 250 square feet" displays? this was like that only no kitchen attempt. However, if you are like us and don't come to nyc to lounge in your hotel room but just need a place where you can get a good night's sleep, then it's fine - just don't pay too much for it.

Reviews.Title: “TV did not work, moved to another room next day, tv also did not work, lighting poor, second room dingy, dent in wall...not lik”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not comfortable recommending it. Good news- no bed bugs and staff always courteous and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpark10
Reviews.Content: Got the room on priceline dirt cheap, for about half the going rate. If I had paid the full price I would have been disappointed, since the rooms are tiny though. Rooms are clean, and the hotel has a great lounge. Really awesome location in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Please DONT.”
Reviews.Author: KizoLove
Reviews.Content: This review is coming a bit late. I stayed at the W New York October 2010 for about 4 nights in one of the Suites. I did not want to stay at this hotel but a friend had already booked his room via expedia because it was on sale, and I had no choice but to follow suit. I knew the rooms were going to be tiny so we opted for a suite. My friend had the "wonderful" room, and they barely had space for their luggage. It was TINY. Our room in terms of space was fine (because it was a suite). But, the rest of the amenities were just ridiculous. The bathroom mirrors were too high (i'm 5'3) and I could only see my eyes. And to think we had called in advance to verify this as judging from the pictures taken here on tripadvisor, I thought it would be too high. The lady we spoke too said it was actually abnormally low (she said she was also 5'3 and could see her whole waist)-- i think they were actually referring to a disabled room come to think of it. The room lighting was too dark which made applying make up and fixing my hair an obstacle. Btw, I had to use the mirror next to the bed to get ready, which meant plugging and unplugging the phone. Plus their bathrooms had a really annoying sliding door that if left slightly ajar, the cold air would quickly seep in and you would actually freeze in the shower, since the shower lacked a shower door/curtain/whatever-- only a tiny glass partition to keep the water spraying out of the shower stall (see: PICTURES). I thought that the hotel was trying too hard to be trendy that they actually ignored the most basic necessities (like mirrors and lighting!!). We had the same elevator key card problem as mentioned in the reviews here. But we didnt have any problems getting it fixed at reception. Service was not great. Getting out of the cab with my luggage, i had to go inside and ask for someone to help me. We also had to call several times for the espresso machine to be brought up. but we shouldn't have even bothered because the mugs they provide are actually not compatible with the machine (the machine would work if it felt the weight of the mug in place-- but the mug was too big and it basically didnt fit).. and when we found a way to make it work using our hands to press on the machine for the 'weight to be right', the coffee tasted like crap.. haha! it was pretty funny actually, but what a major failure. Location: nothing great for shopping or dining. although maybe about 15 minutes to an h&m store. But on the positive side, the beds were very comfortable and the air-conditioning worked very well. But all in all, I dont think I would be back in this hotel even if they went on sale on expedia. definitely not worth the $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WasagaBeachPlayers
Reviews.Content: In New York for business and in classic W style, excellent service, affordable price, stylish company.

Reviews.Title: “The brand is strong with this one.”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay in a W hotel, but my lack of spare $100 bills has precluded me from doing so. The solution? Priceline! For $89 (on a Saturday night, even!) I got my room in the W New York. And I really have no complaints -- this was a very nice hotel room. Even though the hotel gave me a "complimentary upgrade" upon arrival, the upgrade was really just from their smallest room ("Cozy", 180 sq. feet) to their second-smallest room ("Wonderful", 200 sq. feet). The work space for the Wonderful room on their website is defined as "daring". I dared to plug my laptop in and had a hard time because the desk is so close to the wall. A minor nitpick that was overcome by the presence of four available outlets and extremely effective wi-fi ($15). The room itself wasn't exactly large, but the layout was superb and everything was functional. Bed was very comfortable. Flat-screen TV was either not HD or didn't have HD programming available. Doormen and staff were very helpful, even if the whole "We make wishes come true!" motif was a little much. Room service prices were a little absurd, even for a hotel in New York -- their equivalent to a grand slam (oh, hangover) cost $22 w/ a $5 delivery fee, enforced gratuity, and NY sales tax pushing it to $34 or so. Minibar can of soda was $5.50. Late checkout was provided with no qualms. So while I'm guessing there are better W hotels available in the world (including, probably, in New York), this was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smartflyer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good location. Very small rooms. I have stayed at the Hilton and Sheraton on west side and they both had much bigger rooms. I was traveling alone but I think the rooms are too small if you have more than one person.

Reviews.Title: “W Midtown New York - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: IrmaInUptown
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, Ian MacLean (a Starwood Member), and I spent the days after Christmas Holiday and New Year's at the Midtown New York W. My boyfriend and I stayed at the W New York during the Great Blizzard of December 2010. We booked our trip as a stop over on our way to Miami but then the blizzard moved through and we were "stuck" in New York. Initially we were dissappointed that we couldn't leave New York, but it turned out to be a great vacation thanks to Mr. McDonald and the staff's hospitality. The lobby bar staff were friendly and great conversationalists. The bellhops helped each day with our shopping bags or random requests and the concierge helped us find intersting local food spots. In addition, despite the blizzard madness, Mr. McDonald (a manager) handled our upgrade request promptly and effectively. We're looking forward to visiting again soon

Reviews.Title: “While in a great location this hotel's service is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: sakcm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in many New York City hotels and we chose the W because we had heard good things about it and it offered a good location. Upon check in the lack of service was evident. There was no one available to help with bags and lead us to the room. As we opened the door to our king room we were shocked at the small size of it. Only one person could be in the bathroom at a time, the bath had no room to stretch out your legs, the room was dark and offered very little lighting, and the bed took up the entire floor space. In the morning there were very few staff around to say good morning or to ask questions of. Upon leaving we made our way down to the lobby carrying 3 large bags and it was evident we were struggling to open the door to get outside, three staff were standing at the concierge desk and none of them came over to offer help or even hold the door. This hotel is clearly for the younger, party crowd and was a huge disappointment to us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: comfortstyle
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant about making a reservation at this hotel because of some of the other reviews, but we were very pleasantly surprised. We had a wonderful time at the W Times Square . Our room was beautiful and it looked like it had just been renovated! The little chocolates that were left in the room everyday was a very nice touch, along with the note from the General Manager on our first day. We also noticed that we never hear the housekeeping staff, but the rooms are always clean. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel were very accommodating and we felt like they genuinely cared about the quality of our stay. There was one staff member in particular who helped to make our stay extra memorable. Gil (I think one of the security staff?) was especially helpful and went out of his way to make our stay more special. We felt like VIPs in the hotel and also that we had a friend who would take care of us. We've stayed in many W's over the years now and the service in general is very good, but the service at this location was outstanding! We couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the service was just ok and the rooms were falling apart.”
Reviews.Author: semichee
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here the first week of January while my dad had surgery at the Sloan-Kettering Memorial Hospital as SKM has a complimentary and convenient shuttle between 53rd and 3rd and the main hospital. The location is also within 2 blocks of 3 different Starbucks and a big variety of quick lunch spots as well as nice sit down restaurants. However, the hotel itself doesn't have a restaurant, just a breakfast place. From the moment we stepped out of our car, the service staff let us down. My mom and I had to unload our bags on our own, stack them and make our way through the multiple doors into the hotel lobby. There was no one outside to help us so that a random bystander helped hold the doors for us. We then proceeded to make our way across the lobby when finally a bell hop greeted us with an apology. At this point, we didn't let this bother us and moved on. We checked in without a hassle and our room was ready early. As we got into our room, things started to go downhill. We wanted to make some hot tea so we tried to call down for mugs but the phone wasn't working. I headed down the elevator to the lobby and brought this up with the people there. They apologized, placed our mug order and said someone would be up to fix the phone. About half an hour later, someone did show up. The engineer looked at the phone and said it's not programmed and that he would go find us another phone and replace it. We waited around for 20 minutes and then we had to go as we had to meet my dad as he was getting out of recovery. We didn't get back to our room until about midnight as we had to eat a late dinner. When we got to our room, the phone was still not working. We noticed it was chilly so we upped the heat from 72 to 74, but 10 minutes later it was still chilly so we upped it to 76 and then realized the heater was blowing cold air! In the mean time, we started washing up for bed and realized that some of the towels had dark stains on them. They were washed but the stains were set and just looked unpleasant. As it was late and we were both tired, we decided to just crash for the night and deal with stuff the next day. When we tried to lift up the window shades in the morning, they kept getting stuck. At this point, I was pretty furious. We chose to pay extra to stay in a nice hotel so that we wouldn't have to deal with this sort of crap yet here we are!! When I went downstairs to complain they said they could move us to another room in the afternoon. They apologized and offered to do the move for us but as we were already unpacked, we didn't want them touching our personal items. So in the late afternoon, we had to come back from the hospital to the hotel just to pack up and move for one more night. The new room we got was better but the heating unit was still loud and the sink was leaking some dark liquid by one of the handles that turns the water on. Overall, it was a total disappointment and I'm definitely not staying there again. But what really took me aback was the fact that when I wrote a letter to the GM after they gave us a letter stating that if our hotel stay was anything less than a 10, to let him know personally, all we got was a sorry and thank you for letting us know. I would think they could at least invite us back to any W hotel for a complimentary drink!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip but not friendly”
Reviews.Author: karawebster
Reviews.Content: I love the W's. This one is great too....however the rooms are ultra small...not a big deal...it's NYC. However, the hotel lobby turns into a bar at night. I was there on a Thursday and Friday and both nights were full and loud. It's a fun crowd...however here are the drawbacks. 1. The bar tenders are very surly. None of them will wait on you, and when they do, they aren't happy or friendly. I found this on both nights...might be they are understaffed, or just plain grumpy. 2. While the loud scene is fun, it is nice to go around the corner in the lobby, where the restaurant is...it is quiet and nice when you want to have a conversation, however, again the bar tender;s are unhappy...And the bar closes at 10:30...even on Friday. So, so much for that night cap in the lobby. Don't go here to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danceluver25
Reviews.Content: I prefer Starwood hotels and chose this hotel for its proximately to my office (midtown). I now stay at this hotel every time I'm in New York. While the rooms are small, this isn't anything atypical for New York hotels. The rooms are modern - flat screen tv, central heat/air, modern shower and vanity. The beds are just WONDERFUL - I have seriously considered purchasing the entire bed and sheets/comforter (yes, you CAN do this). The BEST part about this hotel (and all W Hotels) is the Whatever/Whenever team. It is a customized concierge team dedicated to whatever/whenever. No joke. I had forgotten some items in my luggage, and the whatever/whenever team was able to bring it up within 15 minutes. While they do what a standard concierge takes care of, this is a team of people just eager to please. The hotels has also paired up with Acura and many now provide free transportation (within a designated area and reservations required) in a luxury Acura SVU. There is a lobby bar and a DJ always plays music. Plus the BlissSpa is located on the premise! But just a note, if you're looking for stuffy and quiet ...the Waldorf is down the street.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed with Lisa the concerge!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeyBrumm
Reviews.Content: While my husband worked, I was able to come along & enjoy New York for a couple days! At the W NY Hotel I found Lisa the concierge so helpful!! I wanted to take the train to China Town for Dim Sum & then shop in SOHO. She gave me directions & went out of her way to explain how to take the train! I got back without a problem (this is probably funny to local people, but we're from Seattle). I went back to see her again for a dinner reservation & she recommended" Luna" an Italian restaurant. Our dinner was great & was all we had hoped for! I want to thank Lisa for all of her assistance in making our trip easy & fun!!! Zoey Brumm, Zo Hair Salon & SOZO Hair Studio, Kirkland, WA.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay, but memorable”
Reviews.Author: Ardjuna
Reviews.Content: It was unplanned stay, since we had a cancelled flight to Orlando on Dec.27 due to snowstorm in NY. So, we need a hotel to stay in until we get a confirmed flight to Orlando. I remember that late night, I called a number that I got from Google (or from my GPS), and spoke to a very interesting guy (who was in California - can't remember his name) who guiding me for a reservation to your hotel (I was at McDonald at Manhattan at that time, homeless, with my family..) The guy was very helpful and welcome, guiding me for room reservation, and finally confirm my stay in the hotel. Then, finally I drove to Lexington, and entering your hotel around 2 AM in the morning.. Still got a very warm welcome from the staff, and after waiting a while for room preparation, we entered the room, and had a good sleep... The hotel has very nice interior and ambience and style.. I like it very much, also clean and fresh. Finally, we stayed 3 nights there, and flew to Orlando Dec 31 after got confirmed flight. Incidently, I found out that W New York is cool and interesting!.. Also with nice surrounding areas, which could reach within walk distance..

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled me rotten.”
Reviews.Author: LauraDelhomme
Reviews.Content: I had a WONDERFUL stay at the W New York. While my significant other and I always enjoy our stays at W hotels, this one stood out. Here's why: -On the trip there, I lost my wallet on the train (silly!). The girl at the desk was extremely helpful, terribly consoling, offered to call Amtrak, offered to arrange us transportation to go retrieve the wallet, brought us water. I wish I could remember her name, because she (and the rest of the staff) was fantastic. -The 'whatever whenever' program was quite a delight! The strawberries and bubbly I'd arranged before the trip were a delightful surprise to my boyfriend, and the timing was perfect. -The morning of our departure, I couldn't sleep, wanted to read, but didn't want to turn on the light, so I went down to the lobby. Soothing music, unlimited coffee, friendly staff - all at 4am! They were in 'great service mode' even during the wee hours. We will absolutely be staying here again. Thank you for a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wallet stolen from room while I slept there, management poor”
Reviews.Author: rick79m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W in November 2010. firstly they put me in a room where the heater kept making a hissing noise, took a while to get my room changed but did eventually. Fell asleep jet lagged one afternoon and woke up to an employee in my room. SHot up in bed and he looked surprised and stammered "sorry, i was just checking the tea" then he goes to the mini bar apologising throughout while I felt very bewildered just watching from the bed. he leaves and apologises again, and I go back to sleep thinking it weird. I wake up that night and go to get my wallet to buy dinner but my wallet wasnt there. I had it when i was dropped off at the hotel (tipped the driver) so i didnt lose it. All of my other stuff was on the table - blackberry, laptop etc. The wallet had about $200 in it and Â£10. Told management and they initiated an investigation. This was fri night but they werent able to speak to the employee until tuesday as he wasnt on shift and wouldnt answer his phone. management get back to me on wednesday and say that the employee was very upfront and admitted to being in the room (against policy to be in the room while a guest is asleep - imagine if i were a female - i would feel a lot more vulnerable) but that he didnt see me in the bed - which is impossible. When you first enter you see a wall and you turn left and the first thing you see is the bed. They said that he had been working there for 10 years and they trusted him. I replied if he had been working there for 10 years you would think he would have the experience to tell the difference between someone in bed or not.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee-ward
Reviews.Content: I travelled with 5 friends and we stayed for 4 nights here. We had 2 rooms on different floors and the hotel was amazing. We stayed when it was very cold but that didn't bother us!! The rooms were really warm and snug and the beds were amazingly comfortable. The showers worked wonderfully and every day after a walk around the city, it was always a treat to come back here and rest for a little while. The only thing that spoiled it for me was the air conditioning in the bed room. It was very loud one night and I went down to the reception and told them that it sounded like it was going to break and they did send someone up the next day to have a look at it. But that was it, everything else was spot on!!

Reviews.Title: “hmm. hotel nice, staff poor”
Reviews.Author: lucidwayn
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there over NYE, the hotel room was nice but can't say the same for the staff. Not sure why they have to be so rude and unfriendly.
