Wasn't asking for much, just the simple things like; - not to double charge me for the room on my bill - address my query when i'm standing at the counter rather than talking to each other - give me useful information at the concierge desk - actually be friendly rather than a snob. I didn't realize that so many other people have complained about the same thing till I looked it up here. I would probably stay somewhere else. We just travelled from Colorado and stayed in a vail resort hotel where the staff were great. That's why we noticed that the guys at the W were so poor. Oh yeah even the bell boys were hopeless, we ended up having to lug our own bags up and down to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Firepot
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the W Hotel at 541 Lexington Ave on January 01, 2011. It was the worst treatment I have ever gotten from any hotel I have stayed at. I have been to Italy and Isreal where I do not speak the language and have gotten better treatment. The font desk guy was very rude and throughout our stay he make it a point to let us know that we were not welcome as we book this hotel through priceline..mind you I payed two hundred dollar and change per night and it was not worth at all. Next time I will stay at the Four Season or The Mark where I know I will get a better treatment. We went to the font desk with a few questions and as soon as he saw us he would pick the phone up so he would not have to deal with us. I have taken the W hotel off my company list as an hotel to stay at and I have informed my friend and family never to stay at the W Hotel. People, I have never written a review before and my family and I travel at least three times per year, so please believe me when I say stay somewhere else. AB

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate New York holiday experience”
Reviews.Author: pamelagrace76
Reviews.Content: I know it was a Miracle on 34th Street, but our holiday stay can be best described as a Miracle on 49th street. We had an amazing experience staying at the W this holiday 12/22-12/30. In particular, Tim McDonald, Fatima Fidan and Anubha Choudrie went out of their way to make sure our stay was a memorable one. Their thoughtfulness and incredible customer service is why this will always be where I stay when I come to Manhattan - be it for work or personal. I travel about twice a month for work, so I am very particular on the hotels I will and won't stay in, because life is too short for bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service made our get-away stay that much more enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: LRRed
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked into the hotel, we experienced staff that were fully committed to making our stay in New York City very enjoyable and relaxing. The bellmen, the front desk employees, the breakfast bar staff and event the housekeeper in the hallway! Top quality employees in a top quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Exceptional Service!!”
Reviews.Author: sharkman22
Reviews.Content: Great Stay in the Best city in the World! Exceptional service and your staff is great! Will def stay there again in the future! Big thumbs up to Nicole Fondry!! Sweet, professional, and very helpful during our stay! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “The only upscale hotel in new york city. Wow experience”
Reviews.Author: Westondrive
Reviews.Content: The title sums it up. Simply stated - The W New York is by far the only hotel we stay at when visiting the city for new years eve party. Y you can stay at other properties but if you are a starwwod platinum member then the benefits are outstanding. We used all points and got the 5th night free, suite upgrade at no charge, excellent service and staff and not to mention a sweet lobby and whiskey blue nightclub. Enough said. Stay there and then write your own wonderful trip advisor review.

Reviews.Title: “I love NY and the W New York”
Reviews.Author: hanna3
Reviews.Content: First time in NY and I loved it. Great hotel with excellent service on all levels. Special thanks to Marco, concierge, who helped us with the best advices of restaurants and clubs in NY. We will defenitly come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's nice”
Reviews.Author: rmendell7244
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay. Its not my favorite location, but nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I've had in Manhattan -- unexpectedly”
Reviews.Author: muddyholly
Reviews.Content: I was in town for one night on Monday, 11/29, for a quick meeting at the hotel on Tuesday morning. The hotel staff provided the BEST service I have ever had in any hotel, including some very swanky 5-stars. I was completely delighted by the experience. The hotel was very busy, but every single employee I interacted with was cheerful and went the extra mile to be helpful to me, even though I asked a lot of your services. I had a huge delivery of packages that had to come up to my room to be assembled then taken down for the meeting the next day and the bellmen were extremely helpful and resourceful. The concierge staff, the front desk staff, the banquet staff all were simply wonderful. You have a marvelous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Extended due to the snow!”
Reviews.Author: Indianajones465
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the W on Lexington Avenue on the 17th December for a 3 night stay and were not dissapointed. I had emailed in advance to ask for a nice view if possible as it was both mine and my husbands birthdays, we were nicely greeted on arrival and told of complimentary breakfast in the room on the morning of our birthdays which was a very nice surprise. We had a very enjoyable stay, the Cosy room was very small however clean and well done so did not feel cramped. On the 20th we were told our return flight was cancelled due to snow in London and the next available flight would be the 26th December!! Very sad that we would miss Christmas with our family back in the UK we called to extend our stay however the best available rates were almost double what we had initially paid per night, however we were told the website offered lower rates and indeed it did, almost 50% less than the rate given over the phone (thank goodness for the iPad!). We extended our reservation online, and were given a complimentary upgrade at the desk as we were there for an additional 5 days (we did have to ask for it). We then spoke with the very helpful concierge team who reccomended some ideas for Christmas day and booked everything for us. We had a very comfortable stay, the upgraded room was a lot more comfortable and the daily bliss products were a very nice touch, the only let down was that all of the rooms overlook each other so you have to be careful and always close the curtains which many of our neighbours had not realised! On the 26th, we were advised of yet another cancellation this time due to the Snow in New York, what a nightmare! Again we extended our stay and was told we could keep the upgraded room. We checked out on the 27th to face yet more cancellations and delays at the airport and finally arrived home on the 28th December, a very long and expensive weekend break in New York. The W on Lexington Avenue certainly helped to make our extended stay more comfortable. We did have to ask for certain things like the larger room or WI-FI password which under our difficult circumstances it would have been nice if they had acertained our needs such as offering say $20 of complimentary laundry as we had run out of clothes, but as I also work in hotels maybe I see things slightly differently. The lobby bar was very comfortable and the Whiskey Blue bar were both very nice serving up some delicious cocktails. In summary the staff were very helpful, the hotel was very comfortable and the location was great, within walking distance of most major attractions. I would definetely stay in another W around the World and reccomend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Team is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: mossman73
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler who comes to the W New York almost weekly. I wanted to call out this end of year comment to thank thank the front desk worker Emily for her attention to detail this year. For someone who travels to the W almost 90-100 nights a year I have to say the likes of Emily have really made the travel easy to handle and making sure things are right every time. It is my hope that you as a property continue to train and build team players like Emily. Thanks for a great 2010, and looking forward to 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Staff service made this stay unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the mixed reviews about this hotel which gave me an idea of what to expect. We had reserved a wonderful room for 6 nights over christmas and from the moment we arrived, none of the staff made any effort to make us feel welcome. Upon check in, the woman on reception was very abrupt with us. Throughout our stay, anytime we rang for in room dining, no one answered, same with front desk or the concierge. It just was like no one was working. We eventually learnt that to get a hold of anyone, ring the whatever whenever service and they would assist us. One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was because it included a continental breakfast daily for 2 which not many other hotels in NYC offers. What't the point??? The continental breakfast is served at the bar where there is hardly any room to sit. The food selection was very basic. On our last day, as we had done for the last 5 morning my partner got her coffee and confirmed our room number with the attendant while i got my juice and walked off (as there was no room to sit), I was told I was stealing. I couldn't believe it but the juice wasn't even included in the continental breakfast, it was an extra charge. It turns our hardly anything is included in the 'continental' breakfast. Just coffee apparantly. W offers a complimentary car ride for its guests so we decided to make use of it one morning only to be told they don't start until 10am. Yes - rooms are small but I feel the designers have made good use of the space but what lets this hotel down is its service. I know many have said that the staff is the best thing about this hotel but maybe they weren't working when I was here? There are many other hotels in New York which are cheaper and better than this place. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ncguys
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the W on Lexington just before Christmas and had a terrific experience. We had a 6 am flight up on a Sunday morning and no rooms were available when we checked in. They said they'd call when one got ready and they did a few hours later! We were Priceline customers and they treated us very well including finding us a room with a king. Very, very pleasant desk clerks, bellman and pretty much everyone we interacted with. Small room but well appointed. While I've been in larger rooms in NY perhaps the complaining about the room size is from people not familiar with NY hotel rooms. We usually like to stay on the West Side but found the location of the W quite interesting with a short walk to restaurants where the locals eat including the best bagels in town at Ess-a-Bagel and New York Luncheonette right around the corner. Checked out, as usual, from the TV in the room. No problem at all. I'd be happy to stay here again if I'm that lucky!

Reviews.Title: “Great location very poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Perrault29
Reviews.Content: We stayer there on December 26 and really liked the location. Other than that pretty much nothing good to say. Staff had the poorest attitude, Check-in was a nightmare, check-out not much better... Would only stay there again for a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but Exceeds the Expected”
Reviews.Author: mollydotcom
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few W's and have liked them all in terms of modern, trendy decor and full service. W hotels in general have a good (if expensive) reputation, so value for money is really a difficult measure in that context. So while high charges for in-room Internet, mini-bar items, room service and generally everything else are a given, it is the experience that really became the lasting measure of this hotel's quality. I arrived almost 24 hours late due to an unexpected snow and ice storm in Denver. When I arrived, I was exhausted but had an event I had to dress for and get to in less than an hour. I said as much in casual chatter to the very pleasant young woman checking me in, and she made sure I got right into my room and had everything I needed, including having a car waiting for me to take me to the event. On such limited notice in New York City, that was so helpful. The room I originally had was a Queen, and while the room was small, that's to be expected in a NYC hotel. The decor and layout of the room was smart, fashionable and very cozy, with luxurious down and high quality cotton linens on the bed, a comfortable work chair with desk, and a bath/shower combo. It was quiet and I was able to sleep very well as I was also at the end of a corridor and away from the elevators. I had been so tired upon arrival that I forgot I actually should have asked for a two-bedded room as my friend was going to meet me for a girl's weekend after the conference concluded. I called in a bit of a panic the day she was to arrive and even though the hotel was quite full, they found me a room with two twins, had staff go in and move my luggage from room to room and made the room generally welcoming so when my friend arrived, it was just like I'd never forgotten to get the right kind of room! The folks at the W are smooth. They go the distance and get the job done, and done well. When those lovely down comforters began to cause a serious allergic rash in my friend (who always forgets she's allergic to down until she has a reaction) we called housekeeping and they had three people up to remake her bed with hypoallergic bedding, and apologizing for it too. W's in general must have an excellent staff-training program. Staff members at this particular W really went the distance to make what was a bit of a haphazard time for me a lot easier, for which I'm grateful. Regular travelers know how important it is to have that extra hand from time to time, so thank you W for extending it with a level of consideration that exceeds the expected.

Reviews.Title: “great localisation”
Reviews.Author: TomekS
Reviews.Content: Situated at Times Square, hard to beat the localization! Rooms and nice and modern, there is free wireless internet in the lobby, concierge service is very convenient, u can leave your luggage after u check out what is really great! Very nice beauty products in rooms .Great for business and short family gateways. i recommend to book online earlier . although its on the times square its very quiet and calm. great deisgn and furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Style, Great Music, Prescient Service”
Reviews.Author: zenodux
Reviews.Content: This trip centered around the Thanksgiving Day parade and also included Cirque du Soleil's Wintuk at the Madison Square Garden and American Idiot at the St. Jimmy on Broadway. The W's location was close to all the attractions we came for, while being nicely tucked away in a less frenetic locale. From the moment that we arrived to the moment we left, the service was prescient. We arrived by car, and though things were busy, we were immediately greeted by one of the bellhops (Nam?) who with a smile orchestrated a spot for us curbside by helping a cab that was trying to leave. He asked us about our trip as he loaded our luggage onto the cart and came with us into the hotel. Our car was whisked away to the W's parking facilities. We arrived around 10:30am, wanting to enjoy the city to the fullest. Being Starwood Preferred Guest Gold members, we were treated to a huge upgrade from our Cozy Room to a Marvelous Suite. When we first arrived, Mario advised us that a suite would be available at 3pm, should we wish to upgrade. For us, this presented no difficulty, since we had much to do around town. A bellhop stored our luggage for us and we were on our way to take a bite out of the Big Apple. Upon our return around 3pm, Cindy C. pleasantly and deftly handled our check-in. Our suite was not quite ready, so to ease the wait she treated us to a handful of vouchers for Oasis, the lounge bar serving the Living Room. Lounging on a comfy sofa in the Living Room after walking around town felt great. Alana took our drink orders sofa-side, returning to mix our complimentary drinks before our eyes with studied skill. A fruit and cheese plate meshed nicely with our drinks. Whenever we needed something Alana was there - a recurring theme for every visit to Oasis. Next, we stepped over to Cindy at the front desk, where we found she had upgraded us to a Marvelous Suite with private terrace since the other suite was still unavailable. The room lived up to its name. Spacious, and modernly styled, full of light, and sporting panoramic views of the city, the room felt like a home away from home. Even the standard amenities had visual appeal, from an interesting swiveling dual level glass-topped desk with Brazo LED work light, to a whimsical fuchsia cutout light fixture in the living room, to the wobbly chess set. The bathroom sported a separate shower and bath, as well as neat textured wallpaper rising from a handsome slate tile floor. One of my favorite W perks is the iPod dock and radio combo next to the bed. No need to worry about charging adapters or audio cables: I just plop in my iPhone and the room fills with my music, making the room truly mine. Everywhere in the hotel, there are trays of green granny smith apples available for consumption - in our room they added a splash of color to the glass dining table in the living room. Healthy and visually striking - awesome. Surrounding three sides of our suite, our terrace offered an open sort of privacy with great views and plenty of seating areas - definitely a space that begs for an after-party. The living room was also quite spacious and offered plenty of seating options, from sofas and ottomans to dining table chairs to the work chair by the desk. As we settled in, Cindy called to ask how we liked the suite - to which our reply was, â€œmarvelous - thanks!â€� We also spent some time in the Living Room at different times during our stay. There was always a refreshing playlist on at a comfortable volume, conspiring with the comfortable, eclectic mix of sofas and chairs, Oasis, and other guests to make the Living Room a pleasant time warp. There were one or two non-waiting staff members who kept watch over the Living Room guests to make sure absolutely nothing fell through the cracks. Everywhere there was something of interest to look at. There were art installations hanging from the ceiling. Abstract images and videos were projected onto some of the walls. Columns were draped in loosely pleated fabric and lit from inside, yielding a modern neoclassical look. The bathrooms on the second floor were also quite a visual treat, wrapped in stone. Vibrant green wheatgrass in stone-gray planters throughout the hotel look quite striking, while keeping the air fresh. The Living Room looks out onto 49th street through a kaleidoscope of randomly-shaped stained glass sections and clear sections, giving guests inside privacy while still offering a voyeuristic view of the street. While at Oasis, do try the sexy fries - they are drizzled with truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan cheese. The pizza looked good too, but I didnâ€™t get a chance to try it. The coffee martini was tasty, as were the kobe sliders. One morning, while having breakfast in the Living Room, I forgot my sunglasses on a table. By the time I remembered, we were already at the Thanksgiving Day Parade. I called the W to let them know what had happened. When we got back, I went to the concierge desk to fetch my sunglasses; the concierge told me to speak with the W security team member a few steps behind me near the reception desk. As I walked towards him, he held out my sunglasses to me. I was surprised and delighted. That was fast! It also gave me a great sense of security. Losing my sunglasses could have tainted my holiday - instead, I felt taken care of, safe. After that, I began to take notice of and appreciate the security personnel. At night, in addition to the usual requirement of an active keycard to use the lifts, security in the lobby makes sure only guests and their guests have access to the non-public areas of the hotel. There is also security posted around the Living Room and everywhere in the lobby. They scope out who brings what. A security team member discreetly looked at my laptop bag and SLR bag when I took them into the Living Room one night; Iâ€™m fairly certain no one but me would have been able to leave with that gear. I love that. That level of safety left me very relaxed and happy. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™m alone, either. Observe the sea of Macbook Pros in the Living Room on any given weekday afternoon. Our stay was excellent. We loved the modern style and great service, and we felt right at home, thanks to the friendly staff. Every time we left or arrived, Cindy or another staff member would greet us. We are already planning our next stay at the W New York, sometime in mid-January. It will be nice to see familiar faces.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This is another hotel I have stayed at dozens of times on various business trips and I do get a great corporate rate here that makes it very attractive for me despite it's flaws. Regarding the hotel itself the rooms are generally very small but I have to say functional and the beds are extremely comfortable. Internet access is ok but expensive though is free for status guest. I have the highest level of status with starwood hotels which generally allows you to be upgraded to a suite but have only managed this once. But the suite I had was very nice and spacious and a nice change from the usual "cozy" cabin. The service leaves a lot to be desired. This whole "Whatever/Whenever" thing doesn't work here as the phrase seems to suggest they will go all out but in general any requests to the staff here at either met with a frown, disdain or just take long to action. The staff definitely have a great superiority complex starting right at the doormen who seem more focused on whatever good looking women are hanging around the lobby. And that brings me to Whiskey and the internal bar. Well they were kind of cool for a drink a while back but are now full of people who think they are trendy and are clearly not and/or shall we say ladies who like to look good and collect money for it. So frankly these days these are spots I just avoid. Still at sub $200 a night if you can get it it's good value, but at the typical public rates of $4-600 a night there are far better places to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnnyechoecho
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel - fantastic staff ! I saw on two occasions the desk staff have to deal with some irrate customers in the most professional way. The staff are a credit to the company. I would have given the two numpties a slap for the way that they were talking to the staff and yet the staff kept their cool and tried to help. We found the other guests to be friendly, although clearly much wealthier than us, and the ambience of the building very warm. Don`t be put off by the `nightclub` stylings mentioned in other reviews - they were much more subtle than we expected and the lounge area was particularly pleasent. The bar was well staffed, (special mention to the evening queen, Tracy for conversation and style), the concept of `service` made us feel like royalty. If NYC wasn`t so interesting, we would`ve happily had stayed inside the hotel for our complete holiday! I wish I could afford to stay there everyday! The double bedroom was easily ample for a couple and extremely well appointed. The massive telly only let us down when trying to get some english news. Obviously the internet would`ve helped, but I didn`t take a laptop with me, so no fault of the hotel. The only ...and I mean only, slight niggle was to do with the card opperated lifts. We had some real trouble getting them to notice we`d stuck our cards in and often had to get other guests to help us out. Its only a small thing and to be honest not really worth worrying about. Go there - its great!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mmontecalvo
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a superb weekend at the W New York (Lexington Ave.). The exceptional customer service provided by Neptaly E. in particular helped make the weekend both enjoyable and memorable. We love the W New York and stay at the 541 Lexington Ave. hotel every chance we can. We used to stay at a variety of hotels, but with Neptaly at the W New York, now we only stay there. â€”Pat & Maureen S., Providence, RI

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: bm25
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip to NYC and opted to stay at the W New York because we have had such great experiences at other W hotels in DC, Atlanta, Dallas, even Hoboken, NJ. Unfortunately, the W New York did not live up to our expectations. First of all, I knew the rooms would be smaller, and yes, I chose to stay in one of the smaller rooms because I figured we wouldn't be spending all of our time in there anyway, but WOW. It was the size of a gerbil cage! We were literally stumbling all over each other and our luggage just to get from one side of the room to the other. And the bathroom! That was the size of a cage within a gerbil cage. There was no room for our toiletries and one of us would have to walk out sideways if we were both in there at the same time. I am petite and my husband is of average height, so we couldn't even imagine how an above average height/weight couple could have settled in comfortably. Fine, we forgave the small room because, after all, we were in Manhattan where space is limited. Maybe all could be cleared away by amazing service? Not really. On the last day we decided to store our luggage for a few hours until our flight later that evening. We asked the woman at the concierge where we could go to do this and she directed us to a small area between the concierge desk and check-in desk. The lobby seemed busy that morning, so we had no problem waiting for someone to help us. As we were standing, the woman from the concierge desk came into the lobby and started chatting with another hotel employee in front of us. After we had been waiting for about 15 minutes, the woman looked over at us and asked if we had been helped. Well, no, we were clearly still standing with three bags. So, THEN she decided that she could stow our bags for us. If she was able to do it all along, why didn't she help us in the first place instead of chumming it up with her pal? It was very bizarre. The close proximity to Grand Central Station and the swanky downstairs lounge are really the biggest perks of this hotel. I feel that for the price we paid, we should have skipped the W and stayed somewhere with a little less name recognition and a bit more space. It was really nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “W Talent”
Reviews.Author: JimNewport
Reviews.Content: W Talent is Wonderful! LaMika Hughes and Cindy Alverez are top notch at every level. If you need something, ask. We stay once or month or so for business and pleasure. The two reasons are LaMika and Cindy.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in the world, Never Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mohitnow
Reviews.Content: This was my worst hotel room experience ever. The check in-time was about 30mins and then we got a room size little bigger than a match box. The room was facing the street and we had a sleepless night due to traffic. Next day the room was not changed till 8pm and we had to sit in the bar cause our promised room was not ready. The new room the heating was broken and we had two absolutely freezing nights. The last night the hotel delivered a crummy room heater to help (Picture attached). The room sign was falling apart and taped to the Wall!! (picture attached). The concierge booked us in a comedy club for paid tickets, where on a basic online search we found free tickets!! As a cherry on the cake we left our luggage at the concierge and they nearly lost the luggage! in a nutshell a horrible horrible experience. I have no idea what other people fouind nice at the hotel. It is Crap!!

Reviews.Title: “If your a Hobbit traveling to NYC then this hotel is just your size”
Reviews.Author: billCarmel_NewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend, and have stayed at W's all over the country, and we were shocked. The room was tiny,,and i mean tiny, now we live,and work in ny and have lived in nyc, and we were shocked at the size. The room would be perfect for a hobbit since the queen bed was actually only a double size bed, don't bring more than one luggage because there is no room for more than that. the rooms are hot and stuffy and the heating/ac system would not cool the room. the bathroom was tiny and cramped. now we had friends also staying at the same hotel and their room had the same problems. The staff was excellent, which was the only good thing that could be said. I would not advise anyone other than a hobbit to stay there. They actually post a sign in the bathroom saying something like does size matter, we know its a small room but it comes with big perks, that every room comes with a laptop with free wifi,,,but the laptop is a slow as a desk top from the early 90's with dial up access, and thats when it wasn't crashing. And the room did have a nice flat screen but it was mounted to a pole in the corner by the bed where to get to the other side of the bed you had lean over since the tv was in the way or you'd hit it. just bad size,layout, and thought process in the design.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding & Professional Service”
Reviews.Author: Wineguy1911
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the W New York (Lexington Ave) for your next visit to the Big Apple. W Hotels always have a stylish, contemporary vibe and great energy. My recent stay was highlighted by the outstanding service I received from the concierge (Lisa B). She was very personable and full of knowledge/suggestions. Her service and attention alone made my quick trip memorable. Also, the service at Whiskey Blue and the lobby bar was great. The drinks at Whiskey Blue were made to perfection and not overly priced. If your coming to the W New York be sure to stop by the Concierge desk and ask for Ms. Lisa B.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dolphins10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Lexington in New York City. The experience was absolutely amazing and the staff did a fantastic job in accommodating my requests. I informed the staff that I was planning a proposal and they worked diligently to ensure my stay was memorable. We were upgraded to a marvelous suite and needless to say the room was perfect. I travel for 80% of my job and I have never been catered to like I was during my stay at the W. Thank you for everything!! In particular, I worked with Teresa who heped me coordinate my plans. She was great!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a prime location, with friendly professional staff and beds that are very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: flojo021
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel Lexington for 10 days from 3rd December 2010. On arrival after a long flight we were met by Gloria on reception and Tori who did everything in their power to make us welcome and give every assistance. We would also like to mention Patrick (concierge) this man knows everything and gives great customer service. Mary the maid did her level best to maintain some order in our room after our shopping expeditions. Overall this hotel rates very high from the day we arrived to the day we left. We would definitely stay again and would recommend to all. We did follow tripadvisor to ascertain the overall experience of others for this hotel, however we did not experience any of the negative reviews posted by others.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: VladimirMw
Reviews.Content: Room is too small, but that is okeyish. Interior nice and stylish, location is great and bar is good. The gym is pretty ok. Real problem is that room noisy, you hear people in corridor, the aircon makes real noise and wakes you up. Service is also pretty poor. For the price, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great 'modern' approach to a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathleenm_10
Reviews.Content: I loved almost everything about this hotel! The room was innovative, with the swiveling desk. The oversize shower was outstanding. The staff was helpful and attentive. In the elevator lobby they change the 'Welcome' mats three times a day. I did not like that I had to pay for wi-fi in my room, when it was free in the bar/lounge. While I understand that the techno music was part of the ambiance, it was loud and annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy was perfect”
Reviews.Author: HappyDay55
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the W's "cozy room(s)." It was the perfect size for one. Plenty of room and very efficiently design. Bathroom as well. Staff was friendly and helpful across the board. Delicious breakfast in the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “W stays for Weak”
Reviews.Author: hjps
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend in NYC to celebrate our wedding anniversary. A friend suggested the W Hotel on Lexington. We won't be staying there again. The rooms are TINY and the bathrooms are even tinier and nothing special. Our two suitcases were always in the way because there was no where to put them due to the small size of the room. Our 9th floor room view was of a parking garage and a brick wall. I could live with the view because we didn't spent much time in our room however the service wasn't very good. While we were given free internet access in our room, according to the front desk, it was spotty and didn't work well. The telephone in our room didn't work the entire weekend, even after stopping at the front desk at 9am on Saturday morning to ask them to have someone look at it. So if you wanted to contact the front desk or room service, etc. you couldn't. Check-out time is 12pm. It was raining hard so we were sitting in the front lobby lounge and wanted something to drink, like a coke. The bar attached to the lounge wasn't open yet and there was no where in the hotel to get a simple coke. Hello, ever hear of a vending machine? The hotel lobby was generally very noisy with loud music coming from the adjoining lobby lounge/bar. You are not walking into a relaxing oasis when you come in from the street--it was like walking into a dance club. I'm really glad we didn't pay the full room rate for the room because it wasn't even worth the reduced rate. We will be returning to NYC but not to the W Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: gordongecko
Reviews.Content: Dissapointing Yes the location of this hotel is good, opposite the Wardorf Astoria on Lexington but the praise stops there. The lobby is always busy, with people milling around and music playing, the hotel tries hard to be hip and trendy in line with the corporate image of the W hotels. My main complaint was the room. I know it's NY and most rooms are small but this was really tiny, basically a glorified box with not enough room to even swing a cat. It was so small the bathroom did not even have a proper door but rather a sliding frosted glass door which did not even close properly. If your loved one/partner is in the room they can hear everything since they will be sat on the bed about 3ft away, so dont stay here if on a romantic break! Also the room was dirty, there was loads of dust on the "mini bar" area (basically some stuff left on the side) which had obviously not been cleaned in weeks and also wasnt for the 3 days we were there. Also there were various stains in the bathroom around the floor and on the walls and some hairs that did not belong to us. Will not be staying here again, this is one to avoid

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Better off at a camp site”
Reviews.Author: jk5817
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely expensive hotel with poor service and tiny rooms. The staff is completely disinterested. There was one overwhelmed person at the concierge desk. If you call the concierge desk you get voice mail.No offer to call you back. Problems with internet access? You call for help and get an 800 number somewhere else.The rooms were tiny with disgusting bathrooms. I am shocked that people would pay this amount of money to stay at this hotel. Fortunately we had a wonderful weekend in NY and only in the hotel for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service (thank you Cindy)”
Reviews.Author: Kamran123
Reviews.Content: I stay at the W hotels all over the USA but when I come to the city(nyc) I only will stay at the W on Lexington from now on. I was checked in by a amazing person this time (Cindy A.) she made the stay ten times better. I had a group of 4 friends and 3 rooms she got them all next to each other and we booked one room without a double and she made it happen. Our rooms were not ready so instead of telling us to just wait she gave us drink coupons and upgraded one room (I am a Starwood platinum member) to a suite so we could hang out there while the others got ready. She called to confirm all was good and made sure our stay was awesome. I am not use to this type of service in NYC but Cindy has amazed me. Looking forward to my next stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “If only we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: seekerofnewplaces
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a trip! The sad thing was that we could only stay for one night. We stayed here to celebrate my sister's birthday. The rooms we had were chic, modern and well thought out. Colors were purple, brown grey light tones. Very comfy bed. Not very big but it didn't bother us as we were rarely in the room. NYC just has too much to offer to stay in the room! Concierge Chris was so helpful and thoughtful. He made our stay so very pleasant! He recommended the perfect restaurant for our celebration. We had drinks in the lobby bar which were busy but we could find a seat. Great for conversation. Whiskey Blue was great for music and drinks. The bar was bouncing til wee hours in the morning. Great location right by the 6 local and E train to take us to the west side if needed. Walking distance to Rockefeller and 5th Ave. Had a most memorable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, W Group keep getting stronger”
Reviews.Author: marksw
Reviews.Content: I may be slightly Biased as i am really enjoying the W hotels recently, they are very cool and seem to get everything i want in a hotel right.. W New York.. I stayed at the Times Square one in 2005 and on my latest trip it was coming up WAY more expensive, so i opted for this one, and was glad i did.. Hotel feels fresh and new, even though it's been around for a while, it's opposite the Waldorf Astoria, a piece of classic NY history, Bar is cool.. (the club in all fairness looked dire) We had a WOW room, which had a view of the air-conditioning units, i complained, all of a sudden we had a nice suite.. 8 windows, two aspects.. lounge bedroom bathroom, all amazing. Beds as with all W's were fantastic, nice sheets, clean and decent pillows. This hotel is a lot more soundproof than the W-Times Square. Other good points.. Concierge helpful Umbrellas when it rained Great location Free ride in the Acura range (bit of a sales pitch but we took ours to the very tip of manhattan to go to the statue of liberty) Use of Bliss Spa on checkout day, wish i'd used it every day, steam showers!! Two Starbucks within 100ft, if like me you begrudge paying $30 each for breakfast at a hotel and instead want your coffee and muffin served by an impatient corporate clone then it's perfect! Security blocking the lifts in the evening and requesting room cards for access, and lifts need a valid room card for floor access, VERY reassuring, nice touch.. My only real complaint.. and it's an easy one to fix.. every day without fail the hallways were a homage to days of student living.. TRAYS EVERYWHERE.. every day.. i actually cleared up one day, piled everything in front of the lifts, this is the sort of tactic i used to have to employ to get my sister to wash up when she was 15, for a hotel this is poor.. hourly floor checks can't be that hard. Oh.. and who charges $20 a day for wifi in your room when it's free in the lobby? get a grip, it's either free or it costs, make a choice.

Reviews.Title: “magical break in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lucyfromlondon
Reviews.Content: after the surprise of a lifetime - my boyfriend flew out to the states where I was working to propose to me - he then made the moment more perfect by taking me to NYC for 3 nights to celebrate! He had booked us into a king sized room with a corner view. It was amazing. We arrived at the hotel - which is impeccably clean, and incredibly cool - and upon telling the staff our news, they couldnt be more excited. they gave us a room on the 37th floor with dreamy views of Manhattan. The room was a good space, with a King Bed and a beautiful bathroom with lots of Bliss products (always a bonus). 5 minutes after arriving in the room we received champagne and chocolates from reception. What more could we ask! Plus due to the room being on a high floor it was incredibly quiet despite being in the heart of Times Square. I found all the staff incredibly courteous, helpful and FUN. Would recommend in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: topssuf
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows NYC is expensive and that the hotel rooms are tiny. What we particularly disliked about the W on Lex/49th: - the dim lighting, everywhere! - the TERRIBLE attitude and rude behaviour of the server at the breakfast bar (we were unsure of exactly how she found our conversation, "Hello, may I please have a strawberry yoghurt and a plain bagel?" offensive, but she sure seemed to) - the precious, precious space in our tiny room being wasted with "stylish" clutter - the fact that we didn't understand the naming system because they employ heavy euphemism and we used a travel agent to book. We would have booked a better room if we had known that the "Wonderful" room that appeared on our itinerary was not very wonderful. We find it easier when words like "standard" or "suite" are employed as room descriptors, but I know that's very uncool - the obscene charges for wifi in the room - the obscenely un-green wastage of packaging at the breakfast bar - cardboard trays, coffee cups... we were not taking out, why not use plates? What we liked: - room service was tasty - reception were friendly - good gym In all, this is a hotel for people who are about 5'2" tall and can see in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: OliaRussianLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week there for Thanksgiving .I bid for this hotel on one of the website and got a really great deal! otherwise, we wouldn't pay for it full asking priuce. As we are members of this chain we were upgraded to even better room. we stayed on the 27th floor. it was a really quite room although i couldn't switch off the conditioner which interrupted my sleep! Also, i can asure that there were no bed bugs in our room! The location is really good and close to everything. The staff is very helpfull as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: dyong
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Priceline and after reading the reviews, were worried about the size of the rooms. Yes, they are tiny and by far the smallest room of any hotel we've stayed in during our several previous trips to NY. We also stayed at the HI Midtown during this trip which seemed 50% larger. We only brought two mid size suitcases and barely had the space to conveniently access them. If you have a large suitcase(s), good luck, it ain't fitting. On the positive side, the front staff was wonderful and were kind enough to give us an early check in after flying to NY on a red eye. The room itself was nicely appointed, IPOD stereo, flat screen tv, swing out writing desk,and a large walk in shower, although the water pressure seemed low even on jet setting. Didn't have too much problems with the low lighting as our room had a large window with plenty of natural lighting. Location is great, close to shops on Madison and 5th ave and theaters on Broadway. Easy get to from JFK on the E train. Cons beside the small size rooms, was the crazy, pressure triggered snack tray which sat atop the small dresser. I can see this device easily triggering room charges, if you close the drawers too hard. And $16.95 a day for internet? All in all, a nice hotel, but probably wouldn't stay here if I had to pay rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: daisyIreland
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in Oct. We had booked a Fantastic Suite after reading reviews and felt that we would need an extra bit of space as cosy rooms seemed very small. Also, we were away for only 4 nights and wanted a bit of luxury. First of all the positives: 1. Hotel in a very good location and could walk to alot of places 2. Beds were one of the nicest I have ever slept in and rooms was very quiet for New York 3. Bathroom very small but had a nice, powerful, hot shower. Now the rest: The Fantastic Suite we had booked, on the website promised "large windows framing breathtaking city views" and " Skyscraper View". Our room was on the 6th floor and looked onto a dirty rooftop and was overlooked by other rooms. There were no large windows in the room. While I appreciate that rooms are different and depend on location in the building I feel that if it is stated on the website that the room we booked had "large windows framing breathtaking city views" we should of been given a room with that. We did not take this up with the hotel at the time because we were only in New York for a short time and not prepared to spend time trying to change room and have the hassle of all that, although I did email the hotel on my return and got no satisfaction from them and this is why I am writting this review. I feel they should make some sort of gesture, even extra starwoods points to make up for this as I feel they did not provide the room they had promised. One other issue we had was that on the morning of check out, while we were trying to pack and getorganised, we had at least 2 seperate housekeeping staff calling to the room to enquire as to when we were leaving, all this before 12 o'clock, which is checkout time. After staying in this hotel I was disappointed with what we received for the money we spent and I feel there is better value out there. I will continue to stay in other Starwoods hotels but will be giving this W a miss next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good W option, but not quite what I had hoped”
Reviews.Author: sambieni
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night just before the holidays w/ my wife as we needed a hotel before leaving NYC for the holiday. The check-in was a breeze. The room was good, but not great. Lighting a bit off. Bed comfy as always. Great TV. But i hated that my view at the foot of the bed was the minibar/snack area "beckoning" me to just spend money. I didn't, but it felt a bit over too much. Shower was great. But strangely they had almost no bath products for us and had to request extras, plus more towels. No biggie. Overall the hotel was fine, but service wasa bit to be desired. It took us forever to hail a cab on checkout and only aftre I approached them myself and ignored the "help" of the W employee trying to hail us one but kept passing on so many. The breakfast bar was good, but WAY overpriced too. Would stay again if need be, but wasn't quite as sexy or fun or vibey as other W's i have stayed at w/ the service taboot.

Reviews.Title: “W New York stand out for all other hotels in NYC”
Reviews.Author: brandyb34
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends recently stayed at W NY and I just want to share with everyone that THE COSTUMER SERVICE AND THE STAFF stands out from all other hotels in NYC. Exceptional costumer service, everyone seems so helpful and happy to be there. Special thanks to Sami and Cindy. We will return again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: spnyctraveller
Reviews.Content: Very good stay. SPG Upgrade given without any hassle. Room size is on par with NYC standards. Most importantly, every staff member friendly and eager to be of service. Didn't have much time to try any of the facilities--but very pleased with the people. Easy access to subway, and only about a 5-10 minute walk to Grand Central or Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good vibe, rude reception staff and unclean rooms”
Reviews.Author: danielle000
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay, but the reception staff are terribly unhelpful and rude. They put 2 rooms on one booking, floors apart and then when we requested to be on the same floor they refused. I spoke to the general manager who organised rooms next door (one room would have been an upgrade). As the receptionist behind the desk realised his mistake, she chased my mother to the lift and grabbed the key out of her hand. It was rude, embarrassing and disgusting behaviour. This did result in free cocktails at the bar!! The rooms weren't cleaned very well, there was also a towel shortage.... on a positive note though, the hotel lobby area has a good vibe and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lisa, Patrick and Chris the concierges SAVED MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: nrue
Reviews.Content: a disasterous trip where everything that could go wrong did go wrong, and these guys really did EVERYTHING they could to get lost luggage back, lost deliveries and managed to turn around a really dreadful journey. At the end of the day the nice design, etc are nothing without competant and caring staff who really follow through.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - small room”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer41
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I booked the room through Priceline for a steal. The room was very nice, although tiny. When looking at the fire exit map on the back of the door, it appeared to be far smaller than any other room. It contained a queen-size bed, and there was about 2-3 feet of space around the bed. It was difficult for both of us to be getting dressed at the same time and we had to store our luggage in the closet. The bathroom was also small and could only accomodate one person at a time. That being said, we were very happy with our stay. The location is excellent and very close to a subway stop. The few interactions we had with staff were also excellent. We were charged for eating an item from the minibar and it was removed without question upon our request. We also received a late check-out. The bed was extremely comfortable. I should mention that we were a little paranoid about bedbugs since they've been in the news so much lately. We stripped the mattress and scrutinized it very closely and it looked brand new, which put our minds at ease. Our room was quiet with the exception of the house-keeping staff chatting in the hallways in the late morning. The doors were not well sound-insulated so conversations in normal tones could be clearly heard. As mentioned by some other reviewers, the hvac system was a bit loud, but it was a white noise, although it did cycle on and off. We also felt very safe as the elevators are activated by room keys, and a security guard was stationed by the elevators in the evenings to make sure that everyone had a room key.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: amvaldes
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a nice trendy Hotel, this is the place to be. There is always something going on and lots of people in the Lounge area and the Bar. The overall service is very good. It has a wonderful location, the rooms are a little small but they are still comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, great service, teeny room.”
Reviews.Author: 2pinacolodas
Reviews.Content: Our credit card company screwed up our reservation, basically leaving us with no room on Thanksgiving weekend, Sami at the front desk was wonderful, taking on the problem and solving it while she also got us a beverage from the bar while we waited. She went over and above in fixing a problem that was not any fault of the hotel. Haven't seen that too often. Rooms very hip and clean, but tiny, even for NYC. Didn't see the problem of noise that other travelers had experienced, all in all a fun place in great location. Lighting in the room was not so good, almost dark.

Reviews.Title: “Had both good and bad qualities”
Reviews.Author: RASG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night. The electronic key system was down. The desk said they would slip one under the door at night when it was ready. They never did. the entire 24 hours we had no key. Very annoying. We are gold members through starwood, I was told the morning of our checkin that our room would be ready and that at the off chance it wasn't ready they would have a room for me. Our room wasn't ready. They let me use the spa to change, but my husband had to wait in the lobby and it just wasn't as comfortable and private as I would have hoped. Especially since I was told our room would be ready. Our room was clean and average, but we did have a nice corner room. The size was ok. You just can't expect gigantic space in NYC, I know because I lived there for years. But it was clean, I think the most important hotel room feature. The staff was VERY busy, a hustle and bustle place with a nice lounge/bar at street level. The woman that checked us out was apologetic that we were never given a key and made it up to us through hotel points. I would stay here again, but I know not to expect Four Seasons quality catering.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , good location, good customer service !!”
Reviews.Author: eewern
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a long trip with my in laws and stayed in 3 rooms at W hotel. This is my second stay in W hotel, and as expected , W hotel is GREAT. Always try to impress the customer and really trying their best to accomodate the customer's needs. Love the whatever and whenever. It makes me feel that whatever i need in the hotel will be accomodated here. The hotel is just 2 block from the subway green line. It is so conveniently located that we do not need a car here. We stayed from nov 20-24th and my family were on a flight for 20++ hours before we reached the hotel. I just reached home 1 minute ago and decided to write a great review for Nicole and Yesheira. Nicole has been very helpful during my trip in NYC (Thanks!) . Yesheira too is a great asset to the hotel. She is so friendly and helpful. She always make sure our family is in good hand. She always try to go extra miles to fulfill our big family's needs. She has made my family's first time New York's stay an unforgettable one. She can be easily one of the hotel receptionist we ever met !

Reviews.Title: “Worst attitude - will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Two nights with DH here was the last straw - I will not stay at this hotel again. Perfect location for business, but not worth the nonsense. The W New York has confused snobbery with with exclusivity. It seemed like every staff member went out of their way to make us feel like they were doing us a favor to let us stay there. Small room, unusable space, and street noise just aren't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ame054
Reviews.Content: We were at the W New York from Nov. 12-14, 2010. On this website many complained about certain aspects of the hotel, yet we found it to be very good and a great location. The room on the 12th floor, with a queen bed, was really not as small as some people described, and very quiet. Did not like that the TV is attached to a metal pole next to the window and the bed, a little hard to get around. Other than that the size is quite adequate. The bathroom is a little small but very functional. Had no trouble with our bill when checking out, and the staff was very professional. This hotel is right across the street from the Waldorf Astoria, with lots of diners and little restaurants to choose from. The restaurant in the hotel is expensive. Very nice three days in New York, especially that the weather was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of form, no function: An ultra-hip hotel that's ultra-uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: bdub3535
Reviews.Content: When you pass through the revolving doors of the W New York, you know it's not your typical hotel. And that's not a good thing. Instead of a calm, relaxing, "welcome home" vibe, everything is too modern, too contemporary. You aren't stepping into your home for the next few days. You're stepping into a nightclub, complete with the thump-thumping bar and lounge to your right and features in your room that are meant to look cool but not actually make your stay any better. Arrive at the elevators, and there's more proof it isn't your typical hotel. At a typical hotel, your room key would work every time. At the W New York, your room key--necessary both to open the door to your room and make the elevator go to your floor--is too unreliable. Only needing one room key for your entire stay? That's so 2004. We weren't the only ones with room key troubles. At least four other guests in the elevators with us during our three-night stay had similar problems. Other reviewers on TripAdvisor have complained about this, too, as you can read. Once you overcome the atypical hassle of actually entering your room, you're greeted with something that actually is typical for a hotel in this location: a shoebox-sized room. This is no exaggeration. There's exactly 12 inches of space between the foot of the queen-sized bed and the wall. Thank goodness that the TV mounted to the wall was a flat-screen and not an old-style tube TV, because there is literally no room for anything deeper than a two-inch screen. At this point, you should know that we booked our hotel through Priceline, and we paid $200 a night compared with the standard rate of well over $500 per night. Though the standard rooms are the same throughout the hotel, I can only assume that Priceline guests get the worst possible location within the hotel. Saving money is not hip, so they give bargain-hunters the leftovers. I came to that conclusion upon realizing that our room was right next door to the cleaning staff's supply room. At around 9 each morning during our stay, three or four members of the cleaning staff congregated right outside our door and chatted loudly for about a half hour. That wasn't the wake-up call we asked for. Another example of the poor location was the view from our room. We weren't expecting to see a sweeping panorama of the city from our fourth-floor Priceline room, but we at least hoped for a little privacy. Instead, immediately to our right along the wall that runs perpendicular to our window was another row of rooms. That meant that four feet from our window was another person's window. If their blackout blind had been open, we could've seen right in. Unlike most hotels, there are no sheer curtains at the W New York. It's either all light or no light. That said, it shouldn't surprise you to know that we left our blinds closed for most of our stay, denying ourselves any natural light but preserving privacy. Here are three other things that made the ultra-hip W New York feel ultra-uncomfortable: - Weak lighting: Turning on all lights in the room gives you less than half the amount of light that you'd get in a typical hotel room. - No shower door: Seriously. The shower has no door. There's a three-foot gap in the glass that you step through and into the shower. Cold air flows through while you rush to complete your shower. A shower curtain? How dÃ©classÃ©. - A spacious minibar: About the only normal-sized thing in the room is the pressure-sensitive minibar. In the hopes of bleeding more money out of you, the W New York uses valuable space in your room to sell you overpriced snacks and beverages. Don't you dare pick up that can of gummi bears, though! You're charged instantly for anything that's moved. OK, so did we like anything about the W New York? Sure. The toiletries were really nice, the bed was free of bedbugs, and the location was ideal. But we won't be staying there again, at any price. Do you want to relax and be comfortable at the end of a fun, fast-paced day in New York City? Then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing guest service experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: csweeney
Reviews.Content: I booked the W as part of a girls' trip to NYC with my sister who had recently graduated college. At the last minute, my mom and other sister decided to join us. Edna checked us into the hotel and she could not have been more accomodating. I told her about our additional guests and she was able to get us a room that would fit all of us. In the course of checking in, I mentioned we were also celebrating my mom who is a Veteran (it was Veteran's Day). That night when we came back to the room, there was a bottle of wine and a plate of fruit and cheese and a handwritten note from Edna thanking my mom for her service. It was completely unexpected and above and beyond what I would classify as great service. She continued to help us throughout our stay. She truly made it a memorable girls' trip!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I wasn't paying”
Reviews.Author: bonoglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Pros: lots of eye candy, overspilling with cool trendy types, good bar at Whisky Blue (still), great toiletries and amenities, great location, OK gym. Cons: tight space, even after I got upgraded to a corner suite, could not take a bath (showers only), dark rooms with tall buildings either side, messed up room reservation (when I was promised a bottle of champagne as compensation, they tried to give us local sparkling wine instead - as if we wouldn't know!), dodgy credit charges appeared a month after I got back and had to get Amex to resolve it. Its a "corporate trendy" business hotel. Trying a bit too hard to be achingly cool when its just too big and corporate to completely pull it off. The W in Sydney manages this a little bit better ... I thought it was very pricey for what it was but there was a conference that week and apparently NYC occupancy and rates are particularly sensitive to conferences (surely in somewhere like NYC there would at least one big conference a week?)

Reviews.Title: “Lamika and Edna always make my stay feel like home”
Reviews.Author: NicTChicago
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this property for the last 8 years. While the hotel is lovely, hip atmosphere and well designed rooms, it is truly the front desk staff and other team members that keeps me coming back. Specifically, Edna Barkley and Lamika, they treat each and every guest as a member as family; and, when you travel as much as I do, it's always nice to see a friendly face that is genuinely glad to see you and try to accomodate your every wish.

Reviews.Title: “Concur with others”
Reviews.Author: picard8427
Reviews.Content: What you read here about this hotel is pretty true...old building that has been reno to be chic but you can only do so much. Rooms are small, even for NYC standards (and mine was already upgraded so not run of the mill rooms). I've never had a room where the wine glass tray was placed on top of the AC unit cuz there is no where else to put it! They are dark (really dark), AC is noisy, and tiny tiny bathrooms...noI bumped my elbows to the sink constantly just sitting on the toilet!. Nice toiletries though, but the shower was small, and takes about 5 min to get real hot water going. No bed bugs to be found (and I looked!). Of course no view to speak of (unless you count room next door!). Cleaning service was so so, missed lots of items and wine glasses still had leftover red wine from previous stay! But they are friendly and the cart was left out in the hall most of the times so I just helped myself! But the service is what makes up for it...great in room dining, great wake up calls (real person with weather, not automatic ones with no voice!), reception folks cater to ALL your wishes, and the Acura experience can't be beat (it's free!!). Got this room for a great deal thru PL, and no mention of it at anytime and even checked in at 1pm with room ready. So all in all great PL deal with great location. Suitable for solo traveller only and would be upset if I had to pay full price (over $300 usually). Could be worse, and given that it is NYC, would not be upset if I got it again bidding on my next visit. Would get a 4 star if they didn't charge 17/day for internet!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great stay, would definitely book again!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug6650
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed 4 nights over the marathon weekend. Each staff member was friendly and helpful (especially Edna!) and they were able to come through on a few tricky requests when our plans changed a bit. The lobby and adjoining Whiskey Blue offer a nice landing pad when you want a lounge feel without venturing too far from the hotel. If you are looking for anything at all, the concierge knows just where to send you. The rooms are a bit small, but that is to be expected in nyc and the swanky decor and above and beyond service more than made up for that. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I absolutely will be going back. : )

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not quite the WOW”
Reviews.Author: AX1000
Reviews.Content: Being the first W hotel you would expect this one to have the WOW factor and be the flagship but it doesnâ€™t quite get there. Donâ€™t get me wrong this hotel is very nice and I would recommend it to anyone but compared to other W hotels it doesnâ€™t stand out. The receptionist could barley raise a smile and the lobby was packed with people. We had a fantastic suite (for a good price) which was a good size for NYC but did feel a little dark. The bathroom was very small considering it was a suite. If the price is right then defiantly book this hotel but the W Union Square was better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, People, Location”
Reviews.Author: boxerrudi
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from W Hotel with my husband and 2 friends where we stayed for the NYC marathon. The hotel is in a fantastic location for shopping, restaurants and the theatre district. The staff where eager to please and so nice that housekeeping and maintenance staff you met in the corridors eager to ask if you where enjoying your stay in the W. When we ordered room service for my husband after returning from the marathon they could not have been more interested or helpful. Room was cool - not the biggest but it s New York - had read some reviews and was concerned about what we had booked, but really it is a cool funky hotel and all the talk of bad lighting I can only say they must be over 60!!! we had no problems at all!!! Would recommend and hope to return soon

Reviews.Title: “Dwayne the Security Guard”
Reviews.Author: Max_Cuellar
Reviews.Content: I rushed to the hotel from a meeting after one of my contacts fell out (sounds trivial but...) Dwayne immediately understood the urgency of the situation and personally saw to it that I found contact lens solution, a case etc. I was impressed by the level of service and attention to detail. As someone that stays in hotel 150+ nights a year, I can recognize this level of exceptional service. While the W Lex is certainly not the kind of hotel that's automatically suited to business travel (small rooms etc), Dwayne's attention to service quality is something that's made me a fan. Many kudos to Dwayne and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: groovymom_10
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews are right -- the rooms are small, the bathrooms are the size of closets (no, really), and in-room climate control is very noisy. Fine for solo business travelers (good midtown location) but rooms are a tight squeeze for 2. This is an *old* hotel building that has been redecorated with dark paint & furniture to look tragically hip. No idea why this hotel rates 4 stars -- the hallways are narrow and dark, rooms are compact and gloomy. Lots of better choices in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pantoufle83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on Lexington for 12 nights! and I was very pleased with the hotel and staff! The rooms aren't big but clean and the location is central to everything, near park avenue and 5th avenue!

Reviews.Title: “I was WOWed!”
Reviews.Author: hejustlaughs
Reviews.Content: Recently, for my girlfriend's birthday we decided to book a suite here and have a night on the town. I have heard that space is a premium in this area of the city so rooms here are quite small. Therefore I decided to book a suite for a little more space. Upon arrival I think I had the chance to check in with one of the most pleasant staff members I've encountered anywhere by the name of Yeshaira. She embodies what great customer service should be. I know it was by chance I got a great staff member because the guy checking in to me was not having a particularly pleasant experience. She is probably one of the reasons why my stay was pleasant in that she embodied the W attitude of "Whenever, wherever" in getting me and my girlfriend what we needed. The next day when I was leaving the hotel she even remembered me and asked how my stay was.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a prime NYC locale”
Reviews.Author: melindaBrereton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on Lexington for one night and was very pleased with the service.. I booked the room through expedia the morning of on a whim and was lucky to get a reasonable rate. Check in was not until 3pm but i arrived at 230 and had no wait checking in. A beautiful friendly woman, Cindy, checked me in and I asked her about securing a manicure appt. Bliss was booked but she was very helpful in referring me to her spa which was two blocks away. I went.. (forget name, but it was the best mani in awhile) I came back to my room to a message waiting from Cindy checking on my and my service.. Cindy was both attentive and sweet.. i was in and out all evening and when i did see her she greeted me by name. I ordered room service which was also wonderful and though i regret not remembering the server the great service continued in the friendly attentive service.. Overall a wonderful evening.. The service is beyond impressive and although the room was not as big as i expected (hey! its ny!) i was very pleased.. Cant wait to visit again soon! BTW- the store had amazing stuff which i indulged in!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Concierge and Location”
Reviews.Author: louwave
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to find a great deal on this hotel. It was worth it. Yes, the hotel can be expensive but welcome to New York. The rooms are clean and the location is central to everything. The Concierge desk will do anything they can to help you. They can get reservations and go beyond what you would normally find. I'd like to mention David Almada. He is the quintessential concierge who made Nobu happen when others said no, helped us get good deals all over town and just always made my partner and I feel welcome. He defines the nothing is impossible mantra. Thanks. By the way, the lobby is loud with music and it certainly is the place to be seen if that is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jjenni01
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews , I was disappointed with the fact that my Priceline bid had been accepted here. However from the time we walked into the hotel I was glad that this was where Priceline put us. I got the room for a steal by New York standards. When we walked in we were greeted by Janaina and although it was three hours prior to check in she graciously gave us a double upgrade and allowed us to check in immediately.She was a breath of fresh air after a very stressful day of travel because of a flight cancellation. She also gave us two free drink tickets to the bar but unfortunately the only time we found to use them the bar had closed for the night. The location was awesome and very close to Grand Central Station. The rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated. The housekeeping staff on the fifth floor were excellent and constantly asked if we needed anything. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was small but I've been in much smaller in NYC. The Acura service which is free was wonderful and much better than taking a cab. I also got a last minute appointment at Bliss spa for a massage which was heavenly. The only three complaints I have is the air conditioning/heating system were very noisy. The ice machine on the fifth floor was without ice our last night but the staff downstairs got us ice. The other minor complaint was our view of garbage and a parking garage. My complaints are so minor and the benefits were so great that I would definitely stay at this W again and would recommend it to friends traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “THE HIDDEN TREASURE”
Reviews.Author: cisco911105
Reviews.Content: As we enter the Oasis bar we were impress with the decor and lighting of the place. We had two sections in front of the fire place reserved for us; and our waitress Maryanne immediately served us giving us an impeccable service which made us embrace the great ambiance within the bar. Maryanne went above and beyond any expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the W!”
Reviews.Author: ibkarenoid
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews for this hotel, I wanted to put my two-cents in. I have to say that my stay was absolutely wonderful. The service was friendly and professional; even though I did have to wait to be helped a few times due to the very busy nature of the hotel. The room was just fine - small, but well designed with a comfortable queen bed, desk and chair, bathrobes, rain shower, and a big TV. People need to realize that as the original W - this building is OLD, and the rooms are NYC small. There is only so much they can do, and unless you plan to stay in your room the entire time - there is no need for a huge space. The location couldn't be better; and I LOVED the free ACURA car service. They will drop you off anywhere in the city from downtown up to 86th street with a reservation. Special thanks to Scott, the manager on duty who moved me to a higher floor with a HUGE window and lots of light; and to Regine - the housekeeper who checked in on me, and brought me water while I was feeling under the weather. For those who expect huge, contemporary rooms, with brand new fixtures and plumbing - you might try the newer W in Times Square. The Whiskey Bar next door is popular and crowded, the hotel breakfast restaurant is okay - but you can find better outside the hotel, and the Bliss Spa is a great place to get a treatment. If you are patient, looking to relax, and just want a nice central location to shower and sleep in - the W New York is the perfect place for you!

Reviews.Title: “The best W in NYC (in my opinion!)”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: Such a cute, quirky hotel. We booked a last minute room and expected it to be tiny given the great deal we got. But it wasn't. Nice big room, spacious, high ceilings, walk in wet room and - as ever with W - amazingly stocked mini bar. Yum. Make sure you have at least one late night cocktail in the bar... It is, after all, what W does best! Oh, and try the W boutiqie attached to the lobby for weird and wonderful gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MrTraveler4444
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, our room was outstanding. We loved our room. The bed was perfect. The food quality of the in-room dining was excellent. The Mid-town location of the hotel is terrific. Most importantly, though, the service that everyone at W New York provided was exceptional. From the doorman, to the housekeeping, to the room service, every employee we encountered was professional, helpful, and friendly. My wife and I have stayed at many luxury hotels, and W New York set a new standard that will be difficult for other hotels to match, let alone beat. We are very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: mdybala
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller and have stayed in many cities at many different kinds of hotels. This was one of my best trips. First, we arrived 3 hours before check in time, and had planned to just leave our stuff and walk around the city, sightseeing, till the room was ready. The friendly staff informed me that there was no problem at all, the room was already ready, and we were checked in early. So we were able to shower and freshen up before going out. The room itself was perfect. True, it was small, but it was beautifully appointed, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom a design masterpiece, and everything was spotlessly clean. The staff was courteous and helpful at all levels. The friendly doormen made me smile; the concierge was earnest and effective; the front desk people were quick and easy to work with. I would stay at this hotel, and recommend it highly, to anyone. I should say, in addition, that I was at a meeting there, during the 3 days I stayed. Their meeting rooms, and the food, were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: BigCJ65
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W because first choice was booked. Staff was helpful; decor and layout are a little overwhelming for the business traveler -- just too focused on being hip instead of user friendly (e.g., room too dark to read in, even with lights on). Room also VERY small, but part of that's NYC. I'd stay again in similar circumstances but would not go out of my way to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “My dream team...”
Reviews.Author: EABoettch
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York weekly for work. The W is my "home away from home". Lamika (ambassador), Mariam (welcome desk), Jermaine (luggage), and Reza (in room dining) always go above and beyond....

Reviews.Title: “Great location excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: rodotraveler
Reviews.Content: could not have asked for a better location and the fitness center and spa amenities we fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox meets Chic”
Reviews.Author: sandk06
Reviews.Content: The W at 50th and Lex is a nice location and is recently renovated. Even by New York standards (and European standards for that matter), the queen room is very small. I used starwood points for the reservation, but otherwise the room would have been $350. Had I paid full price, I'd be majorly disappointed. The reason that it's a queen bed is that there's no space for a king, a desk, and anything else. The bathroom is well organized, but contains no tub, just a standup shower with a rain showerhead providing gravity assisted (read "low") water pressure. We were only in NYC for a night and didn't spend much time in our room, but if you're planning on more time, either book a larger room, or look elsewhere.
