Reviews.Title: “The hotel suite and W New York staff were amazing.”
Reviews.Author: EPAtty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York on Lexington last week in one of their suites. The room was very comfortable, very well laid out with first class amenities. I loved the modern and comfortable couches that made reading a pleasure, the bed was very comfortable and enjoyed the LCD TV. I would highly recommend the suites to anyone looking for a home away from home. Last but certainly not least, the staff was also very professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Big D, not W”
Reviews.Author: peryk
Reviews.Content: We were a group of friends and we took 3 different rooms: single, double, triple. The all were the same (very small) size but the price difference was huge. The lobby looks really cool. Modern design, lights etc. You step in and there is a W(ow) effect. It ends when you try to check-in. Rude and cold personal doesn't seem to care. The W(ow) disappears right after you open the room door. The rooms were extremal (D)irty, the furniture worn and old, on the lamps spider nets. The same for bathroom. All rooms looked like grandma's attic. There was missing the card with prices from the minibar. When we opened the water standing by the bed (not knowing that it isn't free like in other hotels), we the got charged. Even the hotel flayers at the room were old and (D)irty. The only positive is the location. Price/value is very bad. You can find much better hotels in similar location for lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: artkvitek
Reviews.Content: The W is beautiful and the location has been great for our needs but the real bonus has been Jessie. She is the housekeeper that was in charge of our floor. She was absolutely wonderful. She pampered us like we were family. She not only made us feel comfortable and addressed our every need, she made us feel special like we were her biggest priority. This is only our second trip to NYand we never expected such unbelieveable service in such a bigh city. Our daughter now lives in NY so we will be making frequent visits and as long as we can stay on Jessies floor we will be staying at the W. Thanks Jessie for making us feel like home on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Value”
Reviews.Author: wolf7000
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel if you aren't paying for it. However, from a value standpoint, if you are going to spend over $300 a night in new York, you can do so much better! This was by far the smallest room I've stay at in NYC. It was very clean and nice interior designs, but....again...the price was rediculous for what you were staying in. The previous week I was a guest at the starwood siste property, Le Meridian. Not only was it a lower price, but nearly triple the room size, and much better views overlooking Central Park. I stayed at the W hotel because I thought it would be cool to stay at the original W location.....and frankly speaking....I'm surprised the W brand becoming successful after luanching such a horrible firt hotel. Again...if it was a free hotel or if you only had to pay $130 a night, it's totally worth it. But that's not the case...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service makes the experience!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_991423
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here last month. But what made it the best was the great service I received from the bartenders. When you stay somewhere for periods at a time, there's nothing like warm and friendly service to make you feel at home. Lisa the bartender at Oasis makes everyone comfortable while managing a very hopping bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovepaula
Reviews.Content: Valerie was amazingly helpful. We had several family members and friends stay and the wedding couple had a suite which was amazing. We all enjoyed breakfast the next morning with vouchers provided and the food was great. The beds were wonderful and everyone helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful 15th Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: UAMike
Reviews.Content: My husband and I continued our 15th Anniversary celebration with a trip to the Big Apple over Columbus Day Weekend. This was his first trip to NYC so I tried to make the trip a special one. I'm currently a SPG Platinum member. I booked a "Cozy Room" and requested an upgrade, if available since this was a special trip for the two of us. When I was handed the keys to Room 1707, never did I imagine the suite upgrade that we received. Even though it was nearly 2:00 a.m. by the time we arrived at the W, we were truly Wowed by the wonderful suite that would be our home away from home for the next two days. The furnishings were wonderful and the terrace and furnishings on the terrace were spectacular. The decadent chocolate dessert waiting for us on the dining room table wishing us a Happy 15th Anniversary was truly the "icing on the cake". The only minor issue we had was that the beautiful chess set on our dining room table was missing a pawn and a king piece. It was such a lovely chess set and it was distressing to imagine that anyone would want to remove any of those pieces for their own personal use. Even though I'm fortunate enough to be in a top elite tier with a competing hotel program, it is experiences and wonderful surprises like this that will keep my personal and business lodging needs with the Starwood Family, whenever possible. A big thank you to the staff of the W New York for making our trip to the Big Apple a trip that will be fondly etched in our memories for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “I am not as bourgeois as I felt.”
Reviews.Author: ubergenius
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this hotel for two reasons -- mediocre reviews on this site and the absolutely rock bottom rate I got booking on Priceline. We had such a lovely stay. Uh, yeah, I totally paid $15 + tax for a mojito. And it was a little yuppie for my taste. But seriously our room was so quiet and comfortable that, on the second of our two night stay we decided to turn in at 9PM to watch movies instead of going out on the town. Staff was super, bringing us whatever we wanted (which included extra bath stuff, a specific room request in advance, a box fan, and poutine at midnight) and was really really friendly even though we definitely do not fit the appearance of what I would consider typical W guests. The Acura car service was a delightful surprise and we didn't even need an appointment. I really hope William Shatner and the Priceline gods smile on me next time I'm planning to be in New York because our stay at this hotel totally made our trip.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel is by far the trendsetter in the world of service.”
Reviews.Author: puppeteer_22
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the w hotel to commemorate our 5 year anniversary. I realized that this place was amazing.We ended up at the oasis bar. Boy, oh boy let me tell you we had an amazing time thanks to this wonderful bright eyed bartender. Her name was marianne. My girlfriend loved her. She added to our amazing stay. My girlfriend and her quickly bonded, when it comes great drinks marianne knows them all. The oasis bar is definitely the hip and happening place to be. If anyone ever has the time they should definitely see this gem in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: pandla
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with a friend to see the sights of NY. The room was a bit cramped, but we were hardly ever in it except to sleep; the bed was very comfortable, but the room was dimly lit and some additional lighting would be useful. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. On occasion, the bar area opposite the front desk was quite noisy, making it difficult to hear the reception staff speaking. We had some great breakfasts at Cafe Metro, a short walk away, and wonderful dinners and San Martin, an Italian restaurant around the corner. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Club With Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MelinWashDC2010
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hip, fun and trendy place to stay and less concerned with room space then this is the place for you. The hotel is like a trendy club and the vibe is fashionable and hip. On the positive side the lobby is buzzing with activity and the lounge area, especially on the second floor is perfect for canoodling with your significant other or lounging with a small group of friends. Unfortunately if you are looking for a slice of luxury, the ability to do a push-up or lunge in your room before you head out, or exceptional service, this likely isn't the place for you. The rooms are teeny tiny. We stayed in a Spectacular Room (the W's term, not ours) over looking a water tower and a parking garage, with hardly room to walk between the bed and the bath. We nearly walked straight into the closet when we opened the door to our room the first time. The bathroom really only has room for one person at a time - which may be okay. I believe the pics on the W site are deceptive as they don't really give you a full view of the room. The 'whimsy' in the room is charming but doesn't make up for the disappointing size of the room. The service was okay. We were rarely greeted when we would leave the hotel in search for a cab and often spent 10 - 15 minutes just trying to hail our own. The food at the hotel bar is average (and I'm fairly certain that the cocktail sauce we were served with our calamri was simply ketchup). While the lounge, both up and downstairs are cozy, we resorted to getting our own drinks on two nites rather than waiting the 20+ minutes it took to get a drink.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Wonderful at the W Hotel Lexington Avenue”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustlife
Reviews.Content: Montana in security at the W Lexington Avenue took great care of me during this stay. Professional, warm, attentive and caring..she made sure that the front desk enhanced my brief visit with a room upgrade, wine & chocolate strawberries!

Reviews.Title: “Cindy at the front desk was excellent new...”
Reviews.Author: Casper0007
Reviews.Content: Cindy at the front desk was excellent new how to make me feel great from the beginging

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the stay worth it”
Reviews.Author: burritoted
Reviews.Content: This hotel takes the headache out of travel. After a long day of meetings the hotel has everything and you can relax. The Oasis Lounge in the lobby allows you to enjoy a beverage like your in your own livingroom. It also helps that the staff including Lisa the bartender make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: roshposhJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel for three weeks during a program in New York, I am originally from South Africa and I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The downstairs bar, the Oasis was a great place to unwind after a long day and meet friends thanks to Lisa the bartender who always remembered my name and what I enjoyed to drink, what a pleasure! Thanks Lisa, you will always be welcome down here in SA! Roisin McCarthy

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service ever but definitely pricey!”
Reviews.Author: mizzlara
Reviews.Content: Looking at the negative reviews of this hotel sort of confuses me because the staff were amazing and the hotel left little to criticize. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon trip to Manhattan and we had an amazing time. We booked our hotel through Hotwire and the cost was roughly $300 per night. Definitely expensive but it's New York - all hotels are expensive! We didn't even consider room service or the mini bar because, again, these things are always way too expensive because you're paying a lot for convenience, and the W was no exception ($15 for pancakes!). The rooms - Our first night we stayed on the fourth floor in one of the smaller rooms. Yes, the room is small, but I don't see why that matters when you're there to sleep. In the small rooms there is a queen-size bed (with a feather bed mattress topper, down pillows and a down comforter!! zzzzzz! so comfy!), a desk, a mini bar with a set of three drawers below it and still floor space to comfortably move around. There's a small closet with hangers, floor space for luggage, an iron + ironing board, and two cotton waffle weave bath robes with terry cloth lining. There's a 37" flat screen TV with cable and I thought the decor was simple and artistic. The Bliss products in the bathroom and the rainfall shower were also a really nice touch. The remainder of our stay was spent on the 18th floor in one of the larger rooms and it was pretty much the same but just more floor space and the robes provided had a microfiber outer layer instead of the cotton waffle weave. My one gripe about the 18th floor room was that the air conditioner was really loud, something that was not a problem in the 4th floor room. On to the staff - When we checked in we told the (extremely nice) desk clerk that it was our honeymoon and we asked if we could upgrade our room. She didn't have anything available for that night but she said she could definitely do something for us the next night and we were moved all the way up to the 18th floor! We definitely did not expect that and it was really nice of them to be so accommodating. The staff were friendly, all smiles and very helpful during our entire stay. One of the concierges, Lisa, gave us two complimentary drinks when she found out that we were there on our honeymoon! Now I'm not saying that everyone will get free upgrades etc. but my point is that the staff are amazing and they did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. I'd probably stay here again for a special occasion; it was a really positive experience but the price will keep me from making it my regular New York accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMSinMEM
Reviews.Content: W New York is a wonderful property excellent location, hospitable staff, lovely guest rooms and fun lobby. The Acura experiences very helpful. F&B was all on par for the hotel. Going back next month and looking forward to another terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “an overpriced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DJANDYHARDING
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights with work. I should first confirm, therefore, that I was not paying. Nevertheless, I have an appreciation for value-for-money whether itâ€™s mine or not! Indeed, the fact that I wasnâ€™t paying but still have cause to post this review speaks volumes! I duly winced as I paid the $3500 bill at the end of the week (including a $6 watery coffee from the bar). Iâ€™d heard about the W chain being â€˜up-marketâ€™ and â€˜chicâ€™ so thought Iâ€™d give it a go. Well, if up-market means â€œeye-wateringly expensive with snotty serviceâ€�, then theyâ€™ve nailed it. And if â€œchicâ€� means â€œa bit tatty, dirty and datedâ€�, then theyâ€™ve scored 2-out-of-2. My colleague and I had both opted for King rooms, on the basis that any NYC queen bed would probably completely fill its allotted room. My colleague arrived the day before me, and when checking in was told that the king bed heâ€™d booked wasnâ€™t available. He was bumped into a queen bedroom which he confirmed was indeed the smallest you could imagine. The receptionist apparently presented the fact that he would not be paying the â€˜kingâ€™ price for that night was somehow an added bonus. On my arrival at the hotel with a 25kg bag and various carry-ons, after a 12 hour trip, the gormless porters stood by and watched me enter without lifting a finger. The receptionist too was extremely unwelcoming. After the hotel swiped my pleasingly under-used credit card, my card company baulked at the sudden spike in my CC spending. They consequently blocked the payment; news which was delivered to me by the receptionist in the most condescending way you could imagine. No offer was made of a telephone to call my credit card company. Luckily, my CC company called me, to check the charges were genuine and allowed the payment. The dÃ©cor of the rooms is quite nice, although the smart â€˜new york styleâ€™ white bathroom tiles didnâ€™t look as though they had been scrubbed since the hotel was built. The bath and tiles had a yellowish scum over them. The mini-bar is â€˜open airâ€™ and looks incredibly tacky. The price list and the snotty â€œdonâ€™t touch if you canâ€™t affordâ€� warning sign together ensured I didnâ€™t have to remortgage my house to get some Pringles. From memory, it was $12 for a miniature toothbrush and 10ml or so of toothpaste â€“ the kind you get for free on airlines. Ouch. A miniature tube of Pringles was in excess of $10. Careful you donâ€™t choke! The wireless internet in the lounge has the bandwidth of a string telephone. Of course, it would be, because itâ€™s â€˜freeâ€™. The wired access in the room was must better, for around $16 plus tax per day, but the room was too dark (see below) to sit in for any period of time. Wired internet points in the lounge would be good. Not wanting to go-on, hereâ€™s a quick run down of the other problems with this hotel: The lights in the bedroom are too dark to do anything useful. Ditto the lights in the hall. No tea and coffee facilities in the rooms. The air con is SOOO noisy and is hard to turn off. The bathroom fan remains on â€˜hurricane forceâ€™ all night. The DVD player didnâ€™t work. Most of the tv channels were badly tuned. There is no sound insulation in the door, so I was woken throughout the night by noisy guests returning. I donâ€™t want to be purely negative about my stay. The location was great for what we needed it for, and the apples on the reception were a nice touch, as was the iPhone docking station (although thatâ€™s becoming expected these days). Also, you could sit around in the lounge during the day drinking a Starbucks without being pestered by staff trying to fleece you for another $9 bottle of bud - that only started around 4pm. On balance though, I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll be staying at another W hotel anytime soon (although the Meridien chain in the same Starwood group IS very good but sadly not represented in NYC). Now, pray silence please, as a representative of the hotel will now post some wishy-washy, non-committal, nonsense below trying to trick you into thinking that this was just a â€˜one-offâ€™ and that it is actually a really nice hotelâ€¦â€¦take it away maestroâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Best Front Door Staff”
Reviews.Author: DivaDP
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest at this location on several occasions and wanted to give a big shout out to all the hard working guys on the front door! They are consistently friendly, helpful and right there when you need them. Special thanks to Denzel the man with the big smile who always asks when you are departing "did you remember your cell phone charger, your toothbrush etc." These guys work so hard slugging peoples bags, hailing cabs etc. and they treat everyone as though they are the only client. Thanks for being so fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “a elegant paradise”
Reviews.Author: brock17
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous time at the w hotel with my wife. We had cocktails at the oasis bar and the bartender maryanne was a pleasure to be around. I would highly rate the hotel and service to anyone visiting the new york area!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Piccy123
Reviews.Content: While I visited the w hotel NY, I went to their Oasis bar and was treated liked royalty by Maryanne who is a bartender there. She made my feel great about my visit into the big apple. I was at the oasis bar Monday October 4 2010. Maryanne was great!

Reviews.Title: “They have a lot of scripts for the staff...”
Reviews.Author: Salty0923
Reviews.Content: They have a lot of scripts for the staff that imply great customer service but must not have the infrastructure to deliver an even average experience. From missing items in my room (one day no trash can, next day no bath mat...) to claims of fresh oj that's not, the w just didn't deliver. These are all little things but every day i experienced several weird things that made it not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “W New York, great hotel, AMAZING service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersInLove04
Reviews.Content: I just want to say, "Thank you" to the W Hotel and their amazing staff. I surprised my husband with a trip to the Big Apple to celebrate his birthday. The hotel was great, but their Concierge Lisa Bullock went above and beyond to make it a memorable trip. Her knowledge of the restaurants and lounges was very helpful and she made it her personal mission to make sure that we had the experience that we were looking for. Thank you, W New York, and thank you, Lisa. We look forward to our future visits and especially to our future stay at the W New York.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: brianpastore
Reviews.Content: This hotel has always been one of our favorite places to stay in NYC. It is very trendy with a very cool modern design. The rooms are a bit small, but you are in NYC and I've seen smaller apartments than these rooms. The beds are world class... So comfortable and plush. The staff is bend over backwards friendly. The nightlife is hoping with the Whiskey Bar next door. The location is perfect. Close to many excellent restaurants and the famous Upper East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Always good to stay at the W...”
Reviews.Author: tmitango
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling extensively for years, and travel to NY often. I always enjoy having an opportunity to stay at a W. The W-NY is no exception to that. The facility is classic W style and the staff was great. Special kudos to Lisa, the bartender at the Oasis Bar... great service... enjoyed the conversation... ask her for a boleo martini...

Reviews.Title: “The lobby bar/lounge servers are polite, friendly and always have a smile!”
Reviews.Author: CA-Traveler729
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for business. We had cocktails in the lounge before and after dinner. It didn't matter who was working, we were approached by the friendliest people. All of the individuals were extremely nice and we received the best service. Especially Rhonda, thank you!!! Although we had many other options for drink locations, we always found ourselves back at the same plush couches where we knew our drinks would be correct and served with a smile. The other individuals we met, like Maria, were also gracious. The W as a hotel could use some improvements but the staff at the lobby bar were the best. I have to commend the W for their hiring of quality individuals!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst service and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: nickbsr
Reviews.Content: From: ronnie bozine Sent: Monday, October 04, 2010 5:03 PM To: GM.Edward.Maynard@whotels.com; nick bozine sr Subject: Hotel Stay-W Hotel 541 Lexington Avenue Mr. Maynard, I am writing this letter to tell you of our experience at the W New York Hotel on Oct. 1st and Oct.2nd leaving on Oct. 3rd. First, we arrived on Friday â€“ Oct. 1st and it was raining hard. There was no one to help us outside with our luggage so we carried it inside to the check in desk by ourselves. We arrived early so our room wasnâ€™t ready. When we came back we checked with the front desk and our room was ready. We stayed in room 1822 which is suppose to be the upscale deluxe corner studio room. the bathroom and carpets were filthy with lint and dirt everywhere. It was around 1:30. We went to our room and relaxed for awhile in the living room area. We had a massage at the bliss spa at 3:00 PM. We showered and left our room around 5:00 since we had an early dinner and show. We went to bed around 11:00 PM and realized when we got there that the bed was not a king size which we paid for and received an email confirmation for. Early Saturday I went to the front desk to let them know about the bed. The girl at the front desk said that the bed was a king size and I told her that I have slept in a king size bed with my husband for 42 years and it was not a king. She asked if I would like to speak to the manager and I said yes. I waited for the manager for 15 minutes and after none came, I asked the front desk to have her call my room. No one ever called. We went out for the day around 11:00 AM Saturday and when we came back at 3:15 PM our room was never cleaned nor our bed made. I called down to the front desk and housekeeping came up and cleaned our bathroom and bedroom area while we waited in the living room for them to finish. We made the best of it and stayed another night at the hotel. Sunday morn was the worst of all. We asked the front desk to get our car so we could leave for home. It was 8:05 am. We waited for 20 minutes and after the car never came my husband questioned the bellman and he said nobody ever called it into the garage. We asked how and when we could get the car and he said we could walk around the corner and get it ourselves. the porter/bellhops were rude and seemed to be upset with the hotel management.Well, that is exactly what we did and we carried all our own luggage with us(in the rain). We then got to the garage and had to wait another 20 minutes for our car because they told us no one ever called them from the hotel.. It was one of the most unprofessional experiences we have ever had at a New York Hotel. We stay in New York several times a year for shows and shopping and I just wanted to let you know that we will never stay at the W again. Your staff is very unprofessional and there are no friendly faces behind your check-in desk.we asked twice to speak with yhe manager and were told you would call us in the room.you never called us. I would give you a name of the people on your staff we talked to but none wore a name tag to identify themselves. We wanted to make you aware of our experience this weekend mostly to vent our anger and frustration over the terrible attitude shown to us this weekend. we had 2 massages and saw 2 shows and hardly spent any time in your hotel but the dirty rooms,the failure to clean the room while we were out all day and the overall hatred between your staff and the hotel itself was evedent from the arguements between your management and your workers in the hallways and elevator. We are business owners ourselves and your hotel has some seriour management problems. Sorry to say that there was nothing good about our experience at the W hotel. If anyone is considering staying at the w hotel please take our review serious.we were extremely angry when we left and this is a great forum to vent. Sincerely, Nicholas & Veronica Bozine 445 Delsea Drive Sewell, NJ 08080

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, but only just”
Reviews.Author: gdtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stay here three times a year for a week or so on business. The location is great but the rooms are small, even the allegedly "spectacular" rooms, and some - though not all - the staff have some attitude issues. More at the Grumpy Business Traveller blog, www.gbtraveller.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Tacky decor but good bed.”
Reviews.Author: pickygirl2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard "COZY" room. For the price paid, I was expecting at least minor luxury---I've heard the W in L.A. is beautiful----but, sadly, no dice here in Midtown. Entering the hotel, the eye is confused---- common areas are, in a word, ugly and, I guess, trying to appeal to a very young crowd----large video installments hanging from the ceiling, big brown or purple-y fake suede sectionals, loud music constantly. Everything is kind of shiny and fake except for the totally out-of-place pots of grass here and there. Here are my pros & cons: PROS:: Great Midtown location. Walking distance to Central Park, great shopping on Madison, 5th Ave, Park Ave, lots of good restaurants close by (it's NYC after all). Very comfortable bed (but beware if you're allergic to down) Nice Bliss toiletries (and their spa is located in the hotel). Good blackout blinds on the windows in bedroom. Very good coffee at the breakfast bar in the a.m. CONS: Lighting in the bedroom is very hard to master. I finally just put a mask on one night because i could not figure out how to turn off the large illuminated photo over the bed. Ditto a light over the mini-bar. There's actually a hidden, miniscule sign on the desk lamp explaining how to turn it on...WTF!!! Message light was flashing on the phone when i entered the room---it was just an irritating ad for the W and there is no way to hang it up mid-message. Bed size felt more "Double" than "Queen". I was alone, so not a problem. Every mini-bar item is lined up next to the desk, out in the open. Tacky, unless you're 14. Loud music in common areas. Closet door in bedroom would not close without making a loud thud as the lock engaged. I'm sure the neighbors loved it in the wee hours that I arrived. Had the hotel decor been the least bit appealing, I would have been more satisfied because of the good bed and great location. If you're looking for tasteful decor and luxe surroundings, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never more”
Reviews.Author: edmundory
Reviews.Content: When i came to check in there was a guest claiming for having been charged item at the mini bar he didnÂ´t got. I made a reservation for a king bed, i got a queen in a small room (all seem to be small). Noisy lobby. On the second day, the made up the room at 5, 30 pm and after four reclamations (they say: i am going to transfer your call to the manager, and then a voice mail box...)They said A cleaning maid is coming in ten minutes, after an hour waiting for her, i called back...apologies and please, wait for another ten minutes. Another hour later,...they arrive. In the meantime, several calls and several messages machines. Finally, they charged three items from the mini bar i hadnÂ´t touched. It seems they do that to everyone.... So,Never more.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the W”
Reviews.Author: Buick445
Reviews.Content: Thank God for Fatima! If it was not for her we would not have closed a $7 million deal week. It all started when our corporate office had no meeting rooms. So we were staying at the W and Fatima under short notice was able to secure the best meeting place the W had to offer. Iâ€™m forever in her debt. Thank you SW

Reviews.Title: “agree with the negative comments, not much to say positive”
Reviews.Author: rococrna01
Reviews.Content: sink too large for cramp bathroom space, room small square footage could be more efficient and at least one strong watt lamp, customer service must cost extra here, only three positive statements----priceline price was right $148, and bed was comfortable, and newspapers are free-------can not recommend unless less than you are expecting is acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Staying at this hotel is my favorite thing about coming to New York.”
Reviews.Author: cparsons_10
Reviews.Content: The place is fun and surprising in every way, and the staff's commitment to excellence impresses me every time. Patrick at the concierge desk is a particular favorite of mine (he helped me find some life-changing gnocchi nearby) as is everyone who works in the lobby bar. This is why I always raise my hand to do the office New York trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC at 3-4 stars. Booked...”
Reviews.Author: macandginger
Reviews.Content: Great value for NYC at 3-4 stars. Booked off Hotwire and received rate of $229. Full service hotel with small (it is New York) but well appointed rooms. Service was very good, reliable. All in all exactly as anticipated- a bit of NYC swank absent the ridiculously overpriced room. Never mind that a diet coke costs $7. When in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “No style, no substance.”
Reviews.Author: wombie80
Reviews.Content: The W is marketed as being a luxury hotel. It is not. The rooms are small. The furnishings are mostly ridiculous (obnoxious pressure sensitive mini bar/snack bar) very uncomfortable desk/office chair, a glass desk with no mouse pad, a hopeless shower, no tea/coffee facilities unless specifically requested - and even then they don't change the mugs or bring coffee refills. Oh, and the bathrooms have weird textured wallpaper that does not clean up well - as evidenced by the many odd (don't get too close!) stains all over the wall. Maid Service The worst of any luxury hotel I've stayed at. They do service the rooms, but never changed the sheets (we stayed for over a week). The towels were often dirty (we had to ask for changes for two towels that seemed to have blood stains on them) and smelled of cigarette smoke. The cups for the coffee machine were never changed or replaced. We requested replacement robes and they never appeared. By the end of the stay we gave up using their 'whatever/whenever' service. The room keys Frequently stopped working - we had to replace them multiple times. Front desk staff Customer service training would be helpful - I'd suggest a field trip to: the Omni or The Marriott (there's one next door!) for some pointers. The lobby Terrible. During the evening it turns into an awful faux DJ bar. I felt bad for the people on the lower floors. The corridors Are like something out of a vampire tv show. They are dark and dingy, with weird upholstery and trays of grass. Yes, grass. The bed The one good thing about the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. Internet BAD: the wireless is terrible. And, if you have more than one computer forget it - the passcode only lets you use one per room at a time. BedBugs Nope, didn't see any. We figured they probably got lost in the dark corridors or tired of the horribly noisy AC unit or hated the decor so much they decamped elsewhere) (Yankee fans: Beware! You can't watch the Yankees at the W - the TV does not have the YES network, and it also doesn't have any local television programming)

Reviews.Title: “One Star Service! Seems the whole staff need Service Basics 101”
Reviews.Author: balsaie
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small, lighting is insufficient and for the price you pay I can think of many hotels in NYC that can offer a lot more and better value. I asked for a European Plug adapter by calling "What Ever When Ever" button on the phone, the lady on the other end said we are all out of them, wait till someone returns it and then we will send it to your rooms! I am sorry but this is not a service response you get from a W Hotel. For all I know the lady should have said " I am sorry Sir we are out but give me a few minutes and I will have one delivered to your room" When I complained at the reception, the lady at reception said "Do you want to speak to the Manager?" wrong answer again! if the staff had proper training and were empowered, she would have said "I am sorry Sir I will make sure that you get the adapter" last opportunity after I returned from dinner I thought, the lady at reception must have reacted and I am sure that by the time I get to my room the adapter is there! NO Chance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Five-O-50
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff at the W Hotel New York for such an excellent wonderful time. The staff was very friendly and professional. It was my 50th birthday and they (hotel staff) made it the best birthday I've ever had so far in my life. The manager (Augustine) was very nice, polite and professional. The staff also looked professional and attractive (everyone). The room was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Flashy”
Reviews.Author: ktm_toronto
Reviews.Content: Small rooms backing onto brick walls and Indifferent service.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week - ok hotel, but service needs improvement fast”
Reviews.Author: Critical_Mind
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W-Hotel for a week in a 'spectacular room' - (third category up). It was very small, but I did not mind it too much. The bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was small, but relatively clean (some corners need better cleaning). The toiletries from the bliss Spa were extremely good. As a frequent traveller, I find it absolutely ridiculous of Starwood (and Hyatt for that matter) to charge for internet usage - just got back from a stay at the Grand Hotel in Stockholm where it is free... The gym is fine, some machines are quite shabby (bikes), but the spa is nice and clean. The bar has a good vibe (Blue Whiskey, not the lobby one). The hotel tries very, very hard to be hip, which is sometimes a little painful. Now, the service really needs improvement. Two examples. First, I asked for a restaurant recommendation and I felt that the lady concierge was very arrogant and could not care less - the same one showed the same attitude when I asked her how to get to the Plaza Hotel for a meeting. Second, I left my ipod in my bathrobe, which was unfortunately taken away by the cleaning staff along with the towels. No problems here or accusations, as I should not have left it in there. However, when I noticed it just an hour later, no one made an effort to find it. In fact, I called WhateverWhenever and they did not even bother to get back to me that day to tell me what was going on. The same happened with security the next day. I stayed in many good hotels and never had an item stolen or disappear besides this one and to be quite honest, it could have been found if someone went through all the bathrobes in the cleaning department. I was very displeased about security/concierge not bothering to follow up and letting me know - after all, every room phone has a voicemail.. So overall, the location is very good. The beds are very comfortable - my room was opposite the cleaners' cupboard though, which meant that it was noisy from 8am onwards.... The concierge is less than average. The atmosphere is like a Preppie Kid in hip clothes trying to show to everyone that he/she is REALLY cool and trendy - just simply trying too hard... well, hello there... as they keep saying in their emails/notifications...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great staff, high extra costs”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the client booked my room. I would never spend this kind of money myself. I'm glad they did. First things first - all these reviews complaining about the size of the rooms... clearly they haven't stayed in Manhattan much, if ever. ALL hotel rooms are small. There is this thing called limited space. That being said, I was actually surprised by the size of the room - compared to other hotels I've stayed at in Manhattan (including the Plaza, the Hilton Times Square, numerous others), the rooms were larger. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. If I came across any staff in the halls, they always greeted me and asked how I was doing. The shower is one of those "rain" showerheads. I don't particularly care for them, simply because I want something with a little more power. Also, the shower cannot be completely closed off - the glass goes just beyond 50% of the stall, the rest is open to the room. And I'll never understand why hotels put their towel racks *inside* the shower/tub area. All the soap/shampoo/etc. is supplied by Bliss, who has a store on the first floor and a spa on the 4th. I did not try the spa. Wake-up calls are a real person, not a recording. When you call for a wake-up call, they also ask if you'd like a second call, which is nice (a kind of snooze button, I guess). There is an ipod dock for charging and hooking up to the clock radio. Lighting in the room is a bit sparse, but enough to get by. The hallways are a bit dark. The location of this hotel is pretty good - you are maybe three blocks from Rockefeller Center. Times Square, Grand Central Station, the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building are all within walking distance. Being that there is an Intercontinental and the Waldorf-Astoria across the street, I doubt you'd ever have much difficulty getting a cab (even during their shift change at 4pm). The subway is nearby as well - I grabbed the E train (express) from near La Guardia that dropped me off about 2 blocks from the hotel. A $2.25 train ride instead of a $30+ cab ride. One nice thing they have is a program with Acura where you can get a ride in an Acura MDX to wherever you are going in the city - for free. Beats the cost of a cab and is a much nicer ride. A couple of costs that I find inexcusable: Like most higher priced hotels, they charge for internet, which I think is absolutely ridiculous - at these room rates, internet access should be complimentary. Most cheap hotels provide it for free, the higher end hotels can, too. On top of simply charging for access, the rates are ridiculously high - $15 for a day. You can save a *little* bit by buying more days at once. I don't care what kind of excuse they may have for charging... it's unacceptable. The Business Center access is also overly expensive. If you need to print something out, save yourself some money and go to FedexKinko's. The W will charge you 50 cents per page for black and white and $1.50 per page for color. I believe copy charges are the same. Just getting on to the internet in the business center will cost you a minimum of $8 for 15 minutes. I'm not sure what the rate is after that, but I'll bet you'd pay close to $20 for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: charlie34567
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, rooms are very modern and clean. The service is amazing and they realy do everything to make your life simple and make you feel comfortable. On thursdays, the reception area transforms into a very trendy disco with loud music: great atmosphere but no noise around the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but great location”
Reviews.Author: travel-happy08
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay once Latika changed our suite to one with a better layout. Bell hop really friendly and helpful. Great bar, whiskey blue. But there is no restaurant except for breakfast. Great fun hotel but look for offers before you book. Beware of very small rooms and tiny tiny bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: professor_eNewYork
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC for our 30th Anniversary. Staying at the W Hotel was a wonderful experience! We used our Starwoods points for a two-night stay and upgraded to a "Mega Room" on the 14th Floor, corner room. (but be prepared it is still small) The room is contemporary minimalist... absolutely loved the lighting! The entire design of the W Hotel is quite interesting and low lighting everywhere. Very inviting feel and the Lobby bar is a great place to relax and unwind with a cocktail. We enjoyed breakfast at "Heartbeat"... delicious. The staff is friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a great location, directly across from the Waldorf Astoria. Don't forget to book a free ride at the "Acura Desk", they take you wherever you would like! Highly recommend the W Hotel, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Services”
Reviews.Author: hsquare99
Reviews.Content: I had the best experience in my 20 years of business travel last week while I was at this hotel. Cindy the young lady that works at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure my stay at the hotel was a special experience. I was so delighted that I intend on only staying at this hotel on each and every trip I take to New York city. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “The best service and front desk in New York”
Reviews.Author: sfzipper
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the W on Lex for years on business (very convenient to all my clients/partners/investors in midtown). My last trip just highlighted how incredible the staff at the W is, especially my Janaina at the front desk. She, along with the whole front desk, management, doormen really brighten up my day every time I see them. There is always a nice note, bottle of champagne, and most important a smile and hug every time I get off a long flight to check in. If you can, make it a plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jahlygirl
Reviews.Content: The W New York is the flagship W hotel. The rooms were small, but decorated very nicely and more importantly.....were clean. The hotel is right across from the Waldorf Astoria and the Intercontinental Barclay. It's within walking distance of grand central station and times square, but a cab/train ride away from the nightlife in the meatpacking district. The view was standard for NY, tall buildings, and a parking garage. I did not eat the food here or go to the Whiskey Bar, but the lounge and bar areas were always packed. The staff were very friendly. I would def. recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal...we were able to book here for $125/night through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for fun NYC weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kinnagoebay
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Modern hip comfy lobby. Nice bar. Great professional staff. Loved the bottled water when we checked in. Free wifi in the lobby. Our first room was on the small side, but well appointed and comfortable except for a strange smell. (maybe a pet accident?) Anyhow, went to reception to address the smell. Received a sincere apology and a new ungraded room which was a bit bigger than the first one and had two windows facing the street. Loved the room, lots of lighting options, ipod dock, bliss products and comfy bed. Great location - walked to almost everywhere we wanted to go or just a short cab ride away. Got a great rate for our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The W on Lexington is a great hotel to get away from the noise.”
Reviews.Author: JuliaBSF
Reviews.Content: Staying in NY for business can be quite hectic, and most of the hotels, especially those in times square, can be noisy and crouded. Walking into the W on Lexington is refreshing and morever, the hotel employees are kind and friendly. I have stayed here several times and Gloria Morales, who works at the front desk has always gone out of her way to make me feel welcome and help me when I have mixed up my reservations. The hotel is great, the service is friendly, and the gym is much larger than the one at many other NY hotels. The food at the bar could be better, but overall a great NY hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in midtown”
Reviews.Author: Gerry7517
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal online--otherwise we might not have stayed here. The hotel was lovely, modern and spare. The room was small by US standards, but new, fresh, with great amenities. We'd stay again in a nanosecond if we got a deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel is a Great location and the staff is the Best . Travel every month and would choice to stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: ShelliD
Reviews.Content: From the moment you are greeted at the door to the front desk staf,then as you are taking to your room by (Teddy) and while you are staying Jessie will make sure that your room is clean from top to bottom. Tim Mcdonald is the person to thank for your rooms. As you can see this hotel is very much like staying in your home away from home for any length of stay. The energy of the bar / lobby is a great place to have a drink or entertain friends or business meeting. I rate this a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great hotel for travel with young kids”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonType
Reviews.Content: This is a standard W, but I was really surprised at how wonderful it was for families with young kids. The rooms are tiny (typical NYC), but the staff worked hard to make sure we had a room with a bathtub, clean and nice crib, and other standard fixtures for infants. While we saw many other young kids and babies on our floor, the soundproofing was terrific inside the rooms and we never heard the other guests at night. Great location for walking around the city and heading into Central Park. A really pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hospitality”
Reviews.Author: PBT14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The W in order to attend my Dad's funeral in NYC. So - the occasion was not a happy one, but the staff at the W - especially Cindy Cabrera was simply the best. From welcoming us, providing an upgraded room, and Cindy's attentiveness to my 6 year old son (little gift bags), our stay was a true pleasure. Even the concierge's recommendation for a sushi restaurant was "spot on". Great food and atmosphere. We will stay at The W on our next trip, and look forward to seeing Cindy -- who is a true ambassador for the W New York.

Reviews.Title: “WHATEVER, WHENEVER - The Customer Service Was OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Felicia13000
Reviews.Content: The tag line "Whatever, Whenever" is one that the staff lives . . . from the front desk to the operators. However, one staff person in particular stands out - PATRICK HINDS. Patrick was absolutely PHENOMENAL. My husband and I have visited many Starwood Properties across the country and I can tell you that this young man is an asset and shining star among the Starwood Properties. I called Patrick a couple of days and advance and he provided me with all of the particulars - show options, resturant information, trains to take to our prescheduled destinations and more. Not only did he share some information on the phone but he even emailed me to ensure that I had all of the options and a few other suggestions as well. During our stay, I got turned around a couple of times and was able to give him a call he was "all hands on deck." He was responsive, prompt and on point with his suggestions. Patrick Hinds made our stay more enjoyable because he provided "WHATEVER, WHENEVER" we needed it. The only downside was that the beds were small. Both my husband and I are over 6 feet tall and the rooms were a little tight BUT hey this is NYC we expected the small rooms. Overall though - we had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewer232
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! We had a problem with the room but Jessie S. the Housekeeping Supervisor resolved it. She was so friendly and made us feel welcome. We are loyal SPG Platinum members. Also the front desk agents are pretty good. Cant wait to go back. Great value at category 5 compared to union square or times square at a cat 6.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: dgla
Reviews.Content: Excited to move away from the Time Square area and over to the W....Very disappointed with the housekeeping aspects of the upgraded rm I was given...From the moment, Jessie, the housekeeping manager became involved, everything improved dramatically!!!! She is wonderful and amazing and because of Jessie I will definitely return to this W location....In the future, I would request that she be involved with my rm from the moment I check in. The W is so lucky to have her on board...Also, Edna, at the front desk is wonderful!!!!!!!!! I look forward to a return visit, because of there two wonderful ladies!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mps20
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to the W new York for his birthday and had the BEST experience. Everyone was very helpful and the accommodations were incredible! Augustine Saylee, who is the W Insider went above and beyond to make our trip memorable. I highly recommend staying at the W New York, as you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tlr191
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on Lexington for our wedding weekend, as did about 10 of our family members and friends. Without question, this W over-performed and felt like a home away from home. Valerie Solodukho was our contact for our room block and stay and we had extensive communication and responsiveness from her. Having the Bliss spa (see Natalya for a massage) inside the hotel only added to our better than ever stay in NYC. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “First time in a W and will take a lot for it not to be the last”
Reviews.Author: LifeTravelPhilly
Reviews.Content: It all started when I walked by three employees upon entering the hotel and was greeted by the welcome sign projected on the floor-not the employees. The receptionist seemed to be in a bad mood and not very helpful at all. When leaving our bags, we were pointed to the "end of the front desk" and waited for several minutes before getting helped. The gentlemen helping with my bags, when they did arrive, were very nice and helpful. Later in the day, we asked if there was wireless in the room, I was told there was only a cable internet service available. This seemed odd to me, and a big disappointment since I was planning to work out of my room. I decided to use the hotel's business center for internet service, very expensive printing but at least the service is provided. When I returned to my room and got back on my lap top, I noticed that there was wireless available after all! How does the front desk not know the type of internet provided! As other reviews indicate, the room is small and the air conditioning unit is super loud. Even when I tried to turn the a/c off completely, the fan was still working and kept me up most of the night. However, the bed is very comfortable. For two people, the queen size room is WAY too small! Nothing that is really W's fault, but no AMC out of the 40+ channels they provide! Missed Mad Men, but that's a personal complaint. No complaints on the bathroom, it was clean, plenty of bath products and towels were provided. An extra towel request took about 15 minutes. Don't get me started on the sensor in room food, the sign is not very clear at all and I am sure causes a head ache for many guests. Overall, I would recommend the lobby if you want to hang out and get a drink and then go check in to another local hotel nearby, plenty of options in the area!

Reviews.Title: “LAMIKA at the W NY is the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: eppy71
Reviews.Content: The W NY is my go-to hotel when I'm in New York. I travel to NYC for business very often and find that I get the best service at the W NY. The staff is absolutely wonderful! Especially LaMika at the Welcome Desk. She is always very pleasant and goes above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable. She is awesome!! The hotel is very modern and has a great ambiance. I would definitely recommend this hotel for all business and leisure travelers!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Romantic break, or spa”
Reviews.Author: EL_2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now, small room but very comfortable, the view was a bit grim the room is what mattered. Love the Bliss Spa products. I found the staff OK, but not particuarly friendy, especially in the bar area where we had to wait ages to get served (every time). But I would stay here again. Also you must try the chips with truffle oil!

Reviews.Title: “This place is my idea of hell. Writhing...”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen129
Reviews.Content: This place is my idea of hell. Writhing souls, incessant din, rude staff, dimly lit. When I complained about the lack of light in my room, one of the Satanic underlings said "It's part of our concept." Every place is entitled to their concept, I guess, but Priceline loses a lot of credibility as it keeps trying to foist this dog off on its customers as a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, but small room with dirty courtyard view”
Reviews.Author: MattBavaria
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel but revenue maximization to the maximum. Small room and hefty prices for beverages and food (New York?). The lobby turns bar/disco in the evening. The location is definitely great. The "ladies" at the reception are a bit too cool for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location...”
Reviews.Author: tmosley
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the W New York hotel. It's in a pretty centralized location wth good subway accessability. If I had any one complaint, it would be that the rooms are a bit on the tiny side, but I guess that can't be helped. The entire staff of the W New York on Lexington ave. made our stay there very enjoyable; and the concierge staff (particularly Lisa) were all very accomodating and made sure that we were well taken care of. Already being a SPG member, because of the excellent experience I had over the past weekend, I am strongly considering making the W hotels my 1st lodging choice when I travel anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “W on Lexington Ave.--not our usual Starwood hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: pjrwalsh
Reviews.Content: Although not informed at booking or during several calls to the hotel, our request for adjoining rooms lost us 50 sq. So instead of our usual Starwood upgrade, we were downgraded. No free rollaway or breakfast coupons compensated for the cramped space. Our final bill listed a $148 charge for touching sensored mini-bar items, which resulted in a ten-minute dispute at the reception desk. We needed 3 replacement keys, resulting in being locked out of a room with a baby inside (in a crib, thankfully). Dry cleaning took 3 calls and an extra day to get returned. The hotel took 2 hours for the rollaway and crib to arriveâ€”crying baby waiting. The bathroom was better suited for contortionists. The check-in associate asked me to write a good review on TripAdvisor and use her name, which she wrote on my key card. The W on Lexington Ave. has a long way to go to match our usually satisfying Starwood hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: tennis2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was service plus. Friendly, courteous staff from the gentlemen who greeted us at the door to the chambermaids who always said good morning or good afternoon with a smile. Great location, close to all major sites. Rooms a little "cosy" but always nice and clean, plus we did not spend a lot of time in our rooms. If you go to the front desk ask for Mario or Gloria.

Reviews.Title: “small room, too much noise, poor service not very clean”
Reviews.Author: ElenaCap
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom really very very small, bad soundproofing and bad smell in rooms. Very noisy air conditioning system. Very bad experience with the staff often unqualified. Cool lobby, with music and dj.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is perfectly located, clean and has a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: vambarso
Reviews.Content: When my brother and I first arrived at the hotel we were disappointed with the room. They had given us a tiny room with one queen bed, even though we had requested two beds when we had booked the hotel 5 months in advanced. While a particular staff member was rude and reluctant to change our room, others promised to have the problem resolved when there were available rooms. On the second morning employee Mario Quijano took care of our problem, apologized for the rude staff-member and made sure that we were comfortable throughout our stay. He is the nicest, most genuine staff member I have ever dealt with at any hotel. The hotel itself is very trendy with cool bars and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Cast your glance elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Foreveryoung_9
Reviews.Content: We have choices in life & a visit to the Big Apple should be memorable. The room was tiny,dark & not up to standard as expected from a W Hotel. Do not let outward appearances beguile you,like the vibey Lobby,it's back at 'the ranch' aka the bedroom itself that really counts.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: mhlc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with unbelievable service. we went to New York to spend our 30th anniversary and were greeted by Edna at the front desk. She made us feel so special. We had never stayed here before, but felt like family by the time we finished checking in. Thanks to Lamika and Mario for their warm reception as well. The hotel is contemporary, with a youthful vibe. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: pam_cakes1979
Reviews.Content: Anyone who didn't have a good stay here must have pissed someone off because my stay here was great! A co-worker and I came to NY for 5 nights. I will be the first one to say I am a little jaded about W hotels because my experience at the San Francisco hotel hasn't been that great. First and foremost, I want to mention Denzel in particular. He is a greeter in the front of the hotel. He is one of the most pleasant human beings I have met in a long time. Everyone was wonderful, but he stood out the most to me. His demeanor was so relaxed, so friendly, and so comfortable. Hopefully you will be one of the lucky ones to have a chat with this man. On to the rest of my experience-as soon as we pulled up it was nothing but amazing customer service from EVERY (EVERY!!!) single employee. We dealt with the door staff, the bell men, the front desk staff, the bartenders, the waiters, the cocktail waiters, the housekeeping staff-practically everyone and they all seemed to go the extra mile to help us out. We booked a single bed room because doubles weren't available, but as soon as we asked, the front desk provided us with a double bed room. She even offered to have an air purifier put in the room since it was next to some smoking rooms, but we didn't notice a smell at all. Over the next 5 days we actually started to mistakenly call the hotel "home" because it felt so comfortable. Now, for the room sizes and the ambiance of the hotel. The W hotels are supposed to feel more boutique-y so don't expect grandiose rooms and bathrooms. Plus, this is New York, so small rooms I think are a given. My only qualm is the bathrooms are really dimly lit. Which really sucks for make-up application. I would completely stay here again. In fact, the next time I come to New York, I'm for sure staying here again. Thank you W Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Yeshaira!”
Reviews.Author: misscan
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about having booked this hotel after reading some reviews... but from the moment I stepped in this hotel, all my fears were put aside. The atmosphere of the hotel is lively and fun. Yeshaira was my check in agent who went above and beyond to make my stay so special. Check in was a breeze and the room was a decent size. It was really clean and well decorated. Location is great, it's about a 15 minute walk to Times Square, and the subway station is a 2 minute walk. The next day, Yeshaira upgraded me to a fabulous suite and gave me a credit for the bar which I didn't even ask for. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as the service was unbelievable. The staff addressed any issue within a reasonable amount of time and always followed through on what they said they were going to do. Concierge was a great help as well. All in all, what a great, service-oriented hotel. I could not be happier with the service and the rooms. Thanks again and I'll see you soon, Yeshaira!! --Meena

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Teeny Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: McMax
Reviews.Content: Flew into New York last Friday night on a mileage run, and picked the W New York because it was the closest Starwood property to a restaurant I was meeting a friend at the next morning for brunch. I'm typically a fan of W Hotels, having stayed at many of their properties throughout the United States. W Hotels trade on its hipster atmosphere, and modern designs. Even knowing that, I was still a bit surprised by the W New York. After a $40 cab ride from LaGuardia, I walked into the lobby (at 10:30 p.m. on a Friday night), and was immediately pelted by the din of an endless sea of people. The lobby and lounge area, and the Whiskey Blue Bar, are apparently where lots and lots of New Yorkers hang out on a Friday night. It was really, really noisy and crowded. Coming off a long day of flying, it wasn't particularly relaxing. However, check-in was very efficient, and I was up at my room on the 14th floor within minutes. The room surprised me as well. Despite being upgraded (as a Starwood elite), I still was shocked as to how small the room was. It seemed about half the size of a non-New York W Hotel room. The bathroom was no better. A pedestal sink was too oversized, and the toilet was sandwiched between the pedestal sink and the tub/shower. It was a bit uncomfortable. The bed was your typical W bed--very comfortable and soothing. However, what made up for the hotel room was the W New York's location. (If you read my prior reviews, you'll see how important location is to me.) It's about 3 to 4 blocks easy walk to the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station and Park Avenue. A little bit farther to the UN. And, if you're cabbing it over to Hell's Kitchen (where I was meeting my friend), you pass through Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and Radio City. Subway stop is a couple blocks away as well. Would I stay at the W New York again? Perhaps, depending on where I needed to be in New York. It meets the typical W Hotel standards (service, room quality), but as other reviewers have stated, the rooms are shockingly small. Price-wise ($220/night), it was a little pricey, too. But, in the end, the hotel's location made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: holsteincows
Reviews.Content: Like others have noted the rooms are small but that's what we expected in NY. We had such amazing person assist us in our stay. The most impressionable employee was Lisa "Montana"! She was so friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. She went above and beyond the employee job description. She knew us by name and introduced us to other staff should we need assistance when she wasn't working. She made such an amazing impression that we have told all our friends we arrived home. Because of her insight we were able to maneuver throughout NY with ease and no intrepedation. We hopped on & off buses, subways and was able to see all the sights we wanted on our trip. I hope all can have the same experience we did during our stay! Thank you so much "Montana"!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the W but rooms are Small”
Reviews.Author: SoloSpaGirl
Reviews.Content: I had planned a night out with my sisters so we booked this hotel, asked for 3 beds..... I walked into the room and there was 2 twin size beds.. I haven't seen a twin size bed since room at my parents house when I was 10 years old. But as always the room was clean, neat and super cool. I called the front to ask them if they can help me with my dilemma. I told them there was 3 of us staying and there was not even room on the floor. He told me how this was a hotel that is usually meant for 2 guests, but thank goodness he was able to move me to a king bed room which was rather large with tons of floor space. Club downstairs looked super cool but we decided to go out elsewhere. Loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay there, but for the money .. I'll look elsewhere next time. Room had no view and was cramped. But everything was clean and the ambiance was excellent. Great staff and lots of little touches. In all, glad I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!!!”
Reviews.Author: brw82
Reviews.Content: This W was in the PERFECT location business-wise. It's in close proximity to Grand Central and there are plenty of restaurants in the restaurant. I'm staying here for a month and am definitley happy with my decision. Everyone talks about how the small the rooms are, but given my long-term stay, I was able to get a nice sized room that was very spacious. I also have to say the service here was AMAZING!! Everyone was very polite and extremely helpful, form the front desk to the restaurant staff. One young lady, Yeshaira R., was the most pleasant person and extermely understanding. Definitely a must visit! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A great friendly and vibrant hotel with great rooms and great smiling staff.f”
Reviews.Author: PatrickGroombridge
Reviews.Content: From the great rooms to the fab lounge area its a great atmosphere and a great place to chill and to make new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: combono3
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Clean and Convenient. Stay in room522 for 6 nights and got really good services from waitress Vicky and Nana. They are thoughful and polite!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for young children”
Reviews.Author: supermaggy
Reviews.Content: If you have young children I would not recommend this hotel. First, you should ask if a crib will fit in your room since not every room can accomodate one. Second, ask if your room is near construction. I tried putting my baby down for a nap and there was drilling and banging going on all afternoon. It took a full hour and three calls before anyone got back to me regarding this issue. Third, I called the concierge about children friendly activities. They were so busy that I left a message. Needless to say, no on returned my call. This is a swanky hotel for singles and young couples, but not for families w/ young children. I tried to contact the general manager during our stay, but his assistant took 48 hours to get back to me. In the end, they merely gave us a few starwood points as compensation.

Reviews.Title: “The W did not meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGuest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in May and was really looking forward to it - based on the Whatever whenever spiel I had been given - but I have to say that I was underwhelmed. We checked in late - at about 10pm and the music in the bar area was so loud that we could not hear the Receptionist. Our room was very stylish with the usual Starwood extra comfortable bed that you dont want to get out of and nice Bliss toiletries in the bathroom We went for breakfast the next morning and were asked to wait for a table - even though the restaurant was half empty. There were lots of tables with dirty breakfast things on and these did not seem to be being cleared away - after 10 minutes wait we left and had breakfast outside of the hotel. After this first taste we didnt bother going back to the hotel restaurant for the rest of our stay We booked the Accura Service which is a drop off service that you can use and was a great selling point for the hotel. We booked it for 10am but he didnt turm up until 10.15 - fortunately we werent in a hurry - but were bored hanging around in the lobby waiting for it to finally arrive We also tried to book a couple of restaurants via the concierge but found her to be unfriendly and offhand All in all I was quite disappointed with the stay. The room was lovely, but the much vaunted service failed to materialise. I recently stayed at a Fairmont property in Canada and the service was far superior

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: tails22
Reviews.Content: Recently made first visit to NYC for fun, been there for business, booked at the W - New York City (Lexington and 50th) using Priceline (got great deal)... the hotel was outstanding, while the rooms are on the small side we found them very comfortable and since we weren't staying in the room much it was really perfect. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable and the shower nice and hot. All of the staff were polite and helpful. The location is perfect for exploring the city, Grand Central Station is a few blocks away if you want subway access and walking to Times Sq, Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Center, Theaters and even Central Park was easy. Plenty to do without ever jumping in a cab. I highly recommend the W and would choose to stay there every time I go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Manager Commended”
Reviews.Author: 007Guest007
Reviews.Content: Greetings, I am currently staying at the W New York- 541 Lexington Ave â€“ and wanted to provide feedback on my experience. Upon review of my file, you will find I have stayed at this location through the majority of July and August 2010; currently in room 765. Considering the competition in the immediate square block (e.g., Waldorf Astoria, Marriot, etc), you may ask what keeps me loyal? It is a dedicated, professional and friendly manager â€“ Semije Popovic. It was S. Popovic accommodation in early July, when my Marriot reservation was cancelled, that brought me to the W and her attention to detail that keep me here. Please commend her appropriately. Regards, Guest

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the staff”
Reviews.Author: farfelu
Reviews.Content: There are hundreds of hotels in Manhattan but I always go back to the W New York on Lexington and 49th because of the staff, particularly Mario at the front desk. He is professional yet friendly, always remembers my name and makes sure I get terrific service.

Reviews.Title: “Functional with a boutique touch for a large chain”
Reviews.Author: CRtor
Reviews.Content: Helpful/receptive staff, pleasant room, in a relatively quiet part of Manhattan while it's walking distance to any midtown destination, and Grand Central. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DannyCrespo
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for check-in we were received by Mr. Mario Quijano the welcome desk agent and he was very outgoing, friendly and made sure we had all the commodities and information of the hotel and surrounding areas for the entire weekâ€¦and that's something that you will not find almost anywhere else in the big apple. Thanks W and Mr. Quijano for an excellent week in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feeling”
Reviews.Author: JHP_Zuidervliet
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel gave me a mixed feeling about how to rate it. The hotel could be really good but certain events made it less delightful. For starters we arrived after a long flight in front of the hotel and normally there is a bellboy yet here there isn't. So when you get into the lobby you find out the ground floor is covered in scaffolding which of course didn't improve the atmosphere of the entrance. Then you get greeted by the personnel which is dressed rather casual, ie a t-shirt which in my opinion might be a bit to easy going. So far so good we got in our room though it's called a Spectacular room it made me wonder what a normal room looks like. The only difference I could figure out is that they have a slightly bigger floorsize but further are equipped the same. The room itself had what's called a touch of design though a touch of design requires a bit extra attention in cleaning which clearly here didn't happen. Everywhere was dust to be found. After spending the night and finding out the AC made weird sounds while "gearing" we went to get our continental breakfast which was served in a paper cup and a plastic plate like you use for a barbecue. After spending 5 nights (nothing can be said about the people working everybody is cheerful) receiving two faulty bills I won't spend here a night again.

Reviews.Title: “Life doesn't begin at 40 with the W New York”
Reviews.Author: JKlondon09
Reviews.Content: Despite the unconvincing reviews about this hotel i booked a 3 day stay as part of my 40th birthday celebrations. i felt confident my stay would be a success as i booked a fantastic suite which clearly indicated it would be 500 sq ft; i am an spy gold member; and i was sure they would be sympathetic to my forthcoming mid life crisis. After a 1 hour wait for a room to be ready at 7pm we given a most miserable excuse for a suite i have even seen - around 300 sq ft at most with a poor quality view and a shower room ( no bath) that you could barely turn around in. Despite passionately complaining they said no other room was available and offered the paltry compensation of breakfast and 5000 spg points. Even this was a lie - we never received them. Whilst i am a great fan of w hotels, this is definitely one to avoid. False advertising and false promises are not clever and are not what one expects from a supposedly luxury hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Edna was great!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon11109
Reviews.Content: My mother doesn't visit New York all that often, and so when she was coming this time around, I wanted to make sure she stayed in the best hotel in New York that was also reasonably priced. I suggested she stay at the W Hotel, located on Lexington Avenue between 49th and 50th Streets. When we got there, a very nice woman named Edna checked my mother in. I emphasized to Edna that I want my mother to have the best room possible. Well, when we got to the room, it was terrible. It faced an alley-way, was dark, and the telephone didn't work (room 709 -- never stay in this room; it's cramped, very dark and ridiculous)! So I called down to the desk on my cell phone and spoke with Angelina who said she would take care of it while we were on our way back down. We got to the desk and saw Edna again. She felt terribly, so she put us in another room that ended up being very fabulous (room 650)! She was also kind to give us two free tickets for drinks for our trouble and inconvenience. Edna made my Mother's trip to New York a memorable one. Thanks, Edna! Sharon Louden

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: jnikoras
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about our recent stay at the W New York. I had made 2 sets of reservations: one for 7-23 through 7-26 and another for 7-25 through 7-26. The 2nd reservation was for my mother who was celebrating her 70th birthday. I spoke with one of your reservations the morning of 7/25 (I unfortunately didn't get her name, she was in the last station/position by Augustine sp?) and told her about my mother's birthday. She arranged for my mom and great aunt whom she was traveling with, to stay in an available suite for the night. Augustine arranged for cheesecake and fruit to be delivered to their room as well. Both of which, I can tell you, were a HUGE hit. Later that evening, we were chauffeured by the promotional Acura service furnished by your hotel to the Neil Simon theatre to see Harry Connick, Jr. It was a day she and I will always remember and it started with the impression left by your staff and your hotel. Thank you for helping to make her birthday a special one and for making me look so good! Many thanks to all your staff especially to those referred to above. We attempt to stay in NYC as often as we are able and have stayed in several Starwood hotels in the city. This stay was a special one for us all and when planning our next stay in your fair city, we plan to book our stay in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay but would look for an alternative next time”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: good recognition for elite status, My room was small but renovated, Very friendly staff, they wanted to charge me $9 per parcel I had ordered to be delivered at the hotel ... charge has eventually been deleted from my bill. Charged me $50 one week after I left as a duplication...and still wait for the refund. Lots of tourists

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but good service, great location & a chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: coasterlink
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of W Hotels, but after reading some reviews, I was concerned about the stay I booked at the W New York. I am happy to report that most of the negative things I read about in other reviews were not an issue for me. The room was indeed small, but that's typical for Manhattan and considering there was just one bed, there was still plenty of room left for luggage and a workspace. The layout of the furnishings seems to make the most of the space, including a small, but deep closet. The bathroom was somewhat small, but still a reasonable size ans fully functional. There was only a shower as some complained about, but it was roomy and quite convenient. There were also two shelves to place toiletries and whatnot, despite not having any counter space around the sink. All of the staff were quite nice and helpful.
