When there were two problems with my final checkout bill, I was expecting to discover some of the snobby and curt service described by others, but instead, the front desk clerk was pleasant, helpful and apologetic and quickly got me a corrected receipt. The lobby with all of its scented candles is downright sexy and a most comfortable place for adults to hang out and unwind. As with most W hotels, the vibe carries over to the room, but to a lesser degree. The room, however small, is quite comfy with a very comfortable bed and whimsical touches expected from W hotels, such as the two dimmer switches by the bed that can change functional lighting to mood lighting. Perhaps my only gripe is the overstocked and overpriced mini bar with sensors that allegedly charge your room when something is moved--and this includes several items sitting on top--such space in the small room would be more welcome as open space as opposed to "do not touch or you'll be charged" space. Add to all that such a great location that is within a short walk of a multitude of subway lines (including those that service Grand Central Station just a few blocks down the street) and a reasonably short walk to the theater district, the W New York is definitely a winner.

Reviews.Title: “WWWWWANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: jpsk
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional from the moment we arrived until the time we unfortunately had to return home. The staff were all very energetic and happy to help. In particular, Lisa and Sofia. Lisa took the time to recommend restaurants and nightlife and was very helpful in making our reservations. Sofia, always made sure every morning to ask how our previous day went and if there was anything that her or anyone else could do to make our stay at the W more enjoyable. The W was in walking distance to everything we want to see; Rockefeller Centre, Time Square, shopping on Park Ave and only a 15 minute cab ride to Soho and the Meat acking district. I would recommend that everyone experience what the W New York has to offer. Jay Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “First class and professionally managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhodymetsfan
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC all the time and stay at many different hotels. I was extremely impressed by the W by every measure. Starting with the front desk help...very professional, they genuinely "cared" about providing good customer service. While waiting to check in on a hot August day, a staffer was busy handing guests with cold bottled water. The rooms were great...my teenagers loved the iPod chargers and my wife enjoyed the Bliss products. This is a property that is very, very well managed...clearly, the GM runs a tight ship, to the benefit of the customer. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “A charming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a three night Manhattan getaway. The hotel was very attractive, the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable and quiet. We would recommend the hotel and stay here again. We got our reservations through Priceline -- hotels in Manhattan are never cheap and rarely spacious, but I felt we got good value for what we paid. When we checked in, I asked very politely if we could be upgraded. The front desk clerk upgraded us from a "cozy" room to a "spectacular" room at no extra charge. The room was not large but it was sufficient, and from what I read in other reviews here, it represented a big improvement on the "cozy" choice. Once we closed the door, we heard very little noise from either the hallway or the street. We were on the sixth floor. The bed was very luxurious and we slept well. The bathroom was small (and not very private with the frosted glass door), but well appointed with space to put your stuff. There is a dock for your iPod and wired and wireless internet connections (which I didn't test). There are lots of easily accessible electrical outlets. The concierge answered all our questions and made some great recommendations for sightseeing and getting around the city. There is a spa, but we didn't visit it. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant twice. The food was good, if a bit pricey, with plenty of healthy choices. The service was efficient and friendly. Our main purpose in visiting New York is to attend theater, and the hotel was within reasonable walking distance of the Broadway theaters, assuming you are an avid walker. Otherwise, it is a short cab ride. The neighborhood feels very safe and there are lots of stores, restaurants, coffee shops and other amenities. There is a street fair on Lexington in front of the hotel on Sundays. In sum, I would highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy your stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is excellent, particularly Semije Popovic stands out from the rest of staff”
Reviews.Author: RB2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel for the past 2 years averaging 1 to 2 nights every week. Semije Popovic was the first staff member to recognize me as a repeat customer. She is in tune with the client's needs for rapid check in, access to critical amenities and comforts of home away from home. She was always there to greet clients with a friendly face and smile. Highly recommend the hotel, largely due to Semije approach to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: evanjake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with friends for the weekend and we really had a great time at this hotel. The lobby was so nice and comfortable and the hotel was perfectly located. It made our getway weekend without kids really memorable. The concierge was helpful in suggesting restaurants and nighclubs. Scott the hotel manager went out of his way to assist us and to make sure we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonJean911
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the W hotel where I spent 2 nights with my wife and 2 boys. I have to admit I was a bit worried before getting there after reading the various comments on trip advisor but it turned out we had an extraordinary experience at this hotel. It was a first for us at a W hotel since I usually stay at the Hyatt chain. I prefered by far the W to the Grand Hyatt NY. iI cannot compare with other NY hotels since these are the only 2 I have stayed at. The customer service has been extraordinary and they did everything they could to accomodate us. A special thanks to Nicole, Tim and Jessie. When we arrived, our room was not ready (15h30) but they asked us to come back around 18h00 and it would be ready. They gave us complimentary drinks at the hotel which was fine with me:) Then at 18h00 it was still not ready but the room controller then upgraded us to a suite which was great. They greated us again with coupons while we waited a few minutes for the suite:) Although the room was not ready, we have been taken care of and they made sure we were satisfied. In the end, we finished with a suite a free drinks so it can't be better than this. The hotel is walking distance from time squares, central park, grand central station.

Reviews.Title: “Yeshaira Robles is a great representative for your brand.”
Reviews.Author: gtpbrown
Reviews.Content: I stay at the W New York frequently for business. Yeshaira Robles at the front desk is always a pleasure to deal with. She always greets me a with a smile and a warm hello. In addition, Yeshaira is always able to help me with any needs I may have. She is a credit to the W. Gail Perfetto

Reviews.Title: “Yeshaira Robles provides a legendary service experience!”
Reviews.Author: BethR0611
Reviews.Content: Yeshaira Robles, a front desk associate at the W New York consistently ensures that my experience is outstanding. Travelling for business as often as I do, Yeshaira ensures that I am very well taken care of. I feel like the W New York is my home away from home, due to Yeshaira's high level of touch. Thank you, Mr. Maynard for employing such a wonderful representitive of your brand.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - clean but not much outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dbron0000
Reviews.Content: I travel to midtown NYC 3 or 4 times a year. There are many hotels in this area, and many rooms available in this price range. My room was somewhat small - and difficult to get to move lower the drapes or retrieve the remote control. The view was overlooking an interior location (the top of another building) - not picturesque but it was quiet... This area typically doesn't have too much noise late at night though. I tried it this time for a change of pace . Next time I think I'll look for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER stay here again, or recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: BiancaUK_10
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the hotel and truly regret having chosen this hotel. On all other trips to NYC we have stayed at Le Parker Meridien which is so much better than the W! Our experience at the W has been terrible! I had heard so many good things about the W hotels and really wanted to try one but after this experience will think twice! The check in staff were very brusque and not at all friendly; the room was tiny and very dark so we had to upgrade ourselves to a 'suite' which was more like a normal room size. The hotel had no bathrobes so I called to check if there should be one in the room and was informed that there should be and one would be sent right up; I had to make a further THREE calls before it was finally sent up, almost an hour and a half later! We had breakfast here only one morning and the quality of the food was very poor, not to be repeated. On a side note, our breakfast was still outside our room at 10 pm that evening despite having called room service to say we had finished! Overall, very disappointing, the only positive being the location!

Reviews.Title: “OK in some aspects, substandard in others”
Reviews.Author: 1HotelJunkie
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to New York, I switched my reservation to the W-New York due to the fact that I was able to reserve a "Fabulous Suite" at a decent rate. On my previous 5 visits to NY, I had stayed at the W-Times Square (which is in a different class altogether) but this time, unfortunately, I was unable to get a room at a reasonable rate for the 3 day duration I would be staying so I thought I would try the W-New York with the suite offer, and the fact that it was next door to the Marriott East Side where friends were staying. Upon my arrival, I was told that a suite was NOT available, and the only thing they had available for me was a "Cozy Room". 1st issue: Why did the online reservation system allow me to book a suite when none was available? 2nd issue: While the desk clerk was polite and demonstrated a genuine concern with the erroneous booking, the manager who was solicited because of the error was quite curt - did not apologize for the error, and simply stated that was all they had and that was that. In a nutshell, I was displeased within 5 minutes upon entering the hotel. SO - my visit started out pretty bad and left a bad taste in my mouth from the get go - As I said to the desk clerk upon check-in: "This was obviously a huge mistake on my part to have booked at this hotel". My apologies to the DoubleTree down the street where I canceled in order to stay at this W. Now the room - oh my - THIS WAS THE SMALLEST HOTEL ROOM I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!! So, from what I thought was going to be a suite to a large walk-in closet - you can imagine my feelings. So yada-yada, the stay started out very bad. On the good side - the room was very clean, tastefully appointed, and had the usual W amenities. The halls were nicely decorated and clean as well. The maids were very professional (especially the one I had on my 1st day - Hilda?) and attentive. Room service was pretty good (though pricey). All in all, though the hotel was OK in the end, this was my first, and last stay at the W New York. I've stayed now at 6 W properties, and this one is NOT on the same par with the others. Businesses should take note of why customers are dissatisfied and it started with the suite not being available (although I was able to book it on-line), but probably would have not been as bad had the manager on duty been more congenial and accommodating with the issue - it was her attitude that really set off my feelings from the start. Oh - I had to argue with her to reduce the rate initially (since I wasn't being given what had been promoted - as I saw it, a bait and switch tactic), and she was annoyed at my request. All that aside, the room was tiny - really tiny. And, the hotel really just didn't "Wow" me like the other W's where I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: pitbull4151
Reviews.Content: While on a business trip to New York I visited the W Hotel on Lexington for one nights stay. The conceirge's Lisa and David went above and beyond to ensure that I had everything I needed as well as make wonderful recommendations for entertainment and places to dine at. Additionally when I checked in, the manager went out of her way to get me the best possible room they had available mirroring the level of professionalism i received from both Lisa and David. I have yet to stay at a hotel in New York City where the customer service was at this level. Their reccomendations were all spot on and it truely made for a wonderful experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone whether on business or leisure. Thanks W on Lex. Matt

Reviews.Title: “What a Suite Stay”
Reviews.Author: lproller
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, the service was fabulous and our room was extraordinary. Our visit was almost perfect. Check-in was a little hectic but the W hotel made up for it with our gorgeous room and complimentary drinks.

Reviews.Title: “WOW... W just isn't enough”
Reviews.Author: govercash63
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York City so I was a little nervous about where to stay and all that. I read review after review on hotels in the city. We decided on the W since I had wanted to stay at a W hotel for some time. We arrived after 5 on Friday and the Living Room as they call it was alive with music and mingling. Check-in was quick and easy and the staff was very very polite. We chose a mega room for our stay. There was security in the lobby, very discretely dressed, known by the W pin on their lapel. After midnight or so you have to present your room key to get past the lobby. Our room was a corner room. After having read reviews about the size of New York hotel rooms I was impressed. We had a large space to relax in while we were in the room. Very modern in appearance and very clean. The lighting did leave a little to be desired in certain sections of the room, but for reading in bed or working at the desk it was fine. The housekeeping staff as well as other staff members always had a smile and a greeting when you met them in the halls. Refreshing is being done to the facade of the building yet we weren't disturbed by it at all. Apparently from information in one of the books in the room, this is the first W hotel. Located directly behind the Waldorf Astoria, a block from the 51st street subway, the location was great for access to most anywhere. The walk to Central Park, Madison Ave and Fifth Ave shopping was easy and pleasant. Directly behind the hotel is a great pizza restaurant, also 2 Italian restaurants and a Japanese restaurant. CVS is 3 blocks north. Anyway, great place to stay. Will definitely stay there again. The only complaint I have about the hotel is there are no drink machines in the building. I don't know if this is common in New York, but at 2 AM when you are thirsty, you don't want to call room service and have to wait and pay a small fortune for soda. Run to CVS when you get there and grab a soda or some water. There is a mini-bar in the room as well as snacks. The mini-bar and snack area are pressure sensitive so do be careful there.

Reviews.Title: “A truly 5 star experience from a 5 star staff!”
Reviews.Author: BenM2011
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the W on lexington for over 12-13 years and it has got to my overall best hotel experience ever! From the ambiance to the new room renovations and most importantly the staff, it has got to be one of the best! I travel all over the world and a good portion of my life is spent staying at hotels away from friends and family. It is precisely this reason that I continue to book in at the W because the staff treats me like family and always welcomes me back! At the front desk, I have come to know the staff very well such as Mario, Gloria and Liz. They are an absolute credit to the establishment, especially Liz P and my "W" experience wouldn't be the samer without them! Liz always greets me back with the warmest welcome and sees that every detail is taken care of so that my stay is always perfect. She even offers to check my future reservations and offers her assistance without my asking. I truly have never experienced such dedication that Liz gives to her guest. It is superb! Also, The room service staff is also amazing as well! They know me and welcome me back when I place a call to room service. Doristia in Room service, always knows how I like my eggs and what side I will select! That is dedication. I've been Starwood member for over 16 years and it is precisely the above reasons that I select a hotel for my travel needs. I have stayed at other hotels all over the world for just as many years but they consistently have staff turnover and the attention to details is lost. It is the highlight of my many trips to NYC to see the familiar faces of the staff and I applaud the W for reconizing this and for its continued efforts towards achieving excellence. Ben

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Habenulita
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had an excellent experience at the W New York hotel, so good in fact that we will definitely go back to this hotel next time we find ourselves in NYC. The lobby is very well decorated, very modern. Plenty of seating area just a few steps from the main desk - and to our surprise many guests make use of that space making the hotel seem fun, laid back, stylish and cozy. Our flight arrived in the early morning and we were concerned whether the hotel could accommodate an early check-in. To our surprise, given that the hotel seemed very busy, we got a room right away. The front desk staff were very pleasant and asked if we needed assistance with our luggage. Our room was located on the 6th floor. The room itself is a bit on the smaller side, and had little lighting besides a couple lights and the window, but the room was modern, fresh, cozy enough for 2 people and the bed was amazing - very plush, melt in the bed type of feel. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but very nicely done, enough room to set your toiletries on the counter above the sink. Overall, a great room and a great experience and a great location. It is away from the chaos of the theatre district and times square, however you can walk to those locations in just over 10 mins - another bonus! There is also a nice lounge/club/bar just to the left of the main entrance that is pretty busy and happening in the evenings. The one thing I noticed was that the main lobby and lounge were always filled with people and that added a nice, classy feel to the place. I would definitely recommend this to anyone considering this hotel. FYI - there is a mini bar in the room that is hooked up to sensors, so the minute you open the mini bar and take out a drink out of curiosity, your room will be charged, the same goes for the snacks below on the counter. There is a small sign indicating this, but not very visible.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: bossyboo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the W hotel in New York! The hotel was plush luxurious and the staff were very helpful - filling our room with balloons for my partner's birthday! We loved the style of the hotel, the atmosphere in the bar. The prices are expensive - but the style and elegance justifies this! New York's hotel rooms tend to be small in comparision to other destinations so book as big a room as your budget allows. Hope to come back again soon

Reviews.Title: “W New York is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mm1973025
Reviews.Content: I just want to give a shout out to W NEW YORK... Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable. Great staff, great vibe. When i first walked in i knew right away that my stay was going to be great. We had a Manager welcoming us, offering an assistance, directed us to the front desk and the person that checked me in was excellent (sorry i can't remember her name). We had one little issue with the keys not working, and I was in the rush but as we were waiting in line, one of the front desk managers offered help ( her name is I believe Semiji with long black hair) and she took the initiative not to only make our keys work but she brought us to our room to make sure that the keys are working & we are ready to go and make the show on time. Again, thank you W New York and the only place that I will be staying from now on is 541 Lexington Ave between 49th & 50th street. I will def.. recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location, but Don't Pay Full Price”
Reviews.Author: ms174
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband over Memorial Day weekend. We booked it on Priceline, so we only paid $125/night. We were happy with what we got; however, if we had paid $200+ we definitely would have expected more (even in New York). The rooms are tiny, even by New York City standards, and you're well-advised not to order room service, as the pricing on seemed shady. ($5 delivery fee, plus tax, plus an automatic gratuity--strange, as you would think a gratuity would cover the delivery.. especially.when the delivery is simply upstairs.) The provided toiletries were awesome--much better than similar hotels. The hallways were extremely dark, in a way that made the entire place seem a little bit dingy rather than hip (which is what I think they were going for). The check-in staff were not very friendly, but everyone else throughout the hotel was nice. We paid $16 for wireless in-room internet, but it was too slow to be useful. My wireless pulled it up and was able to connect, but listed it as the slowest connection in the area (my laptop suggested that I try faster connections from the hotels up the street). Overall, it was a nice hotel and you cannot beat the location. However, I would characterize it as 3 1/2 stars at most--no way it lives up to 4 star hotels. We were happy with our stay here, but would not seek it out in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MMeRR
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 15th floor extremely small and bathroom ridiculous. People at the Front Office and Concierge unfriendly, no customer care at all. I think you can find a better solution for 250 $ per night without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Beryl1950
Reviews.Content: Please accept this review as my sincerest thank you for the WONDERFUL stay at the penthouse suite at the W Hotel New York. I assume W means Wonderful. We loved the elegant rooms, the fine champagne and berries and most of all our outdoor resort-like terrace where we enjoyed cocktails and appetizers, dined more than once and delved into perfectly dreamy desserts provided by Jesse the diligent Housekeeping Mgr. When she found out it was my birthday she wanted to arrange a special treat. Special kudos to Mike in housekeeping (very attentive to all our needs), Kevin at the front desk, Scott the bellman and Jason the bartender for making the trip extra special. We are frequent NYC travelers and plan on making this W our new home. The room renovation looks fantastic. We are very grateful to the W Hotel and how they treated my husband and I during a special birthday weekend.....making getting older...getting better. Sincerely, Beryl B. Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “They made my special birthday year even better!”
Reviews.Author: KeyLimeTraveller
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully responsive and supber attention to making my stay a stellar experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Chic Hotel--Definitely Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: motherbored
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel on Lexington Avenue represents the model for how a hotel should be run. The staff is trained such that they are knowledgeable, professional, customer-focused, attentive and delighted you have chosen to stay at their hotel. The hotel is meticulously maintained and has a rich offering of services and amenities. The W is centrally located to EVERYTHING NYC has to offer, but not in the mayhem of all the traffic and noise. The lobby is open and welcoming and offers cocktail and light food fare. This is a great bar on the premises, which my daughter and friends frequented and said it was great. The rooms are stylishly metropolitan with chrome and modern furniture, feature Chiaroscuro lighting, rich textured wall-coverings and appointments; and are pristine. The bed is wonderfully comfortable with high-thread count sheets and a down comforter. The bathroom is clean, modern, with a great shower--a tad small if you are a tad large. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. We felt safe and cared for during our stay. Lovely! Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre for Starwood Chain”
Reviews.Author: waukeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were a bit disappointed. The room was tiny, no closet or drawer space. My husband had to lay out his clothing on the window ledge! Bathroom was tiny with no space for toiletries. Shower was cramped. Place was clean. Lobby was always packed and noisy, so quite hard to get any attention at any time. Chose this hotel because we thought we could not go wrong with the W brand. Location was convenient mid-town, one block to subway, walking distance to Central Park & Times Square activities. Would not stay there again though as room was far too cramped and not well planned.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Starwood Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: chris_schene
Reviews.Content: First the positive: The Valet team and Bell hops were eager to please. The location is decent. Inner-city Hotel rooms are small in general, but this room is arranged so inconveniently and thoughtlessly as to make the room very â€œnonâ€� user friendly. When I was entering the hallway from the elevators I wondered if I was entering a â€œtrailer parkâ€�. They had very drab colored walls and pseudo â€œEco friendlyâ€� grass gardenettes on the walls. -There is no usable shelf space in the bathroom to place your toiletries and dental paraphernalia -The shower door is sealed shut at the end where you adjust the water which prevents you from adjusting the water temperature before you enter the shower. -The shower door does not close â€“ this appears to be simple cheapness as they have a single piece door rather than dual piece slider -The bathroom door does not lock, affording no privacy should any one else be in the room -There is no â€œin roomâ€� coffee by default, though I did get it when I complained -The plugs are few and very hard to access. Only one usable plug in the bathroom. The plus near the desk are hard to access....if they had been a few inches higher, they would be perfect usable. -I heard crackling and static when I spoke on the wireless phone. This re-enforced my image of cheapness and lack of attention to detail. -The A/C did not work well â€“ it only went down to 75 degrees and it had a hard time maintaining that There is only one sitting spot (other than the bed): The chair at the desk. The desk chair does not roll. I asked for a blended drink at the bar and was informed that W hotels do not make blended drinks. When I raised this issue to management, I received a very gracious and apologetic message, but no one ever responded to my follow up message accepting their free drink offer. The room screams "I am inconvenient" I have stayed at many starwood Hotels including the W Times Square, Westin Times Square, Westin Seattle, Westin St Francis San Francisco, Park Tower Sheraton London, Sheraton Belgravia London, Westin Bay Shore Vancouver, Westin Grand Vancouver, Westin Mission Hills Palm Springs, Calgary Sheraton Cavalier) and the W New York simply does not deserve to be in the Starwood portfolio: It belongs in the "motel 6" porfolio" in my view. I have reviewed many of the starwood hotels I have stayed at, and my rating are very postive Don't be duped into paying starwood and "W" prices for this property

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay at the W New York on Lex!!”
Reviews.Author: GemmaOne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy staying at stylish boutique hotels. We've experienced many in various cities and like children at Christmas, we look forward to what the room decor will be like, luxurious bedding, spectacular views with or without terraces, and of course the toiletries! The vibe you feel when you enter the front revolving door is calm and soothing as if you entered an oasis and you just know you're in the right place. High ceilings, cool music and low lighting set the atmosphere in the lobby/living room. Fresh fruit and some type of infused water or seasonal beverage is complimentary in the lobby for guests. This property is our all time favorite. The location, the conceirge desk, the door/bellmen, housekeeping and front desk staff are also incredible; especially Liz Pantalone at the front desk. She has warmly welcomed us back on several stays throughout the years and really cares that we have the most comfortable experience. When we see her, we know everything is going to be just perfect. We highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst W ever stayed at...would not even call it a W to be honest`”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently was laid to rest at this W as it was a disaster. They had a renovation, but must of only been in the lobby (only area that appears "W" like). Once you get in the room you realize you have been suckered into a dump. Paint is peeling off areas, dirty caulk around bathroom, and worst of all, I had a "methane" scent that filled the room for hours everytime you flushed the toilet. You could tell there were major plumbing issues as the pipes emitted weird sounds all night and that odor.... When I mentioned this to the staff they said "sorry" and just kept walking. Even the bell hop laughed when I asked if this was a "W" and he then agreed it was going down the tubes here. I stay in LOTS of W's and I am even getting married next year at one; so I love the brand. I must say stay in Times Square (although the location is a bit too busy) as the rooms are up to W standards.

Reviews.Title: “Fake Customer Service but Great Night Life Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScrantonPAusa
Reviews.Content: I was visiting with my wife and kids from Central Pennsylvania. I noted that there was no one in the lobby to help with my family's bags, but we packed light and I'm a DIY sort of person, so no harm done. There was a small line at the check-in desk, and of course I checked the reviews before reserving a room at the W. We must have some shills here because Ms. Pantaleon was all smiles, but no service. My family and I were missionaries in the Philippines for 14 years despite our Caucasian appearance and I could already tell that our Pinoy welcomer was off-putting, half-hearted and uninterested in helping us "puti" or white folks. That much she made clear with dirty looks and short conversation. Despite the unwelcoming party, my kids and I settled in where they were amused at the scenic bar later that evening and my wife and I relaxed in the modest sized rooms, but comfortable lay out and beds. There was a cab always to be found steps from the hotel, there were always great places to eat nearby, and the rooms were spotless. It's a great place to stay, clean and efficient. That's midtown!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Weekend Getaway from DC”
Reviews.Author: BisonBaby
Reviews.Content: I love the W New York! Over the past 2+ years this place has been the best weekend getaway for a DC attorney looking for a quick escape. Liz Pantaleon, the other front desk staff and the entire hotel staff have a level of friendliness and courteousness second to none! The rooms are trendy and fully stocked with Bliss products. Great room service. Splurging for an upgrade goes a long way in solving size of room issues. Great bar and lobby nightlife! I've gone alone, with a friend and even hosted a small get together in one of the suites. Without a doubt, every trip is memorable. Will be headed back soon....

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bedbugs bite!!!!”
Reviews.Author: misbel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights during the month of July. I was traveling with my husband and teenage sons. We needed two rooms because there is only one small bed (very comfortable) per room. Service was very good (except no one at front to help with luggage etc). Air conditioning broke twice (NYC was having a heat wave) and they took care of the problem immediately. The location was very safe and near or accessible to the attractions we wanted to visit. However, my son was bitten by bedbugs all over his arm. He slipped his arm behind the bed to get something that had fallen and was bitten about 30 times. He was in room 1715. I contacted the hotel the day after I checked out (verified bites with doctor) and was put through a voice mail. I just wanted to advise them of what had happened to me during our stay, but no one responded. I know that the city has a problem with bedbugs and wanted the W hotel to be aware of that. So bottom line, I loved the hotel but was very uncomfortable with what happen to our son.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent guest service!”
Reviews.Author: Lucindaf2003
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review because of the excellent guest service that I received after voicing some complaints. I normally do not write reviews of any kind but W New York deserves one. I arrived to my room without incident and was surprised that I had se space between my bed and the wall. Finally no shoebox! I had a clean, bright and quiet room. One my first day, there were several issues with my room that required the assistance of 3 different staff. Each issue was resolved quickly and I was treated with respect. By the second day, additional issues piled on and I decided it was time to speak with the manager about making some changes. I was prepared to be blown off but got the opposite. The management was attentive, immediately concerned about my litany of complaints and responded with a solution within 5 minutes that was way beyond my expectations. NYC is a very expensive place to visit and I feel I got my money's worth at this hotel. Thank You W New York for hearing me and helping me to feel very comfortable in my home away from home. Also, the room service is very good compared to other hotels in the area and fast, the bar staff are fantastic and the concierge consistently pointed me in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all... expensive for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: seaviewasia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times but this hotel can only be described as getting progressively worst each time. The reception is always full, hectic and a mess of people. The bar Whiskey Blue used to be kind of a cool place but these days has frankly seen better days! Much like the hotel rooms... old and falling apart with not enough light. Without the Starwood rewards and if another hotel was available I would never stay here again. Expensive internet charges and the system in the lift (elevator) with the room key card to press your floor never works properly which is most annoying! The only redeeming feature may be the service which is always quick and conceige is helpful. Location is also pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Kondesa01
Reviews.Content: Very courteous, punctual service. Check in and check out was a breeze. And the hotel was in the heart of the places we intend to visit so it was great, no time wasted!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic W Great Price and Great loyal appreciation”
Reviews.Author: A3Queen
Reviews.Content: my husband and I were at another hotel in NYC and not happy, so at the last minute (that morning) we got a great rate on the spg site for this W (we are starwood gold members) - and immediately checked in... we got a rocking upgrade to a suite with a view all the way to the water.. hassle free... great service - great location... great price. we were VERY happy all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: mkimutan
Reviews.Content: It was my first time visiting new york and this hotel did not disappoint. The hotel is trendy with good music. The staff is amazing. Lisa the concierge and Sami at the front desk were super accommodating. They helped us with local nightlife and even got us a VIP hook up at a local club. The rooms we stayed in was very nice and clean. For New York, the price was reasonable, but the service definitely made it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful rooms, friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lakers1212
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W New York on Lexington was perfect. The rooms were nice, the hotel staff was friendly and welcoming and the service was amazing. Jolene Koepp was hands down the move fabulous person to work with on a room reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fire safety hazard and too cool to make eye contact”
Reviews.Author: dollyddraws
Reviews.Content: the fire alarm goes off on the 15th floor and we grab the passports and head out the room into a foggy hallway. We find the firestairs and a painter in the stairwell holds the door open as we start our descent down to ground. We are calm and talk with each other as we head down, but on several floors find we have to stop and clear the landing of trolleys, housekeeping equipment, tables etc, all blocking our path. If the whole hotel had been evacuating, there would have been a bottle neck and panic. On reaching the street we find there are no staff members waiting to guide us to safety or advise us of our next form of action. We head back into the lobby to find staff members standing around, nobody taking control. We advised the head of security that we believe it was paint particles that caused the alarm to trip and without checking he tells us we can return to our rooms via the elevator. This was totally unproffessional and dangerous to the clients. Also, dont expect a smile, any assistance or even eye contact from the young woman who is behind the concierge desk. She will keep looking at that computer screen until you go away and leave her alone. This must be one of the most unfriendly hotels in New York. We will not be returning. Also the airconditioning wins an award for the noisiest airconditioning in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drockafella11
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay here a while back and will definitely stay here next time. Everyone from concierge to the managers in charge completely went out of there way for us; even getting us into a nightclub around the corner. The hotel overall is immaculately clean and very quiet. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay in the city, where your close to a lot of different places, but can retreat and feel like your away from the craziness that the city yields.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay 100 days a year if I could”
Reviews.Author: pesky11
Reviews.Content: Audrey's breakfast room and evening lounge was fantastic. Great place to feel the New York wonder and enjoy a little, "my life is good" thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Pay $300+ to wake to the sounds of drilling and hammering from hotel construction”
Reviews.Author: Javs72
Reviews.Content: There are too many more-than-adequate hotel options in NYC to stay here and risk being subject to horrible service. Below is the notice I provided the hotel to give them an opportunity to make up for not being advised upon check-in that I would hear the sounds of drilling and hammering outside my window in the morning. They requested I let them know if I return for another stay at the hotel so they can show a "true, W experience." No way guys...you lost that trust. "I am writing to inform you about an unfortunate incident during a recent stay from April 11-14 at the W Hotel New York. By way of background, I would mention that I have been a loyal customer to Starwood Hotels, in particular to the W Hotels. During the past few months, I have been traveling regularly to NY for firm business and have developed a preference for the property at which I stayed last week, and my prior visits had been very pleasant. Early on the morning of April 12, we were awakened by the unpleasant sounds of hammering and drilling right outside our window. I immediately called the Whatever, Whenever line, informed them of the noise, and asked the drilling and hammering be stopped. The hotel representative said she would find out what's going on and have it stopped. Five minutes pass and the noise continues. I call again and the hotel representative tells me they cannot stop the drilling and hammering, but can move us to another room on the other side of the building if we choose. I replied that we were half asleep and not dressed so that was not an agreeable option for us at that moment. She said they couldn't do anything else, and I said that I would talk to my girlfriend to see what we were going to do. The hotel representative replied that she would have the hotel manager call me shortly to see what we decided to do. I never received that call from the manager. When I returned to the hotel early that afternoon on April 12, I asked to speak to the manager. The manager came out to the lobby, greeted me, and mentioned that he heard there was a problem with noise outside our bedroom window that morning and offered to upgrade our room and move us to the other side of the building for the following two nights. I mentioned to him that I was following up because I was expecting a call back from him as the hotel representative said would happen, but did not. He said that he was standing right next to that representative when she took the call, and that I was told that they were waiting for me to let them know what I wanted to do. First impression -- I could not believe the manager was basically telling me that I heard incorrectly and challenging me in the first 15 seconds of our meeting. He then asked me if I would like to be moved to the upgraded room for the next two nights. I said yes, and asked him why we were not informed about this hotel condition upon check-in or at any other time (during my previous stays at that property, I have always stayed on a side of the hotel facing the street). He said there is notice in the welcome letter that guests receive at check-in. I told him we never received any welcome letter or notice, because if we had, we would have made a change immediately. He simply replied that we should have received something, and dismissed the issue. I proceeded to ask him how he would like to handle the previous-night's sleep that was unpleasantly interrupted by conditions at the hotel. He replied that there was no problem with the prior night's stay and that his remedy was his offering to move us to another room for the remainder of our stay. He simply stated that he thought the upgraded room he was offering made up for everything and he would do nothing more about our bad experience that first night. In short, I believe an uninterrupted night's sleep goes without saying as what a basic hotel offers its guests, and a W Hotel typically provides that and much, much more. I did not receive even the basics that first night's stay." A few emails and a phone call with Starwood customer care for a few points thrown my way. Stay somewhere else or join the growing list of former guests that stand beside themselves at the lack of service here.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: tandytan
Reviews.Content: The W has spoiled me. Some friends and I wanted to travel to NY to see Fences and Fela. I contacted the hotel's customer care department and received the best customer service care. The entire staff at the hotel is very friendly and always willing to do whatever is necessary to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The bathroom was great and the bliss products are absolutely awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: sunshineseeker717
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just OK, sadly not what I would expect for a W. The rooms were small, the bathrooms tiny, and overall just felt a little dark. It's a central location so there's quite a bit to walk to, which was a plus. The rooms were clean, the feel was trendy, and the staff was nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: padster71
Reviews.Content: Lamika, Your a lady, friendly attitude & a sincere warm heart. Thank you for taking me under your wing & making my stay a real pleasure. lamika, I wanted to take you away with me. looking forward to seeing you again. Keep smiling. Thank you for making me want to choose W hotels the next time i visit NYC on 541 Lexington Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Service with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: JasonWright_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight for a business trip. It was my first experience at a W hotel. The room was nice and I was pleased to find a note from the "manager" saying to call him if I needed anything. The following morning I checked out of the hotel but had one of the bell men hold my bag while I was in a business meeting. I tipped him $3 for the one bag. When I came back from my meeting to pick up the bag there was another customer in front of me that was picking up several items of luggage. Once finished, she gave the bell man (a different one this time) some change. She was a bit cheap for all the help he provided her but his reaction was appalling. As soon as she walked away, he slammed the change on the counter and started storming around cussing under his breath. I had to wait for him to calm down so that I could get my own bag at which time I gave him no tip. As I walked away, he slammed his hand down on the counter. I ended up giving his tip to the guy that called the taxi for me. To make matters worse, I decided to call the "manager" about the situation. The "manager" turned out to be a recording where you could leave messages. I left a message and got a very un-heartfelt email apology reply later on from what seemed like an email reply center. I won't be staying there again. There are way too many hotels I've stayed at in NYC with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sexy lobby. Small rooms. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BMWM5Driver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too sexy for me - the thumping lobby music, the burning insence, the lounge / pop culture clothing in the lobby. The rooms are super small but functional, room lighting is limited and dark - so don't plan to work for long hours at your computer in your room. Great TV, bedding, shower, soaps. The available views of NYC skyline are limited to brickwalls and parking garage interiors. There are better places to stay if you like luxury or a classic NY experiernce. It's an adequate place to stay for short business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the phone charges”
Reviews.Author: Caseman_nz
Reviews.Content: Location was pretty convenient to all the great attractions of NYC. HOWEVER, beware of outrageously high phone charges- what a huge rip-off! Adding insult to injury was that we were quoted that were not applied. We were initially charged $900 for 150 minutes. Granted, some were international, but we weren't calling a 3rd world nation and over half the calls were within the USA. We were able to negotiate with the manager for a reduced rate, but still.....$350 still is pretty hefty for the number of minutes we used. BRING YOUR OWN PHONE or for international travelers, get a pre-paid PHONE CARD! Also, the pillows were a bit on the smelly side and we had to have them replaced. No chocolate scent on these. So, if we were to visit NYC again we won't be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you can book a good deal; otherwise, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: adelly
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Travelzoo, so we got a pretty good deal at around $175/night. Typical W fashion and decor, however rooms are super tiny. See photos of our room - and this was already the medium room (I can't imagine how the small ones look like!). The room looked a bit dated, just a bit spruced up with some modern accessories. Staff was ok - not too friendly and accommodating but not rude, either. Location was good but not near any major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: thefox67
Reviews.Content: I am writing this letter of appreciation for Ms. Lisa "Montana." I stayed at the "W" New York from June 4-6, 2010. I love New York. My niece and her family live there, so I visit every chance I get. This was my first time, however, staying at the "W." What impressed me about the "W," beyond the ambiance, was the customer service of the staff, who were very friendly, informative, and attentive. However, the most attentive staff person I met was Lisa "Montana." I watched her as she made her way through the crowd and smiled and talked to guests, asking them how their day was going or if they needed any help. So, when I needed information, I went to Montana. She advised me on what to do, where to go, and events around the New York area, both during that weekend, and for the weekend of July 3-5, when I am to return, My time in New York was made even more enjoyable with the help of Montana. In my line of work--human resources--I recognize talent when I see it. Montana is talent. She seems very intelligent, friendly and welcoming. I noticed that she made a lot of guests smile that weekend. She spoke highly of the "W" and the way it treats its staff, and she seemed to genuinely enjoy her work. They say that happy employees make happy customers. Montana is one of those employees. Thank you so much for the wonderful weekend I had on June 4-6, 2010, and thank you for employees like Montana who make it all worthwhile. I look forward to my return on July 3rd. Ms. B Anderson Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “Modern and elegant designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Location: The location on Lexinton Avenue was alright, but if location is important, I'd choose somewhere closer to Central Park or Midtown East/Chelsea, the latter location is where we ended up dining almost every night. Rooms: The room was cramped, but that is to be expected in New York and we did have sufficient space to unpack our luggage. The styling was modern and semi minimalistic, we loved it! There is a huge 40 or 42" LCD TV. No negative remarks on cleanliness. The bathroom was excellent, and was separated by a sliding door with frosted glass. Hallways leading to the room were a bit cramped. There was no view from our room and the windows was small. Staff was courteous and I have to give top marks to service. W even had "Acura service" which is a private driver that takes you anywhere within a certain distance from the hotel. Please note that the lobby can be very noisy and crowded as it seems to be a popular place to go for a drink. Not a problem for me, but it felt like walking into a bar or night club even in the middle of the day. I Paid $273 a night including all taxes and fees, a bit expensive but so are other luxury designer hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bognorman
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about the W on Lexington, I have to write to say they are vvery undeserved. Our stay was memorable. OK the rooms are not large but what do you expect of a city centre hotel. But, and we had four rooms for an extended family stay, they were all comfortable and stylish. The staff were friendly and we put them to several tests with requests that were cheerfully and promptly met. Special mention of the concierge - a lady on duty most mornings - who was very helpful and a mine of information. All in all we had a great stay and the acid test of a hotel is 'would you return'? This family would, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Only average...”
Reviews.Author: rookie75
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location. - Quick and easy check-in, nice staff at front desk. - Rooms are nice and clean. Cons: - No room upgrade what so ever (I am SPG Gold). - I expected more quality in the facilities for the amount of $$$ paid, not good value for money. - Very small rooms...especially the bathroom is super small.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Mark04hc
Reviews.Content: We PriceLined this hotel, and got the "Cozy Room" for $180, and the room originally was going for $270 so we got a deal on it. However, we had just checked out of an upgrade Junior Suite at another hotel, and were worried about being cramped in a "cozy" room (roughly 150 sq. ft), so we called and asked if we could be upgraded. We were told the could upgrade to the "Mega Room" - the largest of the standard rooms for an additional $75. We decided to go ahead and do this as that was still a deal as the Mega room was going for over $300 that night. When we checked in, a very nice reception stated "Hmm... let me ask my manager and see if we can give you something bigger..." - They gave us the Fantastic Suite for no extra charge!! Wow a 1 bedroom suite with separate living room! It was 500 spacious square feet with the most comfortable bed! We were here for my birthday, and I didn't even want to leave! And we didn't! We checked in right at 3, had room service of wine, and hummus plate, and then quickly went to dinner and came back, and ordered more room service and watched TV while drinking wine! I never wanted to leave! The staff was incredible, the room service was incredibly quick. I went to the gym, and it was out of this world. This hotel is wonderful. I had an absolute fantastic time, and am now a more loyal customer to the W and SPG hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “A great property to hold a small conference (under 500) in midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: HealthyBrandMan
Reviews.Content: The staff in every aspect made the stay at this W Property wonderful... from the bars, the restuarant, rooms, concierge, to the memorable doorman et al- next time you are in NYC, make this happening place a must on your visit/stay list!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Anna35805
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible the staff had an attitude. I couldn't believe how bad the services are. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Fairly decent”
Reviews.Author: FoxtrotOscar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on business - overall pretty decent but some of the similar problems noted, namely: - room keys do not always work in lifts or rooms - can be a bit temperamental (the red ones work better than the blue ones in my experience) - a mysterious "munchie bar" appeared on my bill but was immediately removed when challenged - rooms aren't the biggest (but not really an issue for business travellers) However, the hotel has many positives, namely: - comfortable beds - quiet by NY standards (my room overlooked Lex and traffic noise wasn't a problem) - good toileteries - very courteous staff (none of the rudeness noted by others observed) - no busloads of schoolkids or tourists - just well-to-do singles and couples on the whole - close to subway - easy to get taxis - doormen actively help you - they also managed to find me one that actually wanted to go to EWR just before shift change - a rarity in NY - decent (corporate) rate (for NY) - OK fitness room - won't win awards but wasn't overcrowded - fairly hip vibe (if that's what you like) - free, easy to set up wifi (in my tariff, but i understand some tariffs make you pay for this) - iPod dock in room - DVD in rom - decent flat screen LCD tv I recommend the Europa deli (east 53rd) for breakfast - a fraction of the hotel cost. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Burlingtonienne
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel through a Priceline bid so had no idea what we would get. We were pleasantly surprised upon check-in by the quick, friendly service and a free room upgrade, especially since we were already getting a great deal on the room. The lobby was chic but small and crowded. Our upgraded room was nevertheless tiny, but on par with boutique hotels in its class in central Manhattan. The decor was attractive. My one complaint is that there was very little lighting in the room to the extent that you could not comfortably read a book after the sun went down even if you turned on every light in the place. Room service was typically overpriced, but there are so many great restaurants in the area that it didn't really matter. The concierge provided us with a printout of restaurant recommendations upon request, and both of the places we tried from the list were excellent. This hotel takes security seriously. You have to use your room key to access the guest room floors via the elevator and security asked guests for their keys prior to letting them past the lobby during the evening when the lobby bar was full. Beware that this hotel, like other Starwood hotels, has a minibar that automatically adds items to your room bill if you so much as bump into them. When we realized this had happened, however, we went down to the front desk and they removed them instantly with no problems. Overall, this was a great experience for the discounted price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding weekend was perfect & hotel staff contagiously happy!”
Reviews.Author: ddh09
Reviews.Content: W New York on Lexington Ave is simply the best! My son was married in NYC and we had arranged hotel accommodations for our guests with the hotel. At check-in I was greeted by Edna, a loyal W employee. She was delightful and helped me correct a room situation that was incorrect. They practice what they preach ... Whatever Whenever! It was a fabulous wedding weekend.

Reviews.Title: “My greatest regret this NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: Swanky lobby, checked. Designer corridoor, checked. Great bedroom, NOT on the list. Again, most designer hotels in NYC do not live up to its hype. W Hotel at Lexington Ave and 49th Street is no exception. Franklky, I regreted moving my stay from another hotel to W Hotel (just because I wanted to experience the W Hotel). 1. Complimentary Wifi is only available in the hotel lobby. For the rates that they are charging, I would expect complimentary wifi to be available in the rooms as well. 2. The room is small (just like any other NYC hotel room) but what makes it worse is that the air conditioning vent is just besides the bed. The noise from the air con was so disturbing that my partner could not sleep the first night when we were there. We had to ask for a change of room! 3. You better be the only person sleeping on the bed. They claimed to have the most comfy bed but they might have forgotten to add in that's provided you are the only person sleeping on the bed. I was awoken whenever my partner tossed and turned. The bed is so soft and a good night sleep was impossible. 4. The good part is if you are a gym fanatic, the fitness centre is quite impressive. They have quite an extensive range of equipments and it's rather big considering most hotel gyms are very small and are there for the sake of being there. 5. The toiletries are great too. This is the first hotel that I've stayed at provides facial cleanser, body butter, shampoo, hair conditioner and shower gel. While the latter three are common itmes, the facial cleanser and body butter were a pleasant surprise. The range of toiletries are from Bliss and they are quite well made.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant shoebox”
Reviews.Author: 3PCE
Reviews.Content: We travel to Manhattan several times per year and have stayed in just about every hotel in the Times Square area. Having spent four nights at the W Hotel, we can safely say that we shall never return. SERVICE: No complaints but the army of "bouncers" dressed in black at the entrance seemed quite unnecessary. They made little to effort to do anything other than stand around and grunt. Front desk staff were awesome as were the room service ladies. DECOR: Ultra modern and chic but they really over-shot. The rooms were also similarly ultra-sleek, but appeared cluttered. Given the fact that the rooms are barely larger than the average bathroom, the whole pink lighting / glass doors / funky light fixtures just did not mesh well at all. ROOMS: These were the smallest rooms that I have ever stayed in, even by Manhattan standards. The bathroom was the size of a cupboard, with the toilet literally jammed in between the sink and shower. LOBBY: Always buzzing with people which was great. The fact that some hip-hop crowd was there made the place much less appealing, well unless the smell of marijuana is particularly appealing to you. Even more annoying was the need to take one elevator to get to the lobby and then a second elevator to get to your room. You need to budget almost 20 minutes just to get out of the damn hotel. OVERALL: Great location, nice decor all in all but really a tremendous waste of money given the alternatives right next door and around the corner. PLAN TO RETURN: Absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “As with most things in Manhattan... you are paying for location”
Reviews.Author: ClarissaM
Reviews.Content: Nothing too special about this hotel.. from the service to the rooms to the housekeeping. The staff in general aren't particularly welcoming or helpful, except for the valet guys getting the cars. The rooms are very small (even though we were under the impression that we had booked one of the bigger suites, it was incredibly tiny - and I expect/prefer a King bed when I'm paying for an upgraded "suite"). The rooms are pretty dark and the lighting is fluorescent, which is just awful for lighting in a nice hotel, doesn't exactly set off the ambiance. There isn't anything plush about the rooms, they're very very standard. Also, I will say that in this day and age, there is no excuse for a hotel to not have free wi-fi in the rooms. I believe the charge was $12 per hour for WI-FI!?! Just ridiculous. And parking at the hotel was $70 per day. I mean, really! Most likely you're in Manhattan to do other things, so you won't spend too much time in your room or at the hotel, which is probably what the hotel is counting on - and also their saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “... nice hotel.. but not so nice service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: RodolfoLara
Reviews.Content: all you can expect from a w hotel: wannabe boutique, the signature smell as you come into the lobby, a loud bar with louder people at the entrance and rooms which try hard to be cool - and only partially succeed. service tries to be nice, alas, the fakeness of it all transpires across the reception desk. the "Ã¼bercool" concierge is better to be avoided - mostly ladies that are too busy with trying to be trendy and treat with coldness and indifference the customer

Reviews.Title: “the most basic of standards was not met.”
Reviews.Author: sachtouris
Reviews.Content: Being able to sleep and relax seemed unworkable. Every morning I would awake up because of all sorts of different sounds outside my room. The doors were banging constantly and it was not my neighbors coming in or going out; it was the maids who were at the hallways talking loudly and laughing, even swearing at times. Towel trolleys were squeaky and therefore aggravating and do not forget that this was every day; it was not a singular incident. Shouldnâ€™t the personnel be more careful and sensitive to the retreat and tranquil of your clients? Isnâ€™t there anything else you can do with insulation? Another thing was morning beverages. Couldnâ€™t there be a coffee machine in the room? Isnâ€™t there anything you offer free of charge to your customers, not even a cup of morning tea? Not to mention that they didn't even have free WiFi... My stay there was tolerable and not in any way wonderful. I would not be recommending these hotels to my social contacts, absolutely not at this price. It is out of the question.

Reviews.Title: “You take the good... you take the bad....”
Reviews.Author: kimmers722
Reviews.Content: As with anything, there are both positives and negatives of this hotel. The Happy: - The super comfy bed! - The Bliss bath products are DIVINE - The exercise room is incredible! Many cardio machines w/ tvs that allow you to plug your ear buds in. Lots of space and a wonderful array of free weights. - Location is wonderful!! It's a block away from the Subway and very close to many cool sites and places to see. The Not So Happy: - The arrogant rude male receptionist who barely looked up from what he was doing for a whole 10 minutes, while I stood there, waiting to be checked in. When he finally did acknowledge me it was tell me he was finishing something else and it would be a little longer before he could help me. (This is exactly what I'm hoping for after a day of airports and travel. NOT.) - The pillows are TOO plush; no neck support. - The elevators are a nightmare... of course, arrogant rude male receptionist didn't explain how to work them so I had the lovely opportunity to visit many floors on arrival. - The alarm clock isn't exactly user friendly (A 'how to' guide would have been beneficial) Tips: - Don't get your breakfast from the lobby --- it will cost you an arm and a leg and your unborn child. - Ask arrogant rude male receptionist for a Subway map - it will help tremendously to navigate around the city (Warning! He'll give you attitude, but the map is well worth it!) - Go to Caffe Linda, on 49th street, within a block of the hotel. Order the black linguine. You'll feel like you've died and gone to heaven. No lie. It's the best linguine I have ever eaten in my life.

Reviews.Title: “gets a thumbs up from me”
Reviews.Author: barneybusbus
Reviews.Content: great hotel. within easy walking distance to everything, shops, attractions, restaurants. modern room, lovely toiletries and a great bed. not the largest room but hey its new york! who wants to stay in a room all day anyway! very trendy bar downstairs full of business types after a busy day at the office

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mostly pretentious staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cdnskier
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here when it first opened and it really hasn't changed. The front desk staff really work hard to ignore you. The concierge spent at least two minutes on her bb before acknowledging my presence two feet away. The door guys are great and so are the bar staff. The room was small, but I knew that going in. Modern amenities, great TV, bathroom stuff was terrific. Room , I must say, was very clean. Coffee service area in the morning is good. a little busy but good. Watch moving anything around in your bar fridge or on the snack tray. You will be billed for items moved and it was only when I read the fine print that I became aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for mid-town”
Reviews.Author: Boyler79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Hotel on Lexington for two nights for a business trip that was mainly centered around mid-town. Can't fault the location as getting cabs or the subway opened up all of Manhatten but the hotel and rooms were basic. Much like other NYC hotels, the view from the 7th floor (which in London would afford you views of Hyde Park) was of an alley way and brick wall and the service was pretty poor as well. Travelling on business, I was not asking for much but it took them over 24 hours to replace my broken safe where I wanted to store my lap top / etc. which meant that I had to carry all my valuables around with me. The bar, Whisky Mist, is pretty poor. It was empty and the whisky is over priced. The Brandy Lounge in TriBeCa is much more welcoming. I definitely would not choose to stay here on leisure unless you know that you really are not planning to spend any time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would go back for its cleanliness, location & Bliss Spa products”
Reviews.Author: ytyger
Reviews.Content: this review dates back to the weekend of April 8th 2010, while I stayed 3 nights at the Cozy Room of W New York. I don't think the cozy room there is worth its regular rate of $350/night but i got a deal for approx $245 / night and that was a good deal. I've been aware of the "super tiny" size of the rooms (about 170sqft, cos it's NYC), and the not so friendly hotel staff, from previous review, and that had made my stay more pleasant. The room was tiny, clean, cleverly designed, not too well-lit but gives you basically what you need, as in you won't be spending too much time in the room while traveling in NYC. The bed was really comfortable and I really regret not having tried their "pillow menu", which you could ask for different kinds of pillow (don't know if there's an extra charge though). The small but clean bathroom is a big plus, especially when it's loaded with high quality Bliss Spa products, which are quite expensive from their store. I really enjoyed the shower area and the decor of the bathroom, which the hotel promoted on their website. As for other in-room amenities, the Tivoli Audio Speakers doesn't work with my iPod Touch; it only works with earlier models. The TV also give you access to their extensive video library, which I didn't watch any cos it's too expensive. NEVER TOUCH THE MINI BAR and SURROUNDING AREA. the hotel have installed censors there and even if you touch or move something, they will charge you. I accidentally moved the box of band-aid and it costed me $9, but the hotel was fair about this, at check-out, I told the front door staff about this and she took it off my bill. so another tip, double check your bill before leaving. there's free wifi in the lobby so didn't pay extra for that in the room I'd have to agree with other travelers' comment about the bad service at the hotel. I've been told of the New Yorker attitude before the trip and didn't expect much from the staff so it was just alright. The front desk staff are pretty much just performing their duties, the concierge desk is often unattended, the bellboy and house keepers are nicer than other staff. Another thing I noted about the service, is that they often asked about how you think of the service or your stay at the hotel, and whether you'd be staying there again on your next trip. I told them "yes" because what I want most from NYC hotel is cleanliness, safety, and location. the location of this hotel is fantastic, 2 mins walk to the #6 subway train, 5 mins walk to pharmacy for daily essentials, 7 mins walk to Rockefella Plaza and 15 mins walk to Times Square. I'd even prefer this location over the W hotel at Times Square, cos the area isn't too noisy at night. didn't try any of the food at the hotel because of the high prices, and the oscar cafe near the hotel is good for reasonable pricing food.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you book here”
Reviews.Author: y1osh
Reviews.Content: I took my hubby to NYC for his birthday, was a long weekend break. Decided to stay at a W hotel, part of a reputable chain. Was disappointed... customer service was appalling at this particular hotel, except for one of the doormen. The reception staff were not friendly & there was never anyone at concierge. The rooms were small & cramped. We used the fridge in the room to keep drinks we bought cold & when we checked out discovered that we got a large minibar charge... it turned out they have sensors in the minibar so if you move things you get automatically charged... clever technology, not helpful. Check the bill! On the plus side the location was brilliant, really accessible for everywhere you want to go in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “small room but comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: xmaskutee
Reviews.Content: The room was small but the bed was very comfortable. The hotel do provide parking but it's $60 per day for Sedan. The hotel is pets friendly with $100 one time charge and $25 / day. The hotel is pretty clean. No view from the room i stayed in...overall it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was excellent like ever”
Reviews.Author: NFRIOSG
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, nice Lobby, nice bed, nice ..... everything

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: swatu76
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the W Hotel. Where do I start? This was our third time in New York and we have previously stayed at the Roger Williams and Millenium Hilton without any complaint. We decided to give this hotel the benefit of the doubt as we were slightly apprehensive about going somewhere which had so many negative reviews but reading the recent complementary reviews we thought we should give it a go - we were WRONG to do so! 1) At check-in we were 'greeted' by Emily who had a sour expression from dealing with the customer prior to ourselves. She did not inform us about any of the amenities within the hotel e.g. where do we go for breakfast, how to operate the complex lifts etc.... 2) The room was labelled a 'Wonderful' room and it did not live upto it's name. It was far too small and uninviting. It felt overcrowded with just the two of us in there! 3) The next day we wanted to use the iron in our room but would you believe it, there was no power socket in the room to plug an iron into!! We called hotel maintenance and the engineer came up and said "I've never seen a room like this". That was not very helpful to us. He spent a further 30 mins to arrange a complex extension lead!! 4) Later in the evening, we phoned concierge for a list of recommended Chinese restaurants - they did not answer the phone but we were asked to leave our request on an answer machine. No one called us back!!! 5) Be warned the lifts are a nightmare in this hotel! No-one tells you that you have to insert your card for them to work but even when you do, your card does not work. We met at least three different people who were constantly going up/down in the lift as their cards would not work!! 6) Finally, we were preparing to share some of the above feedback at checkout but they did not even care to ask us if we had a good stay, hence why we need to write this review on Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Far better than the reviews would have you believe!”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly_Dee
Reviews.Content: Thank you W for one of the best experiences i have had in a NYC to date (and i have to fly over quite often for business, and NYC isn't always renowned for it's stellar hotel service!)! Plus Points: 1. Hotel vibrancy and buzz - great lobby hang out area without feeling pretentious 2. Service - The number of staff available, helpful, polite, attentive, informative, genuine. After reading various reviews here i was more than a little nervous about booking to stay at this hotel. I have to say that my expectations were surpassed. We were booked into the Fantastic Suite and although not very large (by European standards) it was comfortable. This hotel is busy but i found the hotel staff to be helpful, courteous and very friendly. It started with an early check-in (very unusual!) and the great service cotinued throughout our stay and extended to the lady serving us at Whiskey Blue, who without hesitation was able to whip up our 'favourite' cocktail just by telling her the ingredients and then she just kept them coming!! I would like to say a special thank you to 'Tiny' for always making us feel safe, and Augustine for his attentiveness and service. They really did make our stay here feel special. So much so we wanted to buy them a 'thank you' bottle of champagne and i have NEVER been inclined to do that before! I /we will definitely be back for that special brand of 'W' hospitality! If you like a hotel with a buzz that starts from the lobby (hang out and chat, watching the world go by, or just reading alone) then you will like the W New York it is the perfect 'girlfriend getaway' place to stay. Whatever was missing in terms of service historically (based on the previous reviews i've read here) based on our stay here, the W New York must be bringing it back, so well done!! One minus point - it's time to offer free wi-fi connections in the hotel rooms don't you think?? You get out of life what you put in - we were nice and friendly and we received excellent attentive service in return and this made our NY trip very memorable indeed! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: Go2Gal
Reviews.Content: Cancel flight lead to an emergency red-eye to NYC for business. Upon arrival at the W at 6:30 am from the West Coast no rooms were ready (full house) but that didn't stop the staff from giving me a great experience. I was whisked up to the in-house spa for free usage and a great shower and primp area, plus given coffee and fresh fruit. They said they would give me the first clean room that morning - and they did. Honestly, they made an unexpectedly bad situation (that darn canceled flight) into a treat. Will alawys stay here for business - the rooms are not huge (what room in NYC are, though?) but well appointed and, being from Seattle, the coffee ROCKS! Great service wins it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Love the W New York!”
Reviews.Author: aliliebs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York on Lexington for two nights. I wasn't sure what to expect - New York hotels are notoriously expensive for very little value. However, the W New York was a fantastic exception! I had a room with a king bed - the room was small-ish (to be expected in NYC), but totally suitable and more than I had expected. The bed is super comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet - no street noise, and I couldn't hear anyone in adjacent rooms or in the hallway. Decor is super trendy ... with a touch of seduction ... really great if you are a couple looking to get away for a romantic weekend in NYC. I ordered room service - highly recommend the Chicken Burger - kitschy food with a gourmet twist. Probably the best chicken burger I've ever had! Keep in mind though - room service is very expensive! They add taxes, gratuities, delivery fees, etc etc. I ordered a chicken burger and a slice of cheesecake (also amazingly delicious) and the bill came out to $50. All in all, if you are looking for a weekend of luxury and indulgence, I would recommend the W New York in a heartbeat. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Check you credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a business trip. Funky place, modern, cool furniture, but ... noisy air conditioner/heating unit, coud not be turned off; worse, a few days after coming back home there was a separate charge appearing on my credit card statement for $ 18 and cents, follow up call provided an explanation it was a hotel bar charge (never went near the bar), still waiting for a refund 3 weeks later. This is actually not an uncommon ocurrence in NYC hotels, had similar experience a few months earlier at the Waldorf. Perhaps a revenue enhancing initiative - throw in an extra charge and see if it sticks ...
