Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money. Other than the lobby, felt like a No Frills hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BermudaGirl17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W for 5 nights for our 2nd anniversary. We were enthusiastically greeted by the great showman Denzel and were super excited to see the rest. Unfortunately it was downhill from there. I booked a Mega room ($300+ per night) and expected it to be a corner room like the pictures showed. After I pre-paid for the room, I started to get really negative feedback about the hotel, and specifically their rooms. I called the hotel a day before arriving, and requested a corner Mega Room as was displayed in their photos. They confirmed it was noted on our booking. However on entering the room, it was NOT a corner room, and didn't look much like the photo. The room we got was so average - very bare, NOT a corner, tiny bathroom, zero ambiance, and ABSOLUTELY not worth the cost. I have stayed in hotel rooms around the world ranging from $60-$600. I have never felt so ripped off by the price of a room as I did at this W. I understand it's NY, and I've never stayed at another W, but I don't intend to after this stay. The lobby is very busy. The staff were quick and mostly efficient, but often rushed through their duties at the expense of a welcoming and full-service experience. Lastly, on our final night, we were surprised at 4am by a mouse rustling through the mini-bar items in our 8th floor room. Disgusting. We were removed immediately from the room, and management seemed genuinely surprised and apologetic. Because we booked our reservation through hotels.com, they said they could not credit back my credit card for that night's cost. Instead they comp'd us with SPG points in the amount of a free night, and comp'd breakfast. I was fine with this correction, though others may not have been. I thinks it's important to share how management deals with issues such as these. So in short, they stay was average, or slightly below. Definitely not worth the money. Wouldn't stay there again or recommend it to anyone. But Denzel was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever When NEVER" - nice hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: ArtCapella
Reviews.Content: I was negatively surprised by the poor level of service I found at W New York, specially the concierge service. They promise an Whatever Whenever service, but I got an Whatever NEVER one. The room initially booked was really noise . I had to ask another room... The service problems started with the request I made prior to my arrival , for champagne and flowers on the room, as an romantic surprise for my wife (we're celebrating our wedding anniversary) . They simply forgot the champagne, and took more than than 1h30 min to send the Champagne until I give up to have it. After another halp hour they offered and complementary Champagne, not the one I ordered but one really worse that arrived almost at the time I was getting out to have dinner. Do they think that they should "buy my happiness and my wife's and mine frustration with it???? The WhatEver service looks like a joke. I needed the concierge service other three times. First I ask for help to find an Ipad on the apple stores. He called them , all were sold out, so he recommended me to keep trying (why he didnâ€™t offer to try again later and keep me posted? ) On the second situation I called the concierge, nobody answer the phone, I let an message and I never get an call back. The third time, I show up on the lobby but the Concierge area was empty, wait for 5 minutes and I give up. As I was travelling with my wife to celebrate our wedding anniversary at N.York, and inform them in advance, I just expected an better service on this small but important things. After all the problems, reported during my stay, On the good side of the hotel, it's well located, the room is nice despite it's not an MEGA room as published and different from the picture on the website ... The team that works cleaning rooms and helping with the luggage is also an very positive point, as the Accura Service they offer (for sure it looks to work well because it's not managed by the hotel) In resume an nice hotel, on an good location that needs urgently to increase their level of service to be recommended and to stay in the same service level I found in other Starwood hotels

Reviews.Title: “Truly a WoW experience”
Reviews.Author: Dianetraveller
Reviews.Content: Great overall experience, we always enjoy staying at W's all over the world...

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful and Ready to Awake You”
Reviews.Author: saket2006
Reviews.Content: Let me start of saying that the W, was very helpful in every little bit of service they offered. They told me that they could try to get my room ready as early as possible when I came early, they provided directions, quick taxi service and luggage storage when I needed to leave my room, but my flight was hours later. The only troubling part was that the elevator was a little hard to figure out, but once you get it, it is down pat. The best part and most memorable experience was the wake up call I placed. I asked for a 7:00 wake up call, and they asked if I would like a 7:15. I opted for it, knowing my usual dosing off after waking up. Even though I received both calls and managed to stay awake and get ready, a doorman or security knocked and ensured that I was up at 7:45. This was one of the best hotels in making sure you as a guest are comfortable. The beds, rooms, and service are top notch, and the environment (Bar+Lounge) is great. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: psb26
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to NY, I left behind very valuable jewelry in my room. I realized it as I arrived at JFK and had no time to return. I immediately contacted the security person on duty who went to the room I had been in, found the jewelrly and put it in a safe place. I contacted the Hotel manager and his team packaged up the jewelry and had it sent to me, all pieces intact, within a few days. In this day and age, it is a great comfort to know that a hotel exists where the staff is so trustworthy and accommodating. The W Hotel has my endorsement and business.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jinah80
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but worth it due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 Star hotel with 2 star Service”
Reviews.Author: berc
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline and than I read your reviews. The Trip advisor reviews looked to be split between good and bad experiences. Since I had stayed at the W in Chicago (which I had also booked on priceline but because I was a starwood preferred guest received an upgrade), I believed the good reviews. However, my experience was on the negative side. I would recommend this hotel eliminate the concierge services. The woman was more than rude, I asked for a hotel recommendation within walking distance that I could eat dressed as I was. She didn't bother to look at me and handed me a piece of paper with restaraunts on it - no directions. I had to ask for a map - and than it was like I asked for her first born. The room was so tiny I could barely turn-around in it. I do not recommend this W.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate member in the SPG family”
Reviews.Author: Mustihaveone
Reviews.Content: This is dated - I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights in 2008 visiting friends in NYC. Let me clarify where I come from - as a gold or platinum SPG member for years now, I have great respect for this chain. I have had good experiences in the Westins in Tokyo, Beijing, Shanghai; W Hong Kong; various ITC group hotels in India; even places like the Westin Copley in Boston and the W - both of them - on E 39th or thereabouts in NYC. I can categorically say the W New York was a disappointment. The rooms are small - do not put this down to NYC, because the aforementioned W Tuscany or its neighbor have nice rooms. I had a drink at the bar, went up, could not get into my room. Went down, got a new key, could not get into my room. Repeated the exercise, could not get in again. In exasperation, I went down and slammed the card on the desk and the ruffian manning the desk, who was not in the least bothered that a guest was having trouble getting into a room they paid for, admonished me for my behavior. Then I spoke to a supervisor type, who sent me upstairs and I waited on the couch on my floor in a dismal narrow corridor for perhaps 15 minutes. Finally a maintenance guy showed up - the battery in the electronic door lock had failed. It was not the stupid foreign guest not knowing how to use the key, after all. I complained to SPG and all they did was to give me a few free points, which I earn in a couple of days in any given week seeing how much I travel. I was tempted to put this down to a New Yorker attitude - but as a former New Yorker, and having been served better at other SPG hotels in New York, that would be untrue. Therefore, I conclude that either a) this constitutes acceptable service levels in this hotel or b) black sheep like the people who "took care" of me are condoned. Either case is unacceptable and I heartily encourage you to avoid this hotel. There are a dozen choice I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary treatment”
Reviews.Author: jonooates
Reviews.Content: At just the moment when I was toying with whether to make the W hotels my hotels of choice, I arrived at the W New York for a short business trip. The charming staff intuited that this was the right time to upgrade me to a wonderful suite, in which I had one of the most enjoyable stays of any visit to the city. I will be returning here and to the other W hotels on all my future visits. Also worth noting the exceptional spa - Bliss - which is part of the hotel: the most expensive facial I've ever had but better value than any other by a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Small rooms in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: elcoate80
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny, with very small windows and very expensive for what you get. The location is great, and the atmosphere is really loud, bar like if thats what you're after. In short, good for a nice spot to crash and shower, but not much else. If thats what you're after then you may as well get somewhere far cheaper. Asked for a large bottle of sparkling water and was told to go around the corner to a store. Given the concept of W hotels is to fulfill your wishes I didnt think the service was great at all! Won't be back to a W.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: efeeney
Reviews.Content: Went to New York for my husband's 30th. I contacted the hotel previously to ask for something special in the room. Upon arrival we were welcomed to a bottle of champagne and strawberries. The hotel is in a good location with a subway stop a 2 minute walk away. Rooms were modern and a good size (from previous reviews I was expecting much smaller), no bath only a shower in the standard room. Reception area very nice. For being on Lexington Ave the noise really was not a problem but then road noise does not bother me. Didn't really have much contact with the staff other than check in but seemed friendly enough. For the money I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky”
Reviews.Author: c-spro
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a W. This is the cheapest W in town. It was fabulous. Everything is top notch. Service was amazing, and decor was trendy. Rooms and hallways were a little old, but that's standard in NY. Nicest place I've staying in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further.. The Staff and Service at the W is all you need.”
Reviews.Author: hamp03
Reviews.Content: My stay at the New York downtown W, exceeded my expectations. I travel 4 days a week every week and this was one of the best hotel experiences I've had. The location was in the heart of everything, so sightseeing and getting around was a breeze. The staff was very helpful, as soon as I pulled in. The doorman walked my luggage and pointed out all staff members who would be able to accomodate my needs, as well as gave me back ground on the hotel, the bars and various facilities. My room was set up to meet all my business needs. Very comfortable bed and the flat screen with DVD was a plus. The business area was very well laid out. The workout facility, although not too big, was a great size, especially compared to what I've seen in other comparable hotels, complete with an adjoining room equiped with personal trainers. Plenty of cardio and even free weights to meet most all your work out needs. Two bar areas, both great for people watching and ambiance. Service all around was very good. Staff there was always friendly! This was my first time staying at a W property in NYC, and I came away very impressed, even though this was a business trip, as there was time to enjoy the social aspects as well. Would most definately recommend this property as a hotel of choice while visiting NYC, and I'm sure to frequent again on my next return visit.

Reviews.Title: “W=WORST!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily122
Reviews.Content: We changed our room within 10 minutes of being in the hotel! Room so small, not well appointed, low lighting so that you couldn't see in the bathroom, no hot water - only luke warm, towels had holes in them, bath tub so slippery we had to ask for a mat so we didn't break our necks, they let people smoke in their rooms and if you call to complain you become the problem - poor staff reponses - terrible customer service - who would ever want to stay here? We have stayed at a lot of hotels in the city and we always try to give a new one a chance - but this one was TERRIBLE - THEY WORST! I know it's not the PLAZA, but NO CUSTOMER SERVICE _ NO COFFEE IN ROOM, NO SAFE IN ROOM , NO NIGHT SERVICE (you get the room cleaned once and that is it!) , NO newspaper - but I think they feel they make up for it with apples in the lobby! At $359 a night they can forget it! I willl never stay at a W=WORST again! Stay at a MOTEL 6 and you'll do better. The only people that can be writing a good review must be the employees! Even the bartender in the lobby was only interesting in hitting on some of the male customers and didn't want to look at or serve the male/female couples! What a disaster! I am actually going to try to not pay for what was one entire night of a smoke filled smelling room! UGUGUGUGUGUGU

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cajohnaa
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the W a couple of times and have always enjoyed our stay. Staff has always been helpful and courteous. The room are very nice, well appointed and by New York standards comfortably sized. Would highly recommend staying there. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a New Manager”
Reviews.Author: rhlcpa
Reviews.Content: A huge disappointment. Upon check-in, it's obvious the hotel is nothing but smoke and mirrors--it's glitzy, glamerous, fashionable but that's where the compliments end. And, I was actually stupid enough to fall for the phone message that said if my stay wasn't what I was expecting, to call the manager at ext 66. "The manager is not available, but will call you back as soon he returns." I'm still waiting for the phone call. . . . . Had numerous problems w/our room: it was not what was requested, had to call (after 5:00 p.m.) twice to have the room cleaned, the robe was taken, I was erroneously charged for the munchie bar, the heating/ac was not working properly--it was just a disaster. Have stayed at other W Hotels and have never had problem. The manager probably should be practicing the phrase, "would you like fries with that order?" He's clearly out of his element. PS: And, not only will I not recommend this hotel to a friend, I am recommending this hotel be removed from our corporate list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Snazzy”
Reviews.Author: johnnyt918
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to stay in this amazing hotel for the weekend. Everything was perfect! The staff is accommodating, and everyone greets you with a warming smile. There are complimentary drinks and snacks in the lobby and a gorgeous lounge area. The view can be average or great depending on which side of the building your room is on. We we placed along the alley way facing a wall...but such is the life in NY. The rooms are a bit cozy, but quite lavish and modern. The bathrooms are wonderful too with supplies from Bliss, a trendy bath and body shop. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the definition of horrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: everywherenback
Reviews.Content: The W New York has no understanding of hospitality. Never have I felt so mistreated and stressed by a hotel. I was there recently on a business trip with my company. We had 7 rooms for 5 nights (spending over $12,000). The employees were rude and uncaring. The housekeepers woke our entire team up around 7:30AM every morning with their excessive and unnecessary noise in the hallways. The barbaric yells over the fully blasted volume on their walkie talkies was an awful way to start every day. The staff on the phone lines (who rarely answered the phones) was bad mannered and disrespectful. We were not even allowed to hold a work meeting in the lobby. The marketing department solved this issue by asking for more money to use the public area. They followed this pitch by saying, "You are not valued clients because you booked through Expedia and not the W sales directly". If you'd like to save yourself from hardship and tension, I'd suggest steering clear of The W Hotel New York- 541 Lexington Avenue New York, New York 10022.

Reviews.Title: “Switched our room at check-in, safety concerns”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York at least once a month for business and pleasure. I have a lot of friends in the city, I attend charity events, and I go for work on occasion. Most of the time I stay at the W or Westin in Times Square. Due to the proximity of a dinner I had to attend with my husband on this occasion I chose the W New York instead. This property is much older than the ones in Times Square so the rooms are smaller. The decor was nice, having just finished extensive renovations. However, this is the first time I was downgraded from the room I paid for. I have been upgraded many times at Starwood properties but this was a first. When we checked in the desk clerk called someone about our room but didn't say anything to us. She handed us our room keys and I asked if this was the Mega room that I booked. She told us that yes it was the Mega room. I guess she didn't know that we stay at W's a lot and would notice if she gave us a smaller room. As soon as I walked in I knew it was the wrong room. We were late for our dinner (people were waiting in the lobby for us) so we decided to deal with it at check out. We were leaving the room when the phone rang, it was the desk clerk downstairs telling us she made a mistake and gave us the wrong room so she had upgraded us to a suite for our inconvenience. We were happy she had decided to own up to her mistake but we were really late at this point. I went alone to switch the room so my husband could meet up with our friends. The suite was a very small, handicap accessible room, with a terrible view and a tiny bed. Not at all what I wanted, when you sleep in a big bed, downsizing is not fun. The view in the smaller room was better, it had a king sized bed, and a bigger bathroom. At this point I could not take the time to argue and just accepted it but I didn't need the miniature living room since we only wanted to sleep in the room. The bigger bedroom is what I wanted and I am still upset with the tiny bedroom we got stuck with. After dinner we went to The Whiskey Bar with our friends. From dinner until the end of the evening I had a glass of wine and two drinks over an eight hour period. In addition to four glasses of water and an espresso. I had just ordered a water and taken a couple drinks from it when I went to the bathroom. I was feeling fine, not at all tipsy until I reached the bathroom. I collapsed in the stall, I could not see or hear correctly and my legs would not hold my weight. After about an hour I was able to make it back downstairs, meet up with my husband (who, along with my friends had been frantically searching for me) and made it to my room where I passed out. I had a terrible headache the entire next day. The only conclusion we could come to was that someone slipped something in my water, probably at the bar where the wait staff picks up the drinks. I have never had anything like this happen to me before although I've heard of travelers being robbed and assaulted this way. Just be aware, the crowd in this bar is not the type of people I socialize with, it is very small and crowded; I think this may make it less safe than the ones at the other W's and Westins downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Under-W-helmed”
Reviews.Author: mjfore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and clean but the rooms have a lot of problems. 1) Bathroom door is too heavy to close 2) Poor lighting over the vanity 3) If you want a coffee pot you have to request one 4) No exhaust fan in the bathroom 5) The elevators stink with incense sticks 6) No thermostat in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great crash pad for a New York weekend”
Reviews.Author: St-George-416
Reviews.Content: After reading a bunch of the reviews on here, I was really worried that this place would be a disappointment but we had a fantastic stay. The lobby was modern and slick. We stayed on the 7th floor, and though we had an interior room with very little to look at with the exception of the occasional visiting pigeon, it was very quiet. Our room was technically a Cozy Room, but we had ample space and the bed was super comfy with crisp, white linens. The bathroom had funkyl wallpaper and was stocked with Bliss spa products (skip the treatment downstairs!). The room attendents seemed genuine when asking if our room was ok. The front desk staff were helpful with advice and suggestions and the servers in the lounge were attentive with drinks. The one VERY minor complaint was that our room key was kinda temperamental but I would DEFINITELY recommend this place as a perfect stepping off point for a hip weekend in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place Ever - looks cool but it sucks”
Reviews.Author: chrmil04
Reviews.Content: My wife used her Marriott points to stay at this place for a wedding. 1st problem - "non-smoking" room stank of cigarette smoke as did the hall. 2nd - I felt like I was in that movie "Coming to America" as I opened the blinds to look at of the window of the 12'x12' room and it was facing a brick wall. 3rd - when we asked to switch rooms because of the stink, the snot nosed pig at the front desk gave us a hard time. 4th - next morning, bill was under our door with a $900 room charge which had been paid for by points 5th - when we complained about this, again the snot nosed pig at the front desk gave us a hard time and never said "sorry" I would never stay here, my wife and I was easy-going as hell but this place just sucks. No doubt about it. She travels overnight for work at least once per month, I travel about once a quarter and we both this place is awful. The people working the front desk think they are part of some sort of elite hotel employ.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, cosmpolitan Hotel in the heart of Midtown”
Reviews.Author: SunSeaSandGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in January with my husband. We arrived to check in at about midnight, so tired from the journey from the UK. We had booked a "cozy" room (the most economical option) so were delighted to get a complimentary upgrade. The room was a fine size, large enougth to comfortably accomodate the huge superkingsize bed and massive flatscreen TV. We had an inward facing room and we could hear no noise from the street at all. The mattress was so comfortable I wanted to take it home with me. The linens were a really high thread count, as you would expect from a chain like the W. I have read reviews complaining that there was no tea/coffee making facility - well we just called reception and they brought one right up! Bathroom was small but perfectly formed and the Bliss bath products were fabulous. This hotel is very trendy, and the Whisky Blue bar attracts a glamorous clientele. There is constant trip hop music being piped around the hotel and all the common areas have an insence smell due to the scented candles which are everywhere. I loved it, and loved the nice touches like the wecome drinks on the way up to the rooms, and the tubs of grass dotted around the hotel. I have read lots of reviews on the this site with complaints about the staff but I must say I never encountered any rudeness. I would thorougly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere contemporary and stylish.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Travel Experience in Memory - Excellent and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: robinschmerler
Reviews.Content: Hi Edward, I travel a lot on business and stay at a wide range of hotels. I had to write to let you know that your facility is perhaps one of the best I have ever stayed at (that includes Fairmont Hotels, Loews, etc and lots of Hiltons as well as Ritz Carltonâ€™s). You have a truly amazing, helpful and friendly staff from the minute you walk in the door and everyplace in between. I know that you must run a great operation because everyone is happy, helpful and concerned with my comfort. I was only there two nights (but I will never be at the Hudson again â€“ even with the suite there). Thank you for one of the most relaxing business trips I could remember taking. Bravo on a job done best and Thank you! Robin

Reviews.Title: “Straight fraudsters”
Reviews.Author: amarie2902
Reviews.Content: Went to W in new york , Lexington and the hotel was OK , was only there for the wkend to celebrate my 30th birthday. Flew bk on the Sunday evening and imagine my unplesant shock that on the Wed i went to withdraw some money from my account only to see myself OVERDRAWN !!!!! Asked bank what was going on and they said that the hotel had taken $344.70 from my account on the Monday. I was bk in England on the mon, and what makes it worse was that someone actually SIGNED !!!!!!!!!!!! called the hotel ( so more costs involved) they were not apologetic atall but said that they would have my money transfered bk into my acc and that i had incurred these charges as late fees, Very cheeky and because the hotel has alot of celebs staying there it makes me wonder HOW OFTEN DO THAY DO THIS. I NEVER SIGNED 4 ANYTHING AND CHECKED IF THERE WAS ANY OUTSTANDING BALENCE AND WAS TOLD NO.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home to The Chic W, New York. Wonderful Service & Accomdations”
Reviews.Author: pruggieri
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to tell you that I had a wonderful stay. Everything was great and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. I really appreciated that as I was traveling alone for the first time in years. Having my coffee in the lounge area with the fire going in the morning was also a wonderful touch with a relaxing atmosphere. The fruit cup and yogurt was delicious. There was a minor glitch when I checked in because I didnâ€™t have my Starwoods card but the manager took care of it immediately and with a smile. Great service. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet interior room, great location for mid-town business”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night in February 2009. Can't beat location for doing business in mid-town and you can catch the E and 6 trains at 51st and Lex, Grand Central is a few blocks down on Lex too. On the whole, this place seemed more like a really posh dorm than a hotel. Blaring music in the lobby, tipsy people milling about the halls (at least watching them try to use the keycard in the elevator was amusing) and pretty small rooms. At least it was quiet, bed comfortable, and show clean. Highly recommend interior room facing room if you're a light sleeper - Lex stays humming at night. Staff was pleasant enough. Other options in the area if you're looking for something a little less hip, but absolutely as cramped, include Intercontinental and Waldorf in about the same price categories. On site Bliss spa is amazing if you have time for a treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people work there, but nothing gets done. Street noise all night in Lex Ave rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Visit-upstate-NY
Reviews.Content: What appears as a bargain hotel rate of $209 at the W Hotel chain's Lexington Avenue location is most certainly no bargain. My three colleagues and I booked 4 rooms, each of us expressed disappionted and will never stay there again. And we are not fussy people, all of us are frequent world travellers, we spend dozens of nights each year in NYC, staying at varoius mid-priced hotels or University clubs. Here is a summary of my experience at the W Lexington Avenue. This very busy section of Lexington Avenue - the sirens and horns blared well after midnight (luckily I had my earplugs with me). The windows are not soundproof as at other hotels. - you will need earplugs if your room faces the street. The rooms are small, which is expected in NYC, but the W's rooms are especially small, more like large closets, with no place other than the bed to set a suitcase, barely any room to get around the bed. And I had the deluxe corner room. - I am no fan of "form over function" and the W's rooms reek of form, with little practicality (for example the light switches are fussy push buttons with skinny slide dimmers, cutesy little signs on them, etc., closet light is built into the rack rather than overhead, etc.). And, to boot, many of the floor and table lights were UNPLUGGED in my room, really frustrating when I tried the wall switches, buttons on the lamps, etc. just to get a light to turn on! I finally realized the maid or prior guest must had unplugged them. Understandable - but someone from the hotel needs to pay attention to these things. As I walked to my room after check in, there were three room service trays, in front of three different rooms - with BREAKFAST DISHES (this was at 5pm). And, just in front of my room a big unattended hotel valet luggage cart was completely blocking the hall. I moved it aside and it was in the same location hours later. At check in I encountered an cheery front desk staff, and I was provided a card with a name and invitation to call with any questions or problems. When I left for dinner around 6pm I informed the person identified on the card that they should ask someone to remove the breakfast dishes. They expressed great shock over this and said they were "soooooo sorry." When I returned from dinner at 10pm the dishes were still in the hallway. This is a perfect example of the "friendliness with no follow through" that is often evidenct in poorly run establishments. After returning from dinner I noted that the "turndown" maid service left a printed note inviting me for coffee and a danish in the front lobby the following morning. I thought that was a nice touch, offered as token of goodwill for my less than perfect experience at the hotel thus far. The following morning I poured a coffee from the urn in the lobby, took a danish and presented the note to person watching me from behind the bar. She took the note, went to a cash register and presented me with a tab for around $10! I said there must be a misunderstanding, since had I given her the note inviting me for coffee and a danish. Her reply "no, that is only an invitation - nothing here is free for our guests". I gulped down my breakfast and vowed to never again set foot in the W Hotel, Lexington Ave. You would be wise to do so as well. Its management appears to be full of clueless amateurs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hipster Hotel, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: maryannCT
Reviews.Content: In NYC with friends, stayed at the W for it's location (walking to shopping) and Bliss spa. We booked a Fantastic suite, but at check in the bell hop broke some wine glasses we brought, so the manager upgraded us to a Spa suite and it was amazing! Really huge for NYC, double sinks, plenty of room for 3 girls to get ready to go out. Not too noisy either. Great drinks at the lobby bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you enjoy feeling ignored by people who are supposed to make you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: christim104
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to be staying at the W Hotel for my visit to NYC this year but man oh man was I disappointed- let me count the ways: 1. Front desk staff, bellboys and doormen all seemed to be too cool and socially engaged to assist you. We felt no love, no warmth or even friendliness. Upon arrival, my husband and me had to drag our luggage by ourselves all the way up to our room without any staff offering their assistance to us. I'd lived in NYC for 10 years and had never met this kind of rudeness before. 2. The elevators are tiny and we often had trouble operating them: we had to insert our keys at least a couple of times for the beeping sound to appear before we were able to press any buttons. Seriously, W Hotel, with the rate you charged for your rooms I think you can afford an upgrade of your elevator operating system. 3. Bathroom mirrors are located too high, the sink was slow to drain; oh and the bathroom is ridiculously small. 4. The mini bar is outragiously expensive and is tricked with the latest technology so that if you remove or touch anything inside for more than 30 seconds, they'll charge you for it even if you do not plan to drink/consume it.5. We asked for a late check-out on our last day, and we were supposed to vacate before 4 pm. Way before the time arrived, the cleanig ladies and various staff had come and knocked our door to inquire "If everything's okay" and "If indeed we would be leaving by 4 pm." Way to make your guests feel welcome (not!), W Hotel. I can go on and on about what made our stay there unpleasant but I'll save my breath and end with this: Avoid staying here. The Bliss bath products and great mattress and sheets do NOT justify the price they charge for the room!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy HVAC”
Reviews.Author: Weary101
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all of the amenities of the W chain - spa, gym, noisy nightlife, etc. Unfortunately, it is in a renovated older hotel building and the HVAC system seems to be original issue. It is very difficult to calibrate and it goes on and off with a bang, making it difficult to get a good night's sleep. I have stayed here twice, in different rooms on different floors, and had this experience both times.

Reviews.Title: “Whenver Whatever; Not so much........”
Reviews.Author: CtLex05
Reviews.Content: This was my Birthday weekend and Valentines Day so it was a combined celebration. Not so....... During he booking process I selected the Mega Room; not so Mega. Although, for NYC I guess it was OK. I spent almost 800.00 dollars for a 2 nite stay. With that being said I had some expectations. During the booking process, I requested alternative bedding/pillows do to both myself and partner being highly allergic to feathers. This request was acknowledged by the receptionist at check in. I was told that she would ensure that it would be taken care of that evening. After a few spa treatments I returned to the room with crooked eye brows from the waxing tech Jackie at the Bliss Spa and the manicure pedicure from Lucy was actually a pleasant surprise. On my way out that evening I stopped by the front desk to inform the receptionist to let her know that my request had not been taken care of. The receptionist was rude and ignorant; she stated sarcasticaly that she did not know if it had been taking care of. I politely informed her that if it had been taken care of that I would not . After an evening out, I returned to the room only to be disappointed that the request was denied. A phone call was made to the desk and after waiting for 2 hours we opted to sleep on towels so that we could get some sleep. Housekeeping on the 16th Floor was pathetic. Room was very dusty to add insult to the allergens. However, when on the second night the crumbs from the inital day were still on the floor it confirmed that the assigned housekeeper was not only miserable that she actually had to work but incompetent. She appearantly did not use the vacuum cleaner. Bliss Spa was also a BIG Disappointment; when using the Facilities the products to cleanse your face and body did not come out of the dispensers freely it was a chore to get a squirt of soap. Also, the gym was not that clean. There were no paper towels and or disenfectant to sanitize the equipment before or after use.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price in NYC”
Reviews.Author: hocomogirl
Reviews.Content: Paid $155 per night through priceline, which is a pretty hard to beat deal for a nice hotel in Manhattan. We stayed in a Cozy Room on floor 14, which was teeny tiny, but that is to be expected in New York. No major complaints, but based on the room amenities alone, this is more of a 3 star than a 4 star hotel. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was sparkling. Lighting in the room was minimal but sufficient. Plenty of room in the closet for hanging clothes, but there wasn't a good place for us to put out luggage. Had a fabulous facial and a mediocre manicure at the Bliss spa. Living Room in the lobby was a very pleasant place to sit and relax with a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: soapwater650
Reviews.Content: I get there and needed wireless internet for my work. Everyone I called to get it set up in the room was quite nice, but completely incompetent. It took over 30 min of calling, getting dropped, them saying they had fixed it (but they hadn't). I eventually gave up and went downstairs to the lobby. I called back a couple days later to see if a shirt that I had left in a drawer had been recovered. While the previous people I had talked to were nice despite their incompetencies, this guy was really quite unpleasant and had a major attitude. I was shocked by how rude he was. The service at the hotel needs some SERIOUS reworking, and until I've heard raving reviews from people I truly trust there is no way I am going back I expected more from the W

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go wrong with the W”
Reviews.Author: kimgeubelle
Reviews.Content: As always I had an excellent stay for my overnight trip to the city. The service, linens, robe, etc was all great. Even the space, while small was very spacious and the furniture made it seem bigger than my condo!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to drink, bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: This may have been one of the places where the W Hotel concept was born but they've never been able to get things right here other than with the bar and lounge. So good place to hang, bad place to stay. Service is terrible and rooms, even the ones that have been redone, are small and awkward. When I stayed here last week, they had given away my room even though I had a reservation. Waited for another room to vacate which might have been okay except that I had just gotten off a red eye and had meetings to go to. Manager apologized, said that they would make it up to me by upgrading me to a suite on the 18th floor - they never did... The irony is that the other W's in New York are just much better places to stay at. Staying here is just not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “They really emphasize all the little things that embody a spectacular experience.”
Reviews.Author: FunnyCide5
Reviews.Content: Great combination of entertainment and luxury in mid-town manhattan. When I have a choice of options, I select this location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine business location”
Reviews.Author: mjason30
Reviews.Content: I was in New York on business with colleagues . We used the hotel also for a small meeting. The computer system was super fast and the girls at the reception very helpful and quick to solve our questions on a log-in issue. The room I was given was very different than my colleagues' and more spacious. I found theirs to be a little claustophobic but mine was perfect. We had all booked the same standard rooms but I was upgraded. The beds we all found very confortable and had a great night's sleep. The rooms and public areas were very clean. The food was ok and the service good and quick. We all enjoyed the location which was super convenient for business and for leisure afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff but some issues”
Reviews.Author: sendmehome
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my adult daughter for 6 nights. The room was small, even by NY standards. While it was tastefully furnished with comfortable twin beds, the lighting is ambient and impossible to really see anything. Since the room is so small, why they have chosen to take up valuable space with a huge mini bar boggles my mind. There were two drawers for clothes. But it does have a large closet that has its own light. The bathroom, of course, is small and very hot!!! There is no fan or AC vent in it and it appears that some sort of heating system is embedded in the wall and radiates extra heat. We also had a lot of difficulty with the room heatling and cooling. Now they always responded quickly to our requests, but they replaced the entire unit three times. Each time it would work for a while and then quit blowing cold air. Now even though I'm not an engineer, even I would think that 3 units could not all be faulty. Finally the last maintenance person just reset the signal between the thermostat and the unit and it worked again. The hotel did make proper amends for the incovenience, but still we had several very warm nights. There is a large safe in the room that is a nice touch along with big robes for your use. The bedding was upscale and very comfy and the big flat screen tv was mounted on a pole and could be seen in any direction. They also provide two wine glasses and a wine bottle opener in the room, another nice touch. However, there is not a coffee maker in the room. The free use of the Acura is wonderful and the staff there is very accomodating. You can schedule it whenever it is free to take you reasonable distances. Can save lots in cab fare. (note: they will not pick you up from someplace but will take you from the hotel). We had breakfast at the hotel several times and the food was very good, but of course, at NY prices. Across Lexington about 2 blocks toward 45th, there is a pizza, sandwich and breakfast place that has two eggs, homefries and toast for $2.99. Best deal around if you don't mind going out. The restaurant is not open for dinner but will be happy to deliver room service with about, in the aggregate, a 30% surcharge. There is a bar in the hotel and a living room where people sit for cocktails. However, they play this "house music" very loudly and it really is for a young crowd. It is also played on the elevator and is very annoying. You can use the business center computer for about $1.00 a minute. You can, however, print out your boarding pass for free in the lobby. My daughter and I both used the Bliss Spa and we were very disappointed. This is not a first class spa. My manicure took 12 minutes!!! My daughter said it was the most expensive and worst massage she ever had. When I went to check out, the line to pay was 8 people deep. We were not impressed. We also were not impressed that you had to pay $16.95 for internet service in your room. You could use wireless service in the living room area so I saw many folks taking up seats in this cocktail area and just using their laptops. I know I did. The hotel is not very near good shopping. You can walk to it but it is a little hike. There were really few restaurants nearby either. It is close to Grand Central which is an experience in itself. The concierge was very helpful and we used this service many times. The front desk staff was also very accomodating and helped in any way they could. I was truly impressed with all of the staff as they all treated us valued guests. The Manager(s) responded quickly to any of our problems. All in all, I thought it was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always great service at the W”
Reviews.Author: xavierCT75
Reviews.Content: As always I continue to get excellent service at all SPG hotels and particularly with all W brand hotels. This recent visit was for a business meeting and they were very accommodating in allowing me an extra late check out. The staff was very helpful and their meeting services were splendid.

Reviews.Title: “You will Love this place”
Reviews.Author: JimLongValleyNJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed at other W hotels and other hotels in NYC. This is the nicest one. The staff really made us feel welcome and catered to our every need. Great food, Great location and beutiful lobby and rooms. Enjoy. Jim

Reviews.Title: “No hassle customer service - if you haven't been in a while, give them another try!”
Reviews.Author: CG_ATL
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were snowed in NYC the weekend before Christmas and moved to the W when our first hotel refused to let us extend our stay on points and demanded an exorbitant rate for the "privilege". The W not only let us stay on points in prime season, the staff made our stay the one part of the trip that was hassle-free. They were friendly and every request was met with an attitude of "no problem, we'll take care of it". We didn't know from day to day when we would be able to get a flight out, and the front desk staff made sure we didn't have to worry about it - they blocked us in the same room and were extremely flexible with us, recognizing that we had no control over the airline dilemma! In past years, prior to the renovation at this hotel, I had experienced an attitude among the staff that was in no way backed up or warranted by the quality of the experience. They were riding on the coattails of the W Hotel chain's reputation. The rooms and hallways were very worn and past their prime, yet the staff often acted like we were lucky to be there since it was so "cool." The rooms are still small, but they are much nicer post-renovation, and the attitude of the staff has completely changed for the better - we were made to feel that our business was appreciated and that they were happy to help. I will definitely go back, and would encourage others who may have had mediocre experiences in the past to give them another chance - you may be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: Rioca
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to take in all of NYC. Superior service; clean, modern hotel/room.

Reviews.Title: “W always impresses.”
Reviews.Author: MikeyLikesIt09
Reviews.Content: I bought my girlfriend tickets to the Lion King for Christmans. Having stayed at the W-Seattle, I always look for a W wherever I travel too. I went to San Diego last summer and regrettably booked another hotel, and wished I just stayed at the W. So, when i headed to NYC, it was a no-brainer to book the W-New York. Prices seemed better than W-Times Square, probably relative price based on proximity...however, the W New York is still within walking distance to Times Square and saw some sights along the way.....I utilized the Whatever/Whenever service to get a free ride in the awesome Acura MDX, nice touch. I valeted the my car upon arrival and the door service (Welcom Ambassadors) were very pleasant and right away the stay was off to a great start. We went to Whiskey Blue in the hotel and it was a pretty cool scene...great music- expensive drinks....thats what is to be expected all over NYC. Had some cocktails in the Living Room which was also very chill scene. My girlfriend was super impressed with the Whole experience. Wohoo!

Reviews.Title: “Needs new heating system controls.”
Reviews.Author: teemaintwo
Reviews.Content: This could have been a wonderful choice for my night in NYC. The location was ideal for meeting up with friends. The lobby lounge (called Oasis) is a terrific space. And the low priced room was cute and clean. But... the heating/cooling system did not have an 'off' switch and was constantly cycling from too hot to too cold: at unacceptably loud levels to boot. I hardly slept at all. I have responded to the Hotel's emails about passing along a review to them, so I will be interested to see if anything ever changes. - Let us know fellow TripAdvisor people!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Experience”
Reviews.Author: kevman80301
Reviews.Content: The W New York somehow mixes professionalism and class with alittle bit of trend and funk. Its like no other hotel I have ever seen before. The lobby is very sophisticated and it looks to be a place of many business meetings during the week. The room was fantastic. Definitely a different type of decor, but something you could get used to quickly. It makes you feel like you are in New York! Even the music and the smells gives off a New York type vibe. (You will understand what I mean when you go) You will enjoy the smell of the Lemongrass and Sage shampoo they offer you in the room from the Bliss Spa below. If you go to New York, you should stay here at least one night. The Whiskey Blue is nice, but it is pricey and there are better bars in the city for you to check out. Dont expect to hear yourself when you grab a drink here either. Park your car somewhere else. It is $60 for parking if I am not mistaken!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel with a Splashy Paint Palette”
Reviews.Author: BusLeisTravler
Reviews.Content: I just want to be clear - I am a loyal Starwood member and stay regularly at all brands of the hotel group for business and leisure (have been gold or platinum for the last 6 yrs). I regularly stay at the W New York, because its the best value option of the Starwood group in that area. For the price point, its not too bad for what it is. Think of it as a reasonably priced, budget, mid-range hotel. With that way of thinking, you will get everything you expect. Stylish lobby and attempts to be eccentric with the style of the hallway furniture on each floor help, so it looks better than a budget hotel, but in many cases I have had better service at Best Westerns and Holiday Inns - so its all about the balance here at the W New York. The rooms are always clean, the toiletries from Bliss I love and are regularly replaced (so feel free to collect for the use at home). Expect the prices for everything else to be ridiculous to the point that is well worth taking a few mins walk to get food and drink. One of these days Starwood will reduce the price of Wifi, or just make it free, but expect to drop $16.00 for 24 hour access. The biggest issue, and this happens everytime I check in, is that the front of house staff are socializing with the door or bell-staff to the point where you go largely unnoticed forcing you to interrupt the ongoing conversation. Generally, its not the experience that draws me back, but the price point and my loyalty to Starwood - I just wish they would make it a bit easier to stay loyal whenever I visit the W New York. Oh! and Whisky Blue is the hip club that still draws a fun crowd on the weekends, the short stagger back to your room after the night of dance and drink is definitely a selling point.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Guest Experience”
Reviews.Author: cbernal57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "W" on Lexington Ave for New Years with my wife and two daughters. We had a great time being in the City for New Years...the buss at the W was everything we (my two daughters) had expected. But what really made the trip memorable was the fantastic customer experience we received after we checkout and started our journey back to CA. My one daughter forgot half her wardrobe in the closet...of course we assumed that was a done deal. But we contacted the hotel and Nelson with the security dept -- told us that he would go to the room and call us back (right?). He did and took complete charge of having all of her items FedEx to our home in CA. Thank you Nelson and thank you W Hotel...and as our Governor in California is famous for saying..."I'll be Back."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Keithd121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice relaxing place to stay. The rooms may not be the biggest, but heh! they were only to sleep in not live/party! This hotel was perfect for our stay, it was within walking distance of all the shopping areas and close enough to Grand Central Station and Subway to reach further afield. Friendly and helpful staff made it all the better, my only grumble was that the Internet service was expensive for the time you were allowed. Also don't move any of the 'goodies' in your room, unless you want to eat or drink them because unfortunately they are movement sensitive, this means if you move them you are charged. However these charges are removed when you explain and the staff were generally extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst W hotels”
Reviews.Author: MSolly
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of W hotels generally. I have happily stayed in San Francisco, San Diego, LA, New Orleans, Seattle etc etc. My experiences in NYC have been mixed: worst have been terrible and best have been marginal. I've probably spend 20 nights at this hotel over past 18 months on about 10 separate occassions. Rooms are small, a bunch of the rooms have single beds (most people over age of 15 won't fit into it) and they have a super loud air conditioning/heating system which really needs to be left off if you want a quiet room. I am SPG gold which hasn't really helped at all get decent room on a consistent basis. I have also had two experiences where i have on my printed itinerary a confirm from the hotel of a queen bed and when i arrived they said all sold out and only single bed avail. AFter each stay you receive an email asking for feedback. I provided feedback on poor experiences I have had and never received a response back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dash-me
Reviews.Content: The rooms are NY sized but the service and friendliness of the staff is incredible. And when work related issues come up forcing you to change plans at a seconds notice management is amazing at accomodating your request. That slogan "whatever whenever"... is really in full effect here.

Reviews.Title: “"THIS REALLY IS WHATEVER WHENEVER"”
Reviews.Author: laurenm2009
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel w my husband everytime we stay in NYC and we won't go anywhere else! They have everything you need! The rooms are full of amenities, in room movies, room service for whatever whenever!!! I wanted slippers one time and they brought them up immediatley! They also went to the store to get us some iced teas that weren't on the in room dining menu. The Bliss productsin the room are the best and the bath robes are great! The beds are super comfy!!! What more could you want? I highly recommend this hotel, the staff is friendly and accommodating This hotel has Bliss Spa right in the hotel which was so convenient for me and the massage was truly BLISS :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: emmasouthshields
Reviews.Content: This was the second time i have stayed in this hotel and i couldn't fault it. The hotel is ideally located to all the major attractions and there is a subway station right next to it. The hotel room was quite spacious, which is a rarirty in Manhatten and the complimentary Bliss products are superb. When we arrived we found that our hotel room safe wasn't working, we called down to the concierge and someone was upto the room within 5 minutes to fix it. If you have had a busy day and can't be bothered to go out for an evening meal, the in room dining is well worth a look (especially the pizza!!). I would personally ignore all of the negative reviews, as we all know if you look hard enough we could all find negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star experience”
Reviews.Author: Schrodingers_Gerbil
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not hold a candle to other four-star hotels in the Midtown East area. The rooms are cramped, dirty and poorly laid out. Because of the small size, the walls and furniture are scuffed and filthy from other travelers trying to navigate the small area. The sinks did not drain (even after we complained), and toilet flushing sounded like the take-off of the space shuttle Atlantis. The walls and doors are so thin that I am now intimately familiar with the lives of the cleaning ladies. When we checked in, we had a 20 minute wait in the lounge area for our room to be prepared even though we arrived after 3 pm. The lounge was FILTHY, with used glasses and plates littering every flat surface. In places, the plates were stacked 3-4 high. We have stayed in many four-star hotels in the midtown area (e.g., Omni Berkshire, Benjamin, Grand Hyatt, Intercontinental). The W does not compare. This hotel SHOULD NOT be marketed as 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: rcali79
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline.com and while the pictures looked great, the bad reviews worried me prior to arrival. However, we had a wonderful experience at the W. As mentioned in a few other reviews, upon arrival our room was upgraded without asking and we were able to check in at 11am rather than the 3pm normal time. We were also given a late (4pm) checkout rather than the normal 12pm by a quick call to the front desk. Very convienent to subway, shopping, and sightseeing. Room was small but that is expected in NYC, definitely acceptable for a single couple. Funky decor and friendly staff! Be sure to take advantage of the Acura experience..book early and get some great free rides!

Reviews.Title: “Energized in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mbmuscle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times, it is consistent at a high level each time, valet, front desk, Acura Concierge staff are excellent! Fitness center is also excellent, buzzing bars and lounges with lots of "pretty people". Wife & I had a terrific time, can't wait to return visit

Reviews.Title: “I always love this W - small rooms, but consistently great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: FL53095
Reviews.Content: Service = Great Location = Great Room Size = On the small side On-site Food/Bar = Great Decor = Very Modern - Great

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!Funky and Functional!”
Reviews.Author: ceciliawalker4253
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Christmas Eve for nights as part of a package with Expedia.Had a 'Spectacular Room' which was fine for me.Enormous very comfy bed,massive TV,tastefully decorated,Blliss goodies in the bathroom,nice and quiet.Great location for shops and sightseeing,2 minutes walk from subway at 51st Street.They push this 'Whatever you Want You Get' nonsense-and I rang up to say please can I have a kettle to make a cup of tea?Nope, only coffee makers available!!!Downstairs bar nice for a drink/snack-used the gym which was great.Beware of the mini-bar!!!!It is pad-activated and I swear I didn't touch a thing knowing how extortionate mini bar prices are and sure enought they billed me $15 for something I didn't have!!!Great hotel for location,nice deli a 5 minute walk away for breakfast/lunch/snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: Good location for business and shopping. The lobby and bar area has a nice feel to it albeit the music is a bit loud at times. The rooms are small but this is normal for NYC. However the lighting in the rooms was really bad. A plus was the breakfast bar in the lobby which safes the walk to Starbucks and the coffee is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the W Hotel New York”
Reviews.Author: Crystal2680
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed for 4 nights at the W Hotel from 29th November 09 to 3rd December 09. We booked a Cozy room but on checking in at the W Hotel we were given Free upgrade to a Spectacular room (without asking) and we were able to go straight to our room even though it was only 2.20pm and the official time rooms were available was 3pm. There room had plenty of space with a fully lit built in wardrobe which had plenty of room to store our suitcases, the bathroom was a reasonable size with great shower and room to move about. The bed was lovely and soft and the most comfortable I've ever slept in (if you don't like soft beds then this isn't for you). The location of the hotel was good, we were apporiximately 5 minutes walk from Grand Central station, 10 minutes from 5th Avenue, 20 minutes from Times Square and Empire State Building and 30 minutes from Madison Square Gardens and Macy's. We bought ourselves a weeks subway travel pass which we only used twice to get to battery park and back for the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island Cruise. We walked everywhere else which was tiring but worth it for all the great sites we saw and would have missed if we'd been underground. The day before we were due to leave we asked reception what time checkout was and we were told 12 noon, we asked if there was anywhere we could leave our cases until we had to leave at 3pm and we were immediatley given a late 3pm checkout (again free of charge) which meant we could enjoy our last few hours in New York and then freshen up for our journey home. The hotel was dimly lit throughout (if you don't like dark hotels this isn't for you) which we felt added to warm cozy atmosphere of the hotel, for an extra touch every evening in reception there was complimentary mulled wine or cider and biscuits or chocolates, which was a very nice touch and one which everyone seemed to appreciate. During our stay at the W Hotel all the staff we encountered were always very friendly and helpful which was a complete contrast to the reviews I read before we went. I believe in making your own judgements and whilst this hotel may not be to everyone's taste, my Husband and I had a great stay and would recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: carolynvm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! Great location, hip bar, modern decor. Rooms aren't enormous but are roomy enough, and the bed, pillows and down comforter are amazing! We also got a very reasonable rate on-line. Plus there are Bliss products in the bathroom! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location & service excellent, perfect for a quick trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Teddy215
Reviews.Content: I first must clarify that I am a Starwood Preferred Member. I was traveling to New York on very short notice and prefer to stay at W or Westin hotels. Although the online reservation system was showing availability, I was having difficulty booking my dates. I called Starwood Preferred and received excellent service - they were even able to secure 2 nights for me with my Starwood points over a weekend during the ridiculously busy month of December in Manhattan. I cannot say enough good things about the Starwood Preferred staff. The hotel was excellent during our stay, but again was free for us with the use of my points. I would not have paid the $550 rack rate for the nights I was there, but I wouldn't pay $550 for a night at any hotel in New York! That's just me. However, Christmastime in New York is always ridiculously expensive so it is to be expected to pay that much. The front desk staff was very friendly, accommodating and willing to help with whatever we needed. Our room was not yet available, but they called my cell phone the moment that it opened up. The bell staff was integral in providing us with cabs and umbrellas to get to our destinations - we visited during a massive rain-changing-to-snow storm. The lobby area and both bars were lively at all times of the day, which is something I like - I was there for vacation so I felt a great sense of community and fun with my fellow travelers enjoying the common spaces along with myself and my guest. The hotel's location is perfect for visiting many tourist destinations and makes for some great walking around the city. Rooms are small - but this is New York, so it wasn't unexpected. More like a boutique hotel than a "typical" hotel. The bed and shower of course are beyond comfortable. I appreciated the eclectic decor inside the rooms. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for travelers to New York looking for a little more of an upscale, young, trendy stay, especially if it is more affordable around non-holiday time.

Reviews.Title: “Rodents and Roaches - not good for business”
Reviews.Author: MedEventsTeam
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, small rooms, meeting rooms claiming to have natural daylight had frosted windows backing up to a concrete wall. Wallpaper was damaged and panels missing in the meeting room. Rodents in 2 separate guest rooms and cockroaches were found on the lunch buffet table before meeting delegates had started to eat. The central sales process was long and when finally passed through to the hotel events team, responses to requests had to be chased and chased. Transfers were booked incorrectly despite email confirmation. Not good for business.

Reviews.Title: “very accommodative”
Reviews.Author: zzzzmd
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood gold member, the W's in general, and the W new York went out of their way to ensure I get a double to triple upgrade. Even when I came late on a very busy Saturday night, they upgraded me to a Mega Room. Other times they may have not been able to give an upgrade, due to availability, but they always make up for it on the next visit. The rooms are clean, recently redone, and the place is always very active with a metro crowd later in the week

Reviews.Title: “Too Hip to be cool...overpriced, lousy room”
Reviews.Author: lsr2009
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, unprofessional front desk clerks clueless about a simple debit card situation. The elevators are tiny (4 very thin people, max), the hallways are very dark, musty smell. The room: 2 good things: comfy bed and good tv. Bad things about room: the decor /color scheme is not trendy anymore, needs an update to lighter, happier colors, yellow-grey lighting everywhere in the hotel, no natural light anywhere, especially bad lighting in our room's bathroom and the mirrors in bathroom were too high, the sink was clogged and slow to drain, the heating system made loud noises when it cycled and woke us from sleep, dirty carpet. The mini bar area is tricky -don't touch anything for more than 30 seconds if you are not planning on eating/drinking it. We stayed for one night and definitely did not get our money's worth. We should have gone the Plaza... or the Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Guiv37
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for a very very small room. The location is good. But the concierge is very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: BDCTraveler25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the spur of a moment business trip. I always stay at W Union Square, but this hotel is in a better location to dining and shopping. The lobby is absolutely beautiful with fireplaces and nice couches. The rooms are extremely small, but I'm one person so how much space do I really need? I went to Del Frisco's for dinner and that was extremely delicious and highly recommend that as well. Overall this was a great stay and I hope to come back this summer with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Useful base for midtown”
Reviews.Author: jedp78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business and very much enjoyed it. It's very central for midtown (close to Grand Central, Central Park etc). I have also stayed at the Intercontinental Barclay over the road but personally preferred the W, due to the decor being more modern, and the glazing being better. I was on a lower floor at the W than in the Intercontinental, but generally slept much better due to it being quieter. The rooms are reasonably small but this is fairly typical for NYC. I only had one meal here and it was very good, but don't feel I can comment on the food in general.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: elisad79
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights this past weekend at the w new york.... Everything was great from start to finish. Location was perfect. Rooms were fine, comfortable beds, good sized bathrooms. Staff was accomodating. Breakfast at the heartbeat was expensive...$90.00 for three of us. Other then that, we had a fantastic stay. Whiskey blue downstairs was happening every night. Acura experience was great. I cant really complain about anything. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY RELAXED ON THEIR ATTITUDE TO CASH BEING STOLEN ON GUESTS”
Reviews.Author: fiona15
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights from 16th november - 20th november. we travel to new york once a year and stay in the W because of location and we really like the hotel. on our last day we left our luggage in the hold room which is locked and maintained by a staff member. we arrived back at the hotel collected our bags and headed straight to the airport. on arrival to the airport my husband went to a special compartment in our luggage where he had â‚¬450 put by in case we needed it, only to find the money had been stolen. no one could have had access to our luggage only the hotel staff. we reported it straight away to the hotel who basically do not seem to care that guests items have been stolen and also don't seem keen to investigate that the stuff is being stolen by a staff member. we paid alot of money to stay at this hotel and it will be our last stay. i have contacted the hotel several times and they constantly fob me off and fail to return my calls. so for any guests contemplating booking this hotel, keep your cash safe at all times. the standard this hotels sets for itself, this is the last thing we expected to experience from such a place. we feel very let down that this has not been followed up at all.

Reviews.Title: “starwood expectation fulfilled”
Reviews.Author: kshangil
Reviews.Content: Found the W New York to represent the Starwood brand well. The hotel IS a NYC hotel, thus the rooms are smaller than lets say a Days Inn in rural Kentucky. What I enjoyed most about this hotel is the warm welcome and the professionalism of the staff. Being a SPG Platinum member, I have visited many Starwood properties. This one is among the best for front desk check-in. We arrived at 11am and our room was ready. I was asked if I would like my gift to be the 500 points, without request. Also, our upgrade was ready to a top floor king size room. Granted the room is tremendously small. Having said that, they did a great job in utilizing the space with a very stylish decor. The bed was extremely comfortable. When over sleeping our wake up call, the front desk sent someone to knock on our door.

Reviews.Title: “Save your wonga”
Reviews.Author: FootlooseBoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grossly overrated. The room was dark, dysfunctional [look in the minibar and you get charged!] and to get to the window we had to climb over the bed. The view from the window: a brick wall and and the aircon system. Ask to change? Forget it. Miss smartypants at the front desk looked down her nose and told us we'd have to wait - at those prices! Well we didn't. We checked out and went to a small inn where we had a better room, friendly service and more NY experience than the W will ever provide The bar was good, though. Mind you, you needed it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room & disappointing service!”
Reviews.Author: chubette
Reviews.Content: I really was expecting more from this hotel. The location was great however, rooms were small, and front desk service was disappointing! Last year we had an amazing stay at the Hampton Inn. The W was no comparison to the Hampton Inn. It felt like the only competent people we dealt with were the doormen and the housekeeping staff. The front desk service agents were rude and incompetent. It took more than one of them to figure out our reservations and they all provided conflicting information. As for the lobby of the hotel, it was not a typical hotel lobby but felt like a staging room for the bar attached to the hotel. It was poorly lit and seating was lacking for hotel guests. On the first night of our stay, a hotel staff accidentally set off the fire alarm at 4;45 am - definitely not a great start to our stay. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: EmilyB1
Reviews.Content: Great reception but over priced, over rated and getting a decent sleep on those terrible beds was impossible; ended up sleeping on the sofa's.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: alleyrick
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a GREAT time!!! The hotel was clean and neat and the employees were VERY accomodating!!! we LOVED the hotel and service and will be staying here again the next time we visit NYC!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “nyc hotel”
Reviews.Author: marco.to
Reviews.Content: the smallest room i ever seen. smallest bathroom were i ever had a shower. the tv do not work, if u touch things - just if u touch it - you will pay for it!! nice location. at the same price you can find better places around

Reviews.Title: “dark & stinky”
Reviews.Content: rooms were too dark. in fact, the entire hotel was pretty dark. our room was so heavily perfumed, i thought i would have an asthma attack (even though i don't have asthma!). the smell was overwhelming. we asked the front desk if anything could be done, but we were told that housekeeping sprays the rooms when they clean them. no offer to change rooms, no apology. on a good note, the beds were very comfortable and since i used points, we got our room for $90 which is unheard of in the city. overall, who can complain about a $90 room, but i would NEVER pay more than that to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW IS REALLY WOW AT THE W”
Reviews.Author: bicycling4ever
Reviews.Content: This hotel rocks. I have always had a great experience at W's but this was a cut above. i made a special room request that was honored immediately and graciously. The room was awesome and the customer service top-notch. It was a special occassion for us and the hotel GM surprised us with something really special. Great location-great experience-great stay!!! A million thanks to the GM and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, bring a flashlight, and come prepared for a small room”
Reviews.Author: CTA76
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel via Priceline. I figured I couldn't go wrong with a 4* hotel in NYC, and my heart kind of sank a bit when I came here after winning the hotel. However, after reading the reviews, we prepared ourselves for a small room and that's exactly what we got. Yes, the room is small. It will hold no more than two people. We didn't find the hotel staff very snobby -- we only went to them twice -- once to check-in, and once to check-out. They were friendly and quickly performed both tasks. Yes, the minibar is motion sensored -- so don't touch anything in that area and you'll be fine. In regards to the lighting -- it's bad. No way around it. It's one thing to be hip, modern, and cool, but none of that works if you can't see it. The only option for the window shade is a thick fabric shade that lets in NO light. The bathroom lighting was also inadequate. Somebody mentioned the lighting in the elevators -- I'm not sure if the W put more light in there, but we didn't find that too dark. You do need a room key to use the elevator though. Overall, not a bad hotel. We've paid more and received a lot less in our years of travel. Just come prepared and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent use of cash&points”
Reviews.Author: SgFm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bargain for a Starwood hotel, if you belong to their Starwood Preferred Guest program. We used 4800 points and paid $90. We found check-in very efficient, got a slightly upgraded room too. Our room on the 8th floor was on the Lexington Ave. side of the hotel, there was significant traffic noise as a result. The room was modest in size, which is not unusual, in my experience, in New York. The lobby area is quite attractive. The elevators were a little on the slow side, and required the insertion of your room key to operate.

Reviews.Title: “It hurts to be cool”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler555
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool hotel, but the rooms are painfully small. Really painfully small. I've been here three times and you can barely move around in some of them. And they have those old fashioned, really noisy free standing wall/window based air conditioners and heaters. Hard to believe for the prices. Food is very good in room service and restaurants. Staff is good, but a bit too into how cool they think they are.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: halfpint08
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4nite stay in the W on Lex and I was really wary about staying there having read all the bad reviews beforehand. - but we had nothing to be concerned about. I really think some people just complain about anything for the sake of complaining! Yes we got the hotel at a great deal and yes the walls in the rooms could do with a bit of paint but other than that we had no issues. We turned up at 12pm and although we had requested an early check in time at 1pm we were intially told we could not check in till 3pm however as we were storing our bags in the lobby to go walkabout a lovely gentleman came over and told us they had found a room for us and we could check in straightaway. We were given a Spectacular Room which had 2 full windows so lots of light and no less than 5 other light sources so not only was it lightfilled but nicely spacious too, complete with walk in wardrobe. We had a lovely view of the Waldorf across the street and the skyline. The bed was super comfy with a large flat screen tv at the base. The aircon wasnt any noisier than any other hotel and we could lower/higher/turn off as we pleased. The mini bar prices werent overly expensive and we didnt get charged for anything we didnt take. The bathroom itself was lovely, nice and bright & the reviews about it being too small and too dark were unfounded.. its compact (its NYC!) but not too small.. nice large pedestal sink and huge shower/showerhead and the 1/2 door is more than ample to stop water on the floor. We had lovely fluffy towels replaced whenever we wanted and fluffy robes to match. Bliss products delivered every day whether we had used our quota or not and our room cleaned everyday also (we never saw anyone, it was like magic.. we just returned to a lovely fresh room each day!) The only slight downside if even, is that the bathroom "door" is just a slider and it doesnt actually meet the wall when you close it so if you are prudish then it may not suit as it just gives the element of privacy rather than actual privacy! :-) We found the staff extremely courteous and helpful and they always answered our queries (But note if they point you in the direction of Raffles cafe for brekkie dont go unless u want to spend over $60 on a not so good brekkie .. id say the hotel itself is a better bet!) and theres loads of good tasty cheap cafes nearby (Europa Cafe) for original NYC breakfast. The lobby is lovely and always busy & the Whiskey Blue bar is hopping at night but we never heard it from our room and had great night's sleep.
