We were a little overwhelmed by the clientele in the lobby/bar even when dressed to the nines but in hindsight i think thats just NYC.. superchic! all in all a fab stay in a fab hotel, we will definitely go back... we got engaged whilst there so our anniversaries will be spent there im sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JMac63Montreal
Reviews.Content: After all the negative reviews I was concerned after booking blindly on Hotwire. Our three night stay was the first trip away from the kids in 6 years and I didn't want it to go off the rails from day one. My concerns were misplaced - it was a great stay. Good Surprises: Renovations appeared complete, our room was newly redone and while the room was small it was designed with the purpose and not just thrown together. As for rooms being dark, we disagree, I counted 6 different sources of lighting in the bedroom all of them relatively subtle which is better than glaring. The bathroom (which many complained about) is great. The glass shower stall has a half door but we didn't experience water on the floor. In fact the oversized showerhead is high enough for me (6' 3") to stand under with room to spare. Huge pedastal sink. The Bliss shower gels (Lemon) and other amenities are great, so make sure to get your daily quota. Very comfortable bed. Great Tivoli bedside clock radio with iPod dock. Whiskey Blue (off the lobby) is definitely a happening bar - loud and packed. Water with berries in the morning and hot cider in the afternoon next to elevators, a great start and end to a day of touring. A block away from 51st street subway station so getting to SOHO or the Village is easy. Midtown is convenient to everything. Bad surprises: View, was less than good, it included air conditioning equipment, a multilevel parking garage and the back of restaurants. No sunlight, dracula is safe. But we actually didn't care because we didn't come to New York to sit by our hotel window. So we kept the blind closed. Air conditioning/heater unit wasn't quiet, but this is often the case in hotels I find. The thermostat has little switches on the underside which when set to ECONO shut the thing off - I prefered to open the window ( YES the windows open - Hurray!) a crack and get the city air. Valet parking is $60 per day. Park it instead at the pristine ICON Parking a 1.5 blocks away on 51st just east of Lex for $43 a day (including tax). No HD channels on the nice flat screen except for pay per view movies. If you choose to haul your own luggage up to your room the trolleys are not allowed upstairs unless you use a bellhop. Overall a great stay and a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “too cool for skool”
Reviews.Author: ColDavenport
Reviews.Content: Room okay, mattress not great. Elevator ridiculously black so you can't see to insert your room card to operate the damn elevator. V. expensive for what the hotel offers. Staff trying desperately to be cool but come across as charmless, unhelpful and NY rude. Would I stay there again? N.O. not at their prices.

Reviews.Title: “The W was way beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: JillRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the NY Marathon this past weekend and stayed at the W. The hotel is beautiful - very relaxing decor and the staff were excellent. Our room was not ready around 12 pm (guaranteed checkin isn't until 3 anyway) but I had my 5 year old with me and we both needed to sleep! The W gave us a room to rest in until our (bigger) room was ready - which was awesome! We ordered a cot for my daughter, which my husband ended up sleeping on because it was so comfy. After the marathon, we had already checked out, but they kept our luggage and allowed me to go to the spa area/showers to shower and clean up before getting on the plain for home. What excellent service - we will definitely go back and have joined Starwood Hotels Frequent Guest program.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel on Lexington Ave with detail to customer service”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a single night in October 2009. The location was fantastic as I had a meeting on 3rd Ave. I selected this location because of its proximity to a client's office. The room was approximately 200 square feet as is typical of mid-cost hotels in Manhattan. Upon arrival the reception staff was quick and attentive to my needs. Check-in was quick and effortless. I enjoyed room service during my stay- it was quick and tasty. My single complaint about the hotel was that the heat in my room did not go off during my entire stay which required me to open the windows. The front desk staff was alerted to this issue and I was told that the soonest that maintenance could take a look at the issue was the following morning. Since I was only staying for a single night, I didn't make a fuss of the issue and decided to sleep with the windows open. During the night, I enjoyed the sounds of the city and slept like a baby. I enjoyed this hotel and will stay at it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The whole hotel is too dark!!!”
Reviews.Author: KathyAnn50
Reviews.Content: For a first time visit to New York, the location was excellent. W hotels have a reputation for being hipand modern but I got the impression that was a good excuse to rip you off. The foyer and lounge area (which is far too small for hotel of this size) were dimly lit and it's not my idea of fun to sit in the gloom in the middle of the day when there's bright sunshine outside. Okay, I don't want it to be brightly lit either but there is a balance. We had a 'not quite the smallest' room and it was a reasonable size with a very good shower room and large walk in closet. The best thing to say about the room was the decent sized, very comfortable bed. The worst things were the lack of decent lighting and the ridiculously noisy air conditioning. I challenge the management of W hotels to stay in some of their rooms to see what it's really like. It's okay to have sexy mood lighting when it's appropriate but definitely not okay in the bathroom or when you're getting dressed to go out. Our room was dark anyway as we had a half size window overlooking a light well, so we had hardly any natural daylight. Reading was pretty difficult unless you placed yourself right under the very dim desk light. I hated the minibar which was touch sensitive. It just seemed like a money grabbing thing rather than a facility for the guests. The reception staff were brusque but polite, there was always a queue at the Concierge desk, the drinks at the bar were too expensive and the breakfast was overpriced. We had our breakfast at a deli/cafe down the road. If you prefer friendly service and a less-hyped ambience don't choose this hotel. It's far too big and impersonal. The hotel guide in the room was ridiculous. It was trying hard to be a bit different but failed abysmally to effectively provide information in a simple easy to find way. We couldn't find details of bar/restaurant opening hours and locations or even the fact that there was a bar or restaurant. It mentioned the Bliss Spa but there was no mention of treatments offered or prices or what facilities within the spa were free to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Kate-Winslow
Reviews.Content: I love the W in Manhattan! It's a fun, hip place to be and stay! I always have the best time.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getway for one ...”
Reviews.Author: bucky1958
Reviews.Content: Superclean room, quiet, dark with a spectacular bed - that's all I needed and got. Even though I didn't go to NYC to sleep, a good sleep is super important. I wasn't crazy about midtown/east but subway transportation is abundant to everywhere. The 3 for 2 promo I got made the whole thing a deal. The public areas were trendy; I'm not. I had no need for them anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: HrundiBakshi
Reviews.Content: We got booked for two nights into W through priceline so only after paying we started reading reviews and our hearts sunk. We prepared ourselves for Fawlty Towers experience. However it was very good and the only complaint we had was key cards that required several tries in the elevator and the door. The good things included: an unexpected room upgrade, an early check in, and a very comfortable room. I agree that rooms are small but if you only spend nights there the square footage matters little. The good size bathroom had more value for us. There was one erroneous charge for the fridge content (it was triggered by us moving a pop can inside) but it was promptly reversed. Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: ames524
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel - comfortable bed and nice linens. The bathroom was very small - but overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother going here!!”
Reviews.Author: tripadviserreview
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was disappointing, especially after the much-hyped "renovation". We were "upgraded" to a higher floor, although the shoebox of the room led us to wonder what the original room would have been. The pipes in the ceiling were also a very classy touch and made the room feel like it had been converted from an electrical closet. The heartbeat restaurant was closed and the whiskey blue bar downstairs added about a $20 tip onto the original bill after we left a generous cash tip. After a $60 hidden parking fee, the parking valets took our car for an 8 mile joy ride somewhere only to return the car with the service engine light on. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Isn't Worth The Money. Or Name sake. Rooms aren't functional.”
Reviews.Author: onlylovetogive
Reviews.Content: I am a professional stewardess and have an industry standard amongst some of the wealthiest people with the highest of standards. The rooms have no sufficient or functional storage area... The rooms are not cleaned properly if at all with room service and the staff are inconsistent with being respectful and helpful. The rooms had a mold in the roof and the lighting was not safely done. It does not have a flow nor do the staff really seem to be in a groove as a team nor for the guests. Too many different directions going on there which leads to chaos and detachment. The lobby smells of bleach as well. Hopefully, the NYC W Hotel will invest more in the cleanliness and service in the future. I would not recommend this to anyone nor would I ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Average, at best - needs to do better....and they charged for freephone!”
Reviews.Author: Wols88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night as part of a longer business trip. Was excited by the name and the reputation (and hadn't checked any reviews), but was disappointed by the experience Room was extremely small, and didn't have a bath. I think the room was for people with disabilities given various bits and pieces in the bathroom. That said, anyone with a disability could not have gotten through the bedroom into the bathroom, given the lack of space. Shower-only meant the bathroom got flooded when shower was used. Air con unit was very noisy, and to turn it off meant the room was too hot (I couldn't get the window open). I had to make a call to the taxi company and i used the W phone in my room to call the freephone number - i got charged 2 dollars... not a lot of money but it's the princple... Woman at reception agreed it was out of order, but didnt offer to remove it! A constantly busy reception area, lots of people hanging around...the bar staff were totally unfriendly, i waited ages to ask to see the wine list and got it handed to be by some surly wannabe who was looking in another direction as she passed it over... then had to wait ages again to order the (mediocre but expensive) wine Also a lot of rooms had left meal trays and plates outside their room which were there when i arrived at my room (7pm or so) and were still there 4 hours later. Overall impression pretty poor I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: leeb1993
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at this hotel. the room was modern and the kids loved it. great location at times square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: saraboo26
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful. Front desk was wonderful and upgraded our room since our party moved from 2 people to 3 without charge. Only issue I have is the lighting is very low...probably romantic for some but I wanted more light to get dressed. Lobby was beautiful and welcoming and the scent when you walk in is magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect NYC location”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumMember
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect for us. It's so central to everything a tourist would want to see, and the subway is just a few blocks away. We received an upgraded room due to my Starwood status. It was a 2-room suite that allowed us a bit more room to spread out, which was nice. The bed was comfortable, as W beds always are and the room and bathroom were very clean. The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but it was fine - we weren't in the room too much anyway. The one thing that always bugs me about W hotels is that they charge $15 for internet - it's a little ridiculous considering most hotels offer it free now. The lobby was what you would expect from a W - on the trendy side with a big bar scene. We had drinks at the hotel one night and it was quite crowded. We would stay here again, due mostly to the central location.

Reviews.Title: “If you love a highly perfumed room, you'll love your W room”
Reviews.Author: okaycoral
Reviews.Content: For those of you who do not like your room reeking of perfume, the W housekeeping staff sprays your room every day with their "signature scent". My room was reeking of the stuff when I came back the first day. The housekeeping staff must have given my room a megadose because it didn't reek when I checked in. I have allergies. Its really impossible to get the scent out and I personally found it unpleasant. This is my first W experience. I wish someone had warned me about the perfume. I'm told the gym in excellent. Pack your own shower cap. They don't provide one. The bed is good if you like a quality yet soft bed. You have to call the concierge for everything and often they don't answer. The W does not provide an extension for housekeeping or the operator. I found the staff just fine in general. The restaurant is very dark for breakfast. The rooms are dark with mood lighting. In general this is a dark, trendy hotel that is about being sexy and interesting rather than hospitable or comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Unbearable noise , poor isolation, money have been stolen from the room”
Reviews.Author: rdkl
Reviews.Content: Very bad experiance. I took a Mega room in the 9th floor and it was very noisy. The sound from Lexington avenue was so strong that I could not sleep ! The Isolation is very poor. Totaly unexpected and unacceptable for a "Boutiqe 5 stars Hotel". To complete the unpleasent experiance somebody stole from our room 1000$ in cash that had been left in a purse that was in the subcase. It is again unbeliveable that in such an expensive and respectable hotel thing like that can happen. It is obvious that it was one of the hotels' employees who have stolen the money but yet the hotel didnt do anything unusual to try and find the responsable.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: Eileentr_9
Reviews.Content: I booked this through priceline and was a little worried when I read trip advisor reviews. The W was better than expected. The room is a long sliver of a room, but room enough to move around as a single person. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and the flat screen TV was very large. There was a desk and chair. I would not bring my family (although I imagine I was in one of the smaller rooms), but I was very comfortable by myself and would stay again. Great location, as well.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: whiteoakstudio
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the room - nice renovation, modern touches, great bathroom and lighting. and we loved the location, just a block to hop on the subway

Reviews.Title: “awful.”
Reviews.Author: harlembetty
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. I didn't read other people's reviews only because I was being hosted by my company and had no choice but it was absolutely awful. I stayed here for three nights this past week and was shocked and appalled at how many things went wrong at what is supposed to be a hotel that prides itself on service. Granted, I realized the city was very busy with VMAs, Fashion Week, and the US Open, so it was crowded - but I had no idea how many things would be out of order. Cons: 1. Check-in was delayed (likely due to the busy week in the city - still, guests shouldn't have to wait for 2 hours simply to check-in). 2. The television in the living room of my suite did not work and calls downstairs were not returned. I didn't press it because I had a TV in the bedroom and didn't have time to watch it anyway, but it should have been fixed. 3. Minor point that is not their fault at all but there are a ton of wireless networks in the area and W Guest Rooms wireless network doesn't work that great/show up all the time. Beware of this if you go there so you won't enter your credit card info into some other hotel's network (W doesn't ask for that info). 4. I had to print several documents and the printers weren't working in the Wired center. They didn't have a backup option and a staff member graciously printed them for me from her own computer (after I waited 20 minutes at the concierge desk). I had no way of learning the printers weren't working, however, until I got so frustrated and called on one of the phones near the computers. No sign was posted though they knew about it. 5. Checking out, I was given two bills (one that didn't even belong to me) and one that was "mine" but had $120 in minibar charges (I never touch the minibar). I called them to correct it...and they produced another IDENTICAL bill without the charges removed. 6. The final straw was that I left my bag there upon checking out, and they LOST IT. And by lost I mean they misplaced it and couldn't find it when I went to retrieve it. I must admit that they were very polite and thorough and found it within 2 hours but I was inconvenienced by the delay and anxious the entire time that my bag was on its way to Johannesburg or something. Pros: 1. Lovely room 2. Friendly staff - everyone greeted me in the hallway in a kind manner 3. Good service from the housekeeping I'm so glad I wasn't paying for this stay. They need to do a lot to whip things into shape. It may seem nitpicky but for $1600 worth of a stay service should have been much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: stone2
Reviews.Content: Did some reviewers saw the rooms are small. They are exaggerating. They are actually smaller than that. There is about 5 inches between one side of the bed and the window. To get to that side you have to crawl under the TV. The bathroom is not just tiny but has a sliding glass door that neither locks or closes snugly. Am I being prudish? Did I mention that I has told that I was one of first to stay in the recently refurbished rooms. If so, the paint was already peeling off the wall. The staff did seem to be trying and cannot be responsible for the extra blanket we ordered unless they had some role in the stains on the blankets. The stains were kind of crusty -- so let's not think about it too much.

Reviews.Title: “Box room with a view of the garage”
Reviews.Author: caroraj
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for 140 pounds.My heart sank when I read the reviews on Trip advisor. We stayed in the so called cozy room.It is a tiny box room with a bathroom which is so small that one person is a tight squeeze.I understand that space is premium in New york ,but come on. The bath products are lovely as is the location. The ladies at the reception are glacial,a far cry from the warmth and hospitality of the Waldorf across the street. We were lucky we got away with one night.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overhyped”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSerena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth the price they charge. It's very old with very VERY tiny rooms, not very clean, and a not so friendly staff. They do their job and that's about it. Most of the front desk people are probably aspiring models/actors as they all had a dreamy vacant stare... The location is ok - it's about a 15 min walk to Times Square. There's a club in the hotel so be prepared for very loud and bustling evenings. The mini bar is motion sensitive so any movement will result in an automatic charge to your room even if you did not consume the snack. Overall the W is not worth the hype and not up to par to a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for incorrect Mini Bar charges”
Reviews.Author: RFJ
Reviews.Content: At check in I was pleasantly surprised to see a broader range of guests beyond those wearing black head to toe, attempting to look tragically hip. At check out I was Unpleasantly surprised to see Mini bar fees for items I did not consume. The desk staffer told me the system is computerized to assume any movement means consumption. So when I opened the cupboard in search of more storage, or when I placed the small decorative bed pillow on top of the candy bars for lack of desk space, that triggered the mini bar charges (which the W did remove). Travelers should also beware there's an old hotel beneath the modern facade. The first room I got was clean but after using the bathroom and then unpacking, I later discovered a pool of water under the sink. I was moved to another (smaller) room with a tiny desk already covered with W materials. There's not much workspace and the room lighting is weak (don't plan on reading a book in bed). I felt cramped as a single traveler, so would caution couples traveling. Lastly, the desk staff did their job (and no more), but the housekeeping staff at the bottom of the food chain were the friendly, welcoming ones.

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Preferred Guest = Preferred Treatment at "W"”
Reviews.Author: TOB-Philly
Reviews.Content: Great weekend trip to NY with the family at the W on Lexington. As a Gold SPG member travelling with a family I was concerned about the size of the rooms however the hotel upgraded our rooms to Spa Suites. The service and overall experience reminded me why I stay 40 nights a year at Starwood properties as a "Road Warrior" so I can reward the family. The W came through with spectacular (and quiet) rooms, great overall service, great fitness center, super comfortable beds, and the girls loved the Bliss products. Best stay in a NY hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolitanj
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small but quite hip. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was not clean and had hairs on the floor upon my arrival. I did love the Bliss products and the spa. The location is great. I did not have a problem with the staff at all and was able to check in early. I think that if you are set on staying at the W in NYC, try Times Square instead. It is newer and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Totally thrilled with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mymomdressedme
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5 day NYC trip, and made arrangements to try 3 different hotels during my stay. To be honest, I was most dreading the night at W New York. Reviews were borderline scathing for this property and I was prepared for the worst. Turns out I had nothing to worry about. I Hotwire'd this room for a real deal. The lobby was bustling as any W Hotel is. You know the deal. The lobby scene is part of the fun. I fall into the target demographic, so I appreciated the vibe and energy. Check-in was a joy. A very friendly agent assisted me. As usual, I inquired if any paid upgrades were available. She refused to let me pay, but upgraded my two levels to a larger Mega-King room. So kind of her, and a real surprise given how full the hotel appeared to be. The room was a perfect size. Big bed, large window seats, huge tv, and a beautiful bathroom. Some of the W's have such cool design, but ultimately don't prove the test of time as all the finishes wear down easily over a few years. Don't know if this was recently renovated, but everything was in top notch condition. Loved the look of the room, very modern and clean. More importantly it was the most comfortable bed I've slept in in years. I know people say that all the time, but I truly could get out of this bed it was amazing. Bathroom incorporated great original subway tile walls and porcelain pedestal sink, with very cool mirrors and wallpaper. Well done all around. Service continued to be excellent. Room service was delicious. Late checkout of 1:30 was extended. Couldn't have been happier with this stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy”
Reviews.Author: TenTenFive
Reviews.Content: This is one cool hotel that fits perfectly with New York experience. I was up in NYC to celebrate my birthday and the hotel surprised me with birthday cake waiting for me in the room and a birthday card. I had a corner suite that was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “poor service and tiny room”
Reviews.Author: southcarolinamurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the W on Lexington Avenue on 8/8/09 via Priceline. The common areas of the hotel are fine, the coat check and maids were nice, and the location is good.The front desk people never responded to our complaint of having a room that must have been 150 square feet. It was smaller than the cozy rooms they have on their web sight. The room was dark and the view was of a rusty garage. There was even scaffolding outside of our window. The W caters to 20-30 year olds and the noise levels in the hotel are extremely high.Priceline has this as a four star hotel but is by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed in in the city out of 25-30 visits. There are hundreds of better places to stay and I would avoid this part of the city if you use Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to bad reviews awesome hip funky very "NEW YORK"”
Reviews.Author: trippygirl4
Reviews.Content: WE were expecting the worst because of all the bad reviews. WE LOVED THIS HOTEL. If you go expecting the rooms to be small then you will be great. You do not stay at this hotel for a large room. However the room was large enough for us. We were not planning on having a large party in our room or playing rugby, only sleeping. If you want to entertain in your room or have a large family than this is not the place for you. We loved the whole W experience. The lobby was warm and inviting and we loved lounging there during the day, and having a drink there at night. It is a very busy place lots happening, especially during the week because it is in the business district. The room was clean, and updated. Service was great. We would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Rude.”
Reviews.Author: Eastport77
Reviews.Content: Room was fine. Small, but I expected that. Very clean. Love the Bliss products! Great location. But the stay ultimately was not worth it and I will not return to this hotel. Frankly, I don't know that I'll ever return to a W again. I knew to expect loud music, large crowds, very trendy setting, but I was stunned to find that every staff person I encountered was blatantly rude to me. When checking in and out, I don't think that the front desk staff said anything more to me than "credit card please?" Even if they had said more, I doubt I would have been able to hear them over the thumping music in the lobby. The W hotels advertise (incessantly) that they cater to every wish, yet it was nearly impossible to get the concierge or Whatever/Whenever services on the phone. When I made a very simple and very polite request for firmer pillows after sleeping on super-flat feather pillows the first night, the gentleman on the other end of the phone said with a sigh "we'll see what's available" and promptly hung up on me before I could respond. Housekeeping never arrived. I tried to order room service late one evening (during hours where room service is regularly served), but there was no answer after several minutes of waiting for someone to pick up. When we checked in and left our car with the valet, the doorman told us that when we were ready to check out, we should call down to the front desk 15 minutes prior to when we needed our car. He noted that the valet ticket says it takes 30 minutes, but it would normally be less. Approximately 25 minutes before checking out, I called down to the front desk and gave them my name and valet ticket number. They said the car would be ready in 30 minutes. We went downstairs to find that Lexington Avenue was shut down for a street fair--something the staff did not mention on the phone. When I asked the front desk where we would find the valet, since the street was shut down, I got a rude response, a shrugged shoulder and then a point to the side street where the valet and taxi stand were operating temporarily. We went outside, handed the ticket to the valet, and I noted that we had called ahead. The valet responded snottily, "They don't pull the car until I call them." We waited another 15 minutes on the street before our car was brought around. Certainly we understood the staff's frustration in dealing with the traffic and problems created by the street being shut down, but they were flat-out rude to us without any provocation. I don't need to be fawned over, but I have no tolerance for this kind of rudeness in the hospitality industry. We won't be staying at this hotel again, and I'm not sure if I'll ever consider a W again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic in the city”
Reviews.Author: MsFroggy32
Reviews.Content: You want to feel like you are staying in the city? The W is for you. Two twin beds in a small room with fantastic art on the walls kept us talking for awhile. We loved the closet and bathroom doors, hard to explainâ€¦something that you would see in NYC. You canâ€™t complain everything was crisp and clean though a tight squeeze for a girl with big hips and when was the last time you slept in a twin bed? ( By the way they had king or queen beds but we were four girls and did not want to sleep together so if you want two beds you can only get twins) Little oddities were all around, citrus flavored water dispensers in the hall, free fruit and free rides at certain hours with a driver (anything free in NYC is odd) mini lounges by the elevator on every floor and a waterfall of sorts in the lobby. WE LOVED IT, even though the air conditioner was broke in the lobby when we checked, the receptionist almost had to cuss out a rude man with a hard to understand accent, I guess the heat got to him and it was expensive...it was all NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Below average service; not a place to stay for business people”
Reviews.Author: Obderver
Reviews.Content: If you check in during the evening, you are greeted with thumping music from an area next to Reception and also by some not very interested staff. That sets the tone for your stay. I suppose that W hotels are an acquired taste: lighting such that your room and the corridors are always dark and shadowy; ghastly background music everywhere. They have business facilities but I would not class the general ambience of this hotel as attractive to business people. The location is fine. The rooms are OK (apart from the lighting). Service levels are below average (perhaps staff morale is low or leadership is lacking - who knows the background?). When I checked out, there was another guest complaining about staff not keeping their promises.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlgrlNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a fun weekend with friends in the city. W was in a great location. The rooms are very tiny but have nice amenities like flat screen large tvs, and very comfy beds. Something little I enjoyed were the daily fruit infused drink container offered to guests- very refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Typical W experience but really small rooms, even for NYC”
Reviews.Author: 7travelnyc
Reviews.Content: If you're familiar with the W hotels, then you know what to expect: trendy, bar, lounge, music, nice spa, etc. The room was clean, very modern and had nice amenities but really needs more light. Knowing NYC, we opted for a "Fabulous" room, which is supposed to be bigger than the "cozy" room and the "wonderful room" and 1 step below the suite. Needless to say, the room was still tiny for 2 people. My husband and I have stayed at quite a few NYC hotels and we both thought this was the smallest. Since it was a "Fabulous" room, we did have 2 large windows so we could get some direct sunlight into the room. All in all, it was a nice stay and for the price, it was reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - trendy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: salsrug
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for a conference and choose the W because they offer government rates. The rooms were small but it's New York so that's expected. They had a Bliss Spa attached to the hotel, which the ladies in my group took full advantage of. I loved their gym facilites and their lobby was very trendy. It was in walking distance to our conference and pretty much everything else downtown. There were Bliss products in the room, which is a total bonus. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. There's is a reasonbly priced deli about two blocks away where we got breakfast and reasonable is always a good thing in New York.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but several better W's in Manhattan"”
Reviews.Author: Business_Traveler000
Reviews.Content: Fits the mode of the W franchise: trendy lobby lounge / restaurant, good service, clean and appealing. The hotel is just short on square footage, so things feel cramped, and the rooms are extremely small (even by NYC standards). It's a great location on Lexington, and it is truly a W, but I personally prefer the W New York The Court and W New York Tuscany to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel ok for modern comfort but not light”
Reviews.Author: 100pc
Reviews.Content: Went with my partner who was on business. Room size to be expected. Worst problem was the terrible lighting. We asked for a quiet room - which it was around the back wich is positive but the window was very small. To make up for this the lighting should have been given special attention but it was dreadful. I'm used to staying in hotels where they haven't got the make-up light right but here I couldn't even read it was so dark. When I was packing I kept instinctively reaching to the light switches but to no avail. It was so bad it would stop me booking this hotel again even for a short business trip. Internet service in the room is charged at $16 per day. Bar in the lobby is busy with tourists and business people and convenient for a quick drink. Staff were nice and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is in Manhattan so you expect small rooms. And yes, the rooms are small. But the hotel is very cool, has a great bar and a fabulous spa and gym. I stay here often and prefer it to the Times Square location. You are across the street from the Walforf, Smith & Wollenski and other great restaurants. Hotel staff is very friendly and the last time I was there, they had an Acura car service. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing stay in what felt like luxury to me!”
Reviews.Author: PoorWayfarinStranger
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I am usually Captain Cheap 'n Cheerful, but for a special celebration for my husband and I, I decided to try my luck on Hotwire. I was a little put off by the fact that you can't see the hotel before agreeing to accept it, and worried about the immediate charge/lack of refund, but I went ahead and booked. I was pleased when I visited the W's website, which made it look very inviting. Not having received a confirmation from Hotwire, I called the hotel directly to make sure my reservation had gone through. I mentioned that I was traveling for a special occasion, and when we checked in, I found that we had been given a free room upgrade! DH and I enjoyed a lovely long weekend in a "New York spacious" room, which was nicely appointed and had a fabulously comfortable bed. The location was brilliant, near two subway stops and withing walking distance of any number of attractions; the staff were, without exception, pleasant, professional, and engaging. The room's decoration seemed fresh, I noticed very little noise from traffic or other guests, and the drapes are truly light-blocking. The air conditioning was unusually effective and quiet. The hotel doesn't seem to cater specifically to businesspeople--the only strong direct light in the room is in the bathroom!, and while there's wi-fi available in every room, it's an additional $17/day. It is free in the comfortable lounge area, but I needed to print something, which necessitated a trip to the 'business center," where the internet costs $8 for 15 minutes. The hotel does have beautiful meeting rooms, for both social and business meetings. I found it a perfect setting for an intimate weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Does't live up to the hype of the W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: MNMd
Reviews.Content: At first I was really excited when I saw that I had gottten the W Hotel on Hotwire, but then I discovered that it wasn't the W in Union Square which is the really nice one, but this one in Midtown. Yes, the location is very convenient to Grand Central and so you can get anywhere in the city and it's full of cool Europeans and other non-Americans, but the room couldn't be any smaller. It basically fits a queen size bed, a teeny tiny table and a teeny tiny upright closet that doesn't hardly fit any clothes with a teeny tiny bathroom. It definitely encourages you to stay out and be in the city. It is nice that there is complimentary lemongrass water in the afternoon and cider in the evenings, but it runs out quickly. The concierge was quite helpful. I would definitely not stay in this hotel had I not gotten it off Hotwire. It certainly is not worth the rack/internet rate.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience. Would go there again.”
Reviews.Author: ionfacs
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not too small. The lack of bedside lighting was not good. I was tired after a day of sightseeing and wanted to put my feet up and read while the other person in the room slept. I had to sit in the less-than-comfortable desk chair to do this. No shelving in the bathroom a problem. I don't like throwing my clothes or towels on a bathroom floor. I called ahead b/c I was traveling with a sick teenager so I requested a quiet room. They gave me one, but with one double bed. Kind of a curious choice since they knew w/ whom I was sharing the room. We were ok w/ it, but how many people would feel the same? Other than that, a very positive experience. Lively lobby scene, fantastic location, helpful staff. Housekeeping knocked at my door at 8:30 a.m. on Sat. Not a problem for me, but maybe for some people. For the price I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: katetey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel for a long weekend over July 4th in a suite. Perhaps these have been refurbished recently as opposed to the smaller rooms as this was a great room - the bedroom was slightly small but the bathroom was large with a tub and power shower and everything was spotless. The car service was a plus and the staff were helpful and friendly. Not sure if we would stay there again as it was very expensive but for a treat, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “W - NY would def. stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jefk56
Reviews.Content: Great place, very chic and well appointed. Good base for a stay in the city. I could see where some folks said the rooms were small - we were upgraded to a suite and it was really no more than a decent sized hotel room with a bed and small sitting area. Also had a workdesk and comfortable swivel chair. But it did have a glass enclosed shower along with a separate tub and shower and 1 walk in closet and another large closet. Very adequate for 2 people. Queen bed, which was of top notch quality. Would have liked a king, like at home, but this was comfy. Very clean, staff was most accomodating and helpful when asked for anything. Nice fitness room, spa on site.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FunLoverVancouver
Reviews.Content: Booked the W on PriceLine...so I didn't know the name of the hotel until I had already paid. Expected much more than we experienced unfortunately. My 20 year old daughter and I were there for 4 days to celebrate the year end of university. The trip was great but the hotel was disappointing. The room was extremely small, unbelievably dark (including the tiny washroom) and the front desk staff were uninviting. The use of the internet in the Business Center was incredibly expensive (most hotels we stay in this service is free). We were charged for an $80 room service meal that we did not order (or receive). It was a hassel trying to have it removed from our bill. I would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but needs better soundproofing!!”
Reviews.Author: mammafloss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely....stylish, really great customer service and lots of nice touches. The one MAJOR drawback for us was that the soundproofing is terrible and we could hear the couple next door "enjoying" themselves....eeek!!!

Reviews.Title: “GROSSS”
Reviews.Author: jesscicc
Reviews.Content: I'm from montreal and we have a really nice and stylish W here in one of the trendiest districts in quebec, Canada. I expected the same from the W new york.....what a rude awakening it was when we got there.....The lobby is really modern and very happening in the evenings but the rooms are a disaster. They are old, decreped, small and dingy, not to mention also very dirty. I slept with my clothes on and felt dirty just washing my face in the sink. We booked a four night stay and ended up canceling the rest of the reservation after the 1st night and booked rooms at the st-regis across the street. One extreme to another hehe

Reviews.Title: “Too Clever By Half”
Reviews.Author: PeterColl
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the W Hotel on Lexington, taking advantage of a special birthday rate of $249 for the first night, then the guest's birth year plus $100 for the next two nights (available on their website). This was a good deal for me and my husband, who was born in 1939; hence one night at $249 and then two more at $139 for an average of around $200 per night. However, we may have been too old to stay at this recently renovated and overly hip and self-aware hotel. Upon arriving on a Thursday evening at 11:30 pm we had to push our way to the front desk past a wild and crazy disco crowd in the lobby (the bar Whiskey Blue is next door), then shout at the desk clerk over the din of pulsing techno music. We were upgraded to a "mega-room" which meant a king bed. Again, maybe too old for this hotel...lighting in the room was dim, no reading lamp on my side of the bed, and no soundproofing so heard sirens and traffic all night long. At least we didn't hear the lobby music til we stepped back into the elevator (it was piped in). Staff was pleasant, but requests went unheeded til we made a second phone call (asked for complimentary newspaper; had to call again in the morning when it had not appeared outside our door). Bill upon checking out was incorrect...we were charged the $249 rate for all 3 nights. That was amended in a jiffy, however. So...a minus 3 for ambience and overall "look" of the place....dim lobby, money spent on silly things like a brass kalleidoscope on the desk, but a plus 3 for friendly staff and great location. The Doubletree is next door...and Marriott East Side is across the street. I'll check their rates next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Atmosphere. Not interested in staying at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: jcostello99
Reviews.Content: Although the hotelâ€™s lobby and bar area are very nice and have such cool and modern atmosphere, we were not impressed entirely with the hotel. Unfortunately, the â€œaverageâ€� hotel rooms are very dark and incredibly small. They are not comfortable for 2 people to stay in for a multiple night stay. Also, we were disappointed in the overall customer service. Unfortunately, the staff is not very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on the sidewalk.”
Reviews.Author: Tumbler96
Reviews.Content: Avoid staying here. Bliss bath products and great bed cannot make up for the tremendous street noise. Even 15 stories up in a room billed as "spectacular," we were woken by seven (7!!) different fire engine runs blaring down Lexington at different times of the night. With the windows firmly latched, every bang and honk of the street fills the rooms --- almost all of the rooms face a busy street. This place is like sleeping on the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: upperoilcan
Reviews.Content: First of all,sorry for the delay in reveiwing this hotel........ Stayed here with my girlfriend at the end of novwmber/start of december 2008 and must say we were really pleased with our choice,the hotel was swish and the bar area was very cosy and up to date,with a contemporary feel. Our room was not the largest but was more than enough for the two of us during our 4 night stay,The room was again themed on a contemporary look with a large mural placed over the bed,bathroom was clean and had a nice feel to it... Both the room and the bathroom were spotless and kept that way for the duration of our stay,cant remember for the life of me what room we stayed in but if i remember rightly we were on the 15th floor,being in newyork we had no view at all from our window but we wer'nt at all bothered as we only slept and showered at the hotel. We would without hesitation stay at this hotel again as we found the staff to be very helpful from the door staff right through to the cleaner's ! the location of the hotel is pretty spot on as it's only about 5 blocks from 5th avenue and with a brisk walk could be in central park within 10/15mins.....lexington ave is a hive of activity with restruants and good shopping as bloomingdales is located further up towards the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and value for a New York vacation”
Reviews.Author: hotelhopperTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded me and my husband's expectations. We booked our room through hotwire.com and when we got there they upgraded us to a slightly larger room at no charge. Get this, we even had our 5 month old baby with us. Her packn'play fit conveniently in between our bed and the air conditioner which provided a lovely "white noise" to help the baby sleep. The beds are soooo comfy and the decore top notch paying attention to every little detail, nook, and cranny. For those saying that the rooms are tiny, they obviously didn't read about them before they booked. That's New York for you. The staff was much more friendly than I expected at such a stylish place and they had this wonderful service calle "The Acura Service". Tip: for a good and cheap breakfast go to the Cafe Metro just one block west or east of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretencious with Dim Lighting”
Reviews.Author: ReadytogoPlaces
Reviews.Content: First of all, this was the smallest hotel room I have ever booked in NYC. There were two twins beds and a writing table. Basically you could just walk around the beds and that was it. The writing table was filled up with all my stuff plus the phone, hotel books, and ice bucket because there was no other place to put anything. Maybe because W had a deal where if you bought two nights, the third was free. Anyway, I was with my teen daughter so I took it. But it was small. It feels like W is out to impress customers with their edgy style but it's not very practical. The entire hotel feels very moody and dim. That's ok, I guess, in the hallways but once I'm i the room I would like enough lighting to read a book or a magazine. There was no table lamp next to one of the beds. I had to open the window shades to get enough ambient light plus all the lights on to see well and then of course, I cannot walk around in my underclothes because all the shades are up. One day they tried to clean the room at 4pm (that seems late to me!) Well I was back resting before dinner after a day of sightseeing. The maid said to call when I was ready. I called the front desk when I was leaving for dinner and said I was ready for them to clean but they never came. The only positive point I can give this hotel is the concierge service which I found above average and I went everyday and asked questions and directions of the staff. However, I will find another hotel next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny rooms. This used to be the Doral Inn and not expensive”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Over 20 years ago, I worked at the front desk of this hotel when it was called Doral Inn. It was an inexpensive business hotel with a large airline crew and South American tourist business. For this guests got a low price in a great location for a tiny room. The only thing that has changed today is guests get a high price in a great location for a tiny room. The room I am in right now is the same layout as when it was Doral but just funkier and the lobby was noisy. I am glad the elevator has key control to allow guests only as when I checked in last night at 11 pm two people were refused rooms as they did not have proper ID. This is not a short stay hotel. Tiny rooms, noisy lobby that is more night club than business functional. It works for me but I prefer the Grand Hyatt and NY Palace where I usually stay in NY: Very expensive internet which they had led me would be free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff, and good location.”
Reviews.Author: sammieh81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W New York for ease of commuting for a wedding in the city. Only issue I had (along with everyone else on the elevator) was getting the hotel key to work so that a floor could be selected. Frustrating but manageable. Room was great. Love the Bliss products. The room I stayed in was spacious and compared to other rooms in NYC was far better. Started both nights (Fri & Sat) at the bar downstairs. Great staff! No issues while I was there. I'd be sure to stay at the W New York again for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, small rooms like everywhere in NY”
Reviews.Author: juliana2009
Reviews.Content: I think it is a great hotel, the service is good and it is quite. Other hotels in NY have smaller rooms than this. It is comfortable, the beds and pillows are nice and the staff is friendlier than other NY hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Performing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend an evening at the W Hotel in New York City and we where extremely pleased with the accomodations and customer service we received. We look forward to another stay soon. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a comfortable stay when in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty swanky, but bed was small”
Reviews.Author: chitowntravelguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night recently. We were supposed to stay at my brother's apartment but the keys didn't work so we had to scramble for a hotel. We were able to book a "studio suite" for 14,500 Starwood points on a Saturday night. There was also a "newly renovated room" available for 13,500 points, and a "standard" room for 12,000 points. These rates compared favorably with another W in NYC that we checked that only had a standard room available for 20,000 points. The lobby had a cool, trendy vibe. Doormen were helpful with directions, cabs, etc. Our room was on the same floor as Bliss spa which was a bit odd but not a problem. The room (a "studio suite") had a small living room and a small bedroom. The living room was very funky, with a not-so-comfortable "modern" couch and an enormous light on a pole that we had to mess around with to turn on. In the bedroom, the bed was the smallest queen we've ever seen. We're not sure if this hotel has kings (each of the rooms described to us had a queen), but we're not very big people and we were pretty cramped in the bed. It was honestly bad enough that we'd probably look elsewhere next time. The lighting was pretty dim, but adequate. The shower in our room was one of those modern ones that doesn't have any kind of a break in the floor between the shower and the rest of the bathroom. Not really our style, but it didn't flood the rest of the bathroom. We give four stars because maybe we just need a king bed, but we have a hard time believing most couples would be comfortable in the supposedly queen-sized bed that we slept in. One additional tip: if you remove ANYTHING from the mini-bar, even just so you can put a bottled water of your own in there, they will charge you for it. I took a Heineken out, put a bottled water in, and got charged $10+ for the Heineken (which I didn't consume). They took it off the bill but advised that next time I ask for a mini-fridge, which they can bring to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Afeathers
Reviews.Content: For a hotel chain which sells itself as such an amazing experience, they make very little effort to live up to their promises. I have stayed in three W hotels, and each time the experience has varied from extremely expensive and mediocre to downright dreadful. So, this hotel in particular. I have been given a room about 7 feet by 20. That includes the bathroom, the closet and the bedroom. The air conditioning didn't work, they had to send an engineer to dismantle it. The room is on its own down a tiny passageway which looks like it leads to a cleaning closet (which would be a better use for the room) next to the ice machine, which makes an incredibly loud clanking noise when people use it. And I'm a "Gold" Starwood card holder, entitled to complimentary upgrades when available! Last time I stayed in a W - the one in Times Square - they actually DOWNgraded me - I had paid for one of their best rooms, at some expense and for a particular reason of a romantic nature. We were put in a tiny standard room which smelled of bleach - there was no apology, in fact they didn't even acknowledge that they had put us in the wrong room and when I enquired they said there were none available (even though I had booked and paid in advance). They wouldn't have refunded me the difference unless I had asked the manager. In Sydney, the W is much hyped bit inconveniently located, staggaringly overpriced and has very unexciting rooms. The Westin, its sister hotel, is much better in every way and actually in the center of town. In short, this chain fails to live up to its very high standards. Their hotel guide says that they "promise to make all your dreams a reality". Well... as long as your dreams don't include a decent room and air conditioning which works, that is. Not to mention value for money,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room, the usual nutty W decor”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnGoat
Reviews.Content: Well, I don't think people stay at the W because they want a spacious room. Because the rooms are so tiny, New York tiny. And since we're in NYC, what can one expect? My sister and I went to NYC over Thanksgiving and I arrived at the W hours after my sister did. She'd requested that we be moved to a larger room because apparently the first room was too miniscule for two people. The bathroom was really small, and the doorless shower didn't get water all over the floor like the shower at the W Times Square. Nice decor, but the illuminated photo of a woman's bare back above the bed did not provide enough reading light. No nightlights at the W. The fitness center was amply equipped, though the first day (only the first day) I worked out they were out of towels. The bar is apparently a hot spot of sorts (drawing a much younger crowd than the Waldorf across the street) and the W provided complimentary holiday truffles and hot apple cider every night. The concierge was very helpful and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I am loving Life at the NYC W!”
Reviews.Author: dpapadapoulos
Reviews.Content: In life you get what you pay for and I am completely satisfied with my experiance at the W hotel. Centrally located and very posh. I will continue to stay at the W hotel not only in NYC, but W hotels around the world. The staff there was very nice and the atmosphere is swanky. I travel to NYC often and this room is decent sized for NYC. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: urbansombrero76
Reviews.Content: Wonderful customer service, from the front desk to the housekeeping and room service. Conveniently located for 5th Avenue shopping, Central Park and Lexington Avenue subway (6 train). I travelled with girlfriends and it was the perfect hotel for a friends' getaway weekend. The staff at this W went out of its way to provide excellent service, and I appreciated extra effort such as quick response to requests for towels or other items and replenishing bathroom products daily. The beds were very comfortable, and the rooms had been recently re-done, as reflected in the flat screens and new fixtures. Other plusses: Bliss bathroom products, small room size limits loud, large groups, Bliss spa was also wonderful and worth the salon prices, and beautiful lounge area. Very minor complaints: elevators were slow on busy check-out Sunday, no free Wi-Fi, limited outlets if you need to charge or use laptop in the room. I obtained a supersaver rate of $200/night, which made all of the above very worthwhile, but am not sure of the regular prices. In any event, I've stayed at many hotels in New York and this one definitely stood out.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not WOW”
Reviews.Author: Bronxmedia
Reviews.Content: Great location, cool lobby but felt I was paying way too much for the room & service I got. I got a really small room, there was not even room for a bedstand in it. There was basically a bed, a TV in the corner, perched over the minibar and the space around the bed was so narrow that I wasn't able to place my suitcase flat on the floor. There was no safe-box in my room, never got an explanation for this and the only solution I got from the concierge desk was to put all my valuables in a safe box located in a room behind their desk. Bathroom was small and basic, no tub. To top things, room and corridors were really dark. Overall, I don't think W New York is worth the money. Wouldn't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mark57CLW
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights for a business\leisure vacation. Rooms are quite small for 2 people and the price (glad it was company-paid!). First room had a broken a\c which they tried to fix twicw but couldn't. Very accomodating when we asked to be moved to a new room. Nighclub (downstairs) very expensive, $12 a drink. Centrally located in mid-town, staff very pleasant and service-oriented. One bad item: 1 member in our group put her luggage outside her room door for pickup\storage before departure (as she was instructed to do) and it was stolen with all her new shopping items inside. No word yet on the missing bag. Not sure if the hotel will take responsiblity.

Reviews.Title: “Room 1419 - a dark and cramped furnished closet”
Reviews.Author: highlandbride
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it is near our NYC office. Survived one night of dark, dingy room, rattling air conditioner unit and carefully walking the path between bed/closet and bed/bathroom. Glad I am not overweight or would not be able to get through narrow doorway to bathroom and same narrow door way to closet. Poorly designed room has bedside table only on one side - the other side has part of the mini-bar food/snacks on a tray that says "careful - if you touch this we will start charging you" - not helpful, so did a MacGuyver and took trash can liner out and turned trash can upside down to make a bedside spot for water, alarm, etc. Bathroom is claustrophobic even by NY standards...no way two people could be in this bathroom at same time. Not all rooms come with a bathtub, so be sure to check before accepting room key. The concierge wasn't much help at the Whatever Desk. Asked for a recommendation for a good hamburger close by and the best he could do was the outrageouly priced Smith & Wollensky's chop house. After we had the chat "if it was your personal money and the hotel wasn't paying and the restaurant you picked isn't comp'ing you because you send them lots of customers, where would you eat?" - we got sent to a neighborhood pub, the Pig & Whistle on Second Avenue between 50 & 51st - nice atmosphere, very reasonable food and drink -would go back here One positive point -= the Bliss shampoo, cleanser and body lotion. Will stay elsewhere next time....so should you considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluecomet
Reviews.Content: The W is a great hotel to stay at. The rooms are small but it's New York! - our room had everything we needed. I especially liked the little touches like the flowery infused water besides the elevators each morning. I want the recipe! The room staff were particularly excellent .Cheery, talkative but never imposing, and remember your every need - they made our stay extra special and cudos to them for that!

Reviews.Title: “A big 'ole cockroach on the 15th floor”
Reviews.Author: paulajean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on Lexington last night and actually got used to the small rooms. They reminded me of Europe rooms and although they're a bit too modern for my taste (I prefer the Westin), it was still fine. This morning, after my shower, I was greeted by the largest cockroach I've ever seen (and I lived in South Florida for 4 years) as it scurried right past my feet in the bathroom. I ran into the bedroom to pull my suitcase off the floor and onto the bed so he wouldn't climb in and figured the bug had run into a corner and wouldn't be back. Well, about 5 minutes later the same cockroach comes running toward me in the bathroom again! I managed to flip the opaque trash bucket on top of the roach. I finished getting ready and when I mentioned the incident to the front desk (and how it was still there under the trash bucket), all I received was an "I'm sorry"--no explanation, nothing. Needless to say, even though my work is keeping me in the city another night, I went a block and checked into the Doubletree. It was a much lower rate (even as a walk-in) and the rooms are more comfortable and the staff so far is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mrdandism2
Reviews.Content: Overall the W was a great place to stay. Stayed one night, staff was very nice, room was clean. Room was smaller than expected. Very close to subway. No free internet was disappointing. Room service was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Our Mini-Moon Destination in New York City”
Reviews.Author: stillmissmaine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at W Hotel for a few nights over New Years weekend. A couple good things: The front desk left us a couple nice surprises in our room for our honeymoon. It was a nice touch! The bed was very comfortable. The style of the room was enjoyable. The furniture and bed had a very nice modern look. A couple issues: The bathroom had a sliding frosted glass door. We pretty much felt like we had no privacy in the bathroom. In fact, you could see in to the bathroom better than you could see out into the living room. Seems backwards to me. The bathroom sink had no vanity. You had to use a cheap bakers stand on the other side of the bathroom to store stuff. Was a real pain. We were charged nearly $200 for unknown items after we had checked out and had left the hotel. It took me nearly a week to get these charges reversed with their accounting department. We would have definitely enjoyed our stay a lot more if the bathroom would have been better. The frosted glass door on a bathroom is a mistake! The rooms were for the most part comfortable except for the bathroom. The hotel staff was great. The lobby was pretty cool. Great location! We had a nice view of Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Main”
Reviews.Author: Manun
Reviews.Content: Overall fantastic hotel, great location and superb bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, amazing location...absolutly loved it!”
Reviews.Author: VLC1278
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline and was a little nervous given all of the bad reviews but I loved the hotel. Front deck was great and we never had any issues waiting to check-in or only having one person at the desk. Rooms were very clean and nice and we even got upgraded. Yes the hotel room and lobby are dark but who comes to New York to sit in your room? It is a more modern hotel so anyone looking for a traditional hotel atmosphere may not like it but I thought it was great! Would book this hotel again on my next stay for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in! Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Seattleterp
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever I used hotwire to get a 2 night stay in midtown NYC. I was happy to hear that the hotel I was given was the W. I have heard such great things about the W hotels. When I checked in I requested 2 beds. I was told they didn't have any rooms with 2 beds. I was given the key to our room. When we got to our room I opened the door and saw that there were guests already in the room!! I was in shock!! I went back down to the front desk and explained that the room was already taken. The front desk lady could care less and gave me the key to another room. No apology. Nothing. The room was seriously the smallest room I have ever seen! The bathroom was so small there wasn't even any room for a shower door. I doubt the bathroom was bigger than 5 feet by 7 feet. The fridge was full of overpriced food and drink so we couldn't use it at all. At 5pm we asked for a roll away bed ($25 extra). After dinner the roll away was not delivered. By this time it was 10pm. We called down to the front desk and asked again for the roll away. They said it would be up soon. At 11pm when the bed was still not delivered we called again about the bed. We were told they didn't have any roll away beds. I was so upset I asked why they hadn't told me that at 5pm or at 10pm. They tried to transfer me to the manager. We got 'cut off.' I called back to let them know that I wanted to speak to the manager. They told me a manager would call back. After another hour I called back to the front desk and just asked for blankets and a pillow. Our son was going to sleep on the floor. By about 12:30 we finally got a roll away bed! Unfortunately, we had to move the bed in the room to the wall to even FIT the roll away bed in the room!!!! The size of the room? The size of one double bed and one single bed. Possibly 6 inches between the bed and the wall. The only reason we didn't leave was that we had already paid for the room through hotwire and knew we wouldn't get our money back. I would never ever stay there again. I will also never again use hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: nasszone
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the W New York! this place is Awsome ! Rooms are small but very confortable! a Cozy bed and a agreat shower. the lobby is nice confortable and classy, Service is amazing as wll, close to Time sq, about 5 min wlk. 2 min to 5th Av. The hotels is withe wlkg distance to: UN plaza Chrysler buildin 5th Av Time Sq Port Auth Bus Station St. patrick's Cathedral Rockefeller Center Other Rest, Cafes and Hotels

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in style”
Reviews.Author: snc001
Reviews.Content: Just spent a lovely weekend night at the W New York. We were upgraded to fabulous suite and it was ...well, fabulous. Comfortable bed and attentive service made for another cool stay at what is quickly becoming my favorite hotel in NYC. Can't wait to try out the free ride in the new Acura on my next visit. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool spot, minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: tomalei
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in March, both time received a super early check-in with ease. Friendly service found throughout the hotel. Room was very comfortable despite it's petite size. Unique decor, central location (behind Waldorf Astoria), great dinner from room service as restaurants only served bkfst & snacks. Only few gripes: no coffeemaker, hskpg inconsistencies (one rm had a privacy sign, one had a kaleidoscope), dim lighting, wrong directions/address given by concierge, wrong info given by bellman, pricy drinks. Regardless it was definitely worth the rate we paid & we will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What's the big deal??”
Reviews.Author: oilersesksfalcons
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights here. Bid through Priceline and was accepted for less than half the average nightly rate. Score! Before I left, I read some of the reviews on here and was quite unnerved. I set my expectations very low. Needless to say, the W New York exceeded every one of them. The rooms are small (180 sq. feet), but most rooms are small in New York. Small, but well-appointed is how I'd describe it. A good place to rest your head at night. The room has a 42" TV with a DVD player, although we hardly used it. For location, the W is in a great area. It's right across the street from Waldorf-Astoria. About 11 blocks to Times Square, 5 to the Chrysler Building and Grand Central, 4 to the U.N. building, and 3 blocks to the nearest subway station. We walked and took the subway everywhere. Very convenient and cheap. Didn't have to deal with the staff that much, but experienced no issues when I did. Front desk was very pleasant. I didn't use any hotel services as I wasn't in there much, except to sleep. I checked out using the internet...18 bucks a day. No thanks! And 9 bucks for a Heineken out of the minibar. I didn't really enjoy the fact that you can't put any of your own stuff in the fridge since it's jammed full already, so I resorted to filling the sink with ice and putting my own beers in there. In short, I would recommend the W, but not at their asking price. Do some shopping and get a better rate through a 3rd party.

Reviews.Title: “bimbo - beautiful to look at, no substance and you won't get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: McGillGirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times and have been impressed - until out most recent stay in March 2009. The positives- fantastic location, beautiful lobby - good for meeting up with people before going out and small but stylish rooms. The negatives - over the past year, they haven't really kept up the rooms - they're starting to look a little worn. The largest problem is that the air conditioning unit in our room was not maintained. (our condo had a similar problem and it's something that happens over time but absolutely needs to be addressed before it reaches this extent of neglect.) The problem : we couldn't regulate the temperature within the room and it was making the most horrible screeching/ grinding sound. I was absolutely unable to sleep the entire night (I'm a city dweller and used to a lot of noise - so this noise was exceptionally loud. I was somewhat frustrated and called the front desk because the noise was so loud. I could barely communicate with the person at the front desk because the noise was so loud. The person answering the phone was not at all helpful and told me that sometimes the ac makes sounds. (seriously? you don't say, but when we can hardly hear each other over the phone, there is a HUGE problem with the unit). I then made the front desk aware at checkout that the AC in ROOM 1540 is extremely loud an needs attention - the woman at the check out desk didn't even bother to fake concern. She offered me 1/10 of a free hotel stay if I earn enough points by continuing to stay with their hotels- no thanks!!! I then followed up the the GM by writing a nice, succinct email. I received his out of office and after 4 days have yet to receive ANY response. So, in conclusion - this hotel is like a bimbo - beautiful to look at, no substance and you won't get any sleep.

Reviews.Title: “another great W hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrigidE
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd W hotel we stayed at on our trip and we stayed here for 4 nights - we got a good deal for $250 ++a night and was even better when after asking for a nice room we got upgraded.. I would suggest to anyone thinking of staying at hotels in the Starwood group to join their loyalty program it really seems to make a difference as we were always upgraded - every hotel we stayed at on this 3 week trip ! (Including Sheraton etc too) The rooms have just been totally renovated and although was the mid sized room - it was still on the smaller side and very, very dark.. we didn't have a view at all but the room was very quiet which was nice for a change! Still the room was quite sexy and was a nice stylish, romantic pad to base ourselves! Like W the court the heating is really loud and can be a bit annoying.. another thing I didn't like about the W hotels is they don't have any coffee/tea making facilities (even in the suites!) - really annoying as I like to have a cup of tea at night etc.. Would totally stay here again if the price was right.. not sure how I would have coped if we had got the smaller room we had actually booked though...

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what the problem is.”
Reviews.Author: michell3x
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York on Lexington 18/2-20/2. Yes it is dark - in both the lobby and in the rooms. But honestly, if you're in New York then I don't imagine you're going to be spending a lot of time sitting in your hotel room. Great location, easy walk to 5th, Rockefeller and I walked with ease to the theatre district. Very close to 6 train on 51st and the E at 53rd. I stayed in a Cozy Room (paid about $165 per night inc taxes from priceline) and you know what? It's tiny. But that's okay, because like I said, it was just a place to shower and sleep. The room is nicely decorated (if you can enjoy modern deco), the bed is very comfortable and there is room to store a few suitcases in the closet. I moved around the room with no problem at all, but I can understand why some people would gripe with the space. The bathroom is tiny - can only fit one person in there are a time, but the shower is nice, the amenities are nice and overall, the bathroom is clean and nice. Huge flat screen TV with a variety of channels - but you're not in New York to watch TV are you? Apparently there is room service/in room dining but unfortunately I couldn't find a price menu in my room in order to utilize it. Overall, great room, great facilities, friendly/helpful staff. A bit small/dark/modern deco which some people may not like. Great location. Definitely recommend if you can get it cheaply. Not sure about paying full price for their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MICHELLE_xxxxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W on Lexington and i must say i really enjoyed it. Rooms were small yet very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. I found the staff at reception very helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location..about a 7min walk to 5th Ave. The concierge outside were friendly and organise taxis for you...However at night reception does get a bit crowded and noisy so i would suggest requesting a room on a higher floor.Not many restaurants that are a quick walk away so you may need to get a taxi at night if you are eating out....Over all i really enjoyed my stay and it is a perfect hotel for a city break..and i am returning next year!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Impractical redo on the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Primoclass
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of my wife's and my favorite NYC hotels. I am a platinum memeber with Starwood, and because of that we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite for our recent 2 day stay. On the positive side, the staff at this W is fantastic- they are friendly and helpful. On the negative side- the rooms may look good with the fish-eye camera lens that they use to photograph them, but they are totally impractical. Our bedroom was barely big enough for the bed. There was nowhere to unpack our suitcases and store clothes, other than the closet- which had one shelf and a hanging bar- not a drawer in the room or closet. There is a great flat screen TV on a pole in the room, but you have to swing it over to open the closet door, and then limbo past it to get to the bathroom. The bathroom has a small stall shower, and one sink with virtually nowhere to store toiletries (again no drawers, one small shelf). The water pressure in the shower was virtually non-existent. The sitting room had an unbelievably uncomfrotable art deco couch that had cushions which resembled flotation mats for the pool. It also had a lamp which hung next to the couch, but swung over the couch when you sat on it (not by design), so that one bumped their head on it when standing up. On the first night, there was no turndown service. they charged me for a number of things we did not use (e.g. mini-bar) or returned (e.g. blackberry charger)- and although they were happy to remove the charges, they should not have been on the bill initially. My brother had another room (he was upgraded to a "wonderful" room from a "cozy" room) and his bedroom was virtually the same size as our bedroom- I have never seen rooms that small before (what must the "cozy" room look like?)- and he also had no drawers and a tiny bathroom. Our advice- use the W in Union Square or Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Mice mice mice”
Reviews.Author: avgjoe197
