Reviews.Content: Where do I begin....ok upon arrival at the W new york on lexington ave. i pulled up in front of the hotel got out my car and let the valet guy know we were checking in, he the took my keys and my wife and i proceeded into the hotel. after checking in i realize that i forgot a bag in my car so i ran outside to see if my car was still there ....it wasnt . so i ask the valet guy how can i get my bag out of my car he said "oh thats no problem" he walks me to the corner and points to a parking lot a block and ahalf away. if your from ny you know how long ny city blocks are. so i walk to the parking lot only to be told that my car was in a diffrent lot two blocks away. i get to that lot and my car is not there..the attendant at this lot was very nice and told me exactly where my car was. so i finally got my bag at the third parking lot. upon returning the valet guy looked at me and turned his head as if he never saw me in his life..only reason i didnt say anything is because i had a dinner reservation and was in a rush. when i got to my room "the spectacular room" i was in shock at how small it was. the room was very poorly light and stuffy. early the next mourning at about 5:30 am a mouse runs in the room my wife jumps on the bed and so did i. i get on the phone and let the front desk know whats going on they said there sending someone right up five minuetes later a hotel staff comes to the room with fresh towels. i said there a mouse in the room we dont need towels. the hotel staff the gets on her radio and lets the know again tha there is a mouse in the room. she walks out and NOBODY SHOWED UP. to make a long story short we packed our things and checked out. what supprised me during check out is that the hotel manager did not looked surprised at all. it must happen pretty often. i will never stay at another W hotel again. they have a lot of nerve charging over $400 per night. what a valentines day!?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: tipperella
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequently for work and book through priceline. Twice I've stayed at this hotel for a fantastic price. As some other reviewers have said, it is very modern and does have a very active bar scene at the bar in the lobby. If you enjoy modern decor and a more boutique atmosphere, you will really like this hotel. As compared to some others (like 30 Columbus), it is both modern AND functional. Very comfortable and in a good area (not touristy though if that's what you are looking for). If you are staying for several days and actually want to do work there though, the lighting is fairly dim. Each time I was there, it was only to stay the night so this was not a problem. I'd gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rlebkowski
Reviews.Content: I have learned a difficult lesson which should have been obvious; when a hotel is ranked closer to the bottom of a list of hotels than the top in a particular city there is usually good reason. The W New York underwent renovations in August 2008, but do not be fooled; the service remains sub-par. In other words, when the W New York wishes to play the role of fairy godmother and asks what is your wish, the magic wand disappears when you have the audacity to make one. My modest wish over the Superbowl weekend was to watch Superbowl XLIII in high definition in the comfort of my hotel room. To avoid misunderstanding, I contacted the hotel on three separate occasions prior to booking to confirm that I would be able to watch the game in high definition. All three times, employees assured me I would be able to do so. You can imagine my frustration when I learned that while the new flatscreen televisions were high definition capable, none of the programming being broadcast was in high definition, other than the initial hotel welcome channel. When I informed a manager about this misrepresentation, he offered nothing more than a credit of one hundred dollars. Other frustrations included being billed thirty-two dollars for minibar consumption despite never having consumed anything from the minibar and housekeeping staff being instructed to knock on our door half-an-hour before check-out and again a few minutes prior to check-out despite a do not disturb sign having been placed on the door. If there was a positive note during the stay, it was W New York's association with Acura called the Acura Experience. This gives any guest who stays two consecutive nights at the hotel the opportunity to be dropped off in a chaffeur-driven Acura MDX virtually anywhere in Manhattan during your visit free of charge. Upon my return home, I received an e-mail from the hotel suggesting that while it expected I had a spectacular stay, I could write about anything that was not satisfactory. I took the hotel up on the offer and wrote at length about my disappointment. To date, I have received neither a response to my e-mail nor the modest credit offered during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: Princesse069
Reviews.Content: Service was very poor, we had a room that was as big as my suitcase, the bathroom wasn't cleaned the way it should have been and the staff was rude. If you stay 2* you can expect something not to be perfect, but to pay this much.....idiots! We went to the Waldorf on the opposite side and were given a congierge room, same price, much better service, very kind staff, complementary newspaper(!!!!!) and no fuss. Much ado about nothing, although Times Square seems to be better. Anyway, we're NEVER going to stay in a W hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the w”
Reviews.Author: lou000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on lexington avenue in May 2008 for our honeymoon. Having never been to new york I took recommendation of my fiancee who had and our travel agent who had actually stayed at the W the year before. Overall the hotel is a great stay. Having read some of the other reviews I can understand their point - for example, reception is usually busy and the bar and lobby are often occupied by businessmen and woman as the hotel caters to corporate events as do many of the modern hotels in New York. This didn't bother us as we didn't sit in the lobby much anyway. The veiw was limited to the building opposite and the room on our floor was very dark all day but it was easy to relax in after a hectic day in New York. The entire hotel was spotlessly clean and ultra modern in design. The room service prices were unbelievable and considering the hotel are so good about you bringing in food from the many sources on Lexington there is no need to do so. We literally brought in everything from snacks to large take away pizza's! The hotel was so peaceful & quiet all day and all night around the rooms and corridoors - if it wasn't for the lobby and the staff I would have questioned if anyone else actually was there! The hotel staff are lovely, everyone was willing to help and seemed to remember you from day to day which was nice as we felt instantly welcome. The hotel lobby was bustling every night - we got in late quite a few eves and it was like a club that even non-guests flocked to. This wasn't an issue as at was quite sofisticated and chilled. The best thing was the hotel shop also stayed open and stocks the most gorgous selection of New York fashion - very tempting, again lovely staff. The location of the hotel was good, we never had to walk for too long (as long as you are fit and able its fine and taxis were reasonable if not) Quite far from Bloomingdales ad the financial district - so if your going take advantage a plan to spend the day in that area but we went to cetral park nearly everyday as only a 15-20 min walk. Overall, this hotel offers a great balance between complete peace in the room and 'sex and the city' style nightlife in the lobby. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING experience”
Reviews.Author: DA-MTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the W over MLK Jr. weekend. Although the room (the 'cozy' room) is small, it's not a dwarve's den. There is ample room for 2/3 large suitcases + a litter of shopping bags. There is also a roomy closet to store coats, bags, etc... Bed is queen-size and heavenly. Didn't have a chance to try the room service but whatever I did manage to catch a glance of looked great. No need to complain about the room service though because it's NEW YORK CITY! There's a great restaurant on every corner... At the time of our stay, the W was engaged in a joint venture with Acura. This service allows you to book a private car (an Acura MDX) that can give you a lift to wherever you want (in Manhattan). This program was AMAZING and super helpful! The coordinators of the program were awesome as well. All the staff we encountered were kind and helpful. Nothing seemed out of place and/or shabby throughout what we saw of the hotel. Hotel bar is pricey but it's what's expected. I really do not have one complaint about our stay at this hotel. I'd be back in a heartbeat!! Ok, maybe 1 tiny complaint -- if you book a 'cozy' room, make sure you are traveling with someone you are close with. The bathroom 'door' is only a sliding, frosted glass door that doesn't close 100%. Looks like a shower door...

Reviews.Title: “Great base for NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: mgcasvtiany
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate for a weekend stay in NYC. Well located for upper east side, 5th avenue shopping and the 6 subway line. The room was quite small, but time is best spent exploring the city and not in your room.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are TINY and don't stay here if you're over 30”
Reviews.Author: PaulD67
Reviews.Content: The rooms were exceptionally small. One side of the bed is less than a foot from the wall. If you needed to get out of bed you would either hit your head on the oversized TV that hangs on a stripper pole or have to climb over the person sleeping next to you. The rooms are also very poorly lit - we turned on every light in the room in order to barely see what was in our suitcases. Speaking of suitcases, there really isn't any room for them except in the closet. Which we actually wanted to leave open to increase the size of the room, but then the closet light wouldn't turn off. I've stayed in a ton of different NY hotels and have never had a room so small and dysfunctional. The bathroom on the other hand, while quite small was nice. And do yourself a favor if you're over 30, don't stay here. The techno music, insence burning and dim light will drive you nuts. I'm a young 41 and felt completely out of place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but tired despite a renovation and tart up”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAlan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed her about five times over at least 5 years. Most recently December 08 for two weeks. Its just been renovated. The rooms and much improved but they still look obviously like an old hotel that has been cost effectively renovated. In other words not great. That said the best bed I have ever slept in and a very convenient location. The public spaces are very stylish but the rooms etc and the over the top W language cliche is past its best. Stayed at the London NY for a week after the W and its was fantastic Much better location and it was fresh in both design and concept. Cannot say the same for the W New York.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised at the W New York”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for two nights after Christmas and I found a good rate at the W Hotel on Lexington Avenue through hotels.com Asia. The neighborhood is convenient, so I booked it. The arrival was awful--traffic jams due to a demonstration, and so many people in the lobby and only ONE person on front-desk duty at rush hour (this was to be the constant of our stay--only ever one person on front desk!)! We finally did get to check in and got our room, but the configuration on the 11th floor made it very diffcult to find room 1156 and we went around and around in the hallway. It was not a good first impression of the hotel and we were tempted to leave. Especially since we ran into other guests in the hallway who shared our complaints. Once we settled into the room, we found it spacious and comfortable--even though the new decor is not very attractive. The concierge staff were helpful and efficient in bringing more towels and non-feather pillows. We ended up liking the hotel, but regret that traffic flow in the lobby is not handled more efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: thearts
Reviews.Content: Simply excellent. Great room, perfect location and excellent service. The staff bends over backwards to accomodate their guests.

Reviews.Title: “nice time!”
Reviews.Author: SCtravelstuff
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here! Room was nice, although a little small but to be expected in NY. Service was well done. I like the little goodies they have in the lobby like snacks and some yummy juice. They even have a free car service for guests, but you have to reserve it at the Acura desk; otherwise the door guys charge you if you just walkup (wish I had known that the first time).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the W”
Reviews.Author: SavvyMamaTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while vacationing in NYC. Our room was clean, comfortable, and stylish. The staff was professional, friendly, and knowledgeable. They had no problem accomodating a later checkout time and were happy to store our luggage for us before check-in. The location is great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whew! What a trip.”
Reviews.Author: Gigibelle
Reviews.Content: Great fun. Crazy beautiful people, including celebs. Perfect location if you are into the upper east / midtown thing. The rooms are ridiculously small for the price, but they are chic. I like the modern atmosphere, but you literally need a flashlight to find your stuff in the room; this gets annoying after a couple days. Forget reading anything in the room. Everyone gathers in the lobby to see and be seen while catching up on the newspaper or a little news on the flatscreens. I agree that this brand tries a little too hard to be cool. If you are in the mood, it's fun. The bar, Whiskey Blue, takes on a life of it's own after hours and it needs the team of hot bouncers that guard the doors and the elevators. They look like the New York Giants working off duty. Let's just say... if you don't want the atmosphere that requires this type of security, don't go here. While being entertaining and literally exhausting, this club is an upscale meat market. The hot security boys enjoy making their own moves on the guests! This is no place for rookies, so be smart. Hot businessmen and beautiful women appear to visit often for a game of multiple choice till 4 or 5am. Drink prices? If you care, don't go. Bliss Spa at this swank locale? I like Bliss, but I don't get it. The brightly colored cartoonish nature of these products reminds me of a 13 year old's birthday party. I would expect something more in keeping with the hotel atmosphere. The spa is loud, bright, cold and weirdly arranged. I prefer not to ride on the elevator to the spa with the business people. The staff is nice, but the services are average. The waiting area and uncovered snacks are a little sketchy. The steam room and sauna are excellent. Concierge was very fast and helpful. Shop is unique but tiny. No big deal. For the price, I expect Wi-Fi included in the room. I'll go back....after I rest up.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Miriam08
Reviews.Content: Went to NY for a 5 day trip to celebrate my Birthday. Booked The W as part of a package deal with Virgin - which was fantastic value. We had been really nervous after reading the other reviews but when we arrived I was very impressed. Having been to NY before, and paid similar prices at a pretty basic hotel, I really couldn't believe our luck. The hotel is pretty stylish, well decorated, helpful staff and it is in a brilliant location. We had a comfort room which was a good size for two people, especially in NY. Didn't try any of the amenities but found the bar always lively, which must mean good things. Not sure I would want to pay premium prices quoted on some websites, but for the deal we got I was very happy and even looking at the website, the prices quoted seemed reasonable for the standard offered. Would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Cigan_L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for a couple of nights and found it comfortable, but not particularly compelling. The main negative was the extremely noisy air-conditioning unit on the inside courtyard. This is seems to be a problem for any lower level rooms facing inwards (the noise was still very loud after I moved rooms a few floors up). The decor is good and I liked the music that was playing around the hotel. Also having a big flat-screen tv in the room, ipod speakers and interesting books/magazines was a plus. My only criticism of the decor is that in the W's desire to be cool & trendy, both the rooms, lobby and restaurant areas simply did not have enough lighting, especially in the mornings. Overall, I had a ok stay at the W - no more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Antonio101
Reviews.Content: W Hotel at Lexington Ave and 51st. What a big disappointment! . The lobby looks trendy and is fairly nice the staff is ok, not rude but not particularly nice with the exception of the concierge staff who were very courteous, helpfull and professional. The first room I was given was a size of a closet (imagine the size of the closet..) and telephone did not work. The second room was ok in size, but: no directory, no slippers, no stationary, no turndown in the evening, not a single European TV channel, Light in the room is terrible, The air conditionning/heating was extremely noisy, the bath amenities are ok in quality but very poor in size. Overall there is a lack of service and the feeling that no one really cares. I paid 600 $ a night (tax incl)! Be sure that you can get a much better hotel in NYC for that money. Will definitely not return and would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience”
Reviews.Author: traveller1Ath
Reviews.Content: Although recently renovated, this hotel does not live up to the expensive redo. Staff is smug and non responsive to guests' needs. Telephone operator is not always available to answer your calls (the hotel itself sometimes will not answer),and sometimes your wake up calls will be forgotten. Rooms are inadequately furnished (my room did not have shelfing for my clothes in the closet), although the bed is indeed very confortable. Door staff is more for show than help, since they are always busy either talking to each other or checking out passing people on the street. As a whole, I would not recommend this hotel, it was a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “All W Hotels are not created equal”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: My first experience with a W Hotel was in Montreal. Totally enjoyed every minutes of our stay. The next one was the W Hotel Time Square. Not impressed. Average hotel with overly designed features. And then we stayed at this W Hotel on Lexington. Not impressed at all. The rooms were small, way too small. The room was 9 feet wide and 10 deep. It was too small. We went to the bar the first night, the drinks we over priced and not made very well. Like I said, not all W Hotels are created equal. If you are looking for that special experience this not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 night end of October. Room was very well decorated, comfortable and spacious. Unfortunately I was staying on the 5th floor and had a lot of noise of some airco installations on the roof of another building....earplugs helped :-)) Hotel is very well located on Lexington Avenue, so very close to all major attractions. Other nice features of the hotel: Bliss products in hotel room, fresh fruit tea, chocolates & apples in the hotel lobby, ...

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: StephaniB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both live in New York, but we wanted to try something different and stay in the city and celebrate our 2 year wedding Anniversary so we stayed at the W Hotel and we had an amazing stay. We were welcomed with a bottle of Champagne and a bowl of strawberries in our room shortly after our arrival. The room was a little small, but not cramped at all. It was clean and quite cozy and the bed was sooooo comfortable. The lighting that prior customers on tripadvisor had complained about wasn't much of an issue for us. Yes it was dimmer than what we're used to, but that's what adds to the charm of this boutique hotel. The hotel has a restaurant which we didn't have a chance to try out, because our stay was VERY short, but we did have in-room dining and the food was prepared and delivered to our room very promptly. The hotel also has an adorable little boutique that sells everything from Candles, to Jeans, to Handbags and boots for him and her incase you need to do some quick shopping. I was very impressed. The Hotel is also very nicely situated within walking distance to Saks, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral and so on. The only down side was the air conditioning unit ,which adjusts itself every so often, blasts cold air for a few minutes all throughout the night. It was a little uncomfortable for us since we prefer the heat to the cold, But it shuts off after a while and It didn't bother us at night --We were able to sleep through the noise. All in all the staff was very nice and definately took care of us! We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Losing its edge fast”
Reviews.Author: Elpis
Reviews.Content: The W group is not what it was. Sure, it's hard to get a room with a decent view in New York, but the cheapest rooms here are not just tiny but look out on air ducts: you have to crane to see a piece of sky. Pictures are falling off the bathroom walls, the service is curt, and the hotel is investing in fake grass in the lobby in a doomed attempt to become the coolest bar in town. Clean, but depressing and characterless.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. This W delivers the experience, but no more.”
Reviews.Author: Ultraplur
Reviews.Content: Staying at a W hotel, one of Starwood's newest brands, has come to signify to most travellers, an expected level of world-class comfort, combined with hip interiors and good technology. Overall, I must say that the W New York delivers what it promises, but no more. The hotel is often so busy, that it becomes unpersonal and the staff are not as complacent as they should be in a W-caliber hotel. I have stayed, many times, at other W properties, and the staff are friendlier and even greet you by name. The experience at ground level delivers the W promise quite well. Bars are full and crowd is hip, nice and beautiful. The decor in the bars is not exceptional and one can say that there are for sure many more beautiful and cooler bars in New York, but hey, this is New York and that in itself is a statement. The hotel becomes another animal by night, and there is a clear difference of its ambiance during the day hours as that from 6 PM and on. My room was decent-sized for New York standards, which would make a Texas man feel cramped for sure. There was space for only the essential, but the appointments, furniture and gadgets were all in excellent shape and of very good quality. Perhaps my only complaint would be that the rooms are unnecesarily dark. This is a clear case of function following form, where the dark design makes it unpractical to find items in one's luggage, as it really is dark, night and day. The food was OK, nothing to write home about and some items were a bit on the greasy side. It may have had to do with choice, though. The meeting rooms were comfortable, of good size, but somehow uninspiring. Very plain-looking and with no "punch". The gym is OK, also. Nothing great, but above average from other hotels in the area. The spa, however, is worth a visit and if you have time, the amount and quality of the services offered is really outstanding. Treatments, however, are not on the unexpensive side. What is truly great about this W property is its location, which is superb for walking around mid-town and for business visitors to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money more wisely elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Littlegeegee
Reviews.Content: When checking into our room we immediately realised that this was not the room we had reserved. We had booked a "spectacular room" and this was definitely not that. It turned out to be a "cosy room", two categories below ours and unless we had said something at the time then this is the room we would have had to stay in. Essentially, the difference between the two is the size and floor level. We were shown another room, but found that there was no bath. We were shown yet another which overlooked some sort of generator. We then decided to speak to the manager who turned out to be the "talent coach", according to his business card. Never heard of one of these before in a hotel and wondered what his real function was. He showed us another room which also had just a shower and eventually we found a room with a bath and shower over. It took forever for our luggage to be delivered there and that was after a 'phone call to find out what had happened to it. In the meantime we had also requested a tea/coffee maker in the room, but this was nowhere in sight so that meant another call. One was eventually delivered, but was so dusty and unlevel that I decided that it would be wise to run some clean water through it before we used it. Just as well because the water which came through was filthy with lots of horrible black clumps in it. I also washed out the two mugs which were delivered and the one was full of white bits and something pink and sticky. We made one more 'phonecall and another coffee machine was later delivered, but the second machine was even worse than the first with three feet missing - where do they get these machines from?!! By this stage we decided to speak to the hotel manager, who had already left so we spoke the duty manager whom we invited to come to our room and see the problems for herself. She arrived armed with yet another coffee machine and mugs and apologised several times for what had happened and offered us complimentary breakfast the next day. She was actually very sweet and we felt a little sorry for her because her company was obviously letting her down. However when you are paying around Â£350.00 a night without breakfast included then this is not what you expect. All in all, the whole experience was not enjoyable. The rooms are very small, the bathrooms are absolutely tiny and the room maids obviously do not consider it part of their daily routine to wash up the mugs after the coffee maker has been used by guests. The air-conditioning is also exceptionally noisy and it wakes you up in the middle of the night when it bursts into action and then again when it shuts down as it sounds like someone slamming a door! Being directly on Lexington Avenue is also very noisy, even on floor 16, as the traffic is constant and so are the sirens and car horns! Believe it or not we had stayed there several times before and this was our worst experience. Had we been paying a much lower rate per night then perhaps this may have been more tolerable, but still unacceptable. I also noticed that during our six night stay that our duvet cover was not changed at all. I know that there was a sheet underneath, but surely the whole bed should have been change during this period. There were also a few other niggles during our stay, but basically the real management there need to pull their socks up and check that standards are as high as they should be for this class hotel. Before I forget, the room lighting is totally inadequate. I know it is nice to have subdued lighting for relaxing, but when you want to read a newspaper for example you do not expect to have to go into the bathroom for clarity! For Â£350.00 per night we would avoid this hotel like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy? More Like Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: mad4peaches
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on business for 2 nights, will never return. The lobby is a nightclub, couldn't even here the woman who was checking me in. Got a room on the 16th floor, it was a "cozy, queen" that was a claustrophobic cave. Lighting was terrible, don't plan on getting any work done. It is impossible to get from the entrance of the room to the bathroom without bumping into the TV. And they charged my for 3 nights eventhough I only stayed 2 -business plans changed at the last minute. Their cancellation policy "The time for canceling without penalty has passed. If you cancel, the forfeiture amount will be a 1 night penalty. If you cancel after 04:00PM hotel time [3 days prior to check-in date] , the forfeiture amount will be 100.00 percent. There may be additional applicable charges and taxes." The only thing that I enjoyed about this hotel was the bath products.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about the reviews we read here when we got the W New York on Priceline. Wow, were we pleasantly surprised. First, we did get one of the really small rooms. It was fine for a couple (not to say bigger wouldn't be better, but it was absolutely fine)....the main part of the room, which contains the bed, two nightstands, desk, TV, and small drawer-set and mini-bar cabinet, could not have been more than 10' wide x 14' long. The rest was the bathroom (small, but it looks from the traveler photos that it's the same as the bathrooms even in the suite), entry hall and closet. Pros: Decor - very new, very hip Bed - super comfortable bed, pillows and linens TV - flat panel, although someone mentioned HDTV and we didn't think there was actual HDTV service. Lobby Bar - very nice, good service, always lively but not uncomfortably crowded. We didn't go in the club. Location: This is my favorite area of NY to stay in because its relatively quiet, but also so convenient to everything (I guess that's why there's so many hotels within a few block radius). Cons: A/C Worked very well, but was a little loud when it came on. It didn't bother us in the slightest, but we sleep with the fan on even in winter because we like the "noise". It might be bothersome to someone with noise issues. Shower - Spiekman rainshower head. We don't like rainshowers in general, much prefer a regular strong flow shower head like in most Starwood hotels. No reading lights on the nightstands Nit: We made our original reservation for 2 nights and then added a third. They failed to clean our room on the second day. Bathroom: I didn't notice the problems someone else mentioned -- there were two shelves for your toiletries, and I'm short and had no issues. We both liked the "vibe" and we are definitely not in their "preferred demographic"!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: nwterp99
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed here (about 2 years ago) I would have given this place about a three. But this time - I don't know if it was the excellent service, or the remodeled rooms - I was very impressed. If you can reserve a larger room or request an upgrade, do so. The smallest rooms are tiny, but the upgraded rooms aren't bad. Actually, we were able to snag a newly remodeled room, which, even though had a view of a brick wall, had really neat decor that made up for it. The service was awesome, from the check-in, to the bell-hop, to the bartender. The lobby is a comfortable place to relax and hang out. The food and drinks are very good, like other W hotels. The spa is very cool and the massage (along with the brownie bar in the lounge) was excellent. The location is right in the heart of NYC, convenient to restaurants, attractions, subways...it's worth the price for what you get here, considering how expensive New York hotels can be. I would return to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience at the W”
Reviews.Author: jondc27
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the W New York Lex Ave this weekend from Oct 11-13 and despite all the negative reviews we had read beforehand, we had an amazing experience and encountered none of the problems mentioned here or elsewhere. To note, the hotel was renovated in August 2008 of this year and as a result, the whole property looks and smells extremely clean. The staff themselves seem very proud of their new surroundings and eager to please their clientele. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a Fantastic suite on account of it being my birthday and received a small bottle of champagne as an added bonus along with a card from the hotel. Needless to say, this was beyond and above the hotel's duty to its guests and we were very grateful for the extra attention we received. The room we had was on the top floor of the hotel and was large and spacious, with an elegant modern vibe throughout. The bathroom was adequately sized with a rainforest showerhead (and a shower that could fit 3-4 people, if needed) and the room came complete with a small balcony. To point out some of the highlights: - No issues reserving the Acura experience - Welcome water and chocolates (made in-house) were available next to the elevators during all hours of the day. - Any service request (extra glasses, slippers, etc) was completed within 5 minutes of placing the call. - The W Concierge had great recommendations and passes for some of New York's hottest clubs. - There was an exceptional level of service in all areas of the hotel - from the SWEAT fitness facility all the way to the cleaning staff who took great care in providing extra amenities upon request. For those who have stayed in this hotel before, we would highly recommend giving it a second chance as they have really worked hard to make it live up to the W name.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobia and DARK”
Reviews.Author: Coconut_Joe_88
Reviews.Content: Just visted New York city during our Canada's Thanksgiving weekend. Beautiful city and we stayed at the W Hotel on Lexington and 53. If you are claustrophobia and fear of darkness then this hotel is not right for you. Rooms are dimmed dark. This hotel is for young teens who like "Club Atmosphere" settings. I booked using Priceline which was a mistake because I set the ratings to be a 4 star hotel and I ended up with this actual 3-3.5 star rating. Valet parking put some small dents on my doors so please check your vehicle before leaving the hotel. I would visit this city again but not any of the W Hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fun lobby”
Reviews.Author: Bagokie
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers, I had very low expectations based on my research. I called ahead, told the staff it was my birthday and that I'd be there for a mother/daughter trip to NYC. We received a renovated room with comfy beds, huge flat screen, carpet that was not torn and a bathroom that was mold-free. The Oasis Lounge is over-priced, but the drinks are strong and the service was attentive. I honestly don't have a bad thing to say about this place. I've stayed in many different hotels over the years, some were ultra-luxe and some were just an ok place to lay my head for the night. The W New York was fab. The room was a *bit* spacious for New York, actually. I was expecting a broom closet. It was lovely and I'd stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are so small its insulting”
Reviews.Author: Sallie S
Reviews.Content: I go to NYC once per month and the W Hotel on 49th and Lexington is a close walk to my office. I love the location and the hotel lobby is fun. However, the rooms are tiny, so small you cant even walk around the bed without slamming your toe into the wall. Each time I go there (been there 4 times in past few months) I dread opening the hotel room door. I keep hoping that since I am a frequent businesss person and am a premier member of the Starwood guest program, things will improve. But they never have. I need to find a new hotel chain that has more options in NYC unfortunately. This is not a family, kids friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price as I had a great deal on that hotel”
Reviews.Author: EarlDGrt
Reviews.Content: The W on Lexington and 51 was an OK NYC hotel. The lobby is tight, service was acceptable for NYC hotel (not polite but not rude - I would say cold professional greeting), the room was small and the bathroom was extremely small. The furniture and the decor was new that made the room acceptable. Prepare to pay for everything. Overall -- for $250 a night for a NYC hotel I would give it an OK ratings. The W at Times Sq is a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms, Bad Service, Billing Traps”
Reviews.Author: keerkhar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night. I had reserved a basic room. When I arrived around 2:00pm, I was told the room would not be ready until 3:00pm. An available upgraded room was offered to me for an extra $20; I took it. Room was small but nice: nice decoration, large flat screen TV, Radio and iPod player, etc. At check out, there was a $14 charge on my bill for using the mini-bar. But I never used the mini-bar. The explanation by the front desk person was that someone had come into my room to check the mini-bar. However, I checked into my room around 2:00, had a "Do not disturb" sign on my door, and check out the next morning. So there is no way anyone would have come into my room to check the mini-bar. Also, When I called room service several time, it would go into voice-mail !!! By the way, newspaper is delivered to you each morning at a cost to you, unless you call the front desk to tell them you don't want it. Pros: Great Location, Nicely decorated rooms, many amenities in the room. Cons: Rude people at the front desk, bad service, money trap on your bill (charges for things you didn't order or use)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly (and gratefully!) surprised”
Reviews.Author: fyonna
Reviews.Content: I read an awful lot of bad/terrible reviews for this hotel and would have cancelled my booking if the reservation hadn't been prepaid. Glad I didn't! The rooms have been recently renovated (think some may still be in the process) so the furniture and fittings are perfectly adequate rather than tired and worn like I'd read, and our room was comfortingly clean. To those people who complained that the lighting is low throughout the hotel, that's the vibe they're after, appealling to your inner rock star. Personally, I liked it. And the rooms may be small but this is NYC after all! We had the second smallest room (200sqft I think) and didn't mind one bit. Location wise it's been my favourite yet, in the middle of the high rise of midtown without being too close to the insanity of Times Square. The best compliment I can pay this hotel is that I would quite happily stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheDoge
Reviews.Content: While I can appreciate the cost of decent hotels in Manhattan, the W on Lexington Ave is overpriced for what you get. Our room was small with no space to even put your luggage. The bathroom had no place to put your toiletries and you could practically change TV channels with your feet while lying in bed (although the HDTV was nice). On a more positive note, the hotel has a nice location and the lounge area in the lobby is very lively. In summary, for $500 a night, there are much better places to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: ocsec
Reviews.Content: First time Priceline booking. Expected the worse after reading some of the reviews here, but was extremely pleased by hotel. Room was clean and very well appointed. Not much of a view from the 16th, but this is to be expected in mid-town. Bathroom was good size but a little dark. The Bliss products and premium towels made up for that. Flat screen HD TV. Down pillows and comforters. Pleasant and helpful staff. Did not eat at the hotel, so no comment on that. If staying here, check out the Red Stone Cafe Pizzeria at 500 Lexington. Great breakfast and meals at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “My stay @ the W on Lex was Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: legislady
Reviews.Content: The music in the lobby and Heartbeat Restaurant is FAR TOO LOUD for conversation. The lobby was full, full, full every night with people ordering drinks ... yet there was never more than ONE waitress working at a time ... which made the service slow, slow, slow. The front desk staffer @ check-in was snotty. A different front desk staffer was equally snotty the next day. Upon check in we were not physically able to reach our room because workers were putting furniture together in the hall - completely blocking passage to our room for several hours. AND, they worked in that location every day of our stay - smoking and making the usual banging around noises you associate with construction. This would have been a complete disaster had we not been out of the room during the day. I pity anyone in the vicinity who was trying to sleep in or get some rest during the day. Impossible! The long wait for an elevator is ridiculous ... the small size of the elevator is ridiculous ... the card system in the elevator is hard to operate ... I missed my floor MANY a time due to not begin able to make the card work on the first, second, third try at a swipe. The lighting in the room is FAR TOO DIM. I understand the "modern" decor and all ... but I found the room to be depressing. Ditto the hallways. Thank goodness we were on the street side and could get some daylight. The glass bathroom door was no help if you are sharing a room with someone trying to sleep in. The bathroom light shines brightly through onto both of the beds. The concierge had a bit of an attitude as well - in addition to out and out lying about payment for Grayline's double-decker bus. She insisted that a $12 per ticket deposit HAD to paid at the hotel with the balance paid to the ticket guy upon boarding the bus across the street at outside of the Waldorf. That is just a bald-face LIE. That incident ALONE left a very bad taste in my mouth. We ordered a movie one night for $9.99+ and it skipped continuously like a bad DVD from Blockbuster. Annoying. On the plus side, the doormen were unfailingly friendly and helpful, the beds were comfortable (though the pillows were ALL squishy - you do need a variety), the housekeeping crew did a good job every day, the complimentary fruit-water and red delicious apples in the lobby were a nice touch, and one of the maintenance supers ~ his name was DAN ~ went out of his way to be helpful when we were physically unable to get to our room due to the construction in the hall. The plusses do not outweigh the minuses though. I'm afraid I won't be able to recommend this particular location to anyone, and based on this experience, I do not plan to stay at any other W in my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff - tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrhsan
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD the location of this hotel is excellent and close to every major site in the City. Subways and grand central is walking distance. The staff at the W are excellent and will do anything to keep you happy. Atmosphere of the lobby bar area and reception are warm welcoming , chic and happening at night especially with Randy Gerebers bar next door. Food at the Lobby is good but small portions for the prices you are paying. The bed in the rooms is the excellent Sheraton bed i have com eto know and love. Love the Bliss products in the bathroom. good views from my room. i stayed in a small suite,1 bedroom and living area. clean rooms and bathrooms.Bliss spa is excellent and i got used to the "bliss smell" all over the hotel. the staff made every effort to keep us happy . THE BAD The hotel is old and tired and beginning to show. One would expect much more from a W - especially as it is supposed to be upscale. room was a bit smoke smelling. Couches smelt old , so did the carpets. you can see the carpets coming undone at the seams . bathroom although clean has old tiles and traces of mildew coming on the tiles. rooms are very small BUT IS EXPECTED IN ANY NEW YORK HOTEL. tv is basic . and room amenities are also very basic. i was dissapointed on the whole .

Reviews.Title: “Small, Dirty & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bargeror
Reviews.Content: We went on a trip to NY, thinking that we booked a hip hotel. When we arrived the room we got first was so small, that one of us had to stay on the bed if the other one went to the bathroom. Aside from the room needing renovation, it was not overly clean. The next day we were moved to a bigger room, but that room was really dirty with stains everywhere. The whole house smells like old carpet and whatever you do, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: derek1407
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. Very expensive but then its New York. Good location though. The bathroom was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “A cool oasis in humid NY”
Reviews.Author: H_ILChicago
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline ($225 per night). After reading the reviews I was prepared to be disappointed but this place is an oasis! I called ahead to confirm we had a non smoking room and they told me to ask for an upgrade when I checked in and they would do it if it was available. When I arrived they promptly upgraded me. Yes, the rooms are small but this is New York - anywhere central is going to be small. The room was clean with good quality linens. Our room was renovated and I think all rooms are now at the W. Bathroom nice and clean and bright. Room was light with 2 big windows and a view down Lexington. Very handy for the subway. Didn't order room service or dine there but reception and concierge very helpful and friendly (this place is not at all pretentious). Housekeeping were friendly and did a very thorough job. This is a great place to base yourself in Manhattan. It was over 90 degrees in NY the weekend we stayed and returning to our quiet, cool room at the W was perfect. Well above our expectations for the price. Definitely recommend it to others! The only thing I'd add is that it is always worthwhile asking for a room on a high floor just because there is always so much going on at street level in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, comfortable and the bar did great cocktails!”
Reviews.Author: Allis0nB
Reviews.Content: Lovely chic hotel. It was my first tirp to NY and it was everything I hoped it to be and more. It had actually been recommended to me by my hairdresser and as I had never been before was not sure what to expect. It was in a great location - especially close to Bloomingdales which I liked! Rooms quite small but very comfortable and free Aveda toiletries in the bathroom. Bar area was brilliant and the cocktail list was amazing. Staff fantastic, and nothing was too much trouble. When we were there it was my husband's birthday and one of the staff noticed this when checking his passport when we were exchanging money. When we came back in that evening there was a cheese platter with a bottle of wine and a birthday card in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W”
Reviews.Author: chynaluv954
Reviews.Content: I loved the W Hotel in Manhattan. It's a very trendy place to be in the heart of Times Square. The lounge on the 4 floor was a great touch too!

Reviews.Title: “small and ridiculously dark!”
Reviews.Author: gingerray
Reviews.Content: This hotel although located is like being trapped in a bad episode of CSI . Very low blue light. The rooms are tiny, poorly laid out and have almost no light. The windows have no privacy curtains so leaving curtains open may not be an option. A queen room is too small for 2 people to share. Service is surly at best. The doorman are purely decorative. Really absurd overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: vliou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W having read the reviews here, and the biggest difference that everyone failed to mention is the renovated rooms. They are great, i'm not going to lie. Very chic, modern - but a little weird for me. Nonetheless, it was a very cool designed room, and the taste may not be for everyone. The W is not meant as a 4 / 5 diamond hotel...it's supposed to be more like a loft hotel I went there for an anniversary. I got upgraded to a suite (am a gold member with SPG), but the windows were facing a garbage hole. The W has very rude staff, very unattentive service, etc. The rooms are quite nice though. Everything is kind of half [--], sadly...will be staying at the Westin NY. We stayed in a Junior Suite...and found that to be...on the small side. I can only imagine how small the other rooms are...

Reviews.Title: “Skip it.”
Reviews.Author: mapdsd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick get-away to NYC and stayed at the W Hotel. There are many others in the same price range that are better. The hotel seemed to be more interested in pizzazz than function. The rooms were incredibly small - even for NYC. The air conditioning barely worked. And the room was dark. Would definitely skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcoleman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend, we arrived early and was able to check in at 12:30 pm. I inquired about an upgrade and it was granted. We got a " mega suite" which was nice but not mega at all, although it is NYC...none the less the room was clean and well appointed ( travel sized Bliss spa products, lg flat screen t.v., Ipod dock, ) The room had 1 queen bed and we called for a rollaway cot which was delivered quickly. We requested extra pillows, and a toothbrush and both arrived quickly. We had a view of Lexington Ave and the Waldorf Astoria from our large picture window. There are many items in the mini bar, we took them out and put our own drinks in. The lighting in the room is very dim but it did not impact our stay. We confered with the front desk regarding local night clubs and was provided sufficent information. Upon check out we left our bags and went to breakfast at the " Comfort Diner" on 45th st. (YUM!!!!!) about 1.5 hours later we picked up our bags and left the hotel. It was a great time! I don't know what the average price for this hotel is, we paid $220.00 a night and we felt that it was a fair price. I read mixed reviews on this hotel but we were quite satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny!”
Reviews.Author: JaneTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Service was pleasant, but there must be some discrepancy with the room sizes as some other reviews did not mention it. If you aren't one of the lucky ones to always be upgraded, DEFINITELY request a ?larger room or some other room than mine as it was a view of a parking garage, barbed wire fencing, and an old building. The room size was suitable for 1/2 of a person.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful stay at the W New York!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2TravelMN
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the W New York on Priceline, and then were a little nervous after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Since our trip was for our 25th wedding anniversary and we wanted it to be special, we wrote to the hotel asking for a non-smoking room with a king-sized bed, and mentioned that we were coming to celebrate our anniversary. We got a response right away saying that they had upgraded our room (to a Mega room), and that they would do whatever they could to make our trip a memorable one. We arrived before check-in time, but our room was ready, and we were able to check-in immediately. At check-in we were given a complimentary breakfast and lunch for two. We left our hotel to go to the theatre and to dinner, and upon our return found a bottle of champagne on ice, and strawberries. Our room was clean and comfortable, and every employee we encountered during our 5 night stay was friendly and helpful. We asked for a late check-out (3:30 p.m.) on the day we left as our flight did not leave until 6:00 p.m., and the hotel did not hesitate to accommodate us. The W New York may have had some difficulties in the past (according to the earlier reviews) , but if our stay is any indication, they are working diligently to change that, and I would recommend this hotel without reservation (pardon the pun!).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but beware of ceiling ;-)”
Reviews.Author: pacoNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was also a bit worried about this hotel having read the reviews. Therefore I emailed the hotel and asked for a renovated room beforehand. I also needed twins and wanted no noise. Everything was taken care of! Thanks Christy!!! We had a good stay: - rooms are not big but fine for us (father and son) coming from Europe - beds EXCELLENT - renovated room fine - location great But, during the first night we heard a big bang and in the morning part of the ceiling in the bathroom had come down (2 sq ft) and fell in the bath tub. Reason probably leaking drain from room above. We called front desk Someone came looking and said someone else would come. Took some time. Then I called front desk again who put me through to manager and within 10 minutes we had a new room, again exactly according specification. One thing I always hate, and also with this hotel, is the fact that internet is not free. And incredible fees are charged. In many cheaper hotels internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: JE1205
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night when we were in town for a Yankee Game. It was a great stay. Very clean hotel. All the staff we dealth with were very pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 15th floor, the view was nothing great but then again I hadn't selected a room with a view. It was a small room, but average for NY City size. It was nice that they offered Bliss products in the bathroom and the mini-bar had everything you could possibly want. I would say two adults max in the room. If I had more time I might have visited the Bliss spa downstairs. The fact that there was a large, light up photo of a naked lady's torso, condoms in the mini-bar and purple lights made the room seem a little adult-only, but the bed was very comfortable and the room very quiet. The location was great, we were a block off of Park Avenue and caddy-corner to an uptown metro. The downtown metro was about nine blocks down, and we took the four train directly to Yankee Stadium. Overall, I would definetely like to stay here again. Oh, and breakfast was great, even if it was a little pricey ($80 for two).

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED!!!!!!! AND NOT EVEN SO FANCY!!”
Reviews.Author: pursit
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't go back to this hotel! The Rooms are so small that you don't know where to put your luggage, the bathroom is less than small and the foruniture is really IKEA style! The only good thing of my W experience was the Hamburger I got in my room! The rest... foget it!

Reviews.Title: “Another POSITIVE W New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: LittleDoode
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in June 2008 and had a pleasing stay. I, along with most reviewers, read the poor reviews and set expectations low--- BUT I was very much surprised by a great hotel. Check in was easy and quick, although the SPG Rewards I used actually gave me a free night and one for half off rack rate- so I ultimately had two different reservations. That was the only hassle, having to trade in my room key for the second night stay. Walking up to the elevator we were greated with flavored lemonade and candies or cookies in the afternoon, and Tea and snacks in the morning. We stayed on the Spa Floor, getting off the Elevator was a pleasure.... smelling all the amazing Bliss Spa Products... we had a corner room that had ample space, a large closet and lots of room to move around. The AC was terrific, since we were in NYC in 94 Degree heat wave. There was a concern with the safe, and I couldn't get it re-opened, but we called security and they came up within ten minutes AND replaced the safe that day.... asking us, considerately, if we would mind if they enter the room while we weren't there. That was a nice touch.... I felt they respected their guests and wanted to please them. I did loose patience with the concierge, since he was held up with another couple, and I patiently waited on him for 20 minutes, and when he did answer my inquiry, it was short and not very helpful. He gave me a list of local restaurants which we tried: Megu for Sushi on First Ave was GREAT! Back to the hotel- I was very happy with the room and the service and the location. I would understand why reviewers would think that the room is small... but it is NY and a studio apartment the same size lists for $450,000.... so it is safe to say that the W is a good choice. The Valet parking is pricey, but again, once you park your car you will never have to touch it until you leave... The rates are high, but again it is NYC and the location can't be beat.... but remember if you need to take a taxi uptown, walk a block over to 3rd, so you can find one going north! Over all the W was an EXCELLENT STAY, with GREAT SERVICE and GREAT ATMOSPHERE! I will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know how any of you would stay at this hotel after reading these reviews”
Reviews.Author: Derektravels
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at. So bad that I really don't feel like writing much becuase it was disgusting. I would have rather stayed at a motel 6 because at least my expectations would be on par. The rooms are filthy and old and moldy and embarassingly small. I wish someone would have been this honest before I booked it. Do yourself a favor and pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mkod
Reviews.Content: The W hotel was a great hotel in a great location. The cozy rooms are small for sure but well decorated and the service is great. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend it. I

Reviews.Title: “Chic but surly”
Reviews.Author: DarrenHM
Reviews.Content: Having read some mixed reviews (including some terrible ones) I was a little apprehensive about this place. Many people have complained about the ageing decor. The hotel is undergoing a refurbishment so DO specify that you want a refurbished room. These are smart and modern with very comfortable beds, ipod docks, flat screen TV's and modern bathrooms. They are still a bit small though. The staff still seem to be a mis of those prepared to do their jobs and those that don't really want to be there. After trying to check in, we were told that our room was not ready yet. We left our luggage with the staff and went out for 90 minutes or so. When we came back, we were told that the room was still not ready. The lady behind the desk quickly organised one but we had to take our own bags up! When it came to leaving, we were catching a night flight and so asked if we could leave our luggage while we went out, which we were told we could. We then asked if there were any facilities available where we could grab a quick shower before heading off to the airport when we came back to collect our luggage. The girl behind the desk looked at us as though we had asked to take a leak in the middle of foyer. We carefully explained several times that many hotels have either a couple of rooms or separate facilites that guests could use on such occasions. She seemed utterly unwilling to help until she eventually made the effort to phone the in house spa who happily agreed to let us use their showers. In contrast , we found the concierge service very friendly and helpful when we needed it. Great location, improving decor, but it would seem that some staff still need to be reminded that they work in a service driven industry.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasBaseballNut
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews of The W New York I didn't know what to expect. Well, this hotel was very nice. We were on the 10th floor which had just been refurbished and the room was very clean and nice. I enjoyed the new modern look the hotel is presenting. I think when others write reviews and give many negative things they just look for those things that might be a little different than at home. Lighting, bathrooms, TV's, views, etc. are just not like home. Don't sweat the small things....look at the overall positive things the hotel offers. I can say with out a doubt that this hotel is in a great location. The City Sights and Grey Lines Bus stops at the corner and it's only about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Just one block over is an GREAT bagel shop. Ess-A-Bagel!!!! What a great place to eat breakfast for about $6 for a bagel and coffee. I went there 3 of the 4 mornings for breakfast it was that AWESOME! I won a bid on Priceline for this room and paid way under what the nightly rate was, but I felt that The W New York deserves a 4-star rating which it has been given. Everyone there was pleasant and was very helpful. I'd return there again and refer anyone to this hotel. The Waldorf, Intercontinental Barclay, Radisson Lexington, and The W New York are on the 4 corners......so you can see that it keeps great company with the other hotels. Don't worry about the smaller things of life.....just enjoy this hotel and don't worry about all the small nit picking others write about. Freedom for All begins in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Paying for the Ambience”
Reviews.Author: feistygirl_23
Reviews.Content: I travel for work so I rarely am in my room for anything but sleep. I had the "Spectacular" room after I called in days prior to complain. I noticed all the bad reviews and I called to see if they would upgrade with no extra charge. They did from Wonderful to Spectacular room. The smallest room is the Cozy room, so beware. My room had zero room for my suitcase. I had to place it in a corner and try not to walk into it. The bed is in the center of the room looking out the windows. Nice change from your ordinary hote rooms. However I feel for the price, I could just stay next door at the Mariott East Side and had a much larger room. My room there was a king size bed, sofabed, and a large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry!”
Reviews.Author: amyhibbs
Reviews.Content: Like many others I was initially worried about W New York because of the mixed reviews. I booked a 'Spectacular' room which I was told was on the 11th floor or above - ours was on the 12th floor but the view faced the back of another building so was pretty dire. Yes the rooms are also small but if you're staying in New York, you should only be using your hotel room for sleeping! We found all of the staff very helpful - especially the concierge who recommended 4 different restaurants given our criteria - all of which were excellent. They also have free DVD hire in the hotel which was good. The lobby of the hotel is very nicely decorated with a new cool soft drink to try each day. I thought it was great - just a pity about the view (or lack of it!) Also, the location is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic service, worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: XRF-Trainer
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying at W New York. I'd read some online reviews that weren't positive, and wasn't looking forward to my stay. I shouldn't have worried, my 4 night stay was incredible. I stayed on the 17th floor, in a 'Marvelous Suite' with wet bar, couches, desk w/printer/fax, and separate single queen bedroom. Very comfortable bed and linens, BIG walk in shower (my wife loved the shampoo and stuff) Small, but nice, balcony. One of the funnest mini-bars I've run across, with toys in addition to the usual high end snacks/drinks. Very good soundproofing. I couldn't hear any other guests, or traffic noise. Hotel decor exhibits a clear sense of humor. W takes hospitality seriously, but it's obvious that someone is having fun there. Great service. Some reviews mentioned staff with bad attitudes. I never encountered them. Every single person I interacted with, from the doorman who repeatedly found us minivan cabs to transport our gear, to the front desk clerk who reminded us to take an apple (and handed me a stack of hand towel size wet wipes when I mentioned that I was heading out to set up a display at Javits) was friendly and professional. Even the shipping department surprised me by refusing a tip when she returned 20 minutes after delivering my first set of packages to deliver a second set. She said that she should have noticed that there were 2 shipments. Hotel bar is decent, room service is exceptional, food is creative, tasty, and fast. They mean it when they say "Whatever/Whenever". I called the front desk for printer paper at 2:00am, willing to go down to pick some up. It was at my door in about 5 minutes. Bottom line - It's expensive, but worth every cent. If you're heading to NYC on business, this is a great refuge. If you're heading to NYC for pleasure, this is a great home base.

Reviews.Title: “Only liked the decor”
Reviews.Author: travel_cappie
Reviews.Content: My significant other booked a room as part of a package deal that this hotel had offered. As part of the "Feel the Wuv" package, you receive strawberries w/ chocolate. I could have picked better strawberries. I was really disappointed by this considering my high opinions of this hotel, especially it's sister the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Its just OK”
Reviews.Author: Rosyjoon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the W primarily because of the location. They have essentially taken a very old hotel with SMALL rooms, painted it and furnitioned it with modern furniture. The heater is old and on the side of the room. The bathroom is very small and old. Pros: Great Location nice lounge at the lobby the bar is great Cons: The bathrooms were old and small the rooms are VERY SMALL concierge was not all that helpful

Reviews.Title: “awful service”
Reviews.Author: dt111270
Reviews.Content: The infrastructure is a little past its sell-by-date at best. This could be rescued by great service, but sadly it isn't. Two minor faults in the room -- a non-functioning light and a closet door which wouldn't stay closed -- became jaw-clenching frustrations when they weren't fixed even on the third time of asking. The third time, by the way, was to the duty manager, who has also not delivered on her promise to let me know the cause of the non-responsiveness. All hotels have little glitches from time to time -- the good ones fix the problems first time round and apologise. In bad ones, they don't and they look you in the eye and lie to you. This is a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and Location”
Reviews.Author: HARVEYG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the W hotel on Lexington Ave last weekend. All of us were really happy with the hotel and would definitely stay again! The 'spectacular' rooms were small with abnormally loud AC however the location was excellent and there was a good atmosphere in the modern bar and lobby which was great as this is where we met up before heading out for the night! Overall, while the W was more expensive than the average hotel we felt it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant experience!”
Reviews.Author: CheekyLondon
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the W hotel on Lelxington Avenue. We had a fantastic time - a very unusual and interesting hotel - a change from the stereotypical city hotel. The staff were all helpful - from the concierge and front desk staff to the porters and room cleaning staff. The bar was often overcrowded, but fun to be in. A bonus was the Whisky Blue bar being open till 4 a.m. We booked Wonderful Rooms but were upgraded, at no extra cost, to Spectacular Rooms - these were still on the small size, but what you expect at a city hotel. The rooms were newly decorated and the plumbing and airconditioning worked fine. All in all, I have no complaints about the hotel at all - on top of this, it's in a perfect location for shops and sightseeing. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and I'm very surprised at it's low ranking in popularily amongst previous guests.

Reviews.Title: “Its not like they didn't know i was coming”
Reviews.Author: executive-backpacker
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on a Thursday night having booked a queen smoking room (disgusting i know), when i arrived i was told the hotel was full and the only room available was a double (ie a single beds) non-smoking room, yes i was offered a downgrade, so much for being a 'starwood preferred guest'. The room was tiny and had the hotel airconditioning out the window which made for not a very good nights sleep, and that classic new york view of a brick wall next door. I have stayed in other w hotels and enjoyed the experience but i would avoid this one. Aside from this experience the place could do with a makeover, the airconditioning unit in the room is loud, and the finish in the room is poor, lights didn't work in the room, you get the idea, you'll get better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not Short People Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: nancyhedy
Reviews.Content: If you had asked me the first night I was here, I would have given this hotel 5 stars. It's beautiful, upbeat, great decor, and the staff is SO friendly. But - after staying here a while there a few things that really started driving me crazy. - The size of our room is small. Which was fine at first but after I've accumulated a few shopping bags, I literally have to walk over them to get to the bathroom. - It's not short people friendly (I'm 5' 2"). The bathroom mirror starts at about my chin. I had to stand on the toilet to do my makeup. - The lighting in the room is awful. It looks great and modern, but there has to be a time when a designer forgoes some "modern" for functionality. I can barely see anything in my room even with the lights on full blast. - The maids start cleaning at 8:30am - which is 5:30am to West Coasters. The vacuum is LOUD. Even as I write this I can hear "BZZZZ BZZZZ BZZZZ" echoing through the walls. I'm not sure if it was my natural "early rising" that got me up early or if the vacuums did. - Our room key only worked about 60% of the time. Somebody had to show us the "trick" (you force it in the slot diagonally). - For 2 nights, I couldn't figure out how to work the on demand movies. By the 3rd night I finally called and apparently there is a 2nd remote that I was supposed to have (and my room was not equipped with). They sent up an Engineer (at 3am EST) and he was SUPER nice and fixed it for us. Then he said our breakfast would be comped for our trouble. I wasn't very upset at anything here, and I still thought my stay was great. I almost booked the W in Times Square and am SO glad that I changed it. This location is great and the staff was the best. I'd still stay here again - but probably only because of the location and the Starwood affiliation. If you aren't affiliated with anything, I'm sure there are better places to stay nearby. My friend stayed next door at the Marriott and was very happy with her room. It was significantly cheaper too.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Style, Manhattan-Sized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night coming back from a long trip overseas. I arrived at 6am from an 11 hour flight and the hotel said they didn't have any rooms ready. The front desk attendant was cool and told me she would call me when my room was ready. In the meantime, I went upstairs to the Bliss Spa to shower and freshen up. Once I was done, I left my bags with the bellman and went out for coffee. 2 and a half hours later I still hadn't heard from the W. I went back and at this point a shift change had taken place. The new front desk attendant, Liz, said it had been ready a while. Someone dropped the ball. She was great - couldn't have been more accommodating and apologetic for our inconvenience. Got to the room and the reviews are right - it's TINY. My bathroom at home is bigger. Seriously. But, what do you do - it's a regular room in a W in NYC. it's not going to be huge. I have only stayed in 2 really large rooms in NYC - the Pierre & at the Marriott in Times Square no less. Back to the room. It's typical W - very stylish, but just tiny. Definitely the tiniest W I have ever stayed in. The room was also a little worse for the wear. Most of the furniture had serious marks on the pieces. As for the hotel, it was nice. Very stylish lobby. The bar, Whiskey Blue, had a great after-work scene. One thing I love about W's is that spend some time, money & thought into their fitness centers and this one was no different. It was a little on the small, but it had a wide variety of modern equipment. You can get a good workout in here. The small rooms didn't bug me that much as I was only there for one night. If was staying there a week - it would have killed me.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: fatkat50
Reviews.Content: The room was small, the service was slow ... rooms need a lot of renovation ... and BAR was way too exp.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rgag1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on business because it was convenient to our morning meeting. Great location. Terrible hotel. The room was worn, noisy, and appeared to have been decorated by a color blind 10 year old. I do not find anything edgy or trendy in broken lampshades, dirty floors, or noisy rooms. The heating did not appear to be adjustable. One of my business associates who stayed a few floors below, ended up taking the cushions off of his sofa and placing them in the bathroom to sleep, the noise was truly unbearable. The restaraunt downstairs is very good, but the rooms upstairs are ready for refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gi19
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on here I was very nervous!!! When I arrived at the hotel the staff were very friendly. I was given a room on the 9th floor, it was a little small but was I only planning on sleeping there not hanging out. The room had been recently renovated and was very nice, it had a plasma tv, small tub but great shower and great Bliss products. They were in the middle of renovating the 9th floor but I was up and out early every day so I never heard any work being done. Loved the lobby, music always playing (not to loudly) and comfy sofas. Would definitely recommend this W.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to reviews”
Reviews.Author: Hainsey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here using amercian express points which limited me to Westin hotels or Sheratons. As my reason for being in NY was to visit a friend on the east side, this was the closest. I hoped the reviews and pictures I saw were limited to lone room. alas, not the case, unless I was lucky enough to get the same room. The bathroom so poorly laid out that the toilet was so close to the sink I had to lean my arm on it to fit. Wallpaper was peeling in the bedroom. The hallways were dark and poorily marked. The carpet in the hallways was ripped in places and uneven. I was using a cane at the time due to a recent ankle break and it was only due to my extreme attention to the walking surface that I was able to avoid tripping. It is an accident waiting to happen. I felt no connection to the staff, they were not unhelpful just impersonal. I stayed again in Jan. under protest. I had a suite this time. the bathroom was very small though the toilet a little better placed. The hallway remained dark and uninviting, the staff impersonal. My experience here was in sharp contract to the W Tuscany where I stayed in Dec. of 2007. We had two rooms, both great, the staff very helpful and attentive. The W Tuscany I would definitely recommend .

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FMelon
Reviews.Content: It is nothing amazing, but enjoyable when stayin in new york

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Paul_015
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the W Montreal last year and loved it, we were excited to be staying at one of its counterparts in NYC. The lobby was large and typically funky (although there were no 'greeters' and no one offering free bottled water like they were when we checked into the W Montreal), but the room was a major disappointment. We'd booked a 'Spectacular' room on one of the upper floors, which was really stretching the definition of the word. A bed (not a big one by US standards), a small desk, chair, a TV and a bathroom - that was pretty much it, and the decor didn't even feel particularly modern as you'd expect from the W chain. And then there was the connecting door to the room next door, which meant that we could hear the TV/conversations/snoring from our (unknown) neighbours, which was especially annoying when the latest occupants (who were thankfully only staying for one night) arrived back at 4am on Saturday night and started shouting and partying with no concern for any other guests. The maid service was not great - we used both disposable and normal glasses for water on the first night/day and these were never replaced. The plus points: we ate breakfast one morning in the hotel's restaurant, Heartbeat, which was delicious - and the staff on the reception and concierge desks were unfailing helpful and friendly (although isn't a concierge meant to help you get theatre tickets? Ours just told us where to queue for the TKTS booth!). The hotel location was pretty good too - a short walk to Central Park in one direction and to the Rockefeller Plaza in the other. It was also useful to have an iron & ironing board in the room. Would definitely never stay at this hotel again and I'll be doing some serious research before spending my money with the W chain in the future. Hopefully this W is not representative of the overall brand and the W Montreal is more like the way their hotels are meant to be...

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative review. This hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: scotti1340
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this website I had very low expectations and was expecting to be staying in a broom cupboard surrounded by grumpy hotel staff - the experience was quite the opposite. We were greeted at the entrance by concierge who helped us with our bags and directed us to Gloria on reception who could not have been more helpful. We stayed in room 440 (a superior room just along from the spa so the lobby smelt devine!) and the room was more than adequate for space (it has a plasma tv on the wall so no issue with the large tv that everyone said took up 1/2 the room!) The bathroom was small but what a brilliant shower (I want one installed at home) and the beauty products were excellent. They were so nice and refreshing that I had to buy some larger packs from the spa shop downstairs. The comfy bed and pillows were just like being at home so I had some really restful sleeps (not usual when you stay away from home). The hotel is definately for the young and funky (or just the young at heart) . There is always cool music greeting you as you walk into the hotel and in the lifts. Whiskey Blue is great along with the living room bar adjacent to the reception. Comfy sofas, lovely ambience, etc. Their motto is whatever, whenever and they really do stick to it.
