They were so accommodating and nice and I will definately be returning to this hotel as I could not fault it. Who needs a huge room in New York? You only sleep and shower in it because there is so much to do you haven't got time to sit in your room all day! The location is by far one of the best in New York for tourists as all the major attractions are in easy walking distance and as a non-local I felt safe day and night walking around the city (obviously I don't mean central park at night!). I had a wonderful 4 day experience in New York and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PBDC
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W Hotel (Lexington Ave) and were disappointed. I'm okay with the small rooms, even at the higher level we are in Starwood's membership level, since the only thing I do in a hotel room is sleep and shower. With that expectation the shower and bed need to be good. Unfortunately the shower had no water pressure. My wife refused to wash her hair for fear she'd never ger the soap out. It was a lousy shower! The bed was wobbly. Every time I or my wife turned over the whole bed would move. Get a screwdirver and wrench and tighten the thing up! Two lousy nights of sleep. The lobby scene is always fun at any W and this one is no exception. As long as you're not in the room it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JRaff527
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews for the W New York, I had very low expectations. However, I was pleasantly surprised upon my arrival. I have stayed in many hotels in every US major city and this W definitely measured up. Our check-in was prompt, but the first room we were given reeked of cigarette smoke. We went downstairs immediately to tell the front desk. The attendant gave us a little bit of unnecessary attitude, but quickly assigned us a new room. The rooms were small, but since we were in NYC, we were expecting this. Linens were clean, bathroom was clean, and as everyone else mentioned, the best part was the Bliss products! Overall, we had a positive experience. I wouldn't say it's the best hotel I have ever stayed in, but definitely well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish customer service”
Reviews.Author: pixie08London
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in the W hotel on Lexington for 4 days and can honestly say it was the worst customer service I have ever experienced. Their motto is 'whatever you want, whenever' but this is laughable. On arrival we had to lug our own suitcases from the taxi up to the hotel room (bellboys were there but didn't assist us). We then had to ask to be moved rooms as had booked a 'spectacular suite' which turned out to be a small room with a small double bed - too small for two friends too share. We were moved from the 15th floor down to the third - same size room but with two singles. We couldn't open the windows at night to get fresh air due to the street noise and the air con was really noisy. Also, the lock on our door was broken so the keys wouldn't work. This meant that every time we wanted to get into our room we had to stand around and wait for security to come and help us. Three times we were told that the door had been fixed and each time it wasn't. We asked for compensation for this (had paid about Â£150 per room per night up front before arrival) and were offered a measly Â£50 to spend only in the bar of the hotel. And they even forgot to take this off our final room bill when we checked out! In general the hotel staff were rude and completely unhelpful. There were a few exceptions - such as the concierge and the doorman of the 'Whiskey room' bar but everyone else we came across treated us terribly (including the girl behind the bar who ignored us for 10 minutes when we were trying to get a drink and then snapped at us that it was last orders and the two women on reception when we checked out who right in front of us talked about us to each other in Spanish). It was almost like a scene from Faulty Towers! This is a prime example of style over substance - a place that looks great but fails to deliver. I will never stay in another W hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad for a W”
Reviews.Author: heatherpie
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here on a girls weekend. The lobby is totally W style so I was excited. I've stayed at the W in Dallas which was a completely different experience (in a good way). We get off on our floor and cant find our room bc there are no room directions on the wall. I've never heard of a hotel that doesnt have room directions on the wall. Anyway, we walk into the room and laugh. It was so small. I understand we were in Manhattan, but come on. My friend and I were bumping into each other the entire time we were there. There wasnt enough room to move around each other. It was that small. But OK whatever we're here to see the city not sit in our room. We had to call two of the three nights for housekeeping. They didnt replenish the water or toilet paper the first night. Second night it was six oclock and our room still hadnt been serviced. The floors were noticably filthy and the wall paper in the bathroom was peeling. The air conditioner unit was a joke. It was old, loud and sounded like it was dripping. THe spa experience wasnt much better. I schedule a mani/pedi and they tell me that I will be with two different ladies and since they have a 24 hour cancellation policy I can not cancel or i will be charged. I go get my pedi first, which wasnt the hour it said or anything special. Then I have to leave the spa and go to the gift shop to get my mani. I sat down there for 45 minutes before I was seen. All they were willing to do was give me some product. Seriously at this point I was no longer interested in my manicure, but again whatever. I was very disappointed in the W new york. I would not stay there again or recommend it to anyone for any reason. The bar was lame too.

Reviews.Title: “To W or not to W!”
Reviews.Author: g1wzwnd
Reviews.Content: W hotel on Lexington Ave gets a perfect A for staff, location and bathroom toiletries, everything else is a B at best. The room I got for $375 a night (mind you is NY) was very small even by Japanese standards. The bed was hard for my taste, towels are small, there is no plasma TV, very few cable channels, a cheap iron an ice maker on the floor which did not work and many trays of finished meals outside each door. The bar downstairs is VERY expensive but nice and clean. Again, go there and the staff, they are nice, polite and very honest (the doorman found my IPod in the cab and returned it to me) and the location is also fantastic. Everything else can use an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Welly Wotten”
Reviews.Author: DavidDC
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel expecting the level of service you might receive at other W hotels, or even at a Motel 6. While the room and facilities were fine, the service was, to put it mildly, abysmal. At 9 am each day, you can hear the person responsible for the mini bar knocking on each door, loudly announcing "MINI BAR," slamming doors, and chatting with the housekeeping staff. Each day of a 4 day stay, I was asked by the housekeeping staff "checking out today?" When I said no, I was asked when my partner would be leaving the room for it to be cleaned. An answer of "10 minutes" was routinely greeted by a sigh and rolling of the eyes. A request to change rooms, which was confirmed by the front desk, and by phone the day of, was not honored. Apparently there was a miscommunication among the staff. When I confronted the manager about it, I was treated to significant amounts of "corporate speak" in which I was informed that I had met "challenges" during my stay. I didn't meet "challenges;" the hotel made "mistakes." While the manager tried to make things better, a $50 voucher for breakfast doesn't do much good when breakfast for two is over $60. The coup d grace came a week later when two separate sets of letters and DVDs failed to make it to their recipients. A call to the hotel simply elicited the response "we deliver all mail to the post office, we're not responsible for what happens to it after that." Amazingly, after 5 years of Netflix, this would be the one time that the post office misplaced 3 separate DVDs. This level of service is not indicative of W hotels in general, which have been great. In terms of rooms, you should request a room on a renovated floor. The unrenovated floors, on which I stayed, are decorated, as a nice Texan on the elevator put it: "as if by some housewife who picked up some stuff at Target."

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not for families”
Reviews.Author: bpym
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location, great food, great staff - and a fun lobby/lounge experience on the main floor. However, although I am a Starwood member, I don't usually stay at W hotels, so was not completely attuned to the fact that the rooms and style are designed for younger couples, singles and business travelers, not for families traveling with children. I was with my two daughters, aged 11 and 14, and although they thought the hotel was great - they loved the brownies in the lobby in the PM and the lounge scene - we did not really fit in the room comfortably since each room only has one bed. We got a rollaway cot eventually, but I am used to having the two double or queen beds in the Sheratons e.g., so was brought up short when I first saw we were supposed to all sleep in one slightly smallish queen sized bed. The staff was great at responding to my quandary here, but I think the hotel website could have been clearer about what was REALLY in each room in terms of sleeping space. On the other hand, we really enjoyed ourselves on the East Side, and loved being so close to the subway, to Fifth Ave. and Central Park. Also loved the Japanese restaurant right around the corner...

Reviews.Title: “Fine...not awesome, but fine.”
Reviews.Author: RachelRenee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W a few weeks ago and it was fine. The lobby was nice, as was the bar (although VERY expensive, but it is NYC so you sort of expect that). Check in was quick, and we were able to get into our room early. Our room (a wonderful room, I think), was small...but honestly, it didn't matter because we hardly were in our room except to sleep. For two people it was the perfect size. The smell...well, that's another story. We don't smoke and I guess we should have asked for a non-smoking room because it smelled like there was some serious chain-smoking going on before we got there. We called the whatever/whenever line an got an Ozone machine, which helped a bit. Looking back, we probably should have gotten another room, but it was fine. Can't beat the location. We like to walk, so had no problem walking to Times Square, the theatre district and Central Park. Bottom line - don't expect a spacious suite if you reserve a wonderful room, and ask for non smoking...but it is totally fine to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but adequate”
Reviews.Author: kkyh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip for 2 nights in November 2007. Overall, for such a short stay i found it convenient and close to restaurants, shopping and my office. However, the rate is pretty expensive for such a tiny room (even by NYC standards) and similar to other reviews, I found most of the hotel's efforts have been spent on the lobby and bar with not much left for the rooms. Given the convenience of the hotel I would probably stay here again while on business but on a personal trip, I'd probably go somewhere more comfortable and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: kristineLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W the first weekend of February. The staff were very nice and helpful upon check in which was the extent of my interaction with the staff other than the occasional hello as I walked in. I had a queen size room on the 8th floor with a view of a parking lot. Given the amount of space we are working with here, I would have to say they did a good job decorating to try and make the room seem bigger. Overall, no complaints about the appearance/cleanliness of the room except that it is a bit smallish. Very little space for luggage and packages. Also, the walls ARE a bit thin. My neighbors were having sex next door and I could hear them quite clearly at 3:30, 4:30, and 8:30 a.m. The bathroom is typically small with some water temperature issues. The hot water came out of the sink VERY hot immediately, while it took me a while to figure out the shower. I couldn't get the water hot enough. I finally realized that if I pointed the knob towards COLD, I could actually get hot water. Best thing about the bathroom is probably the Bliss products.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK at the W”
Reviews.Author: atlanta.david
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on business. Was given a 14th floor room, "Spectacular" type room (last stay I was in "Cozy" = very small). Comfortable room for 1. I would still pack your earplugs the outside traffic is still loud, room/bathroom was in good upkeep and clean. Housekeeping does a good job. Staff was friendly and efficient. Fast coffee in the AM and easy to get a cab. Bell service is on the top of their game. Just be sure to check those room charges both myself and coworker were charged erroneously for the honor bar. Front desk quickly took care of that at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms, good staff”
Reviews.Author: linda528
Reviews.Content: This W really is not up to snuff. Rooms and baths are small, which is expected in NYC, but also shabby and outdated. It's as though all the attention has been lavished upon making a cool lobby and bar. The staff is very helpful, however--it's just that a renovation is desperately needed.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent NYC Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Trover
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many reviews, so I will try and stick with the salient points. I think the bottom line is that whether you have a good hotel experience here depends significantly on how much you are paying. I've stayed at all of the other W's in NYC and this W (surprisingly since it is the original W) has less of the "W" vibe than the others. The location is reasonably convenient. Close to a number of subway lines and within walking distance of midtown shopping. Lexington Avenue is also an easy place to pick up taxi's heading downtown. This is an older property and the rooms are very small. Do not waste money on a suite. You will be disappointed. Similarly I would not book a room here expecting to spend a significant time in it (or the hotel). I like the W, however, when compared to a similarly mid or lower-priced (for NYC) hotel that doesn't offer any sense of fun or style. Is the style of the W getting a little old and in need of refreshing? Perhaps. But it is still better than many of the typical main-line brands. Again, this is a great place to stay if you want to be in mid-town, don't mind a small room (which is not atypical for NYC), and aren't paying a significant bundle - if your expectations are in check this place is likely to fit the bill. Other points - had a mistake on the mini-bar and didn't have a problem having it removed the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: SharpLily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon. The good things: the lobby is lovely. It was a rainy night and the lobby bar is cozy with a great fireplace and good drinks. The room service was also good, and staff is friendly and helpful. There are great Bliss products in the bathroom. With that said, it is SO not worth the $600/night for a room. We travel a lot and have stayed in hotels all over the world. This room was the WORST. They "upgraded" us to a room with a "view." The room itself was teeny tiny and completely run down. The Ikea looking furniture was stained and tattered. There were errant wires coming out of the wall. It was all-around a sad and pathetic feeling in the room, and I cannot imagine having to stay there for more than one night. If you're going to pay the money (even half what we paid!) please stay somewhere on the West Side or Downtown. There are too many great places in NYC to stay somewhere so run down.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Not Usual W Hotel Standard - Stay at Times Sq”
Reviews.Author: Gibbo320
Reviews.Content: Arrived with high expectations after staying at other W Hotels in NYC. First room was in need of a make over with water stained light shade and threadbare carpet and paint scuffed on the window sill. Add to that renovations taking place outside the room too we moved. Second room - little better - still very small but clean and tidy. We ordered the celebration pack but this was not given on arrival and had to ask for it, but was told we had to ring different numbers to get the items. Disappointing and not the stay we hoped for given our previous experiences... Location though is superb

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms need some work!”
Reviews.Author: mullaghley
Reviews.Content: The W hotels look great from their web-site, and whilst the public areas succeeded in being cool and hip the rooms clearly didn't. Ok, so size is at a premium in NYC, but the rooms are small. The bathrooms too are very small. Our room was poorly lit, with light fittings missing lights . We asked for a desk lamp to give us some more light, this was still insufficient. The room was very clean, the Bliss products are great and the staff were very friendly and efficient, but the bottom line is that the rooms are in no way comparable to the public areas nor to the pitch of W hotels. The marketing drive is to go the extra mile, but they need more than a mile with the worn, tired and frankly drab decor. All the 'extras' that they purport to offer are available only at a steep price - wi-fi, DVD's, in-room offerings. We did pay for the wi-fi and the signal was next to useless. The only bonus for the W New York is the perfect location to get to all the mid-town treats - Rockerfeller, Fifth Ave., etc.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirstibabie
Reviews.Content: The W hotel is the only hotel I stay at in New York City. I travel a lot and from personal experience i definitely recommend the W hotel! The staff were very friendly and energetic, the rooms were always clean. And you cant beat the BLISS products they give you in the hotel rooms! They are awesome! I wont ever stay anywhere else in NYC but the W hotel! People complain about the rooms but PLEASE its NYC!!! Every hotel in NYC will have the same size rooms......

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gordo_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Year's eve. I had Starwood points and was able to secure a room essentially for free. Check in was very quick, and our room was a decent size (for NYC). We had a queen bed with pretty nice bedding. The bathroom was on the small side, but looked as if it had been remodelled recently. The room and bathroom were both very clean. Bathroom came equipped with Bliss spa products which were pretty nice as well. Location of the hotel was great, close to a subway line and very close to Radio City Music Hall where we were going to a concert that night. The bellmen outside were very courteous and helped us get a cab very quickly both times we needed one. After we came back from the concert we stopped in the hotel's night club, around 3 am. It was still packed with people but we were able to get drinks quickly. We hung out for a bit, but then took our drinks to our room as it was pretty late. The staff at the club were all very polite. Overall, a good stay. We've stayed at a few NYC hotels and have had some bad experiences, but not this time. If you're looking for a decent room in a central location for a few nights, this is your place, especially if you can use your Sheraton points!

Reviews.Title: “This is it?”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: The whole stay, I found myself thinking "This is it?" We were there over the New Year holiday and everything else in New York was about as great as it could be. The only negative we experienced the whole time we were there was our hotel. I dreaded going back to the W. I usually love the W, so this hotel was a disappointment. My friends have recently stayed at the Marriott just down the street and I wish I had too. It makes me very sad to say that, but it's the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Vibe, Desperately Needs Update”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: This is a fun place to stay, yet like many say, it is very worn, VERY! It is hard to believe Starwood would let the flagship W get so worn out. Old TV's and carpeting look funny in a place trying to be hip. The bar is fun downstairs, lobby is cool, and the staff is helpful. Rooms are super small, so they need to make every effort to renovate the heck out of this place to make it worth several hundred a nite...

Reviews.Title: “BARBIE sized - stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: torav
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference so we didn't have a choice where we stayed - If you do have a choice - choose another hotel. My husband put it best - it's Barbie sized! The rooms are TOO small. We shuffled around trying not to bump into each other! Our bathroom only had a shower - no tub and the beds are queen-sized and not very comfortable. It seems the more you pay for a property the less you get. No coffee in the room - 2 in the lobby will set you back $7.00. For the price, I'd rather be at the Omni - which was less actually.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in NYC, Great Location for Mid & Uptown”
Reviews.Author: DianeLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent service staff and very good restaurant and social scene. Located on 49th and Lex so very good for mid and uptown activities with Soho being a 10 minute taxi ride. The W has built a brand on urban chic and this is totally true, their whatever, whenever concept does work. One small issue, indicative of hotels in NYC, very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hair and barking dogs”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTVtraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and have years of hotel experience but this takes the cake. The W has to be the most horrible hotel I've stayed in in years. Staryed for 3 nights...first room had torn wallpaper, hair on the floors and "short hairs" on the Bliss products and pictures ripped form the wall with holes showing. Second room not much better with a barking dog next door...for 2 nights...and managemant said they could do nothing about it. Unresponsive management with an attitude. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Room was too small, hotel itself quite nice. Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: gjck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great area for sightseeing in Manhatten. Hotel itself was very nice with nice decor. Lounge was excellent. restaruant far too expensive even for breakfast. Rooms were small and cramped and a bit old/run down for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not the W hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: xxqsme
Reviews.Content: The W hotel chain has created a magnificent marketing brand. When you set food in the lobby of the W at Lex and 49th the brand is perfectly on display with its energenic and busy bar to its sleek and ever so cool front desk. One can't help but think that this is "the place" to stay and be seen in midtown Manhatten. Wrong. It all ends with and in the lobby. Past the lobby this W hotel might as well be a highway motel. The rooms are old, not particularly clean, dark, bleak and just plain worn out. The photos someone else posted are accurate. There are at least 3 better hotels, The Marriott, DoubleTree and Waldorf Astoria, in the same area. What the W does well in other cities is not duplicated here. The was our first and last visit and was based on an American Express promotion. We will and you should stay elsewhere. You know, one would think someone with Starwood would review the comments on this page and act. That speaks volumes for Starwood and its new CEO.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Hip NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: JAR303
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a four-day, three night extended pre-holiday weekend. I really didn't have the issues that so many previous reviewers had. I've stayed at several other properties in the W chain, so I was eager to try the original, flagship property on Lexington Ave. I wasn't disappointed - as I had a great room and great service in all aspects. I really enjoy the attitude and theming of all of the W hotels (each property is very unique, but the general philosophy and experience is consistent), and if you go in expecting that experience, you won't be disappointed. Spend some time exploring the W Hotels web site before you book a stay at a W. If the vibe isn't one that pleases you, you may want to go elsewhere. The look and style of the W New York was great - I loved the "elements" theming of water, fire, earth. I guess that lots of people just don't 'get it', but it is so nice to live your life as art, which is what W seems to be trying to do. I was most impressed by the friendliness and attitudes of the bell staff, the welcome desk staff, and everyone else that I encountered at the W, and everyone appearred energetic and professional. I love how W staff consistently try to treat you as a friend or associate - they seem interested in your story - what makes you unique - and I'm sure that isn't an easy stance to pull off in a large, big city hotel like the W New York - but they do suceed, and if you willing participate in the relationship, you'll have a great time. I was very fortunate to be upgraded to a corner suite, - the room was lovely, with a seperate bedroom and sitting room. and a large bathroom with combo tub/shower. All things in the room were fine and in working condition, the bed, linens, and Bliss products were decadent. I took breakfast three days at the Heartbeat restaurant, which was nice, in a very lovely setting. The restaraunt was closed in afternoon/evenings for some upgrades and remodeling, so I didn't get to try any other meals than breakfast - but since there are so many wonderful options in NYC, this certainly wasn't viwed as a problem. I also had a fabulous time at the Bliss Spa, it gives a vibe very similar to that of the W. Also had a great holiday cocktail in the Living Room where I chatted with some interesting and convivial people - just like a hotel lobby should be for. The W Hotel offered nice treats throughout the day in the Living Room area(chocolate kisses, brownies, blondies, hot cider, etc.). Security was very evident in the hotel in the evenings, so I think anyone would feel secure staying here. I'm really puzzled by all of the bad press that this place gets on this web-site. I suppose that people are just turned off by the overall vibe of the place, or perhaps are craving that "brand new" look and feel of typical corporate chain hotels. For me, I continue to really enjoy the 'warmth of cool" spirit that the W offers, a wonderful respite for all the senses and for the human spirit. This hotel was instrumental for a fabulous weekend in NYC. I defintitely wouldn't hesitate to return, - in fact, I'm looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Suited our purpose”
Reviews.Author: MoTown
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) booked this hotel through Hotwire for just a one-night visit, and i was a little nervous after reading through the reviews. BUT...it ended up suiting our purpose just fine, as we were just looking for a place to store our packages while we galavanted around town and for a comfortable bed after the pub. I think we ended up paying about half the normal rate...i quite possibly would have been disgruntled had i paid more than $300. Please note: when you book this hotel on Hotwire you automatically get a "Cozy" "Smoking" room. Smoking? Do they even still HAVE that? Anyway, we were not amused but they were kind enough to move us to non-smoking rooms so all was well. Size of rooms: Yes, they're small. We're from NJ so we only had an overnight bag with us...therefore, we didn't have any difficulties w/ storage. At check in, the woman said she had one "Cozy" and one "Wonderful", so we flipped for them and then spent 15 minutes accusing each other of cheating when we couldn't tell the two rooms apart. I would not want to stay here for a more than a day or two! Upkeep: didn't notice any issues with damage or wearing to the decor, although the TV and TV stand were very obviously from 1954. Well, maybe 1994, but same thing. Shower worked fine, bed was small but comfortable...the sheets were soooooo soft. You could hear a little noise through the windows (we were on 9th floor), but it didn't bother me...lullaby of the city and all that. Misc1 - Elevator: you have to use your keycard before you can push a button, and i think we had to rely on the kindness of strangers each and every time. Try not to use the elevators in an advanced stage of inebriation, or at least make sure there are kind strangers around. Misc2 - LobbyBar: fancy and hoppin', but i wouldn't pay for a drink there again. We could go a few blocks away and pay $6/pint for an extremely wide variety of beers, or pay $10 for a small glass of house red that tasted like it had been open since March. During the day, the lobby is a great place to hang out and read their fancy coffee table books, and the fireplace is a nice touch. Misc3: Bliss products in bathroom were great, location was good if you want to be near 5th Ave, Rockefeller, St. Pat's, etc. Service - N/A, as we tote our own bags and hail our own cabs anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but overpriced for poor quality”
Reviews.Author: pv24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for business/pleasure for 3 nights. The location was great! But the hotel itself was not the best experience. We experienced the following problems: * Extremely SMALL rooms * Heating system was not working and had to be replaced * Wallpaper in bathroom was peeling * Caulking around toilet was yellow/brown * Lights in the bathroom were faulty * There were holes in the wall of the bedroom * The carpet was dirty When we checked out, we mentioned some of the problems we experienced and the front desk staff was not overly concerned. I have heard such good things about the W Hotels and was shocked at the quality of the room and the lack of interest by the staff. It is hard to justify how a hotel can charge over $500 a night for such poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “real funky”
Reviews.Author: tobey4
Reviews.Content: we stayed hear as a family. I had picked this based on recommendations from work travel agents as the place they put people from work in central new york. having read the descriptions on trip advisor I thought it would be good but was a bit unsure if it would be OK with the kids. They thought it was great. They were impressed with the funky layout and the rooms. The staff were helpful and friendly. Location was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: psu86
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 days on business/leisure. Pro's: Great Location! 3 blocks from 5th ave, across from Waldorf Very Friendly staff Free hershey kisses Nice bath products Cons: Small Small Small rooms Expensive Not enough outlets in room Crazy busy check in

Reviews.Title: “Small and outdated, good location”
Reviews.Author: yiasas
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this location for business and have to say it was one of the least impressive hotels I've stayed in (and I travel for work 100+ days per year) for the cost. The outdated heating and cooling system woke me several times per night during my stay, as it was VERY noisy. The room itself was very small (yes, yes I understand this is NYC but VERY small - even by New York standards) and also did not have easy access to a power source, which is a consideration if you are planning to work in your room at all. In order to plug my laptop computer into the power source, I had to fish the AC adapter around the wall and into the bathroom (not an easy task). The rooms need to be updated and to the W Chain's credit, I've heard they will be updating all Ws in NYC in the coming years. If you are just looking for location, this is a fabulous midtown location... but there are far better hotel choices in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, rooms small”
Reviews.Author: KingTito
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small but I suppose this goes with the territory as it is New York. The rooms are also a bit worn out and in need of refinishing. The lobby is great and the restaurant is very good. The lounge is very comfortable and seems to be a popular meeting place. The proximity to local shopping is great. The staff is quite helpful but requiring me to pay $2 for Advil seems a big much. I assume this is a policy issue and not a staff issue. The gym is wonderful for a hotel gym. Nice free weights, very clean, plenty of cardio machines. This by itself could elevate my ranking to an above average but the rooms knock it down a rung. Overall, I will stay there again just for the gym.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BUDDIE115
Reviews.Content: Having booked a prepaid rate which I could not cancel and then reading reviews I was not looking forward to my stay, however i was pleasantly surprised. We had 2 spectacular rooms booked and were allocated one on 11th and one on 16th floor. As per everyones comments the rooms were compact but for the time we spent in the room this was not a problem. Our rooms were in pretty good condition and were very clean with everything you could need including safe, cd, dvd, iron & board and mini bar. Locaion is great and plenty of deli's nearby and a starbucks just opposite for coffees and snacks. I would agree room service is expensive and also the lounge, although there is a great atmosphere, Heartbeat for breakfast was good value and very good. I found all the staff I came across to be helpfull and efficient and would certainly return to the hotel. I believe they are starting a refurb in January which will not increase the size of the rooms but should certainly make a difference to decor etc.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm, Form over Function”
Reviews.Author: imike
Reviews.Content: Well, After the mixed reviews on here I was unsure what to expect. Definitely this hotel suffers from form over function, and I'd say pretentious without good cause. It's really trying hard to be something it's not. The room like most have said on here is small. We had a 'Wonderful' room which was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in - smaller even than one in Paris I stayed in. The room was incredibly dark with poor lighting. There was no WiFi in the room at all, only paid for 'Wired' internet connection which was $7 for 30 minutes or $15 for 24 hours. Also there was no free WiFi in the lobby. The lobby is nice but like a cave - quite dimly lit. The guest information booklet resembles a brick that fans out with information on cards. It really is form over function - quite difficult to read. Room service was really expensive. A cup of tea from room service is $6 plus $4.50 delivery charge + Tax (8 odd %) + mandatory gratuity of 17% ! I didn't bother with room service in the end there's a Starbucks one block down and a few good deli style places handy to eat at. The inroom toiletries are quite nice - all in the Bliss range. They are restocked everyday. The bed + pillows were very comfortable. The desk was a bit shabby, much of the varnish has come off. The shower was OK, although water would go over the floor - mopped up however by the plentiful supply of towels which were changed everyday - around 6 towels a day. On the whole the staff were quite friendly, I got a later checkout (+1 hour) for free, and the concierge helped me to check if the show I'd booked had been cancelled due to the strike or not. I paid $300 per night and my room was on floor 6. The hotel is just OK, or acceptable. I won't stay here again. Not because they hotel did anything to upset me, but more because I think there are nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise after reading the reviews”
Reviews.Author: milacik21
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and booking room for $410/night during what seemed the busiest week in NYC, I felt a little uneasy about spending so much money for what seemed as a sub par hotel. I stayed in starwood hotels before and had nothing but good experience before so I decided to take a chance and I'm glad I did because my stay was good and I did not have any problems. When we arrived, it was raining and cold so it was nice to see complimentary cookies and tea in the area near elevators. The room was small, but clean and so was the bathroom. The beds were a little shaky (had 2 twins) and one of the lamps did not work. This was promptly fixed when we called. The next day for some reason the lamp did not work again and we just could not be bothered to call again since we only stayed one more night. Other than that we were happy with our stay and I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again or recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt stay here again unless I got a really cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: lovesublime
Reviews.Content: I had been scouring the internet looking for a good rate for a Friday night in the city. Finally I found one for a 4* hotel in midtown. I wouldnt know which hotel until I booked it, figuring it would be the Waldorf or Marriott East side or something of that caliber. I figured any 4* hotel for under $300 would be great. Upon receiving my confirmation from hotwire I found out Id be staying at the W. Immediately I hopped over to trip advisor and read the plethora of bad reviews. I was disappointed, but decided to go with an open mind. We entered the hotel at 6pm on Friday night and the lobby/bar area was abuzz with people enjoying happy hour. It was more like a night club than a hotel lobby with loud thumping music. But thats a W for you, trendy and exciting. We were checked in immediately. I noticed many people said the staff was rude. I wouldnt say rude but we werent greeted with a smile thats for sure. The concierge was much friendlier. Went up to the 5th floor and its like a labrynith..nooks and crannies and dark, dim hallways. We found our room and prepared for the worst. The room itself was not bad. But it WAS small. VERY small. There was MAYBE 1 foot of space in between the bed and the shoddy TV cart. There was a large closet with plenty of hangers, a small desk and chair. The bed was also very small. No way was it a queen size. I think it was a full size because I have a queen at home and this was smaller. But the carpet was clean, the wallpaper was not peeling. It reeked of smoke and air freshener. I wish I could have just opened the window to air it out but obviously we couldnt open the window. Instead we turned on the fan which really did nothing. The room was rather dark also, even with all the lights on. The bathroom was very clean and had plenty of towels and I loved the Bliss Spa toiletries. Since I only stayed here 1 night (left the room at 7pm and didnt return until 2am) I really didnt care but if I were staying several nights on vacation I would have asked for a non smoking room or stayed somewhere else. if youre only going to be in the city for a night, and just need a place to crash, and get a good rate, and dont care about service or space, then the W is fine. But there are so many fantastic hotels in the city I really see no need to stay here otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Experience!! I mean Horrid!”
Reviews.Author: lechillura
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I used to stay at this hotel monthly. I am a big starwoods points client and decided for this vacation after not being there a few yrs, to go back. I talked this hotel up for months to my boyfriend who was so excited and expecting a lot. I was expecting what it USED to be. I work for the govt so booked a govt rate. I sent all of my paperwork via fax ahead of time as I should not be travelling with badge if I am not working. We arrive to the hotel and the front desk associate was just plain nasty. I stood there for 15 mins while she completed a call. I was patient and excited to get upstairs and relax before heading out. I go to check in and she tells me the hotel never received my govt badge copy even tho I called 4 times to confirm. After 1 hour at the front desk, she tells me in a loud, rude voice that by Sunday at checkout I better be able to provide my badge. Hmm well considering it was in my office back in Florida, that wasn't going to happen. I instead had to sit on the phone with work for an hour trying to get a letter from Human Resources verifying info. Waste of life... She had a massive attitude and gives me our keys. We go up to our room and I just laughed. It was a TINY room facing a massive AC Unit and was a handicap room. There were cigarette burns all over the carpet. The bathroom was dirty, the wallpaper peeling off the wall and desk had dents all over it with cigarette burns. The whole room Reeeeked of smoke as well. The rates on the back of the door were wayyyy less than I paid. My boyfriends face at that point just deflated. I told him to wait, I called back down and told them in no way were staying there. 2 hrs later I was told we had 2 options.. both bad options but I opted for one. The view was better but the room was not. Cigarette burns on furniture, wallpaper peeling, the drapes all frayed, no place to put luggage, no drawers and 2 hangers. Unbelievable. 1800 for what?!!! I will NEVER stay there again. I came back and noticed on my credit card statement that the woman STILL went ahead and charged me almost double even tho I jumped thru hoops verifying my govt ID. I complained and the manager called me at work once I returned. Did anything come of it? Just a sorry. I told him word of mouth is better than a sorry. Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else!!! It was funny, we went to the lobby bar for a drink one of the nights and even the bartender said the hotel has turned old and not worth it. Can't get any worse than from their own staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: StAntonJulie
Reviews.Content: Positives Location, location, location (you will note this is important from all my reviews!) Great lobby (if a party zone - wish I'd had more time to participate) Small, but nice room - given a twin which I was pleased about (was with a girl friend and whilst we don't mind sharing a double, a twin is a bit more private). Modern bathroom in the style of a wet room. Comfy bed Very helpful concierge Negatives Teeny weeny window and poor lighting so room constantly dark. Stupid oversized desk chair that just completely got in way of the bed, tv, wardrobe, door... Heating stuck on tropical (the engineers visited our friend's room to no avail). The bathroom floor was not level so the water didn't drain away properly in the wet room so there was a permanent puddle in the middle! Quite expensive but it is downtown manhattant

Reviews.Title: “Hoppin' spot”
Reviews.Author: climber_in_CH
Reviews.Content: We arrived Halloween evening and spent 3 nights in New York and the party in the lobby never seemed to end. We wished we had come down at 4 AM to see if the lounge emptied when we weren't looking! This did not make our room noisy but the lobby is not a restful refuge either. Because the room was a little warm, we left the window open a bit and I probably don't need to mention how noisy that was, even on the 11th floor. The room safe would not open and I was miffed that they would not fix that because they were going to renovate the room soon. The offer to store things in the front desk did not seem convenient and when one is paying over $450 a night for a room, expectations are raised. We were upgraded from a 'cozy room' and I went back down to the desk to confirm that as the room was so small. I have often stayed in larger rooms in Europe! Friendly service, clean rooms in good repair at a location that worked well for us, its just had to justify the value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinOrla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant. I couldnt belive my eyes when I saw the size of the room. ( we stayed in a Mega Room) It was huge!! And you know how small hotel rooms in NY can be, but this was by far one of the biggest rooms I have ever stayed in, anywhere!!! I think we were extremely lucky to have a balcony, overlooking the Waldorf Astoria. That was the icing on the cake. Not every room had this bonus!! Even the complimentary toiletries were fab, from the hotels spa, Bliss. The bar in the lobby of this hotel do wonderful cocktails and the atmosphere from upstairs was perfect. It is in the perfect location, we walked to most atractions from there every day and took in all the sights and sounds from the city. The hotels concierge was the best I have ever come across, and recommended some really brilliant places to eat and drink. I cant recommend a better place to stay than the W Hotel, 49th and Lex!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can It Get Any Worse”
Reviews.Author: DMLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: In many respects the W New York (Lexington Ave) provided the worst hotel experience we have had in many years. Before recounting what went wrong or what is wrong with the hotel, I want to be fair with respect to the few good things that occurred during our stay. The bedding was excellent, the rooms were clean, the toweling high quality,and the staff courteous and helpful. We stayed on Starwood points and had taken a larger than normal room. for that locale. Now to the issues we encountered. 1. Our first "Mega room" (about the size of a normal hotel room elsewhere) had one tiny closet, a portion of which was filled with one of those hanging fabric shelves one buys at a closet shop. There were no chest of drawers, end table with drawers, or any other place to put things. 2. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling. 3. The air conditioning was noisy. 4. After being out the entire next day, we returned after dinner. My wife opened the door and got blasted by heat. Looking at the ceiling, we saw large globules of water just waiting to drop. It was close to 105 in the room and extremely humid. When we went to see the manager, we were told that they were aware of the problem and had already moved us to another comparable room. They apologized for the inconvenience and credited us a night's stay. During the move they managed to ruin my wife's handbag (their insurance will cover) and leave her reading glasses, which we found along with some other items that were missed. 5. The new room was on a lower floor and was much noisier. 6. Additionally, we couldn't turn off the heater, which was scalding hot. The third call to maintenance got that settled. 7. We had originally asked for an upgrade to a suite but were told, none was available, so still being unhappy, the next morning we told the front desk we wished to leave the hotel and be credited for our stay. At this point, they managed to find a suite for us, which was reasonably satisfactory. 8. However, the suite's bathroom was so small that there was no room for towel bars to hang towels. They were nicely set out over a heater in the bedroom, which also could not be turned off. As a regular traveler I have encountered problems at hotels from time to time; however, here there were just too many, and the fundamental way in which a room, rack rate about $500, was outfitted just makes no sense. If one travels for an overnight with no luggage, maybe it works. Certainly, the extreme crowds in the lobby at midnight suggest it may just be a mismatch of customer and vendor. I just wish I knew if this is the "W" or simply this one example.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely NOT Reccommended”
Reviews.Author: IRISHBOYDublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the W Hotel in the end of October 2007 for a week. Where do I start ? Arrived from the airport and was allocated the wrong kind of room even though we clearly had a reciept from our online reservation with a booking number and clear details of what we had booked. We were given a " Cosy Room" by mistake which was clearly not suitable for two people, when you put two cases into the room you could not even walk around the bed to navagate going to the closet size en suite. Nowhere to store your clothes either, there was only a closet where you could hang a few things and that had no light in it and you could not see into it. Eventually got put into my reserved room after a spat at reception where it took me three phone calls to get my proper room. The splendid room is not much better, tiny bathroom, very little room to manuevre around, no storeage space for cases, small closet with no light, scruffy brown carpets with stains, generally very very poor. I found reception to be not very helpful, I got the impression that they are probably inundated with complaints about room sizes etc so its probably part of the course with them afterall its not their fault. I have regretted not taking the complaints you see on this web site at face value. I now understand that the reservations about this hotel are mostly accurate to the experience we had, and as we were in New York with other couples who stayed here aswell. It is not a case of me being over critical as they all agreed and had the same comments to make as I have highlighted. This hotel is not cheap either in fact its extreemly bad value for what you get, average holiday Inn's are cleaner, more comfortable and rooms are far superior. You must take into account room sizes in New York are not big in comparison to European Hotels, but cleanliness and layout and facilities should be a given in a Four Star Hotel which know how to charge. I would not advise any of my friends to stay here, it my have a good address and a decent bar but its a shame that you pay good money to visit such a great city to have to stay in such medicore facitities with average service.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed; incredibly overrated”
Reviews.Author: lorenbc
Reviews.Content: Horribly overpriced,, tiny room, tinier bathroom with wimpy shower and pedestal sink, so no room to lay out cosmetics/shaving stuff. No dresser or drawers in room for folded clothes; just a hanging cloth shelf thing in the closet. Tiny round table as one nightstand, no lights next to bed (hanging fixtures over the bed, but insufficient light for reading). Will never stay here again; there are much better hotels in NYC for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mex467
Reviews.Content: I was extremely dissapointed by my recent stay. I was on business in NY for 6 nights and found very few redeeming qualities about the "W". The reception staff, while initially friendly during my check-in, was exceedingly rude when I came down with additional questions. In one instance, the woman at the desk, walked away from me when I was talking and this same woman picked up the phone and had a personal conversation another time I was waiting for assistance. I had to call down 3 times for a blow dryer, before one was received. I asked for help with my luggage on the way up, and they were "too busy". (I was one of two guests in the lobby). On my departure, I called for assistance, waited 30 minutes and ended up bringing it all down myself. The room (a "cozy" queen) was the smallest I've ever stayed in and it's shameful that they charge that price. The "living room" or lobby area bar is always packed with lots of "hip" people and not at all inviting to sit down for a drink. On Sunday at noon, we tried to get a Mimosa and had to talk to three people and finally a manager before someone would help us. The housekeeping staff is very pleasant and accomodating, the "car ambassadors" were helpful, and the concierge was pleasant- although moderately so, compared to other hotels. I am a frequent traveler and have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels. I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest, but would never return to this hotel. Overall, the staff is a little too impressed with themselves, are generally unhelpful and rude, the rooms are ridiculously small and the atmosphere in the lobby is unwelcoming. Their "whatever/whenever" motto was certainly nowhere in evidence with the service I received (or lack thereof). There were 12 of us staying here, from my company, and all of us had the same experience and won't be booking here again on future trips. The Bliss products are great though, and the Spa was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “my bathroom at home was larger than my room/bath combo”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaHonest
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the w in atlanta many times. the rooms there are fabulous. so i booked the w in new york for $500 per night. the room was ridiculous. the carpet was dirty, the bed horrible, and you had to stand to the side of the door to close the bathroom door. no joke - the combo room/bath is smaller than my bathroom at home. there was no place for your luggage, no storage space only a very tiny dark closet. the shower water did not drain properly - i could go on and on. my husband and i were so cramped that we were miserable. i called the desk for a larger room - none available the "wonderful room" is FAR from wonderful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wait for the Hotel's Remodel in 2008”
Reviews.Author: chermanator
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the W in midtown, and boy has this hotel been weathered and worn since 2005. We arrived on a busy Friday evening and it was a cattle call. No welcome, or anything! (And we had just come from the W in Montreal, which was amazing!). They put us in a really bad room on the 18th floor. The blower was broken and the constant noise was so irritating...no sleep! The chair in our room needed to be sent out to the Goodwill. The fabric was torn and frayed. No closet space...the entire thing was horrific! We asked to be relocated but the hotel was sold out and we got about 5 more square feet in another room. After three nights we spoke to the manager (because they said one wasn't available when we arrived) and the nice woman didn't want our experience to be so negative. She moved us to a suite on the "Bliss Spa Floor" and it was a 180 degree turn. Everything was wonderful, and clean, and smelled good, and there was no noise or crappy furniture. They explained to us that this hotel will get a facelift in January 2008, so I recommend that you request the Bliss floor, or try another one of their properties until the face lift is completed. Another thing...the cocktail waitresses in the lobby bar have major attitude! Go somewhere else if you want a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy the W”
Reviews.Author: Happiness333
Reviews.Content: I was concerned for my stay at the W Lexington after having read numerous Trip Advisor reviews that were less than complimentary. However, I went ahead and overall my stay was less than memorable, other than the less than friendly reception at the front desk. Unfortunately I was allocated to a smoking room when I suffer allergies to smoke. An hour later and two failed attempts to check in, one into a smoking room and the other occupied the situation was resolved when I finally reached a non smoking room. I don't consider myself to be a difficult guest but my concern lies with the uneccessary attitude of the agent and the time wasted.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it offers!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSP
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to NYC and I knew hotel rooms were small, but Wâ€™s was ridiculous!! My husband and I almost did not fit in the room with our luggage. The only place where I could open my luggage was on the bed! And what about the bathroom? To use the sink I had to leave bathroom door openedâ€¦Phone didnâ€™t work. Wi-fi connection (free of charge, but available only in the lobby) was incredibly slow. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Weak link in the W chain”
Reviews.Author: shinhanga
Reviews.Content: In an earlier life the current W New York was a 2 or 2.5 Star hotel, but W spiffed up the lobby, turned down the lights in the hallways upstairs so that you need a seeing eye dog to negotiate the place, attracted a crowd of trendy young "club" types to the bar (as well as a few hookers), and all of a sudden somebody gives it four stars? I guess I'm showing my age. We have stayed at other Ws, both in NYC and elsewhere, and generally I like them, but this one is the weak link in the W chain.

Reviews.Title: “W is for "Waste" as in what a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: LP20000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on Lexington for 1 night. Check-in was fine but the "spectacular room" the check-in person told me I had turned out to be only slightly bigger than a walk-in closet, had no view, no room safe and a broken message light, which meant i missed a message. The fan in the room was loud and kept turning on every 10 minutes, keeping me awake. Check out was slow and the person didn't even ask me how my stay was. The place looks better than it is. Completely over-rated and disappointing for almost $700 per night. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Kukusik
Reviews.Content: The rooms are terrible -- small, noisy, dirty... and all for the average price for $520 per night! I stayed here by myself on a business trip and my $600 room was so small that I couldn't get by without knocking something off... My other 5 colleagues have similar complaints... Wouldn't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for grown-ups...”
Reviews.Author: mcog
Reviews.Content: The rooms were too small for one person...even a very tiny person. Honestly, the elevator was about the same size as our room. The entire hotel is trying so hard to be "cool" that it's ridiculous. From lobby to restrooms, it's worn, torn and makes you want to run into the streets to escape. Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: moslejam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W New York a few times now, always over weekend during a business trip to the US. The W is a welcome change to the bland business hotels I stay in during the week. The rooms are small (but then most are in NYC) and it's expensive for what you get but I keep coming back. The service is good, the beds very comfortable and you do feel like you are staying in a boutique hotel. The bar is lively in the evenings. The hotels great midtown location is a strong draw for me. You can take a run from the hotel up to and around central park and there is good shopping nearby. My favorite streak house (Smith & Wollensky) is right behind the hotel. If you just want a room and don't plan to use the hotel's other facilities then price is a bit steep. I'd recommend the Doubletree next door, the rooms are not far off the W's and the price is usually about $75 a night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: docschus
Reviews.Content: My friend and I and our two daughters stayed at the W Hotel on Lexington for a two-night stay and were very pleased with the service, the food, and the accommodations. From the moment we pulled up to the front door, there was a doorman available to open our car doors and to take our luggage out of the car and taken directly to our room. We proceeded to the front desk where we anticipated our room would not be ready since we arrived a couple hours prior to check-in time. We were pleasantly surprised to see our room was ready. We proceeded to our room; and while a little small, it was able to accommodate a cot, which was immediately brought to us at our request. Since most of our time from morning to night was spent sightseeing, we did not object too much with the small size of the room since it was primarily being used for sleeping . The staff was consistently pleasant and accommodating. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant each morning, and the food was very good as was the service. If I had to make one suggestion, it would be that the waiter inform the customer in advance that there is a charge ($8?) for the full-size glass of orange juice, which he offered and poured at the time of seating and prior to any food order being taken leading us to believe it was complimentary. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job of maintaining the room, providing additional bath towels, and ensuring the complimentary Bliss products in the bathroom were replenished. The queen-size bed was very comfortable. Serving cucumber water in the lobby was a nice touch, and the bar was always "hopping." I would definitely make it a point to stay at this hotel on my future visits to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: acwud
Reviews.Content: This is the feedback I sent to the W New York hotel Manager. ============================================== Hello. I stayed at your W New York over the Labor Day weekend and I wanted to provide some feedback. The location and lobby are very nice, and the services of the WW concierge outstanding. My main issues are really with the room I was assigned: 1211. I am used to the small NY hotel rooms, but not to unkempt and worn out rooms, especially at a W hotel. This is a $300 plus room and not worthy of the many hard-earned points I redeemed for this 2 nights in this room. Here are some of the issues you should please try to fix for future guests: Torn furniture Chipped/paint worn cabinets/fridge case Loose wall paper Discolored/Worn out carpet Chipped and worn out doors I am attaching pictures of my assigned room.. and I have to say these conditions are truly discouraging and not up to my expectations of a W Hotel or any worthy hotel for that matter. We also had to ask that out shower curtain be changed 3 times upon arrival as each one had a very humid/moldy smell and it just made the bathroom smell horribly. In addition the safe in the room was locked and security could not get it open, but advised me I could use one of the downstairs safes and to ask at the Front Desk. When I went to the Front desk I was told by the same security person that he had just checked and there were no safes available. My friend and I had to carry our personal papers, credit cards and money with us throughout our sightseeing trip in NY.. not a comfortable sensation. I stayed at the W Mexico City for 10 months and had an outstanding experience there. Currently I am determined not to go back to the W New York again. What's going on at the W New York? Should I assume that W Mexico City is the exception or W New York the exception? I am skeptical to book at a W Hotel again. I hope you can fix some of these things for future guests. After my experience I read the W New York reviews in TripAdvisor, something I neglected to do prior to my trip because of the blind trust I had in the quality of the W Hotels. I suggest you take a look at these reviews. One would get the impression that guests were talking about a roach hotel. Needless to say I will be adding my experience there too. Regards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Friendly Service - London”
Reviews.Author: love29travel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 5 day trip in New York and stayed at the W hotel at Lex Ave. Before leaving I read other reviews on the small rooms and run down hotel. My honest opinion is the room was very small and we did pay a high rate for it but the bed was very comfy and we slept so well. The air conditioning was slightly annoying as we couldn't seem to work it but we did not complain about it. There is enough hanging space for 2 people staying for a week and I did find the bathroom too small. I found it hard to get ready in the evening as the lighting was bad. The floor had a horrible musky smell but when we saw other floors they looked alot nicer. Make sure you do not stay on floor 11. Floor 9 looked alot nicer. I wouldn't let the bedroom put you off as the staff service was really very good. We had our passports stolen on the first day and they really did their best to help us. The two bars in the hotel were very nice with good service. On the last night I had steak and chips before leaving for the airport which cost Â£15 and was very nice for bar food. The security is amazing, you have to put your room key in the lift to access your level. This made us feel very safe as there are lots of meetings going on and people coming in all the time. Avoid this hotel if you require good access to computers. Although they have several computers only one had a working mouse so I wouldn't suggest it if you do not have your own laptop and need 24hr internet access!! Also the hotel has a spa which looked very nice although we did not try it. Best of all the location is amazing. As I said we had our passports stolen... do make sure you take all your things out the taxi when you arrive as they will not return it to you! but the police station for lost and stolen is across the road with the British embassy!! Bloomingdales is a 5 min walk away and we really couldn't have been in a better location! I would deffinately stay in this area again but probably try a new hotel. If you have any questions you can e-mail me on sjnt@btinternet.com. I hope this review helps you!! Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: TorontoToronto99
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible - the front desk staff was indifferent to the point of being rude. The express elevator bank broke down, and the remaining elevators took forever. The Bliss spa they promote so much was a write off, as it closed at 3pm on Saturday and was closed Sunday. The lobby was beautiful and offered free apples, taffy and lemonade, but the rooms were awful -- room 612 where we stayed had wallpaper peeling off the walls in the bathroom, and no full length mirror anywhere in the room.

Reviews.Title: “turn around”
Reviews.Author: jewwandering
Reviews.Content: the W is a very trendy "hip" place to be but the room we had was no larger than a walk in closet......almost impossible to walk around the queen sized bed. the Hotel Lobby was extremely nice with couches TV's etc. The bathroom was minute...you could rest your chin on the sink as you used the toilet. the shower curtain was too short for the shower and water spewed out on the bathroom floor....not a square inch to put your toiletries......the room was way too small even for a single traveler and given the price you could easily do so much better.....never again...never

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kikicole
Reviews.Content: While I am a fan of the W Hotel chain, this one is simply AWFUL! There is no one to help you with your bags when you check in, the line to check in was far too long and they had only one person working who seemed indifferent to everyone she was assisting - and worst of all, one of the friends I went with was eaten up by bed bugs! She had bites all over her legs and back and all the hotel offered to do was move her into another room. She had to ask to have someone clean her clothes and they never offered to comp her room. There was mold on the ceiling, the shower door in my room didn't have a handle, and the elevators require a key to get to any floor - which is good security if the security actually worked! Everyone seemed to have issues getting to their floors. Finally, two other friends of mine came back to their room only to find them OPEN - and they weren't being cleaned. When they complained, what did they get? Free drinks. Great - thanks for nothing. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “YUK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoo-ma-goo
Reviews.Content: This has to be a total disaster. I would never stay there again. The rooms were really small and there were virtually no amenities. I woudl NEVER stay there again. It was a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are SO RUDE”
Reviews.Author: hirsch7808
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a comment before, but after reading that other people felt the same way I wanted to say something. I have never been treated so badly by front desk staff in my life! They sneered at me, were condesending and snippy. Based on that alone, I don't think I would ever stay at this hotel again. The rooms were also very lackluster. Dark and overall unimpressive. The gym was fairly good, however. Definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Style no Substance”
Reviews.Author: mendota
Reviews.Content: Staff at check-in were apathetic and not well trained (taking 15 minutes to type in an already-reserved room to the system is not good, esp. for NY). Room was very small, even for NYC. Interior quality was dated and in need of a makeover -- furniture shopworn and walls needed painting/papering. A/C system was filthy and began squeaking loudly at 3:30am, waking me up. Bathroom large but had no ventilation execept for window which was difficult to open. Upon checkout, was told that late departure would cost $25, then charged $75 for a three-hour period!!!! Charge was refunded, but I was not told that charge was PER HOUR! What is this, a flop-house?

Reviews.Title: “Worst, Worn,Worst Service W”
Reviews.Author: Janet1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the worst hotel I stayed in. i was on line checking in, and there was two guets complaining about bed bugs!!! I was a little concerned, but decided to check into the hotel anyway... MISTAKE!!! When I arrived to the room, someone had used the bathroom already, and left the evidence, and there were dirty socks in between the sheets. I spoke to a manager by the name of Maria, and she was very RUDE!!! Will never stay here again, as a matter of fact I will tell everyone I know to never stay at another W again.....

Reviews.Title: “Sucks!”
Reviews.Author: LTN73
Reviews.Content: Horrible, horrible experience. They claimed I checked out a day early, didn't have my reservation. I actually had to bring my laptop down from my room to show them the reservation, as the person they sent to get the paper copy didn't give it to the manager (I was not allowed to use the computer behind the desk, and the desk help claimed that the business center did not have a printer). They wanted to charge me $499 a night to "rebook" by reservation, even though I had prepaid. My key card only worked once throughout the entire weekend. The manager claimed that she would comp me my next stay, with an upgrade, but I have not heard from her - she said she would send me an email. To top it all off, when I checked out, they gave me someone else's bill! Oh, the room itself was fine, but definitely not worth the hassle. They're slogan of "whatever, whenever" is pure bull - they can't even get the basics right.

Reviews.Title: “Really Not That Bad !”
Reviews.Author: sc64
Reviews.Content: Was really anxious about my vacation as I had booked 14 days here for a much needed break..... then I read the reviews ! I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised - the room wasn't huge but perfectly adequate if you are coming to NYC to see the city and not stay in the hotel all day. One or two days of not great weather and spending the evening in the room was fine - it was comfortable,clean and how are these people showering?!?!? I managed not to get the floor wet all the time ! Towels,linens etc were all clean and if I was going to be really picky the grouting is looking tired but this is a busy hotel and it will get tired quickly especially when people don't respect the property {putting wet glasses on surfaces etc}. The staff were all courteous and room service arrived on time with pleasant staff. All in all walking into the hotel after a busy day was a nice calming experience and my room on the 7th floor was very quiet . Don't be afraid of the reviews - this hotel does work for some people !

Reviews.Title: “W-orried W-hatever”
Reviews.Author: sasha888
Reviews.Content: After a long haul from Australia I was looking forward to putting my feet up. Especially in their "much self acclaimed" spectacular room. Booked in for 3 nights. The porters were fantastic. Upon arrival and leaving the hotel. When I entered throught the doors however, I was greeted by a pathetic girl who lacked any enthusiasm, energy and didn't even smile. I found it surprising from a highly rated American hotel. Checking in at 6.30pm was tough due to the noise of the bar in the foyer area, nice if you can lip read the staff at the front desk. But it was made all the more difficult by this "girl". On entry to the "spectacular" room, it was less than W-hatever. Tiny for the price, tiny bathroom and cheap decor. I actually felt like calling front desk to check if I had the wrong room but there on their website displays clearly all rooms above the 11 floor is this standard. I would not recomment this hotel. Try other for better value and appreication.

Reviews.Title: “worst W I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: NOLAHotelConsultant
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin to list what went wrong? 1. room type not availabe at check in 2. new room had used water 3. missing toiletries 4.broken tub, 5.used coffee in decanter from room service 6. extremely rude "whatever/whenever" customer service employee not to mention the noisy doors and smell of pot in the hallway at night third room was fine but the safe was locked. Make sure you get compensated for this type of stuff, its not acceptable to the W brand and they realize it

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TraveLotSF
Reviews.Content: For an upscale brand in the world's finest city, this hotel was absolutely not up to par. Starwood management has given up on this one and that mentality has spread to the staff. Bad news first: - Lack of doormen, bellhops upon arrival at 11P. - My non-smoking room smelled strongly of smoke. - Cramped rooms. Little natural light. Very tight lightwell. - Old furniture and fixtures. TV was from the 80's, furniture was damaged and scuffed, carpets dirty, and there was a random metal mounting bracket on the bathroom wall where it looked like a fixture had fallen off. - Room service very slow and inaccurate. Food was not good. Overcharged me. Good news: - Conveniently located to Midtown businesses. - Lobby is still nice

Reviews.Title: “W Gets a B+”
Reviews.Author: bushido
Reviews.Content: We were going to be in NYC for 1 night, and I got the W through a Priceline bid. Jumped over to TripAdvisor and reading the reviews was a little worried, but I didn't find it bad at all, although that might depend on how much you paid. - Great Midtown location on Lexington Ave and 49th. About 6 blocks from Grand Central or Times Square. We saw a play on 45th and had a nice walk back afterwards through Times Sq. and Rockerfeller Center. - No problem checking in a little early. No line, friendly-enough staff, including a very nice woman we chatted with in the elavator. The bar in the lobby area looked nice, but we didn't stop in. Lobby was attractive enough, although my wife thought it smelled heavily of cleaning fluids. - The room & bathroom were no bigger than absolutely necessary. The queen bed was in the middle of the room, with a desk and chair squeezed in by the windows. The somewhat high ceilings did help make it feel a little bigger. But this is Midtown NYC, so it was expected, and we hardly did more than sleep there. - I found everything perfectly clean and functional. Bathroom was a little tight, but the shower was fine for someone over 6 feet. Bed was comfy enough, although a little softer than I prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea..”
Reviews.Author: parkview094
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on Lexington on business. Having stayed at a number of Hotels in New York, I would try to avoid returning to the W in the future. It's probably a fine hotel, but suffered from too many of my pet hates. The room was a reasonable size, but poorly laid out. Hard to imagine it was actually "designed". In-room snack tray, kept atop a large TV balancing on top of the mini-bar was quite a precarious combination. The furnishings in the room were clearly quality when they were installed, but torn bedding, frayed blinds, scratched and damaged desk, broken bed.. needs some TLC! As other travellers have reported, the aircon in my room could have done with a service. I was never hot, but the cooling was only just barely adiquate and had a terrible smell. The bathroom is small. Complementary toiletaries were not pleasant. It was impossible to have a shower without soaking the floor and no room for a wash bag etc. I didn't find the staff partiuclarly helpful or friendly and even the elevator music irritated me!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Fall For The Appeal of the W brand”
Reviews.Author: lex5towns
Reviews.Content: The W has a wonderful and sleek lounge and bar and that, along with its marketing have given it a "wonderful and sleek" repuatation. Once you get to your room, though, all of that is out the window. I mean - our bed did have scrumptious linen and the room decor was pretty sleek. But the room is tiny! I've stayed at upscale Manhattan hotels as well as typical brand name airport hotels ($109) and they all have a decent amount of space. not so the W. I called and asked. The room is 170 square feet. May very well be the size of your closet at home. Beyond the entryway and bathroom, the bed area part of the room is about 10 by 10. Maybe even 9 by 9. It's tiny. You walk, you bump into something. No bath. The standard room you get without complaining has only a shower. Sound like an upscale NYC hotel to you? Stay somewhere else and use the W's bar and spa.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: girlncalifornia
Reviews.Content: the hotel lobby is very nice - minimalistic chic, sophisticated and trendy. there were nicely dressed people in the bar at all times, but on the 14th floor where we stayed it was quiet. after 12mn, a bouncer is at bay by the elevators checking room keys for access. (doesn't mean though that this is foolproof as one could have already checked out the hotel but still have the room key). the checkin was fast and efficient; the staff was not snobbish at all. the apples and wipes were a nice touch. there were multiple elevators, tiny but efficient. the hallways were indeed dim but still nicely decorated but showed signs of wear. we were given a room with wheelchair access, which was slightly larger than the usual room. a true disabled person needing a wheelchair will find it impossible to navigate as there is simply no room. the queen bed was just the right fimness, and the sheets were adequately clean. however, the whole room was so dimly lighted. there was a small window but the view was just a side of a building mostly. the closet was small and there was a canvas shoe holder that was supposed to replace shelves, i think?
