there was a small loveseat, a small work table. a small tv was resting on an equally small tv stand. everything was again simple decor but they looked worn down. there was a keyboard for internet access, costing $9.99 to access a day. the bathroom was a little bigger, again because it was wheelchair accessible. counterspace was just a small ledge by the top of the sink and toilet. the hairdryer did not have its own charging area and occupied some of this precious shelf space. there was a thin bar to keep things in place but alas, 2 of my makeup fell off into the toilet!! additional space for towels and extra toiletries was provided by a modular ikea- like coffee table in the bathroom. the floor tiles were relatively clean but the grout was very dark. in line with the w style, i guess, everything had an industrial feel. no granite, no marble/limestone anywhere! the sink was rectangular porcelain, the showerhead had adequate pressure but can only be adjusted up and down, but not side to side, showering here made me feel like i was in a gym! thankfully the bliss toiletries smelled divine. we got this hotel through priceline, and felt it was ok value for money, but if we paid retail, there are a lot better choices out there!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: pete865
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the W hotel on Lexington directly on The W website solely on the W reputation. If I had read the Tripadvisor review first, I probably would have booked somewhere else. Since I booked on the sight, I was unable to cancel the room or I would have been penalized one night ($269). So, my "spectacular room" was waiting and I braced for the worst after reading the reviews. I arrived on Friday 8/3 at 6:30 p.m. and the lobby was packed. Both bar areas were full and the music was thumping. I had no problem checking in. It was fast and courteous. The elevator was a little slow, but there were a lot of people moving around. My room was on the 11th floor. The room was tiny, but well appointed, attractive, and clean. It was tough for 2 people to move around and get ready. There was a musty smell in the hallway and in the bathroom. There was no vent in the bathroom, and a lack of ventilation (or AC) in the hallway. I wasn't bothered by it. There was no view. The room was worn. The carpets could be replaced as well as the laminate around the window and AC unit. The bathrrom was small (no tub), but was in very good shape. The bed was a queen size, and solid. Nice linens and very comfortable. If I group this room with the other $200 to $299 rooms I've stayed in NYC over the years, it would be high on that list. It was the perfect room if your days and nights are filled with activities and all you need is a place to shower, get ready, and sleep. It's close to a subway stop, and cabs are readily available. If I was stuck in the room for whatever reason (or had kids with me), I'd probably be uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “"W" for Worst.”
Reviews.Author: WOLFreview
Reviews.Content: Arrived on an early flight and didn't expect a room to be ready-- but didn't expect a gum-smacking girl at the front desk with attitude either. So we left our bags and headed out for some exploring the neighborhood. The hotel is in a great location on Lexington Avenue and is really close to shopping. Bergdorff Goodman is a few blocks, Saks Fifth Avenue is a few blocks, and all the rest of the great smaller store. My favorite store is Takashimaya New York, located at 693 Fifth Ave-- there's a Japanese Tea Room in the basement which has great Daily Bento Boxes for lunch. So back to the hotel lobby at the W. I could not believe that over the three days, not one single doorman ever greeted me or offered to open a door at the entrance. They also never asked if I needed a cab-- I've never had this happen at ANY hotel in NYC. Seems like the "casual" attitude has taken over. The W's motto is Whatever/Whenever and all I can say to that is "Whatever!" Let me say a few nice things: They do offer free apples and refreshing towelette wipes at the front desk. In the afternoon they had cucumber water near the elevators which was a nice touch. The Concierge was INCREDIBLE and deserves high marks for getting me two tickets to the Tony Award winning "Grey Gardens" which was completely sold out and was closing that night. Sure it took a chunk of change, and about an hour, but he did it: 10th Row Center on the Aisle. The only downside was I couldn't put them on my room tab to get "SPG points." Speaking of points: Upon check-in I was told, repeatedly, that I would not be receiving SPG points. Repeatedly. Did I say repeatedly? This was due to my booking through Expedia and not through the "official" SPG website. I was not even getting credit for the nights toward my upgrades. Bummer....So, I get no points, I paid over 300 bucks a night for one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in NYC, and I get a big dose of attitude. This should be fun. Spectacular Room for over $300 per night. The room really was small. There was barely space to pass sideways by the TV-MiniBar console (there was tray that was teetering on top of the TV) on the way to the torn slipcovered chair shoved up against the bed next to the window. The only thing Spectacular was that they were getting $300+ a night. While the bathroom was very neatly styled, there was nowhere to put my travel case since there was only a glass shelf with all the glasses and hotel items, and a pedestal sink. NOTE: Not all rooms have bathtubs-- my room had a shower only. Waterpressure was great and the showerhead was adjustable for tall guys like me. Sometime around midnight the air conditioner stopped blowing cold air. Since I didn't want to have to wake up and have guys in my room fixing it at midnight, I left it until morning and sweated through it. I called down in the AM and asked them to fix it while we were out. But they didn't. So I called again when I got back that afternoon and after waiting 45 minutes, I called again and asked for a manager-- instead of connecting me to a manager... they finally arrived a few minutes later. After a few minutes inspection the guys brought in a brand new unit and installed it. I had already noticed mold and rust on the unit myself (see photo), and I also snapped a pic of the gapping hole where they pulled the unit. You can see, cleanliness is not next to godliness at the W NY. They were nice guys, quick to apologize, but they should have cleaned the mess behind the wall, which they didn't. The new unit broke that night around 11pm. Called. Waited. Finally had to move rooms-- to a smaller room!!! And not even any kind of credit to my bill. How Spectacular! I've stayed at many NYC hotels. I'm a SPG Preferred Guest. And this was the worst experience at a hotel in Manhattan, aside from the Ramada Plaza near the airport, but that was because of a bumped flight, and I think it's technically in Queens.

Reviews.Title: “So and so....”
Reviews.Author: scmk3000
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel and there were lots of people in the small lobby. No one offered to help with luggages when walked into the hotel. Nevertheless, didn't wait long before a receptionist was available. The girl was very friendly and helpful and gave us a room on 14/F when asked for a higher floor room. The decor on G/F was nicely and modernly decorated with strange grass patches here and there. Funky almost. Oh, apples readily available on the reception counter. Big and juicy ones too! Quite a few elevators but quite cramped and a bit too dim. The corridor feelt dirty and did have an unpleasant odour......decor/wallpaper looked old to be honest - same thing with the room. Even on 14/F, there is no view to speak of and the room was quite small, smallest among the 3 hotels my friend and I stayed. It was relatively quiet though. No plasma to be seen. The TV was tiny and made cica 1990....... The room did have enough space for suitcases. Although I booked it, I didn't actually sleep there as I stayed at another hotel (Barclay, right opposite). Bathroom was again big enough and to my surprise shower only - no bathtub....toileteries aplenty though. My friend used the laundry service but they didn't send it back the next day as promised. Complainted and they waiver the charge. Bed felt comfortable though and sheet clean. Fitness room bigger than the Barclay's and better equiped. No steam room/sauna however. Didn't eat in the hotel but had a drink in the lobby lounge. Pricey and barmaid wasn't that friendly - not a profession bartender as you would expect from a chic, high-class hotel. The lobby is far too small and with the bar crowd it's constantly too packed and had to dodge people on my way in and out. Conciege was helpful but the counter was too small that only one person can help at any one time. Had to wait a LONG time to get served. Other staff were just wondering around really - no smile offered. As W 'founding' hotel (I think), they really should make it more special and keep it at least look good. Except the G/F, they are in desperate need of a hugh renovation to other floors, esp the room! Can't say it's worth 4* really but the location is good. For the money they are after, there are plenty of other better choices. Not all bad though. If you get a great rate through priceline, then it's an okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews - and then book elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: SDSteve
Reviews.Content: I almost always read (and heed) TripAdvisor reviews before booking hotel rooms. About once or twice a year I ignore the reviews for one reason or another, and almost always regret it. Case in point, the W Hotel New York. Believe the reviews, this hotel is really dreadful. I have stayed in Four Points that have significantly better service and facilities. I can deal with the small rooms, that is expected in NYC. The lobby is nice enough to look at, the the first floor is hopping with bar guests and diners. I checked in about 11pm after a late night flight from Europe. The service at the front desk was chilly and detached. When I asked the hostess if I received an upgrade for being a Starwood Platinum member, she looked at the screen and coldly responded 'no.' When I asked why not, she told me because I booked my room using points, that I would have no Platinum benefits. What? Isn't that exactly the reason why we accrue our points in the first place?! After some discussion, a manager walked by, coldly clicked some keys in the computer, and he found a jr suite for me. However he didn't address me or the receptionists obvious lack of understanding on how the programs work there. I could understand if the hotel was sold out, but no upgrades based on ineligibility using points was crazy. We got to the room - a jr. suite in NYC is like a regular sized room anywhere else, but I was happy for it nonetheless. However, the hallways are dank and musky, and the carpet is worn and frayed throughout. The furniture in my room could've come from my nephew's college dorm hand-me-downs. I haven't seen that much particle-board since my last trip to Ikea. The bathroom was fine. The mattresses are extremely out of date and uncomfortable. They bounce so much we thought we were on a waterbed, and had plenty of time to ponder that as we were rolling into each other in the center of the bed. Arriving late at night, I called the 'Whatever/Whenever" line to request a late check out. It rang for five minutes before an agent answered, and then cut me off midsentence to tell me that I needed to speak with the front desk to complete that request. (So much for whatever/whenever). After 10 minutes of ringing (no exaggeration), I ended up having to call the Starwood Platinum Concierge 800 number to ask them to complete the request for me. They were very slow to answer the phones (if ever), and the whatever/whenever button was true to its name. Their attitude was very 'whatever' and 'whenever' they got around to answering their phones, they may or may not assist you. The staff at this hotel had a tremendous amount of attitude and it wasn't positive. The location is fairly good, walking distance to Times Square and many other spots, and easy subway access a few blocks away. I realize it's NYC and that New York is its own animal, but bottom line is that if I have neutral to friendly service and a comfortable bed, I can deal with most anything else. This hotel offered none of the above. Try one of the newly remodeled Sheratons instead. Same amount of points and you'll be a comfy bed. The Starwood Platinum Concierge told me that they get regular complaints on this hotel. Save your time and energy, believe the reviews, and move on to another choice. This hotel does not deserve the W brand name, and the long list of lengthy poor reviews shows they are not interested in making the changes needed to earn their stripes. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: redbloom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W in July 2007. Checked in went to our room and laughed. The bed is in the middle of the room with a big circle headboard cut out so you can see through it on both sides. The first thing I noticed is no dresser or anywhere to put our folded clothes and etc. Went to the closet and there was a hanging container but it did not work for either one of us. There were four hangers, one was broken. The inroom safe was not useable as it was locked so after we put our bags away we went down to the front desk and told them our problem. She said that someone would come to our room in ten mins. We had to be there for maintaince in order to reopen the safe. We waited over 45 mins. and left. The first night sleep turned out to be an adventure as the bed sloped to the middle, on our way down the next morning to report our unhappiness another couple was on there way back down and they had been moved twice with no difference in beds. No need for us to report and move we thought. The ice had melted in our glasses and we noticed black hard objects in the bottom of the glasses. Thought maybe it was a one time thing,but no it happened everytime we had ice. So we drank at the bar. The food and the bar were good as was the nice bliss products in the bathroom..that room was small. All in all for the money go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen from my room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagonative_7
Reviews.Content: After checking in and going out on the town, we returned to find our luggage was ransacked and 2 of us lost over $500 in cash (yeah we were dumb not to put it in a safe) hidden in 2 different suitcases! The maid had entered for turn-down service but the hotel could've cared less - didn't offer to review security tapes, etc. RUINED our vacation - and the staff was uncaring!

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad people”
Reviews.Author: Millzo
Reviews.Content: I do not think this is the greatest hotel in the world but for 3 nights it isn't that bad if you don't hole up in the room. The rooms are small but if you get out and explore the city most of the day and night who really cares. The staff was friendly and the lobby and bars had a good vibe. I got a great massage at Bliss one morning as well. It's all what you make it.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: ducs
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Booked four nights, stayed only for one. I have stayed at nicer Motel 6's and they did not cost $512 per night. Upon arrival, we were not asked if we needed help with our bags, instead they were taken out of the taxi and brought into the lobby and the attendant stood there waiting for the tip. The lobby was noisy and dark. Paid extra for the "mega room" which was certainly not large, but I would not have minded small if it was clean and in good working order. Here are the things wrong with the room: *Carpet was filthy and stained *Safe was completely broken and unusable *Bathroom outlet did not work at all (neither plug) *Dust ruffle on bed was torn and hanging on floor *Roman shade on window was torn *Chair frayed on both arms *Desk covered with drink rings *No lightbulb in lamp (called front desk for lightbulb, they said they would send one, never came) *Grate on air conditioning vent sticking up in dangerous condition *No thermostat control, air conditioning was on or off, no other choice *The room was very dark (probably to hide its deplorable condition) The room was disgusting and the staff arrogant. Could not bear to stay there for four nights. On the first night, after dinner, around midnight, we walked around the corner to 50th Street and saw the San Carlos Hotel sign which I remembered getting good reviews on Trip Advisor, walked in and booked a room for our remaining three nights. W Hotel staff did not seem surprised when we returned that night and said we would be checking out in the morning. San Carlos Hotel was wonderful and saved our trip - see separate review on that one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Suite was a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: shay26m
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. I had a deal for a Fantastic Suite room for 249 a night - velvet couch, marble top bar... From the description on the web site I thought I was in the wrong room and I asked the manager to come up. The carpets were disgusting, the couch was a dirty burlap and the "bar" was a small wooden table. The manager assured me I was in the right room and said the burlap couch was what they call velvet. I told her I know I had a deal but was not happy in this room and have been in regularly price 249/night rooms in NYC and they were much nicer. I was offered an upgrade the next day to a Spa room. I took it because it was nicer and cleaner. Two things happened - after I left the water out of the whirlpool there was dirt all over. Either I was very dirty or there was something wrong with the jets. The second thing was a worker came in to deliver a magazine after two knocks as I stood there in a state of undress. (The deadbolt is engaged by moving the entire handle upward - something I hadn't figured out at the time.) The security laughed when I told him what happened and said there was nothing he could do. Bottom line - I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, great lounge bar”
Reviews.Author: johnny12
Reviews.Content: My $400 per night hotel room reminded me of my college dorm room...only smaller. My room came complete with a broken chair and dvd player. The pathetic european shower even reminded me of the jail house shower stalls you'll find in every college dorm. The Whiskey Blue bar downstairs was pretty hip though. We saw Peyton Manning and fam hanging out and enjoying some cocktails. Do not stay here. There has to be better value in this part of Manhattan..

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as others make it out to be”
Reviews.Author: alp65
Reviews.Content: The lousy reviews on this hotel may be overstating its short-comings. Yes, the rooms are small, but this is New York. If you're concerned about room size, then spend a little extra to get the 200 sq ft room instead of the 180 sq ft. That extra bit may make all the difference. The hotel lobby and bar is a real urban hipster "scene" which is either a big plus or a big drag, depending on your preference. Check-in was hectic but surprisingly speedy. The concierge did direct us to an enjoyable bistro nearby and made reservations for us, albeit with just a little bit more attitude than we would have preferred. The rooms were well-appointed and featured the over-hyped heavenly bed. Yes, they're comfortable. No, they won't change the course of history. The bathrooms were small but efficient. Adjustable rain shower heads were most welcome. Our room had a shower only, which was just fine. Other reviewers have complained that "water splashes everywhere" which only led us to wonder what they were trying to do in the shower that made such mess. Pet owners will find plenty of hospitality, including a "doggie room service" menu.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kw78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very trendy boutique hotel which is lovely to stay in. The rooms are quite small which makes having 2 suitcases in the room a bit of an issue. They are very comfortable. Staff and service is excellent. Hotel bar is lovely and does some fantastic cocktails. Equally the hotel restaurant where we had breakfast had a brilliant menu to cater to everyone's tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet in the City”
Reviews.Author: JenQCIL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel June 8 & 9th. It was clean, the staff was helpful, close to the subway, and most of all comfortable. The pillows were goose down the bed was comfy and it was quiet. I slept like a baby. This never happens on vacation. Usually I'm awake tossing and turning. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but...”
Reviews.Author: Rubester
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews for this hotel before my visit and found most to be accurate but let me add my two cents: The rooms are indeed microscopic as are the bathrooms. The staff was friendly and attentive. My air conditioner did not work but was fixed almost immediately once I alerted the front desk. The Bliss products in the bathroom are very nice. With taxes the per-night charge came to nearly $320. Is it worth it? Not really. Would I stay again? Probably not. If you want to spend about $100 more a night you should go across the street to the Waldorf-Astoria which is truly glorious.

Reviews.Title: “Many better choices nearby”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTim
Reviews.Content: I come to New York every few weeks on business, and the W has been my backup hotel when my preferred choice (the Intercontinental, a block away) is full. I'm going to look for a new backup hotel. I have stayed here a number of times in the past, and every time I wonder why I come back. Yes, the lobby is very hip, and if you're planning to hang out in the lobby bar, then it's certainly hopping, and that's a plus. But now head up to your room... When you get off the elevator (which itself is incredibly tiny -- an omen), there's one sign pointing the way to your room. But at that point it gets challenging. The floor design is a complete maze, and there are no more signs after that first one. Depending on where your room is, be prepared to wander for a bit. The hallways are very dark, with almost no lighting. The standard room is tiny, and *don't* be persuaded by the reviewers on here who say, "Hey, it's New York, what do you expect?" The answer is that for this price I expect much bigger and better, and I get that at the Intercontinental, Grand Hyatt, Millennium, Sofitel, Helmsley, and others, all within a few blocks of the W. The room literally has no drawers -- not one -- so you're living out of your suitcase whether you like it or not. If you're planning to do any work in the room, you won't be happy. There's a tiny desk, with a very cheap and very uncomfortable chair. If the view is important to you (it's not to me), you had better ask about that at the front desk, since many (most?) of the rooms look out into a small central area that is all ventilation pipes and other "behind the scenes" features. And not in a good way. If you think you're going to be persauded by the hip lobby, the new age music, and the Bliss products in the bathroom, then this hotel will work for you. If you prefer a decent-sized room in a quality hotel, I highly recommend the Intercontinental or any of the others mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “I said never again; I went back; never never again”
Reviews.Author: PeterVirginia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W New York twice now. The first time, the AC in my room didn't work in the middle of summer, there was trash in the hallways, a large stack of someone else's luggage was delivered to my room while I was out, it took 20 minutes to check in, and they an out of coffee in the lobby and towels in the gym - all for a $600 room. Oh yes, and the $80 laundry bill (which they quickly wrote off). An operational mess. I swore never again. But two years later, there were no other rooms to be had so I gave them another try. The second time, the hall rugs are dirty, the room corners dirty, and things still ran out. Check in lines were long and elevators didn't work properly. This time for only $375. I understand that the W is a concept hotel, but do they have to be so bad operationally? And absolutely no response from the manager's email or phone calls when I left an item behind. I'll leave the W to those who want the atmosphere (dark halls, lots of scented candles, new age music, and such) and don't need the little things done well or even at all.

Reviews.Title: “The word is â€œFauxâ€�”
Reviews.Author: TIBIDO
Reviews.Content: I was at this W over Memorial Day weekend. I had no problems and enjoyed my stay. It was clean, well maintained, and everyone was very pleasant and helpful. I also paid <$140 a night. I get the sense that a lot of these bad reviews are from the rich and privileged that had very high expectations that were shattered by what they got. Itâ€™s a ton of money for what you get. The place has a very trendy design that often makes the spaces unpleasant. The walls were all hard surfaces that made every space loud and lacking in intimacy. There were 20+ people hanging out in the lounge off the lobby at 1:30am, so people seemed to be enjoying themselves. I spent almost no time in the hotel. Just sleep. It was cheap, so I booked it. The corridors are dark and hard to navigate. I expect the lack of light is to hide the poor craftsmanship which there is plenty. I got lost a lot. And if you are going to put beautiful expensive photography in the corridors at least spot light them. The bottom line is weird materials and strange, often awkward, spatial relationship, do not equal High Design. And letâ€™s not forget â€œFauxâ€� means artificial, imitation, or fake. â€œFauxâ€� may be trendy but vinyl wall covering that looks like grass is still vinyl wall covering. If I am going to spend $300+ a night I want really, not â€œFauxâ€�. Even if it is a little older, a little less trendy and a little less polished around the edges. I like a little grit in my New York. I would stay there again, but for not over $180 a night.

Reviews.Title: “W="Wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: Healey04
Reviews.Content: What's all these negative reviews about? After reading some of these reviews on TA I was expecting an Econo-Lodge with a bid "W" out front. Not the case. We stayed at the W over Memorial Day Weekend and we were met with an ultra-hip, clean, and magnificent hotel. Are the rooms small? Sure, but keep in mind you're not at a Holiday Inn-Select in Binghampton--you're in Manhattan. Things are tight but the rooms are clean and well-appointed, with nice bath amenities and a cool W robe. The front desk staff and the concierge were both friendly and courteous. The lobby bar is more of a lounge and a great place to have a drink before heading out. The staff does a great job of always keeping the place sparkling clean. The real wheat grass throughout the hotel is a pretty cool touch. The location of the W is perfect. There's a subway stop two blocks away, 3 different coffee places(Dunkin' Donuts, Starbucks and Au Bon Pain) and you're walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. When returning from a night out be sure to have your key card out--there's always a beefy security guard there to make sure you're not trying to sneak in. Overall, it was a wonderful stay at the W. Would I stay again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: profriars
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Priceline for $175 + taxes. The reviews here aren't doing the place justice. As for the room size, they are small - sure, but it's NYC we are talking about. They were actually bigger than the last place I stayed at in the area - Hotel Metro. You can't expect big rooms in NYC. Otherwise, they were very clean and it was a very nice atmosphere. Be sure to grab a few of the complimentary citrus towels (think wet-ones) they have at the check in desk - they are great while you are walking around in the downtown heat. The shower is odd, and water does get everywhere, but the pressure is great. Can't beat the location either, right near Rockerfeller Ctr., Fifth and Park aves, Central Park, and Grand Central if you come in by train. Would def. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.”
Reviews.Author: travellerBangor
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Belfast, Northern Ireland we were extremely tired so glad of the great location. However, we had booked to non smoking twin rooms. Firstly, the receptionist told us there were no twin rooms left, then she tried to give us two twin rooms 4 floors apart. Finally we got two on the same floor, but they were far way from each other and smoking rooms. The smell in the corridors was terrible. The rooms were no bigger than a postage stamp and the view was a breeze block wall, making the rooms very dark. However, on the plus side, being at the back we didnt hear any traffic and the location was excellent.. The lobby was stunning two, and the candle smelt lovely. Still not worth the money though.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: DR07070
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on Lexington Avenue for two nights (Fri and Sat) and, based on the reviews I had read, was pleasantly surprised. I don't doubt others have had the bad experiences they've written about, and I'm not saying this would be my first choice of hotels in NY by any means, but I had a better experience than many have, so maybe all these tough reviews have had some effect! The rooms were certainly the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel, period, bar none. If I were truly claustrophobic, I might've been really miserable. It took some getting used to, but it had a certain 'coziness' to it by the time I left. I guess it's 'to each his/her own' on that one. I've also stayed at the W in Chicago (not by the lake, but the other one) and these rooms were really not all that much smaller than those in Chicago as I recall. I did not find the rudeness or lack of cleanliness so many have cited. I got smiles at the front desk at check-in and upon leaving, there were no mistakes made with my reservation, and my room was perfectly clean. Very small, but clean. The daily charge for Internet access is ridiculous, but maybe just a dollar or two higher than the other 4 and 5 star hotels charge. The hallways are dimly lit to achieve a 'chic' look, but not to the point where I had any problem with it. The AC unit was loud, but in a good 'white noise' way; it was not the kind of 'loud' where it cycles on and off all the time and wakes you up, so I heard almost nothing from the hallways and nothing whatsoever from the street. I was on the 12th floor, and did not face Lexington Ave., so I guess that helped as well. Housekeeping was 'invisible' --in a good way -- the room got cleaned while I was downstairs in my conference, but I certainly didn't have the problem of vacuum cleaners and loud conversation among the staff at 8:00 a.m., or anyone knocking on my door, etc. So, do they overcharge here? You bet! (My room was $359/night). And, most people would no doubt prefer a bit more space to walk around in and a larger bathroom. Oh, and that shower curtain thing -- that IS annoying and really odd; it does come down to about 2" off the floor so you do get a lot of water on the floor outside the shower. No question they should spend a few million to really get this place up to par considering the rates they charge. But my room was clean, the temp was comfortable, the hotel was quiet, the elevators -- while small -- were not especially slow or anything, the front desk people were nice, and I had no occasion to use the concierge, so I can't comment on that. Overall, it was way better than I expected, given the reviews I had read here, but if I were going to NY on my own dime -- even if I were going alone -- I'm sure there are other hotels I'd look at first, just to have a bit more room and to get more for my money. On the other hand, if I'm offered a chance to work in NY again and I'm told the meeting will be at the W, I won't be scheming to get out of it just to avoid having to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the W's name”
Reviews.Author: whereisluck
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the W and unfortunately, it was a disappointing one. I expected a lot more considering they were part of the Sheraton chain and charging close to $400/night. I've stay at Le Meridien in Germany which is just as expensive but much nicer. To start, the rooms are incredible small. We stayed on the 4th floow (Bliss Spa floor) and the room was about 9 x 10. This was considered an upgrade from our original room. Now, I consider myself a small person at 5â€™4â€�. This room was so small that with the queen size been, I bearly had enough room to squeeze across to the window side of the room. The restroom was even smaller. Only one person physically occupy it at a time. While we were there, we had to call maintenance because the shower head leaked. The building is showing sights of its age. On the plus side, the lobby was very nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The gym was modern and very well equipped. Locationâ€™s great, right in midtown Manhattan. If I have a choice to stay on my next trip, the W New York would not be my top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: onevacation
Reviews.Content: The W on Lexington is a chic hotel. The rooms are small but that is very expected for downtown. The hotel was in a great area. We walked many places from the hotel. I loved the cool lobby with the unique floral arrangements and comfy chairs and couches. There are also green apples at the front desk for the taking. We would definitely stay at the W again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is one of the worst”
Reviews.Author: Sleepless_Travelers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2007. It is by far one of the worst 4/5 star hotels I have stayed in. The staff is terrible. Now, the W hotels are renowned for stylish lobby's, bars, restaurants BUT cramped rooms and uncourteous staff but this was just terrible. Take it from someone who stays in a hotel 4 days a week and spend your money elsewhere. Pros: - Nice lobby - Good hotel bar (adjacent to the hotel) - Good fitness center Cons - Rooms are terrible, some are smelly and noisy (air vents) - Staff is absolutely uninterested in catering to your needs I was going to be staying there for 11 nights. When I checked in, I was given one of the most congested and cramped rooms I have ever stayed in. It was hard getting my bags through the door. I immediately requested to be changed to another room. Now, given the fact that I have the highest tier on their Starwood loyalty program I thought the staff would be accomodating but no such luck. They reluctantly agreed to change my room. The new room was bigger, but smelt like poop, had a wet carpet spot and made noise all night long. I called and spoke to them again and mentioned that I would be moving out the very next day. Instead of addressing the problem, I was told that they had to check if I would pay penalties for early checkout. At this point, I had had enough and spoke to the manager. Although he did apologize, I thought he would try and do more especially given that I travel to NYC every week, 4 days a week and given my tier on the Starwood loyalty program. But no such luck !! So, I took my luggage the next morning and checked in at The Marriott across the street. The lobby is very basic but I was immediately upgraded to their Executive floor (large rooms, free breakfast, soft drinks, appetizers, snacks, desserts, private concierge). The fitness center is also nice. W - SUCKS !!

Reviews.Title: “Style over Comfort”
Reviews.Author: SteffenA
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the W won't shed any new light on the deep, fundamental problem that plauges this hotel. The lobby is beautiful and there's a great hip energy to the place. But the rooms themselves are a disaster. Our "Spectacular" room was absurdly small and uncomfortable. So small that my knees pressed into the bathroom wall when I sat on the toilet. So small that I cracked my elbow on the sink everytime I reached for the toilet paper. So small that I had to turn sideways when walking around the foot of the bed. Also, the TV's got lousy, snowy reception. Don't people notice these things? I guess not because the hotel was so full that our request to be upgraded to a suite -- and we were willing to pay for it -- couldn't be fulfilled. In fairness to the staff, they did upgrade us to a "Super Spectacular" room at no charge. That room was marginally larger than the first, but still, by any standard, a very small uncomfortable room. And it's already dim lighting was plauged by a few burnt out bulbs. I think this hotel chain does itself no favors by creating expactions that can't be met. Maybe a little less creativity in it's copywriting and a little more truth would avoid these situations. The next time I go to NY, I'll stay at the Kimpton's Park 70. Yes, it's more expensive, but the rooms are much (MUCH!!) larger and far more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “W= Worst”
Reviews.Author: RachaelMC1980
Reviews.Content: On Saturday, April 28 my boyfriend and I reserved a â€œSpectacularâ€� non-smoking room at the W on Lexington in Manhattan. Instead we got a craptacular stink box built for a midget. I understand NY hotel rooms are small, real estate is at a premium, but this was ridiculous. I was sitting at the end of the bed and had to move to let my boyfriend by to go the restroom. The carpets and shades were shabby and gross. The bed, though we reserved a queen, was definitely not. When we called downstairs to get a different room (we were more than willing to pay to upgrade to a suite) the staff said they overbooked Saturday night and the only room available was the stinky little hole we were in. My boyfriend and I travel to NYC several times a year and would never stay at a W Hotel again. W= Worst hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: gzaczac
Reviews.Content: here is the verdict: front desk: Two people when i came in. One, would not even acknowledge me room: tiny, but clean bathroom: Water pressure???? bedding: small queen size (me and wife) room service: $39 for a continental with dry croissants and pastries right out of your local gas station restaurant: good experience. i recommend lobby: party central, if you are into it... elevators: slow, small, a general complaint from almost everyone that we talked to. last but not least, there is a cleaning lady in charge of doing the revolving doors. When she is there,she has no problem in not letting anyone through it. Hospitality anyone???? needless to say...after two days we moved to another property.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Rather Stay at the Y than the W”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at this hotel for a meeting. It was the smallest room I have stayed in since college. I'm used to small hotel rooms in New York but this one was ridiculus. It had one queen bed as a king bed would not fit in the room. The view was of a parking lot. The furniture was old and worn. The desk chair was almost like a metal folding chair with worn out fabric on the back. The bed was uncomfortable and not heavenly for sure. The bathroom was tiny with a half tub as a full size tub would not fit and no water pressure. The air conditioning was noisy and would wake you up each time it came on. You could also hear every body in the hall way and each time a door would open it was as if it were in your room. The sheets and towels were of low quality and very worn. On a positive note the lobby area was nice and hip but the music was very loud. The food at the meeting was pretty nice and the hotel is close to Ess-A-Bagel which has the best bagels in the city. This is the second W hotel I have stayed and and so far both have been terrible. (Atlanta was the other) I was so happy I had only one night at this place. Every one at the meeting had similar complaints about their room. It seems the W tries to make the lobbies and hallways hip and cool but they forget about making the rooms nice and inviting. Avoid this hotel no matter what price you can get for a room!

Reviews.Title: “too much, too little”
Reviews.Author: littlegoldenone
Reviews.Content: I found a great rate on the web site. $169....total bill around $200 for one night. The good news was that it was only one night. The service was lousy starting with a long wait for check in... they didn't have any rooms ready at 4:30 pm and no they couldn't upgrade us. 90 min later the room we got was small, so cramped that you had to almost leap over the beds. The room over overly hot.. so that we sweated non-stop and the front-desk could do nothing to help us. The shower in the tiny bathroom had a drain that was plugged so 6-8 inches of dirty water accumulated in the tub during a shower. There were multiple room service trays left in the dark, dingy hallway overnight, ripe for someone to trip over. Finally when we checked out, the front desk woman, who had horrible teeth and bad English took my complaint about the room and told me she would pass the comments on, but could do nothing about the bill. Even though it has been almost 18 months since I stayed there, the experience was so terrible that (1) it is fresh in my mind and (2) I shudder whenever I see a W hotel anywhere. do not stay here even it is was free! I was prompted to write this review after reading an article about tripadvisor in the NYT.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews seem!”
Reviews.Author: ibb
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Priceline for Easter weekend-- $140/night, but after reading the reviews here, I thought we were in for a cheap, yet awful experience. However, the W was so much better than the reviews made it seem! We were upgraded from a cozy room just by asking (although I'm not convinced we really were because the room only had about 3 feet on either side of the bed) and it was perfect for me and my boyfriend. Pros Great location, right by the 6 subway stop, impeccably clean, quiet, attentive staff when we called down about our heat and our safe that didn't work, nice lobby, awesome toiletries, comfortable pillow top mattress, the windows actually open to allow you to get some fresh air Cons Not a ton of places to eat lunch/brunch on the weekends in the area, if we didn't have the a/c on heat automatically came out of the pipes-- it took a few hours to get a comfortable temp in the room, the concierge had a "whatever" attitude and was a tad snooty, the key card maker was broken so we only had 1 key-- had to wait in a ridiculous line with people checking in later that evening to get another working key, no nightstands next to the beds

Reviews.Title: “Room absurdly small”
Reviews.Author: geekspice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while our Manhattan apt. was being painted. Our room was billed as a "Wonderful" room (they had a lower class of room - the "Cozy" room). It was so small that we could barely move around and kept hurting ourselves on the furniture. The shower was poorly designed and the bathroom floor flooded whenever it was used. Also, they deliver USA Today - why would a New York City hotel do that? The bathroom amenities from Bliss spa were very, very nice, and the bed was comfortable. The selection of TV stations was poor - we couldn't even watch a Yankee game in the heart f Manhattan. The climate control was also poor - the room was constantly either too hot or too cold, and the air conditioning unit was extremely loud.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage”
Reviews.Author: cartfan123
Reviews.Content: Lowlights of this hotel 1) excessive wait to use the elevator (they only hold about 4 people) so there where usually line ups to go up 2) heater was stuck on, even after maintenance came by to "fix", made for a brutal time trying to sleep 3) long wait when calling front desk staff from your room 4) rooms so small that you can imagine what staying in a closet feels like 5) charged me for mini-bar items that I didn't use (had to call for a credit) Highlights 1) good bar and lobby 2) decent fitness area Bottom Line: too expensive and too small, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DMC16
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I stayed at the W New York hotel on Lexington Avenue for 7 nights in March 2007. After booking the holiday, we thought we would take a look at the internet and read some reviews. We were gutted by the remarks people were making and began to worry that we had made the wrong choice. PLEASE DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THESE PEOPLE! The hotel is awsome. It is in a really great location (straight opposite the Waldorf=Astoria) and is a joy to stay in. As soon as you walk into the lobby you can smell fresh scented candles and pick up on the ultra chic and relaxing vibes that engulf the place. We found the staff were superb. The concierge were fantastic and really stood by the hotles 'whatever, whenever' motto. I cant say enough good things about the place. I cannot understand why some people have slated it. it is really impressive. (I visited all the top hotels and given a choice i wouldnt swap it for any of them, not even the world famous Waldorf)!! With regards to the size of the room. (standard) it was fine. it wasnt huge but it was big enough for the two of us the relax and wind down away from the chaos of the city. the on demand tv was great and the munchie box was a great touch. I hope you enjoy your stay there as much as we did. we will surely be going back there!!!! Over and out.

Reviews.Title: “In Need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: kctat78
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend in NYC, where I stayed at the W Lexington. The reason I chose this hotel was that it was running a pretty good discounted rate. Having stayed at numerous other W hotels, I thought this would be a pretty safe bet. Disappointed would be how I would characterize the rooms. Carpeting needs replaced and the wallpaper it botched in many spots. Room was missing a coffee maker. Everything just seemed pretty "dated." This wasn't something exclusive to this one room, as the poor carpet and decor ran throughout the building. I did see that the Marriott next door was undergoing significant rennovations. Perhaps the W Lexington will follow suit. Decent price, but I expect more from the brand and this one hotel is clearly devaluing their other properties in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: RipleyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the W this past weekend. I was concerned b/c I had read alot of negative reviews. However, I was relieved after our stay. The hotel is in a fabulous location, right at Lexington Ave and 50th. It is walking distance to so many things (e.g. Central Park, Rockefeller Center, etc.) The hotel atmosphere is sort of quiet/trendy during the day. The lobby is beautiful with a great sitting area. The hallways were dimly lit and quiet. The rooms are small, but it's New York and if you are not planning on being in the room that much, it's not a big deal. Everything was clean, fixtures were updated and bed was very comfortable. I visited the Concierge several times (directions, needed a sewing kit, etc.) and they were always friendly and helpful. Additionally, at night, the lobby bar area and Whiskey Blue (hotel bar) were packed. If you can get a good rate, plan on seeing the city and not spending alot of time in your room, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Less black turtle neck, more do your fing job”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: At that price, you'd like to not be treated like the dirt. I understand the trendy cooler than human W attitude but unless my bed is made, my bathroom clean, the door opened, my bags carried and the towels not frayed, stfu.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJA
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but that's it. While the staff was pleasant enough to talk to, the service was dismal - slow or nonexistent. I arrived about 9:30 pm; the first room they gave me reeked of men's cologne and made my throat tighten up. The manager was good about giving gave me another room and a free breakfast the next morning. Still, it took several phone calls to get a new key to me. I called room service and front desk, but they never answered (I let the phone ring at least 16 times). When someone finally answered on the fifth or sixth attempt, it still took an hour to bring the key. The second room was very warm even though the thermostat read 65 F. The paint was chipping from the windowsill, and the wallpaper looked dirty, as did the carpet. The linens were very nice, but the cold water faucet on the sink broke off as soon as I turned it. I called about having that fixed, but it was never done in the three days I stayed there. Even the priceline deal was too much money for this dump.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel-Ovrpriced, Underperformed”
Reviews.Author: travellingChicago
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at for the price. After walking into a very jazzy, fun lobby, the rooms are so disappointing--tiny and dingy. Even after moving to the renovated floor, the bathroom was very small and the shelf was tilted so that everything you put on it slid into the toilet or on the floor. The staff was friendly but the phone rang at least 7 times before any of them would answer. The topper was that my new shower did not work and they provided no robe. The location is great but skip this dog unless the prices are significantly reduced.

Reviews.Title: “Expected A Bit More”
Reviews.Author: Slobberpot
Reviews.Content: Generally nice hotel but had a few problems with: -Mini Bar wasn't re-stocked when we check in. -Front desk wasn't very helpful when asked once about the closet 7-11 and immediately said there weren't any in Manhattan. -The TV internet stopped working once while in the middle of accessing it (for a fee) and the technician sent up to the room said it was free and insisted it was when it wasn't. He wasn't able to fix it but it eventually started working again a few hours later. Other stuff, the hotel was nice and the staff were generally very friendly and helpful as were any of the cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel on Lexington”
Reviews.Author: shurbyz
Reviews.Content: Nice, very small rooms with 2 twin beds. Nice, relatively quiet location just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center. The Greyline bus tour was right around the corner. The manager was very accomodating over the internet. I emailed a question and received a phone call with my answer. I prepaid for my room in full with a "buy 2 nights gets one free" special. When we checked in, we were asked for a credit card for each room in case of additional charges from the room (room service, bar, etc.). My friend used a debit card for this purpose. When she checked her account, $402 + a $1 debit charge was removed from her checking account right away. When called, the manager said this was the typical way of doing things and it was her bank's fault that the money was not added back to her account. The money was added back into her account after a couple days, but it was a nuisance in the meantime.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, ok...”
Reviews.Author: Mrescobar
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with it really, but not too good either. Rooms are small, location is very good, restaurant is poor, bar is nice but also not the nicest and staff is friendly. And that's it. Nothing more nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel50
Reviews.Content: I thought W New York was a great hotel - I booked on Expedia so got a great rate, but it was much better value than other hotels I have stayed in in NYC for the same price. The room was clean and very well equipped, with CD player, DVD player, internet access, well stocked mini bar plus a fantastic hairdryer and ironing board and iron. The bed was so comfortable - well above average for any hotel I have been in. The bathroom was spotless and in good condition with extra towels, robes and paper and the Bliss toiletries were fantastic - I'm converted! The staff were fine - they did look you up and down, especially the doormen, but I was expecting it, having read the reviews on this site. All were helpful if not smiling. The Bliss spa staff were much the same. The lobby was buzzing and the Whiskey Bar was too - great cocktails. The location was very central - near 5th Ave and a subway station. I liked the fact that the hotel was very secure, plus the housekeeping staff were polite and unobtrusive. I'm not sure if there are 2 W New York hotels operating in a parallel universe, but I definitely stayed in the good one - look out for internet deals, you'll be getting a bargain. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingmds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend (three nights) in the W New York this past President's Day Weekend. Ok, here's the skinny on this hotel. Don't be scared off by the other reviews. We are avid travellers (read our other reviews) and we enjoyed this property. This is a great hotel in an amazing location. We have stayed at several other W's and this hotel delivers all of the panache, comfort and service that the other W's do. The difference is . . . it is in the heart of Manhattan. This translates to a $300-$500 hotel room which is small and more functional than spacious. SO WHAT!! It's Manhattan, that's what you would and should expect. Other than the small room (ours was about 20X10), everything about the hotel was great. We found a buy two nights get one night free promotion on the hotel website. Our flight arrived late (after midnight) and we didn't arrive at the hotel until past 1am. Upon arrival, the front desk upgraded our room to a 'spectacular' room. The lobby is awesome, just what you expect from a W. The room was small, but totally functional and despite the tight quarters, it had all of the amenities that every other W's we have stayed in had. We used our hotel room as a lauching point for all of our adventures in NYC and it served us well. I do agree with some of the other reviews that this is not the right hotel for anyone who plans on spending a lot of time in their room. (Though I can't imagine who comes to Manhattan to sit in their hotel room). The other W's in New York are newer and nicer than this one, but you will pay more for their rooms. In one sentence, this is a great place to stay in NYC, amazing location, with comfortable, but not spacious rooms, at a great price (for NYC). Please keep in mind that on the same block there are four other hotels (Waldorf Astoria, Doubletree, Kimberly Hotel and Benjamin Hotel) none of which are nearly as nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic W Made Our Holiday”
Reviews.Author: cazzalou
Reviews.Content: just returned from NY was alittle dubious about staying at the 'W' after reading many unflattering reviews but we found our stay there exceptional front desk staff concierge housekeeping porters and security all deserve a big thankyou for making us most welcome. Ok rooms were a little small but for goodness sakes it is a boutique hotel and in NEW YORK. I'm sorry but we had no intentions and nor did we spend every hour in our room. So what's the problem with room size. Theres enough room to sleep, change shower etc and beds wereSooooo COMFY, bathroom spotlessly cleaned everyday as was rest of room. We got married during our stay in NY and staff treated us like celebs They went above and beyond any expectations we had of this hotel -Thanks to other reviews. but we are so glad we decided to ignore them and make our own minds up -In fact we enjoyed it that much we just booked to return later in year. I have never been upset about going home after a holiday-quite the opposite for many (welcomed going home early from some!!) but I admit I was sad to leave here and shed one or two tears at checkout and on plane home!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and understaffed”
Reviews.Author: TBUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York for one night last August. Having waited in line at immigration at JFK for two hours, I was ready to collapse into bed upon arrival at the hotel. On arriving at the hotel, I was practically thrown out of the cab by the waiting hordes outside. I looked in vain for someone to help me with my suitcase (it was heavy!) and in the end a passer-by took pity on me and helped me inside the hotel. I left my suitcase at reception to be brought up, but waited almost an hour in my room for it, before going back to reception to fetch it myself. The receptionist promised me a free breakfast as compensation for the poor service, but after I checked out I noticed I had paid for my breakfast. The room was nicely furnished but tiny - any longer than one night would have been claustrophobic. The lobby was more like a nightclub than a hotel. Bliss toiletries in the bathroom were a nice touch. The guys in the room next door decided to party all night, and the walls were too thin to block out the noise. I couldn't wait to check out and won't be coming back. I emailed the manager afterwards with my complaint and never heard back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W hotel, would definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: clare_eaton
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous about what we had booked!! We stayed at the W hotel for 2 nights. We arrived at the hotel around 3pm and at check we were told our room was not ready but as they knew we had been on a long journey from London they did what they could to re arrange the rooms so we could go straight up to the room. We stayed in one of the Mega rooms and we were pleased with what we had. the room was modern and a nice size the bathroom was clean and crisp. The hotel itself was very buzzy and had a great atmosphere. A great place to stay if you want to get into the New York atmosphere and also a great location. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel, it was modern and had a great atmosphere. It was clean and every where smelt nice and fresh, the people were friendly and the room was lovely. I would only recommend places i would go back to and we will definately be going back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor fire safety”
Reviews.Author: Wildernesscycling
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if emergency safety is important to you! While I was there I jogged down the internal emergency stairs to go to the gym, from the16th floor room to the 4th floor. I was amazed to see EVERY emergency stairwell crammed with in-room dining trolleys, housekeeping trolleys and even a cot bed! All were there blocking up what is meant to be a safe exit for guests and staff in the event of an emergency.I called the hotelâ€™s reception and the duty manager, promised to look into it for me. She never got back to me and when I left the hotel 2 days later, the emergency exit stairs were still blocked.

Reviews.Title: “No Fuss Buzz”
Reviews.Author: McNott
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the W Union Sq and was surprised by the negative reviews on this site about the W New York. The hotel is much bigger and is always busy. We were upgraded to a suite which was nice on arrival and the service was always cordial and efficient. Check in and out was a breeze. Ate out very night so I cannot comment on the food but the Breakfast Bar was great for a person on the go. All W hotelshave dark corridors so this was no suprise, The rooms are clean though now a little dated and tired but still "cool". The cleaning staff were very helpful though the internet access in the rooms was sometimes very slow to get on. Downstairs in the lobby Internet is free if you are willing to balance your laptop on your knees. If you dont wont to be papered be a part of an ambience then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, 2/9/07, and was very pleasantly surprised. I arrived at 6:30 on a Friday night and the place was buzzing. That may turn a lot of people off, but on a Friday night during Fashion Week, I'd be disappointed if it wasn't. The staff at check-in could not have been more pleasant. I am a Starwood Gold member, and maybe that's why they were so nice, but it was as smooth a process as I've ever had. I even received a call about 20 minutes after I got into my room to see if everything was okay. The concierge (Wherever, Whenever) tried to help change some hard-to-get dinner reservations without any luck, but at least he tried. My room was large and very comfortable, and the bathroom was, by NYC standards, a pretty good size. My only complaints were the shower cap that was never brought by housekeeping and the door men, who were not much help in at all. No one opened the car door on arrival and not one of them offered help in carrying my bag into the hotel. There were several gypsy town cars out front blocking cabs from picking up fares and I saw one of the drivers hand the doorman some money in exchange for this "service". When I left he following day, I had to hail my own taxi - the door men were nowhere to be found. The door staff at the Union Square W were much more professional and helpful. Also, the spa is okay, but not nearly as good as the original Bliss downtown. I had to wait almost 1/2 hour for my service because the client before me was late, and the desk staff said nothing - they just let me sit there the entire time offering me bottled water. They could have at least told me the cause of the delay. Oh, and the elevators are very, very slow and very very small.

Reviews.Title: “The best NYC experience.”
Reviews.Author: brookedthomas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the hotel. I had been reading the reviews for months and even tried to cancel because the reviews were so bad. The reviews were wrong. The hotel was great. The service, room, drinks and the location. In fact I felt like we were in the best part of the city. My room was a great size the bliss products smelled great. I would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: HIGHCLIFF
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE EMAIL I SENT IN REPLY TO AN EMAIL SENT TO ME TO ENQUIRE IF OUR STAY WAS FABULOUS. When I first read your email I thought you must be joking. The worst hotel experience we have ever had in the US and here we are getting an email asking for feed back! Well you asked for it. Arriving at 9pm on the 19th of January ,we made our way to reception. Expecting a warm welcome on a winters night we cheerfully with big smiles said "good evening". "Checking in " was the reply "Yes "was our reply. Stop! at this point I would like to add that I had the reservation print out in my hand and luggage and porter standing behind us. "Credit card and photo ID" was the reply "You are in room" ( sorry I forget) And that was it. No greeting or even have a nice stay. Righto we thought as we looked for the elevators , Someone has had a bad day. Then we got in the lift and after a frightening lift ride we ended up on our floor. ( you might want to check out those lifts, it felt like we were talking our lives into our hands every time we used them) The room! Well as far as 2 to 3 star hotel go it was OK. Tired , dated, and a bit grubby. I was under the impression however that it was a 4 star hotel. The air conditioner or 'the Concord' as it was affectionately named kept us awake on and off for three nights. Breakfast on day two. Interesting that of all the tables in the restaurant we were put at one in full view of the kitchen.Hmm! We and our friends who had also checked in the previous evening ordered. When my order of Eggs benedict was taken I very nicely asked that my eggs have runny yolks." They always come with runny yolks was the reply." I apologised and explained that I had bad runny yolk karma . You can only guess what happened. Yep out they come rock hard as did the other benedict order at the table. To his credit the waiter noticed me sawing into my eggs ( a slight exaggeration) insisted that the cook make some more. I protested and said it would take too long. The eggs arrived as my friends were finishing their breakfast and they were fine. We survived our three nights at the W but one last thing happened that made made us so angry we have labeled your porters / doormen beggars. We had another 5 night in New York and were going to see what the room was like at the W and maybe stay on. I think after reading my review that there was no way that was going to happen. We decided to book the Sofitel. Bags packed and a spring in our step we made it to lexington where the doorman who we had tipped on numerous occasions asked if we would like a cab. Thanks was our reply. My husband helped load the bags into the trunk of the cab opened the door to my side of the cab to get his wallet. As he was doing this he heard the doorman who thought he was done out of a tip say in a sarcastic tone " Never mind the tip Sir" You can imagine how we have dined out on that one over the past two weeks. Sorry to tell you this but our experience at the Sofitel was amazing.You should stay there. We checked in early and because of the attitude of your staff we very apologetic that we were early only to be told "nonsense we have a wonderful room waiting for you." I pulled out my passport only to be told that they were expecting us and just a credit card imprint for extras was required. They even offered us a complimentry drink in the bar. When I enquired about checking my emails i was told that there was a complimentary business center . We love you was our response. they laughed. So, you asked. My advice is for you to re brand the W before it can do any more damage to your brands. We will never return but you have a chance to exceed the expectations of other travelers. We will never ever return nor stay at any of your other brands.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay - Have These Other People Ever Traveled?”
Reviews.Author: bdevido
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the W New York twice in the past three years. Both stays were very nice. Highlights of the hotel: -Great lobby and cool bars in the lobby and next door, Whiskey Blue. -Nice atmosphere in general; I've never noticed worn carpets, outdated bathrooms, etc. My rooms have always been fine. -Great service. We checked in at 11 a.m. on a Saturday. Concierge was helpful, so was staff. -Room size perfectly adequate for a stay in New York. We had a nice view, great W Bed, Bliss bath products. One reviewer commented on an "overly warm" room - it's been twenty degrees in New York for the past week! Woud you rather the room was cold? -Great places to eat lunch, breakfast, dinner all around. Oxford Cafe nearby has good breakfasts. Convenient to everything, too.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - do not give these people your money!”
Reviews.Author: wuhannah
Reviews.Content: So much was wrong with our stay, I hardly know where to start. The main problems were; - my bedding was dirty, I had to report it twice before anybody did anything about it - when you check in, no member of staff bothers to tell you anything about the hotel, you're merely handed a key (where's the gym? The spa? The restaurant? How do we operate the damn lift?!) and there's no information in the rooms to help either - the room was like a sauna so we had to use the unfeasibly loud air-con (loud enough to keep both of us awake), not what one expects in New York City in January! - the plug didn't fit the bath and the water in the sink didn't drain properly - I raised these issues when we checked out of the hotel and the guy on reception acted as though he hears just such complaints all the time and merely berated me for not asking to change rooms (so they clearly KNOW some of their rooms are not up to scratch - I wonder how they allocate such substandard rooms?!) Apparently not all W Hotels are this bad. I'm not going to risk it, pick pretty much any hotel and it'll be cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel, would not return”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_AC80
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not as bad as some of the reviews would suggest, it is definitely not worth the price. The hotel has a great location and a nice lobby and bar area. The beds are really comfortable, and my room was not as small as expected, particularly after reading some of the previous postings. The bathroom was actually quite large, and had a great shower. I also liked the bath products. Having said that, the bathroom was also somewhat mouldy, and the rooms were tired and in need of a renovation. The carpet was quite worn. The hallways are somewhat dark, but I guess that's in keeping with the hotel's decor, but the rooms are inexcusably dark. Lastly, the service at the hotel was extremely uneven. While the concierge was helpful in recommending a restaurant, we were met with extremely indifferent service when we tried to have the hotel hold our luggage. Although 10 or 15 guests were waiting to have somebody take their luggage away to be held, staff members just stood around talking with each other. One, in fact, went outside for a smoke! This was truly unbelievable. Lastly, I was woken up each morning to the sound of housekeeping loudly banging on doors and saying "Housekeeping!". I've stayed in hotels around the world, at all price levels, and this is the first time that I've ever encountered this problem. Stay at this hotel if you can get a great rate, otherwise there are far better hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the other Ws - this one is the worst of the bunch!”
Reviews.Author: TamaBlue
Reviews.Content: After hearing me rave about my stays at the W: Tuscany, my then-boyfriend booked us a room at the flagship W the weekend he proposed. The proposal was great. The room was not. It was TINY and had definite signs of wear (there was an actual hole in the wall of the bathroom where the doorknob had hit a few too many times, or maybe someone's fist? Who knows...) The room I had at the W: Tuscany was huge -- it had a sofa, a huge bed, and a great bathroom. I assumed they were all like this - they're not! Looking around our room, I could tell my husband was like "THIS is what you've been raving about?!?!" At almost $400 a night, we felt cheated. Here's how I see it: since this W is the first one they built in NY, it's the oldest and has the most problems. They made sure future Ws didn't have the same problems, hence the other Ws in NY are probably all really great. Besides the small room, the rest of the our stay was fine. The bath products are Bliss, which was really awesome. We had many drinks in their cool lobby bar and even though we were paying through the nose, the drinks were very strong and well made. To sum up, I still love W hotels, but I would make sure to stay at the Tuscany or the Court the next time. (I left off the W Times Square because I've never stayed there)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: cmohara
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC for my friend's bachelorette weekend and I was extemely dissapointed in the W! One of our friend's had our rooms held with her credit card at a rate of $199/night which is an excellent price. When we arrived, they told her the credit card expired (it was valid at the time the reservations werre made) and that we will now be charged $279/night. No one contacted her regarding the expired card even though it was to simply HOLD the room, not pay for it. In addition to that, we get to the room and it has 2 twin beds in it. We had 2 rooms and 7 people in them. When the reservations were made, they were aware that there were to be 7 people and they still put us in rooms with twin beds. When we confronted them about it, they told us NONE of the rooms have larger beds. Peering out our window, we noticed King, Queen, and Full size beds!!! They ended up rolling cots into our rooms, but the rooms were so small, there was nowhere for them to go. Another negative event that occurred in our room was the horrific experience with room service. We had come home from a night out and 3 of the girls in my room wanted to order pizza. We did not have any menus in our room, so they called room service and orders 3 personal pizzas. When the pizzas arrived they tried to charge them $60 for 3 personal pizzas!! It seemed like some kind of joke! We told the room service guy nevermind and to take them back. He started yelling at us and was quite frightening. He called his manager and the manager said to take them back! The only nice thing surrounding this hotel is Bliss Spa and the Whiskey Bar. This was one of my worst hotel experiences EVER! I will NEVER return to this overpriced DUMP!!

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic and unkempt”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Duo_2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New York for a week for a international security conference in October and through the convention booked at what we thought would be a memorable stay at the W Hotel on Lexington. It also coincided with my partner's birthday and thought that this would be memorable hip place to celebrate. Well the bar area is definetly happening but we were most disappointed about the size and quality of the rooms. There was not even a set of drawers to put your sweaters, socks or underwear away. We had only a cloth shoe organizer inside the dinky closet to store our personal belongings. The carpet had stains and rug pulls in it and our two pieces of luggage had to be stacked on top of each other due to lack of space. This facility needs an upgrade of its rooms.....we stayed the year before at the Ameritania on 230 West 54 Street which was a quarter of the price and twice the space...go there and hop over to the W Hotel for drinks and you will have the best of both worlds. The salt on the wound is that their sales department offered us a credit of points but this amounts to less than one night after spending close to $400 per night. Not good enuff!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: FDFLONDON
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel with the worst reviews I have ever seen on Tripadvisor. To my relief they weren't totally realised, yes the rooms are minute (or cosy as the W staff say) and room furnishings are tired but the common areas and lobby are fine, the concierge sevice first class and we found our room quiet and comfortable. We stayed 2 nights, it would definitely be claustrophobic to stay more. I do not regret staying here but would not do so again. It's just not up to the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Angeladt
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 6 night stay in W New York. I was a little bit worried after reading all the reviews, but I found the hotel very nice. The position is great, you can walk almost everywhere in midtown and there is a plenty of nice restarant near the hotel. The check in and concierge was really good, the booked for us a very nice restaurant for new year's eve. The lobby is great and the atmosphere too. The breakfast is nice and is served in the restaurant or at the bar. Ok, the rooms are very small and the bath is a box, but I have triyed many other hotels in NY and they were quite the same.

Reviews.Title: “Small, dark and depressing...”
Reviews.Author: DLPLondon
Reviews.Content: This W hotel is terribly disappointing. For sure, the lobby is nice but you dont' sleep in it, especially as I was here for business and did not intend to spend much time at the bar. The corridors are desesperately dark. So are the rooms (I have been unlucky enough to stay twice in the hotel). Views for any room below the 16th floor are terrible. Carpets were dirty, lighting depressing. Air conditionning was stupidely noisy. Finally, bathrooms have no bath. Location is good thouhg and service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JeanW-6
Reviews.Content: Right after booking our room for the W Hotel on Lexington Avenue in New York, I started to read traveler's reviews. I was concerned by all the negative comments about the 4 star hotel and expressed my worries to Hotwire. All my trepidations were for nothing. The lobby was impressive and the room very comfortable. The subtle essence of spa follows you from the lobby to the elevator to the room itself. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was quite small, but the hotel's location and its other amenities more than make up for this. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W in the world”
Reviews.Author: torot
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at W's all over the world. The service is always impeccable, but the W New York is horrible. The concierge assure us he set up our reservations for us at a restaurant , when we arrived there was no reservation, on 3 separate occasions we never received a wakeup call. Our room was so small that a full sized bed only had a 18 inches from the end of the bed to the wall. The shower was clogged, we called on 3 separate occasions to have it fixed and no one even attempted to fix it. We complained to management twice, only to have them tell us that the hotel was full and that the wasnâ€™t much they could do. DO NOT STAY at the W New York , all the other Wâ€™s in the city are great.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agents honest view”
Reviews.Author: asj2
Reviews.Content: Being a Travel Agent i thought i would add my views on my recent stay at the W New York ! I have been to New York several times and have stayed in Hotels ranging from 3 to 5 star so with the 4 star rating Virgin Holidays give the W my expectations were high.The lobby area is beautiful and very,very busy after dark as it seems most of New York pops in for a drink after work ! We were allocated a room on the 16th floor in one of W's "spectacular" rooms i was really concerned about the room size after reading the reviews on here as the whole point of the trip was to take advantage of the weak $ against the Â£ and do my Christmas shopping so we had taken 2 huge cases !! Anyway when we stepped out of the lift on the 16th floor i was shocked how dark the corridors were and actually how depressing it felt.On entering our room i was happy to see it was far from small there was plenty of room and the view was decent too...however ....it was so dark the lighting was very poor except in the bathroom which was fine.The carpet was dirty i have to say but apart from that just fine and i didn't plan on spending my 4 days sat in a Hotel room anyway ! I found the staff very friendly and the whatever,whenever service on the front desk was excellent the staff really knew their stuff ! In summary it depends what your going to New York for ! The W is for the hip and trendy the decor,lighting etc is all to try and create that cool look ! The staff were excellent the room a good size,bar prices about average for a 4* Hotel ($10 for a white wine $7 for a beer) and the location just fantastic everything is on your doorstep.Yes its pretty dark in the rooms but do you go to New York to sit in your room 24 hours a day ? If your in your 20-30's looking for a hip Hotel with a great bar area in a central location go for it ! otherwise look else where there are plenty of fantastic Hotels in New York !!

Reviews.Title: “W stands for "we don't get it" from DC_dinks”
Reviews.Author: NYMotherFussers
