Reviews.Content: The W Hotels have a recurring campaign on W-words--whenever, why not, etc. For us, it was "we don't get it." As the flagship hotel, the quality of the rooms were far from what we expected. Manhattan hotel rooms are tiny, but in the regular-sized room the closet door barely cleared the bottom of the bed. The lobby was quite nice though, and they had a handy hot chocolate and marshmallow station near the elevators. But aside from the lounge-like atmosphere of the lobby, we won't stay at the hotel again, mostly because of the size of the rooms. For half the price, you can stay at a Choice Hotel where the rooms aren't bigger, but your expectations will certainly won't be completely let down.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the other W properties”
Reviews.Author: meg321
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note not to stay at this hotel! Overpriced, small rooms, and extremely poor service! Save your money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and we had the suite!”
Reviews.Author: J.Cruz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very funky but I thought with a suite we would have a decent sized room. Unfortunatley the room was very small and the bathroom like a cupboard! Beside this the hotel itself is really nice and I found the staff very help indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the W - Lexington Avenue”
Reviews.Author: NGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W because the Mercer was fully booked and you get what you pay for. For 450 dollars per night one could reasonable expect a fantastic room and great service. The hotel room was tiny, shabby and damp. The staff were dismissive and basically ignored our requests (3 times) for someone to take a look at the issues we had with the room. The bathroom was tiny, there was mould growing in the carpet, there was a cigarette burn in one of the blinds... I could go on. If you want a room of this standard (but 3 times the size) pay a quarter of the price and stay in 2 star accomodation close by (I have in the past!!) All in all the W Lexington put a huge dampner on what should have been a fabulous weekend in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Desperately Needed!!”
Reviews.Author: cricket500
Reviews.Content: I concur with most of the negative reviews. Very expensive, yet very shabby. Bathroom is tiny, dirty and smelled of mildew. Desk had sticky stuff on it. Linens were worn. Slip cover on chair worn and dirty. Light in entranceway burned out. Decidedly downscale.

Reviews.Title: “great location, no ventilation”
Reviews.Author: lizzy217
Reviews.Content: my fiance and i stayed at the W NYC over the thanksgiving weekend. w hotels are trying so hard to build a chic culture for travelers. they should work on making rooms habitable. our room was small, had no ventilation and the bathroom was full of mold, not what you expect for $300 a night. the concierge was helpful in getting us in to nightclubs and restaurants. check in was a nightmare, they had a staff of 3 on one of the busiest holidays of the year. we arrived at 4 and were informed our room was not ready. if you want to be in the middle of the shopping area and tourist spots this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby!”
Reviews.Author: digideals
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and had a very decent stay. The rooms are typically small in New York, so we were quite happy with the accomidations. The bars were trendy and location was great. Nothing in New York is cheap, so this wasn't the most amazing deal, but for a trendy spot, clean room that is across the Waldorf, it's a great stay. It's original W location, so it needs a few updates, but on the whole, it's a great little hotel to crash in. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the negative comments about this hotel and the chain in total. W is just a BAD chain. They can talk the talk but haven't a clue about how to walk the walk. Wahtever Whenever means Whatever W wants and Whenever W wants to do it This property is the worst in the chain Too bad .. so much potential so little delivery If you want a decent hotel experience pick just about any brand except W. If you want horror stories and just pure entertainment about bad W experiences email me. don.brown@brownchild.com

Reviews.Title: “not cheap enough”
Reviews.Author: Alexiosp
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since the Ws look cool! But after getting there and looking at the room we asked for our money back and left within minutes. Tiny room, dark, bad customer service. The room looked clean but we didn't stay enough to really pay attention. For the money they ask, it is better to go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “To All Honeymooners - Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCHoneymooners
Reviews.Content: We originally had planned to spend 3 nights at the Waldorf Astoria but were persuaded by the travel agents to stay at the W New York instead. Money was not an major factor. But a good, clean hotel was. We arrived at the W after carrying our own bags into reception and onwards up to our room. The staff at reception were unfriendly. Our first room was completely disgusting. Tiny, even compared to New York standards, dark, dirty and very much in need of a total renovation. The furniture was worn beyond belief. See photos for clarification. The bathroom was tiled and again the pictures will speak for themselves. This is not the way you want to spend your honeymoon. The bed had stained sheets. The list of complaints went on and on. The hallways were dark and dirty and there was a bad smell in general. The reception area had dimmed lighting and candles lighting morning, noon and night. Wonder why? Possibly to prevent guests from seeing just how bad the hotel is in need of further renovations. We went down to reception and complained about the room and its standards. We also explained we were on honeymoon - which made absolutely no difference whatsoever. We were moved to another room - which was just the same (decor wise) only bigger in size. At this stage, we rang reception again and asked to speak with the manager. She rang the room back and we explained the position. I told her that the hotel as per the website looks totally different to the reality. She said that the only floor that had been renovated so far was the 4th floor. All other floors were of the same standard we had been given. There was no apology forthcoming but it was agreed that we would be moved to the 4th floor the following day. After more problems (with the reception staff) - we were finally moved to the 4th floor late on the 2nd evening in NY. The new room was again tiny but at least it was clean and slightly more up to date decor wise. Even the bell boy commented on the difference in smells from the 10 floor to the 4th. The room on the 4th floor we had still didnt gut the mustard as far as we were concerned. So BEWARE. The hotel manager at no time followed up our complaint to see if we were ok or indeed satisfied. SO if you get the 4TH FLOOR - you should be ok. But its not worth the money you will pay. We paid $504.00 per night (without breakfast) to stay at this hotel - we feel it was total extortion. We could have stayed in the Waldorf for an extra $50/$70 per night or Fitzpatricks for under $500. The Waldorf is directly across the street from the W. I have stayed in Fitzpatricks before (no comparison to the W New York). Our major regret is that we didnt go with our own gut feeling and stick with the Waldorf. Since our trip people has told us about the Marriot in Times Square and given it a good review. We only discovered Tripadvisors after we came back - I will always use it before booking a hotel in future. If anyone is considering staying at this hotel - we strongly suggest that you reconsider your options. There are other cheaper hotels available with MUCH better rooms and facilities. We thought Lexington Ave was the place to stay - if you want to shop, shop its great but if you want to enjoy a few days, sightseeing, wining and dining like us - you might be better off somewhere like Times Square, where there are alot more restaurants to chose from & nightlife on offer. We recovered 1/2 of the hotel cost from the travel agent (as a gesture of goodwill) . Even with all that went on with the hotel - we had a blast in NY - what a brilliant city. We will definately be back again.. but will stay well clear of the W New York.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - be sure not to pay anything close to rack rates”
Reviews.Author: Gigi1234
Reviews.Content: Great location in midtown; close to Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Station, 24-hour drugstores and delis. Two blocks away from two main subway lines. Also, the Bliss Spa products in the bathroom were terrific. Having a large desk with notepads, post-its, etc. was nice. However, it was a good thing I didn't have any work to do because the lighting was very dim. The TV Internet access didn't work and the clock radio took a little time to figure out. The amount of W-branded tchotckes was a little much. Tthe condition and the size of the room were merely adequate. Heating/air conditioning system was very noisy. It was a great value for the price we got via Travelzoo ($200 per night w/o taxes, prepaid), so overall we were happy; we didn't spend much time in the room. We would have been sorely disappointed if we had paid any more than we did!

Reviews.Title: “My Least Favorite Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CatPaw7
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at the W NY for business purposes. It's location keeps me coming back rather than the hotel itself. Although the lobby is lively and hip, the rooms are truly showing their age. The carpet, bedding, wall coverings are in dire need of a refurb. Although the hotel itself is not really old, the amount of traffic through it has taken its toll. I also repeatedly have had bug problems- from spiders to a black fly infestion- these issues are not deemed worthy to be addressed when calling the "Whatever" number. Literally one night I had 6 huge black flies in my room, called 3x, and no one ever showed up to kill them. Also, rooms are the smallest among the NY hotels in which I regularly stay. Turn down service/ chocolates are infrequent. Rarely get any sort of benefit/upgrade from being a Starwood Platinum member. 2x they have given me a room with a twin bed b/c they have run out of others- even though I'm a Starwood Platinum. Also, the elevators are excrutiatingly slow. Allow yourself 10 mintues to exit the hotel between 7:30-8:00 am. The Doubletree Metropolitan next door has much larger, brighter, cleaner rooms with recently refurbed bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki-Morris
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in an excellent location. Rooms are quite small but very nice and it is expensive but I think this to be expected in big cities. Attended a function whilst staying here which was excellent, well run and the food was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid W Lexington Ave.”
Reviews.Author: namoo
Reviews.Content: I recently paid $500 for a room at the W Hotel on Lexington Ave. The lobby is classic W. I fully expected a matchbox sized room but did not anticipate chipping paint, no bathtubs but showers with plastic curtains, heating system dating back several decades, electronics such as phones from the1980s and a sofa chair that was brown and tattered from overuse. The only response to my complaint was that the hotel had not been renovated--no kidding! A 3 star hotel posing and priced like a 5 star. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: jtaylorabq
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at the W for three nights in early November. I was a bit skeptical about booking this hotel based on prior negative reviews but it was conveniently located to our business meetings so we thought weâ€™d give it a fair shake. Happily, we found The W to be wonderful. The service was excellent. We did not encounter a single W staff member either in person or on the phone who was not at the top of their game. Kevin at the front desk was exceptionally helpful throughout our stay and we appreciated his assistance with each of requests. The rooms are on the small side but it's New York and space is at a premium! The rooms are also expensive but itâ€™s New York and again, space is at a premium! We stayed on the club floor (4th) and had a lovely room with the Starwood signature comfy bed, a flat panel TV, DVD player, desk, and a good sized closet. The bathroom was a little tight but it had a large shower with a terrific shower head, a vanity, and a pedestal sink. The towels, washcloths, and robes were quite plush and showed no signs of thinning or wear. We enjoyed the generous selection of Bliss toiletries that were replenished every day! There was, indeed not room for two people to maneuver in there but who wants to have company while youâ€™re in the bathroom?! We would absolutely stay at The W again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, worst value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Brasil_Argentina
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the W New York this past weekend and what a disappointment. The hotel is old and the rooms need a big renovation. It is not a W! It is worse than the Holiday Inn! We paid over $980 for 2 nights and were given a tiny, tiny room (with a double bed which was supposed to be a queen bed!) that didn't even fit our luggage. The room was on the 3rd floor facing a garage building and garbage cans. The carpet was dirty, the air conditioning made weird noises and the paint was coming off the wall. We called to complain and thank god a super nice guy tried to help but told us nothing else was available. After 1 hour with him on the phone he got us a different room. However, it was the same size and similar bad shape, just on a higher floor. The bathroom was tiny too, without a bathtube but with a shower curtain and no doors (which meant super wet floors). Seriously, we had stayed at the W Times Square twice and it was definitely worth the price tag, but this one is awful! This hotel cannot be considered a W. It does not live up to the chain's standards. I understand this was the first W ever, but if they want to keep up the image they need to renovate this NOW. For now, you might as well pay $300 for the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, massively overated”
Reviews.Author: jhorsfieldbradbury
Reviews.Content: If the lobby were anything to go by, the hotel would be great. The bar looks very cool. However, once you enter the elevator, it all goes wrong. The room was tiny and dark and shabby. The carpet was worn, the closet did not close because the ironing board hanging there was too big for it, and broken. The television was old, the bathroom tiny, and it smelt musty. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere- I did”
Reviews.Author: Madcongar
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at the W Westwood in LA. What an amazing hotel. I love it there. Boy, what a surprise the W New York was. The lobby is grand but the rooms were horrible. I ended up checking out and going to the Four Seasons for only $100 more a night. The room was dirty (hair on the sofa), the wall sockets were misfit and dangling, the carpet was ripped, and the wallpaper and plaster was peeling. While the manager went out of his way to try to accommodate me, the hotel was booked and they were unable to give me a better room. I would put this hotel in the Ramada, Howard Johnson catagory. I would never stay here, especially for that price ($609), and i'm glad I went to teh 4 Seasons- It was perfect. Do yourself a favor and book elsewhere. I should have listened to the negative reviews here. Don't make my mistake.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get an upgrade, the experience is pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel, I requested a king bed, which the (nice) woman who checked me in noted. However, she put us in a TINY room with a queen bed. I called downstairs to complain adn was told rather rudely that there was nothing I could do short of talking to a manager and that a manager was not available at that time. I waited a few minutes for a manager to call me, and she was actually very accommodating. She said that only 5% of their rooms (including suites) had kind beds so keep that in mind when booking. However, she did upgrade us to a larger room, which made our stay MUCH more pleasant. If no other rooms had been available or she had not upgraded us, my review woudl only be a 2 or 3. The beds are very comfortable, though, and the bathroom in our upgraded room was only slightly small, not unbearably small. The lobby bar is quite a loud scene so after a long day, it was not quite what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny room but nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in late Sept 2006 on business. The hotel is at a great location - it was 3 blocks from my client's office and very close to shopping and restaurants in the evening. I've stayed at other hotels in the area and been bothered by street noise into the wee hours of the morning, even on high floors, but I could hear nothing from my room and had a couple of good nights' sleep. Check-in was quick, with the staff friendly but not necessarily memorable. The room was incredibly small, but fully equipped with everything I needed: great W bed, tv, mini bar, Internet and desk, robe, and wonderful Bliss spa products. The bathroom didn't have a tub, but I didn't need one. Room service was quite good; I had dinner here one night and breakfasts both mornings. Delivery was very quick and on time when pre-scheduled. My only complaint was that my office manager booked the room through Starwood's main line and was told we could get an AAA rate by showing my card at check-in (significant savings: $499 down to about $350). Unfortunately when checking in, the front desk said the information was wrong and would not give me the rate. They insisted "anyone at the hotel" would have told us the card number had to be given at booking over the phone. Also, a fedex package was waiting for me when I arrived and I was told it would be delivered shortly. When it hadn't come 3 hours later (by 11 pm), I had to call again; it was brought up promptly after that. Overall the hotel was fine for my purpose, but I don't think I'd spend $500/night on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: VikingMn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W because a friend recommended it. We checked in and got up to our room. It was very stuffy. Especially for our rate. We went downstairs and the front desk agent changed us. We had dinner reservations so we didn't go up to the other room. We had our luggage put in the conceirge while we were gone. Getting back to the hotel, there was a long line at the check-in and we had misplaced our room key. There was a nice gentlemen in the lobby who said hello and asked if he could help us. I jokingly told him our situation and if he could bypass the line, I was so surprised he went right to work. He said his name was Emron (spelling) and he asked me my name. Within 2 minutes he confirmed our room, got a key and a bellman taking our luggage up to our room. He introduced me to another manager who's name was Ali and said he could assist me with anything else. I was impressed at the level of service and committment the two gave us. It was like Emron knew what to say and what to do. He was very professional and the both were very friendly. The follow up was great. I've stayed at many hotels but the W made me feel very important.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: jdsh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only one good thing to offer - the cental location. My husband and I could not believe this hotel room when we walked in, it was so small it could only just fit in the bed. The carpets were so dirty. The bathroom was so small you had to close the door to use the sink. The corridors were so poorly lit i assume that was to hide the state of the carpet. The staff were so unfriendly and unhelpful. The door men were trying to offer us overpriced and not always insured black cabs instead of the yellow cabs. Enough said I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: KP&TP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property 5 or 6 times over the past year and a half, and have joked with other travelers that it is the cruise ship of hotels - the rooms are tiny and you cannot fall down in the bathrooms because they are so small! I have had two rooms where when you sit on the toilet you are smashed up against the sink - seriously. Having said that, the beds are always comfortable and the showers have always worked well for me. As a frequent business traveler, those are the things that matter most to me, so I keep coming back. As a corporate option, we can choose the W or the Waldorf and many more people at my firm complain about the service and rooms at the Waldorf. It is funny how small most of the rooms are, they don't have dressers or night stands because they won't fit!!!! If you are staying for a week or longer, this probably wouldn't work for you. Also, some of the rooms I've had there is no place to put your suitcase on the stand, which I like to do for dirty clothes, keeping things neat in the room, etc. The maid service has always been great for me, although I am a tipper so maybe that helps. Have never had any service problems at this property. Would I recommend it? I'll answer that with a qualified yes. Sometimes you might get a dark room with a view of a black brick wall, others you get a street facing room that's quite comfortable - you can always try to change if you can't stand the first room. Personally I haven't bothered changing rooms since I am only there by myself in the room and am working most of the time anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AussieBailey
Reviews.Content: Very small room - so small there was no where to put a suitcase. The airconditioner sounded like a train so I couldnt get any sleep because it was too hot without it. The windows did not open, even an inch. The carpet was torn and very dirty. The water was brown, yes brown. We were told it "was the city water". Hmmm, I go to NYC every couple of months and have never had brown water in a hotel in 5 year. I chose this hotel based on the W reputation. This was my first experience in a W. Based on this, I will pass. The room was not any cheaper than the other nicer hotels in the area. No one from my company will be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “W=Worst hotel I have ever stayed at for the ridiculous price.”
Reviews.Author: CyberGreen
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by my travel agent, who seemed to think that the chic flashy lobby and bar was what we wanted. How wrong. On arrival we were escorted to our room by Dennis who had better things to do , than help us with our bags . He opened the door , no words exchanged and that was it. No tip for him. We arrived at midnight and the hotel was not expecting us, we ended up in a room that had 2 airconditioning units outside, that were louder than the plane, that we had spent 15 hours getting to New York on. Ironically enough having the airconditioners outside didnt actually mean that the air conditioning would be working in our room. The room was small stuffy, dirty. The bathroom was small, dirty and mouldy. What a pity they decided to put all the money into the lobby and bar and forget about everything level 3 upwards. We changed rooms because of the noise, Room 323 should be avoided and turned into a cleaning cupboard, which sadly would not get much use at the W. Fridge was dirty and we were also charged for drinks that we never consumed. Seems to be a trick of theirs. Didn't eat at the hotel as they had taken enough of my money in ripping me off with the room rate. Staff rude, and surly. A very disappointing start to our holiday, our travel agent at House of Travel has been told & we certainly won't be using the W or our travel agent again.

Reviews.Title: “Suggest you book elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LeoneFB
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel. Yes, I know that all the hotel rooms in NY are small, but this was ridiculous! I've stayed in other NY hotels, but never in a room this small. Even the elevators were tiny. I will say the bed and linens were nice and comfy. There was no where to put anything! Thank goodness we weren't in the room much. The closet was tiny - not even big enough to open up your suitcase in- and there was no light in it. The thing that disappointed me the most was that there was only a shower - no bathtub. I know that doesn't matter to a lot of people, but it is important to me and considering I booked the room through the hotel's website I really think they should include that in the room description. They didn't. There was also no shower cap, so I had to work to keep from getting my very long hair wet when I showered each day. The person who said in another review that the bathroom was a nice size obviously had a different type of room than we did. We could brush our teeth in the sink, take a pee, and shave a leg in the shower all at the same time. The location of the hotel was good - about 7 blocks from Grand Central. Also, the Bliss spa products in the bathroom were very nice. I did have a facial in the spa one day and it was one of the best I've ever had. I do recommend the spa - they know what they're doing there. Keep in mind that this is a very trendy hotel and there is always a lot of buzz going on in the lobby. Oh.. and we also got a wakeup call early one morning that we did not ask for. All in all - go spend the same amount of money at one of the other million hotels in Manhattan and get yourself a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here, Ever!”
Reviews.Author: DTS1
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by Corporate Affaris. It was competely a horrible experience. The lobby is very close to the club/bar. Very loud. The hotel tries so hard to be "hip" that it parodies itself. Techno music plays at all hours in the very small elevators (that rarely work). The room for $479 was very small with a really tiny bathroom. The bathroom actually had a whole in the wall . I could not get into the room with the entry card . I had to call Security who also struggled to open the door. It is an old run-down hotel with minimum updates that tries to market itself as a hip "in spot". I have no doubt it is a fad that will fail soon. There is nothing gracious about this place. Loud, tasteless and self-promoting from a bunch of wannabees. The bed, however, was comfortable. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You'd Expect from the W”
Reviews.Author: InSearchofEscape
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my husband while he was on his mid-tour break from Iraq and we were both very dissapointed by our room. We booked a "Wow" room which should only be allowed to be called "Wow" unless it is followed by "what a terrible room." It was very cramped and some of the fixtures were broken in the bathroom. We had to request that the room be made up as it was not by 8 PM. The booking got very screwed up and I had to check out twice. The room was terribly expensive, which is to be expected of New York, but we would have had much better accomadations for the same price down the street. The elevator is tricky to use which is not fun when also carrying baggage. I wrote to the manager of the hotel with my polite complaints and never received a response. I will say however, that the Bliss spa products were quite lovely and the concierge was very helpful. The lobby (completely decked out in Jonathon Adler design) was nice and got quite crowed, even on a weeknight. I suppose no one wanted to go back to their cramped, messy rooms! It was a big let down after some very nice stays at other Ws in Chicago, New Orleans, and San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Snow_Richmond
Reviews.Content: Service is extremely poor. Prices are obscene for closet sized standard rooms. Hallways are dimly lit, probably to hide the fact that the carpets desperately need replacing. The staff seem to think they are movie stars. We rang the pathetic 'Whenever/Wherever' service line three times to have someone look at, among other issues, the room safe and they never arrived. You must constantly line up for the front desk, the concierge and even to use the lifts. Can you believe it!! They overcharged by $150 for send a 30 page fax to Australia. They tried to charge $37 for a minibar item that was never consumed. They also tried to double charge for the room. The bell hop was a completely out of line. When we came back for our stored luggage, we eventually found it thrown in a service hallway, upside down and damaged. The management has a well polished marketing propaganda that they serve you when you ask a simple 'why'. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fine, but more suited for folks who just need a bed and shower.”
Reviews.Author: nmanning
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the W on Lexington to be fine for our stay in NYC. However, I would say that this hotel is more ideal for those of you who simply want a clean room, bed and shower. If you're someone who prefers to "hang out" in your hotel room, then another hotel may be more suitable. The rooms are definitely on the small side and updates / renovations in need. But, for the very reasonable per-night deal I scored through Hotwire, our room was suitable for us. A note of caution, however. When we booked through Hotwire, we were automatically assigned a smoking room. When I asked for a non-smoking room, I was given the run-around at the front desk that if one opened up, they'd assign us one. That is, until I told them that I was a Starwood Preferred Guest. Then all of a sudden, a non-smoking room miraculously opened up. So, if you want to stay here and book it through an Internet discout site, then I highly recommend you become a Starwood Preferred Guest. You can sign-up online. Otherwise, expect less-than-friendly service at check-in time. After flashing my Starwood Preferred Guest card, I was suddenly treated like royalty. The room was clean, as were the sheets, towels and robes. No bedbugs. Saw one teeny, tiny spider who had probably hitched a ride on my shoe through the streets of Manhattan. But, nothing gross. The lighting, television and phones were all in working order. We stayed on the 9th floor and it was very quiet. The beds are really soft and comfortable. You'll definitely get a great night's sleep. Again, bathrooms are tiny, but the Bliss spa products are wonderful!!! They smell so good!!! Had no problems with the billing. No weird charges appeared on my statement, as I had read they had on other reviewers' bills. The Whiskey Blue bar downstairs was great and seemed to be full of energy during the later hours of the night. All in all, I'd stay here again, but I'd do it at the discounted rate through Hotwire. I'd never pay full price for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern, and hip”
Reviews.Author: dngrockstar
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped out of my cab til the moment I left, I was treated with nothing but excellent service at the W! Check-in was quick and I was even offered complimentary drinks at the bar. I was loving my stay already! The interior of the hotel was very chic and modern, and truly fit for a young hip crowd. There's a nice bar and lounge right at the lobby, if you want to have a couple of drinks before heading out. The rooms were indeed small, but had all the amenities I needed. The room included a t.v., dvd player, cd player, a mini-frigde that included an assortment of drinks, an iron, blowdryer, bath products, a food basket, and desk with internet access. Hailing a cab was effortless, since there was always one waiting outside. The concierge was extremely helpful in giving us information of nearby restaurants as well as restaurants around the city. They also gave very detailed insight of the happening nightclubs around New York which was extremely helpful! The location was great. It was within walking distance to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, and Bloomindales on 59th. If you want to take the subway, there is the 6 train you could catch on 51st, just two blocks north of the hotel. Very convenient! I had a great experience during my stay at the W, and wouldn't mind returning!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: robertcut
Reviews.Content: We've been to New York several times, but this was our first stay at this W. We had stayed at the Times Square location and we were very impressed with that hotel. This was just an average hotel. It didn't look as modern as some of the newer W hotels, but the price was lower than the others and it's a convenient location. This is the oldest of the W hotels and it's starting to show. The staff were friendly, but not anything near the customer service we experienced at other W hotels. They were just average. The rooms were somewhat disappointing, especially the size. The bed was almost the length of the room. We had the WOW room and it was really tight. The furniture and the bedding looked okay, but again, not as nice or upscale as some other W hotels. The air condition was not very good and the paint around it was peeling. The desk was fine and the bed was comfortable, as usual. The bathroom was small too, and looked somewhat worn. There were some tiles and wallpaper that had been replaced, but the quality of work was very poor. All in all, our stay here was fine, but not as good as you would expect for a W hotel. You might want to consder paying extra for a larger room. We might stay here again, but there are other hotels that we consider as well.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Rooms Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: beach567
Reviews.Content: This is the worst W I've ever stayed at!!! I'm not joking when I say our room was no larger than 10" x 11"!!! The queen size bed took up the entire room w/ a tiny little desk in the corner. The tv looked like it was going to fall off the stand. Luckily we weren't in the room a lot but this hotel is NOT worth the money! The maids were terrible- they barely made the rooms up and on the last day they didn't even come after we requested they make the room up when we went out for the day! The bar/lobby scene was the best part as it was nice to come back for drinks after dinner before going to bed. I heard the W in times Square is much better- think i will try that next time...

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed in Starwood”
Reviews.Author: LeMonde
Reviews.Content: I was spending a night in the city and wanted to "splurge" so I tried for a 4-star hotel through Priceline. This is what I got. No way, no how is this place 4 stars. It's one of those places that are more concerned with being "cool" or "trendy" than with the guests' comfort. The room was tiny and not very clean, and I was told that no bigger rooms were available. The A/C barely worked; you could only feel it if you were sitting right next to it. People came up to look at it twice and still couldn't fix it. The room was dark -- good thing I didn't want to read -- and the hallways were downright creepy, they were so poorly lit. The bathroom had only a shower stall, something I find unacceptable in a "four-star" hotel. Next time I want a 4-star hotel, I'll be sure to avoid "midtown east" when bidding. This place was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “W was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: slacker5555
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the W. After winning a bid via priceline, I immediately checked out the reviews here. Naturally, I became a bit nervous since they weren't exactly glowing, PLUS I was showing up with a ton of luggage since we were en route to Australia AND a 3-year old child. I worried we'd be treated like lepers asking to share their Cosmos. But, I needn't have worried. The staff welcomed us from the moment we stepped out of the cab. Front desk was exceptionally pleasant -- upgrading us to a King bed room and ordering up complimentary icecream for our child. The styling of the hotel was far more interesting than most we have stayed. I do admit that there are some tired areas of the hotel rooms, but overall, the room was pleasant and the Bliss spa products were lovely. We had a wonderful experience (at a wonderful price).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel - but Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: WillieLoman
Reviews.Content: There are a couple good things about this hotel and I will mention them first. The staff were extremely friendly, the location is convenient, and the bar in the lobby is pretty cool. Aside from that, it is little better than a Best Western with decor that was trendy in the 80's. The first room I was given was supposedly a "Wow" room, but was so small that I had to turn sideways to get past the bed. I called the desk immediately and asked if they hadn't possibly put me in a lower class of room. They were apologetic, and moved me to a preferred room which was the size of a small-to-average normal room. However, the upholstered chair was dirty and stained, the rug looked dirty and worn, and the bathroom was so small that when I sat on the toilet the sink dug into my ribs! I ordered room service two nights and the burger was overcooked one night and my drink order was wrong BOTH nights. After that, I went out for food. The bathtub had hair in it - and it wasn't mine. It was extremely hot while I was there, but the ice machines on my floor AND the floor above mine AND the floor below mine were not working. A staff member in the hallway nicely offered to bring me a bucket of ice and when he did, there was dirt in the ice! I had a pair of pants laundered and the cost on the Laundry Form indicated that it would cost $15. Upon check out I noticed that they had charged me $112 for laundry. They removed the charge when I brought it to their attention. The whole hotel was badly in need of renovation, especially the rooms, and one of the staff said renovations will take place next year. Her exact words were: "and we REALLY need it!" I couldn't agree more.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old, trired hotel - BIG DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Jake_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were not happy at all. If the booking would not have been done through and we had already paid upfront for 2 rooms x 3 nights I would have walked away from the hotel IMMEDIATELY after arriving to our room. So what was wrong: - Rooms are dirty and old. In addition for "normal" wear and tear there is stains all over the place and it's just DIRTY. We changed rooms TWICE during our check-in process and got slightly better rooms but be warned that even their "nice" rooms are having stains like one shown at my picture - Coridors are in very dark obviously to hide dirt, stains, holes and ruptures in the carpert - Rooms are RELLY TINY even by NYC standards. - Sfaff was rude and not helpful. They did not give us what we had booked but changed us to other type rooms. What was good: - Location is great! Neighbourhood is nice & safe (by NYC large-city standard) and everything is close by. Will NEVER visit ANY W hotel after this just awfull experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Mari1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in April for three nights. This was our first trip to New York and we saw all the sights! The W was located in a perfect place and we were able to walk to many places and we took a taxi for places that were too far. The hotel is very chic and modern. The decor in the lobby was great and we enjoyed lounging there and having a few drinks in the afternoons. The drinks were great, as were the appetizers! We had a beautiful room with a view to Lexington Ave. The room was clean. My expereince at the W was a great one and I will definetly return there on my next stay at NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience-Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChrisieD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W hotel New York on Lexington for my best friend's birthday between June 30 and July 3. I was weary at first because I read so many negative reviews so I was expecting problems from the beginning. I am sorry to disappoint you but there is NOTHING negative to say here. We got an awesome rate that included parking in NYC (which by the way costs $50/day). Everyone at the hotel was very friendly when we arrived. I asked them if they are able to upgrade us and they did for free!!! The suite we had was beautiful. I did get a look at the room similar to the one I originally booked and that room is very nice too. The room is small but this is common in NYC. If you want a big room, get a suite or stay in New Jersey. I must say, the suite made our stay very comfortable, however we did not spend too much time in our room. The room was very clean and well stocked. Some of the staff even bothered to learn our names. They were very helpful and informative. Just a note to the expense of this hotel. Sometimes you are not paying for the room, but you are paying for the time of year you go. No standard hotel room is worth $300 and up-you pay a premium if you go at a busy time. Go at a slow time to ensure better rates and more personal attention. The location of this hotel is perfect...right in the centre of everything and less than a $10 cab ride away from all attractions. We walked most of the time because the weather was so beautiful. My advise to everyone is shop around for rates in NYC hotels, negotiate and be friendly when you arrive. I was expecting a snobby hotel-but I was very friendly and spoke to people with respect. You will be surprised how far you get in life by being nice to people. Also, I suggest to tip well when you get great service. These people work very hard at their job. I spent about $30 tipping total which isn't much because it ensured great service. We are planning to stay here again. If you go, ask them if they remember Christine and Nathalie from Toronto!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the W”
Reviews.Author: JDP527
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W at the end of June for business. This was my first time ever to NYC, so I have nothing to compare it too, but I really enjoyed everything. The room was clean, had a beautiful down comforter. Yeah, it was small, but it was perfect for just me. The staff was wonderful and very kind and helpful. The hotel always smelled clean and refreshing, the shower was great. My only complaint was the constant honking of horns all night long from the street below, but I guess that is just NYC! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2006
Reviews.Content: I love the W hotel chain and have stayed at several different locations. I have stayed at this particular hotel 6 times. This hotel has problems, plenty of them. The only time to stay at this hotel is when they are running a special. I have been able to get rates between $129-189 dollars a night at this hotel. That is a bargain for New York City in the neighborhood where this hotel is located. The rooms need to be renovated. The blinds are tattered, as are the towels. The rooms are very small unless you get a suite. Service is sketchy execept for the Whatever/Whenever desk and the doorman, they are usually very helpful. With that being said, I stay at this hotel because there are some positive factors. All rooms regardless of size have the heavenly bed. They have Bliss products in all of the bathrooms and the spa is right next door to the hotel. The location is great, 50th and Lex. You can walk comfortably to most places in NY. I would not recommend this hotel to tourists visiting NY for the first time because you will feel out of place and the staff doesn't seem to like the camera touting fanny pack wearing type of guests. The bar and lounge are very nice and comfortable. Good drinks, expensive but this is NY. Bottom line, if I had to stay here for more than $200 a night, it would be an extreme waste but if they're running a special offer which they frequently do, then I would recommend it, especially if you want a hip atmosphere in a good location without paying too much.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of Two Rooms”
Reviews.Author: missintuitive
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in other W hotels. In fact, I am a Starwood gold preferred member which entitles one to a free room upgrade and late (4pm) checkout. When I saw a room rate of $199 including parking and two free drinks on W's website I jumped on it. The W NewYork has a great location. Its only two blocks from the 6 or E/B train and only four or 5 blocks from time square. The doormen were not as friendly as I remember them before (I was a guest at the hotel 6 years ago) but the lobby was still very nice. I stepped up to the desk expecting to check my lugage since it was only 12:30 or so and was told that they had a room ready. I was also told that I was going to be upgraded from a wonderful room to a wow room. The front desk staff were friendly. When we arrived to our upper level floor, the hall smelled like there was a water leak and mildew. I have bad allergies so I immediately took note of the hallway. When my fiance and I opened the door to our room on a higher floor I did say "Wow" but not for the expected reason. Our room was super small (even for NYC standards) and it had the same smell as the hallway. I was disappointed. The paint was peeling a little, the bedspread looked extra lumpy and backboard needed repair. True it was a cheap rate but I have paid less for more (and I would have been exceptionally upset if I paid $299-$399 for this room). I called downstairs and was told that I would have to wait until after 1:30 to switch rooms. I decided that I would probably need a face to face talk with the deskclerk so I headed down stairs. I explained the situation and was promptly given another room. It was a suite with two plasma tv's, a living room area, a larger bathroom (still only a shower), better robes than the other room, and most importantly no mildew smell! It was an exceptional room, decor and all. Overall, I have seen the worst and (near) best that the hotel has to offer. If you pay $300 per night you will be disappointed with a Cozy, Wow or Wonderful room as they are supersmall. The suite is wonderful and reminds you of what you would expect out of a W room. If I had to do it over again I would probably just go to another W location (they are all in great areas) and shell out the $75-$80 more for the room only because it I would have been disappointed if I had to stay in the first room and obtaining the suite was a courtesy I can not come to expect everytime (unless I pay for it;0)

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaParislover
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay was the worst in NY ever. The carpets in the rooms were soiled and torn; in some places the carpet was gone and we could see the concrete slab. For over 36 hours a room service tray from another room remained on the floor in the hallway. Rooms are TINY. The wait staff in the restaurant is way too pushy, the food was adequite, but no more. In the evenings, the lobby is a mad house. The bar is packed and the music is loud. The front desk is snotty. Breakfast for two ran us $60. without the tip; this consisted of coffee, juice, bacon & eggs, and toast. This hotel needs a major renovation. would not stay there again, not at those prices. We would have been better off across the street at the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Not since the EconoLodge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not since having to sleep at an EconoLodge in upstate New York have I stayed in such a dirty, dingy hotel. The absolute worst.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the W Hotel has seriously gone downhill. THe W Hotel Lexington is really such a disappointment. W Hotels I've stayed in in the past have always been modern and interesting. But not the Lexington W, it looked and felt like a total "has been". The bar and lobby area were still pretty busy but the rooms were awful. At around $400 a night my room was extremely cramped, but worse it felt dirty, run down, stained and falling apart. It was seriously in need of a refurbishment. It just wasn't a room you wanted to come back to. Seriously, if you can avoid it don't bother with this W hotel. I moved out after a couple of days and found something much better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrBob5
Reviews.Content: The W hotel is another botique hotel with small rooms and cool bars. The staff is pleasant but hard to understand a simple problem. For example, the presence of a street fair closing Lex and the difficulty in locating the Hotel on 49th.Tthere is no signage to speak of on 49th and the Hotel is between 49 and 50th, not 48th as the concierge told us as we circled in heavy traffic. The doormen also who were needed to valet the car were also in front of the hotel out of view. This created a situation where we parked our car in another garage and had to have the Hotel move it to their lot. To their credit they did deduct the cost of the lot from our room before we left. The small room ( we had the King size bed) is clean the bathroom too small for two people to occupy and the T.V cable reception was pitiful. The A.C. was all too effective and louder than the T.V. when it kicked on, but did I mention the location? Walking distance to everything on Fifth and the Hotel Bar and Lobby were also very Metropolitan, so all in all a good weekend get away was had even if the hotel was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the W on Lex”
Reviews.Author: Mattsrh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff and very accomodating service. I surprised my wife with a trip to NYC for her 30th B-Day and chose the W based on positive experiences with W's in other cities plus the location and a great deal I found on expedia that combines the flight, attractions and the room into a great rate. As we arrived in the morning, we expected to have to wait to check in, but they gave us a room right away. The only problem, was that the room seemed to be the size of a large closet and the view was of a large HVAC unit atop an adjacent building. A quick call to the hotel operator and they promised us a better view if we could wait until 1pm to check in. expecting this anyway , we left our bags for them to take to our new room. After a few hours of roaming around the city we returned to find that they had upgraded us to a suite as we were celebrating a birthday, which was a wonderful surpise! The suite was fantastic, great view , 2 rooms with 2 TV's, plenty of room to stretch out and relax after a day walking around the big apple. Anything we wanted they were right there with it, wonderful bathroom products, very comfortable bed, we never heard any of the other guests, and were very happy with how quiet and relaxing the hotel was. All in all a wonderful experience and we thank the great staff for giving us the upgrade. We will certainly stay here again, the only word of caution is that if your at all interested in being comfortable in your room, vs basically just sleeping there and being on the go the entire time, I would not book a room here unless its a suite (it will be worth the cost), otherwise you will end up with a very little space to come back to at the end of the day and to get ready in for going out that night. Also found the concierge to be very helpful, kind and knowledgable, and hotel lobby was a great place to relax with a very well made drink at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “The W is Great!”
Reviews.Author: OCDrew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W New York this past weekend and I loved this hotel! It's in a great area and is centerally located to everything in Midtown. You can easily walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and the Theater District. It's young and chic, exactly what we were looking for. Close to everything, but away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. I'm not going to lie, the rooms are TINY. But, we really didn't need a large room. We were only there to sleep. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great. The Bliss products were also a nice touch. I am very, very picky when it comes to the cleanliness of hotels and the W was perfect. I never felt like the room was dirty or dingy. The trip to NYC was for my husband's graduation from optometry school so I had inquired about getting a bottle of champagne sent up to our room a couple of days before our arrival. I decided against it, but they sent up a complimentary bottle anyways! That was very, very nice of them. I would highly, highly recommend this hotel for young twenty and thrirty somethings. We had an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “...paved with good intentions”
Reviews.Author: smithandzip
Reviews.Content: at some point before 5 am I awoke with a massive respiratory episode, and discovered that within 15 minutes of shutting off the AC, it began to subside. I ended up suffering the consequences though for 2 days. they transferred me to another room --- teeny-tiny, that, by my re-entry into the room at 5pm (they told me they needed the day to prepare it) looked like it was smackdab in the middle of being cleaned. a wonderful front desk woman, Lamika, assigned a room with a terrace and offered to accompany me there personally to troubleshoot any issues. once there, she decided to send in maintenance to check on the AC. when the guy took out the filters, he had a shocked look on his face (as i did when I saw them in his hands). They were filthy beyond description. He took them out to clean them. I ended up having to spend 48 hours confined to my room for the respiratory symptoms from the first night to subside (I have allergies and asthma). I would have to say that this property is way behind the eight-ball on their technical upkeep. I fought to credit for this experience and ultimately prevailed. it was a waste of a trip. it took me nearly an hour to check out because everything that had been previously cleared by one of the managerial staff and by Starwood, was not showing up on my final bill. these people are not brusque or nasty -- they are clueless...they are offering me 2 nights by way of compensation and I am nervous about returning...

Reviews.Title: “Simple chic”
Reviews.Author: What_a_view
Reviews.Content: Both my brothers had stayed at W Hotels in New York this past year so I figured it was my turn! The entrance, lobby and lounge are as I expected - very chic. The W New York is a refurbed older building so hard to compare to the Times Square location. I did get a corner room so had lots of natural light from the windows. The bed was comfortable and the bath basic and stocked with their signature Bliss supplies - great products. Staff were helpful and courteous. Drinks in the lounge was a fun hangout. Was able to walk everywhere comfortably and safely. Had high tea across the street at the Waldorf, dinner a few blocks away at the Rainbow Grill in Rockefeller Center, watched the Easter parade on Fifth Avenue and took at tour of the MOMA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adz99
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC and I was a little concerned after reading some of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor about the W New York but went ahead anyway and booked as we found a great rate. I have to say all my worries were unfounded. This hotel is fantastic. They e-mail you a day of 2 before you are due to arrive to ask if you have any additional requests (!) I requested a high floor with a view in a quiet position, and thatâ€™s exactly what I got. We overlooked the Waldorf Astoria, on the 16th floor, and a room on the end. Perfect. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly, every maid even said 'hello' on our way past each morning. The rooms as spotless, and come with fab Bliss products each day and a great shower. For American standards they are small rooms but the bed was so comfy so thats all that mattered. The location is perfect, only a few minutes to the Subway and a short walk to 5th Ave. and Central Park. Would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “upgraded goodness”
Reviews.Author: Tabb
Reviews.Content: We're New Yorkers who stayed at the W for a little getaway for my fiance's birthday. When I got my confirmation email after making a reservations there was a link to click to make any special requests. I let them know that we were celebrating a birthday and we were treated to a free upgrade from a queen room to a junior suite, given late checkout, and when we checked in we were given vouchers for the lobby bar for two drinks and two appetizers per person, which at 12-16 bucks a drink and even more for appetizers, was a very generous freebie. The rooms -are- small, but treatment like this was really nice. Also check out the bliss spa which is awesome, but be sure to reserve early b/c appointments book up way in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGirl
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is a fantastic hotel and I really could not fault our stay there. The location is brilliant, the hotel is stylish and calm which is great after a day walking round Manhattan. The rooms are faultless to with amazingly comfy beds and the view of Lexington Avenue was brilliant (especially as it was my first time to NYC!). We also spent New Year's Eve there on another trip to NY, as our own hotel (Hudson) had closed all of the bars for a private party, leaving guests either with nowhere to drink or having to pay Â£180 for the priviledge of entrance. On this occasion, W Hotel made us feel very welcome, giving everyone free champagne and certainly weren't out to rip anyone off. When I next return to NY I will not hesitate to stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 40isMarriedCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on Saturday 4/22. We were in NYC to attend a wedding at a much pricier hotel. Our room at the W was small, very small, but also efficiently equipped with all that we needed for an overnight stay. The lobby bars were hopping with beautiful people, a very hip younger crowd with big martinis. The hotel was booked full. Amazingly, our room was sound proof and we were not once interruped by hallway noise. In response to a prior review I can report that our room was very clean and the bathroom stocked with Bliss products. Subway was 2 blocks away and walking distance to all of the best shopping on Fifth Ave. Room may be too small for some couples, and may be too small if you have more than one suitcase. Overall, it was the perfect location for us with very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: KyAmy
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I have to wonder what these people are used to that write such horrible reviews! Our four night visit was everything I would want it to be. The room IS nice. Very trendy and aesthetically pleasing. After reading all the reviews, I expected to walk into the tiniest room in the world. It really was not that small. Not large but it contained a queen size bed, that had unbelievably great pillows and comforter, a wrap around desk with chair, tv and wetbar stand, and a chair in the corner. The bathroom was shower only, which I prefer. When was the last time you took a bath in a hotel?! The Bliss products were blissful and restocked everyday. The towels were plush. Bathrobes provided were comfy. Snacks in mini-bar were unique. Room Service food was WAY too expensive, but with cafes everywhere open all night or late, room service was unnecessary. The staff went above and beyond. Very courteous and helpful. I saw some minor signs of wear and tear. Nothing that I didn't witness in every other building in New York. Our room was always clean. I will go back and stay with the W hotel. I do recommend it to others wanting to visit. I have to ask who really requires a massive suite when they travel to a place like New York anyway? The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at The W when in New York and were disappointed in the standard of cleanliness and maintenance for a hotel of this rating. Our room was less than cosy - scarcely room to move around if we were both standing - and furnishings and bathroom were really rather shabby. The downstairs bar attracted a huge crowd each evening, but as we did not join the noisy throng, we cannot comment on it. The location was good, however, but we could not recommend this hotel to other travellers seeking a comfortable and quiet room in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Kelton
Reviews.Content: Very hip, "Sex in the City" youngish, professional 30-50 crowd. Room was EXCELLENT, right down to special features like nice robes and FREE luxury bath products from the BLISS spa (on site). If you plan to visit the spa, plan ahead and make reservations as they were very busy, as BLISS is one of the best spas in town, known to NYC locals as well. Rooms were small (very little closet space). Plan to use your suitcase a a dresser, and hang up suits or dresses in the small closet, as we had no drawers for storage, but that was okay as the room was EXCELLENT. Nice desk with internet, CD player, DVD, TV, etc. The bed, is in fact, HEAVENLY, as the advertising suggests. Nice mood, throughout the hotel. Excellent, large work-out facility, with personal training available, as well as a BLISS spa on-site (no pool). Food was excellent. Drinks were good, but pricey at $12-15 per cocktail, but well worth it for the atmosphere and people watching GREAT location, on Lexington at 49th. Five minute walk to Grand Central or Rockefeller Center. Very active lobby with free "enegry juice shots" in the lobby every day - the mango was excellent! Helpful and cheerful front desk and concierge desk. Enjoy your stay at this EXCELLENT hotel! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BB in KC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W on business and had a great experience. Rooms are small, okay...really small, but it's a terrific location with a cool lobby. If you like swanky modern upscale hotels you'll love the W. If you don't, there's always the Waldorf Astoria across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: wacka
Reviews.Content: Is the location great? YES Is it a cool Place to have a drink? YES Is the room smaller than my dorm in 10th grade? YES Is it way overpriced for NYC? YES There are so many other great hotels in NYC for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: DAZZSER
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the W hotel last week of march, HOTEL was nice but what you get,or don't get, for the money says I won't stay there again. The rooms were way too small for the cost. There are to many other hotels just around the 'W' where you get more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to GCT, recommended for the younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: PDDNOSMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night on 3/18. We were impressed by the modern decor in the lobby, the relatively uneventful check-in, and the inviting lobby lounge with the overstuffed chairs, tables, and plenty of places for people to congregate. We got there early and were able to store our luggage while we shopped a bit. Security was very good as well, as there were staff to monitor the comings and goings near the elevators on all floors. Our particular king room was very, very small, which is probably to be expected for having booked through a discount website! We had a king room in which the bed took up about 75% of the available space. The view from our room was of the parking garage. Absolutely nothing impressive - but then we were only there basically to sleep so I wasn't too disappointed. The bathroom was small with only a shower, a handicapped accessible, very loud commercial toilet, and a pedestal sink. Almost no storage space. We felt that some areas of the hotel, particularly the hallways, were in need of some maintenance. We had breakfast the next day in the restaurant which had some very delicious food i.e. eggs made of two parts egg white to one part egg yolk, homemade potatoes and sausage. We have stayed in other hotels in Manhattan and will continue to explore them. Probably won't stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Mid-Town Gem”
Reviews.Author: Traveler73
Reviews.Content: We had a great exprerience through and through. We got the room through Priceline but did not feel that we were treated any differently because of that. The lobby is perfect for having a drink and people watching and the food in the restaurant delicious. The hotel is right across from Waldorf-Astoria and is close to shopping and the subway station. The rooms are small but most rooms in NYC are unless you pay for a suite. The bed we had was more a full than a queen ut the interior was nicely designed and clean. The Bliss products we got everyday was great and the Bliss Spa is on the 4th floor, making for an easy spa visit. I travel quite a bit, 4-5 stars in general and I would definetely go back to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, some bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon Christmas 2005. When we first arrived the room we were allocated was cr@p, it must be said, so I demanded a better room. We were changed straight away to a high floor room with a good view. The rooms are small, but clean and tidy...none of the complaints of the previous reviews. Good points- The concierge (very helpful) and doormen. The food. Drinks are nice (but pricey). Great location. Bliss freebies- lush! Comfy beds. Bad points- small rooms. no bath only shower. the dimly lit corridors are a bit annoying. American TV!!! But generally, loved our stay in NY here, but probably not enough to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was a bit disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Chealle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four days at the W New York. I was very excited and really looking forward to my trip. When we arrived we were greeted by an extremely courtesy and friendly staff. We never had one bad encounter. EVERYONE was great!!! They were very helpful, courteous, pleasant, and professional our entire stay. The lobby was beautiful - very hip, cool. Needless to say, our excitement was diminished the moment we opened the door to our room. It wasn't much bigger than a walk-in closet. We had to turn sideways to pass each other in the room. Not exactly what we were expecting. It was very small, the floors and chairs were dirty. Our thoughts of rest and relaxation were dashed. We ate only once at the hotel restaurant. The breakfast was very good and I wish we would have eaten there more. The Bliss Spa was fabulous. I got the best pedicure I have ever had. I would definitely go back. The staff were very pleasant and willing to go the extra mile to make sure you were comfortable and pleased with their service. The best part about this hotel is the location. The location is terrific!!! All in all - the staff was GREAT! location was GREAT!!!! The rooms were not great! Probably would never stay here again, but accomodations are important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Super Small Rooms -- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at W-The Court previously and loved it. So when my wife wanted us to return to New York but stay near Fifth Avenue, I -- without thinking -- booked a room at the W-New York. Without question, it's a **great** location. But Be Warned: The rooms are SMALL. As in, when we opened the door to our room, my wife said, "You have got to be kidding me." It was (much) smaller than my dorm room at USC. The Good: Service was good. Lobby was gorgeous. Bar had that cool W vibe. Spa was only OK. I asked for a male therapist, and I wasn't very impressed. Plus, the decor was rather bizarre -- hard to explain...felt like I had done some really hard drugs or something. Or like I had entered The Twilight Zone. Gotta say, though: Location was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel s----!!!!!!!!!!! bed bugs overun the place. seman stained sheets that are simply turned over for future use. torn and dirty shades. this is a poor excuse for a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A Negative Review? You have to be kidding...”
Reviews.Author: surreal6
Reviews.Content: Now, if it wasn't for the toilet paper roll almost falling off the wall (I think management needs to do more room inspections), I can't imagine WHY a person would say anything negative about this hotel. It has a GREAT bar in the lobby which plush couches a fireplace. It's attached to Bliss Spa and in fact includes their amenities in the rooms. The staff is extremely friendly and the concierge could not be stumped...they new the whole city backwards and forwards. For the price, you cannot beat it in NYC...

Reviews.Title: “people: stop kvetching already”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel! All the staff I dealt with were quite friendly, the room was decently sized and compares favorably with anything less than a five star hotel in Manhattan, and the place was clean and stylish. People seem intent on comparing it to a motel room that you would find in the "fly-over" states of the USA, where everything (including many people) comes super-sized. For a $160 internet bid (through one of those sites where you name your own price) this place offered fine value. The only flaw that I experience was that the towels had a strange smell, like vinegar. To get a room across from the Waldorf Astoria, the Benjamin, and the Barclay - Intercontinental, at half their rates seems like a great deal to me.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, yes; curt staff, yes; great experience, yes!”
Reviews.Author: artfuldodger
Reviews.Content: The W New York is a fine hotel. Expensive, but fine. The rooms are really, really small, but most huge city hotels are. The room we had was in excellent condition, very clean, and the beds were very comfortable. As some have mentioned, the staff is a bit curt and stilted, but certainly shy of outright rude. The room, although tinny, provided everything we needed; really, if youâ€™re in a city like New York, how much do you see of your roomâ€”there is so much to do and see outside of your room! And it has a fantastic midtown location! There are probably nicer hotels in the area, and some may offer better rates, so shop around. If you can get a deal on this place though, it is really a great hotel, in a great location and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mom and I had a wonderful time...”
Reviews.Author: McC35
Reviews.Content: I had already booked a room here before I read the negative reviews, so I was panicked that the mother/daughter bonding weekend I'd planned for my mom's birthday/retirement would be ruined. I'm happy to report that we had a fantastic time. I would guess that the outraged reviews might have something to do with cost-related expectations. Through the Starwood Preferred Guest program, I got a Wonderful NonSmoking room with 2 single beds for a rate of $199 a night. A steal for virtually any hotel in NYC. This same room is often priced much higher, and I admit that if I had paid $299 (or more) I might have been a bit underwhelmed. And like others have mentioned, we did have a problem with the heating/cooling system--the thermostat wouldn't go below 80 degrees. Okay, not the hallmark of a 5-star hotel. But within two minutes of informing the front desk, they sent someone straightaway to check on it. He confirmed that it was broken, and we were immediately offered another slightly larger room with a better view. (Both rooms, for the record, weren't nearly as small as I thought they would be, very clean and well-appointed.) From that point on, we had no problems, and what's more, any requests (i.e., for a foam pillow because I'm allergic to down pillows, or to stow our luggage for six hours after check out ) were handled quickly and courteously. Anyone who complains about "attitude" or that the hotel is overrun by the beautiful snobs have no idea what that pretentious hipster scene is really like. My mom--who is 59 and from the NJ suburbs--felt totally at ease and really appreciated "the organic vibe" of the place. To her, W was a glamorous oasis in the city, one that she would return to in a heartbeat. (Incidentally, Heartbeat, like many hotel restaruants, a bit on the pricy side. But it's tasty and holds a certain ambient appeal.)

Reviews.Title: “Whats the problem?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Christmas day this year up to the 30th. All we can say is "what is all the moaning about". We had very good service from ALL staff members who were courteous at all times. The rooms were comfortable and clean with very nice decor and excellent soft furnishings. Yes, the paintwork in some (small) areas was slightly chipped but that certainly did not ruin our holiday! Only one small problem was that that Air Con was slightly noisey. The communal areas were also very nice with a good hotel bar and "Whiskey Blue" both adjoining the foyet. I would stay in this hotel again as it is in an excellent location and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hellhole in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: caljl
Reviews.Content: ***DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I THOUGHT THE OTHER REVIEWERS WERE EXAGGERATING, BUT TI'S ALL TRUE** My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this New Year's weekend. The relaxing, hip, luxurious lobby is VERY deceiving compared to what the hotel rooms look like. Let me just say from the moment we checked in to this Motel it was nothing but problems. The beds are NOT heavenly, the AC knocks every 2 seconds to remind you its on, the walls are peeling, the carpet is beyond repair, and so on... The size of the rooms are beyond tiny (there are tons of NY hotel rooms that are standard sized.. you dont have to sacrifice... try the Sofitel) If I took the time to list out all of my complaints of this hotel and its staff, it would take me all day. They are totally not worth my time. This Motel is a disgrace to the Westin/W/Starwood name. And the attitude of the staff is comparable to any low quality greasy spoon hamburger stand. To pay nearly $400 a night for this is robbery. Again, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “really poor management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York for 4 nights after Christmas 2005. The hotel itself (or what I saw of it) was pretty nice, I thought. Not super hip, but definitely nice and comfy. The trouble is that place is just not managed properly. I booked a king bed room online, but when I showed up they gave me a queen. (Call and confirm!) I had to go to the trouble of printing out my reservation ($4.50 to use their computers!) to straighten it out, which I had no time to do for 2 days. Meantime, my girlfriend got bedbug bites from the queen they gave us! They did eventually compensate us for all that, though -- $100 towards the restaurant and room service. (Though even that was sort of a pain to get out of them.) The king room we finally got was excellent -- spacious, and with a proper tub. (I recommend the king rooms over the queens at all costs.) The place could be terrific if it were managed properly.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: teaseicu
Reviews.Content: On Dec 28th to 29th I stayed at the W New York in room 659. Upon arrival I was told I was upgraded to a "spectacular room". I was late for dinner reservations so quickly dropped my things off and went to dinner. Later that night I returned to the room and upon further inspection found the following problems - a hold in the wall in the bathroom, a significant tear in the rug by the bed, an unsightly area around the heating/air conditioning unit, and really, in general, just an awful room. Given the late hour I had neither the patience nor the energy to head down to the front desk to complain and figured I'd discuss the problems at check out in the morning. Wow, was I wrong. At check out I explained that I have stayed at Starwood properties for over 130 nights this year and that I was wondering if there was any sort of discount or points allotment that I could receive for my less than spectacular room. I was told by the front desk attendant that there was nothing that could be done. I find this appalling. The basic rooms at the Sheraton Chapel Hill which I stay at for business are much nicer than the room I unfortunately received at the W New York. This was by far the worst Starwood stay I've ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “no to W Lexington”
Reviews.Author: huxn
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else! My fiance thought he was being super hip when he planned to stay at the W for my 30th birthday. After a long flight we were disturbed at the site of our miniature "room" on the spa floor. They were suppossedly the newest but the floor smelled bad and there was constant noise from all the cleaning, etc. The spa was a constant slap in the face b/c they don't block out appointments for hotel guest so there was no hope of getting a much needed massage after attempting to sleep in our miniature bed. Tiny Room We booked a king but got a full-almost queen bed that we couldn't walk around without hitting a wall. We couldn't even open our luggage b/c the room was so small. The last night they upgraded us to the slightly larger room that we had booked but only because we had a bazillion "points" from staying at other W's. Some loyalty. Mini Bathroom The bathroom was slightly larger than what you would find on a train. No ledge/counter for toiletries. The trendy cheap shower head sprayed out of the shower and could not be turned. The shower also did not drain properly. So we stood in dirty water while we showered. Bad Service Minimal conveniences. It took me days to get a hair dryer which should have already been in the room. I was awoken at 1 AM on my birthday by a man trying to deliver blankets and sheets that I hadn't ordered. Housekeeping called back 30 minutes later to argue that I had indeed ordered them. Incompetent Staff Door men didn't have a clue about city geography. They couldn't give directions to intersections that were just a few blocks away.They weren't great a cab grabbing either. They do have a nice workout facility but the bottom line is this is a joke of a hotel. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE WORST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Annie1128
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at W hotels before, I have stayed at "no-tell" motels before. I cannot decide which is worse. This was BY FAR not a 4 star hotel. Our room was an absolute utter disgace. It was approximately 80 square feet. BEWARE if you are over 5'9" and need to sit on the toilet. My husband injured his knees when they hit the wall (I'm not kidding) as he was sitting down. We requested to be moved, but the hotel was at full capacity (were all of the other guests complaining I wonder?) and we could not be moved. To boot, they double-charged our bar tab to the room. All I can say is thank G-d we only stayed for 1 night.
