We had an entire day planned the day of our departure that we opted to cancel because we needed to check out of this hellhole at 7am on a Sunday. I have never felt so claustrophobic in my entire life. There are soooo many other great hotels in this city. DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a chaotic city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. I have to admit that many of the concerns of previous reviewers are accurate. The rooms are small, the staff is curt. But I think they miss the point. This is a midtown hotel in a great location with everything you could hope for in the City. Maybe Iâ€™m just a sucker, but when I returned from demanding meetings, the peaceful and calming atmosphere was a real comfort. I wouldnâ€™t have predicted it, but this place feels like an oasis in the middle of a chaotic city.

Reviews.Title: “Another disappointed experience”
Reviews.Author: phiphimomo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, we have stayed here about 7years ago and were kind of frightend by the size of the room. This time we returned here with our daughter due to a business trip and the room size and certain services frightened us again. The doormen weren't efficient and welcoming, nor were the taxis waiting in front of the hotel. The reception was however very nice. Our room was small and as we travelled from Asia, we had more than 2 pieces of luggages. We could only have one opened, the rest we needed to have them open and stored under the bed. The ventilation in the bathroom was constantly on and so lound that we couldn't bare the door of the bathroom opened. The heater seemed not to work properly. The first impression of the lobby might be trendy, and indeed the room itself, however not the bathroom at all, was also in a trendy setting, however it is definitely not a family friendly hotel and absolutely not the room rate worth. The only positive point was that we were STARWOOD Gold level members, so we could stay in our room until 4pm, as our plan took off at 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at dozens of hotels in New York City ranging from the YMCA and its shared bathroom facilties right through to the 5 star hotels of Lexington Ave...this latest trip was by far the worst. Let's put aside for the moment that the one day hotel bill (including parking and cocktails in the lounge) was almost $700!! Instead, let's review the service and accomodations. When we checked in, the greeting was couteous and friendly and the service was decent. When we arrived at our room (or our high priced 10' x 10' sardine can), we found soon enough that $700 doesn't buy you a sink or shower that actually drain...nor does it buy you a TV that works. It does however buy you a heater with a broken thermostat that will keep your room at an unbearable 90 degrees. Oh yeah, and it also buys you the thinnest walls of any hotel I've ever stayed in to compliment the noisiest neighbors I've ever had. Oh well, at least repeated calls to the front desk scared off the neighbors who choose instead to head out to the bar - which incidentally closed at around 4 am...which brought our now-drunk neighbors back to their room. Further attempts to call the front desk were fruitless. If I were planning a trip to the Big Apple, I'd stay far, far away from W Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “trendy but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but I understood that to be the norm in NY. But mine was not as small as mentioned in some of these reviews. They were clean and quite nice. The main attraction here is the bar area and reception its designed for young twenty and thirty somethings singles and couples. Views were tn great but is anywhere in manhattan, had a room at the back so there was no noise There a bar whiskey blue attached thats very nice. All in all agreed to its quite expensive, I went with my girlfriend whose a New Yorker and a number of her friends had recommended. Size of room a side I thoughts its was nt to shabby. Compared to hotels in other european cities though its pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and gloomy”
Reviews.Author: stanleyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W hotel at the end of October 2005. The hotel in summary is trying to be hip, but the execution isn't up to it. The ground floor is stylish in a loud night-club sort of way. But when you get above the ground floor the implementation all goes to pot. The lift to the first six floors is dazzlingly bright, but opens onto corridors practically unlit - just the occasional pool of light. You could imagine that the design looked good on paper, but in practice it just looks gloomy, even not very clean. In the rooms the lighting is also dim, except for the two lights that hang over the bed on chains instead of bedside lights - both have to be on or off together and don't make reading in bed much fun. The bathroom was fine - it only had a shower, but it was good and used the space better than a tub. And the noise of the traffic. Don't be on a lower floor facing Lexington Avenue (I was on the 6th floor) - the cabs blow their horns all day and night - to the point where sleeping is more like just being in a hallucinogenic trance, if you're lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to begin... -Tiny but trendy room -Room overlooked the car park at the back. The people parking the cars honk the horns of the cars as they drive up each level. A lovely sound at 8am!! -After checking out, we joined the hotel taxi queue out front. There was one couple in front of us and the doorman was in the street talking to a cab driver so we assumed he was getting that cab to take the couple in front. He was taking some time and we were in a rush to catch a plane, so we walked a few yards ahead and saw a free cab which we hailed. The cab driver was putting our luggage into the boot when the hotel doorman came shouting at us that we had jumped the queue, called us bad mannered and started taking our luggage out of the cab boot. The couple waiting were signalling that it was ok for us to keep the cab but the doorman was having none of it. The result was that the cab driver drove off and we were left standing with our luggage in the street. We then screamed back at the doorman who got us another cab. I have not returned to NY since as this is my lasting memory of W Hotels and NY - what great service - NOT!

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Not worth the Hype”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel maybe trendy, cool and full of beautiful people.. But no soul or atmosphere. No specific complaints, other than, I felt a little too 'average' to be staying there, and felt the staff were more interested in third own reflection that customer service. Room small, bit clean. Great location (next to a wonderful hotel - The Benjamin)

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I just got back to the UK after staying 6 nights in the W New York, Lexington Ave. Theres bad and good about this hotel but given the chance, we both agreed we would not stay there again. My cousin works for the travel company we booked through and requested a twin room for us. When we arrived I asked at the desk to ensure it would be a twin (I only asked because I have seen a previous review from someone who was booked into a double when they requested a twin). Anyway, the girl at the desk informed us that we were booked into a double room "as requested by the agent" she told us, and that they are fully booked so they can't move us! The manager came over and we informed her that my cousin worked for the travel company and basically was the agent! Took her a few minutes to actually get this. She offered to move us the next day and gave us a free breakfast so I guess at least they compensated. They were pretty miserable though. The rooms are extremely small and shabby. They need thorough redecoration and new carpet. The room service was very expensive but good quality. Its a good location, walking distance to most attractions, plus the open top bus tour starts around the corner. The rooms are very dark, not helped by the fact that one of the lights didn't work. We couldn't be bothered to ask to get it fixed as had already asked them to fix the safe and the bathroom sink plug. The twin room was actually 2 single beds, the first time I have seen this when visiting America. The beds were comfortable though. The most positive thing about the hotel was the cleanliness. The room was always cleaned to a high standard. We were charged Â£1400 for 6 nights for this hotel. If we had actually had to pay all of this (we got a discount), I would be asking for a partial refund. I know New York is expensive but last time we went we stayed in a 3 star hotel at a fraction of the price which was by far superior. If you got a special deal on this hotel, and I mean very special deal, then yes go for it. But if you are paying the normal rate, just don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel that tries too hard to be hip”
Reviews.Author: momo3bigD
Reviews.Content: Had a fine stay at the W New York. Had a corner room with 2 twin beds. The room was small but not as small as some in NYC. The restaurant was good but overpriced. The bar (and entire lobby) was hopping on Thursday night but not so much on Fri. and Sat. Found the staff very helpful. They removed a disputed charge from my bill at checkout no questions asked. The location was perfect for all that we wanted to do in NYC. My daughter and I did laugh every time we got in the elevator because the music and incense are such an obvious attempt to be cool. Same with the Whatever/whenever dept.

Reviews.Title: “It Should be named V becuase you only get half a room!!”
Reviews.Author: scalderon
Reviews.Content: I go to New York a few times a year; I know it is expensive. But this place is just awful. First they allow pets and the carpet in my room bears that out. Second, the room is sooooooo small, like 10x10. No Armwar, just a hanging "port a cubby" in the closet. The restaurant isnt open for lunch and dinner on the weekends. I asked for breakfast room service to be delivered at 7:00 a.m. It finally came at 745 and was cold and wrong. The only good thing about this place is the lobby lounge and the staff. Stay away, if you have to pay $300 a night as i did

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before staying at this hotel I had read the many reviews on Trip Advisor and was very reluctant about staying here but it really wasn't as bad as the other reviewers said. And believe me I am very picky. I stayed at the W Hotel Nov. 7 to the 10th and was surprised at how nice the staff was at all times. Yes, the rooms are small and the bathroom was the size of a powder room, but it was cozy and clean. The room decor is 7 years old (a staff person told me that) and should be redone but it was much better than I had expected. The room rate was very high but hotels in New York City are very expensive. This is not a Ritz, St Regis, or Peninsula and thus will not be super plush! Everything in New York is expensive so put up with it or don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Past Its Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a major overhaul in every aspect: Needs new attitude in its staff - too rude, even for New York standards - new entrance, new lobby, etc. Rooms are horrendously small and everything is old, old, old. Paid $350/night. It does NOT deserve more than $200. I would NOT recommend this to any traveller. For comparable prices one got to be able to find something better.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for "Whatever!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bellman placed our luggage on a cart but we I had to roll it to our room ourselves. Oh and the room...my dorm room was larger. Water stains on the desk which I used as a counter for my suitcase. Musty old carpet, stained (with white crusty substance??) duvet cover, half inch think layer of dust on air conditioning controls. Clean but tiny bathroom was the only bright spot in the room. I've stayed in hotels all over NY from the best (Palace) to worst (Hotel Carter) and this is the smallest. It is a matchbox. Don't care about the club environment downstairs, I am paying for a comfortable room which I did not get. Shame on Starwood chain. I laughed at the room and cried at the bill. I've stayed in better rooms at hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the W New York on Lexington Ave”
Reviews.Author: myrasq
Reviews.Content: Eleven of my Investment Club friends and I stayed at the W New York on Lexington Ave. last weekend(Sept 29-Oct 2, 2005). We were all extremely happy with our 6 rooms (2 rooms were upgraded to suites, while the other 4 rooms were upgraded to higher floors). The staff was absolutely wonderful, very helpful, professional, and extremely friendly. We could not have been more pleased. Everyone's room was clean and well lighted; everyone loved the Bliss products; several of us were given complementary cocktail coupons; we were all given late check out times. We had no complaints at all(very rare when you're dealing with 12 women, most of whom do a lot of traveling.) The hotel's location is great! We will be returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Small , dark, damp and...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not up to normal W standards, especially the rooms on the 2nd floor where it is very noisy with traffic going into the spa and gym constantly. Unfortunately, our aroom was next to the janitors closet so there were even more noise especially early in the mornng. The washrooms had no ventilation so the whole room (since they are very small) gets steamy and warm after a shower. The shower curtain does not keep water in the shower area so we wasted a lot of towels covering the bathroom floor. The lighting was the worse, it was always night in the room The best part of the hotel was the ambiance of the lobby and the helpfulness of the concierge. Location was perfect as walking distance to most shops and attracitons.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden charges, nice lobby though”
Reviews.Author: kampswas
Reviews.Content: Well I found that upon returning back to my home my credit card was billed an additional 90 dollars for 3 rooms each! Took some time to clarify charges as well as requested 2 beds only offered us one and charged us additional when we requested again, Stated that they never receieved the request which I promptly showed them the copy they still charged, very aloof service, did store our bags for a day of walking however bags were mishandled and a gues phone ended up in our bag. I would choose another hotel next time, the rooms where very nice clean etc. no A/C in elevator and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “W=Wished for a nicer hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay frequently in this neighborhood for work, and I sampled the W's "charms." So depressing. As a female business traveler, I prize hotels that are cosy and feel safe and clean. The W features a huge trendy bar in the lobby--like passing through a cocktail party to check in (seems to be the case in all the Ws I've visited) with loud techno music even in the elevators. The halls are dimly lit in an artsy way with tiny spotlights in lieu of real lights (what are they hiding?)--it didn't make me feel comfortable to pass through these dark halls and I practically ran with my luggage. My room was even darker and wasn't helped by the stingy three lamps with low wattage bulbs, the black-and-gray carpet, grey/silver walls and slippery maroon comforter. In fact, I travel with needlework to pass the time in the evenings, and couldn't see well enough to work on it! The room was clean but tiny (typical NY) and looked out onto a parking garage and roof, which didn't add much light in the daytime either. Bathroom was just ok with a stall shower--barely big enough for one person--and a giant water stain on the ceiling. Thoroughly grim and I won't be back if I can help it. It's a pity, because the location is great and there are tons of wonderful little eateries nearby and it's just a few blocks from wonderful shopping including the Bloomingdale's flagship store. The W needs to grow up.

Reviews.Title: “trendy stuff , yeah”
Reviews.Author: veussel
Reviews.Content: what a trendy design. i really liked it. especially the bar and lobby at night. comfortable seatings and lovely atmosphere and view. the rooms are equipped with the latest comfort. nice CD with ambient music. really quiet in a buzy environment. We stayed on the 11th floor. 1 negative point; when making up the bed and cleaning the room the housekeeping staff lost one of my t-shirts. I told the reception and they looked everywhere but unfortunately it disappeared. The compensation was nice. Expensive city, but unique in the world

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel = The Worst”
Reviews.Author: 1JetSetGal1
Reviews.Content: Well first for the good news about NYC, the city was packed with people. All hotels were full,, which surprised me because it was August. With everyone finally coming back to NYC gave me some problems trying to find a hotel for our last minute trip to NYC. I tried all my regular hotels, Essex House, St. Regis, Palace Hotel, Four Seasons, ALL FULL! So my last resort was the W on Lex., all of the other W's were full also. The fact the W had room should have been a warning to me. I checked in and was told I wouldn't a non-smoking room. By this time it was midnight, and my Starwood preferred gold status didn't mean bubkus to the rather rude lady at check-in. So up to the smoke filled floor, and somehow I got rather lucky as the smell of smoke wasn't that bad. I called downstairs to ask for a mini refrig. to be delivered to my room. The Whatever Whenever person told me no-Lovely. The room was approx. 200 square feet. When I pulled my comforter off the bed, I noticed a cigaarrette stain on the mattress-Oh how GROSS- The bathrooms at the W should be called room for one person, preferably a small person. The next day we were moved to a suite-It was so very depressing. The furniture in the living room needed to be renovated, and the room smelled like mildew. I was looking forward to a nice long hot bath. Walked into the bathroom and it was the same size as the first room, with no bathtub. The bed-this must have been a joke or something. We own the Heavenly Bed at our house, the bed we slept on that night was anything but comfortable. We would never stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel- hip but rooms are very small”
Reviews.Author: LGuo
Reviews.Content: I just came home --stayed at the W Hotel for one night. The service was fantastic compared to a lot of other New York hotels . The staff are very welcoming, but the rooms are , as expected extremely small, and the doorways to all the hotel rooms are very dim . Don't know if this is deliberate for ambiance or whether they are trying to save money on electricity! The food at Heartbeat Restaurant ( I had dinner there ) is extremely good ( it's healthy and organic food ) and tasty but I was cross that the bottle of mineral water which I ordered was 8 and a half bucks !!!I thought that was a bit expensive compared to other hotel restaurants. Heartbeat looks to be the only restaurant in the hotel. The bars in the hotel are full of trendy, youthful people having drinks and the atmosphere is very lively. I stayed here primarily because I wanted to go the Bliss Spa which is in the hotel --am a huge Bliss Spa devotee, and highly recommend the facial and manicure services at Bliss. Overall, my stay at the W wa " blissful", but I wouldn't recommend that a traveller stay too long at this hotel as the rooms are really very small and rather spartan , and the lighting too dim.Strictly for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mathildexl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in June for 4 days and liked it. Friendly staff, the room was ok, but the lobby was noisy, extremly noisy. we would probably stay there again

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not up to W standards.”
Reviews.Author: dgabor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in February for the Cristo exhibition in Central Park. I got the deal from Starwood's website - 189 and as such, was not expecting the most elegant room in the place. However, having stayed at Ws in other cities - including two others in NYC, I was expecting at least the minimum W experience - small, but clean room, big comfy bed, premium bathroom supplies, etc. The W New York is a good -but not great hotel. It's dated as a W, and the room seemed unfinished and less than the level I would have expected - noisy AC unit, spots on the carpet, etc. The bed was old (banana shaped) and the sheets were not the ones used in Westin's Heavenly bed. All in all - not bad, but not great. Try staying up the road at the W Times Square - even with the deficiencies, the "show" you get from the that hotel in terms of decoration and the clientele makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregfromnj
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed for a few days over the holiday weekend. From all the reviews I was scared about what to expect, but it was actually really nice. Yeah the rooms were small but that's just New York. The elevators were also very small. But for the location and how nice the staff was, it was well worth it. We even got room service one night, a little on the pricy side but well worth it. I know I might stay there again, at least if I get the discounted rate with the W stay package.

Reviews.Title: “A bit down at the heels”
Reviews.Author: OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: If you can get a deal on this hotel, it's not a bad choice. You'll feel like you're staying in the hotel because you got a deal, though. This hotel is much the worse for wear, especially when compared to the other Ws in town or in other cities. Beneath the veneer of decade-old hipness, it's clear this was a renovation of a much older hotel. Not much attention was put into details -- an air conditioning unit that looks and sounds like it belongs in a cheap Motel 6 from the mid-'80s was simply covered up with a box. The lighting's terrible, and the bulb in the flimsy lamp on our desk didn't work. While it's true the rooms are quite small, they are not as small as in other hotels in the city, like the Hudson. There's space to unfold a small carry-on rollaway on the floor but nothing larger. Having a shower rather than a bathtub is very disappointing when it's clear the bathroom's big enough for a simple tub. The one shelf in the bathroom was fixed at a slant, so nothing stayed on it. Bliss products are nice, but what's the point unless you can bathe with them? The location's okay, but for tourists interested in the Times Square scene it's a bit out of the way (on the other hand, being well away from Times Square can be a good thing).

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was a Hotwire deal!”
Reviews.Author: pathgirladpi
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Ws in other locations (Los Angeles, San Fran) I was expecting a great hotel- upon arrival the lobby did not disappoint (trendy nice atmosphere with fruit and lemonade for guests) but from the elevator up, boy what a shocker- the elevators barely fit two couples with luggage and at one point in the visit, two of the four elevators were not working so waiting on a ride down to the lobby from the 11th floor took a while. As many others have said in in their reviews, the room was shockingly small with the comfortable queen bed taking up most of the space. While we weren't in the room very much, several of the television stations (even though it was one cable) had static/snow. I enjoyed the bliss products but was disappointed to only have a shower stall and no bathtub- The concierge was very nice making reservations for dinner and pointing out nearby spots. Location wise it was nice being away from the total hustle and bustle of the Times Square area but not too far away that we couldn't walk to some of the tourist spots- I'd stay again as long as it was a Hotwire deal only but can't imagine the disppointment I would have had if I had paid $200+ a night for the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: librnstn
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel since it was right across the street from the Marriott Eastside, where we had a free room for the night. When I checked several weeks in advance, the W was booked. But, when I checked a week before the trip, more rooms opened up, which was good. Unfortunately, we had already booked at another hotel and were issued a cancellation charge when we booked with the W instead. I thought the hotel was in a great location. The lobby was very nice and relaxing. While some people don't like the nightclub vibe and music, I thought it only added to the hotel. The front desk staff were efficient and courteous. We had one of the least expensive rooms on a high floor, but it had a good view and was just big enough for two people. Although, there was not much room to lay out luggage. The furnishings were very cool and the bathroom was very nice. We especially liked the Bliss products. When I was at the Bliss spa, I saw the same travel kit runs for about $20 if you purchase it there. The bed was pretty comfortable too. And, the elevators ran pretty quickly without being too crowded. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Decent Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked it pretty cheap on Hotwire ($155/night). The "original" W looks like it was probably cutting edge when it first opened, but their other properties are much cooler these days. It is nice enough, though. We got a "cozy queen" room that might be the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. And the street noise was Very loud from the 10th floor. But everything was clean; the concierge was helpful; the doormen friendly, etc. They lent us a clothes steamer for the entire stay - at no charge. I would probably stay here again if I was able to get the same rate. But I would not recommend it if you're paying over $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “great bed, decent hotel though the hip attitude is a bit passe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in W hotels before, namely in San Francisco and Seattle. In comparison to those two, this one looks like a dressed up 3 star hotel rather than the large 'boutique' style hotel of the aforementioned two others. I must say the W style is starting to look a bit tired--hallways that always look like late night and slightly intrusive house music in the elevators. That said, I found the service very courteous and efficient. My room was a 199 special so it was on the small side though perfectly comfortable with free internet and a fantastically comfortable bed. The onlly thing amiss was the odd lighting system--two energy efficient bulbs in lampst that hung over the bed but no independent lamp over the desk. The location is unbeatable, near lots of New York landmarks such as the Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Centre, etc. Two subway lines right across the street, the E and the 6 as well as stops for the 103, 102 and 101 buses.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some simple improvements”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The people who work here are amazing, they are very responsive and polite. Definitley Professional. Hotel is very clean, stylish well maintained. Excellent Midtown Location and Love Whiskey Blue bar (but better spas than Bliss for the $$ are around). The rooms are TINY and not well appointed. (I was here with a friend from college so we had to have twin beds because the rooms couldn't have two doubles!!!) No drawers at all, No light in the closet and the door to the closet, the door to the bathroom and the entrance door overlap. Bathroom has one small shelf, that is shared with all the wonderful cosmetics they replinish everyday. The bathtub is tiny. And there is only one outlet in the room on the undersized desk. Lightining is lacking, not even a make-up mirror in the bathroom I have stayed in more W's than I care to admit and have never had this type of dissapointment. The only reason I give it above average is that we got an incredible package from the W website so the price is exceptional for NY even in the small room.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive, the outside is beautiful and your right across from the Waldorf. The lobby is a site to be seen and has plush seating ( but don't count on getting a seat at night.. its packed.. mainly by people who don't even go to the hotel!) Check in was quick, but the elevators are very very slow and small. They play music that is " soothing" but it ends up being annoying ( its maily French rap). We got to our room on the 16th floor. We commonly called it "our closet", for the rest of our trip. The room was very small. The king size bed was the only savior. extreamly comfortable, but its an over glorified feather bed with a satin duvet. The bathroom was basicly the size of our closet and had no counter space! The shower was nice.. good water pressure. The Bliss products they give you are very nice and they are replenished everyday. The air conditioner was on FULL BLAST for 3 days and it never got cold in our room. It was ok during the day .. but sleeping at night with the heavy comforter make it way to hot to sleep sometimes. Nightlife at the W NewYork- the bar in the lobby is EXPENSIVE! Don't bother.. the drinks are way too strong. We purchased 2 cocktails and it ended up to be $ 24.00 before tip! I know its NYC but at least make a good drink! The wait to get on an elevator could sometimes be up to 15 min! Once your on.. it seems like it stops at every floor. All in all.. its an ok hotel... but not worth the $300 a night! Go across the street to the Waldorf for that kind of money!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for a romantic weekend. While we were pleased with our 'signature bed,' which really was code for pillow-top bed in a small room, there was much to be desired from this hotel. I've stayed in much cheaper hotels and would much rather spend that $300/less and do without the Bliss spa Shampoo products.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a weekend in NY”
Reviews.Author: nicknova
Reviews.Content: The W is what it is - one of the original designer hotels in New York. That means that yes the rooms are small but the design, ambience and overall experience of staying here is excellent. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the amenities and cleanliness of the rooms is good and the lobby bar is a highlight - great drinks in a fun and funky environment. In any of these types of hotel you pay more for less space than somewhere like a Hilton or Sheraton but you get so much more character and atmosphere instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain, good location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in the last two years. We were able to get a good rate on expedia, our average room price was about $185. The rooms were small, but this is new york. the beds were absolutely awesome, the best hotel beds that I have ever slept in. Everything in the hotel is over the top expensive, $10 vodka tonics, $17 chicken sandwiches etc, but I know that comes with the territory. If that kind of stuff really bothers you, don't go to new york. Whiskey blue is a great hotel bar, one of my favorites. You are very close to 5th ave, central park, times square, etc. I think this hotel is a pretty good value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the W New York in April 2005. We were in NYC for 5 days, and loved every minute of it. The modern decor was beautiful and a nice touch compared to other NYC hotels. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The hotel location was within walking distance to the Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Shops on Fifth Ave, and Central Park. I would seriously consider staying here again on my next trip to NYC, and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!! Very Modern and Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I start off by saying that this hotel was very nice and modern. I really liked the area as well. My girlfriend and I loved our room. Service people were very nice and helpful. The rooms were kind of small, but expected for New York. If you are just staying for the weekend then itâ€™s awesome. If I was staying for more than a week then I could use more space. I did get a smoking room instead of non-smoking room, but check-in was at 3pm and they let me in at 12pm. Very nice bar connected. I will stay there again..... I Love this place!!! Pros: Very Nice, and Clean rooms Nice Bar Valet Love the area (walking distance to Time Square) The beds were soooo comfortable!!!! (Didn't want to get up) Shower pressure and Shower head were the best!!!! (Didn't want to get out of shower) Cons: Got smoking room Too expensive for food/drinks Kind of small rooms for long periods of time

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable - Modern Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: rfl68
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the 5th floor. One looking directly onto Lexington accross from the Waldorf, and the other facing the Marriott on 49th Street. The rooms were small, but very clean. We enjoyed the 'Bliss' products offered. We look at it this way, we go to NYC once every other month for an extended weekend. You do not live in your hotel room. It is there for only three things, and three things only... Sleep, Shower, and Sh... The hotel did forget to bring up a vase that I requested for some roses I bought my wife, but hey stuff happens. I thought the hallways were a bit dark with the way they do their lighting, but that is their call (it was neat). The flower arrangement in the lobby (wheat grass) is cool. We got to meet the person in charge of that. Experienced NYC travelers know not to drink or dine in any of the hotel's bar or restaurants (unless you are at the Waldorf). Nonetheless, next door to the W, on 49th St, is an excellent little Medditeranean restaurant called San Martin. Nice local hang out. Sparks Steakhouse is an easy 4 block walk too. Rosen's Deli (a little Jewish Deli accross from St. Pats) is close on 51st St too, and is excellent for breakfast and lunch. Overall, this was our first time staying in Midtown East, and we would go back. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel - 541 Lexington Ave - Part 1”
Reviews.Author: pchnmain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel from May 06 thru 14, 2005. Please bear with me, as my review is in two parts--and I got to see two separate rooms. Also note that there are multiple locations to this brand in the city. I stayed at the W Hotel location on Lexington Ave. I arrived at 5:30am on 05/06/2005. I told the desk clerk upon arrival that I would understand if they did not have a room available for early check-in. I also requested a corner room, if available, as I was going to be there for a whole week. She was able to provide a room, so I check in. Upon inspection, I was dissatisfied. First, the room door openned to the elevator landing; secord, the room was quite small. (see photos) I went back to the desk and stated that I didn't want to spoil the room, and was willing to wait until noon, to see if anything better openned up. To my delight, she offered that I should keep the room assigned as a courtesy room and that should make myself comfortable. I could return at noon, and she would change rooms if an improvement could be made. I will remark at this time, that the room was small, and so was the bathroom. This hotel room was about the same size as the room that I got when staying at the Radisson down the block (during a previous trip to the city). Also, the closet of this first room was very small, and there were no drawers. (end - part 1) pchnmain

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: DandC
Reviews.Content: Service level is low, and the location is noisy due to traffic. Woke up every day to honking horns from the street. We will not stay there again. Location is 3 blocks from subway stop. Lexington goes downtown so taxi's are easy to get.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly (and sadly) just plain awful”
Reviews.Author: VacaObsessed
Reviews.Content: I am so surprised just how bad my stay here was. I will note at the outset that the staff was very nice and helpful. As for the accomodations .. . unspeakable. The first room that I had a pungent and awful smell. In addition, the bathroom smelled like mildew. It was sickening. In response to my complaint, I was promptly moved to a new room, which did not smell but had its own issues. The carpeting was worn and stained. One of the pillowcases had a dirty handprint on it. The blinds on the window were completely mangled on the edges. Overall, it is obvious that these rooms desperately need upkeep and updating. I have stayed in many hotels - - in Manhattan as well as other major cities throughout the world. This was the most disappointing experience I have had. I expected so much more from the "W" brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very hip and exciting, but the rooms were cozy and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, you can walk everywhere or easily get a taxi. The concierge was wonderful, every restaurant recommended was great. The room was small but very clean. I loved the Bliss bathroom products, the fluffy, comfortable bed. I asked for a hypo-allergenic pillow (instead of the feather pillow) and it was delivered to my room within 15 minutes. Small bathroom with a shower stall, but again very nice. VHS and CD players and a desk in the room. Bliss Spa is located in the hotel. Stocked mini bar and separate snack tray, expensive but that is always the case. Take your own drinks and put them in the refrigerator. Check in was quick but I noticed the next morning there was a about a 20 minute wait to check in. I will stay there on my next trip. Paid $369 a night from the W's website.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Young Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkuchar
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the W Hotel and were quite impressed. We stayed in a "Wonderful" room which was small but all of the amenities were top notch. My favorite was the shower head, while my girlfriend's was the Bliss bathroom products. This hotel's Midtown location was great for visiting New York and a lot of the city's sites are within walking distance. I will note that this hotel is for the younger travelers. The hotel lobby after 5pm is very busy and there is electronic music playing in the elavator at all times. Being that both my girlfriend and I are 30 years old we enjoyed it. My only complaint was that after our luggage was delivered from the airport the hotel did not bring us our bags as soon as it arrived. After I called the front desk to ask the whereabouts of our luggage it took them 15 minutes to bring it up. Besides that everyone was very helpful from the concierage to the bellhop. Also we did go to Caffe Linda around the corner as a previous reviewer had suggested and it was great. Very good food and very inexpensive for New York. I would definately stay at this hotel again when I go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “'W' Hotel, style or substance?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, spectacularly stylish lobby-definitely THE place to be seen-with friendly helpful staff. Everything fine then....until you get to the rooms, which were small, cramped and poorly lit with inadequate storage space and an air-conditioning system noisier than the helicopter that circles the Statue of Liberty, though the bathroom was more than acceptable. If you're the sort of person who values style above all else, this may be the hotel for you. Those of you with a more pragmatic approach would be well advised to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “New York Minute!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Super Chic!...This is NYC!...All courteous & helpful...Very trendy bar...WOW rooms a bit on the small side but, very comfortable with everything that you would need...Aveda products used...Economical rates...Walking distance to EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “New Attitude at the "W"”
Reviews.Author: spenser78
Reviews.Content: Don't let other reviews steer you away from this gem. Yes, the rooms are small, but they are very comfortable and interesting. Location is perfect for museums, restaurants, and theater. The bed, towels, pillows and shower were first rate. Best of all was the service. Every staff member was warm, friendly, and helpful. The parking attendant, front desk staff, cleaning staff, and conciege could not have been nicer. Thanks to them we had a terrific weekend in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Cool with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great walking area. The rooms are not very big but a "Wow" room or up should be more than accomodating for two people. It has a very cool vibe, particularly at night with the Whiskey Blue bar and the lobby bar, drinks are pretty steep. The W concierges are the best, got us into a couple great clubs without waiting and recommended some very good restaurants. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, excellent concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: danwhy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Times Square and W Court before and liked them both but couldn't find a good rate for my vacation in NYC at those properties last week so I stayed at the W New York instead (got a great AAA rate from their website). Having read previous reviews I was somewhat hesitant but i'm pleased to report things are just fine at the W New York! Check In: Fast and very accomodating to my request for a high floor with a view of some sky and sunshine (not always easy to get that in NYC). Room: Some previous people commented about the rooms being too hot and my room was indeed hot when I first entered. I simply put the hvac onto "low air" and adjusted the temperature (I like my room around 18C) and it did the trick and stayed at the right temperature perfectly throughout my whole stay. The room was fairly small (about 200 sq ft) as I had booked a less expensive room type but I found it was not all a worry as the room was laid out very nicely. The bed was as all W beds are, very comfortable with great linens. The TV was good, the window was huge and opened for fresh air and provided great sunlight. The washroom was more then adequete for storage space and had great water pressure for the shower. The closet was small but had a great hanging organizer that gave me more then enough room to store my suitcase and clothes for 5 days. Food and Drink: I ate at the restaurant heartbeat a few times and the food and service were great but pricey. Lot's of alternative (and cheap) places to eat within a block in any direction of the hotel. The living room was extremely comfortable and you could get a great latte there and have a lot of fun people watching. In the morning they set up a very nice and affordable breakfast. Staff: All the staff I encountered were friendly and would smile and greet me. Stand outs were the concierge staff. They remembered me by name and were always saying a hello or enjoy your day whenever I would come in and out of the hotel. They were also able to obtain Monty Python Spamalot tickets for me which is no easy feat as it is sold out for months. Overall a very nice experience at this hotel and I would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel - OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Gismoet
Reviews.Content: I was worried when I read all the reviews on this site. I booked the hotel via Hotwire - so you don't know the hotel name until after booking - Here is was rated as a 4.5 star (I kid you not). The rooms are tiny, air con does not work and you need to back out of the bathroom to exit. However in saying all that - The location is great - some brill restaurants close by (a previous reviewer mentioned Cafe Linda - just around the corner - and I agree - relaxed and good italian). The concierge was good and I did not experience any rudeness. The decor is trendy and a little too dark - is this to hide other problems ???? Would I stay here again - no - rooms too small and stuffy- I can't imagine what it would be like in the summer. Dublin traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and chic - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaGirl
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights here on business and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I love the look of W Hotels - really interesting materials and lighting and OH MY GOD the textiles! Heaven! (I'm an interior designer, so I get a little worked up about these things.) Everything from the bedspread to the shower curtain was done in luxurious fabrics, shimmering taffetas and plush velvets. Sweet. My room was a bit small (I opted for one of the less expensive rooms), but the bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom was also on the small side, but there was enough shelf space to spread out my toiletries and the lighting was good. The room was quiet, and they even provided a small CD player and complilation CD. The "Living Room" lounge area beats any hotel lobby I've ever seen. It's filled with large, comfortable chairs and well-stocked with an interesting assortment of coffee table books. And it was usually packed - people actually enjoy hanging around this area. All public spaces (the front desk, Living Room, the bar and restaurant, even the elevators) have a constant flow of music, mostly downtempo/ambient electronica (kind of groovy but soothing, never too loud or intrusive). The music provides an especially nice counterpoint to the cacophony outside. I had lunch at the restaurant twice (the crabcakes were excellent) and grabbed a quick breakfast in the Living Room each morning (it's very convenient and the food is pretty good: coffee, juice, pastries, smoothies, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.) The bar was really crowded and loud most nights. Staff were friendly and efficient - the concierge recommended several excellent restaurants, and everybody was pleasant and responsive. Also, the hotel was very clean, and the interior design is really well done. It's kind of pricey, but what hotel in New York isn't? I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and a bit of alright”
Reviews.Author: TCATHudsonValley
Reviews.Content: The W caters to an urban crowd that probably likes the grass growing out of the walls and the chic black shirts and pants of the wait staff. They don't give away the rooms, but the bedding is comfortable and everything works. You get a good night sleep on a king bed with nice white sheets. My wife and I enjoyed ourselves. We chuckled at the slimming mirrors that are placed just across from the elevators when you get off of each floor.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: TravelalotSudbury
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed from the moment we arrived. It took us 20 minutes to register. They put us in a smoking cubicle (I can't call it a room. One inch smaller and we could have sued for cruel and unusual punishment) even though we would never have booked a smoking room. The bathroom barely fit one person and you had to achieve contortionist proportions to reach the toilet paper. No one ever answered the concierge or main desk phone any time we tried. The only bright spot is comfortalbe and visually interesting bar downstairs and the music CD which they have available to listen to in the room although CD has remained the same for over 1 1/2 years. Toiletries stink -- they make you buy them instead of offering them for free. All in all not anywhere worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere for less $$$”
Reviews.Author: DeMilo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night during this past week in March. I chose this hotel because the AAA rate that I could get made it comparable in price to the Waldorf across the street and the Marriot next door. Having stayed at both before, I thought I'd give the W a try. Big mistake. First of all, when I went to my assigned room, I noticed that there was a tray of dirty dishes next to the door (and also along most of the hallway - yuck!). I also heard loud music coming from my room. Perplexed, I unlocked the door and peeked inside. Fortunately, I didn't catch a glimpse of anyone in particular, but all the lights were on and music was blaring. Clearly, this room was already occupied. When I went downstairs to get another room, there was no apology whatsoever for sending me to the wrong room. Apparently, they are too cool to give apologies here. When I finally got to the correct room, I was highly disappointed. VERY small - even for NY, and I travel there on business quite a bit. The room was boiling hot and when I went to turn down the heater, I noticed the grate covering it was all broken and in pieces. It never really cooled down and it was so loud for the entire night. I went to turn on the light next to the heater and guess what - it was broken, and even if it wasn't, there was no light bulb in it. The carpet was ripped in a few places and the desk was all chipped up. No bathtub either, but I don't really need that. However, the shower curtain didn't reach all the way to the floor, resulting in a flood the next morning when I showered. People in the corridors were very loud. I kept waking up all night thinking someone was trying to break into my room, when really it was someone across the hall or next door going into their room. Overall, this was a very disappointing stay, especially for the prices they try and charge ($300+ per night). Just to be fair, I'll also point out a couple of good things. The lobby bar seems like a fun place if your young and pretty and want to have fun. Although I am young and pretty :-), I was on a business trip and not looking for much fun. I ordered room service and the food arrived promptly and was very good. Pricey though - $30 or so for a plate of pasta. I wouldn't recommend this place for families or business travelers. But if you're looking to have fun, don't care about the size or cleanliness of your room or the corridors, by all means, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is your run-of-the-mill, overpriced, trendy New York Hotel. I just got the feeling it was trying to be too hip. Do the halls really have to be so dark? The club music in the elevator *was* annoying, as was the startling knocking noise from the heater in our room at all hours of the night. It would have been okay if the heater had worked decently.... The shower was open to the bathroom which was kind of cool except that the curtain didn't go all the way to the floor. Messy. There were very long lines for the slow elevators at certain times of day. For a place of this level, there were just a lot of little details missing. On a positive note, the ladies at the front desk were extremely nice. Great staff. It's a pretty lobby. Very trendy. The Bliss products in the room are replenished daily, which is a very nice touch. And being a W, the beds are to die for, of course. Extremely comfortable. All in all, I would recommend it only if you get a good rate. If not, the Barclay across the street is very nice, reasonable, and the heaters don't make loud noises.

Reviews.Title: “Could do Better”
Reviews.Author: cw0904
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W New York March 4-6 for our one year wedding anniversary. The only good thing I would say is that they did deliver the flowers my husband got for me to the correct room. So when I checked in the flowers were there. However, my key cards did not work when I got to the room and security had to come up to open the door. One of the cards was not activated. For all the raves that I hear about the W hotel resort chain I would think that the service would be better here than at lower end hotels that I have been to. The fact that I as a woman had to lug my own suitcase into the hotel without being asked by any of the employees standing outside is unacceptable! The fact that when I left nobody offered to help me with my luggage is unacceptable. The bell captains attend to whomever they please to attend to. On quite a few occasions we were standing outside and they asked other people that arrived after us if they needed help. Then asked us. Very rude! I have read numerous reviews that the rooms are small. You are correct they are small. The bed took up the entire space. There was no counter space in the bathroom for our toiletries. I was concerned that I was going to break the counter as it was all glass. For the amount of money we spent I would have rather spent it somewhere else. Thank goodness we only spent a weekend there. I don't think I would have lasted any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the room quality given the expectations they build with the W chain of hotels. Noisy heating that wouldn't shut off so the room was very uncomfortable. Supplimental fees on room service were unwarranted. Decor was sterile. Bed skirts were ripped. Tables had crumbs on them and the floor needed a vaccuum. Needless to say I doubt I will stay at any W hotel in the future unless someone can convince me otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: beva12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W 5 â€“ 8 Feb 2005 in a Wonderful room. I agree with other reviews that the rooms are small but for 2 â€“ 4 day stay the hotel is great, very stylish hotel and the bar and restaurant area are very cool. No bath â€“ shower only but the bathrooms were cool too and with great free wash products by Bliss. I have stayed at 10 different hotels in NY and this is one of the best for the money and location on a par with Tribecca Grand.

Reviews.Title: “W...service a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for a three day weekend and booked the trip through quikbook. The elevator regardless of time of day plays annoying club music which you don't need at 8 in the morning. The room was small but nice. When we checked out the hotel attempted to charge us $700.00 more than the price we were originally quoted. When we caught the error it was fixed but there was not an even an apology for the error despite having to spend more than 20 minutes with the staff to correct the problem. The bell staff was also rude on occassion. Conceriege was great.

Reviews.Title: “you can do much better in NY”
Reviews.Author: HelenSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood preferred guests and so expected better â€“ we got a small, well worn room apparently a suite (I would hate to see the size of other rooms!) The service was initially enthusiastic, but no one never resolved any of our many problems. To add insult to injury after one complaint the manager sent up four free beers with a note and then charged them to our room! On the positive side the location is great and if you are 20 years old this is definitely the place to get â€˜hooked upâ€™ in the ever packed bar. There are much better places to stay in NY for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Service Excellence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Service Excellence Dearest Yerhaura, I wanted to take a few moments and say thank you for all that you did to make our stay one to remember for a life time. Every time I had a problem or better said a concern regarding my stay at the W on 541 Lexington Avenue you where there to bring quick and swift resolve. I have been in the eye of public services for 15 years. I truly understand how difficult and taxing it can be on one to stand and hear all the complaints / problems of your clientele with out ever being told when things went exceptional. Well here is one that will be the exception. I did not like the initial size of the room for the ventilation sake and asked Yerhaura for a fan only to find out they had none available. As I am standing at the counter in the Lobby she is obviously fixed onto her computer screen and after a few moments looks at me and my wife and says, would you like to switch rooms? Is it a bigger? Oh yes she replies. My wife and I dashed off to find room 664 so much nicer for minimal cost. We moved all of our belongings and this made the stay so much nicer. It did not stop here. Yerhaura followed up with us three maybe four times during our 2 night stay ensuring that everything was all right. This kind of follow up created a customer relation that I call second to none. I do not know the room count in this facility but I will tell you I thought I was the only room she was tending too. This kind of customer service is only second to none. Yerhaura has set the standards and raised the bar of service excellence. I have had the privilege of frequenting a number of 5 star resorts and have to give her skills a rating of A++. The bar has been raised and standards are set by Yerhaura. Waldorf Astoria will never get my business as long as this keeps up at the W. I can still see in my minds eye coming in after a long day of walking the town. She would light up and smile saying I just called you guys. I was out of sight but not out of mind! Awesome! Am I a dedicated to staying at the W? Yes! Why? Because of the excellent customer service that was given to my wife and I on the week of New Years Eve by Yerhaura. I have to also say that the Bell Hop and the Front door men where also very polite and very courteous. Thank you so very much for making my first trip ever to New York City a very friendly and warm memory. Yerhaura, I cannot thank you enough. First impressions are lasting impressions. Word of mouth will weigh in stronger than any yellow pages advertisement. Because of this service excellence I will highly recommend your establishment to my friends and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “W Hype, disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OJonVacation
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel for business. I stayed in the regular room with King Size at first then moved to a suite. Both were so small. The Suite was a joke. The 2nd room was so tiny I was running into things whenever I walked around. The walls were dirty, the shower stall small and dingy. The shower head had no power - drip drip. Major attitude in the lobby and the servers in the lobby bar had attitude. The porter was very rude and indifferent to our requests for a cab. It is the worst W I have stayed at....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lindatrip
Reviews.Content: W Hotel has a good lobby area, with bar where you can get snacks. Bedrooms were on the small side but you expect that in New York. Beds were very comfortable but we had no bath in the bathroom. The room was on the 15th floor and the noise of the traffic was terrible, also we could hear everything that went on in the room next door, by midnight on our first night we had, had enough and was asked to be moved, which the hotel obliged with, unfortunatly they only had twin rooms left. However it was on the other side of the building so no traffic and it had a bath, which you will definatly need if you do as much walking as we did! Hotel restaurant served good food, however maitre de was a bit snotty and gave us a rubbish table saying they were fully booked even when we told her we were residents, yet we saw other people in parties of 4 who hadn't booked get better tables. Hotel is in a good area for getting to 5th Ave and all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Lex. Ave. NOT like before”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here weekend Dec 2004 and found entrance very attractive, lobby fun. However, when my room had been assigned to me, I was given a smoking room against my reservation specifications, and the view was directly onto air conditioning unit without any view and filthy. I was not informed I had been put into a smoking room. I complained and was shown a second room which stunk of cigarettes. I went back to reception and said could not stay in smoking rooms with worst views ever! They finally put me in a large, well appointed room facing the Waldorf Astoria which was fabulous and after that had no complaints. What I don't like is that you are given the worst rooms first and would be stuck staying in them unless you complain until you get a decent room. Discounts should be offered if client does not change rooms. It is much better to stay here than the Marriott next door! Still, this hotel has a very nice appeal and Bliss products wonderful. The staff could be less snooty and give more respect to clients...they act as if they are the best going and need to learn from European Hotels how to handle clients.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Ready4thenextplace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for five nights during the Christmas holidays. What a disappointment! This was my first time staying at a W property. I had heard that the hotels were trendy and the rooms tastefully designed with a contemporary flair. What I didn't hear is that the rooms are so small that they are barely functional. Because it was the Christmas holidays, my husband and I packed more heavily than usual, bringing gifts as well as the usual travel items. The first room we were given was so small that I honestly didn't think we would be able to maneuver once our luggage and packages arrived, and we are both smaller than average. I expressed my concern to the desk clerk who informed me, albeit very politely, that none of their rooms are very spacious. He agreed to relocate me, but warned that the new accommodations would only be minimally larger. He was right. In addition to the small space, there was an awkward room divider which didn't add anything to the style value and merely segmented the room unnecessarily. There was a built in area with an armless chair which functioned as a small desk. In addition, there were no night stands but a narrow wall shelf which held the clock radio and telephone. The bath only contained a shower (no tub) and the lighting in the entire unit was so dim that it felt like a cave. I don't know how anyone could possibly apply makeup in the dark bathroom and I even had trouble seeing the items in my suitcase (there was not sufficient drawer space to unpack your clothing). Although the hotel was generally well maintained, there were, as my daughter would say, "telltale signs of aging" with torn wallpaper and peeling paint in the bathroom. There was a charge for high speed internet service and for the wireless service which I understand was available in some of the lobby areas. The only complimentary itnernet access was in the Business Center, and the desk clerk failed to disclose that information when I called to inquire about availability. Finally, the fitness center was being renovated and although alternate facilities were offered, I wasn't up to trekking down the street in the cold, rainy weather. If you like the location, I would recommend the Eastside Marriott, only steps from the W. My advice -- stay there. The rooms and facilities are infinitely better. Even though the reviews were not great, I chose to stay at the W based on the reputation of the chain, thinking the accommodations couldn't be that bad. Don't make the same mistake I did -- believe the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Hard as a rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what beds the previous posters have slept on but the bed we got was so hard I was unable to sleep. So much for a comfortable bed. The bliss spa products were awsome though.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest place on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of November for three nights over Thanksgiving. We had read mixed reviews about the W, but decided to try our luck. We were sorely disappointed and regret the decision hugely. Our room was hardly big enough to swing a small cat. Common in New York I know, but when you can't get to the bathroom because your luggage is taking up the entire floor space, due to the lack of storage, then it really does become tiresome. Most of the 'Terrible' reviews cover many of the points that we also experienced but there was something else that we weren't fully prepared for. On check out we decided to leave our bags for the duration of the day to collect in the evening. There was one luggage guy covering a 20 deep queue. During our lengthy wait, we observed the luggage guy swearing at guests behind their backs as they deposited their bags with him. This was done numerous times once guests went to leave. No strangers to the States we know the tipping culture, however, when we went to leave our bags, the same guy would not give us our luggage tickets until we handed over cash. He actually held on to the tickets and we grappled with him to retrieve them. Incidentally, we didn't tip him due to his threatening nature and felt for the rest of the day that he was torching our bags! We reported the incident to the manager and he said, "We can't touch them due to their Union". So again, ineffective staff as described by other travellers and having stumped up a large amount of cash it left a really bad taste at the end of largely noisy, rude and cramped stay.

Reviews.Title: “Run, Don't Walk, From This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was so awful, I frankly don't know where to begin. Each year, my partner and I host a Christmas gathering in New York City for our friends and family. This year, we chose to put everyone up at the W Hotel New York (49th & Lex). What a dreadful mistake. Quick summary: The infrastrucutre in this hotel is tired and failing. Making matters worse, management is ineffective. For those of you who don't have time to read the details that follow, I say run, don't walk, from this hotel. Tired, Failing Infrastructure: The W Hotel New York is old and failing. Three examples: 1. No more than half of the elevators in the hotel were ever in service at the same time during our stay, resulting in long waits and shoulder to shoulder crowding (the elevators in this hotel are absurdly small, at approximately 4 feet square. 2. The room key card lock system failed us during our stay no less than three times (in one instance one of our guests was locked out of his room for an entire evening as the hotel removed the door to his room, jam and all, in order to gain entry). 3. The hot water boiler had to be turned off one morning during our stay, leaving the top floors of the hotel with no hot water (ironically, a large portion of our group arrived that morning, having flown all night on red eye flights, and we had paid for their rooms beginning the evening prior specifically so that they could get in to their rooms early that morning and shower). Ineffective Management: The W Hotel New York features two "penthouse" suites on the 17th floor. My partner and I stayed in one and, to our horror, quickly discovered that the other penthouse suite (it should be noted here that both of these suites share a large, common rooftop deck seperated only by low planters) had been rented out to a major U.S. corporation as a "hospitality" suite for the Nascar race being held in New York that weekend. The result? Non stop partying next door, night after night, with people standing out on the rooftop deck smoking cigarettes and cigars until late into the night. Making matters worse, since the room next door wasn't designed to be a hospitality suite, this meant the door would lock each time it closed. To alleviate this problem, our friends next door would block the door from closing each evening by flipping the lock bar into the door jam. This resulted in the door slamming into the lock bar each time someone came or went (which was constantly throughout each night). But wait. That's not all. The bedroom of our suite shared a (thin) common wall with the service elevators on the 17th floor, which meant that each morning, after being kept up late into the night, we'd awake to the housekeeping staff coming and going (it should be noted here that this issue was pointed out to the manager on duty, who at first refused to believe me when I told him our room backed up to the service elevator -- incredible!). All of the issues I've discussed above, including the service elevator issue, were reported to hotel management. Unfortunately, management was unable to correct any of these issues. The room next door was rented, Nascar related parties were planned, and there was no turning back. The best they could do was promise to monitor the situation (which, unfortunatley, they didn't do). There are two final insults to all of this. First, in the closing days of our stay, management offered to reduce the rate on our room (I quote his words here) "by 50%, or $900.00 per night, which results in a total savings of $5,400" in consideration of the issues we faced with our neighbors throughout our stay. In response to this gesture, I told the manager that I appreciated the offer but nevertheless wanted him to understand I hadn't come to the hotel in search of cheap rooms. To the contrary, I would rather see management correct the mistakes. With this as background, imagine my surprise when we went to check out and discovered that the promised credit hadn't been put on our bill. When I inquired, this manager told me he decided not to do it because I had told him I wasn't there for "cheap rooms." When I protested, he argued with me, ultimately agreeing to credit $900 (50% of one night). As we stood to miss our flight, we didn't have time to argue further and left. Second, after spending nearly an hour checking out, we went to leave the hotel -- now running late for our flight. The bellman had stored our bags in a baggage room behind the front desk. Unfortunately, the card lock system was acting up again. We waited 15 minutes while he tried to get into that room. About the time we were ready to leave the hotel without our bags so as not to miss our flight, our bags appeared. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent 3 nights at the W and we found it to be fine for our requirements. Yes, the rooms are a little small - but we spent so little time in our room that this really wasn't a problem. We both LOVED the Bliss products, and popped into the store next door to buy the place up before we left. Reception staff were all very friendly and helpful - although the same cannot be said for the barstaff....but I suppose you can't have everything. We'd definately stay in a W Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent software and hardware”
Reviews.Author: Bondosan006
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in November and had a suite. This rating is charitable - I hear the general standard of NYC hotels is grim. There was no bathtub in my suite - astonishing. The windows let a lot of street noise even though mine faced a side street. The heating system was difficult to adjust and I kept waking up at 4 am in the morning as the room was incredibly hot. Even after the maintenance guy repaired it (he had to replace something) I had to set it to cool the room in order to saty at a comfortable temperature. The decor of the suite is reminiscent of the 1970s - completely fails to be funky. Service is indifferent - some days I got my specified paper, some days not. The restaurant was closed on a Sunday night, and on one other night was fully occupied with a function. The location is excellent, but all these minuses mean that I plan to try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “TINY Room, Fun Bar!”
Reviews.Author: biztravelguy
Reviews.Content: This room was so small, me and my partner could barely walk around and we are not big people. I travel to NYC frequently, but I've never seen a hotel room this small! The hotel does have a great lobby and a wonderful bar attached...The Whiskey Bar. The Bliss Spa is also now open...heard it's great, but didn't go by. Also, internet in the room will run you $15 a night. I would not stay here again on my next trip to NYC. I would recommed the bar and spa, but not staying in the hotel! Try one of the other W hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As all the other postings have noted, this hotel has two saving graces: an incredibly comfortable bed (albeit the same as you'd find in any Westin) and a trendy ambience downstairs. Additionally, the hotel options in Midtown are not incredible (the Waldorf has small rooms, the Palace is great but no loyalty program etc) The rooms are incredibly small, the noise from Lex Ave comes in through the very thin windows, the service is often less than stellar (a "because I could potentially be a D-list model, I don't really have to work" attitude permeates the staff)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This trendy hotel is probably best in the lobby. Muted tones and great bar present a good first impression. But the rooms are a major disappontment. I had a suite over the Thanksgiving weekend and it was not worth the cost. The bathroom was so small, I had to leave my shaving kit outside, there was no place to put any of my personal items. The room had no place to put my clothes, a drawer was no where to be found. The view fromthe corner suite was outstanding until it was tainted by the sight of my clothes piled on the window sills so I didn't have to contstantly dig in my suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: irrum
Reviews.Content: well, the rooms are the smallest I have ever stayed in, there was only room for me, thats it, peeling wall paper, blinds that were also peeling, no tub! Don't even get me statred with the tiny bathrooms the only good thing was the location and the bar and lounge downstairs, it is filled with people there for business a lot of networking and the drinks are great! room service is a rip off $40us for breakfast, I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: S&P-Together
Reviews.Content: The only reason why this hotel gets 2 dots is because it had a cool lobby, nice shower head and a heavenly bed. Other that this hotel sucked. First the room was so small that my husband I both barely fit in the room. The room is only big enough for the bed which was only a queen size. We had room service for breakfast and I had to sit sideways in the desk chair with my husband on the bed to eat. Simply absurd. Also the rooms need to be remodeled. The bathroom had peeling wallpaper and the carpet was pretty thin and the heater was loud and old/dirty. I will never stay at this W again. I'll try the Tuscany again while in NYC or go back to the Penisula which is an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CiderMaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is getting two dots vice one because of its very comfortable bed. This is the most I've every paid for a hotel room ($400) and was expecting a comfortable stay. Here's what I found: - the bathroom sink is so huge that it overhangs the toilet. I am not large, but had to sort of hang over the sink while using it. It was a first for me! - maintenance was very poor. One blind didn't work at all, permanently stuck in the down position; another had many deep tears two to three inches long on one side. It took two tries for the maintenance people to fix the broken blind. There were many, many two to three inch snags in the carpet both in the room and in the halls, with cut and patch jobs evident. - we thought we'd made arrangements for our bill to be split between my partner and myself (it took about 15 minutes for the check in clerk to do this) only to find as we were checking out that no arrangement had been made, and they had no way to split it. Wish I'd been told that when we checked in! - it was incredibly noisy. Lots and lots of street noise, including car alarms, truck horns at 3 in the AM, etc. I guess it's to be expected in NYC, but better soundproofing might have helped. - only one chair in the room, a deskchair; no other place to sit besides the bed (yet there was plenty of room for other seating) What took the cake was when I was standing outside reading the restaurant menu and felt something wet on my head. A individual was leaning out the window several floors above vomiting on me. Charming clientele! Truly a disappointing experience. A friend stayed at the W Tuscany in NYC during the same period and raved about how pleasant it was. Stay there; don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “The most expensive shoebox I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: timster_1000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 2 week vacation in USA and stayed at three locations: Las Vegas, Los Angeles and New York. The ironic thing was as the hotel rooms got smaller, the rates got higher. Not surprising given the general differing costs of living in those respective cities. However, trying to ignore how spoilt we were in Las Vegas, the so-called King bed was a Queen (actually, I suspect it was a twin, but I didn't have my measuring tape) and conveniently when I called them about it, they didn't have any rooms with a King bed available and lo and behold, on their computer systems we were meant to have a Queen anyway. Unfortuantely, I made the mistake of booking over the phone and not on the Internet where a receipt proving my booking would have been found in my Inbox. Other bad points: we had several suitcases for which there wasn't a bell boy in sight when we stepped out of the taxi. The carpet in the room was very worn in places, the bed just wasn't made to have 2 people sharing it, the maids didn't replace the Bliss toiletries my wife "misplaced" in her bags after the first night (I pay over $300 per night and they get cheap on simple pleasures such as that!). The good points: professional check-in staff, ultra-soft 100% cotton robes, lovely bar area (I suspect that this was the bait to make you assume the rest of the hotel is just as great). Overall, not impressed for the money I forked out. I would love to know where the other reviewers on this forum got such heavy discounts...

Reviews.Title: “The Bed is incredibly comfortable.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this W twice and each time I've had a Wonderful experience...the location is perfect:close to Central Park, 5th Ave, Timesquare..close to the Subway...the Staff was very helpful from the Restaurant waiters to the Bellboys to the Concierge...the rooms are small but Im from California so I'm def not used to that..I do, however, Love the Bliss Products and can't wait to go to their spa when I stay during Thanskgiving! The bar on weekends are very crowded with the Hip n Trendy and the Restaurant serves delicious food...I'm an Spg member and am excite to try out their W the Court location in a few weeks.

HotelInfo.Name: W New York
HotelInfo.Address: 541 Lexington Avenue, At 49th Street, New York City, NY 10022
